I appreciate your thoughtful review, and we look forward to welcoming you back for many more relaxing getaways in the future.  Kind regards,  Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We went to Pelican Hill for a family holiday and the venue was beautiful however the attitude of some of the staff was not. We hired a 2 bed villa and asked for sea views and at over $2600/night I expect to sea the sea.  The villa was nice and spacious but if you looked through the trees you could just catch a tiny view of the sea!! Not sea view in my opinion! When I mentioned this to my butler he informed me (very aggressively) we could see the see so that was sea view.  When we arrived at Lax airport we had lost one piece of our luggage and we asked another butler to help us locate it but we were informed that they couldn't help and gave us the number of Delta airlines which we already had.  However when we asked the concierge for help they were wonderful and sorted the whole
Manager Response: Hello Anjali,  I apologize that your recent trip to Pelican Hill left you disappointed, especially because your family was looking forward to enjoying a relaxing holiday together. The service missteps you describe don’t reflect the attentive and personalized experience we aim to create for each of our guests, and I’m sorry that your butler service tarnished what would have been an enjoyable vacation. I’d like to connect you with our Guest Services Manager, so we may personally apologize for falling short and hopefully regain your trust for a much-improved visit in the future. I’ve shared his direct phone number with you in a private message, and we look forward to connecting with you soon.  Kind regards,  Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: My husband and I decided to go last minute from L.A.  We made our reservations through American Express. They have quite a pricing structure, every night is a different price with weekends extremely expensive.  For these prices I hate to say it but the  rooms need updating.  T.V.'s do not pull out, cannot watch from the bed, outdated electronics, lots of space with very little lights.  Showers have water restrictors, it is hard to get a good shower.  The golf looked amazing and I can see this as a place for a great guys getaway.  Golf Club restaurant was good and bar busy but also dated.   We had a few days of cool overcast weather so I went to the spa.  Here is the big disappointment, very dark, fair message, but even lesser spas have heated tables, and considering the cool

Summary Heading: Very enjoyable stay, some areas for improvement
Summary: I was so happy on checking into the 2 bedroom villa, the layout and space is perfect for 2 adults and 2 children.  The villas, are super well laid out with double basin bathrooms with bathtubs and showers in each.  A small kitchen and generous living room with gas fire and balcony with sun loungers.  Its really a great option with families. They have a washing machine, which was a welcome addition for me after 3 weeks of travelling.  Nice touch to have some complimentary milk, beer, breadsticks laid on, as well a complimentary fruit and cheese plate.  The villas have a lovely pool and lounge area.  We ate at most of the resort restaurants and food and service were good.  Couple of areas for improvement, reception staff at villas don't seem very well trained.  Seems like they
Manager Response: Hello,   Thank you for choosing Pelican Hill for your recent family vacation! While I’m glad to read that your family enjoyed your Villa accommodations, I apologize that some parts of your service experience weren’t equally impressive. Please know I’ve taken this opportunity to address your feedback on the pool service, housekeeping and WiFi strength with our management team, so we may continue to improve the overall guest experience. I’d also like to connect you with our Guest Services Manager and have shared his direct phone number with you in a private message. I truly appreciate your candid insight, and we hope to welcome your family back to Pelican Hill soon.   Kind regards,  Tom Donovan  Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: another great vacationa t pelican hills
Summary: we went as the whole family this lst week to Pelican hills repost. played golf on two great gold courses and the rest of the time where at the pools we had a villa and it was very nice we eat at the pools each day or at the golf grill
Manager Response: Hello Donald,   Thank you for choosing Pelican Hill for your family vacation and taking the time to share your thoughtful feedback with us. I’m so glad to read that you enjoyed the Villas and had the opportunity to experience all the Resort has to offer. I’ll be sure to share your kind words with our golf and culinary teams, and we hope to welcome your family back for another memorable getaway soon.  Kind regards,  Tom Donovan  Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We had our 4 children in a villa and the weather was perfect. We loved the villa pool because it was a lot less crowded than the main resort pool. The spa and the restaurants were all very good and we enjoyed just sitting outside our Villa with and relaxing with a glass of wine in the evening. I would definitely go back but would avoid the beach -- the shuttle was running and the beach was so crowded and uncomfortable. That said, Ruby's Diner was a fun distraction from that for our kids and we got a shake and waited for the return shuttle.
Manager Response: Hello,   Thank you for choosing Pelican Hill for your family vacation! I’m glad to read that you enjoyed your Villa accommodations and had the opportunity to experience the Villa pool, Spa and on-property restaurants as well. I apologize that your trip to Crystal Cove State Beach wasn’t equally impressive, and I’ve taken this opportunity to share your detailed feedback with our team. I truly appreciate your thoughtful review, and we look forward to welcoming your family back for another memorable getaway to Pelican Hill soon.   Kind regards,  Tom Donovan  Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: From the first contact with the property, I experienced pure excellence.  Prior to booking my stay, I reserved a tour of the property.   I was given a personal tour by Gavin Powers, the Guest Experience Assistant Manager.  He went above and beyond in every possible way to ensure my tour of the property was "excellence."   During my tour, I had the pleasure of  meeting Whitney Wilson, Executive Meeting Manager.  There is a saying, "You never have a second chance to make a first impression."  From the first impression, during my tour, to my actual visit during my birthday, this property is "pure excellence."  Ms. Wilson remembered me and reached out to me and my family when we arrived at the property to celebrate my birthday.    Whitney made my birthday visit extra special.  The
Manager Response: Hello Jeanniene,   Thank you for celebrating your birthday with us at Pelican Hill! I’m so glad to read that you enjoyed your recent visit, and I’ll be sure to personally thank Gavin, Whitney and Sanja for taking wonderful care of you. I truly appreciate you taking the time to leave such thoughtful feedback, and we look forward to welcoming your whole family back to Pelican Hill soon. Happy birthday!  Kind regards,  Tom Donovan  Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Terrible stay, initially booked an ocean 2 bedroom for a 2 week stay, checked out after 4 nights due to the following:  1- villa was not inspected before check in, AC didn't work in the first night, in addition the water spray in one of the bathrooms was broken, in a 5 star resort, it would be a given that all rooms / villas are inspected and are up to standard, this unfortunately was a shortfall by the resort.  2- Room Service, on the first night, called room service 3 times to pick up the food, after 45 minutes, called and the attendant was rude and coldly stated that if I can't wait, I should put the dishes outside the villa ! Not acceptable at all.... Second night, ordered a pizza for my children, the pizza arrived late, and was a rock... due to the fact that it was cold....
Manager Response: Hello Mr. Almehairi,   I apologize that your recent stay at the Villas fell so short of your expectations. I understand that your family was looking forward to enjoying a relaxing vacation together, and I’m disappointed by the unacceptable housekeeping issues and service delays that tarnished your time at the Resort. I was glad to learn that our Director of Rooms has already connected with, and I’ve shared his direct phone number with you. Please know that I’ve personally addressed your detailed concerns with our management team, and we hope to regain your family’s trust for a much-improved visit to Pelican Hill in the future.   Kind regards,  Tom Donovan  Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Very disappointed with my stay in this hotel. This is my second time staying here and first time was excellent. This time we got a 2 bedroom villa   When we got to our room, refrigerator had leftovers from people before us! Gross. The freezer was all dirty with something brown and really disgusting. The shower had hair all over! We wanted to switch hotels but we had an infant with us who was getting fussy so that was not our option. This is not what we expected from $1700 per night hotel. I mentioned it to the front desk and i was told that this will be related to the manager and that is it. Not even an apology!  The pools, especially the coliseum are nice so i am giving it 2 stars for that. However the pool attendant at the villa pool was not friendly at all, not even a hello.
Manager Response: Hello Ms. Spiridoniva,   I apologize that your family’s recent visit to the Villas fell short of the excellent first stay you experienced. It’s important that every guest enjoys not only attentive service, but also exceptional accommodations, and I’m disappointed by the unacceptable housekeeping issues you describe. Please know I’ve personally addressed your concerns with our management team, and I’d like to connect you with our Rooms Director, so we may personally apologize for the shortcomings of your stay. I’ve shared his direct phone number with you in a private message, and we look forward to the opportunity to connect with you soon.  Kind regards,  Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Had a great stay whilst visiting laguna beach - the pool is amazing - staff very friendly and overall a great experience. We would highly recommend based on location and service. Try a meal on the terrace.
Manager Response: Hello Jill,   Thank you for visiting Pelican Hill! I’m glad to read you enjoyed a great visit and were able to spend time at Coliseum Pool as well. I appreciate your kind feedback, and we look forward to welcoming you back to the Resort soon! Kind regards,  Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Love The Resort at Pelican Hill!
Summary: This is my sixth visit to the resort and it was fantastic!  The bungalows are spacious and gorgeous.  The service is fantastic.  Everyone is very friendly and accommodating.  The Coliseum has a wonderful breakfast buffet.  The Pelican Grill is a great spot for dinner.  The pool is beautiful and relaxing.  The views all over all the resort are pretty.  I am looking forward to my seventh visit!
Manager Response: Hello Sheryl,   Thank you for taking the time to post your kind reviews on our Resort, Coliseum Pool & Grill and Pelican Grill TripAdvisor pages. Your insight is very important to us, and I’ll be sure to share your thoughtful feedback with our management team. I’m so glad to read that Pelican Hill has become a special destination for you, and we look forward to welcoming you back to the Resort for visit number seven very soon!  Kind regards,  Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Booked through Amex Platinum and was very disappointed!  Wanted a 3 bedroom for last minute family escape before jobs started and back to school and thought Pelican was the perfect place.  Took the 2 bedroom Ocean View Villa as that was largest available at time of booking and upon arrival ended up across the street from the resort in the North Villas with only a view of the road and large trees blocking the Ocean "view!" This was the first visit with our kids and had a totally different vibe being disconnected from the resort and absent of the views we flew to CA in search of!!   The desk staff graciously provided a credit in admission that we did not have an ocean view, but were unable to move us as the resort was sold out this weekend.   Our dining at Andrea was not the
Manager Response: Hello,   I apologize that your recent stay to Pelican Hill fell short of your expectations and the positive visits you’ve enjoyed in the past. I understand how important it was for your family to spend a relaxing vacation together before the end of summer, and I’m disappointed that your Villa accommodations and meal at Andrea weren’t at the same caliber that you’ve experienced before. Please know I’ve addressed your detailed concerns with our management team, so we may continue to improve the overall guest experience. I’d also like to connect you with our Director of Rooms, so we may personally apologize and hopefully regain your family’s trust for an improved visit in the future. I’ve shared his direct phone number with you in a private message, and we look forward to connecting with you soon.  Kind regards,  Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I checked into pelican Hill late and my room was ready it was absolutely gorgeous I got an ocean view Standard room but even though it wasn't a suite it's still had a little sitting area A huge bed a little bar and a gorgeous bathroom the view I will say it was not the best I did get an ocean view and there was trees in front of my room but it was not a problem based on how beautiful my room was I have never stayed at pelican Hill before I've only been there for lunch and the pool the food there is absolutely outstanding and I got a cabana by the pool and spend the day up there which was absolutely lovely I 100% recommend pelican Hill if you're going to be in orange county area and looking something very classy I will be returning to pelican Hill hopefully soon

What an amazing resort, from the arrival experience, views and service you can't go wrong.  The bungalows are spacious and well appointed.  Love the Nespresso machines!  If you need a lift to the main lodge, jump in the Mercedes 550 or a golf cart shuttle.  The marine fog never really lifted during our stay but that's to be expected that time of year.

This was a lovely end to a hectic 2 week road trip, made nicer by a surprise upgrade to a Villa. Although would have been nicer to be in the complex the 5min walk was no hardship and only once had to wait 10min for free transport to main area.  Main critics were the kids with poor Wifi that kept dropping out, other than that Colisium Restaurant perfect for casual dining enjoying sunset at same time.   Gym more than adequate, didn't get to Spa, Pool nice for splash but be good if some of the kids were kept on a tighter lease by parents and consider other guests. Pool Service was poor at weekend but fine on quieter week days.  Would we return? 110% even staying in main complex.
Manager Response: Hello,   Thank you for choosing The Resort at Pelican Hill to be part of your special family vacation and for sharing your kind review with us. I’m glad to read that your family enjoyed a relaxing stay and that our team was able to accommodate a complimentary Villa upgrade. Please know I’ve also taken this opportunity to address your feedback about the Wi-Fi and Coliseum Pool with our team, so we may continue to improve the overall guest experience. I truly appreciate your insight, and we hope to welcome you back to the Resort after your next road trip!   Kind regards, Tom Donovan	 Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: My family and I live close by and visit the resort frequently, usually to enjoy their restaurants, drinks, coffee, or just to walk around the hotel grounds. It is in a beautiful setting with breathtaking views. We stayed recently in an ocean view room for mini family getaway. The rooms are very large, with a fireplace, fantastic bathroom, and a large deck to relax and enjoy the view. The staff are always smiling and helpful. My son and I the next day enjoyed the spa facilities, wet and dry saunas, and huge clean Jacuzzi. Wonderful stay again, and we will be back!!
Manager Response: Hello Scotty,   Thank you for taking the time to share your kind review on our Tripadvisor page. I’m so glad to read that Pelican Hill has become a special destination for your family and that you all enjoyed your recent getaway to the Resort. We truly appreciate your feedback and look forward to welcoming you back for many more family vacations in the future.   Kind regards, Tom Donovan	 Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This is a spacious property with two large living areas and a golf course.  We stayed in the bungalows and had a very large comfortable room with a veranda looking across one of the holes of the golf course to the Pacific Ocean.  The bathroom was quite large and functional.  The king bed was very comfortable.  The room was quiet and relaxing.    The staff members were very friendly throughout our stay.  Check-in and orientation to our room were outstanding.  We experienced some waits in being picked up but learned that it was often easier, if we weren't moving luggage, to walk where we wanted to go.  The spa was excellent.  It is spacious, top rate and the therapists are excellent.  We tried the Coliseum Grill by the pool for dinner, opting not to dine at the Pelican Grill or
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for choosing Pelican Hill for your recent vacation and sharing your thoughtful feedback with us. I’m glad to read that you enjoyed a relaxing stay and an excellent Spa experience. It’s important that our guests enjoy every moment of their time at Pelican Hill, and I apologize that your dinner at Coliseum Pool & Grill left you disappointed. Please know I’ve personally addressed your feedback about the fish tacos and wine service with our culinary and management teams, so we may continue to improve the overall dining experience. I appreciate you taking the time to share your review and hope to welcome you back to Pelican Hill soon.   Kind regards, Tom Donovan	 Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Amazing Service, friendly staff and Wide choices for menus at the restaurants! Enjoyed the Swimming pool;  A lot of family with kids here so young couple, or big family  this place is perfect for you!  PS: we got a complimentary champagne because there was a little party outside our villa ! That was nice! Thank you !
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for sharing your review with us! I’m glad to read that you enjoyed a wonderful stay in the Villas and also had the opportunity to experience the pool and restaurants during your visit. I appreciate your thoughtful feedback, and we hope to welcome you back to Pelican Hill very soon.  Kind regards, Tom Donovan	 Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I really enjoyed my time at the spa, It's beautiful, super clean and the staff are very friendly. Couldn't take many pictures of the facility out of respect to the clients privacy. You need to book in advance.

Summary Heading: Overall excellent, with a few unpleasantries
Summary: Stayed 2 nights with 2 young children in a 2-Bedroom Garden view Villa about a week ago.  The Pros:  the villa is quite secluded and very quiet, the 1-car garage is great.  Rooms are well maintained and clean, beds comfortable.  Having a kitchen and laudry inside the villa is a definite bonus.  Being a short trip, we didn't need to use the butler much, or anything else for that matters.    The Cons:  1.  Check in is at 5 pm, and they mean it.  We waited in the villa clubhouse from about 3:45pm and was supposed to receive a call when the villa is ready.  No one called.  I had to check w the front desk again a little after 5 and it took another 10 min to get the keys.  While waiting in the club lounge, I got 2 kid-size apple juices from the bar, and it cost $17.  I'm used to
Manager Response: Hello Ming,   Thank you for choosing Pelican Hill for your recent family getaway and taking the time to share your thoughtful feedback with us. I’m glad to read that you enjoyed a relaxing stay in your Villa, and I apologize that our team wasn’t able to accommodate an early check-in upon your arrival. Please know I’ve taken this opportunity to personally address your concerns and recommendations with our management team, so we may continue to improve the overall guest experience. I truly appreciate your insight, and we hope to welcome your family back to Pelican Hill for another vacation soon.  Kind regards,  Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I recently stayed here on business, and overall had a good experience. The grounds are beautiful, well kept, and worth exploring. All of the rooms are beautiful bungalow spaces with lots of privacy, which was also great. Some of the negatives are that it's quite large, so you have to walk a lot to get back to the main building. And everything is really pricey here; I paid 60 US for breakfast and 40 US for a glass of wine, which to me is rather expensive.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! I’m glad to read that you enjoyed your recent business trip to Pelican Hill and had the opportunity to explore the Resort during your visit. Please know that complimentary coach service is available for convenient transportation throughout the Resort and to our neighboring Crystal Cove State Beach. I appreciate your thoughtful insight, and we look forward to the opportunity to welcome you back to Pelican Hill for another relaxing stay in the future.  Kind regards,  Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This place has unfortunately changed for the worse. We have stayed here around 10 times. It was always great up until our last stay. We checked into a villa on June 22 for 3 nights. We noticed upon check-in that there were tons of cars parked up the side of the private street leading to our villa. When we approached our garage after having dinner that night we saw that the end of our dead end street was filled with people outside drinking & smoking weed. This is not the atmosphere that Pelican Hill advertises that's for sure. Over the next 3 nights the people next to us partied outside, revved their cars insanely loud  & let their kids ride motorbikes through the grass all around the area. We made multiple calls to the front desk. Not once did any manager ever talk to us to even
Manager Response: Hello Celestey,  Thank you for your continued loyalty to Pelican Hill and taking the time to share your candid review with us. I apologize that your recent stay at the Villas fell so short of the relaxing vacation you were looking forward to enjoying as well as the family-friendly environment we aim to create. Please know the safety and comfort of each guest is of the utmost importance to us, and I’m disappointed to read that our team didn’t graciously address your concerns while you were staying with us. I'd like to personally connect you with our Villas General Manager, so we may properly apologize and hopefully regain your trust for a much-improved visit in the future. I’ve shared his direct phone number with you via private message, and we look forward to the opportunity to speak with you soon.  Kind regards, Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The Resort at Pelican Hill is absolutely stunning, with amazing views of the Pacific Ocean.  The resort pool and dining options are also beyond wonderful.  The hotel offers trips down to Crystal Cove beach and café every hour which work out perfectly if you want to enjoy the beach & sand along with enjoying the pool at the hotel.  We loved our 3 hours trip to that beach!!!  The resort staff is very helpful, as we found out when we needed to call housekeeping 3 times our first night!!  The reason for all the calls?  The room needs a user guide because the light switches, TV controller, etc are not very user friendly.    We had a lovely time, the only improvement we recommend is to have BETTER IN ROOM LIGHTING.
Manager Response: Hello Bridget,   Thank you for visiting Pelican Hill and taking the time to share your experience with us. I’m glad to read that your family enjoyed a wonderful stay and had the opportunity to explore our neighboring Crystal Cove State Beach. I appreciate your feedback regarding lighting and media accessibility as well. Please know I’ve personally addressed your concerns with our maintenance team, so we may improve the overall experience for future guests. Thank you again for thoughtful insight, and we hope to welcome you back to Pelican Hill soon!  Kind regards,  Tom Donovan  Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Fantastic all the way around. The grounds are magnificent. The rooms are impeccable. The service is superior.  The cost reflects all of the above.  The staff is superbly trained and accommodating. The beds are extremely comfortable.  Nothing negative to say about my three day two night stay with my family. The kids were in awe and loved every minute of it.

Amazing hotel. My husband and I stayed here on an overnight trip and had a great time. We loved the bungalow. So cozy and charming. I did not want to leave the room. The restaurants are all top notch and we enjoyed our couples massage and spa experience. The only bummer was that my husband came for the golf and that weekend, there was a tournament and he was not allowed to get a tee time. He wasn't told in advanced and it would have been helpful if he had known. It wasn't a bother to me but I understand why he was unhappy. Overall, it was a great stay and we'll definitely return.
Manager Response: Hello Rebecca,   Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughtful review with us. I’m glad to read you and your husband had a wonderful stay in the Bungalows and enjoyed your dining and Spa experiences. I understand your husband’s disappointment at being unable to book a tee time during your visit and apologize that our team didn’t communicate that information to you before your arrival. I truly appreciate your insight, and we look forward to welcoming you both back to Pelican Hill soon.   Kind regards,  Tom Donovan  Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We have stayed in all the best hotels in New port, Laguna, and Dana Point.   We can honestly say that our favorite is staying in the 2 or 3 bedroom ocean view Villas at Pelican.   They are gorgeous and offer great space.  We love the villa pool and and resturant. The spa is amazing.  The coliseum pool and restaurant are spectacular.   You have a top of the line kitchen if you want to cook something if you have kids with you.   The Villas are great for enterand just hanging out.  We would go every weekend if we could,  it is like a home away from home.   They are just amazing.

This has to be one of my favorite Marriott's. Service was great. The shuttle service was an added bonus. I liked the layout of the complex and didn't mind the walk up many steps to the one pool are. We'll be going back.

This resort has amazing views and okay restaurant and less than average spa. The staff are professional and the restaurant is always packed so you should reserve before you visit if your going to brunch or lunch.

Excellent all around: in location, facilities, and service.  Two thrums up!  Rooms are more like apartments, with a outdoor balcony facing the ocean or the gulf course.  The property is HUGE, allowing difficult venues in multiple days.  And the Roman style swimming pools are incredible!

I booked a Mini Vacation for myself and my Mother, Bungalow Garden View. I wanted a trip to spoil my mom. As we entered the resort we were left speechless.  We took lots of photos, this resort is Majestic. Views of the Pacific Ocean, the property grounds, the golf course and the complex are breathtaking. Our room was a Garden View but it actually has a ocean view over the foliage so we were greatly surprised and pleased. Huge bathroom, the whole bungalow was large. The outside patio/terrace is actually very large and roomy with glass wall so nothing blocks the ocean view. We loved the fireplace in our room. The Colosseum pool is Grand. It actually has small waves like a beach shoreline. We ate 4 times at the resort and all was very delicious. Did not use the Spa this trip, will

Tim is outstanding, I never got his last name but he was so nice to my family and I!   This was at 10am of June 24th, we went for a breakfast buffet and he served us. And really really set the bar high for my future servers, he's such a great example. He's so nice, i cannot stress it out enough. This is how restaurant services should be. I am also aware that he was a bartender but as a waiter he's so outstanding. He made me really feel comfortable and well taken care of.  He was very excited to take care of everyone, and i really wish him luck to his future endeavors.  Tim if you're reading this, we were the ethnic family that you served your secret smoothie! We hope you the best!

We stayed recently over Memorial Day weekend in the Villas to celebrate our parents 50th wedding anniversary.  The resort itself is truly luxurious and upscale.  Plenty of attention to upscale detail.  Unfortunately, there weren't a lot of activities for the various aged kids with us so they mostly spent the days in the pool.  It was crowded over the weekend and although the pools were very large - it was often hard to find a spot to sit if not there 1st thing in the AM.  Not right on the beach and we walked vs. taking the shuttle - easier down the hill than back up!  Ate at 2 of the restaurants on site and while they were very nice - we all felt they were also very overpriced.  Overall,  it was a great time away.

Summary Heading: Clearly Customer Service is not their watchword
Summary: We had researched the property and booked an ocean view bungalow , upon arrival we were told we had a free upgrade to the Villas that are far superior to what we had booked, however a six bedroom villa is not what a couple wanted with no ocean view and a lack of any service in the villa.   No butler was at the room as promised on arrival, on 4 occasions the first day no one answered the phone for butler service as we were so far away from where we wanted to be we had to call the butler to give us a lift to the resort or dining areas.   On once occasion they did not turn up for 1/2 hour, making us late for our reservation, we called and no one really had an clue what is going on, we asked for our feedback to go to the manager for a response, but heard nothing.   Now checking out,

We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa and had a fantastic weekend trip. The villa was spotless, views were fantastic, service was great, and food was delicious. This resort is very kid-friendly and great for families. We will definitely be back.   Also loved the live music in the evenings. The 4-piece band in the bar area got everyone dancing and the musician at Andrea was a fabulous touch.   Only minor complaint is that the Colosseum pool appears to fill up quickly on weekends with Pelican Hill members - we weren't expecting so many members and their families. If you're a resort guest, make sure to get a spot by the pool before 11AM or you'll be out of luck. Unfortunately we didn't make it to the beach but the pools really were fantastic.   ***One recent reviewer commented that Villas

The Villas have been a bit abused by guest and the Irvine Company has not stepped up to the plate to remodel, repair broken items, lighting and internet is horrible. The list goes on.  Not worth the price
Manager Response: Hello Vicki,   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us, and I apologize that your recent stay at the Villas was anything less than perfect. Our goal is for every guest to enjoy exceptional service and accommodations, and I’m disappointed to read that your Villa fell short. I’ve taken this opportunity to share your detailed comments with our engineering and maintenance teams, and I’d also like to connect you with our Villa General Manager, so we may personally apologize. I’ve shared his direct phone number with you in a private message, and we hope to welcome you back for a much-improved visit soon.  Kind regards,  Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: A simply stunning property in one of the nicest locations in Southern California.  Great for a romantic getaway, the staff will lavish you with attention and a smile at all times.  Every aspect of the physical layout was spectacular and the setting was beautiful.  Very expensive, but worth it.

Pelican Hill has now become my home away from home when I travel to CA.  I try to get out here at least three times a year.  What I have come to like most is the service and the fact that I can count on everything being right.  Not perfect, but right.  Check in is never an issue and they try to accomodate when I arrive much too early to normal check in.  The resort and area is usually very quiet.  This might have to do with the time of my stay but still, it is quiet.  I also always get a good nights sleep.  This is one of the few places that I actually feel rested and relaxed after sleeping.  I usually stay in a villa which is a great deal if you are having guests over and want a little more privacy.  You have to be a little self reliant and stop and pickup some goceries for

Beautiful property!  Loved our room!  Loved the views, grounds, service, food, spa, everything! The rooms are very large.  The bathroom is as big as my guest bed room!   I have never stayed anywhere this quiet.  Literally didn't think we had immediate neighbors. Only drawback is that everything is a trek.  Would love for my parents to stay there but the distance to the facilities would be a bit much for them. Hoping to make it back there!

Summary Heading: A very special place for a special day
Summary: This resort is gorgeous.  Stayed in one of the beautiful 3 bedroom villas and got married on the patio overlooking the golf course with the ocean in the distance.  Everything about this resort is first class.  Tom, the General Manager, responded extremely quickly to some questions I had regarding the suitability of this location for an intimate wedding.  Another staff member, Chris, was extremely helpful with finalizing details and ensuring things went smoothly for us on our special day.  The grounds and amenities were immaculate and all staff members we encountered were friendly and professional.  We will look forward to going back for our anniversary!

This place is beyond! The service and amenities are wonderful -- I couldn't have asked for a better stay. I was there on business and would come back for a trip with my family anytime. The staff are attentive, the food is good, and the atmosphere is relaxing. You are surrounded by a beautiful golf course and the pools on the property are instagrammable.

Summary Heading: Magnificent resort at the RIGHT time.
Summary: The California coastline is so grand as the ocean meets the coast. Pelican Hill celebrates this grandeur inviting visitors to enjoy nature in luxurious surroundings with stellar service. We had a bungalow in the ocean which only accented the natural beauty. This is a resort of quality and my my  family can hardly wait to revisit but at the right time.  Many know of this jewel in Newport Beach but on this Memorial Day weekend managers kept the doors open negatively affecting the luxury of the property. As more visitors came seats by the pool became scarce and the food service became slow if not forgotten. Luxury suffered leaving patrons disgruntled.  I will return to this elegant property but not on a holiday weekend. Then I will know.that Pelican Hill will resume  its place

Summary Heading: Very Attentive Staff !! Great Rooms!! Tranquil !!
Summary: 5 night visit . The hotel is set in the most amazing grounds surrounded by a golf course . The hotel is away from hustle and bustle and a short walk to the beach . The spacious room was clean and had everything we needed . The Hotel Team here are always very courteous and obliging. Would definitely return.

Summary Heading: Luxurious girl's getaway at the gorgeous resort at Pelican Hill
Summary: Our girl's getaway at Pelican Hill was midweek so it was quiet and felt like a true vacation. We had a beautiful bungalow with a large patio overlooking the ocean. The view is gorgeous and reminiscent of a Mediterranean seaside resort. The coliseum pool is colossal and has views of the ocean and golf course. There is a spa and admission is  included in the room rate which we thought was awesome. They also offer fitness classes and have a nice gym. They have great walking paths and a free shuttle to the beach! We also liked the gelateria in the cafe by the lobby and may have frequented it daily for our daily dose of gelato :)

Summary Heading: a second visit to the resort at Pelican Hill
Summary: I'm a bit late writing this review for my 3 night stay at this resort which took place in late April...i was busy....but, i don't want to skip it so here goes: our second time at this beautiful resort was even better than the first: we (my husband and I plus our adult son and our little service dog, Daisy) stayed in a gorgeous ocean view villa (thank you, Joshua!) and enjoyed every moment sitting on the terrace looking at the ocean in the distance and golf course below. Although our check in was not great (we had to wait until 5.30 pm to get access to our room) but this ocean view villa was well worth the extra wait! while waiting , we had a lovely lunch at the restaurant near the hotel pool ( I forget the name)...and then enjoyed the villa immensely. we stayed at the villa pool

Stunning. Ultra-Luxe. Outstanding. It’s rare to find a resort that can capture all of these qualities simultaneously, but the Pelican Hill makes it looks easy. Although we’ve been there several times before, I feel inclined to review the resort because of the way they handled themselves on our last trip. Arriving slightly before check-in time, we had a chance to enjoy the property with our children (1st time family trip), for a good part of the day. We were notified as soon as the hotel room was available, and eventually made our way from the pool to our room, but had a hiccup with shuttle service/communication which “domino-ed” into our dinner plans. We made it to the room, and as expected, it was immaculate. After settling in, we called the front desk, and asked that

Great hotel with fab restaurants. My only negative is the 2 bedroom villas across the street can feel a bit isolated, and def loose the hotel feeling. I know some guests may like that, but I def prefer a buzz from the resort.

Summary Heading: Staff will bend over backwards for you
Summary: This is a lovely resort - compares quite nicely with the nearby Ritz Carlton. The bungalows are clean and comfortable and the amenities are first class. We had lunch at the restaurant next to the pool and dinner at the golf course - both meals were great, as was the room service breakfast we had on our patio overlooking the golf course and ocean. The main restaurant was fully booked for dinner by early afternoon.

Summary Heading: Business trip with my boyfriend but pleasure for me
Summary: Everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel, accommodations, food, rooms, spa all amazing. Poolside was fantastic although they stopped serving alcohol a little early for our group! Brooke was lovely attentive and kept her running pretty good. I had an 80minute massage by Jaun Carlos and it was really the best I have ever had. Customer service excellent. The only negative experience was that the housekeeper was cleaning my room at 5 pm when we needed to get ready and be at a dinner reservation. She did not speak or understand English. Also, the women that have me a tour of the spa her accent was so thick I could not under her. These two things in no way finished or affected the enjoyment of this lovely resort. I can't wait to go back!

Visited on my 70th birthday.  The view of the ocean and golf course was absolutely breathtaking .  This resort is first rate all the way from the cozy fireplace to the palatial bathrooms !!  We felt like royalty in our plush bathrobes and could've  stayed here forever.  Before we left we toured the infinity pool and cabana area.  The view over the resort rooftops looked like we were in Italy.  Hoping to return soon, it would be a perfect destination for a family holiday gathering !!  Kitchen is well stocked for cooking !!

Summary Heading: A Week of Bliss in the OC
Summary: The perfect place for a family stay. Very attentive service and a great system of shuttles. Close to the resort hotel if you want to walk to spa, workout classes or coffee. Very quiet and secluded with fabulous views of the golf course and ocean. Gourmet Kitchen is fully equipped with Wolfe appliances for cooking and entertaining. We love the patio area although we only had 3 chaises. The table and umbrella make for another great space to entertain. Full 2-car garage has large load washer/dryer that worked well. This was our second stay at the Villas and we will be back.

Summary Heading: There is no false advertising going on here.
Summary: Pelican Hill really is as amazing as the brochures say. They have great restaurants. The spa is wonderful. The pools are beautiful. What can I say? My only complaint is the cost, but you have to know that going into it.

We stayed at the resort for 4 days as part of a larger group.  The room & scenery were beautiful, but the food & food servers were shockingly bad.  We spent most of our time by the pool, but struggled to get a server to return to us to even get drink orders.  The service was also very slow.  We also had private dinners with our group of about 100 people and many people commented about how bad the food was.  Food at the outdoor dinner was cold and/or without flavor.  The spa, however, was nice.  We had 2 massages at the spa, which we enjoyed.  There is only 1 resort pool, which also surprised me.  This resort is very pricey, and it's a shame that the food & service doesn't measure up.
Manager Response: Hello Kristin,   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. While I’m glad to read that you enjoyed your guest room, the Spa and the Resort’s overall ambience, I’m sorry that your dining experiences fell short. It’s important that our guests enjoy an excellent experience throughout their entire stay at Pelican Hill, and I’m disappointed that your dinner and pool service fell short. I’d like to connect you with our Director of Food & Beverage, so we may personally apologize and hopefully regain your trust for a much-improved visit in the future. I’ve shared his direct phone number with you in a private message, and we look forward to the opportunity to speak with you soon.  Kind regards, Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Luxury and beauty with ocean views
Summary: This resort is beyond belief. It reminds me of an Italian estate. My room was exquisite with a fireplace, a very comfortable bed, and an beautiful bathroom. The pool and its adjoining restaurant look like a Roman palacio.  I was attending a meeting and the catering cuisine was excellent. Before I returned home, I had dinner in the restaurant and watched the sun set over the Pacific.   I once stayed in a great resort in Sardinia, and this was certainly equal, if not superior. On a scale of 1 to 10, this was a 15.

It's hard to oversell how amazing Pelican Hill is. We've stayed twice in the past six months, and both times I didn't want to leave. The bungalows feel so private and secluded, I forget that I'm at a resort. Then, I call to order room service, and remember just how incredible the service is, and how on top of their game the staff are. With out a doubt, this is our go-to hotel when we visit Orange Country.

The nicest by far grandest resort Ive ever been! Everything about my stay here was outstanding and the service exceeded expectations. Our 3 bedroom villa amazing and view overlooking golf course and ocean was beautiful. We had our own butler button at our service!  We walked to the beaches below and enjoyed lunch and drinks at nearest beach restaurant. Beautiful resort and 5 star rating was accurate on all levels. Would be a beautiful location for a wedding!

An incredibly beautiful resort. However, the staff make the experience. Exceptionally polite and accommodating. For our group, Matt Rodriguez, was the stand out. A natural entertainer, so eager to make our stay as good as it can be, we will sincerely miss him. Thanks Matt!

Immaculate place, with stunning views over to the ocean and golf course. The villas are exceptional, everything you will need are here.   The largest round pool I have ever seen anywhere. No need to fight for a lounger.. sooo many.

Summary Heading: Such a shame their spa staff are so rude!
Summary: Our first time here. After checking into our room and being blown away by the views, me and my fiancé decided to hit the gym, which was through the spa. At the Spa, we asked the girl at the counter to give us the run down on the spa services. She quickly began "booking our appointment" without even giving us a description of the services and the prices. After 3rd question, I reiterated that I simply wanted to learn about the services...!. She nodded and kept asking questions about the booking. Once she got to the end, she read the disclaimer, that "this booking is final and can not be canceled, and if no show, 50% will be charged to our room, would you like me to go ahead and book this appointment of you?" that's when I said no, can you tell me about what Im buying first and
Manager Response: Hello Mr. Jalili,   Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback on our Yelp and TripAdvisor pages. While I’m glad to read that you and your fiancé enjoyed your guest room and the Resort’s ambience, I apologize that your unfortunate experience at the Spa front desk tarnished an otherwise positive visit. I’d like to connect you with our Director of Spa, so we may personally apologize, and I have shared her direct phone number with you in a private message. I truly appreciate your insight, and we look forward to the opportunity to speak with you soon.   Kind regards,  Tom Donovan  Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We had recently stayed at the Pelican Hills Resort for one week and rented two Villas.  The complete experience was outstanding services with the exception on the Country Club Grill.  The Grill Bar had a special event for the Kentucky Derby and was closed for a Private Party.  My wife and I walked up to three Hostess standing at the desk and asked them since your closed for a PP where can we go and have a glass of Champagne.  They all looked at each other and said we are not sure but let me call for you.  I said to my wife lets go back to the Villas lobby where the service is outstanding and truly enjoy a bottle of Champagne.  We've been on this property many times and services has always been outstanding.  Spoke with Tom D. (New Managing Director) Omar over the phone the new GM

With a large property beautiful golf course and great pools this is one of the best resorts i have every stayed at. I had the luxury to stay in a villa with a car garage 2 rooms kitchen and a lot more. Mine and my family experience was mind blown. The service all around the resort is really good and come pick you up in cars and the odd time a gold course. If you are interested in a tour of the property just ask and they are more then happy to take you on a tour.   This resort is so good i can't really say that much about it it really takes the word right out of my mouth.

Summary Heading: 3 times in 5 years, still the best
Summary: family of 5, 3 kids(13,13,10) stayed 3 nights in a Villa. Awesome place, the Villa Butler service, the concierge, and the facilities are all 5 star. It still looks wonderful and you feel so special staying here. My children had a birthday here, and were treated very well. I thoroughly recommend you stay here.

Summary Heading: Beautiful property that is not being well maintained and has rude, unprofessional staff
Summary: My family and I visited in March, 2017.  We rented two bungalós and this was probably our sixth or seventh stay here over the past few years.  This will be our last stay at this property.  When we asked to check in early around 12:30 pm, we were told that the one room would not be ready until 4:00 pm,, but the other room was almost ready and we could check in to that one shortly.  We went over to the pool bar and ordered two burgers and four drinks. We waited over an hour for the food and it was NOT quality food, although very expensive.  We checked back with the desk and they advised the room was not ready, but we were on a priority waitlist.  We kept checking back every hour until the very rude  guy at the desk told me "look, don't ask any more, we will call you" So, our
Manager Response: Hello Penney,   Thank you for your family’s continued loyalty to Pelican Hill and for taking the time to share your feedback on our review page. I apologize that your most recent stay with us didn’t match the level of excellence that you’ve enjoyed during your previous visits. There is nothing more important than the time you spend with your family, and I’m disappointed in the service delays and maintenance problems you experienced during your family vacation. Please know I’ve shared your detailed comments with our Coliseum Pool & Grill and engineering teams, so we may improve the overall guest experience and make all necessary repairs to your Bungalow. I’d also like to connect you with our Director of Rooms, so we may personally apologize for falling short and hopefully regain your family’s trust for a much-improved stay in the future. I’ve shared his direct contact info with you in a private message, and we look forward to the opportunity to speak with you soon.   Kind regards,  Tom Donovan  Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This resort is so accommodating. The bungalows are in fantastic shape, and have plenty of room. Beautiful vistas and GREAT location just a few minutes away from Laguna and Newport. Don't forget to bring your clubs. The course is very nice and fun to play.  Almost everything was fantastic. The toilet in our room ran a little, but we couldn't here it unless we were near it. I had to find something negative to say,  but I would highly recommend this resort.

Summary Heading: Attended conference here.  Didn't spend the night
Summary: Views are spectacular!  Conference room was FREEZING!  It was ridiculous.  Everyone was complaining but didn't seem to get better.  Food was wonderful and again, you can't beat the views.  Room prices are crazy pricey.  I didn't stay here, but at a gorgeous resort in Newport for 1/4 the price

Have stayed here previously, but this was our first time in a 2 bedroom villa with a family of four, booked via Amex Fine Hotels. Check-in at the villa clubhouse was a little discombobulated, but staff recovered quickly and held our luggage until the villa was ready. Upon our return, we met our butler, who escorted us to our villa and went over everything. Villas are very large and well-appointed, with a considerate "starter" level of beverages and basic amenities. There is a full kitchen, dining room, living room, two ensuite bedrooms, powder room, very large balcony, and perhaps most excitingly, a washer and dryer! We also received wonderful welcome amenities from the resort and American Express, just part of the little things that make a stay so special.  To get to the main

I was lucky enough to play the courses at Pelican Hill when they first opened.  There was no resort, there was no clubhouse, there was only the golf.  25 years later the property has gone from local gem to world class stratospheric superstar.  The golf courses have matured into the stars that Tom Fazio hoped for when he designed them.  The North Course we played is a longer course and higher in the hills than the South Course which runs near the ocean, but it is a better test of skill.  Beautifully laid out, gorgeous surroundings and exceptional views, this course rivals Pebble Beach as one of California's stellar courses.   The Pro Shop will give you whatever you need, there is a great Men's Locker Room with showers and other facilities you would expect, and range balls are

By far the most spectacular resort in the country. Traveling nearly 100 days per year between business and pleasure, this is my go to hotel/Resort. The staff are exceptional. The grounds are breathtaking, the ocean view from the bungalow is a wow. We had dinner at Andreas on Easter Sunday and the food and incomparable wine list (and reasonably priced wines are available-and if you desire Screaming Eagle and Harlan too). My wife had what she tells me was the best facial ever. My wife now understands why I consider this my No.1 destination for work and play. A Five Star and then some.

Summary Heading: World Class Service, Rooms and Views
Summary: I have stayed at luxury properties on 5 continents and the Resort at Pelican Hill has some of the best rooms of them all. I had an upgrade to an amazing Ocean View Suite. Two fireplaces, soaking tub, two bathrooms, HUGE terrace with ocean views and asking right out front.   The resort has an epic pool -- the largest circular pool in the world. The space is world class and the management staff is exceptional.  A special shout out to Zarko Lucic and Danielle De Beaubien who went above beyond by answering pre-arrival questions, keeping me posted on the status of my room, greeting me at check-in, giving a great upgrade and overall being all-star management staff. Pelican Hill is lucky to have them

Summary Heading: Great Rooms at Villas.  Not good at restaurant
Summary: We rented two villas for Easter weekend.  Very expensive, but also very nice.  The butler Angie could not have been more friendly and accommodating.  The pool and public facilities were also wonderful.  It is therefore surprising that the restaurant at the villas was pretty bad.  We had breakfast there in two mornings and attempted one lunch.  Service at breakfast was bad; servers were often absent from the dining room, forgot requested items ordered.  Also, they seemed surly - which can't be good for their tip income.  The buffet food was okay.  One of the toasters didn't work.  Milk for cereal and drinking was in short supply.  When the server brought the check, no pen was included.  Hard to believe lunch was even worse.  I placed an order but never received any item ordered.
Manager Response: Shermyanne,  Thank you for celebrating the Easter holiday with us and for taking the time to share your thoughtful review.  While I’m glad to read that you enjoyed your overall trip to Pelican Hill, I’m disappointed that your dining experiences at the Villa Clubhouse left you underwhelmed. Our goal is for our guests to enjoy every moment of their stay at the Resort, and I apologize that we fell short during your family’s special vacation. I’d like to connect you with our Director of Food & Beverage so we may personally apologize for our shortcomings and hopefully regain your trust for a future visit. I’ve provided his direct phone number to you in a private message, and we look forward to the opportunity to speak with you soon.  Kind regards, Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: If so, then the Resort at Pelican Hill is for you. The only highlight of our stay was some of the service and food at the restaurants, aside from that everything was pretty much beige. I live near Pelican Hill and had an idea of what it would be like - it wasn't anything like what I thought. It was disappointing at best.   First off, I felt the rooms were large, but cheaply done. They didn't have any style, they were (you guessed it) completely beige. We happened to stay for our 1st wedding anniversary, which also happened to occur during one of the worst rainstorms in January. This was fine, we expected this, but our room was very cold when we got there and took hours to heat up. We had to contact the front desk twice to even get any service. When they did arrive they said we
Manager Response: Hello Amy,  I apologize that your stay at Pelican Hill left you and your husband disappointed, especially because you were celebrating an occasion as special as your first wedding anniversary. Our goal is to provide each guest with not only beautiful accommodations, but also attentive and personalized service, and I’m sorry that we fell short in both areas during your stay. Please know I’ve taken this opportunity to address your concerns about your Bungalow as well as the service missteps at Coliseum Pool & Grill and check-out with our management team, so that we may improve.  I’d also like to connect you with our Director of Rooms, so we may personally apologize for the shortcomings of your recent visit. I’ve shared his direct phone number with you in a private message. I truly appreciate you taking the time to share your detailed feedback with us, and we hope to welcome you and your husband back for a much-improved visit soon.   Kind regards,   Tom Donovan Managing Director, The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We are talking luxury here! The grounds were so spectacular I felt if I had landed in some exotic European Destination. The rooms were luxurious and large with fireplaces, and unlike some Four Season properties they provided coffee makers and ironing boards/irons in the rooms. The property was very large but shuttles were always available. I was lucky enough to attend a lovely event and dinner, which was magnificently delicious in every way. Service was wonderful.

Nice facility and grounds. Our bungalow was large, luxurious and had a great view of the ocean. The pool are is really nice. Good food on site. Service was average (particularly at the pool), I expected a higher level based on ratings. I'm not a golfer, but it looked like a great golf destination. You have to shuttle to the beach and I'm not sure it was worth the trip.  The beach was dirty. Decent spa, got a good massage.

My husband and our teenage daughters spent a few nights at this resort last week and everything was superb!  We all wish that we could have stayed for a few more days.  We stayed in a two-bedroom villa that had beautiful views of the ocean (note that this resort is not right "on" the ocean but has ocean views).  It's hard to isolate a few things to comment upon because everything was wonderful.  Bedding...great!  Furnishings...great!  Housekeeping...super.  We appreciated the few complimentary items that were in our refrigerator when we checked in.  We were starving and it was great to have just a little something to munch on while we were unpacking.  I personally love the evening turn-down service...a little extra bit of pampering (fresh towels, candy on the pillows and water

From the time we arrived to the time we pulled out of parking spot in front of our Bungalow and little bocce ball court, there was no detailed missed.  Our room, a bungalow, had a nice marble floor and deep soak tub. Along with a nice big shower. The tub has wooden panels that open up to a view of the room. The linens and bed perfect. There was a fireplace, too, and nice big flat screen television. This all led to a nice patio that overlooked a small lawn.   The massive coliseum pool was great and the water temp was just right. I'm unsure, but want to say that it was salt water. Walking around the grounds, one could believe they were in an Italian village.   There was a daily resort fee and I'm still unsure what it included; wifi and??? Along with a daily parking fee. Not a fan

I stayed here for a week in the storms in January as part of a conference. Everything was amazing - bedrooms, food, service,  conferencing. The gas fire in the bedroom was a particularly nice touch. But the staff and their attention to detail, service with a smile attitude really stood out.

I'm bummed that my review can only have five stars. If I could give 10 stars I would. This is one of the best resort we have stayed at. From our arrival, views, room, food, personal resort tour from Gavin, the dining, spa experience and more... everything was perfect and couldn't have been better. We are so thankful to have had the opportunity to experience this resort. Attended on business and had the time of our lives! Thank you, Gavin, for helping book our spa treatment and we loved the ocean view bungalow. Ahhh we want to go back! You have to stay here!

We loved our spacious room, lovely spa and beautiful grounds. Great bathroom with nice toiletries and comfy robe. Nice patio with great view  and excellent beach. Comfy bed and good turndown service. Planning on returning soon.

Family of four had an amazing time at this easy and gorgeous spa hotel.  Very close to beautiful crystal cove beach, a huge pool for the kids to use, great restaurant for breakfast, wonderful staff and kind neighbors. The gym and the spa were just perfect. Not too big and not too small......and the spa has a great big Roman bath feel with vaulted ceilings and plenty of room to dance around. If I could change anything it would be for the resort to drop the parking charge.  It was $25 a night just to have our car parked in front of our bungalow.  That seems a bit much given what we're paying per night, dontcha think ? 😊

Summary Heading: If one could only live this well all of the time!
Summary: We made our a trip to Newport Beach last fall and splurged on the Villas at Pelican Hill.  What an experience!  Even though our room wasn't ready when we arrived, the staff apologized by treating us to a meal by the pool.  We had our three year old with us and they could not have been more pleasant to us with our over-tired little guy.  The stay was amazing as always, but even better with a kitchen and extra space.  We ate at the Grill at the Golf Club for a casual lunch that topped our expectations.  The Villas have their own clubhouse and pool. Highly recommend!

Summary Heading: One of a Kind in the Best Way Possible
Summary: We have been very fortunate to stay at the hotel on a number of occasions over the years, and have always found both the hotel and the services to be world class.  It is a rare occasion when the photos do not do justice to the actual property. The Irvine Company took their best parcel of land and created something timeless. Even if one can not afford to stay here, it would be a disservice not to come.   This year, we had the pleasure of connecting with both Jackie and Hunter at the front desk. They were exemplary in making sure that everything was in order, as we were arriving late in the evening. We even received a call back when we checked in to ensure that everything in the room was in order.   Our room was located near the top of the property. What is unique is that you can

This is a luxury facility and the staff are very friendly and helpful.  I expect more from a luxury resort than plush surroundings and high end décor. The fitness facility was good, but no better than a Hilton or Marriott.  If you are from the east coast, you are waking up early.  There is no coffee service or cafe open until 6:30 am. The restaurant and bar are very good.  Nice selections of salads, appetizers, and entre's.  The bar had skilled bartenders making crafted cocktails.

Although the public areas have beautiful views be sure to see your view from your bungalow first. I was looking out onto a construction site and had a veranda with no sun exposure and covered with overhanging shrubs! Do not allow them to put you in any of the bungalows numbered 441 to 444. I was unsuccessful in getting moved although I heard from others our group that did get reassigned. The front lobby staff were not interested in assisting me. Very disappointing!

We stayed in this resort for 10 days the rooms are so big and cozy the sea view is amazing , in the same compound you can find amazing resturant it's a 45 minutes drive to the city but around it are many areas like Disney land,  san diego is close ... etc

The minute you drive to the door the valet is there to park your car. Still quite an unusual experience for us Europeans.  Entering the hotel you get a feeling of comfort, detail, taste - more commonly associated with great hotels of bygone eras. This is a very well thought through place.  Candles, seating, lighting, space - I enjoyed it. I just wish that I had longer to stay!  I am not a golfer but it looked pretty amazing from the vantage point I had above the course.  The bar is fabulous, the patio and pool areas are very nice. I hope to return!

Private patios with ocean views, fantastic pool and cabana service and spacious rooms with all the amenities. You will be pampered and well looked after throughout your stay with really no need to leave the property except to jog the trails and sand beaches just down the hill from the resort. If you want California luxury, this is it.

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort, great service, spa, golf and food
Summary: Loved our room. We stayed in a "bungalow". Wonderful deck/Patio with private lounge chairs. Loved the pool and the food was outstanding. Can't beat the golf. I feel the crystal cove (public) beach was overrated so don't feel bad skipping that.

This place was amazing  Service was great and has some excellent restaurants   Great golf course and was a difinite 5 star stay  Pool area was very good and lots of amenities   Highly recemend for couples or families

Even though we were only able to spend one night, The Resort at Pelican Hill is on our comeback list.  Very friendly staff (which really makes a difference), a clearly well maintained physical facility and a setting that deserves more than a passing look, it is one of the best we have been fortunate to stay at.

Incredible resort with something for everyone. We visited for a birthday celebration and we were not disappointed. We stayed in a bungalow with both an ocean and golf view. The beautiful room was very large with a fireplace, a sitting area and a private balcony.   There are two golf courses. Both are well-manicured and many holes have views of the ocean. A golfer's paradise for sure! There is an amazing circular pool. But, the air temperature was a bit to cool for us to try it. It is heated and there were people swimming.   The hotel employees were wonderful and gracious. They were all so anxious to please.   We found the weather in mid-March to be tricky. Certainly not as warm as we expected. I might hold out til April for warmer weather.

We had the pleasure of staying here for a company retreat in February. The staff was professional and accommodating. I spent a couple rainy days in the spa and thoroughly enjoyed all my treatments.  This is a quiet spot that would be ideal for couples.

Quite bowled over by hotel.   Beautiful design inside and out with fabulous views over the golf course and sea. Had excellent lunch above the pool which was just spectacular.   Terrific hotel shops - everything outstanding and couldn't be more impressive

We are hoping to come back this Spring! I adore this hotel-the rooms are the best part. I would of course love it was a little less expensive... but it is luxury :)  The pool is great the grounds are beautiful and the ocean view is worth it!!!

We've stayed here several times when visiting Southern CA- beautiful location with views of the ocean.  The property is large and the pools are very beautiful.  Our kids love this place.  You can drive your car and park next to your residence.  The pool is really nice, reminds me of Italy.

Summary Heading: One Day I Am not Going to Leave
Summary: Enjoyed another fantastic stay in a villa at Pelican Hill.  While I am impressed with the service and the views, I still enjoy how quiet the area is. Whether it be during the day or night, it always feels peaceful.  Leaving the large patio doors open offers a great breeze right off the ocean.  Service is impecable while not being over the top or intruding.  Attention to detail is great and the butler service and ability to have your villa stocked with groceries ahead of time is a wonderful perk.

My wife and I have stayed a Pelican Hill several times of the past few years and it is always a wonderful experience.   The Bungalows are some of the nicest rooms you can ever stay..  There are 2 gold course and a great spa.  The entire staff can not be more helpful.

This place is amazing - whether you talk about location, service or facilities.  Regrettably I was here for business, so I didn't have an opportunity to take advantage of all the facilities or ample time to enjoy my accommodations (which were nothing short of amazing).

Summary Heading: One of the best resorts we have ever stayed in
Summary: We stayed in a three bedroom villa for our family vacation in February.  The villa exceeded all expectations.  They are extremely spacious and luxurious. There was no comparison as the price we paid was the same as one room at the Ritz Carlton. Travelling with three kids ( two teens) as a family of five, this was the perfect size for our family. We love the Newport Beach area and this resort was beautifully maintained.  We were ready to move in permanently:))

You think Tuscany. The resort is a cluster of stuccoed villas sprawled over several acres of land  in Newport Beach. The decor is plush and inviting.  It just calls to you to sink into the couch or bed and daydream while staring at the stone fireplace or to the patio and beyond to the hills and the Italian junipers. You do begin to relax.....

This is my first trip to California celebrating my sister's 50th birthday.  Incredible staff, food amazing and spa facilities and treatments to heal you.    Great villa with a great kitchen, fireplace, living room and dining area for 8 people was incredible.  I felt like we were at the cottage.    Breathtaking view of the golf course and the back drop of the ocean from our patio is like being in paradise.  I will always remember the caring staff where one day I was not feeling well and provided me with a complementary chicken noodle soup dinner.  Believe me I appreciate great customer service.  This is a trip that I will share with all and hopefully will come back soon.  If you have a special event to celebrate or want to be pampered, this stay will reenergize you.

Summary Heading: Best stay during our California tour!
Summary: We arrived late and didn´t get to experience the facility at the hotel. But, the standard of our bungalow was just amazing and definitely the best during our entire trip through California. It was very clean (best!), perfect bathroom, delightful bed, large room, terracce with best sun beds and so on. I can just say that you will not regret it.   However, be aware that it is a bit far from city center (for a European person), but we experienced that you need a car for everything in this area anyway. So, given that, just go for the hill :)

Pelican resort is our #1 place to stay at in California. This place never disappoints. There service is five star +! I don't think that we ever checked out disappointed. There staff are friendly and very accommodating especially on our last trip Marcus helped us with check in his customer service was beyond my expectations. We enjoyed our stay so much that we are looking forward to our next stay with this resort.

My wife and I were guests at Pelican Bay.  Rooms were great. Spacious bed & living area with porch overlooking the Pacific.  Large bathroom with large shower.  Food was great and because we were with a Group the dinners were well prepared and hot as 100+ ate at same time. The staff was extremely friendly and would do anything for you. We flew into J.Wayne- Orange County which is only 20 min away. Very easy as opposed to LAX. Golf was outstanding!  Great carries and beautiful vistas on the South course both days. Greens hard to read and sneaky fast at times. It was a great 3 days and if you are a golf enthusiast it needs to be on your list of courses to play!

Went there for business. Fantastic venue, ideal for golfers. The venue is perfect for receiving large groups, i.e. seminars. Quality of food & service is exceptional. Only downside, is that hotel is not at walking distance from beach or shops...

The weather may not have been ideal the week we were there but the resort made our time memorable. The staff is warm attentive and genuinely interested in insuring they exceed your expectations. The spa service are unique with excellent therapists. Restaurants are universally great. Special kudos to the sous chef at Pelican Grill  - if you can try his chef's table menu it is well worth it. Andrea's is also memorable. Any of the fresh pasta dishes are worth the extra time you spend in the gym working off the calories. The morning guided walks along the beach make for a great start to everyday. Can nto wait until our next visit.   .

The bungalow rooms are large with a fireplace plus a nice private balcony. The bathrooms are spacious. Service is ok to good but not truly superb. Where I have a problem is Pelican Hill bills itself as a beach resort but it is not. The beach is a 20 minute walk away. You cannot even walk through the resort and exit onto the beach or even near the beach. They provided no property exit like that. You have to exit from the entrance of the resort and walk 20 minutes on public roads to reach the beach. In fairness, they offer a shuttle. However, when we arrived our first day, we used the shuttle at 4pm to the beach, but they didn't tell us they do not do pickups after 5pm. When we called, they told us to call for a taxi. The following days, we just drove ourselves to the beach and

One of our favorite weekend get-away resorts. A easy drive from Los Angeles to escape the hustle and bustle. Once there, we simply stay put and enjoy the elegant spacious room, beautiful grounds, and gorgeous pool. This is truly a lover's paradise and we can't wait for our annual spring anniversary to experience it all over again.

We arrived at the hotel very late. Some how we got lucky enough to get upgraded. This hotel is amazing. We had our own private ocean view villa. I don't have enough good things to say about the service of this resort. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. I will be back!

Mediterranen style architecture, high ceilings, light colors, stone and light wood help to make this resort extremely beautiful. Not to mention the wonderful location.We stayed in a bungalow with ocean views. It was a very large room with a vaulted ceiling, sitting area, huge bathroom, entry hall and a private patio with a table and chairs and chaise lounges. The day before we arrived was my birthday, Maria our Experience Concierge left a bottle of Moet & Chandon Champagne on ice in our bungalow! Thank you. We had a nice dinner at the Andrea restaurant with live music playing.We took a free shuttle bus to Crystal Cove beach. They supplied us with a free beach tote, towels and water. I used the hot tub in the Spa. It was enormous and I was the only one in it! The outdoor pool the

First of all, as others have noted this is one jaw-droppingly beautiful campus.  The grounds are lovingly maintained and the views are impressive.  We stayed in a three bedroom villa for five nights.  The space was very comfortable and the furnishings were in good condition.  One of the first things I noticed was that although six Nespresso pods had been provided, there was no coffee maker.  I called the front desk and was told that one would be delivered.  By evening, none had appeared and we were exhausted after flying in from the east coast, so we resigned ourselves to grabbing coffee out that next morning.  After several more phone calls the next day, the coffee maker finally appeared.    Unfortunately, the pods were not replenished the next day.  Again, three or four

This is not a five star resort, more like a three star. Absolutely no attention to detail. Rooms not cleaned till late, food service very slow, marketing materials not accurate. It was a very disappointing stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us, and I apologize that your recent stay at Pelican Hill didn’t reflect the Five-Star service or attention to detail we aim to provide every guest. I’m disappointed in the housekeeping delays and slow food service you experienced and understand your frustration with any marketing inaccuracies. I’d like to learn more about the shortcomings of your visit, so we may improve and hopefully regain your trust for a future visit. I’ve shared our Director of Rooms’ contact details in a private message, and we look forward to the opportunity to connect with you personally.  Kind regards, Ralph Grippo President, Irvine Company Resort Properties

Summary: Bungalows are magnificent with views of the Pacific Ocean.  Nice high ceilings,  Well appointed.  The restaurant within the resort is very good.  We enjoyed a very nice meal with live background music.  Staff is very attentive and nice.  The golf course looks amazing however I did not get a chance to enjoy it.  They provide a shuttle to the beach which a must do.

As we entered the "bungalow ", we knew one night here would never be enough. Within minutes we had extended our stay!  The staff can not do enough for you. Ask for a bag of ice and they offer two.  The food and beverages are pricey but oh so good. They shuttle you to the beach with a bag containing towels and water and chairs and an umbrella are available for the asking. A memorable experience.

Summary Heading: Top Notch Rooms, Service and Staff
Summary: My wife and I were here for a board meeting and conference.  We were given suite 420 which faces west.  The view from our private was the fairway of #1 of the south course.  The ocean was on the other side.  The 400 level suites all have an ocean view and would recommend them for the view.   The resort is very high end, but you really get what you pay for.  The main pool was beautiful with amazing sunsets.  The restaurants were great.  The market is the best value for food. The staff were amazing and very helpful.

Great place and friendly staff. Everyone is so nice. I love the fact that the pool does not close and went swimming at 2am in the heated pool! The Golf course is great. Room had a great view of the ocean and enjoyed having breakfast each morning there. The spa is a must as after a long day the steam room and sauna was perfect.

Summary Heading: Second stay in the 3 bedroom villas
Summary: We enjoyed our second visit to the villas at Pelican Hill. They are gorgeous and we had a wonderful stay. We reserved a 3 bedroom villa which was beautifully appointed.
