Our family of 5 enjoyed delicious breakfasts at the villa clubhouse every morning (the staff there is awesome!) and the front desk was so nice~ Kaylynn always greeted us every evening with extra water bottles and a smile. My experience with the villa concierge Kyle Clayton in planning our week was the best I have ever had. He helped me weeks ahead- selecting places to eat and getting difficult reservations, researching hikes, and suggesting wine tours. He was great! We took a family vote and will go here every year~ usually we try a new spot to explore but these villas are hard to beat.

Stayed last week on occasion of a company event. Gorgeous and fantastic. This place is amazing. Not cheap but amazing. I had a villa with great views and two big independent bedrooms with bathrooms. Kitchenette, ample living room. The location is walking distance to the sea. There are shuttles that transport you around property. As said before the prices at restaurants and bars are not cheap. There is great pool which is heated. Concierge services will do many things for you. I was very fortunate to stay at resort thanks to my company.  Only comment I would make: let's put more bicycles at disposal. It will help transportation and made stay healthier for guests.

Absolutely incredible stay. It's pricey. But well worth it. The restaurants were great. Service was excellent. An amazing spa that complimentary except for massages. The golf course is an experience you'll never forget. We did not spend time at the pool, but just the view was relaxing. Complimentary shuttles within the property. For traveling outside the property, uber rides were $5-$10. The bungalows were really comfortable. Gas fireplaces with timers. Great beds. Private balconies. I could go on.

Upon arriving is when I had a not so great experience with the front desk not provided the customer service I expected.  Then bc I was in a villa I had to go to a different area which is when I didn't have a pleasant experience with the valet. I was recovering from back surgery and they made me feel like it was such an inconvenience to take me to my villa and help me with bags.   The villa is amazing with fluffy robes and slippers wonderful products in the bathroom.  The butler service was helpful. Unfortunately at lunch the bar restaurant gave me dirty utensils and water glass. It happens but still.   Upon checkout I couldn't find anyone to open the heavy door at the main entrance and had to wait some time for my car.   I'm sure these are one off instances but for all of these
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting The Villas at Pelican Hill and taking the time to share your feedback with us. I’m disappointed that our team did not provide outstanding service throughout your stay, especially as you were visiting us to rest and recover from your surgery. I apologize that our valet and front desk teams were not more attentive during your check-in and check-out experience, and I’ve also addressed your comments about the dirty utensils and glass with the Villa Clubhouse management.  I’d like to take this opportunity to have our Villas General Manager connect with you to discuss your concerns in more detail, and I have provided his contact info in a private message. I truly appreciate you sharing your experience, and we look forward to connecting with you soon.  Kind regards,  Ralph Grippo President, Irvine Company Resort Properties

Summary Heading: Wow what a resort and location
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Resort at Pelican Hill recently for business meetings I had at location.  My first response is WOW.  This place is amazing.  Not cheap but amazing.  We had over 1,600 square foot bungalow with great views and two bathrooms.  The room was very private with large patio.  The room did not have kitchenettes - you have to stay in villas to get that.  The location is walking distance to ocean.  There are shuttles that transport you around property and will take you to close places.  The prices at restaurants and bars are not cheap.  There is great pool which is heated.  Concierge services will do many things for you.  We were very fortunate to stay at resort and loved every minute of it.  We did not want to leave.

I arrived on a Sunday for a conference, with some vague expectations that this looked like a nice place at least online.  Immediately on arrival, the look and feel of the Resort reminded me of Northern Italy, not only from the Villa like bungalows, but the foliage and hillside placement of of the property.  Pictures do not do it justice, and there is no bad view from any spot as a walk around revealed beauty of this place.  The Zen of the ambiance followed me everywhere from  the conference rooms, down to Crystal Cove and to the patio off of the main lobby where I sat and watched a hummingbird as I drank glass of wine.  My bungalow was lovely with its fire place and quiet privacy looking out over trees and the ocean in the distance.  Pricey? Yes, but worth every penny for the

Stayed many times. Both on business and with family. This is a much nicer stat than the Ritz Carlton, the St Regis or the Montage which are all close by. The 'rooms' are in fact mini villas/bungalows. Huge comfortable beds. All with fantastic massive bath tubs. Nice private balconies, bigh ceilings, all mod cons etc etc. It was wet and cold when I was there..the in room fireplace was just the ticket. In summer the pool is the best. I have always found the restaurant very 'meh..'..but pool service is very good. Golf course is crazy expensive. The rates tend to fluctuate significantly but if you can get a deal, there is nowhere better. Free parking too.. Will continue to return.

Summary Heading: Prestige. Luxury hotel but not friendly
Summary: This is a really nice place. My suite has great views of the coast across golf court and spacious living area. It's so important that the sunshine goes all the way inside and you can either enjoy the bath at patio or inside on sofa.   Some suggestions: 1. The mini bar is like a business hotel, charging all drinks. While for some other resorts I been to, the drinks are free in side the room. It's not a big investment and you don't expect us to drink them all. But it gives us a home feeling. And especially in cali, water quality is bad with strong smell.  2. There are two mags inside the room which are handmade. There is a section of writing saying they are sold in store and if anyone take the mags away, resort will charge you the price of new one as replacement fee. I am ok and I
Manager Response: Tiger,  Thank you for visiting The Resort at Pelican Hill and taking the time to share your feedback with us. I’m glad to read that you enjoyed your Bungalow Suite, and I apologize for the housekeeping disruption you experienced during your stay. We take the safety and comfort of our guests very seriously, and I understand your frustration in being interrupted while enjoying the privacy of your suite. I’ve personally addressed your concerns with our management and housekeeping staff, and our engineering team is investigating the water system in your Bungalow to confirm that it is drinkable for guests. Also, please know that we offer complimentary gourmet coffee pods and bottled water for you to enjoy in addition to the beverages and snacks available for purchase. I truly appreciate your feedback and look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Kind regards, Ralph Grippo President, Irvine Company Resort Properties

Summary: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa and everything you could want was there! The butler service included transportation around the resort. The staff were very good and the location excellent. You can either relax as we did or take part in everything on offer!

Summary Heading: Gorgeous resort near Newport Beach, CA
Summary: We stayed in a beautiful 2 bedroom, 2 1/2 bath villa for 2 days in January 2017. The villas are very nice and have all the amenities you need for a short or long term visit. The villas come with a butler, but we only saw him one time during our stay. All the staff at Pelican Hill are very friendly and professional. The villa was huge, probably around 2,000 square feet and came with a garage for your car.  We did not spend much time on the grounds of the hotel, instead we explored all the neighboring beaches and visited Fashion Island for some retail therapy. The hotel is about a mile from Corona del Mar, a gorgeous beach area. The official check in time is 5:00, but we called the morning of our visit and were allowed into our villa a little after 2 pm. When I return to this

Summary Heading: Not a 5 stars hotel at all
Summary: This is a beautiful property managed as 3 stars hotel !!! What a frustration to check in January 1st for booking made long in advance and waiting for my sea view room from 5.00pm to 7.15pm !!!! Do you think the management did care about my disappointment ? Not at all !!!! This is Pelican Hills management ...  For the rest of my stay i just confirm this hotel is absolutely not customer oriented at all !! Just beautiful landscape ...
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your recent experience while visiting with us earlier in the month. I am truly disappointed that we failed to provide you an appropriate check-in, but can absolutely assure you that taking care of our guests is our highest mission and not just a beautiful place. I would like to have our Rooms Manager connect with you to learn more about your specific experience, so we can improve, ensure it does not happen again and extend our care to you personally.  Thank you again for sharing your feedback, and we sincerely hope to have the opportunity to regain your trust in a future visit.  Kind regards,   Ralph Grippo President, Irvine Company Resort Properties

Summary: Nowadays there seems to be confusion as to what a 5 star place is. This is a 5 star place! The upgraded rooms are worth it (mind you I upgraded to an ocean view but keep in mind the ocean is pretty far away... ), and all the extra touches make this place just wonderful. I didnt eat at any of the restaurants but you are in Newport Beach so you should venture out and explore some of the local restaurants.   Needed to give a shoutout to Marcus who provided with an excellent checkout experience. Thanks!!

Resort at Pelican Hill is a posh, upscale expansive resort with views of the Pacific ocean. It's expensive and device with one exception was top notch.   My room was large and comfortable with good and convenient outlets. Amenities are nice and large. In room coffee service included.   My negative experience was checking out I told the bellman I was expected a car but due to exceptionally passive behavior my driver was there for 20 minutes before I prodded the bellman to find him. Very baffling.

My wife and I stayed at Pelican Hill for the final leg of a two-part babymoon (the last trip as a couple before a baby is born, if you're not familiar with the term). The resort is as-promised--grandiose, with sweeping views of the Pacific and an immaculate golf course. Sunset by the swimming pool is a thing to behold. The food was stellar at each of the restaurants (be sure to try the risotto at Andrea, which is finished tableside, mixed directly within a wheel of Parmigiano Reggiano).  I was particularly impressed with the special attention we received when I informed the concierge we were celebrating. Marcus somehow found a way to upgrade our room, and what would already have been a generous fireplace suite with terrace was effectively doubled in size (yes, TWO fireplaces, a

The entire property is gorgeous and beautifully maintained. The views of the ocean, especially on a sunny day, are perfect. We enjoyed our stay and especially appreciated the excellent service throughout. We requested an early check-in due to our flight arrival time, and the front desk staff were very helpful in trying to accommodate our request. The servers at the Cafe and the Coliseum were all friendly and efficient, despite being busy. The valet staff were so welcoming -- it was a great way to begin our stay.  We stayed in a garden view bungalow, which was a good size with a large bathroom and patio. Unfortunately, our view was of some parking spaces, so if lounging on the patio enjoying views is something important to you, it would be good to either reserve an ocean view

Stayed there for a family vacation.  What a perfect SoCal experience.  The resort has wonderful views of the pacific ocean, and set on rolling Newport Beach mountains. The pool is expansive (but too much/not enough chlorine? My eyes were itchy and red afterwards).  The bar service at the bar is good, but the pool service leaves a lot to be desired.  There simply was not enough attendants for the guests who were enjoying the beautiful day.  The lobby area is elegantly appointed generally a good place, although my check in took longer than I would have liked.  The valets were friendly, and the shuttle bus that makes loops around the resort comes frequently that you can just park your car and forget about driving.  The kids club is good, but when we were there, was sparsely

Summary Heading: Another great stay at Pelican Hill
Summary: We live in LA and, from time-to-time, like to get away from the city.  The Resort at Pelican Hill is a perfect break.  It's about a 1 to 1 1/2 hour drive from LA, located between Newport Beach and Laguna Beach.  The property, the rooms, and the service are all top notch, and we actually feel like we've had a vacation even when we go for just one or two nights.  There are lots of families at the property, but it is very easy to avoid noise and kids if that is what you want.  There are some amazing views from the terrace outside the hotel and from the rooms if you have an ocean view.  There is also a beach where you can walk next to the Pacific at Crystal Cove Park which is down the hill from the entrance to the property (maybe 1/2 mile).  If you want a beautiful pool or an

Summary Heading: unforgettable new year's weekend at the resort at Pelican Hill
Summary: I just returned from a lovely weekend at the Resort at Pelican Hill, celebrating the New Year with family. From the moment we arrived at this gorgeous resort we were blown away by the views from the terrace...it truly looks like you are in the midst of Tuscany. Check-in with the lovely and knowledgeable Jackie at the front desk was delightful...we got upgraded to a 2 bedroom villa which did not disappoint. Beautifully appointed and very large we were extremely happy and comfortable. Our little service dog, Daisy, had her own backyard to roam in and we each had a beautiful and large bedroom with en- suite bathrooms... complete with separate shower and tub. There was a large terrace off the living room ( it was unfortunately too cold to hang out on it). The fireplace in the living

I have been to some very luxurious resorts, but I am not sure I have been to one with this level of perfection in the overall quality of the common areas, grounds, pool, and rooms. Every blade of grass, every sidewalk seems like it has received individual attention. A few highlights...the clubhouse commands a spectacular ocean view and looks like it has been there many years, despite its relatively recent construction. Food is consistently excellent and, though expensive, not outrageous. The rooms are huge and have beautiful high ceilings. Our room did have a bit of an ocean view from the terrace, though it was not a spectacular ocean view. Service was excellent, though I was not a particularly demanding guest. I did call for ice each evening and it was delivered almost

My husband and I stayed just a few nights at this resort as a splurge.  Wow what an elegant place.  The grounds are beautiful. We enjoyed views from the restaurants and the room. Yes, the ocean is far, but the view is still amazing.  Our room was huge and had a large balcony. We enjoyed the restaurants. The food and the service were excellent. We played the golf course and took in the beautiful ocean views. The golf staff was very accommodating. This resort is expensive, but lived up to our expectations!

The Pelican Hill Resort blew us away and far exceeded our expectations. We were looking for luxury resort and this place definitely fit the bill. The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. The Coliseum pool is beautiful and is  as advertised - we spent a lot of time there. We were in  one bedroom bungalow suite with an ocean view, and it was one of the nicest rooms we've ever stayed in. The room was enormous with very high end finishes. The terrace was also huge and provided us with a private place to enjoy the amazing views.  We never wanted to leave the room.   We stayed there just before Christmas, and got to enjoy the festive atmosphere  while were were there - complete with a GIANT gingerbread house /train track and Santa who did nightly story readings beside it.

My favorite Southern California band, the Beach Boys, sang about “Good Vibrations.” It could be the theme song for Pelican Hill Resort, a magnificent Mediterranean retreat (500+ acres) on the golden California coastline.   The one of a kind resort is an eye-popping blend of tropical plants and trees, California flowers and European gardens; verdant green abounds. They use only the finest Italian stone, marble and design which they blend with California woods, rattan furniture, plush rooms, and a circular pool the size of a small lake. The resort evokes a picture-perfect small village with the added benefits of a pool, a spa, golf and tennis, and majestic views of the glorious Pacific Ocean. The eating includes superb food at Andrea (their signature restaurant), and a poolside

We can't say enough about this property. It is luxury and hits the mark in every way. The service is impressive, the rooms are updated, comfortable and beautiful. The lobby, restaurants and pool are amazing. The golf course is spectacular. I agree with some that the ocean views in the rooms are not impressive - sort of off in the distance. Absolutely love this property.

Summary Heading: Breathtaking views, breathtaking pool, oh, and did I mention those VIEWS?! :-)
Summary: Just got back from a one night stay at Pelican Hill. Overall, we had an amazing experience, the resort is beautiful and the views are breathtaking.   When trying to find the hotel, we first ended up at the Villas, guess we should have read the signs better. Finally having found the lobby of the hotel, I was a bit disappointed as I did not experience any outstanding service. Throughout our stay we noticed that many employees seem to look down and ignore guests when encountering them, instead of smiling and greeting them.   I had booked via Hotel Tonight and got a good rate (I think), and the lady at the check-in told me that it is a room with 'garden view' (don't do it, don't get garden view). I asked her if it was worth trying to upgrade to an ocean view room, but she was not

I stayed 6 nights in the Pelican hills resort. Despite the mess of first night of the miscommunication of house keeping and the room dining, along with the room location of totally blocked sea view. The next day the room was changed to 400 series which changed all the picture and raised the hotel to 5 instead of 1. The resort is well designed and maintained with fabulous views. The room is huge with huge breathtaking terrace.The fire place inside the room ( gas operated) is a real addition to the luxury. The bathroom is absolutely wonderful and you can't think of anything better. The staff stands to the 5 star luxury standard of the hotel.Very helpful and friendly. The Gym is wonderful with almost everything you need . The breakfast at the colosseum was great . Food , service,

Summary Heading: Nice resort and good location, but don't pay extra for an ocean view.
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for a wedding in June.  We stayed in a one bedroom bungalow with ocean view and everything was great concerning it.  Beautiful room and view.  Even if it wasn't what I was expecting.  We arrived at night so waking up the next day, I was expecting to see the ocean.   The description online is a little deceiving.  It stated that we were staying in an ocean view bungalow.  However the ocean is quite far away from this resort.  You can kind of see it if you look past the buildings and the highway.  I guess when I see ocean view, I am thinking it would be close enough to walk to from where I am staying. As for the other amenities and dining at the resort, They were all adequate.  We ate breakfast several times at the resort and enjoyed it.  The food was

Had to cancel a reservation due to a passing of a family member ( father) Cancelled 6 days and not 7 as stated  Hotel wouldn't refund  Cancellation policy is terrible They sympathize but that didn't refund the nightly fee.   Funny thing we ended up going to a nicer hotel last week better location more updated and for the same amount.  Has dinner at pelican , overly rated as it's an older hotel not living up to its glory days.
Manager Response: Meirav,  I'm sorry to hear about the loss of your father and sincerely regret the disappointment you experienced. Please know that our reservation policy allows you to cancel or change your booking up to five days prior to arrival. To better understand and resolve your concerns, I kindly invite you to contact the Reservations Manager directly and have shared the contact info in a private message. Your candid feedback is sincerely appreciated, and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Loved the brunch with the great holiday decortations
Summary: The pelican Hill offers a great setting for brunch with the view on the oversize pool, the golf course and the pacific ocean.  Our last brunch was served outside on one of those great California winter days with  70 F temps.  Attentive service and creative menu.  I did not rate our experience with a 5* for the grumpy store employee who was bothered by the request for small gift bags for the items purchased, no offer of tissue paper or nothing. Ditto for the snack shop that does not serve iced tea ( unless purchasing it in a bottle). In southern California, really?  The Parking policy near the restaurant is also fuzzy (unless you show up in a Mc Laren or a Rolls Royce) Who cares if you are bringing some gifts or luggage, schlepping through the resort you go if you show up with

Summary Heading: The Perfect California Destination Luxury Travelers and Business Meetings
Summary: I travel 200+ days a year and I have visited California many times, but frankly the traffic and congestion can be overwhelming. This hotel is a very special destination since they accomplished what would seemingly be impossible; tranquility, luxury, relaxation, and culinary mastery in California. The hotel's investment in their physical infrastructure is without peer. The staff is overwhelmingly accommodating and the rooms are well appointed. I appreciated the fireplace in my room along with a Nespresso coffee maker. The property is big and perfect for any business conference and has a beautiful golf course. The team has shuttle vans, golf carts available 24x7 to help guests move around the many property amenities.  I will be back.  I also enjoyed that local shopping malls and

Outstanding large accommodation in single storey casitas Three gourmet restaurants Ocean views and enormous swimming pool. Two challenging golf courses. Free shuttle to the beach, golf club and nearby shopping centres. Great place to chill out.

The management team and response to 4 calls over 80 minutes was completely underwhelming. Unprofessional.  To be more blunt, terrible. Nobody called back, a service tech did not show up.  The heater issues and my communication were ignored.  I've stayed here a number of times, usually decent service, but the last 2 times was not good, this was the worst.  Go somewhere else.  Surf Sand, Montage, Island, there are a number of hotels in the area. After 25 minutes on hold for a front desk manager, Mike or Michael indicated he was tied up,  Apparently there's nobody else in this resort that can think or take action as necessary.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback on our review page, and I apologize for the unacceptable service delays you experienced during your most recent visit to Pelican Hill. Please know that I have personally addressed your concerns with our management and guest services staff, so we may improve the overall guest experience. To better understand the shortcomings of your visit, I kindly invite you to contact the Rooms Manager directly to discuss your experience in more detail. I have shared his contact information with you in a private message. Your insight is sincerely appreciated, and we look forward to connecting with you soon.  Kind regards, Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort, but valet did not charge our Tesla as requested overnight.
Summary: We were there for a holiday party.  My husband drove our car to the valet people before the party, after we checked in, and asked them to charge it.  The next morning after breakfast when they brought the car to us, they said that they didn't charge it. We were hoping to drive straight home, but we had to stop at San Clemente to access the chargers there.  At that location, there was a line, 3 cars deep, waiting to use the chargers.  This inconvenienced us and added about an hour or so to our drive back down the coast.  The valet manager needs to have better communication and control of the Tesla charging at Pelican Hill.  At a nice resort such as this, we shouldn't have had to have this problem.
Manager Response: Lisa,  Thank you for sharing your feedback on our TripAdvisor page. While I am glad to read that you enjoyed your holiday celebrations at the Resort, I apologize that your valet experience fell short of our Five-Star standards. Please know that I have taken this opportunity to personally address your concerns with our valet staff and management, so we may improve the experience of all guests. We sincerely appreciate your insight and hope to welcome you back to Pelican Hill very soon.  Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Perfect place to escape in Southern California
Summary: The grounds are impeccable, the service is impeccable, the spa is fantastic and it seems that they just get every detail right. The rooms are large, comfortable, private and every finish is just so. Every member of the staff is professional, courteous, friendly and they answer every request with "of course" (and then make it so).  We've been fortunate to stay at some of the very best hotels up in the world and Pelican Hill seems to combine some of our favorite things from all of them in one place. We went for an anniversary escape and were delighted in every way.

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort great amenities , so so in service
Summary: We go to The resort at pelican hill often, at least  2-3 times a year. The grounds are amazing , the rooms both the bungalows and villas are a great value comparing to other comparable resorts in the area.  The food at the coliseum is good but we are not crazy about Andreas the high end restaurant although the setting the pretty.  The kids camp is the main reason we love PH resort. They have great counselors, and fun activities and monitor the kids very well. Our kids beg to go there which gives us time to shop or relax by the amazing pools or spa. Where I give PH resort 4 stars is the lack of service! They just can't the service to the level of a four seasons where you feel pampered and important no matter what !!  They general attitude is always that they are fully booked and

We had a large company Christmas party at the resort ballroom and all of us overnighted at the resort. Hotel was overbooked so some people (parties of 2) stayed in 2-4 bedroom villas above the resort.  We had a regular room.  I have stayed here many times and each time I find it less enchanting.  Even at Christmas, it was sterile.  There is so much they could do to make up for the lack of ambiance.  Usually the food and service is pretty good but It took forever to order and receive a glass of wine at the Andrea Bar and while the dinner's first course salad was excellent, the main course was inedible. The pork was so dry, no one at my table could eat their meal.  The room service breakfast was good and timely but the gal taking the order over the phone literally refused to give
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback about your recent visit, and I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect. Please know that I have personally addressed your detailed concerns with the Andrea culinary team and in-room dining staff, so we may improve the overall guest experience. To better understand your experience, I kindly invite you to contact the Director of Food & Beverage and have shared his contact info in a private message. Your insight is sincerely appreciated, and we hope to welcome you back for a much-improved visit soon.  Kind regards, Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Best place for romantic getaway probably in CA Room with fireplace, panoramic view from a secluded and private terrace.  Park your car in front of your room. No need to go to the lobby if you don't want to be seen. Just perfect for that special ocasión. Restaurants and Spa are fantastic. Most beautiful pool with breathtaking views. Breakfast is just fantastic at the terrace overlooking the pool. Found a great deal using Hotel Tonight. Otherwise be prepared to spend > $500 a night. It's worth every cent. The perfect place to make memories! Hope to come back many times. Only drawback was that Newport is a sleepy town. Nothing to do if you like to party late. So bring that blue pill just in case you need to perform extra innings.

If you are looking for a five star experience, The Resort at Pelican Hill is where you want to go. Everything is five plus stars from the accommodations to the on-site restaurants. And the staff is just what you'd expect from a first-class resort.

This was a single night stay for our 48th Wedding Anniversary. We were greeted in the driveway and from there until we left the property, everyone called us by name and treated us as family. Extraordinarily beautiful property. Grounds are immaculate and the lodgings are 5 Star. We had a bungalow (434) that overlooked the golf course and the Pacific Ocean. We could easily see Catalina Island. Even though this was a weekend of rain, the enclosed patio (with one wall of glass) gave complete privacy and shielded the room from the weather. The bed makes you want to stay in and just relax. The bath is very spacious and comes with a variety of high end products. Our Concierge unexpectedly brought us a bottle of champagne to enhance our evening. There was even a printed card with our

Summary Heading: Nice but.... it's the little things....
Summary: We were looking for some R&R for Mom after a hectic Turkey Day with family. We are local so many top shelf choices available (Ritz, Montage, St. Regis, etc.) but had never tried Pelican so gave it a shot. We stayed in the Bungalows which were overall very nice. The fact that there are options for larger families (Villas) is very rare and appreciated even though we did not bring the entire family this trip.  Let me start by saying this is a wonderful hotel. Most of what you would expect from a 5-Star location. Great location, nice visual appeal, very courteous staff, etc. The room was comfortable and spacious. The veranda was great and private. To create the feeling of being more spread out and private the property requires either a cart ride or a bit of walking but nothing

Spent three days in a villa for Thanksgiving.  Wonderful layout, high end finishes, and breath taking views.    Loved the terrace with ocean views and the coliseum pool. The team did a great job with shuttle service too.

Rented a villa again. We usually have a poolside day with cabana and then a beach day. The food poolside is excellent. They have the food for the kids - the regular hot dogs etc, but have sushi and other food for adults. There is Pelican Hill bus that goes down to Crystal Cove and they will get you chairs and umbrellas. The kids love it.

My wife and I just returned from a weekend at Pelican Hill. We have stayed at Four Seasons Hotels throughout the United States and Pelican Hill is on par from a service standpoint and exceeds from a physical standpoint. Saying that they're on par with Four Seasons from a service standpoint is the highest compliment I can pay. The staff are well trained yet hired to be naturally helpful and hospitable. It was the physical beauty of the resort and the absolute perfection and comfort of the guest rooms that really push them past Four Seasons. Spacious, comfortable, thoughtful touches, clean and well maintained. Everything is thought of. Large, with lovely, perfect, clean patio. If you want an extraordinary Coastal Southern California experience, this is the place to book. It isn't

Summary Heading: Amazing Wedding Site but Resort Disappointing
Summary: This is a dazzling location for a wedding. It is incredibly expensive and they don't miss an opportunity to charge you for something, but the backdrop of the rotunda, rolling green lawn and Pacific Ocean is just breathtaking. The purpose built wedding facility separate from the main resort building with its own bridal suite is perfect to leave your wedding party off in heaven. The food is very good and they are equipped for most any type of event. We absolutely loved it. Check out #mostinterestingmaninworld for pics.   However, the Resort side of things were disappointing. The staff appeared overwhelmed when operating at full capacity which they do often. You can't always call the front desk, the carts to pick you up at your bungalow can take a while. Check in is late at 4-5pm
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback on our review page and for choosing Pelican Hill for your special day. While I am glad to read that you loved your wedding celebrations at the Resort, I apologize that you did not experience the same level of excellence during your overnight stay. I have taken this opportunity to address your specific feedback with our housekeeping, front desk and transportation staff. I have also sent you a private message with the direct contact information for the Rooms Manager, so we may learn more about your concerns and improve the overall guest experience. We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us and hope to welcome you back for a much-improved visit soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary last weekend, and while the resort and property is amazing, the service was lacking.  When you are spending about 4 figures in all for a night stay, you expect a certain level of service.  We had requested an early checkin prior to arrival and were told it will not be an issue.  When we arrive we were told that the room is ready, but housekeeping needs to make its final touches.  Confused as to what this was, we said ok and went for lunch.  Two hours later we were told the same.  The front desk is very well trained at providing obscure responses to brush guests off their backs, I observed this numerous times while waiting near the front desk.  When we arrive to the room, it was apparent what the final touches were.  The hotel was
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Pelican Hill for your anniversary celebrations and for taking the time to share your feedback with us. While I am glad to read that you enjoyed the Resort property, I am disappointed that some elements of your visit fell short of your expectations and our Five-Star service goals.   Please know that I have personally addressed your concerns regarding check-in and complimentary amenities with our management team, so we may improve the overall guest experience. We would also like to take this opportunity to discuss your concerns in more detail, and I have sent you a private message with direct contact information for the Rooms Manager. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and look forward to welcoming you back for an improved experience soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We stayed in an oceanfront 3 bedroom villa.  We're high end travelers but this was absolutely beyond our wildest expectations.  It was absolute perfection.  So comfortable and easy to settle in for a week stay.  Matter of fact we extended the trip by 3 days because we were having such a spectacular time.  The service is impeccable.  We wanted for nothing.  They have 2 separate pools, both are wonderful.  This is a sprawling property which actually is quite nice.  You feel like you're the only one there.  With a quick phone call, they promptly arrive to transport you anywhere you'd like to go in a Mercedes SUV no less.  We cannot wait for a reason to return.

I stayed in one of the one bedroomed bungalow suites and the entire stay was a pleasure.  The location is amazing, the views stunning and in my experience the staff and service superb.  In the few days I was there I ate at Andrea, Pelican Grill and the Colliseum.  In Andrea you must try the risotto which is mixed at your table in a giant parmesan, the flavour is amazing.  All the other food I ate at the hotel was delicious and the little market shop sells the best homemade gelato and sorbet.  The hotel is luxurious but also comfortable and suitable for couples and families alike  For golfers the courses are incredible and my fellow non golfers the views of the golf club almost make you want to start playing.  I was very sad to leave.

We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa located in their exclusive resort part of the property.  We were a total of 6 adults and 3 children.  This was for a 5 day/night stay a few months back in August.  And although a few months back, I still feel compelled to submit a review.  It was simple one of the best family vacations I've had.  The service was exceptional from the moment we arrived.  Everyone is so friendly and accommodating.  We worked with a concierge there --- Tammy, I believe.  I cannot speak to how absolutely wonderful she was.  Even prior to our arrival, she worked with us to make sure all our needs were considered from booking car service, spa, golf, kids club, cabana and restaurant bookings.  She also helped with getting the villa filled with the groceries we needed and

the "regular" rooms are great. everything you need and more, with amazing views. the Villa's are larger than most homes, with full gourmet kitchens, multiple bedrooms and bathrooms. the resort is so large, that many rooms require car service to get back to the lobby, pool, beach... many of the cars they send to pick you up are Mercedes SUV's. only issue I had was someone stole something from e at the bar and secutity could not figure out who it was from their camera's. one of the nicest resorts I have ever been.

We chose to stay at the Pelican Resort for a long weekend getaway/staycation as we have heard so much about it from many friends in LA who had done the same. The drive from Santa Monica to the resort took just an hour.  I've seen photos of the resort online and was awed by the stunning Pacific ocean views and the ginormous circular pool and more importantly - by the spa menu. I am a complete spa junkie and wrote a separate spa review of this resort's Forbes Five star award spa on Trip Advisor as well - but if you're lazy to read that the it was a perfect spa experience . If this place was any nearer to LA I would have have splurged on a membership.   Driving into the resort , I can’t help but notice that the grounds and gardens (they have a lot beautiful olive trees here) are

We have stayed several times, and found the property elegantly relaxing.  (We went in slow seasons.)  Attentive, professional staff, nice grounds, calming environment, wonderful accommodations.  We found this more of a spa environment, rather than a noisy family play spot.  But our server said it gets very busy with visitor/families from other countries during some times of the year.  We will be back...

We really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were beautiful with a great view. We were able to enjoy multiple restuarants and the spa during our visit. All were great experiences. The caddy for the course hinder our enjoyment of the game and then once he was tipped (the suggested amount) he became upset with us. Very unprofessional.

I loved the bar area, pool area, has a great view of the beach. Dinner was great. I would recommend for couples or family little get away. I don't live far from here but wanted the feeling of being away. This resort did that for me.

Summary Heading: Ultra beautifu, romantic fireplace rooms with views of the ocean
Summary: It is not a high rise hotel, but bungalows with fireplaces, large patios overlooking the ocean..Stunning! Service is superior and all the help know you by name..Food is wonderful and so fresh..We hated to leave the room!

It just works. The staff are friendly the rooms are great. The pool is huge and beautiful, the food is great and although luxurious it is nice and unpretentious. I prefer it to where I usually stay which is the Montage. Great for couples kids and business. Awesome golf course as well.

We have just returned from a six night stay at pelican hill resort.  We had been looking forward to the last leg of our vacation in California and I was celebrating my birthday.  The drive into the resort is very impressive and surroundings in the main building very beautiful and clean.  A mouth-watering sea view awaits you as you head out into its main balcony and the pool are is spectacular as you gaze out over the ocean. Our room was a bungalow. Room 327 in via Capri.  I have to agree with the review before mine in that the furniture was quite grubby and poor on the patio with ripped sun loungers.  It was very disappointing considering how much this place charges a night.  Also I would say that the food is very salty and considering Californians ar to be fairly health
Manager Response: Amanda,   We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us, and I apologize that your recent stay was anything less than perfect. The comfort and satisfaction of all guests is a top priority, and I am disappointed that some parts of your visit fell short of your expectations and our Five-star service goals. I have personally addressed your specific feedback with the Coliseum Pool & Grill, housekeeping, spa, golf and rooms staff, so we may improve the overall guest experience. We would also like to take this opportunity to discuss your feedback further, and I have shared the direct contact information for our Rooms Manager in a private message. Thank you again for your feedback, and we hope to welcome you back for an improved visit.   Kind regards, Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Stayed here on business. The villa was gorgeous and the views are breathtaking!!! This resort overlooking the ocean is a piece of heaven.  The lobby was beautiful. The restaurants had delicious food. Great service.

Summary Heading: The resort can't replace this dirty, worn furniture??
Summary: This was gross, disgusting and could not even sit on any of the furniture.  It is worn, dirty, smells.  The customer service is awful, a zero in my book.  They don't care who you are and is the worst place I have ever stayed. The room smelled like old baby diapers. I asked housekeeping and they said they would bring a ionizer.  They never did.  Never showed up.  100% Worse Place Ever.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback on our TripAdvisor page. I am disappointed to read that your recent visit was anything less than perfect, and I apologize for the unacceptable service you received.  Please know I have directly addressed your concerns regarding bungalow conditions with our housekeeping and rooms staff, so we may improve the overall guest experience. We would also like to take this opportunity to discuss your concerns in more detail. I have shared the contact information for the Rooms Manager in a private message, and I kindly invite you to contact him directly. We sincerely appreciate your insight and hope to welcome you back for a much-improved experience soon.  Kind regards, Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This hotel was the ultimate relaxing spot. My husband surprised me on my birthday we went on a monday mid October the hotel was empty which was nice. We booked a bungalo room which had beautiful views of the ocean and the golf course. The room was very spacious high ceiling huge bathroom beautiful balcony with tanning beds and a sitdown area.. The room had a fireplace... bar area with snacks coffee machine complementary water. The bed was very comfortable and clean the room also had sofa with chairs and office desk right across .. we paid for two nights got the third night free. It was a two minute walk to the spa and to the pool and to the restaurants.. they do offer transportation but the walk was just so beautiful & peaceful.. I also like the staff they were super friendly

Our son and daughter in law were married on Laguna Beach.  Our impressive three bedroom villa served as the gathering place for wedding guests from Japan as well as many states across the country.  We were provided with excellent service for five days.  Our veranda overlooked the golf course and ocean, a beautiful setting for entertaining and relaxing.  We all enjoyed the pools, beach, restaurants and local shopping venues.

Summary Heading: Beautiful property, ugly guest behavior ruined our visit
Summary: Pelican Hill Resort is an aesthetically pleasing property that attempts to portray premium luxury.  Unfortunately, during a recent 2 night visit, it became painfully obvious that management's efforts to maintain a sophisticated and elite guest experience can be diminished by the admittance of boorish, immature guests. The multiple guests located in the Bungalow Suite (large) adjacent to the room (Garden King) my wife and I were provided, were boisterous, obnoxious and intoxicated, awakening us from sleep at 2:30 AM. I made 3 separate calls to the Front Desk to alert Security of their loud conversation and noise on the patio at this absurd hour. These guests were cursing and carrying on louder than one might expect at noon, much less predawn hours. We were blasted from our sleep
Manager Response: Mr. Murphy,   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us, and I sincerely apologize for the disruptions during your recent stay. The comfort and safety of all guests is a top priority, and I was pleased to learn that our staff accommodated a complimentary night for the disturbances you experienced. I have personally addressed your concerns with our security, front office and rooms staff, so we may improve the overall guest experience. We would also like to take this opportunity to discuss your feedback in more detail. I understand our Rooms Manager has attempted to contact you, and I have shared a private message with his direct contact info. Thank you again for your feedback, and we hope to welcome you back for an improved visit soon.   Kind regards, Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Every year I choose to celebrate my birthday here and am NEVER disappointed...top notch and a great value in every way! From our checkin with the affable Ryan, who made our room assignment truly celebratory, to our checkout, with again, Ryan "front desk extraordinaire", our time at the resort was fabulous! We have stayed at all of the local luxury hotels in the area, Montage, Ritz-Carlton & St. Regis-Monarch Beach Resort...Pelican Hill exceeds them all in both value & what it has to offer. I also find the staff there to be naturally friendly, not the forced "I'm waiting on you friendly" that you often get at many other resorts. We love the gorgeous Italianate ocean view, the pool atmosphere & service, the varied and wonderful dining opportunities (Marissa, thank you for our

Just checked in tonight for four days. What a disappointment. Room is beautiful but ocean view is chimneys of other units. Why would we stay in Newport Beach to see chimneys?  Won't be coming back. Dinner was good and pool looks beautiful but not the beach view I hoped to see.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback on our review page. I am disappointed to read that your accommodations fell short of your expectations. We would like to take this opportunity to discuss your concerns in more detail, and I have sent you a private message with the contact information for the Rooms Manager. We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback and we hope you enjoy an improved rest of your stay.  Kind regards, Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: My wife and I came up for the night for a quick getaway as we live in nearby Rancho Santa Fe.  I have stayed here at least 15 times since it opened and you can't beat the beauty of this resort.  What you can beat is the quality of their service which has decayed over the last few years.  My biggest gripe is with the room service lag in delivery.  Without getting into too much detail we waited for coffee and gave up after an hour and I drove up to the main lobby to pick it up in the fine coffee bar there.  Our bungalow is a ways away but with carts and more staff I think it should have been done quicker.  The coffee never did show.  Also the check-in and check out process is very tedious as far as when the rooms are ready.....  I once waited until 6:00 pm for my room and was to
Manager Response: Tom, Thank you for sharing your feedback on our review page. I apologize for the unacceptable service delays you experienced during your most recent stay, especially as a loyal guest of Pelican Hill. Please know I have taken this opportunity to address your concerns with our in-room dining and front desk teams, so we may improve the areas you mentioned. I would also like to invite you to connect with our Rooms Manager directly to further discuss your concerns. I have shared his contact information with you in a private message, so we may better understand the shortcomings of your experience. Your valuable insight is sincerely appreciated, and we look forward to another opportunity to serve you again soon.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: VERY disappointing "ocean view"... misleading and let down
Summary: Unfortunately, just as many others have mentioned in Tripadvisor, the ocean view is EXTREMELY limited in the bungalows 100's row (blocked by rooftops and trees), yet this hotel continues to advertise ocean views. I stayed in #127 and only a small sliver can be seen of the ocean. Unsatisfactory.  When mentioning my dissatisfaction to the lobby staff, he did not seem to care nor want to address it or make things right. Lack of care/concern is not 5 star service.   Being a local from southern California, I would like to be back, but the misleading ocean view description is definitely preventing my return at time. If management addressed my concern, I may return.
Manager Response: Edward,  Thank you for sharing your candid feedback on our review page. I apologize that your recent visit was anything less than perfect, and I am disappointed to read that your service experience fell short of our Five-Star service goals. I have shared your feedback with our management team, so we may improve the overall guest experience. We would also like to take this opportunity to discuss your concerns in more detail, and I have sent you a private message with the contact information for the Rooms Manager. We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback and hope to welcome you back for an improved experience soon.  Kind regards, Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: They get the premium for the location and facilities but the service was very bad. We had a dead rat left in front of the room (after it was reported)and we paid extra for a an ocean view room (The view was less than a regular room). The management does not match the rest of the resort.
Manager Response: Chris,   I apologize that your recent visit to the Resort fell short of your expectations and our Five-Star service goals. I have taken this opportunity to personally discuss your concerns with our management and maintenance staff. We would like to learn more about the shortcomings of your recent visit, and I have sent you a private message with the contact information for the Rooms Manager. Thank you for taking the time to share your concerns with us, and we hope to welcome you back for a much-improved visit soon.  Kind regards, Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Words cannot truly describe the beauty of this place. It is amazing. It is breath taking. It is tranquility. It is a "better late than never" experience. The service is outstanding. The villas are incredible. I cannot believe I am here. If you have the opportunity to come here---say YES!! You won't regret it.

Amazing property, great rooms, perfect location, great food. They don't get 5 stars because the customer service is average and at the prices you pay here, average is unacceptable. Expect to stand around and be ignored by doormen, wait staff, etc. - not all of them mind you, but enough to see a pattern.  Also, ordered food at the pool, only to wait an hour for nothing to come.  Told the wait staff to deliver it to the room only to have it arrive 3 hours later (after I had left for the evening).  Other problems with maid service as well.  Nothing in and of itself a deal breaker, but added up to a less than stellar stay. I'll be back but only for the room and view.  Walk to Crystal Cove or go into town for good service.  Even with average service this place is great.  The location
Manager Response: John,   While I am glad to read you enjoyed the Resort property and accommodations, I am disappointed in the unacceptable service delays you experienced during your stay. Please know that I have addressed your feedback directly with our Coliseum Pool & Grill, in-room dining, housekeeping and guest services staff, so we may improve the areas you mentioned. We would also like to take this opportunity to discuss your concerns in more detail. I have shared the contact information for the Rooms Manager in a private message, and I kindly invite you to contact him directly. We appreciate you taking the time to share your candid feedback and hope to welcome you back for an improved service experience soon.  Kind regards, Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Just as good the second time
Summary: We stayed here for a second time, and everything was just as good as last year. The room, their "basic" Bungalow, was extremely comfortable. This is the only hotel I've ever stayed in that provided not just a Nespresso and complimentary coffee, but also a toaster, a milk frother, and a kettle! We especially enjoyed the gas fireplace. Housekeepers did a great job, and were always finished by the time we got back to the room in late afternoon.  Service really shines at Pelican Hill. Every employee we met was friendly and helpful. If any of them saw us waiting more than a minute for a ride (which was rare), they were quick to make sure we were taken care of.  Again this year, we visited during the Italian harvest festa. We didn't attend many of the events, but once again we really

This was my first time at the resort and i can confidently say that this is one of the nicest hotel i have stayed at in California. We stayed in a bungalow which had an ocean view. The room was very large with a fireplace and Bose surround sound speakers. The bathroom was very large and everything was kept very clean. I highly recommend this resort to everyone and will definitely be coming back.

I can't say this place isn't going to cost you. The views. Rooms and staff were all amazing. The only things we had go wrong was we asked if we could do laundry. We had to send it in. Cost us $180 to launder baby clothes, shorts and t-shirts. Everything is terribly expensive. Yjey forgot a fruit bowl when we rented a cabana. We didn't realize we were supposed to get one until our last night. They gave us a partial credit on the cabana. Paying $20 a day for parking was just over the top. There were always available spots. The only other thing is we came with a 2 year old. So she must nap. We didn't get to nap her yesterday because they hadn't cleaned our room but 3pm. We needed it cleaned. Mostly trash removal and towel replacement. The views are awesome. I will come here again

This resort is very special. The location and views are tremendous. The rooms are very tastefully done and the restaurant Andrea's is superb! One of the most beautiful pools I have ever seen! Great for a family or a couple. Enjoy

My husband and I were recently there for a meeting and enjoyed it very much.  However, we were "upgraded" to a two bedroom villa.  It was not what we were looking for.  It was a beautiful condo, but not within walking distance of the main building where the meeting was held.    The resort "sells" it as having a butler.  All the butler did was take us to our room in a Mercedes.  After that, we were transported by a van vehicle back and forth.  It was fine, but I'm not fooled by a butler.  If you are just 1 or 2 people, I would recommend the bungalow suites.  They are beautiful, and within a short walk of the main building.    The food was very good.  The staff was also very good.  I would recommend this hotel.

Absolutely gorgeous place. We had our daughter's wedding here. The venue was fabulous. The guests commented it was the best wedding they had ever attended. The villas are amazing. The best I've ever seen.

probably I had better experience in motel 6.Poor customer service, for basic cleaning of the room have to call them 10 times,finally had to get hold of manager until the job gets   done.In our bungalow the bed skirts  were dirty with visible brown spots that I was not sure what was it,sloppy cleaning for the price that you pay for your staying.In pool area at 11am out of towels,the staff only think about selling the food an drink not solving the problem about towels.With that price that we paid we could get better customer service in motel.Dinner time waitress was nice and smiling she was very friendly opposite the servers in pool area during day time.
Manager Response: Marcielue,   Thank you for sharing your detailed comments on our review page. I apologize that your recent stay fell short of your expectations, and I understand your frustration in the service delays you experienced. Please know I have taken this opportunity to address your concerns directly with managers in our rooms, pool, restaurant and housekeeping departments, so we may improve upon the areas you mentioned. We appreciate you taking the time to share your candid feedback and hope to welcome you back for a much-improved visit in the future.  Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I just returned from a 5 day four night stay for a seminar/business trip, with spouses and significant others, and found the entire visit to be just delightful.  In addition to perfect weather, the views from the pool and veranda are simply spectacular.  I do not golf, but those in our group that do greatly enjoyed the course.  We stayed in a bungalow that was simply stunning.  I note that it was a good value, but that is at convention rates, so I am uncertain how I would feel at rack rates...but for a stay at one of the best places I have been to, a splurge every now and then would be acceptable to most people.

We were pleasantly surprised with an upgrade to stay in the Villas.  We usually stay in the bungalows which are lovely, however, the Villa we stayed in, 516 was exquisite.  Always peaceful, the food is excellent and customer service is great.  The pool at the Villas was relaxing and the food from the lunch menu very tasty.  Our favorite place to stay-perfect for relaxation.

Wow and wow Hotel The view from my room is beautiful  Look  too ocean  The pool this Hotel is fantastic. This Hotel have nice restaurant,I eat With my lady ,name Andrea,very good too The staff Hotel very nice  Valet good too  The room is perfect!!!!!!!

Best 5 star I have stayed in in the U.S. ever. The Resort at Pellican Hill bosts a Fazio designed golf course, over 500 acres in Newport Beach with views of the ocean, world renound chef's, the pool and grounds are amazing, the Vills have fire places, marble showers & tubs. Breakfast, lunch and dinner were wonderful.Georgous padio with a view of the ocean, Why did we have to leave?

Stunning grounds.  Irvine Company's masterpiece.  Stay here and you won't want to stay anywhere else.  Best views and landscaping.  Amazing spa and restaurants.  Must try Pelican Grill and Andrea.  Both are outstanding.  The rooms are larger and nicely laid out.

The Resort at Pelican Hill truly is a world-class resort with fabulous accommodations, manicured grounds, golf course and restaurants. The views of the Pacific Ocean are spectacular, and the beach is 10 minutes down the hill.   The resort is owned and operated by the Irvine Company.

We stayed at the beginning of September for 3 nights, fantastic deal as 3rd night free. Very luxurious facility, even the smallest rooms are really spacious, fire in the room, huge bathroom with super size bath and a balcony. Only downside were the extras like resort tax and 20 dollar a night parking! Pool is enormous also with great service from the team of waitresses.  Highly recommended for a short break.  We had dinner in Andreas, food was fantastic and service very attentive. Also the poolside restaurant was great for dinner with the views over to the coast and the luxury of overhead heaters when it got a bit cooler at night

Summary Heading: Ocean Views are not ocean views (and other things)
Summary: Maybe it's just that this hotel is not my style, but I found a lot of faults here for the amount we spent per night.   1.  Rooms in the 200's are "ocean view", but you can barely see over the roofs on the 100 levels.  Go for a lower or a higher number.   2.  Pool area is fine, but you share it with ALL the kids in the resort.  I have three, so I get it, but they weren't with me and hearing Marco Polo while I'm trying to relax is not the best. 3.  Bars close at 10:30.  What? People were all milling about trying to figure out where to go.  Hotel is up on a hill fairly secluded, so you'd have to drive or cab somewhere. 4. spa.  I had two treatments.  Very nice, but not outstanding.  Facilities are fine but not memorable.   5. I was hoping to do a little canyon hiking or get outside
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback on our review pages. I apologize that your recent stay was less than perfect, and I understand your disappointment in the unacceptable housekeeping service you experienced. I have taken this opportunity to personally address the concerns you mentioned with our management team. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us and hope to welcome you back for an improved experience in the future.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Lotta glitz but somewhat disappointing on substance
Summary: There's been a ton of advertising about this place with lavish pamphlets extolling its virtues and it got us interested in exploring this place as a stopover from Asia, the resort being an hour's drive from LAX. We had high expectations. We weren't thrilled to find out upon arrival that official check-in for the villas is 5pm; they actually had it ready by about 3pm but told us they had no idea when it would be ready and to prepare ourselves for a few hours of camping out at the pool, which was no thrill given we had just flown in from Tokyo. We had one of the north villas with a distant coastal view (it's billed as an ocean view but the ocean is far away); it was a stunning villa with tons of space and a beautiful terrace with doors you could keep wide open all the time without
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback on our review page. I am glad to read that you enjoyed your Villa accommodations, and I apologize that other aspects of your Labor Day visit fell short of your expectations and our goals. I understand your disappointment in the service delays you experienced during your stay, especially as you were here to enjoy a holiday weekend with your family. Please know that I have addressed your concerns directly with our transportation, spa and culinary management staff, so that we may improve our overall guest experience. Thank you again for sharing your valuable feedback with us, and we hope to welcome you back for a much-improved experience soon.  Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This is a luxury resort with sprawling ocean views overlooking a top rate golf course with Catalina Island in the background.  We stayed in the 3 bedroom villas which were professionally decorated and had a full kitchen with a Wolf Range and Oven.  Each Bedroom had its own Bath and the beds had 5 down pillows to choose from.  Michael McDonald played a concert next to the green last night.  What's not to love??

Finally managed a visit after hearing so much about it. I was impressed with the setting and the size and comfort of my bungalow. Someone should have rethought the olive trees lining the street. All of the olives smushed and smeared on the walkways were not very attractive. You definitely wouldn't want to walk barefoot. The service level for me had highs and lows. The food and service at the Coliseum were great. The front desk was inflexible when it came to things that were outside of their standard policies. The Caffe never seemed to have cash on hand when I went to buy something. I have been to other resorts along this coast that have impressed me more.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments on our review page. I am pleased to read that you enjoyed your Bungalow accommodations and dining experience at Coliseum Pool & Grill. I apologize that some parts of your visit fell short of your expectations. Please know that I have personally addressed your concerns with our management team to improve upon the areas you mentioned. Thank you again for posting your feedback, and we hope to welcome you back for an improved experience in the future.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We had a lovely stay here. Service was fantastic, we always have in room dinning. They always set up the table quickly and nicely. High celling is plus, lovely fireplace, bathroom have shower and lovely bathtub. Everything is nice and clean, TV is kind of old but they have pretty good sound system. We bring our own cable to hook up the TV but the picture was awful. There is no USB charger for iPhone, so we need to bring our own charger too. I like the wet bar, if you bring milk you can make your own milk form. Like our little balcony with garden view. They have nice slipper and the most bathrobe in the room which is a plus plus~

The Resort at Pelican Hill lives up to it's stellar reputation.  The rooms, service, facilities and setting are all quite spectacular.  Although not on the water, the hillside location provides great vistas of the Newport Coast.  We were in the North Villas, which were spacious and elegantly appointed.  The Butler service is a nice touch and not intrusive.  The only drawback is distance of the Villas from the main resort facilities on the property.  Complementary shuttle service in Mercedes SUV's helps. The Villa Clubhouse is just across the road, but not quite the same as the remarkable Coliseum facilities. on the whole, we had a wonderful stay.

Summary Heading: Drinks and crab cakes Pool side! Great Views!
Summary: Friends told us to check out this place. Wow! A beautiful view of the ocean.  We planned to have one drink. Our server was so excellent that we had a few drinks. Then a few crab cakes which our server recommended. Great ! Some of the best I have ever had.  I  order crab cakes often. So I am a good judge. ..After wonderful bread, sweet butter, we did not want to leave!  The Designer matched everything perfectly in the resort, décor.  Napkins, candles, pool accessories are pretty Teal! Much thought had gone into each detail. We plan to return for dinner. Great Ocean  view in the distance. More for adults I would say. Fine by us!

Summary Heading: One of the most beautiful resorts in all of California
Summary: Wow! What a great resort. It is as beautiful a setting as there is in southern California. The resort feels huge as the rooms and villas are very spread out, especially as it wraps around parts of two 18-hole golf courses that are part of the resort. The architecture is so tastefully done. The service was top notch as well.  I had played golf here a few times but this was the first time I had stayed overnight. The rooms are great as I stayed in a "bungalow" which is so convenient. You park your car right in front and have direct access to your room from the outside. Inside, the room is very spacious with high ceilings and a private balcony. The actual color scheme and wall decorations were a bit bland but why would you want to take away from the views of the ocean and resort.  I

Summary Heading: Not as good as on previous trips
Summary: PH is still a lovely property, but I thought the service across the board had slipped.  Food came out of the restaurant wrong, room wasn't fully cleaned, a challenge changing rooms ...  Everyone is very pleasant and accommodating - it was just that service didn't match the words. Given the price, should probably be a three star review, actually.

Our dinner at the Villa Club was great.  Our server Matt Rodriguez was so amazing!! Matt has a great personality and was very attentive to our party of 12. It was a great pleasure having a server that was able to bring a smile and laughter to everyone. The best part of the evening was Matt singing to us!!!  Thank you again for a great evening !!

Mat Rodriguez was amazing.  Our dinner was the best meal at the resort with his direction and excellent service.  He is amazing.  I will be returning to enjoy his expertise. The picallo aka Restaurant at the Villas had the best service on the property.  Augie was the best as well as Mat's excellent service.   He is amazing!

Matt was an awesome waiter!! Thank you for the laughter, singing and service! The food was delicious and the ambiance was so much fun! I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends and family.

Summary Heading: Outstanding Resort - Look Forward to Next Visit
Summary: First time visiting Pelican Hill - overall summary - outstanding resort - outstanding service. Location: Very good - nicely located just a short couple mile drive north of Laguna Beach, and just a couple miles from Fashion Island, Balboa Island and Newport Beach.  Resort sits on a massive property (believe 500 acres) - only downside is not being directly on the beach. Grounds & Common Areas: Beautiful architecture - very well manicured & maintained - simple-styled but elegant interiors. Rooms: We stayed in a 1br Ocean View Bungalow - very large - 2 baths - separate master - large living room & dining area - living room & master both have sliding doors that open to patio.  Again fairly simple styling - but as well elegant - and extremely comfortable.  Large bathrooms with high

We absolutely enjoyed dining at The Resort!  Our server Matt Rodriguez was charismatic, personable, and impressive on the menu options. The desserts were delicious!   I was here for my bachelorette getaway, and he absolutely helped make it memorable with his serenade.    Thank you!

We had a great dinner and Matt Rodriguez was great !!!!  Such a great waiter !  So a great guy !   Piccolo was an amazing dinner for my family and I and I have never had such better device in an amazing atmosphere. We appreciate the attention to detail and how much effort Matt put into making my sisters pre-wedding dinner immaculate!!!! Thank you Matt!

Summary Heading: Phenomenal Property; Customer Service on Decline?
Summary: Absolutely love everything about this hotel minus the customer service.  The facility is the most gorgeous hotel we've ever stayed at, and the location is stunning, with Newport Beach views, food and culture wonderfully accessible from here.  The rooms are cozy and luxurious.    We've stayed here before and it is our go-to place in the area.  However, this last visit we noticed that things were starting to slip.  The concierge, valet, and house keeping all required several calls to get our original requests answered (can we get another bathrobe?  only 1 was provided.  can you help us get some flowers delivered?  took 3 phone calls.  etc)  We'll stay there again, but we hope that the hotel mgmt will double down on it's efforts to ensure that the level of customer service is on

We weren't sure whether or not to rent a car for our visit.  Decided to take a chance and rely on cabs and the beach shuttle.  It would have cost us over $500 for a rental car and the resort parking fee for 4 days/3 nights.  The taxi rides to and from John Wayne Airport cost us $40 each including tip.  The beach shuttle to Crystal Cove worked fine (get your towels from the driver --- they are not available at the chair and umbrella spot).  Given the short duration of our stay and no need or interest in doing excursions or shopping beyond Crystal Cove, going carless was the right choice for us.

Incredible experience, gorgeous resort and professional staff. Everyone was on point.   My family and I stayed in a 3 bedroom villa on the south side. We loved being near the clubhouse and the view from our room was beautiful.   Meals at the villa clubhouse were exceptional. Special thanks to: Tawny, Lynnea & Manny for always making us feel special and to Collin, Corey and Matt for always taking care of us with a smile.  During our extended 9 month stay there were of course issues that would arise from time to time but they were always expeditiously and expertly handled by Omar or a villa front desk supervisor. EVERYONE at the villa front desk is exceptional, especially: Bryce, Jordan, Hunter and ALL of the butlers. My kids are fond of Chase.  Our room was cleaned daily by Maria

Summary Heading: Gorgeous property, Helpful/Professional Resort Staff, Stunning Views, Nice Spa
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay. Hope to visit again soon.  GROUNDS: The property was gorgeous and beautifully maintained. Stunning views around the resort. ROOMS: Very roomy and very lovely. Furniture was quite comfortable and high-end; perhaps a little worn in some spots (e.g. around the base of table legs). Plenty of electric outlets. SERVICES: All employee interactions were positive and professional. I used the concierge service prior to arrival and they were great and responded in a timely manner. Turn-down service offered. Solid wi-fi. SPA: Really nice with comfortable lounging space and professional staff. The skincare products used were Natura Bisse and a few others. "Locker rooms" were quite nice and spacious; provided hotel shampoo/ conditioner along with the basic

My wife and I had visited, dinned, and stayed on The Resort at Pelican Hill number of times.  Last night we had attended dinner for four people and our professional waitress was Theresa,  The outstanding quality of food, the outstanding services by Theresa and her waitress was icing on the cake. Theresa's services was professional, and willing to assist with a smile.    Next time you visit the Coliseum ask for Theresa.  Thank you senior management team for the quality of professional training and services.  Best Regards, Jack Anaheim Hills

If you're looking for luxury, beauty, and comfort, there is no reason to look anywhere else. This resort is beyond incredible. Literally everywhere you look there is a sight of beauty. From green rolling hills on the golf course, to the giant pool, to the incredible view of the ocean. I will definitely be recommending this resort to every bride I work with!

I stayed in the pelican hill resorts for a week in the south villas and it was amazing big villa with a living room and great kitchen and amazing view of the golf course and the ocean.the staff are very helpful. The pool was great there was a kids side. My only wish was if there is basketball courts and tennis courts.

Summary Heading: LOVE this resort - gorgeous, palatial and top notch service. A+
Summary: This hotel is palatial and gorgeous with spectacular ocean views. Despite this, it captures a luxurious, homey comfort. I've stayed here numerous times over the years. The rooms are beautifully appointed and the linens are sumptuous. The staff go out of their way to accommodate. The spa is fabulous. It's very close to Mastro's and other fun restaurants to go for dinner. In fact, I believe they have a house car that will transport you there if you want to have wine with dinner and don't want to drive. The restaurant there is nice, not my favorite food in Newport beach. However, the ambience is very romantic, gorgeous views and live music. Even the bar adjacent to the restaurant is great for the view and people watching. Bartenders are always friendly and accommodating. The golf

Summary Heading: 5 Star for Beauty and 1 Star for Overall Service - go to the Montage instead
Summary: The beauty of this property is spell-binding. Clearly a lot of time and attention has been placed on the aesthetics - which are truly spectacular.  Perhaps they ran out of money when it got to training their employees.    To the point where I overheard fellow guests at the pool saying "This place does not deserve to be as busy as it is with the abysmal service they provide.' I have to say - I agree whole-heartedly.  I travel regularly and consider the Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons some of the most consistent in 5 star service across the board (property, amenities, service, food, ambience etc).   All this to say, I appreciate how wonderful service makes or breaks a hotel by either conveying an attitude of caring or an attitude that lacks this.  First - the concierge gave us
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to bring these concerns to our attention. I sincerely regret that your recent stay was disappointing, and I apologize that my management team did not thoroughly address your concerns. I would like to take this opportunity to have them connect with you directly. I will be sending you the contact information for the Rooms Manager in a private message, so he can personally address your comments in further detail.
