Once again, thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Great spa, Weak rooms, Great golf
Summary: Well, I must say this was a tricky review to write.  Overall, I would start out by saying it may be a better resort for families. There is a large, round pool in the Coliseum area that is lovely with a super view overlooking the golf course and the ocean from up in the hills. There is a kids club which from all appearances seemed to be great. Pool downside is that for adults, there is no pool without kids. Although it's a lovely pool, it's great for families. If you are a swimmer, this is not a swimming pool. It's shocking for a resort of this size to not have a lap pool and a pool for adults only. Apparently there is another pool but reserved only for villa guests. Well, that's great, but bungalow guests are paying close to $1000/ day, so that should count for something too.

Summary Heading: Becareful of Hotel's False Advertising - Ocean View Rooms Don't Have Ocean View
Summary: The resort is great for visiting and even staying if you do not care about your view.  Most of the staff is excellent or above.  Food quality at the different facilities is good or better.  I have visited multiple times and never had a bad meal.  If you are staying in The Villas, it takes too long for them to get there and your food will likely not be as hot.  Rooms are well maintained for the most part as well.  The square footage of the rooms seem to be larger than most other comparable hotels in the area.  The only real big problem and huge disappointment I had here was that I booked an Ocean View Room and instead got an Olive Tree View Room.  I asked a number of staff if the room I was in was an ocean view room and they all confirmed, Villa #601 is indeed an ocean view room.
Manager Response: Steve,  Thank you for taking the time to share you feedback with us. I understand your level of disappointment and regret that the view from your Villa did not meet your expectations. Please know that I have addressed your concerns with our Villa manager, reservations and in-room dining departments, so we can improve the guest experience in the future. We value your perspective and appreciate you taking the time to share it here.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Relaxing Resort with Beautiful Sunset Views -- OC's Finest
Summary: We've stayed here many times over the years and have always enjoyed the resort. The strongest feature is its location in the hills of Newport Coast within view of the Pacific Ocean. The buildings are beautifully designed and the rooms are substantial and comfortable.  The service is generally high though when we arrived (early afternoon), nobody was stationed to open the entrance doors (we had a toddler in a stroller and were carrying handbags).  The property perhaps is just starting to show its age in some places -- barely noticeable but incipient rust and chipping paint outside our bungalow patio.  The large pool area is spectacular and excellent for families with children.  I grew up in Newport Beach and nearby Corona del Mar. I believe that the Resort has the best location

This resort is gorgeous and definitely looks well kept and 5 star. The staff is plentiful and professional, kind, and eager to help. The rooms are a nice size.   We ate at the Coliseum for dinner twice. The first night our waitress was amazing. I wish I remembered her name. I ordered the specials of the day for my soup and meal and they were delicious. My husband got the Thai fettuccine and didn't think it was that great. The next night he got a burger and I got the filet, which were average, nothing special.   We booked our reservation for one night initially and then decided to add on another night a few days before arriving. We booked the 2nd night with a different reservation as changes are not allowed within one week of arrival. I put a comment on the online reservation to

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort with great customer service
Summary: Awesome staycation at Pelican Resort. Beautiful property with excellent customer service as soon as you drive up.  You leave your luggage in the car and check in first. Then someone escorts you to your villa or bungalow. We stayed in an ocean front bungalow. The guy who escorted us also helped us with our luggage, gave a brief description of the room, got us ice, and adjusted the temperature in our room.  The bungalow was spacious with some seating on the balcony. The ocean view was just okay. I guess to get a better ocean view the villas might be better. Our kids had lots of fun in the colisseum pool. The next day we used the free shuttle to Crystal Cove beach. They give you a bag with towels. Another guest told they also had water bottles but we didn't get any. They have

I've been here twice and really enjoy the resort - it's quiet and relaxing, and it's really convenient to Newport Beach and many areas of interest along the ocean front.   It's a great experience and we'll definitely be back, but we've experienced some confusion in how they label the lodging options - we thought we had the same room both times but we were in a very different area the second time (without a view). A minor detail, though.

My husband and I, along with our two young boys, couldn't wait to get here from NYC.  We have family that lives in the area and were excited to spend quality time in our villa. Rebecca, our concierge, helped us with many of our restaurant reservations, as well as Camp Pelican, and local activites to do with the children.  Augie Palas showed us the property and familiarized us with our Villa, which is great.    We have been eating on property and staying at the villa pool almost every day.  Karey is a wonderful help getting us set up and making sure we are comfortable.  Service by Corey, Angela have been amazing.  They are prompt, kind and always making sure we're having a wonderful time. The villa lobby staff have been wonderful too. We know how hard the staff works and we're
Manager Response: Ms. Genova-Hall,  Thank you for taking a moment to post your feedback here on our review page. I am disappointed to read that your experience has been anything less than Five-Star during your Villa stay with us. Please know that our Villa Manager has contacted you directly to address your concerns to your satisfaction. I have also shared your candid thoughts with our Food & Beverage Director, so we may follow up to improve upon the less-than-perfect restaurant service you kindly detailed. Additionally, I appreciate your kind recognition of Rebecca, Augie, Karey, Corey and Angela. I will thank them all for taking wonderful care of you.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We stayed in a bungalow that is spacious and beautiful with a fireplace, balcony, huge bathroom, and lovely amenities. The staff is helpful and courteous. The infinity pool is enormous with a view of the golf course and ocean. Resort has complimentary use of the fitness room and shuttle bus to the beach. Spa is wonderful. Would love to stay here again.

Stayed for four days and was outstanding! Immediately relaxed, majestic views, bungalow room had fireplace, gorgeous patio with ocean view, fantastic spa. Although resort large it was easy and scenic to walk everywhere. Restaurants fabulous also had room service and they set up on back patio - was wonderful. Many of the 5 star hotels can have an arrogant feel. The staff here was extremely friendly, but very conscious of your privacy so would take care of your needs swiftly them quietly slip away. I can't wait to go back - OC has the best weather and Newport has a trendy village feel. If you are a car buff, this is your resort. My husband loved seeing the valet lots with Bentleys, Rolls, McLarens, etc. If you have the opportunity to stay here, count yourself lucky!

We took some friends here for a break. The hotel is lovely, its position one of the best in the world, beautiful views and stunning sunsets. The staff were pleasant and efficient. The coach service to the beach was very good and made a welcome change from the pool area after a few days. I recommend an early coach to the beach, breakfast at the beachcombers or the shake shack and then a beautiful walk next to the sea to work off the breakfast excess. One thing Pelican Hill misses is an adults only pool. The pool can get very busy with excited kids and the addition of an adults only pool would be make this hotel perfect. Congratulations to the green keeping staff the north course was in great condition.

I had a wonderful 5th visit to the resort! The grounds, pool area, rooms, restaurants, golf course are all beautifully maintained. The staff is friendly, efficient and accommodating.  I can't wait to return. This is the place to stay when visiting the Newport Beach area!

This place is the best! The views are spectacular and the service is off the charts! We stayed at the villas one time and is was amazing! The pool is mind blowing. It's called the coliseum. The butlers are the coolest. It's expensive but worth it :)

I was here to attend my friend's wedding. The view behind the ceremony was breathtaking. Furthermore, the decoration in the ballroom was impressive as well. For the food, I love the soup but can't remember its name...

The bungalows are just wrapped in pure perfection. You come in through the guard gate, give you name, enter, park you car, enter inside utopia. Bose sound systems, California coastal decor, clean, it is all clean, views, patios, USB music ports, movies on demand, deep soaking tubs, flat screen tv's with movies in theaters, a Colosseum style pool, gourmet room service, beds that make you melt, cappuccino machines with a milk frothier. Beautiful, manicured grounds. Grab a raft, order real coconut milk in a real coconut. Feel the California Sun, and just day dream. The world can just fade away. A good trashy, mindless magazine in the tub later, with a cocktail and some fresh fruit and your fireplace. Yoo Hoo Cabana Boy! You may not remember where you live. $$$$ is a must, but what

We enjoyed our stay here a lot. The concierge service was great, as was the transportation both around the resort and also as a shuttle service to crystal cove. The provision of towels, umbrellas, water and beach chairs at crystal cove was great too. All of the staff were so respectful here and spoke so nicely to us. Nothing was too much trouble for them and the villa was kept immaculately clean.

Recommended hotel, bar and restaurant. The Andrea at Pelican Hill is excellent restaurant with great atmosphere and food..............   The location is amazing and the terrace area is awesome in Newport Beach   The restaurant is family and kids friendly

There is no disputing that this is one of the most beautiful hotel properties on the west coast. However there are a few things the savvy traveler should know.   The rooms (bungalows) - they spared no expense in design, furnishings, bath amenities etc. However, your view depends on your location within the neighborhood. That's right neighborhood - complete with tree lined streets, car parking lots and lot's of hotel traffic (via golf utility cards). Bed and bath are very comfortable, techies will like the media hub and great WiFi speed. Recommend bungalows in higher elevations (100 series) for best ocean views.   The Grounds - immaculate and beautiful. Property is spread out so expect a lot of walking or calling the front desk to arrange complimentary door to door shuttle.(long

The Resort at Pelican Hill delivers time and time again.   I have stayed at the Villas multiple times.   It's a perfect getaway in the winter to have Sun and mild weather.   The villas are well maintained with beautiful views of the ocean.    Perfect home away from home!   Two world class golf courses.   Great dining with ocean views at the Pelican Grill.  after a round of golf.  Pelican Hill is close to the boutique shops in Laguna Beach.  Close to Disneyland.   Great dining at Mastro's Ocean Club.    If you are a looking for a family getaway, this is the place to be.

Summary Heading: Old customers are told to go else where
Summary: My family and I have stayed at  The Resort at Pelican Hill almost 100 days over the last 6 years. We always stay in the villas (either a three or four bedroom unit). The visits had always been superb until the last two stays.  On our visit in April we were made aware that the new villa general manager, Omar Abreu, had decided to discontinue butler transportation  to Crystal Cove beach for villa guests.  The butlers were no longer allowed to run any errands off property. Daily newspapers were now going to be charged to your villa. These seemed like silly unnecessary changes considering the daily rate of the villas.  This now brings me to our last stay of 16 days this last July. We arrived to find the villa was dirty. The recovered furniture had big tears from a previous cat

First of all, this property is simply stunning from top to bottom.  We had one of the sea view bungalows and the first bungalow we were issued could hardly be considered sea view.  Even the staff acknowledged that they have had previous issues with mismanaging expectations relative to this specific bungalow.  After a word with a supervisor the following day, sharing my deep disappointment with how this was handled (i.e., I didn't want a refund of the difference, I wanted the room that I reserved several months in advance).  They moved us into an actual sea view bungalow at the top of the hill and the experience was night and day.  I commend them for taking initiative and relocating us as it made all the difference in our stay.  Further, the pool and grounds in general are also

Pros:  The grounds and rooms are exceptional. The spa is very nice and accessible even without a treatment scheduled. Most employees were very pleasant. My wife loved the yoga class and raved about Jennelle the instructor the class. Fitness center was above average.   Cons:  Pool. Who has ever heard of a hotel pool being at capacity and no room for actual hotel guests?  That's what we were told and so no pool for us. Apparently this is not uncommon here on weekends. They said the hotel was full and that's why it was an issue. However, who builds a resort and doesn't think one day maybe they'd be full and have guests that want to sit by the pool. Very disappointing. However, once we finally did get some chairs (1:30pm) it was short lived. Apparently someone drank too much alcohol

2nd time here. We love it! Going back again in September but this time gonna get a villa . Super clean and relaxing. Great warm coliseum pool. Our 4 month old loved it. Close to nearby shops. Picturesque views with the golf course and the beautiful hilltop gazebo

We were at the suites. (golf and oceanfront view) Apart from hotel with separate pool. Luckily because, the main hotel (pool) seemed to be overcrowded by small children and questionable guests (moment in time ??) Very nice property , very good staff , good food, no complains !  TIP : book a suite.

This is the 2nd time we have stayed here.  Everything about this hotel is 5 star.  Service is exceptional, very clean, property is exceptional maintained, the rooms are not your typical hotel room...they are like a chalet with huge ceilings, privacy, large bathroom, nice patio.  Location is excellent, they offer a shuttle to Fashion Island & the beach (they give you chairs, umbrellas, towels & water.  The grounds on this property are so large that it's almost impossible to ever feel like there are too many people.  Also, very kid friendly.  This trip we didn't take our kids, it was a romantic getaway.  Either romance or family...this is a serene, welcoming, beautiful place.

We are currently staying at the Resort at Pelican Hill and our stay has been both good and bad. There is no question that it is an absolutely amazing resort. The grounds are excellently maintained and the Bungalows are beautiful. We are staying in an ocean view bungalow and the views are incomparable. The food at the Colisseum Grill and the food from room service has been a good quality and is priced as one would expect from a high end resort.  Unfortunately it appears that the resort has an ongoing problem with getting guests checked in on time and getting rooms turned over in a speedy fashion. We've read previous reviews on Trip Advisor during out stay and it seems there is a common theme of rooms not being ready when guests check in. We booked our stay through American

Another place with credible beauty in Pacific Ocean views.   From entry to exit everything about This place was on top notch.     Try to catch a sunset.  You will never capture the degree of beauty on a camera nor I'll you be able to describe it in words.  You have to see it.

We booked for 1 week stay , our first time in California . We opted for a 2 bedroom Villa which would fit our family of 5 perfectly .  To note that what they mean by Villa is in fact a bunch of 2 story buildings in a gated compound minutes from the main hotel , each building containing 2 apartments/floor with individual garage for each .  We were in 603 in the North villas . It's truly a haven of peace , gorgeous view with all possible amenities . Fully equipped kitchen with stove , microwave , big fridge ...and best of all a washer and dryer !  The villa consists of 2 en suite bedrooms , both room and bathroom are huge with super comfortable beds . An additional bathroom next to the living/dining space , big screen tv , bose home theatre . We loved it so much we did 't want to

Best resort we have ever stayed in North America, beautiful setting, comfortable room, friendly staff, good live entertainment, and great foods at restaurants.  I would rank this one better than the Pebble Beach resort.

This is how luxury feels! Each person we encountered spoke in a way that made me feel like royalty. It was genuine and sincere, as if they truly cared about our experience. Our room was breathtaking, it felt more like a home than a hotel. Driving thru lush beautiful grounds then thru a guarded gate, parking directly in front of our room. The room was grand, vaulted ceilings and a fireplace...I mean wow! The patio was devine,views of the golf course with the ocean as a backdrop. It was just too nice to leave... so we had room service delivered and stayed in. They told us the time our food would be delivered and showed up at exactly 740pm. Our food was hot, not just warm but hot. Every bite was delish! Mac & Cheese was a huge portion to share and ah-may-zing! My husband had the

A wonderful paradise where the ocean meets the golf course The most incredible service from check in to check out Beautiful bungalow rooms over looking pacific and golf courses Magnificent pool, beautiful golf courses and delicious food This resort is as close to paradise perfect Can't wait to come back Sandy Chestman

A group of 4 friends decided to take a break fro Los Angeles and headed to Newport Coast.  We stayed in a very spacious and tastefully furnished bungalow with a great ocean view and view of the golf course.  Spent one afternoon at the beach - taking the shuttle.  It is a California State Beach Park and a wonderful spot - Crystal Cove.  The hotel has chairs and umbrellas for you when you get to the beach.  Another day at the great pool -- lots of shady areas and there was a musician playing while we relaxed!  We had breakfast daily at the Colloseum which overlooks the pool and ocean.  Good selections for breakfast and everyone enjoyed their meals.  The staff is attentive and always ready to help with any requests.  Summer rates are pricey but the property is wonderful and the

Summary Heading: Stunning Hotel, Brilliant Staff and Fantastic Location
Summary: I stayed at this resort in April and it certainly has the wow factor!   On arrival you are greeted by a very friendly receptionist and directed to your room. Myself and wife stayed in one of the King garden bungalows, as I was working in LA most days I asked for a room close to the hotel as my wife would be on her own. The staff made sure this happened as we were around a 2 minute walk to the Coliseum Pool.   The rooms are very large, clean and all the amenities you required. We ate at the hotel most nights and every meal was fantastic plus the service was second to none. The main pool is huge and you have fantastic sea views. It was hotel guest only around the main pool I noticed a number of people trying to go down to the pool after just being in the restaurant but they were

The resort  at Pelican hill is a beautiful  oasis from the calm view of the ocean, the well appointed rooms with neutral  zen decor, fireplace, soaking tub, and modern shower. To the plush robes, complimentary  slippers, and amenities of exclusive products  with the aroma of lavender, lemon, and sage. Along with paths of beautiful  aromatic gardens and brightly  colored foliage as you walk to the infinity pool or take a golf cart to the corse  that is sourounded by this beautiful landscape.   It's a fantastic  place to be still and re-engage life.

We just left the Pelican resort and overall had a fantastic time  Pros: The rooms were very large and we were fortunate enough to get a suite which worked out perfectly for the both of us. Everything was well cared for, clean and well laid out. The list could go on with everything I liked about the room.  Breathtaking views all around the resort and although we don't golf the course was nice. I also got the opportunity to go to the spa one day, I'd recommend to go a bit early and enjoy the pool/steam room and sauna. So relaxing and the therapist did a great job (loved all the extra touches, tea, snacks, scented oils ect.). Our waitress at the bar in Andrea, was fantastic very energetic and made our drinks just how we liked it (I wish I remembered her name, she deserves to be

I have been staying at this resort since it opened and have LOVED IT and RAVED ABOUT IT- we try to off set jet leg when we return from Asia before headed home to the east coast.  I walked into the lobby and felt something was different - they added a glass wall in-between the lobby and the sitting are and A LOT of furniture- it looked like what I would imagine a bus terminal would look like, all of the charm is gone.  They also put a lot of tacky candles in glass vases with sand all around- Laguna Beach, sure but not Pelican Hill! Our room wasn't ready so we went to the Coliseum for lunch.  It feels that they have added more tables, when I got up to rinse my hands, my chair hit the chair behind me- I don't remember it being so close to other tables?? The food was fine, although
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to post your candid thoughts here and on our Andrea review page. As I shared in my previous message responding to your Andrea review, we sincerely appreciate your feedback and apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect. We would like to connect with you directly and discuss your experience further. I have provided the contact information for our Rooms Manager separately in a private message. Once again, I sincerely thank you for sharing your valuable feedback with us.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Beautifully appointed resort with ocean views
Summary: Check-in was professional and quickly facilitated. Our room wasn't quite ready - they have a 4.00pm check-in although you can request an early check-in if a room becomes available. We enjoyed lunch on the patio at the pool while waiting. The rooms are large with ocean views and the bathrooms, expansive with all the amenities. Breakfast on the patio was exactly as ordered. The staff were attentive and well trained. Definitely a return when in the area.

Summary Heading: Calm and quiet in So Cal
Summary: We were upgraded to a two bedroom villa.  This place was like a perfect home.  2100 square feet, all marble and granite, two patios (the ocean view was at least one thousand square feet), perfectly furnished and a full high end kitchen.   Forget the Ritz Carlton or Montage in Laguna Beach.  Pelican Hill is the perfect spot on the Newport Coast.   The Bungalows (where we were originally booked) looked great, but we are spoiled by the Villas, and will book there directly when we return to So Cal this fall.

Pull up to the entrance and it is immediately apparent you have arrived at a high end and lovely property. You will be directed to check in.  No need to unload your car as your room/house(villas with kitchen a garages) is elsewhere.  Grab your key and parking pass and head to a separate security gate.  You are almost home.  Park by your unit or in your private garage and you’ll realize that valet parking and bellhops are overrated.    Head through your private entrance into a very large and open room with lovely appointments. Even the cheap ($600 a night) rooms are excellent and there is no one above you (awesome). Although the non-villas are attached and don’t have the amazing views of the villas, they feel like casitas. They are super quiet, with a large bathroom, foyer,

Summary Heading: Poor customer service and very bad experience
Summary: Very disappointed thus far in this "5 star" property.  While the grounds and public spaces are very nice and the views from some areas are spectacular our bungalow and pool cabana experience was very sub par.   To begin with the cabana, I was told we had cabana from 8 am until sunset.  While this is true there really is no service until approximately 11 and no food until 11:30.  Would have been nice to know that.  Secondly although I did not complain to staff at the time there was an awful sewage smell wafting towards the cabana that while not constant was there for much of the day.  Service was otherwise good and when we needed anything server brought in a very reasonable amount of time.  Now the room.  Reserved an ocean view bungalow with two queens.  Minor issues kept

Summary Heading: It started out on the wrong foot
Summary: We waited for three hours for our room, then told we were "upgraded" to the villas...which are so far away form everything that you need to be driven. All we wanted was the room that we booked, and it seemed like a hassle to have the "upgrade" reversed. Finally, after 3 hours, the hotel made it right and gave us a $100/day resort credit as compensation for the lost vacation time.  Golf was great, but VERY expensive. And then the coup...a baby crapped in the pool both Friday and Saturday eliminating the enjoyment of the pool for hours each day. Now it is hard to hold the hotel responsible for this, but additional compensation should have been provided. The service at the poo grill restaurant was inconsistant. Yes, it is a beautiful place, and everyone seems very polite but too
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your candid feedback.  I am disappointed to read that your recent visit was anything less than perfect. Please know that I have personally addressed the concerns you mentioned. We appreciate you taking a moment to share your comments with us and hope to welcome you back for a much improved visit in the future.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This hotel is knock you socks off amazing!  From the grand entry way, lobby, and rooms.  I walked around with my mouth open it was so gorgeous.  Every single stop on the grounds of the hotel are manicured and simply perfect.  Our stay was outstanding.

Summary Heading: Villas make for a luxurious stay with kids
Summary: Wanted to take a moment to acknowledge Laura Garcia and Christine Alfred at the Pelican Hill resort. They helped to make our wedding anniversary/family get-away a memorable one by going above and beyond in helping us to plan our stay. From making our hotel reservations, to the luxurious villas accommodations, to the fun kids club, the gorgeous pool and the  great service our stay was a five star experience.

Summary Heading: Beautiful views but just lack the basics
Summary: We stayed for 2 days over a weekend to attend a wedding. As a wedding location this place is simply outstanding though I am happy I wasn't the parents of the bride, because it'd also exceptionally expensive! The hotel did all the pre arrival stuff really well - emailed us for details of when we would arrive and our preference of pillow type. We arrived about an hour early (3pm)but unfortunately our villa wasn't ready yet so we had to wait around.  The pool area is a large circular pool with beds, and the restaurant overlooking - sorry to say it had the feeling of a tired Turkish or Greek pool complex from the 80's or 90's. The drinks and food on the restaurant were served quickly, tasted good and not too pricey. My complaint centred around the room servicing. On the day of the

It seems that every time I visit the Resort at Pelican Hill it gets better and better.  To be fair, my first visit several years ago was not good.  But, I decided to give it another try and it has been fantastic.  The service is great and now that I have stayed a few times several of the staff knows me.  One of the things that I really like is how quiet the resort is and the surrounding area.  Very restful nights sleep and in the morning, have a cup of coffee on the balcony is a great way to start the day.  Another thing that impresses me is that management actually reads and responds to the surveys that guests fill out.  So if something did not go as planned during your stay, it will be addressed.  Even after you leave the resort, the follow up service you get is wonderful.  I

stayed here after our wedding and couldn't say enough good stuff. we booked through the visa signature hotel website and got a room upgrade, dining credit and because it was our wedding day they treated us like royalty. could not say enough about the staff (they acommodated early morning luggage drop off/checkin, were ready when we arrived later in the evening, and made sure everything was perfect for us. the coliseum pool was perfect. we're both from orange county, but it felt like we were somewhere neither of us had ever been. can't wait to stay again

The pros: Before arriving we received emails asking detailed questions about our party and our preferences,which was a nice touch. The property itself was lovely and vast. I liked having two separate pool options (we stayed in a 2 bedroom villa so we had the choice of using a pool just for villa guests). The location was also close to lots of great restaurants and shopping, and our room was spacious and very well appointed. I loved the large terrace. Perfect place to enjoy morning coffee. They also have a shuttle that takes you to the beach and they provide you with your own beach bag of towels and water. Super convenient.  The cons: Upon check-in, we were told our room wasn't ready at the promised time of 5:00. There were many other people waiting for their rooms as well. I
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid thoughts on our review page. While I am pleased to read that you enjoyed the location, pools and Villa setting, I am disappointed that your overall visit was anything less than perfect. We apologize for the unacceptable service you described in your review and would like to take this opportunity to discuss your experience in further detail. I have sent you a private message with the contact information for the Hotel Manager, so we may connect with you directly. Once again, thank you for sharing your feedback with us.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Pelican hill & its sister property adjacent to fashion island at Newport are superior in all ways and the golf courses are challenging yet well maintained   Morning buffet by the pool  Amadeus restaurant for dinner  Walking trails and some casitas have view of ocean

I want to be objective here as I have stayed here on several previous occasions.  I have not yet written a review of this property however.  Sometimes one does not know the true colors of a business until one has an issue.  Then he/she can see how the property resolves said issue.    As a frequent business traveler who stays in hotels about 250 nights per year I thought I had seen it ALL.  Well not quite yet. . .   As I said, I want to be objective so the positives first.  The setting of this place rivals any setting of any resort in the U.S.  The restaurants are great and the pools are well set out and well serviced.  Not a good or a bad thing but the resort is very spread out so you are dependent on valets to take you everywhere.  Now to my story that the reader can judge for
Manager Response: Jeff,  Thank you for your candid feedback. I am deeply disappointed to read about the less-than-perfect experience you encountered during your stay. Please know that I am personally addressing your concerns with our staff. We would also like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. Once again, I appreciate you taking the time to communicate your feedback here.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The Resort at Pelican Hill is normally a quiet retreat within the busyness of SoCal.  On our last trip, we stayed in bungalow 304. Don't hesitate to book a stay at Pelican Hill, unless you get this bungalow. Just outside the ocean facing slider, there is a small patio with loungers and a table, bordered by a mini rose garden within a privacy wall. The wall offers little privacy. On the other side of the wall is a busy walkway. Taller (6'1" and up, which is pretty average really) guests can see over the wall, able to view you anywhere in the room, unless the curtains are closed.  Just downhill of this room, there are other bungalows. We happened to be blessed with a family from Italy (they told me that was where they were from, and I have no reason to doubt them),with I'm not
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your detailed feedback on our review page. I am disappointed to read that your recent bungalow stay was anything less than perfect. I have shared your comments with our maintenance team, so we may improve our guest experience based upon your candid feedback. We sincerely hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back again soon for a better overall experience.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Good view, clean, attentive - hands out staff
Summary: Well above average property.  Stretched out nicely.  Golf course is beautiful, yet "Caddies" drive for the tip.  Rooms/housekeeping superior with room service the best with a nice variety of foods. Important to get a room with higher view to enjoy the ocean.

We stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon and we were so sad to leave. We had the most unbelievable experience. The bedrooms are luxurious, the massages are superb and the food delicious. We are really surprised by the bad reviews as this is definitely one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in!

Summary Heading: The Villas is a spectacular setting for a luxurious family vacation
Summary: We just finished a one week vacation in a 3 bedroom villa.  All of our future hotel stays will be judged by the extremely high bar set by Pelican Hill.  The villa had very large, well appointed rooms and a spectacular patio to enjoy the wonderful sunsets.  We also enjoyed the beautiful pool and clubhouse.   The luxury of the property is surpassed only by the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff, especially Concierge Michelle Olivier.  Michelle provided a tremendous amount of assistance to our family before and during our vacation.

This resort excThis resort exceeded my expectations.  It is beautifully decorated and meticulously maintained.  The staff is professional and courteous. The rooms were beautiful – we stayed in a 3 bedroom villa – thanks to an upgrade! It was spacious and well appointed – could live there for rest of my life and be perfectly happy.  The view is endlessly beautiful from sun rise to sunset.  It is a great place for a family vacation or just a place to retreat for relaxation. The restaurants were all good with the exception of the Villa restaurant called Piccolo.  The menu at Piccolo is challenging – Asian and Italian which is hard to match up.  The worst dish I ever had – ever – was here – it was a lamb meatball – dense and gamey and lamby – served room temperature on reheated old

Summary Heading: 10 Years of Visits and Still Terrific!
Summary: Last weekend, we returned to Pelican Hill for our 4th trip in 10 years for a birthday/Father's Day celebration.  In truth, before we came, I was wondering if I had made a good decision and wanted to make my own evaluation, based on some of the TA recent reviews, but I need not have concerned myself: the entire weekend was more than perfect.  Our family of 3 came primarily to play golf, so I will not be able to comment on the other activities available.  Before we even arrived, we were graciously contacted by Ms. Rivera-Shaw, Guest Experience Concierge, who set up all of our tee times and wrote us a beautiful letter, as well as Ms. Shirley Mar, in Leisure Resort Sales, making sure we were very well taken care of.  (We were on a Virtuoso Amenities package from our excellent travel

We didn't end up spending a lot of time on the resort. However, the time we spent there, it was very nice. We stayed in a villa, which had plenty of room for the 4 of us. It was nicely appointed but not over the top. The bed was not extremely comfortable. The mattress seemed past its prime. The cable didn't work part of the time we were there. And the air was not able to be controlled from the room. Once I pointed this out to maintenance, they adjusted it so we could turn the fan up as needed. We ate breakfast at the buffet one morning and were a bit taken aback by the price. I have eaten at buffets in Hawaii and all over the world and never paid $40 per person for breakfast. We didn't eat there again. Overall, it was a nice resort and we would stay there again if visiting the

Summary Heading: A stunningly located beautiful property - California Dreamin'
Summary: I usually write very long review on TA but I am going to keep this one very short. I stayed here for 1 week in early July 2016 and, in a word, this property was excellent. They have tried to recreate the charm of an Italian Tuscan retreat and they have very nearly succeeded. (I'm thinking Villa D'Este on Lake Como where I have also stayed). I had a thoroughly enjoyable stay here, and the staff were truly exemplary in every respect. Nothing was too much trouble. In particular, I would like to call out Antonio in the spa for special praise. He was charm personified - a lovely gentleman. I promised I would give him a mention in my review so this is for you Antonio. Please keep it up! I would like to bring my parents here next time for a couple of nights and they are quite fussy so

I stayed here for a week in April and I was really impressed with the resort. I was in two minds about not staying in Los Angeles (this resort is an hour away) but I got there it was worth it. The resort is made up of bungalows and villas and I stayed in a ocean facing bungalow. The rooms are really spacious and are very comfortable. All rooms have a terrace and as it was quite chilly in April, I appreciated the real fire in the bedroom. The resort has 4 restaurants, which I ate in all and they were all excellent. I had a great pedicure in the spa, the golf courses look good (but I'm not a golfer) and the swimming pool is apparently the largest circular pool in the States. All in all - very impressed and would highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: Lifestyles of the rich and famous
Summary: Pelican Hill is a convenient 20-25 minutes from the Orange County Airport, if that.  Nice. Trying to figure out which complex to check in at took a little work.  Forget checking in early, we had to wait a couple of hours.  After a long cross country trip, we were a bit grumpy.  Check-in for the villas wasn't until 5pm and we simply didn't want to wait any longer, so we had them check us into a bungalow (room).    The bungalow was really nice but the bed configuration not what we needed so the next day, we moved to a villa. We should have just waited in the first place for the villa.  So, after a questionable start, it was all good after that. We ended up in a four-bedroom villa (two-stories, a master on both levels) that was, actually, nicer than our home.  It overlooked the

I would rate this resort as nice, above average but not great. We had a bungalow but it was quite far from the main hotel so you needed to call for a shuttle or buggy to get around. Uber cars would often decline our picks up as they had problems locating us which is bizarre. Our bungalow was a little dated in its decor but it was clean. The resort didn't particularly wow us and there was nothing close by to do/see. I think next time I would be more inclined to stay in Laguna/Huntingdon Beach areas.

Our 1st stay and had booked a 2 bed villa with ocean view..........however on arrival , imagine our surprise and pleasure to be told we  were being  upgraded to a 4 bed villa. this was huge, very well furnished ( both inside and outside on the private terrace) and exceptionally clean. It also offered stunning views over the golf courses to the ocean It's true to say there were some service issues during our stay but once reported they were immediately acknowledged, accepted and then resolved to my complete satisfaction ( thanks to Jordan/Bill) I played both wonderful golf courses ( expensive but worth it) which were in excellent condition and offered a serious challenge from the blue tees. My caddie Dave Low was great company and knew every blade of grass on both courses we ate

The place is huge and well managed but lacks authenticity. It feels like they've spent loads of money on the place and have staff of 2 or 3 per guest, but it just doesn't have real charm. Food is good. Rooms are spacious, but neither romantic or practical. So if you're over 60 and love golf, do go here, but for a romantic getaway, honeymoon, business trip, of you're looking for nightlife, skip this one.

Summary Heading: Their front desk staff drove my wife to tears
Summary: My wife was literally in tears becaus of the disrepectful, condescending, patronizing behavior of Haley at the hotel's front desk, who refused to allow my wife to speak to any manager about the loss/theft of an article of clothing at the hotel. She left a $500 jacket in Andrea restaurant at closing, and despite the server seeing it after she left, the item disappeared never to be seen again.  According to Haley at the front desk, Manager on Duty, Olivia, was too busy "managing rooms" to be bothered to come out and speak with my wife about this issue, even after Haley had my wife wait almost an hour with the promise that Olivia would "get to her." When asked again after almost an hour wait, Haley said, "we're at capacity" which apparently meant she couldn't be bothered to try to
Manager Response: Mr. Frasier,   Thank you for sharing your candid feedback with us. I am troubled to read about your unsatisfactory experience, as our Five-Star standards were clearly not delivered during the unacceptable interactions you described. I sincerely regret the disappointment that you and your wife experienced. We would like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your concerns in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. Once again, I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: The Pool, The Villas and The Food
Summary: The pool at Pelican Hill resort is their strongest attribute.  It is beautiful and has nice views of the Pacific.   It’s even bigger than it look in photos.  It definitely has the “wow” factor!  I’m not a huge fan of giant resorts and was fortunate enough to stay in the Villas instead of the main resort.  We were in a butler- serviced three-bedroom villa that was comfortably furnished and filled with many amenities to make the stay easy.  The Villa’s also include  a private pool and restaurant which was helpful on a crowded Memorial Day weekend.   Drawbacks:  I didn’t care for the quality of the food in any of the restaurants at the resort.  I would give the food quality in general a B rating.  I would expect better menu options and execution in a resort like this.    Also, this

I stayed at Pelican Hill for a business conference this week and WOW what a spectacular resort. Room are amazing service is every bit of the 5 stars they are awarded. Views are fantastic and sunsets on a clear night are breathtaking. The coliseum pool is very unique you must check it out.

Summary Heading: Villa was perfect home away from home
Summary: The resort is beautiful (beyond expectations).The common pool barely had anyone there - felt like a private pool. Golf course is well maintained and had a great view of the ocean. The food tasted wonderful and room service was within 30-40minutes, that is pretty quick given that each villa was the sized of a small house (you have your own garage, washer/dryer, entrance, etc) and so the resort is very big. The butler is pretty useless though, but don't let that deter you from going there. Splurge and go with an ocean-view room, the view is beautiful!   One minor complain would be the check-in/check-out process. Our travel agency guaranteed an upgrade but the gentleman at the counter did not honor that even though there was availability (it was later fixed once we complained to

We had the pleasure to stay at Pelican Hill this past Memorial Day weekend. It was a truly delightful experience.  In particular let me note a few highlights: 1. in room dining. timely; efficient; well orchestrated. Food was always hot or cold as required. Impressed by the fact that the morning toast was done in the room! and the staff who delivered every meal never missed a beat.  2. dinner at Andrea: resort dining can be a hit or miss adventure. In this case, we enjoyed some marvelous seasonal Italian cuisine.  3. the bungalows are lovely and spacious. Nice appointed. Ours overlooked the blue Pacific and golf course. 4. Golf: played the North Course. Well kept. Not too crowded for a holiday.  There are a number of 5 star resort spaced up and down the Newport and Laguna coasts.

Gorgeous resort with top notch service.   Having your own bungalow is a huge plus! Parking right out front, no one above or below you, with a large furnished terrace and ocean view.   There is a kid pool separate from the main pool.   The spa is a MUST. We frequently get services there without staying at the resort.   We look forward to coming back soon!

I had a spa treatment ar the Pelican Hill Spa and it was Amazing! The spa is so beautiful and has every amenity available for guests. The staff are welcoming and helpful. The aqua area is pure luxury with a salt water hot pool, steam room and sauna. I had a deep tissue massage and felt completely rejuvenated. A lovely experience. I will be back!!!

The most spectacular hotel we've ever been to!! The rooms are unsurpassed, the cabanas near the pool were comfortable and the pool was awesome! Every member of the staff is friendly and accommodating. The food is out of this world. If you want the experience of a lifetime, visit Pelican Hill. The kids club is one of the best the grandkids have been to.

Actually ididnt stay at the resort , just stopped to have my early morning breakfast. Iwould highly recommend this place it's wonderful and the customer service was more than fantastic especially with the waiter ( Stephan ) he was really welcoming and came to my table twice to double check if i was happy with the food which made me happy I would be happy rating them 10 out of 10 and ill be back to this place for sure ..

This is a great holiday venue - large, spacious, stunning location, great views, well manicured gardens, well appointed furnishings, etc.  We came here for our honeymoon and spent several nights here.  The room was beautiful - very well appointed and spacious and had all the facilities you would need.  The bathroom is particularly spacious with double sinks and a separate shower and toilet.  The room provides a great haven to return to after a long day.   We spent a lot of time by the pool which is stunning - it is a beautiful place to relax during the day.  In September it was very quiet and some days we had the whole pool to ourselves, which was brilliant.  We also took a cabana by the pool one day, which was great, very luxurious and great to have some extra privacy.   The

We stayed at Pelican Hill the middle of May '16 for our 25 yr Wedding anniversary.  We booked a golf package to stay in a bungalow, but the staff upgraded us to a 3 br villa and it was spectacular.  Played both golf courses, and had a wonderful time.  I highly recommend staying here, and in fact are already working on trip to return next year!

I spent a weekend and loved it, my room was very comfortable , loved the breakfast, had many tasty options ! I loved touring the villages and keep watching those olive trees that were planted adult already !

I've stayed at Pelican Hill maybe 100 nights or more over the last several years.  My summary - the rooms are in desperate need of an update.  Everything looks worn, ragged, old, something I wouldn't even have in my home.  Also, room view quality is all over the place.  Some ocean view rooms are just a sliver of the ocean looking over rooftops or trees, while some have an amazing, unobstructed view, and you never know which you will get.  On the plus side the pool is amazing - great view, fantastic service, good food.  I mostly stay here for the pool.  The spa is also nice but honestly haven't been there often.

Pelican Hill was an incredible place to stay.  The rooms are villa style.  Ours was quite plush, a short walking distance to the restaurants and lobby, and rooms are like living at home. Very spacious, well appointed furnishings, and amazingly comfortable rooms.  The beds are comfortable.  Bathrooms are large and wonderful.  Each of the three restaurants we ate at were very good.  Service overall is impeccable. The location is great - right off the PCH between Newport Beach and Laguna Beach.    One of the best places I have stayed at ever!

So far it's not good. Took a while to check in. Our villa was large and clean but service is not good. My villa was not cleaned on time the first day, the next day not cleaned at all.   My in-laws also stayed with us (in a separate room) and had no towels in the room. I called the front desk and spoke to the General Manager at the Villas who tried to help but the second day when there was no cleaning I could not take it anymore. I received a call from the Manager of the Hotel and he was was not professional at all. I have traveled in so many nice hotels but this manager was by far the worst I have ever seen. He was not American and this does not really matters but I was expecting more class and customer service.
Manager Response: Timisha,  Thank you for taking a moment to share your comments on our review page. I am disappointed that your experience was anything less than perfect. We would like to take this opportunity to connect with you directly. I have sent you a private message with the contact information for our Hotel Manager, so we may continue to improve upon the guest experience. We hope to welcome you back for a much improved visit soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama The Resort at Pelican Hill Managing Director

Summary: We saved the best to finish our journey. The Resort at Pelican Hill is 1st class. Situated on the top of the hill overlooking the ocean with stunning views. A quiet location but easily accessible to the beach and the resorts along the coast. Huge quiet pool with plenty of comfy beds and attentive staff. Beautiful public rooms and restaurants everywhere is immaculate. Staff are all friendly and helpful. Bedrooms and bathrooms stunning tastefully decorated and well appointed .

This resort is extremely luxurious! It truly feels like I visited a tropical location - not just a few hours away from home. The pool is the largest circular pool in the world and the golf course overlooks the ocean. Every inch of the property is well thought out. I would recommend renting bikes and checking out Balboa Island and Crystal Cove. The spa is glorious, definitely go early before treatment to take advantage of the jacuzzi, lounges and steam room.

The California coast is hard to beat for beauty and this resort is nestled in a near perfect spot. Do not be intimidated if you must park your Mercedes between the Bentleys and the Rolls and an occasional Ferrari. All are welcome. Impeccably outfitted rooms which seem new although the resort is nearly ten years old. The bungalow style rooms are "yuge". The larger binges have a separate living spam and bedroom both of which would constitute oversized rooms on their own. The Bungalows come equipped with a gas fireplace and a patio facing the Pacific and overlooking the golf course. Large glass sliders provide an expansive view, and the bath opens to the room to share same. The decor is rustic but don't be misled, it exudes luxury at every turn. Rough hewn huge wood beams buttress

The hotel has magnificent rooms that are warm and comfortable. Each room has its own sidewalk front door entrance, a warm gas fireplace , nice deck with chaise lounges and table and chairs. The main section of the hotel is lovely with great dining and atmosphere. Large pool is very convenient. All of the employees were attentive and very helpful. Would really like to go back again!!!

Summary Heading: Spectacular Views - had to pinch myself
Summary: I stayed here for a few days on a work trip. Upon arrival I was greeted with bountiful swaying palm trees, lush greenery and a cloudless blue sky. I checked in and then was driven to my villa. The room was very large and luxurious; with a giant garden tub and amazing spa-like bathroom, a peaceful balcony with loungers and an incredibly cozy king size bed. It was all pristine. After getting settled in I had lunch at the poolside restaurant. The food was amazingly delicious.   We had meetings for the rest of my stay. The meeting staff was top notch, not one detail was missed. The food during all of our event was absolutely perfect - 5 star all the way!! This resort is worth every penny. I only wish I could have stayed here with my family.

Nichole Urell and Pam Wolter were instrumental in making this trip an AMAZING first wedding anniversary for my wife and I. Pam worked with us in helping to plan our perfect wedding at Pelican Hill on May 8, 2015. For our anniversary dinner Pam helped us relive our wedding dinner by coordinating with Chef Marco at Andrea to recreate our wedding meal. We started out with an unbelievably delicious crab cake, followed by a filet with a potato stack and sautéed spinach, and then finally a mini version of our wedding cake that was equally delicious and beautiful. A true work of culinary art! As a surprise, as we were having out dinner at Andrea, Nichole was busy in our bungalow decorating it with rose petals and flame less candles. My wife LOVED IT! Was totally surprised! Nichole also

Summary Heading: Great family hotel and Perfect location
Summary: My family and I were here last year and we all loved the hotel. I stayed in a two bedroom villa on the top floor and it was marvelous. There was a huge balcony overlooking the ocean and it is beautiful. The location of Pelican Hill is perfect, It is right in between Newport and Laguna Beach. The hotel provides GL550 mercedes to drive you too the club house. At the clubhouse is a huge quarter circle pool. There is a bigger pool at the main club house which is much more crowded and but is a full giant circle. The beach is a 5-10 minute drive from the hotel. Besides the distance to the beach this is a great family hotel.

Our last 6 nights of a 3 week trip to California was spent here.  We should have realised there would be a problem with the service when we were told we would not get into our villa before 4pm. We were told the maids were doing the final touches to make it perfect! That was clearly rubbish. It was 4.30 before we got in. Although the apartment (why its called a villa I have no clue as its on a top floor of a block ) was clean there were oily smears on the cabinet doors in the kitchen area and dirt on the floor in the washing machine cupboard. We moved to another apartment in North villas, before we had unpacked as they had put us next to a family with young children and the baby crying from the minute we arrived was too much. (no fault of the baby or parents, but we've been there
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your candid feedback on our review page. I am disappointed to read that your recent visit was anything less than perfect. Please know that it is our aim to deliver the finest experience and Five-Star service to each and every guest. I have personally shared your comments with our management staff, so we may continue to look for opportunities of improvement. We hope to welcome you back in the future.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Probably one of the nicest resorts I have ever been to. From the staff to the entrance way, the attention the detail and the complex and rooms, it is stunning. We stayed in a 2 bedroom Villa. It was huge, has a massive patio with beautiful lounging chairs, doors that open up on the whole one side of the unit, a kitchen with Sub Zero appliances and the bathrooms are massive and all marble. I was thoroughly impressed. Hands down, one of the nicest places I have stayed at.

The Resort at Pelican Hill definitely has the WOW factor! It is set up in three different sections; the main hotel, the Bungalows and the Villas which get nicer and bigger with each one.  I stayed in the Bungalows and it really is a beautiful room. It is set up like little, well... Bungalows separated from the main hotel. The Villas are like 3,000 sqft, so great for families.  I was there for business which was great. Very nice meeting room and plenty of time to enjoy their very large circular pool that is only 3' deep all the way around. I loved the pool and there is a nice view of the golf course which I'm sure is amazing!  The only negatives I can say are:  • When they have an event, it will mess with your day. One day I went to get lunch and my only option was pre-packaged

Summary Heading: Superb stay for a family reunion
Summary: We rented a 3 bedroom villa for 3 couples. The accommodations were superb. Each bedroom had its own bathroom, the kitchen was supplied with some food and all of the amenities to cook. The place was spotless and cleaned every day. The view was breathtaking overlooking the ocean. The food at all onsite restaurants was very good.  The hotel was close to the beach and hiking and biking trails. Unfortunately, we did have some problems with broken bicycles but the hotel sent a van immediately to pick us up. We had some problems with hair in one of the meals but that was addressed immediately and we were reimbursed for the meal.  Overall we would return in the future because of the great and friendly service and great accommodations.

The villas are stunning and you can get them decorated for the holidays!  The beds are extremely comfortable and the bathrooms are fantastic.  Although there is no beach access from this resort, the views are phenomenal and the pool is great.  Food = A+ at the Colosseum and the Pelican Grille.

we have traveled all over the world (almost) and this is among the best resort I have ever stayed in we had a villa for our family it was GREAT we did not use the kitchen much but it had a wolf stove and Sub zero fridge. two master baths and a great view of the Pacific Ocean over the golf course the pools were a short walk form our Villa and wonder full our grand children loved that they were only about 3 feet at the deepest the restaurants ere very good and varied  we were there for Easter Brunch  the finest brunch I have ever seen they had everything and more the put on a Easter egg hunt for the children and it was fun fun fun  the golf courses were amount the best I have played

Summary Heading: Enjoy chanpagne with elderflower liquour while overlooking the spectacular Coliseum Pool and Restaurant.
Summary: This is the largest circular pool in the world and is surrounded on one side by a Roman Villa like structure that holds a great both indoor and outdoor restaurant which is open to both Pelican Hill Resort Guests and other visitors.    We ordered brunch off the menu and enjoyed drinks and champagne infused with elderflower liquour prior to our meal.  Our guests enjoyed the burritos served with fresh avocado and we were most impressed with the scrambled eggs and lobster.  There is valet parking.  Please telephone ahead for reservations!

This is one of the nicest resorts my husband & I have ever visited.  Attention to every detail!  Our suite was gorgeous & we barely wanted to leave because it was so well appointed.  Great food & cocktails in all the resort restaurants.  Staff was beyond fabulous. Beautiful golf course & views.  Felt like we were in Italy.  So much to do in surrounding Orange County with shopping & restaurants a quick drive away.  Will go back every year!

Summary Heading: An unforgettable escape nestled in the hills of Newport Coast
Summary: Overview: Breathtaking from the moment you step into your ocean-view bungalow! My wife and I live nearby and decided to enjoy a weekend get-away without the travel hassles. We booked an ocean-view bungalow at a rate of $335 (special promotion for locals during the shoulder season). This was our first time staying on this property, though we've visited many times for dining and special events. Highly recommend this property.   Note: "Bungalows" are their standard rooms, versus the "villas" which are larger, multi-bedrooms with full kitchens and even garages. Bungalows are huge, have very high ceilings, gas fireplace, patio, Nespresso machine, milk frother, and even a toaster. There's a mini bar with two small complimentary milks in it for your lattes.   Tip: make sure you request

Summary Heading: Lovely stay spoilt by lousy lunch
Summary: We had the opportunity to stay here in one of the rooms- rooms! I wish my bedroom was like this-espresso maker, comfortable bed, patio, privacy. Great service with people like Tim Falk, Front Office Manager willing to listen to your questions/ concerns. However this was SPOILT by lunch at Coliseum. I had two poor experiences, poor service and indifferent food. On the second occasion, after waiting some time I was seated on the terrace, suffered a sun burn- my fault but then I didn't expect such a long wait to order food, followed by the wrong order, followed by a long wait for the right order. The location is breathtaking, and we had the opportunity in the evening to dine at Andrea, enjoying the sunset over the ocean- amazing food, terrific waiter and great busboy- spoilt by the

Good: Golf, Concierge service, room, in-room dining.   Mexican people, who work in the hotel, they didn't understand what I would. Breakfast in the room. The food in restaurant should be better than now, good food in the in-room dining. View from room (if you sold the ocean view it means that you must to get front view. I don't want to see the ocean view at the left and watch the parking place in front of my room!). Reception people, they couldn't explain about some expenses.

One of the main draws in staying here is the 2 fantastic golf courses on campus. Turns out, there are much, much more to enjoy.   As you pull up to the registration building, you can almost feel the grandiose atmosphere of the area. Everything looks elegant and marvelous. We were greeted by a warm welcome by the front desk staff. After all said and done, she walked us out to the bellhop and personally requested one of the bell captains to assist us. Really first class treatment of their guest.   The bungalows were quite spacious  and provided us with much needed room for the kids to run around inside.  And it has a nice balcony for outside lounging.    The resort provides a shuttle on request to take you to the different facilities available to the resort guest, which included

Perched on the cliffs overlooking the Pacific Ocean, the Resort at Pelican Hill provides an idyllic setting. The rooms are spacious and tastefully appointed. Sadly, the service at Pelican Hill left much to be desired for a place in this class. Our room wasn't made up until nearly 5 pm most days. Turn down service happened after we were back in our room most evenings. Several times we needed to call to have our tea or waters replenished in our room. Sorry, but I place in the price range should be able to get these things done correctly every time without fail.   Pelican Hill advertises that every bungalow has an oceanfront view. Room 102 has a peekaboo view, so be aware. The website advertised that they provide bags with towels and waters for the beach. When we got to the beach,

Summary Heading: Customer Service and Courtesy Zero, facilities good
Summary: We have stayed here a number of times and it has been a memorable experience every time because of the sheerly awful management and lack of attention to in house services. When we dine here it seems fine. Staying here has been a night mare and we wish either this hotel would sell to Four Seasons, or in the alternative hire people with skillsets in luxury customer service. If you have a problem like ants in your room, like we did several times- don' t bother to call the front desk for help. If there are spiders crawling in your bed and one pos on your foot while watching a movie- don't bother calling front desk. Basically, there is utter lack of any service. If you don't need any assistance then your stay may go fine. Management was unapologetic for spiders and blamed the past

My husband, my 16 month old son, and I stayed at Pelican Hill for three nights last week.  Overall we had a good experience at this hotel, however, we felt it was lacking some of the detail you might expect for the price tag.  First, the good.  We stayed in a one bedroom room which was spacious and comfortable.  We loved the outdoor sitting area and spent a good amount of time in this space.  The bathroom was almost as large as our bedroom and had a beautiful tub which was our son's favorite spot.  We were especially impressed by the staff in the cafe, everyone was so friendly and helpful.  There was also one van driver who went above and beyond and pulled the van over to offer me water as I ran by (I wish I had gotten his name). The entire property was beautiful and we enjoyed

Summary Heading: #2 Resort For Families Spot On; Couples Not So Much
Summary: The Resort at Pelican Hill is surely 5-stars for families. Built by the Forbes Group in 2008, the resort features 150+ villas and 240+ bungalows. There are no traditional hotel rooms. Bungalows are close to the main pool and about 850 sq. ft. We stayed in the South Villas, 4 bedroom and 3500 sq. ft.   The villas are perfect for families. Ours had two beds and baths upstairs, two on the main level plus full kitchen, dining room and family room. Large balcony overlooking the golf course and ocean with lounge chairs and dining table.   Amenities include milk and beer upon arrival, twice-daily service and really good chocolates. Wifi is everywhere and no password needed.   Construction of the villas and resort is amazing. Doors are solid core and very heavy. Every detail has been

Summary Heading: One of the best resorts I have ever stayed at
Summary: I have stayed at some nice places in my lifetime, and the Pelican Resort ranks among the top 3, if not the top 1.  What I liked 1. Spectacular views from everywhere 2. Excellent service 3. Outstanding rooms with excellent amenities 4. They have a charge station for Teslas, and for other electric cars,if you bring your charger, they will charge your car an no extra charge 5. The food at the restaurants was amazing 6. while the hotel is not beach front, the shuttle will take you to a nearby beach, and set up lounges for you   what I did not like.  Admittedly, I am grasping at straws, but here we go 1. The clock in the room is a tiny, unlit clock.  good luck seeing it when you wake up 2.  Not all the TV stations are HD, even the ones that offer HD service

We've just returned from Pelican Hill after a 2 week stay here in a 2 bedroom Villa with our family of 5. After 26hrs of travelling and arriving at 11pm we were immediately welcomed and shown to our Villa by our butler Kevin who helped us with our luggage and 3 sleepy children. When we were shown in we were amazed at the space we had it was much bigger than we expected and looked very cosy, we had very kindly been left a cheese and fruit platter and a bottle of prosseco to welcome us and a pelican hill beach bag with 3 toy pelicans and a baseball cap for the children which was a huge hit. The Villa was lovely and clean all we wanted to do was have a shower and sleep , the beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms were lovely and clean and the bath was more like a swimming pool

This is our second stay at the Pelican Hill Villas. Our last stay was three years ago in a 4 bedroom villa. This time we have a 3 bedroom villas with ocean views. We arrived Thursday late afternoon and will be leaving in the morning. Our last stay was flawless in every respect. This time no so much.  There is no question that the property is world class stunning. Absolutely perfect. What is not perfect this time around is the service. There is a complete lack of service and attention to detail this visit. I hate to be put in the position where I need to pick up the phone and ask for something that should be available.  Each room has a DVD player. The master suite has a Bose system which is useless without the separate remote that it requires. We picked up a bunch of DVD's from a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback. I am troubled to read about your recent Villa experience. I apologize that your recent stay was so disappointing, especially as you enjoyed your previous stay so much. We would like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. Once again, I appreciate you taking the time to communicate your feedback here.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Our family of 4 loves it here.
Summary: for a quick getaway we love it here , the rooms are very clean , and the employees are pretty on it. We come a few times a years and they remember our names when we come back. The kids 6 & 8 they just love the pool and when it's not crowded it truly is a beautiful pool. Kids club is great also and if you want more privacy . This place is our home away from home, Pricey side however you get what you pay for :).

Our family booked an ocean view villa four months in advance of our stay this March. We were disappointed when we checked into the resort to find that we did not have a view of the ocean as requested. We were located in Villa 742 with an obstructed view of the grounds and a view of our neighbors garage. We were relocated the next day, but not without the headache of two days (of our five) in flux. We were disappointed in the level of service and the initial dismissive attitude about our request for an ocean view villa. This is disappointing for a AAA five-diamond rated hotel that promotes a highly personalized luxury experience. We love the resort location and area, but sadly I am not sure that we would return based on the level of service received during our visit.

Summary Heading: A truly special place - that comes with a price tag
Summary: I have the pleasure of staying at nice resorts for business. The Resort at Pelican Hill is definitely in top 5 of places I have stayed. Beautiful accommodations, impeccable grounds, and warm friendly staff. Stayed in a bungalow and it could have fit a small family as a their home. While décor is not the newest/freshest, it is very welcoming and comfortable. Agree with other reviewer, while you have a large and great patio - the views are not amazing by any means - the ocean is in the distance but lots of resort roofs to look over first. I think the views at Terranea are better. Also cost of Pelican Hill is STEEP, and the cars in all the lots show people can afford the room rate. All in all, a beautiful place to be pampered, but at a cost.

From the moment you pass under the Arches you are visually taken to a private world set apart from the busyness of Orange County. It is a favorite spot for locals to escape amid the lush and serene grounds. The service is outstanding. The bungalows are restful and very quiet with pretty views. It was a enjoyable experience and made me not want to leave the property. My only disappointment was with housekeeping. I asked them to clean in the morning and they said they would. I called 4 hours later and they still did not. I then had to call in the early evening agin. It was finally done in their night service. But they did a great job when they finally came.

I have been fortunate to stay in a lot of nice places in the U.S. The Pelican Hill Resort is perhaps the nicest I have seen. The bungalows are fantastic, the golf course is a treat, just an incredible place. And the service is wonderful. Expensive but worth it!

The hotel is lovely, the rooms very comfortable.  The views are nothing to write home about; I could, sort of see the Pacific but as it was a board of directors meeting and I was working, I really did not care.  My suite was a very long walk to the hotel proper and the meeting rooms.  Do not hold your breath waiting for the hotel golfcart.. Further, after waiting three hours for my room to be cleaned I called the Montage to move there when my suite magically appeared.  The food was very good, the conference rooms above average.  This was my second stay but I will take the Montage if I can.

Summary Heading: Really warming up to Pelican Hill
Summary: I have always enjoyed going to Pelican Hill (PH) for dinner but only recently started to enjoy staying here.  This was my second time staying in a villa.  Service was excellent.  The villa was excellent.  I am really starting to warm up to this resort.  To be clear, this is big resort.  Depending on where you stay it could be a long walk to the main building/bar/etc.  The two story villas may have limited views of the ocean.  Some trees do block your view depending on the location.  Regardless, I am really liking the resort.  Be prepared to be a little self sufficient.  Stop and pick up some groceries or, if staying in a villa, have the butler do it for you.  To be sure, a stay at PH is over the top and I am glad that the service has been meeting or exceeding expectations.

my wife and i spent a few nights here as a getaway from the kids even though we live only 20 minutes away.  the property itself is gorgeous and luxurious, almost over the top with italian architecture in your face everywhere.  great location right on the coast with easy access to crystal cove, newport beach, laguna beach.  we stayed in an ocean 'view' bungalow from which unfortunately we weren't able to see much, but i could not find one complaint about the room.  the bed was comfortable and i slept like a baby, everything was clean as a whistle, nespresso coffee pods were included, and even the furniture was built in to have a bose sound system and safe.  bathroom was large and luxurious.  we ate at both the coliseum pool and the pelican grill, and played golf at one of the

Stayed here for first time and stayed in 2 bedroom villa. Please note. All 2 bedroom are in north villa which only give a small small ocean view.  It's very disappointing and wouldn't pay extra.  Also if you sit on your patio it faces a busy road with speeding cars going by and very loud and not relaxing at all.  Our butler is very vague in details doesn't offer info unless asked. Hope the week gets better.
Manager Response: I am disappointed to read about your less-than-perfect experience, and I am following up with our staff to promptly address your concerns. We would also like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. Once again, I appreciate you taking the time to communicate your feedback.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The facility and villas are beautiful and wonderful for a family.  For us, the service was slow and remarkably disappointing.  Perhaps it was Spring Break / Easter weekend issues, but we expected much better service.  The service is well below comparable resorts in the area.  For this reason, we probably won't be back despite loving the property.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit. I apologize that the service you received fell short of your expectations and our goals. I have sent you a private message with the contact information for the Hotel Manager, so we may connect with you directly to discuss your comments in more detail. I appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback, as we strive to improve the overall experience for our guests. Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Bought a very expensive liqueur at the bar and was swiped by the waiter within minutes and the manager Clancy called me a liar and would not replace ! Terrible hotel protocol I was really in shock. A mess , don't expect much in terms of service at this hotel.
Manager Response: Matthew,  I have taken this opportunity to follow up with my team to address the unfortunate experience you encountered. I apologize that your visit was anything less than perfect. In following up on the details you described, it is my understanding that our restaurant manager at Andrea Ristorante was able to replace your beverage. I sincerely thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback with us.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The key to Pelican Hill is the service. From assistant server Jose at Andreas, Room service delivery by Jean, or the helpful girls in the spa gift shop, every member of the staff was well trained and efficient.  Following check in, you follow a staff member to your parking spot by your bungalow. The rooms are spaciously designed and inspired by Andrea Palladeo. I especially enjoyed falling asleep to the flickering fireplace (which turns off automatically after an hour), and the in room nespresso first thing in the morning.
