For families, there are several Bocce ball courts on site, the 136' diameter circular pool, coastal walking trails, and separate programs for kids and teens. The golf course is spectacular. We dined at Andreas, and found everything (scallops, prime rib for

This resort is stunningly beautiful, but I can't imagine how anyone can ever justify staying somewhere that costs so much. We were given a $500 gift card but still ended up having to pay over $300 for the room balance and dinner for one night. The staff is trained to meet your every whim, but the offers to assist us for the simplest things seemed so over the top and completely unnecessary that they seemed like unbridled plays for tips. At one point, unrequested and unannounced, two people showed up to our room to offer us "complimentary" champagne (we don't drink) and strawberries. It was awkward because my husband was in the tub, I was in my pajamas, and they lingered for a tip. The batteries in our TV remote were dead. We had to wait for the engineer to come and replace the
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your candid feedback on our review page. I am disappointed that your stay fell short of the Five-Star standards we aim to deliver to each and every guest. I have shared your experience with our Resort staff, so that we may continue to look for opportunities of improvement. Additionally, I have provided the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. We look forward to the opportunity of speaking with you directly to discuss your feedback further.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at The Resort at Pelican Hill this past week for business and for pleasure.  This resort, by far, was the most spectacular and sophisticated resort we have every stayed in!  We have traveled all over the world for many years and have never experienced a stay that was so perfect in every way!!  Starting out with the front desk upon arrival, greeting us with exuberance and expertise, about the resort!  When you walk into this gorgeous lobby you feel as though you are in a class above all else.  The "spa" music in the background , spa fragrance and soothing colors, and over the top decor, was extremely enticing!!  The ENTIRE staff at this resort greets you by your surname at all times.  You actually feel like royalty!  The bungalow we

hello we are from Armenia, we have been in the United States 5 months ago indescribable impressions and visit you and have extremely beautiful environment, pleasant atmosphere, delicious cuisine and of course the incredible glowing purity. US coming to visit you longer to enjoy the beautiful environment

Summary Heading: June in the spa is wonderful
Summary: Stayed here for a work function and scheduled a massage in the spa. June was amazing. She was excellent at massage, but she was also so nice and accommodating and friendly and lovely and warm. Just an awesome experience.

Summary Heading: Our Favorite Resort in the United States
Summary: The resort exemplifies 5 star accommodations, service, and food. We found ourselves surrounded by friendly and professional staff, gorgeous Italian architecture, manicured landscapes, and ocean views.  This resort is absolutely phenomenal across the board. Gavin and Nichole with the concierge desk crafted a personalized trip for us that included boating, oceanfront hiking, whale watching, fine dining, riding electric bicycles through Corona Del Mar, and of course relaxing by the beautiful pool. The rooms are enormous and boast tall wood-beamed ceilings, fireplaces, and sunny patios. Whenever we asked for anything from the front desk, it was handled it immediately. Every small detail was perfect, from the superb quality of the coffee to the pristine condition of the landscaping.

This place is breathtaking.  The room had a patio with a spectacular ocean view.  The bathroom was far bigger than the apartment I lived in while in grad school and the grounds are just stunning.  A walk along the hotel balcony gives multiple ocean vistas broken by beautiful golf course scenes. The only issue for me was the service.  Most of the people were professional, friendly and highly skilled.  But maybe it was off-season thing, but a lot of the people just weren't very well trained.  I ran out of coffee pods for my coffee maker (I know - what an incomprehensible problem) and it took two days and five calls to get more.  Silly complaint, except for $490 a night, coffee ought to pour from any place I wanted it. The restaurant over the pool was similar - two great service

You'd be hard pressed to find anything "wrong" here as it is a world class resort.  The resort is perched on the hillside overlooking the ocean.  I had an amazing bungalow done in the finest finishes; luxury linens, gorgeous soaking tub, living room area and a fantastic patio overlooking the ocean.  Yes, it's a large resort and quite spread out, but i never waited more than three minutes for a car or shuttle to come round to take me to my destination.  We had dinner one evening at the Pelican Grill and the salmon dish was fantastic!  Excellent wine selection- I have no idea as to cost as it was a work function however.    Our lunches were served oceanside on the patio- simply cannot beat the beauty of this resort.   The pool was amazing (huge) and service was top notch.  We will

My wife and I and our 3 kids had a week to spend in LA area for a wedding taking place in Newport Beach at the end of the week.  We decided we would spend 5 nights in LA since we had never been there.  We were far from impressed with the service at Beverly Willshire and after spending the last 2 days of our trip at Pelican Hills, we had wished we spend the whole week.  The accomodations and amenities were outstanding.  It was ideal for families with child and teen areas.  The pool was fantastic.  Most importantly the service was in our top 10.  I cant say enough good things about Pelican Hill.  I only wish i had a chance to play the golf course.

This is a great resort with all of the amenities.  I stayed in one of the villas while there, and it was amazing.  All of the furnishings are high quality and it is incredibly spacious.  If you like coffee, they supply the room with the Nespresso machine which i think makes the best coffee from capsules.  It is a bit of a long walk to the restaurant from the villa, however you can call for a ride and they will bring you over.  The driver was usually very quick to show up.    Highly recommend it, especially if you are a golfer.

The Resort at Pelican HIll was amazing!  We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2.5 bath villa with an ocean view over valentine's weekend 2016.  The villa's view was spectacular and we watched the sunset every night. The villa was nicely appointed, and even came with a few starter groceries, which was a nice touch.  The beds were comfortable and it was very quiet.  Plus, the villas offer butler service to drive you between resort location, etc.  The food at Pelican Hill really impressed us, especially The Pelican Grill.  We ordered room service for breakfast everyday and it was always delicious, hot, and on-time.  The kids enjoyed some time away from us (we were annoying them!) at Camp Pelican.  They loved the counselors and the space and having their own pool.  Speaking of pools, both the

For various reasons, I have stayed at some of the nicest resorts along the OC coast:  Hyatt Regency Huntington Beach, Montage in Laguna Beach, St. Regis in Monarch Beach, and the Ritz Carlton in Laguna Niguel.  However, I have not had the pleasure of staying at the Resort at Pelican Hill in Newport Coast (reportedly the Top Resort amongst them all) until recently.  First of all, the service from top to bottom was top notch.  From the moment we were greeted, to the moment we left, the staff was friendly and professional.  However, a special shout goes to Guest Experience Concierge, Rachel Ugay.  Before we arrived I let her know we were celebrating a special birthday.  Upon arrival, we were given a complimentary bottle of Prosecco, and our reservations at the spa and Andrea were

Thanks for ruining my father's birthday and overwhelming us with the complete disaster of an experience from start to finish. Booked my parents an ocean view bungalow as a birthday gift for my dad. We tried to check them in at 2:30pm (no room available) so  decided to kill time in Coliseum having lunch. We experienced a host of problems such as cold food, missing items and slow service. We all ate at different times. Wandered back to the lobby inquiring about room keys (they promised to call as soon as room ready so my folks could change for pool) and they magically produced the keys sitting there when we came back ... Uh, wait. The keys were ready and we never received a call letting us know? Got to the room and found the carpet wet around the coffee table and side of bed. Also
Manager Response: I sincerely appreciate the time you have kindly taken to post your candid feedback on our TripAdvisor and Yelp pages. I apologize that your stay and dining experience were anything less than perfect, especially as your family was celebrating a special occasion. Please know that I am personally addressing your concerns with our managers. Thank you again for sharing your comments with us.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Will be Dreaming of Our return
Summary: We stayed in the North Villas which were perched high on the hill.  Each villa is beautifully designed and equipped with everything you will need although we did not cook.  The resort is gorgeous and is in a fabulous location near Crystal Cove beach. Hence the five star rating.  The staff really tries to make sure you are enjoying your stay but falls short time to time.  Must be a training issue.  The spa was beautiful and not crowded.  Food at the restaurants and room service was very good and large portioned.   I cannot wait to return and possibly play the impeccably maintained golf course which looked stunning.

During a drive along the coast from San Diego to San Francisco.....we had heard about this place and were told to stop in to use their pool. Are we ever glad we did!!! This was, by far, the highlight of our trip!! With the gorgeous landscape of the golf course behind you, and this GIGANTIC round pool in front of you, I can't think of a better word than heaven to describe it! We felt pampered and well taken care of, and our bartender was always quick on her feet to make sure our drinks were never empty. I will never forget the few hours spent at this amazing hidden gem and most definitely have plans to return!!!!

We've recently returned from a 9 night stay at the Pelican Resort with our two daughters aged 3 and 4. We had a wonderful time, such a beautiful resort. Unlike many resorts of this standard Pelican was really family friendly.  The staff were so welcoming and made every effort to make sure our children felt at home. All the restaurants had a children's menu whatever the time. We went for dinner one evening in the Pelican Grill on the golf course at 8pm and again the kids were offered their own menu.  By the time we were leaving the staff were welcoming us by our names which is always a sign of good staff who care. We'll definitely be be back next year.

Every year our family makes it a point to get together around the holidays. This year we decided on the West Coast. Coming from all parts of the country it was a very pleasant surprise when we arrived at this property to have the feeling of being at home. The entire experience was amazing. The staff made you feel like a guest in their own home. We will definitely make The Villas at pelican Hill our new home away from home.

Great location, very attentive staff. We had an oceanview bungalow and the views were truly fantastic. The resort is huge but there is a shuttle/car/cart that will pick you up and drop you off wherever and whenever needed. Walking distance to the Crystal Cove beach (20 minute walk). We are definitely going back.

Summary Heading: Pretty good for a business meeting
Summary: I attended a business event at this resort. The resort is absolutely beautiful! So the views were amazing from the conference room. The food was really good for a banquet menu at a hotel. I went to the bar after to wait for traffic to ease up before driving home and the bartenders were very nice and attentive. Definitely a great place for a conference.

Spent three nights and didn't want to leave, this sets the bar high for the rest of the trip. The check in was smooth, had booked a bungalow. Large room, very large bathroom. It had a balcony but didn't take advantage of it. It was a partial sea view, check this if you are looking specifically for this, there are better views to be had. The service throughout the resort was generally good. The Colleseum pool looks great, had dinner there one night, was bit slow getting our food. The coffee shop has great views, the coffee and food are good. Prices are what you would expect in a 5 star resort. The spa is very good, great facilities, very clean. Took a few yoga classes, Cara, who seems to take most of the classes was excellent. Maria at the concierge desk was also very good. Wifi
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your kind thoughts and photos on our review page. I pleased to read that you enjoyed your visit to the Resort.  We certainly hope to welcome you back again soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Wife and I stayed 4 nights in a beautiful and well maintained bungalow.  Staff was friendly and bedding plus amenities as you would expect.  ONLY problems had to do with doors and keys (had to switch room because of inability of staff to fix lock), unable to get front desk to answer phones (literally took 5 tries to get someone to answer….had this problem MULTIPLE times) and housekeeping that was NOT on their toes (failure to replace wash towels or toilet paper each and every day).  Shuttle schedule to beach was not printed and seemed to fluctuate by the hour and person asked.  These are easy issues for some new manager to fix.

My husband and I just celebrated a special birthday at the spectacular Resort at Pelican Hill!  As frequent travelers and loyal clients of the Four Seasons, St. Regis and Peninsula brands, we must say we have not yet experienced the level of service and meticulous touches that we found at the Resort at Pelican Hill. We have already recommended this jewel to several friends and family, and will surely return ourselves! Having married in Rome several years ago, and traveled throughout Italy (Tuscany, Amalfi Coast, Venice, Florence), we found the beautiful Resort at Pelican Hill to be "the finest of Italian aesthetics and hospitality in California"!   In addition, your welcome and special birthday touches made our stay extra special, and Ristorante Andrea was just magnificent. We

If I were to imagine what paradise was, this would be the place that pops into mind. Hands down the most beatiful and prestige resort I ever been to in my life. You have to experience it to understand. Breath taking views, and amazing villas. I stayed in Villa room # 737. The view from this place looks like a scene from a movie. The customer service exceeded my expectations. Especially the reservations department. I booked with a nice lady named Arielle Dagenais who was so nice, understanding of all my personal needs, helpful and comforting. Ask for her when you call she will go out of her way to make sure you have the best stay (she pays attention to the small details that goes a long way).

I just returned from an absolutely perfect weekend at Pelican Hill.  We had a family reunion to celebrate my dad's 80th birthday, and the resort went the extra mile (miles!) to make it a weekend we will never forget.  My dad, who loves to be pampered, was all smiles the entire weekend. We all were! We stayed in two villas - a 4 bedroom and a 3-bedroom.  They were spacious, gorgeous, and with stunning views of the pacific ocean.  The resort made sure we had everything we needed at all times, and made arrangements for everyone in our crowd to golf, enjoy a multitude of spa experiences (I had the most relaxing massage of my life from Christine), and point out the most scenic hikes.  The highlight of our weekend was the amazing cuisine.  The first night we, we had dinner at Andrea

My wife and I spent 2 nights at the Inn at Pelican Hill in August, 2015.  We had a mixed stay – some things were great, some good, and others just awful.  Because of this, I’m reluctant to unqualifiedly recommend the hotel.  Let me explain.  First, the physical surroundings:  We stayed in a Bungalow Guest Room, which I believe to be the “basic” level of lodging at Pelican Hill.  On the plus side, the room was extremely spacious, and amply furnished.  There was lots of comfortable seating (couch and easy chair) in the room.  The bed also was comfortable, and the linens of the highest quality.  We had an outdoor “view” terrace, from which partial views of the ocean could be enjoyed. The terrace had both chaise lounges and a pair of chairs with a table.  The hotel provided a coffee
Manager Response: Thank you for graciously taking the time to share your feedback with us. I am deeply disappointed to read that your stay was anything less than perfect. I understand your concerns with regards to the lighting condition of your room and the service you received around the Resort. Please know that I have personally addressed your feedback with managers in each of the areas you mentioned. I believe that we have an opportunity to do better in the future, and we will use your candid feedback to heighten the overall guest experience. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Like Tuscany, with a shorter flight
Summary: My husband and I nipped away to Newport Beach to the Pelican Hill Resort. It's a stunning place with a gorgeous outdoor pool (The Coliseum). The concierge Madison was INCREDIBLE and set us up at amazing places to eat on and off property. Our villa (221) was beautiful, with a private patio overlooking the ocean. We enjoyed the spa there on a daily basis as well as the golf (The South Course was just OK, but that was mostly due to the rain and the intimidating carries at many of the holes and no marshall to keep things moving along). Brunch at the resort was fantastic.

If this were a moderately priced resort, I'd be okay with it. But it is not. And you do not get what you pay for here.   We came up from San Diego to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday. We chose Pelican Hill because we heard good things about it and we also have a 5-yr-old and knew that it had a kids' club which would allow us to have time with just the two of us. I let the concierge and staff know the reason for the visit and requested some accommodations like champagne and chocolates and a small birthday cake for our dinner at Andrea. They said no problem. We told them we had a 5-yr-old traveling with us, and they promised to leave him a stuffed animal of a Pelican in our room. We also paid extra for an ocean view room.   Got to the room, no champagne. No stuffed animal,
Manager Response: Mary,   Thank you for graciously taking the time to share your candid feedback on our review pages. While I am pleased to read that your son enjoyed his experience at Camp Pelican, I am troubled to know that we did not deliver a positive experience for you and your family, particularly as you were celebrating your husband’s milestone birthday.   I have personally followed up with the management of each area to discuss the detailed comments you kindly noted here. Additionally, I have sent you a private message with the contact information for the Hotel Manager, so we may connect with you directly to follow up. I sincerely apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect.     Kind regards,     Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We rented the 4 bedroom Villa. Our first time staying at the resort. Although we only live 20 minutes away this was the perfect spot to entertaining 16 of our closest friends and family for my wifes 50th. The resort handled everything as requested and the property is amazing. The views cant be beat even though we had some drizzle on Saturday.  Most all the guest loved the idea of the party at the resort. They mentioned doing the same thing. Al in all a agreat time was had by all. The service , food, location not to mention the Villa was all amazing. We plan on coming back when we can.

Summary Heading: My favorite resort in the US!
Summary: Its absolutely heaven on earth with the most wonderful service and spectacular views, food and rooms! One of the best experiences of my life! We went for my 21st birthday and every detail of the trip turned out amazingly! Rooms were wonderful and the staff was so nice and helped us plan some exciting adventures like disneyland and kayaking its the best!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your kind comments and photos on our review page. I am delighted to read that your stay was exceptional, particularly as you were celebrating your birthday. We certainly look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: One of the nicest resorts we have ever stayed in!  The bungalows are beautiful, elegant, and so comfortable.  My favorite thing to do is turn on the fire, read in bed and just cozy up!  The views of the ocean are terrific!  The spa is THE nicest one I have ever been to!  The restaurants are all fabulous and the service is top notch.  I look forward to staying here every year!

Summary Heading: Very good hotel for the US
Summary: It's a great holiday resort if you are coming as a couple or family.  The room was nice, large, comfortable and cosy, so was the bathroom.  The restaurants are good and the golf course is amazing.  I was expecting a bit more peace and calm at the pool side but it was way too crowded and noisy, not at all what i expected. I was also disappointed by the spa treatments which weren't up to par with what i expect from a 5 star hotel. The gym facilities are good otherwise...

Although we live within a half hour of Pelican Resort, we come here for special occasions with family.  It is a 5-Diamond resort.  Everything is first class.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Accommodations are immaculate, comfy, and spacious.  All have fabulous views.  Their large circular pool is one of the largest of it's kind, really special.  Their cabanas are wonderful!!  If you are in a villa, they assign you a butler and a driver to take you where ever you need to go within a short distance of the resort.  In the past the driver had a "Bentley".  This time we were disappointed to see that our ride was in the property "shared" van.  The "Butler" really is just glorified housekeeping, although they will do pretty much whatever you want/need.  You don't see him unless

Summary Heading: Return visit just as magical as the first visit!
Summary: I just had to give another compliment to the Resort at Pelican Hill as one of the top hotels I have ever visited. If you are planning on a special event this would be the hotel if you are in the OC. The pool is outstanding and the view is amazing. The beds are extremely comfortable and the bathrooms are beautiful. If you want to do some exercise you have a great gym on site and if you want to take a short drive down the street you can run along the beach. If you are looking for atmosphere when you want to indulge in an adult beverage then go to the bar near the golf course. Way to go Pelican Hill.

Perhaps one of the nicest places I have ever stayed, this hotel is set on manicured and lushly landscaped grounds. Some rooms have ocean views.  Rooms are immaculate and anything you might need is tended to by the amazing staff.

Summary Heading: The Gold Standard for Special Occasion Celebrations
Summary: Celebrated our 12 year wedding anniversary at Pelican Hill resort this past weekend in an ocean view bungalow.  The experience was fantastic from start to end, the only sad part was leaving.  The resort has a simple, understated elegance and the service is impeccable.  Everyone we encountered at the resort from registration, waitstaff at the restaurants and housekeeping was gracious without being pretentious.  I found this to be most impressive, as many hotels of this class take themselves too seriously and often fail to take the time to honor their patrons the way Pelican Hill does.    The resort during this time of the year (January) is very peaceful and quiet.  The hotel has a lovely Tuscan meets Southern California design making it classy yet casual.  There are plenty of

Summary Heading: Beautiful property but needs service to match
Summary: In a nutshell, the property is beautiful—5 star, Four Seasons-like, large and well-appointed rooms (loved the fireplace and used it daily!).  The service—not so much.  It was spotty and not befitting the level of resort.  Some staff was terrific, but it was hit or miss and not consistent. Mark Anthony who escorted us to the bungalow was outstanding.  Kudos to him. Service in the Coliseum Grill on Christmas Day was very, very slow, and not unexpected due to how busy it was in the resort that day.  However, the same experience happened at breakfast the next 2 days (we walked out one of the days).  It was better the 5th day after we said something to management. It was slow to be seated, slow to be greeted, slow to be waited on (even for coffee and water), slow to take food orders,
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Pelican Hill for your recent holiday stay. I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect. Please know that I have personally followed up on your concerns with the managers from housekeeping and restaurant service. Additionally, I have sent you a private message with the contact information for the Hotel Manager, so we may connect with you directly. I appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback, so that we may improve upon the unfortunate shortfalls detailed in your review.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: At the height of summer with an almost full-term pregnant wife we headed down the road to a 'local' luxury hotel, a hotel which we have driven past hundreds of times. You hear about this place being top notch with a great golf course (I can't comment on that since I don't play the beautiful game).   It was actually my wife who surprised me for this stay and boy am I glad she shelled out the cash for a bungalow. I didn't know much about this hotel other than it's prestigious name. When I walked into our bungalow I was taken aback by the rooms. Super high ceilings, a fireplace, large seating area wonderful bed but perhaps the most fun thing about this room was the 'walk-through' link between bedroom and bathroom. The lovely bathtub sits in a very large bathroom next to a wall

We spent three nights in a villa at the Resort at Pelican Hill recently and had a mixed experience. We were upgraded to a top-floor villa on request, which was much appreciated. The villa itself was large, comfortable, and extremely quiet. The view was stunning. We appreciated having a full-kitchen (although the rules about what was complimentary and what wasn’t was a bit unclear - do they really charge for individual coffee pods)? Huge bathtubs, and we loved the beds and sheets. We must have been lucky in that our villa was ready at 3:30pm instead of 5:00 pm or later, as others have reported.  We ate a number of meals at the resort: two room service breakfasts, one lunch at the Coliseum Grill, and two dinners at Piccolo, the villas-only dining option. We thought the quality of
Manager Response: Thank you for selecting the Villas as your home away from home for your recent stay with us. I am disappointed to read that your service experience fell short of your expectations and certainly our goals. As your valuable insights help us heighten the overall experience, I am personally addressing your concerns with our managers in the Villas and other areas you mentioned. Additionally, I have sent you a private message with the contact information for the Hotel Manager, so we may connect with you directly to follow up. I sincerely thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: My husband and I have been in Palm Springs for 2 weeks getting ready for the start of the 2016 PGA Tour season as he is a professional golfer. We decided to take an overnight trip to the beach for the night to get away. We were deciding between the Ritz, Pelican Hill or Montage. Friends have raved about Pelican Hill so we booked a King Garden View room on their website and jumped in the car.  My husband and I got married two years ago at The Cloister in Sea Island, Georgia and travel about 35 weeks a year. The Lodge at Pebble Beach, The Little Nell in Aspen, The Breakers in Palm Beach, Rosewood Mayakoba are some of our favorite resorts. I fully  expected to add Pelican Hill to that list.   Upon checking in we were informed that they do not have any king beds left and we would
Manager Response: Tia,   I sincerely appreciate the time you have kindly taken to post your candid feedback. I apologize that your stay and dining experience were anything less than perfect. Please know that I am personally addressing your concerns with our managers. Additionally, I have sent you a private message with the contact information for the Hotel Manager, so we may connect with you directly. Thank you again for sharing your comments with us.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: High Prices don't Reflect Service and Lack of Attention to Detail
Summary: For the promise of luxury with butler service, I would expect better attention to detail.  Our dinner in the Colleseum restaurant was terrible.  My grouper special consisted fo about 2 ounces of fish. My colleague's "fresh" salmon was still frozen on the inside.  The bread was stale, hard and inedible and the service was slow.  The manager replaced our fish entrees but I would expect more from a 5 star resort in one of the wealthiest zip codes in the US. We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa and had a major water leak that flooded one bathroom and soaked the wallpaper right off the walls.  The villa kitchen was sparsely appointed.  I had to try 3 separate treadmills before I found one that worked.  And when I called for room service at 5:30 am, I couldn't get anyone to answer the
Manager Response: Karen,  Thank you for taking the time to post your candid feedback. I apologize that your Villa stay and dining experience were a disappointment. As we continuously work to perfect the guest experience, I am following up to address each of your concerns with our management team. I have also sent you a private message with the contact information for the Hotel Manager, so we may connect with you directly. Thank you again for sharing your comments with us.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: If you are looking for a first class retreat for awe inspiring golf and amazing spa services, check into Pelican Hill.  From the moment we arrived we enjoyed friendly and attentive staff and spectacular ocean views. The resort is well maintained with beautiful common areas and well appointed guest rooms.  We were lucky to be upgraded to a luxurious ocean facing, 3 bedroom villa in the South Villas. Not only did we have the ocean view but overlooked long fairways. We were close to the villa clubhouse so enjoyed the heated pool there which is a bit more private than the larger coliseum pool. We ate at the casual Coliseum dining room for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The service was great and the food delicious at all meals. We also dined at Andrea, the more formal dining option.

I loved it.I felt as if I am at home.The villas are wonderful,comfortable and have a huge space for everything.The location of the resort is on the ocean and in the hill at the same time.I enjoyed the weather there and the green area of the golf course and the gardens.

Summary Heading: Beautiful view but average service at best
Summary: Rented a three bed room villa and spend 5 days around christmas at the Resort. To start with the positive the views were breath taking. The Villas are separate from the actual resort so you have to either drive, get a ride, or walk around 10 minutes to get to the Hotel and the Lobby. As a result we pretty used the hotel facilities only minimally. Think of the Villas as a glorified Air BnB. The villas have to large bed rooms and a 3 bedroom is quite small and does not have an ensuite bathroom. As far as the butler service. We saw him when we checked in. He was never seen again. The maid service was also surprising poor when you compare it to either equivalently priced hotels and resorts like Four Seasons. The location was not far from anything but not close to anything either

we live in LA, so its very convenient for us to just hop on the freeway and go for the weekend. love the property. spacious rooms with great views. the staff is very nice. my mom left her expensive watch by the pool and realized she forgotten it on our way back to LA. we called panicking and of course, they found it and held on to it for us until we made a U-turn and got back. they were so honest and nice. great times.

Premium priced, but good  value for money..  Good restaurants at decent price. Lovely rooms.  Beautiful setting.  Pool staff could have been a bit better and faster with service, but on whole we really liked this place.

A group of friends picked Pelican Hill for an informal business school reunion.  Most of us had never been to PH before.  Its fair to say that we were all pretty blown away.   Its hard to know where to begin in writing a review.    Everything is first class.  The service is friendly and efficient.  I got upgraded to a "room" that was the size of a house.  Our group had a great dinner at the restaurant at the golf club and we used the pool and workout facilities throughout the weekend.    The individuals in our group have collectively traveled to a lot of places and stayed at a lot of luxury hotels and resorts but we all agreed that PH was something truly unique and special.  If you haven't tried it and plan to be in the area I definitely suggest adding a few days and

Our stay at The Resort at Pelican Hill was near perfection! The service was amazing, the rooms were amazing, the pool was amazing; need I say more?! We will definitely return and the sooner the better! If I had to say there is one downside, it is that the hotel is not directly located on the beach. However, it was not a big deal at all to take the shuttle to the beach and they have some great tide pools to explore as well. There is great shopping nearby at Fashion Island and many excellent restaurants to choose from in that area as well.

Summary Heading: Conde Naste voted it "Best Resort in America"......and it is well deserved.
Summary: They say Conde Naste voted it "Best Resort in America"......and after one stay I don't doubt that for one second.   What a place. What a resort. The service and food, bar and options are all exceptional, and so are the facilities.  We got a two room, two patio ocean view suite (thanks again Griffin) and couldn't believe it. The bathroom is spectacular, the features, fireplace, guest bath, vaulted ceilings, bar area, lounge area, dining area, super high end finishings and the furnishings just perfectly tasteful, modern yet comfortable.  I really, really enjoyed my stay. It was worth every penny.

My husband and I stayed here over the Thanksgiving holiday week. We loved everything about it. The grounds are gorgeous. The 360 degree round pool is beautiful and a lovely place to eat breakfast. They call it the Colosseum and it is does remind you of it. The rooms are large and overlook Tuscan like vistas that lead to the ocean. Each room has a private outdoor patio and a fireplace and a big screen TV. The lobby is spacious and comfortable and there are outdoor balconies to overlook the golf course and the ocean. The Christmas decorations were up and they were tasteful and ornate with a fun 10 foot gingerbread tree with trains that went around the gingerbread itself. The food was very good and the service was impeccable. We will definitely return here!

This property was beautiful.  Amazing views no matter where you were standing (of the ocean, of the gardens, of the golf course, etc).  I love the more private feel of the "bungalows", which also had a wonderful view looking down into a little valley from the back (glass-surrounded) patio.  High-end details in the rooms (plush slippers, Nespresso machine).  I was there while it was decorated for Christmas, the lobby looked lovely and festive.  The Pool restaurant was great during lunch, dining outdoors in the sunshine. I was there for business, so all our catered meals were high quality and tasty.  This was a wonderful location!  I stayed at a Ritz the very next week and was consistently disappointed because it didn't compare to Pelican Hill.

This is about our 15th stay at Pelican Hill and they just never can seem to get the service right. We keep going for the absolutely world-class location and beautiful facilities, but they just cannot execute at the level of what should be a Four Seasons quality property. I know the owner of Pelican Hill would be personally disappointed with the level of service, but they either aren't training right or managing right. We consistently have long wait times for room service both on the phone (the recording says "personal dining assistant"--really?) and for our food. This time our first night dinner arrived with everything terribly over cooked and tasteless. The quality of room service breakfast is consistently exceptional however.   We stayed in a four bedroom villa and they have a
Manager Response: Mr. Marino,  I am disappointed to read that your visits with us have fallen short of your expectations and our goals. I sincerely appreciate you bringing these concerns to our attention, so that we may promptly address the service and facilities that require improvements. I apologize for any inconvenience you and your family experienced. In the future, we hope to welcome you back for a much better experience.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Awesome view , we stayed at the coffee shop watching the sunset over the pacific. The scenery is amazing. The coffee shop is self served. Go grab a coffee from the cafe and watch the view We went a stroll in the golf area and it is gold!

Bring your own light bulbs otherwise you'll go blind in the rooms, yes the lighting is horrific. The resort is enormous so be prepared. When reservations yells you ever thing is conveniently located....forget it. The restaurants are average. The staff a bit callous. Clean rooms, certainly big enough. But there us something missing and I think their to spread out to be guest friendly. Also caution the 5pm check in. Which is ridiculous. People waiting for their rooms sleeping in the lobby!  Very sad. Not sure if management is awake on this one, perhaps they sleep in the lobby also.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your candid feedback from your recent stay with us. I regret that your experience was disappointing and have taken this opportunity to follow up on your concerns. I appreciate you taking the time to post your comments here. We hope to welcome you back in the future for a much-improved experience.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This is a world class 5 star hotel that delivers a superior guest experience. All aspects of this property are top class. Staff is helpful,caring and polite. Staff is obviously extremely well trained and always attentive to the needs of their guests. The dinning options on the property are simply fantastic. The golf courses are excellent and a must play for any serious golfer. This property has it all and any patron will be satisfied. It is that good. Be sure to get a room with an ocean view.  Don't forget to eat at Pelican Hill as the food is terrific and the restaurants have jaw dropping views.  A walk along the beach is a must.

Staying in Room 439, Came to check-in after a 16 hr flight from Dubai and i was shocked to see only one staff at reception, waited my turn for sometime, until a second staff arrived to help, her name was Pannega, extremely un-accommodating, took time in processing my check-in while my family waited in the car. Being a Platinum Hilton member, Gold Jumeirah Group member and Gold Four Seasons Member, i'm so surprised how hotels would employ such staff that would damage there brand. Felt the need to inform others that plan to stay at this resort...
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to share your candid feedback here. I apologize that your check-in experience was less than perfect. Please know that I have personally followed up to address your concerns with our front desk management. I have also sent you a private message with the contact information for the Hotel Manager, so we may connect with you directly.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: When our daughter had her fall break in October, at the last minute we decided to plan a trip to Newport Beach.  We live in Reno, NV and was a bit cold.  In search of warmer weather and the beach, I found this wonderful place I call paradise.  I don't have to write much to say what a wonderful place The Resort at Pelican Hill is.  From the staff to grounds to the villas and the flowers, all is beautiful!! I recommend this place in a heart beat.  We will be back!!!

Summary Heading: Valentine Celebration at one of the gorgeous suite at Pelican Hill Resort
Summary: We love the Pelican Hill Resort's suite. Spacious, elegant, great interior design, Tuscany style. We were here to celebrate our Valentine and we had an amazing experience. We ordered in room service for our Valentine dinner and the food was amazing. Attached in my review are some of the pictures we took inside the suite.   The staff is friendly and helpful. The view is amazing. Love everything about Pelican Hill Resort!

Summary Heading: The best kept secret in Newport Beach
Summary: Every restaurant in Pelican Hill Resort is superb. Excellent food, great ambience, prices reasonable. Great service too. The setting is exquisite as the view is of the rolling golf course and the Pacific Ocean.

This is the place if you are in or around Los Angeles. Absolutely stunning views and the service here is as Five Star as Five Star gets. From the moment you arrive you realize you are in for a real treat. These days there are not a lot of true Five Star locations around. This just happens to be one of those special places.

I gave this resort a 5 rating, however, honestly it deserves a 10. Setting is just lovely, grounds well manicured, with olive trees just like Tuscany! Accommodations are luxurious - well thoughtout, spacious (villa style vs. high rise). Fireplace with a glass of vino, while looking out at the ocean and sunset...hmmm. Morning coffee on the patio (room well equipped with coffee service).Huge patio with comfy furniture (table, chairs, umbrella,2 loungers). The staff is friendly and professional. Lunch at coliseum grill (fish tacos) was a good choice - food was good & setting/view wonderful. Dinner at Andrea was excellent - wine list is great, pasta dishes & eggplant Parmesan just as we had in Italy. Service attentive and spot on. Next time in Newport, definitely Pelican Hill.

For starters, this weekend trip was booked a day before arrival so we weren't surprised at the rates we paid. We were lucky enough that The Resort at Pelican Hill was available under the American Express Fine Resorts and Hotels program. The benefits we received included: -early check in and late 4pm check out -room upgrade (upon availability at time of check in) -$100 spa credit -$60 breakfast credit daily during stay  On the plus side, we did in fact receive an upgrade from a standard Ocean View King to an Ocean View Suite, which was great. However, the early check in was not accommodated at all. We arrived around 1 pm and didn't receive our keys until 3:15pm, a mere 45 minutes before regular check in time. Had we known they would not offer an early check in as stated, we

Love, Love this place. We just spend some nights at the villa. The villas are beautiful and Spacious. The bed are super comfy, the fireplace is nice and romantic as well. The style Italian… a dream the views of the Pacific Ocean and the Golf from our villa were spectacular. What a treat Prosecco and Cheese on Arrival with a sweet note card from the Manager Nicolay T.   The complimentary valet service from your villa to the various areas of the sprawling property is a huge bonus. A special mention to ISMAEL , the Butler… first class service, you are lucky to have this type of employee in your property.   The hotel has a wonderful walking trail down to the beach as well as around the Pelican Hill area.   Andrea was absolutely Amazing..!!! The dining room is lovely. The server was

Summary Heading: Treated as if we were family.
Summary: My wife and I are locals, and we stayed here while they were doing some plumbing work in our house and would be without water for two days.  We often come here for dinner, the spa, or just to hang out.  This time we booked directly through the resort, and booked a 2 Bedroom Ocean View Villa in the North Villas.  Room 608.  The two bedroom villa included one garage parking spot.    I asked to check in around noon and to have a crib set up already, as my son takes a nap in the afternoon.  I drove to the villa reception (different check in than the main desk) and was told they were turning over the room, and it may be ready by two.  So my family decided to go to Fashion Island for lunch.  Finished lunch and came back, and the room was all ready.    Luis was our butler and waited

Summary Heading: No hotel better in the USA!!
Summary: Great architecture and layout plus excellent interior design.  The service is excellent along with the food.  The extensive property is gorgeous overlooking the ocean.  I cannot overstate how deluxe this property is.  Plus a killer golf course!

Summary Heading: Among the most beautiful resorts I've stayed at
Summary: It would be very difficult for me to find fault with my experience here. I loved everything about it.  The resort is very near to the PCH in Orange County. It has convenient access to Disneyland, Newport shopping and harbor. The entrance to the resort property is extremely imposing. As is the foyer and most of the Italian architecture.  The bungalow we were in was very pleasant: warm, comfortable and old-fashioned, with a charming fireplace. It also had one of the largest bathrooms I've ever seen in a hotel. We had a beautiful view of the golf course and the ocean behind it from our room.  The staff and service is excellent. From the fleet of GL's that take you around the resort, to being attentive and prompt, the staff took great care of us. We met the general manager during

My husband and I stayed here in August, 2015 and had a fantastic 5 night stay.  The property is located on a hill across the PCH from Crystal Cove State Park (which is absolutely gorgeous).  We pulled up and were immediately amazed by the grandeur and perfectly manicured landscape of the property.  Check in was easy and we were brought to our room.  We booked an ocean front view room, but noticed our room faced the golf course and you could only see the water if you looked left.  We called the front desk and they promptly moved us to a new comparable room that had better views.  Parking was right outside our villa which was super convenient.  We ate breakfast each morning at the Coliseum Dining Room.  Food is good, but a little overpriced and service was slow.  One tip is to

Summary Heading: An outstanding resort with awesome restaurants
Summary: The real estate here is remarkable, and the landscaping is well done.  The bungalow style rooms are very nicely done and very quiet.  I particularly like being able to park within a very short distance from the rooms.  The pool are is amazing and the restaurants are incredible.  Overall, this is a great resort.   Went there on business, and was a little disappointed that the big screen monitor didn't work.  However, the service was very good and the attendants were very attentive.

We were not planning on writing a third review of this hotel; after all, two glowing reviews about one of our favorite spots should be enough.  However, a few minor points came up on this our seventh visit, that although more personal to our own needs and tastes, we thought they were worth mentioning.     The hotel no longer offers hard copies of newspapers, delivered to your room or otherwise.  The only place to find one is in the hotel gift shop where you can purchase the paper of your choice once it opens.  This shop could be quite a distance from your room.    The hotel does offer newspapers digitally, but I am sure I am not the only guest that enjoys reading an actual paper.  At the very least, the hotel should place some complimentary newspapers around the resort such as

Book this place, pronto! So amazing. We had a beautiful 2br villa with an amazing view. Pools, grounds are beautiful.Food is great. Staff is extremely helpful. Wonderful trip. They will also help you book excursions, things to do.

I'm a pretty well-seasoned traveler, and not overly picky. I'm okay with paying for quality, and appreciate it when I see it. Items like chipped tile or baseboard probably won't bother me.  I'd heard great things about Pelican Hill and was greatly looking forward to my stay there. Another couple agreed to meet us at the resort for a relaxing five days. We stayed in the bungalows, which is the hotel portion of the property. The villas are designed for a longer term stay. All of us came to the same conclusions and they were the following:  Positives: --Beautiful, large pool with incredible views. --Excellent poolside service. Really, I was so impressed! --HUGE rooms. Very quiet. Great layout. Love the fireplace and the bathroom double vanity. Also the Euro glass shower doors.
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid feedback. I am deeply disappointed to read about the less-than-perfect experience you encountered during your stay. Please know that I am personally addressing your concerns with our staff, especially those related to housekeeping and in-room dining. We would also like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. Once again, I appreciate you taking the time to communicate your feedback here.   Kind regards,    Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This place is amazing, where do I start. Went there to play both North and South Ocean Courses arrived at 9am was not even expecting to be checked in, was only going to leave bags at front desk and hit the links. They not only checked us in at 9am but they upgraded us to a Villa,the room was unbelievable ,full gourmet kitchen ,complimentary 6 pack of import beer and snacks ,  just my girlfriend and myself in a two bedroom villa , more space than we knew what to do with.Both golf courses are 5 star with numerous holes overlooking the Pacific, had a caddie on the second day when I played the North course, Neil, the guy was excellent,look this place is pricey but you should be able to figure that out just by looking at the website and at no time did I ever think , wow this isn't

Hubby and I had a fabulous few days staying in a 2 bedroom villa. Rooms had amazing views very spacious and comfy. Gardens are beautiful pools are fabulous. Hubby played golf and I went to spa for the day. Best resort by far that we've stayed in! Loved it Pelican Hill!

We stayed in an oceanview room for three nights and it was truly great.  The spa was enjoyable as was the golf.   The only downside is it is not on the beach and it was tough to get to.  After coming from Del Mar, Ca, we were spoiled.  The rooms were large and truly beautiful with an outside terrace that was huge.  The hotel is big, a lot of walking to and from the restaurant to your room or dining so be aware of that.  I did think most of the employees were truly wonderful from the concierge to the breakfast wait staff to the cleaning staff.    There were minor issues:  the check-in staff did not immediately recognize that we were AX Platinum members with the associated benefits and made us wait for a room to be confirmed and a waiter in the dining room refused to split the

We had a great time here. Our house was wonderful overlooking the Ocean and city lights down the coast. One golf course was open and we enjoyed . Our only less than perfect experience was in the club Resturant. We ate there twice and service was very poor. Once on a Sunday for dinner and then lunch later in the week. Food was good .

The Resort at Pelican Hill is a fabulous place to go on vacation.  The staff was exceptional.  Our accommodations at the Villas were extremely spacious and handsomely decorated.  The natural beauty of the surroundings was spectacular.  The North golf course was very playable even if you are not Tiger Woods and the views are breathtaking. The sign of a great resort is that it pains you to leave there and you can't wait to come back!! In short, we loved the place!!!!!!

I was there as an award from my company and was a little worried after seeing some of the reviews about service. The service was excellent! From checking in to my departure every single staff person was professional and friendly. The resort is amazing. I stayed in the bungalows and they are huge. Beautifully decorated, high ceilings and mine had a view of Catalina. The pool is the biggest pool I have ever seen. I have to figure out how to get more of the hand lotion in the room because it is the best lotion I have ever tried!

Summary Heading: This time we got to stay....
Summary: The 1st time we visited here, it was just for dinner; this time we had the pleasure of spending the evening there and it was pretty spectacular. The public areas are roomy, opulent and stylish. We were escorted to out bungalow, a short  drive from reception, and it was really a sight to behold! I could have just spent the entire time in the room; beautifully designed, chic and large. The balcony had great views across the resort. The bathroom was sumptuous ( loved the toiletries too).   After watching the sunset by the fabulous circular pool we headed off to dinner after freshening up; it was an Italian weekend there so we had a wine/dinner matching event which was truly memorable with amazing, great wine choices and friendly & efficient service.  The next morning we attended

Summary Heading: Yes It Is Worth The Money!
Summary: Very few times will I ever say a place is a 5 Star across the board. This resort is a true 5 star property. The staff is incredible the service is amazing and the rooms are very spacious and the views are nothing less than spectacular. Don't forget to try the golf course cafe and try the Kobe burger. There is nothing the staff won't do to insure your comfort. They will also take you to the beach and pick you up!  Great job staff and room service!

Summary Heading: Luxurious Italian Villas on Newport Coast
Summary: Enjoyed a five night stay recently in an ocean view bungalow suite at this 5-star luxury resort along the Newport Beach coast.  Room was spacious, comfortable and well-furnished, with some of the tallest ceilings I’ve ever encountered in a hotel.  Service from all staff was extremely personable and prompt.  Enjoyed delicious meals in each of the resort’s fine dining establishments, plus room service.  Golf facilities are outstanding.  Very convenient location for Orange County shopping and other tourist destinations.

Summary Heading: Wow what a Unbelievable Property and Resort!
Summary: We stayed for a couple of Nights late October. This hotel was phenomenal! The Views from there are out of this world right onto Catalina Island. We had a lunch and a breakfast at the Colosseum Pool Restaurant there is no better setting for a meal. The food was superb. I totally loved the Hotels' restaurant 'Andrea' it was also excellent. Italian food with a Californian flair. The eggplant parmesean and gnocchi were soo good. We had a dessert sampler and it was perfect.     The rooms are beyond wonderful. We stayed in a garden view king room and it was like we were staying in a house. It had a huge bathroom, huge living area with fireplace and a nice patio for lounging. They had a nespresso machine and tea kettle in room. The decor was high class all the way.    We did quite a

Rooms are large with a gas fireplace, nespresso coffee maker, bottled water, large bathroom, quality toiletries including a nice bathrobe & a decent sized secluded balcony. I wish I could have spent more time in the room (& less in business meeting!).  Wifi is free & worked well.  My interactions with hotel staff were positive.    Able to see the ocean from various parts of the hotel -- it is a nice view.  The walk to the beach is not as direct as may expect - however, if like to walk, can walk to the beach & there are various trails.  Suggest having a car if plan to explore the area -- the resort is at least a couple miles from any shops or restaurants other than the ones at the hotel.

Location is great, just off the PCH, on a slight incline that reveals panoramic ocean views.  The property is sprawling, with the Golf Resort off to the left (we don't golf so we can't comment on anything on the golf side) and the Main Resort with restaurants, spa and pool and bungalows off to the other side of the main road that runs thru the property, so it's a lot of ground to cover.  The Coliseum Pool and Restaurant are perfect. A huge round pool with plenty of lounge chairs encircling gives everyone plenty of breathing room.  Pool service was attentive and efficient. The property is spotless and well maintained.  There are private cabanas on an upper level, not sure what they rent for, but you really don't need them unless you are a large party.  There's no need to fret

The hotel is an amazing experience in The OC! I enjoyed a lot my stay at Pelican Hill. Amazing Suites, Incredible Spa, Unique and breathtaking views of the ocean and fine dinning cuisine. All the experience at this fabulous resort makes the stay memorable!!!

So much wonderful to say about The Resort at Pelican Hill!   Everyone we came in contact with went out of their way, with smiles on their faces, to make us happy. The employees appeared to love their jobs, which means that management treats them great and which ultimately means that the guests feel good.  The spa was beautiful and an attendant assigned to me and each of my friends. The massages we got were wonderful and the sauna, hot pool, etc. were great. The place had all sorts of amenities and was clean as a pin! Ambience galore.  The Colosseum (pool and eating establishment) was very beautiful with a stunning view of the ocean and parts of the golf course. The poolside server was a very friendly, attentive young lady. The food and drinks were delicious.   The room was very

Our fourth visit and we only lve 20 minutes away. A beautiful setting great food and a staff that can't seem to do enough to make your stay perfect.  The lock on our door malfunctioned and when we returned near midnight,ready for bed we were locked out!! Not a happy situation but three management level men worked almost an hour and finally got it open so we could go t bed.  However it was not fixed.  They asked what time they could have the proper staff come in the morning to fix the lock. They came spent about 45 minutes,were very quiet and fixed it. This is a hotel that makes you feel appreciated.

We stayed at a Pelican Hill for a wedding and loved it even though the architecture was somewhat "over the top"! The grounds are beautiful and immaculate. Loved the Coliseum Pool for relaxing laps. Food at Coliseum and Pelican Grill was excellent! Played golf at the North Course and felt that it was more beautiful than Pebble Beach!! Stayed in the least expensive bungalow room and it was perfect with gas fireplace, patio, great toiletries and bedding!! My only complaint was that we left the room at 6:30 am to play golf and came back at 3:30 and the room was not made up. The next day housekeeping  knocked on the door at 8:15 when we were still sleeping! I'd suggest putting the Privacy sign on the door until  you are awake.

Awesome view, terrific service, heated beautiful travertine outdoor terrace floors....all in a casual but elegant "grill" setting. You can even wear your golf shorts into this beautiful restaurant/bar. On a clear day you may get lucky and catch a glimpse of Catalina Island. Take a sweater. It can be breezy that high up.

Summary Heading: Immaculate property and very relaxing stay!
Summary: This hotel is pristine and well worth the price tag. The room was very comfortable and the private patio felt very secluded. I didn't spend any time at the pool so I can't speak to that but the rest of the property was gorgeous.

What a wonderful resort! We stayed in the least expensive room, a Bungalow with no view, and it was still better than most hotel rooms. Large sitting area, gas fireplace, beautifully appointed with everything of excellent quality. (Except the toilet paper, which was kind of thin and harsh. I wouldn't have noticed except that everything else was so luxurious.) The toiletries were high quality and had a lovely natural scent.  The room came with a Nespresso machine, and 6 free coffee capsules, refilled daily. The sign said they were complimentary, with additional capsules for purchase in the minibar. We didn't have any capsules in the minibar, and also had no price list for the minibar, but the minibar selection was wide. In addition to the Nespresso, there was a tea kettle and a

arrived Oct 16, 9:00 pm ; directed to villa 24. cheese & fruit plates as gratuities in kitchen: overrun by ANTS  visit to toilet @ 2:00 am, overrun by MORE ANTS.  next AM filthiest carpet I have ever seen including feces(pet) stains. Kitchen appliances & glass counters grease stained and lots of finger prints. outside entry to villa doggy bag FULL bypassed by two housekeepers who barged in despite privacy door sign  cous de gras: RAT RUNNING DOWN ENTRY WALK TO VILLA confirmed at second siting by my wife. Also at reception, butler who was never to be heard from despite 4 phone attempts. BUT million dollar views over golf course and coast!
Manager Response: I sincerely regret that your unfortunate experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. Please know that I am personally addressing your concerns with our housekeeping, maintenance and service staff. We would also like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. Once again, I appreciate you taking the time to communicate your feedback here.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I was here for a business meeting and the physical surroundings and facilities couldn't be lovelier.  I really enjoyed the "bungalow" accommodations - very spacious, well-appointed, nice amenities.  The ocean view, sizeable patio and gas fireplace were big pluses!  The bed was so comfortable I thought I'd sleep forever, and the linens were soft and luxurious.  And the toiletries are luscious.  I took a cooking/wine tasting class - really great - world class food and perfect pairings - the chef and sommelier were terrific.  I only a couple of minor complaints.  First, my coffee maker - one of those fancy espresso machines with capsules - was not working.  It took an hour and two calls for someone to come to replace it, by which point I almost had to leave the room.  I had to

We could not have been more disappointed with our experience at Pelican Hill, which is based on an incident that happened during our stay and their response to the issue.  In short, we had cash stolen from our room during our one night stay at the resort. We reported the issue to them. They had record of staff entering our room at a time out of normal hours. They documented what happened and promised to fully investigate. While this was upsetting, I realize that this could happen anywhere. Most disappointingly, their staff never even bothered to follow up with us. I called, was transferred two times, and never received any type of response.  I can’t imagine having this experience happen with another top hotel chain. I hope this is an isolated incident. But this was so bad, it
Manager Response: I am disappointed to read about your unfortunate experience here and on Yelp. Please know that what you experienced is certainly the exception, not the rule. I have followed up with our Director of Security to address your concerns and contact you directly with any updates on the investigation underway. Thank you for taking the time to share your candid comments on our review pages.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Incredibly beautiful location with very nice rooms. We were unfortunately very surprised at the many signs of poor service - dirty coffee cups left in our room for 3 days (an extra dirty one was even left there one day), very slow drink service at the pool (over 45 min to get the first drink), inconsistent cleaning in the room, and a general lack of concern. Strange and disappointing for such a phenomenal place.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments about your recent experience. I am disappointed that your visit did not reflect the Five-Star standards we aim to deliver to each and every guest. Please know that your feedback is sincerely appreciated, as we strive to improve upon the less-than-perfect experience you encountered. We would like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. Thanks again for taking the time to post your feedback here.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Beautiful resort!  This was our 4th visit to this property and with our daughter now in school in the area - we will definitely be back!  Rooms have beautiful views and balconies.  Beds and bathrooms comfortable and very luxurious!  Coliseum pool and restaurant was our "go to" for breakfast and lunch.  Golf is spectacular too!  Highly recommend if you're looking to treat yourself and that special someone!!!

We were staying in a hotel near Disneyland when we realized we needed to change hotels. We google searched resorts near the beach and Pelican Hill came up. The pictures were stunning so we called to ask questions. I spoke with Richard and he was beyond helpful answering everything. We decided to book a guest room. We left Disneyland exhausted and headed straight to Newport Beach.   Driving up to Pelican Hill was gorgeous. We went and checked in and the front desk lady said that they upgraded us to the Villas with our own butler since we were traveling with children. We had no clue what the Villas were but we were given directions to them. They were located just down the street from the Resort.  We arrived at the check-in and then our butler showed us to our 4 bedroom, 4

We stayed here for 4 nights this past long weekend and had an absolutely wonderful time.  The rooms - HUGE!  We stayed in an ocean view bungalow and it was just wonderful.  The rooms were extremely spacious, the bed as well as the couch and the chairs were extremely comfortable, and the best part was the amazing balcony which had a perfect amount of space for lounging around and reading a book while looking out at the ocean.  The pool - The pool was extremely nice.  I greatly appreciated the attendants that got our chairs set up for us and covered.  The view was great and the whole ambiance was good.  Also loved the pool floats!  When we were there on Tuesday though they were seriously understaffed from a drinks serving perspective - clearly not the end of the world but

Had a basic bungalow, 400 series and right by the 1st tee on the North course.  Room is very spacious and extremely comfortable for our family of 3 (plus a couple guests from time to time).  Service was top notch even if a slight bit stuffy, pool it outstanding, and the golf is great.

Summary Heading: A hotel is only as good as it's weakest link!!!
Summary: My husband and I were there for one night to celebrate our anniversary.  I read quite a few reviews and was a bit concerned about the not so good ones regarding the staff.  My husband thought the place looked so beautiful he convinced me to try it at least once.  I booked the room through Visa Signature Luxury Hotel Collection which comes with added benefits such as upgraded room when available, breakfasts for two, hotel credits and VIP status.  I requested an upgrade to ocean view room on line but did not really think we will get it since I leaned from the hotel website that the hotel was having the Italian Street Fair event that day.  When we checked in, I asked the front desk clerk about the upgrade.  Without even checking the system, he very politely but mechanically told me

I cannot think of enough positive adjectives for this resort.  To say we were thoroughly impressed with the staff, room, amenities and the view would be an understatement.  When we arrived the staff was extremely helpful.  We were escorted from the desk to an awaiting bellman.  He escorted us to our room and explained where everything was.  The room was one of the most beautiful rooms I have ever been in and the ocean view was breathtaking.  I cannot wait for my next visit.

Beautiful setting, expensive, and incompetent front desk staff. Check-in is @ 5pm and our villa wasn't ready until close to 7p!  How do you account for the daily rate?  Nothing was offered during the wait time except empty apologies and repeated messages.  Glad we were able to amuse ourselves and had fun I spite of other administrative failings.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to post your feedback here. I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect, as we aim to deliver Five-Star service to each and every guest. We would like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: It is a beautiful location. It should be able to be wonderful experience. It is not. One can only assume there are money problems and the management is attempting to address that by decreasing staff and overhead. Villa was not ready even at the odd check in time of five pm. Explanations given made no sense and manner of "dealing" with delay would not have earned passing grade in hospitality 101. Restaurants "out of" various wines and items of type that suggests cutting back on overhead. Anticipate paying five star prices for, at best, two star management.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent experience. I regret that your visit fell short of your expectations and our goals. Please know that I have personally addressed your concerns detailed here with our management team. We would like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We stayed here the third week of September with our four kids.  We were in a two bedroom two and half bathroom villa.  The cost is about $1000 a night during September, which we felt was very reasonable considering the area and the spaciousness of the villa.  Our plan was to do the beach for part the time and Disney for the other part. The beach is right across the street.  They offer a complimentary shuttle or you can drive down yourself and pay to park at Crystal Cove Historic park.  We decided to drive and pay to park each day ($15).  The beach was gorgeous.  If you have kids the tide pools are a huge hit at low tide.  It is about a 20 minute drive to Disney.    The villas are extremely clean and well kept. We were treated with an array of food goodies such as a bowl of fresh

Upon checking in we were notified that our room would be right outside a street fair.  They failed to let us know any of the following that led to a miserable experience...   1. There would be loud music right outside the room day and night. 2. People would be loitering outside the room with conversations carrying into our room. 3. Even after the event was over workers would be loudly breaking down and cleaning up late into the night.  Again, audible into our room. 4. Further deconstructing and trash pickup would occur throughout the next day. 5. Could not park right in front of bungalow as is standard. Forced to valet where it is a considerable distance from the room. 6. They said they would take care of getting our luggage to the room however when we got to the room several
Manager Response: I appreciate you sharing your candid feedback about your recent experience. I regret that your visit during our annual Festa dell’Autunno weekend was anything less than perfect. Based on your detailed comments, I have followed up to address your concerns with the appropriate management of each department. I sincerely thank you for taking the time to let us know about these opportunities for improvement.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This was amazing! The pool was gigantic and very peaceful. The cabanas were close enough to hang out in but far enough away from the pool for privacy. The staff was on point with everything and very polite.

Summary Heading: A true luxury resort - 5 star service
Summary: This resort is a 5 star experience from the moment you arrive.  5 star service.  The rooms are well appointed. We had an ocean view villa - although is was a peek a boo ocean view villa located behind gates, there is an large private outside patio.  The room opens up into a foyer. There is a large bathroom with double vanity, separate shower and large tub. Our villa had high ceilings and a fireplace.  Pelican Hill rooms have all the amenities you would expect in a luxury resort. The service is the quickest I have experienced in all my travels. Most impressive is the wifi service that worked perfectly through out the entire resort. The pool is breathtaking. This resort in my opinion is the gold standard in a luxury.

Celebrating my Bff's Birthday at Picollo' Resturant. Excellent service and the  cosmopolitan drinks "Made by Jameson" were off the chain. I would also be remiss if I did not mention Collin's spin on the Lavendar Martini.  Entertainment was great!

Beyond disappointing. 6hr golf rounds with surly staff to boot. Billing overcharges. Cold food at the "signature" restaurant. All they care about is squeezing the last dollar out of you. They charge like a luxury resort without any of the service or customer culture that should accompany it.My advice-stay away.
Manager Response: I regret that you are disappointed in your experience. In following up on the details you described here, it is my understanding that the VP of Golf has already reached out to you directly to address your concerns. I’m also disappointed to learn about the personal insults that our golf staff experienced when communicating with you and your wife. It is our aim to deliver Five-Star service to each and every guest. To this end, I have followed up with managers of each area mentioned in your review to discuss your experience.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: The Perfect Place to celebrate our 45th Anniversary
Summary: Pelican Hill is the epitome of comfort, service and sensational food.  Our pre-arrival needs, details, changes, one thing after another were all handled in an exceptional fashion by concierge Nichole Urell.  I truly felt like she was as invested in our trip as we were-just 125% all the way!  I have never had better concierge service from anyone in 45 years of travel.  The Bungalow Suites are so inviting that it gets harder and harder to leave the room.  Every single sofa, chair, bed is plush and wonderful.  In fact, our friends who joined us at the resort for a weekend came home and ordered the Pelican Hill bed.  Room service food was as well prepared and hot as if we were in the restaurant.  Andrea's has first class service, ambience and food-the house made pastas, as well as

Pelican is a luxury hotel above the rest in OC. We've stayed here a few times and found the north villas to be the most serene and private part on the property -- feels like you're in your own little cottage.    It's a walk to the main building unless you call for a ride up but nice exercise nonetheless, especially after dinner in Andrea's.  Everything is excellent and if you want a splurgecation then this is the place.  Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Gave it another try....this time it was Great
Summary: I stayed at PH a few years ago in a bungalow.  I did not find the resort very enjoyable.  I believe part of the issue was the expectations that I had.  The Resort at Pelican Hill is a huge layout.  There is no bar that you easily get to.  So having the mindset that I was going to wait in the bar while the wife gets ready for dinner did not happen.  There is a bar (several actually) but depending on where your bungalow or villa is located, it can be a long walk or you have to call for a shuttle.  Going back to PH for another time and knowing this, I believe I had better expectations and embraced being self sufficient.  This time I stayed in a villa and used the villa conceirge to stock the villa with items that I would want (water, snacks, breakfast items) I then made sure to

Summary Heading: This is a beautiful place with very friendly staff
Summary: We had a wonderful 4 day stay at this wonderful resort.  The grounds, the pool, the spa and the golf course were all great.  We really enjoyed the pool and walking the grounds.  I have to say again how friendly and helpful the staff were.  They really made the stay enjoyable.  The bungalows are very quite and large.

The villas are incredible and perfect for a family vacation. The service was amazing.  The anticipate your needs then leave you to enjoy your time alone.  The Spanish guitar by the pool at sunset- Heaven.
