I stayed here for one night as part of a surprise anniversary gift. This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in state-side. The service is sublime - attentive, but not in your face. The bungalow suite we stayed in was ridiculously luxurious and we had so much space! I cannot recommend this place enough. Yes, it is pricey. BUT it is a case of you really do get what you pay for here.

The facilities at the hotel are very slick and very clean but the whole experience was very sterile.  There is no personality to the Resort.  We were also extremely inconvenienced when it was revealed that the hotel had accidentally cancelled our reservation which meant that we could not be accommodated in the room requested (which was required for medical reasons).  Hotel was polite but unapologetic.  Very disappointed overall.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit. I apologize that your experience did not meet you expectations and our goals. Our aim is to deliver the best possible experience for each and every guest, and I am disappointed to read that your visit did not reflect this.   I have personally followed up with the reservations manager to discuss your feedback. We kindly request an opportunity to speak with you directly to discuss your experience further. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message, so we may take this opportunity to listen and understand your perspective in more detail.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The Resort at Pelican Hill exceeded our expectations in every way. The grounds are stunning with magnificent views in every direction. We stayed in a villa with our two young children and they were spacious, as well as, beautiful with no detail spared. We have stayed at multiple resorts and Pelican quickly became our favorite. The service was impeccable. Our private butler, Ismael, was more than accommodating to our needs and his professionalism and commitment to making our stay enjoyable made our trip even more special. We spent a great deal of time out at the Villa pool which was also a wonderful experience thanks to outstanding service provided by Corey and Simon. My family and I cannot wait to go back to Pelican Hill as our annual trip!

Summary Heading: Phenomenal Rooms, Great Views, Walks, superb service
Summary: We celebrated my birthday at the Resorts at Pelican Hill.  Our experience began when Madison,  one of the Guest Experience Concierges, reaching out to us a week ahead of our stay reaching out to determine if there was any help needed with pre-assistance arrangements.  Madison reserved appointments for us.  She also learned that it was my birthday.  We were surprised, please and thrilled to have bubbly in room after dinner.  Madison was a joy to work with.  Our bungalow room was incredible.  We loved the golf course and ocean view.  Great amenities and great food.

By far the best hotel I have ever stayed at. We stayed at the South Villas, not the hotel. The villas are pretty much an apartment, and an incredibly well - designed and decorated one at that. It has a massive kid - friendly pool, a spa, and a gym right by the pool. The luxury of the resort is simply mind - blowing, I had a great and memorable stay at this wonderful place.

We live within walking distance... we had a trip planned for our anniversary that we needed to cancel due to time constraints. So we headed down the road to Pelican Hill Resort for a "Staycation" , They made us feel so special and offered some special amenities for our anniversary celebration. The best fine resort experience we have ever had and it was right in our own back yard!

I can't say enough about this magnificent resort-except that I am so glad that I hosted my mother's surprise bday (Sept 12-14)here! From the very beginning of my planning, the room rsvp mgr, Jeff was helpful and responsive to my request. During the planning Nicole in concierge was more than helpful and detailed re: various options, and upon arrival, I was greeted by Ali and Nicoli (Villa Clubhouse) with huge smiles and assistance to assure that our weekend was every bit of fabulous! There were so many helpful hands and beautiful personalities. Thank You PH :)

The hotel and its Villas are incredible in both design and in amenities.  Some of the service staff was at a level expected but most left much to be desired.  The hotel and its Villas are spread out and to get between many of the villas and the main hotel lobby and restaurants you need to take a shuttle.  The shuttles were largely untimely having to wait for up to 25 minutes for someone to arrive.  The restaurants had decent wait staff service but the people running the restaurants were more interested in how they handled seating to accommodate their needs as compared to the needs of their patrons.  No need to get into the details but when you want to sit outside in open tables that overlook the sunset it is pretty hard to accept that they would not seat you outside due to the
Manager Response: Timothy,   Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback. I regret that your overall experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. Based on your comments, I have personally followed up with the front office and restaurant managers. Please know that our terrace seating are accommodated on a first come, first served basis. It is not guaranteed when making the reservations. I apologize if this information was not clearly communicated to you.   Your candid thoughts are appreciated, as we strive to continuously heighten the overall guest experience. We would like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. Once again, I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect and thank you again for your feedback.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: No expense was spared when The Resort @ Pelican was built and you can see why. From the sweeping Pacific Ocean views to the golf course and guest villas a resort stay doesn't get much better and you'll struggle to leave the accommodations they have..

Summary Heading: Labor Day weekend with great friends
Summary: Some friends rented a 3-bedroom villa at this resort over Labor Day weekend and invited a few couples to enjoy the pool and weather.  I have stayed here a few times before and I have never been disappointed.  The villa is huge (probably almost 1800 sq. feet).  There are three full bathrooms and a very nice kitchen with a HUGE refrigerator.  It's a perfect place to host a party of 10-16 people.  We spent the time at the pool (in a cabana that was nice, but nothing spectacular--i think you need one that faces the ocean to really feel like a rockstar) and a few of us played golf (which is REALLY nice--beautiful ocean views throughout and excellent course layout by Tom Fazio).    The level of service at this resort is as good as you would expect for the high price tag.  If you've

The Resort at Pelican Hill is probably one of the nicest resort I have ever stayed at. From the moment you enter the property you can tell this is a 5 star luxury. We stayed in a three bedroom villa which had two master suites and another bedroom with an adjacent bathroom. Each room was very well appointed with comfortable beds and large bathrooms with tub and stand up showers.  We had a full kitchen and a patio overlooking the ocean. The resort and the accommodations are truly spectacular.   The property has two pools. One for the hotel guest and the other exclusively for the villa guests.  Both pools are beautiful and super clean.  The pool area have separate lockers and showers for guest who either arrive early or need to leave the property later in the day. This was Key on

Summary Heading: Total luxury with a few qlitches
Summary: Our one night splurge on our 15 day journey around SoCal. First of all the property is gorgeous!!  Very beautiful landscaping with sweeping views down to the Pacific Ocean. The lobby is immense and decorated in lovely coral colors. There are tapestries on the walls, couches, and sitting circles all over. There is a building adjacent to the hotel for private functions. They were setting up for an outdoor wedding when we strolled over, and it was fascinating to see how they were creating a ceiling in an open space. The Villa was very nice, big, and had a gas fireplace and cute patio with furniture. There is no microwave, mini fridge or safe. There is "an honor bar" that can be opened with a key. The wood ceilings were high, There are two sinks in the bathroom, and a large walk in

Spent the week golfing, pool time, biking to Balboa, running down and on to the beach. Our bungalow room, spectacular. Food and service amazing! Definitely the best! The swimming pool was so fun and beautiful. We also got a massage and it was the best ever- you lose time here because you are at peace.

The Villas are beautiful and spacious.  The beds are super comfy and the bathrooms is huge and the tubs and walk in shower are great with nice amenities in the bathroom.   The fireplace is nice and romantic as well.

Amazing golf and location. Beautiful amenities with great customer service. The golf is fantastic! Restaurants are really good. The spa experience is relaxing and tranquil. Great service and accommodations throughout the entire resort!

Having visited Orange County several times in the last 7 years and getting married in Laguna Niguel in 2010, my wife and I have stayed at most of the area's top properties. Pelican Hill consistently delivers 5 star service, friendliness, amenities, golf, dining and customer service. I highly recommend staying here and if it's affordable for you, choose a villa. We'll definitely be back again and again.

My husband surprised me with a trip to this beautiful resort for our anniversary.  Neither of us had even been there before though we had considered it for a business event.  We had a very good time but I am not sure we would ever return except perhaps to the restaurant if we were in the area.  We checked into our room which is quite spacious and beautiful.  Though we had requested ocean view as often happens, we had a view but we couldn't really see or hear the ocean which had been the reason my husband chose it initially.    Our dinner at Andrea was incredible.  Both the service and the food were impeccable.  We had the tasting menu and every course was marvelous.  The next morning we had room service and then my husband left for some errands in the area.  While I was in the
Manager Response: Cheryl,   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent stay with us. While I’m delighted to read about your experiences at Andrea Ristorante and the Spa, I apologize for the inconveniences you encountered during your stay, which impacted your overall experience at Pelican Hill. Please know that I have followed up with housekeeping and in-room dining managers to address the feedback you have graciously detailed here.   We kindly request an opportunity to speak with you personally to discuss your experience further. I’ll provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. Once again, thank you for your feedback.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Pelican Hill is a favourite of ours. The resort is spotless, well organised and beautifully set out to compliment the stunning Newport Coast. An easy drive from Corona del Mar, Crystal Cove not to mention the shopping centres of Fashion Island and South Coast Plaza- this is a quiet haven. The excitement of San Diego, LA, Disneyland and Universal are also within reach and can be done in a day trip. Whilst there is a champion golf course, a well equipped gym and swimming pools available- the resort is equally a place to chill and relax ( perhaps on the nearby beach or at the well managed spa). Villas and apartments are very well equipped for a traveller with a full kitchen allowing for self catering- and also washing machine and drying - (a huge plus when travelling with children

The term "world class" is often casually thrown around.  But our experience here made us feel this literally.  The resort is spacious and spread out.  The rooms are luxurious and perfectly appointed, with great attention paid to detail.  The staff was completely pleasant, attentive and helpful.  We loved the pool area and its amenities.  Everywhere you looked, from the manicured grounds to the restaurants and the hotel itself, made you feel like you were in the lap of luxury.

Summary Heading: Beware of the types of guests who visit here
Summary: The feel of the hotel is certainly luxurious albeit very spread out. Our first room seemed to be a long way from anything which is not ideal with young kids.   The main issue for me is that there were a number of small annoying things about the hotel which meant it wasn't quite as relaxing or as nice as you would expect for the price. The hotel on some levels has the feel of a family resort but on others it definitely didn't.   To be fair our break got off to a bad start when I found out that the concierge had not made the bookings he had said he would. I also then found out that the restaurants can't cater for the hotel guests unless you want to eat at 5pm or 9pm (not great if you have kids and arrive later than anticipated at the hotel).   The first room we were shown was a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback. I apologize that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. I have personally followed up with management of each area to discuss the comments you have kindly noted here. Please know that Coliseum Pool & Grill opens daily for both Resort and local guests from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. The lounges at Andrea and Pelican Grill, as well as the Great Room Social Lounge are open between lunch and dinner services. Additionally, the Resort’s in-room dining is available 24 hours.   Once again, your candid thoughts are appreciated, as we strive to continuously heighten the overall guest experience. I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect and thank you again for your feedback.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: First 2 nights we stayed at the villa. Excellent place to be. 2 big bedrooms marble bathrooms, good size living room, great veranda, kitchen with high end equipment. A fridge for wine bottles (part of the bar). Sound equipment, TV, dinning room and washer and dryer! A great option for a family. each villa has it's own garage. The other 3 days we stayed at the bungalows, which I prefer as it's closer to the main pool and restaurant. The rooms are beautiful, lots of space and a great veranda.

This sprawling, exclusive resort was constructed with such attention to detail. Everything is made of the highest quality materials, the bungalows and villas are laid out thoughtfully, with wide, sweeping balconies and views to the ocean. I absolutely loved our villa, which was large, especially the master bathroom and huge soaking tub. The food at the Coliseum restaurant was delicious: my husband and I both had lobster scrambled eggs for breakfast and almost died of happiness.  The one MAJOR drawback to this resort? There is no adult/quiet pool, and there are hundreds of kids. Literally, the place is crawling with children. I had no idea it would be such a family haven, but both the private villa pool and the main Coliseum pool are filled with screaming children. If you're a

The room, the location and the hotel itself is 5 stars, but the staff that runs it, I would rate it as three stars.  My experience with the staff was as follows:  When I checked in I was told that the suite was being cleaned and it would be a few minutes before it would be ready and was asked to go sit in the lobby.  After 30 minutes I went back to the front desk and they told me that a supervisor was on its way to check the room, another 30 minutes passed and again I went to the front desk and this time I was told that the supervisor was inspecting the room and to go back and wait.  Finally after 1 hour and 15 minutes the room was ready.  The supervisor apparently didn't do a good job as the wireless phone next to the bed had a dead battery and when the phone would ring if you
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you have encountered during your stay. In following up on the details you described here, I learned more about the miscommunication and confusion you experienced. I hope I can help clarify with the following information.  Please know that when your assistant made the reservations on your behalf, there was uncertainly at the time of booking whether you may be interested in the breakfast package, so the reservation without the breakfast package was confirmed by email to your assistant. During your stay, the message sent to our front desk agents was a screenshot showing the package options on our website and not a reservation confirmation that included a breakfast package. This is why our staff was unable to confirm the breakfast credit, based on the email provided.  I’m glad to hear that our supervisor graciously gave you a breakfast credit in consideration of the confusion you experienced. However, I assure you I have personally addressed your concerns regarding the unfortunate lack of response you encountered. We value your perspective and apologize that your experience was less than perfect. Thank you again for providing your feedback.  Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I cannot say enough good things about Pelican Hill! My room wasn't quite ready at 10:30 am when I got there so I went poolside. When my room was ready they brought the keys to the pool! Jeff Hauser helped me secure my reservations and was nothing but professional. Amanda Lawler in concierge was simply awesome in making my dinner reservations. The entire team at Pelican went above and beyond, from the pool team, the valet team, the room service team and the restaurant team! Top notch service all around, surrounded by beauty!

Summary Heading: 5 day stay at Villas, fantastic home away from home!
Summary: We just spent five days at the villas. Three years ago we were at the hotel during the same period. The villa experience was much better for a family of five. There was a mechanical problem in our original villa so we were moved to a three bedroom which was much nicer. The manager, Nicolai was very responsive, lovely and super nice to deal with. Three years ago, there seemed to be a lack of housekeeping service which is no longer the case. All staff was super respectful and made you feel at home.. Also, would like to say that there was no wait or issue when we needed a shuttle lift. They were right on the case. All in all, it was a great experience and we would return again.

Great dining, great service, great golf and fantastic views. Was there on business on three occasions.  Very elegant, yet relaxed and private. Highly recommended to anyone looking for a pampered experience.

We stayed here for a weekend getaway and we're both very impressed with the resort.  Rooms were clean and well appointed, but the one thing we loved were the size of the room. We had a standard bungalow which was huge with a great patio to sit and relax. Had dinner at Andrea and had the most amazing waiter, friendly, knowledge about the menu, and just an overall pleasant attitude. The bucatini carbonara was awesome. We will be back soon.

Set up an event for the Pediatric Cancer Research Foundation and this team of banquet services and the captain were super duper TOP Notch!  They were expedient and professional and work diligently to assure quality customer service and fabulous turn times!  I would use them in a heartbeat budget permitting for my corporate events!

Relaxed, slow paced, golf course resort. It feels secluded though it's relatively close to Newport's Balboa Island and Fashion Island. Spacious bathrooms. The 'coliseum'' pool is huge and grand, online photos don't do it justice. The coliseum restaurant feels beachy and very california in the evenings, overlooking the pool. Relaxed, low key but luxurious, comfortable.

I've been to this resort 3-4 times and enjoyed the views, the golf, and the service. This time was no exception to that. We had a fun couple of nights in a villa suite which was pleasant but I suggest this resort needs to start and refresh some of the design and decor. Some public areas are looking a little tired and our suite was in need of an update. Overall an enjoyable few days.

Everything about Pelican Hill is special.  From the gorgeous views, to the great service, to the fantastic rooms and suites.  I stayed in a two bedroom suite and the room was amazing.  All the restaurants were terrific.  Very expensive.  But an amazing place.  And the golf is absolutely spectacular as well.   They also have hourly shuttle service, a 5 minute ride, to Crystal Cove Beach.   This is a very pretty beach and you should definitely go down to see it.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel but service and management were terrible
Summary: Stayed at the villa side of pelican resort.  Beautiful room, 3 bedroom 3 baths, although it looked a little worn and dated.  At the price of 2000/night you would expect it to not miss the mark though.  Service was terrible, snobby front desk and not helpful nor accommodating.  Check in time is unreasonable, 5pm but expects a noon check out.  We were only there for one night so we wanted to get into the room as soon as possible, there were availability but they just did not let us check in even though I had called in advance to request an early check in.   Not only that, we were not give our room until close to 6pm.  When asking for late check out the next day, we were again denied, even though house keeping does not come until 3/4pm which was the reason why our check in was
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I am deeply disappointed that your experience fell short of the Five-Star standards you expect and we aim to deliver. I apologize for the delay in your check-in time, due to the heightened demand during your visit. Please know that our staff made every effort to expedite the cleaning and inspection of your accommodations. Additionally, I have shared your thoughts with our Resort landscaping team, so we can ensure that views from our oceanview rooms are not obstructed in anyway.   Once again, we regret that your stay was less than perfect and appreciate you taking the time to post your candid feedback. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. We look forward to the opportunity to speak with you personally to discuss your feedback further.    Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Beautiful villas - we stayed in a 4 bedroom which felt like home. Clean, new, updated everything - bathrooms, electronics, fireplace, kitchen. A delightful place to stay. Staff was incredible. Shuttles everywhere and no waiting. Can't wait to return!

We just stayed for the forth time at the Pelican Hill with the family and enjoyed lovely days. The bungalows are large equipped even with a Nespresso machine.  The location offer gorgeous views and the whole resort offers a lot of space - just the pool area can be very crowded over weekends (and does not offer enough shades. Food is good value for money. A tennis and basketball court is seriously missing for family sports.

My family and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Resort at Pelican Hill.  We have 3 children ages 5-13.  We were originally staying in a beachfront room at a moderate resort on Laguna Beach but decided to move because it was too much of a party scene.  Luckily for us Pelican Hill had a 1 bedroom bungalow to accommodate us.  How did I not know how amazing this place is!  The architecture is grand throughout the resort and golf club.  The pool and its setting was breathtaking and enormous.  The pool is a gigantic circle overlooking the most amazing view of the golf course and the ocean.  My kids loved how there were many big foam rafts floating in the pool that they could use.  The pool service was excellent.  The cocktails offered at the pool were unique and delicious.

Summary Heading: Food Poison at PELICAN HILL "Andreas"  Restaurant Four Cheese White Pizza
Summary: Do not order, repeat do not order the Four Cheese white pizza at Pelican Hill Andreas Restaurant.  Pizza is a specialty item in Southern California, What a treat it is  to have pizza at  Pelican Hill Restaurant ANDREAS, that is  until I ordered the 4 cheese white pizza.   I called Chef Marco up at 1 am in the morning to complain about food poison. Chef Marco  told me that  the  pizza oven was heated to 500 degrees and that it was not possible. The next day the head chef called to reiterate that the ovens were heated to 500 degrees.  Both Chefs told me that they would not be  responsible for the food poison I contracted from Pelican Hill,  Andreas Restaurant after ordering  a  four cheese white pizza  Suggest that Andreas Restaurant  remove the four cheese white pizza from the
Manager Response: Vincent,   Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback. I am sincerely disappointed to read about your unfortunate illness. I apologize that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. Most importantly, I hope that you have recovered swiftly and completely.  In following up on the details you described here, I understand that both the Andrea Head Chef and Executive Chef have already reached out to you to address your concerns. Please know that all cheeses used on the pizza are pasteurized, and there was no ricotta cheese on the pizza.   I will provide the contact information for the Director of Food & Beverage separately in a private message, if you wish to discuss your feedback further. Once again, I apologize for this unfortunate experience and look forward to another opportunity to serve you better.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama  Managing Director  The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: There are so many reviews about this property clearly. I will try to be of value add and avoid repetition if I can. Me and wife thought the Pelican Hill experience overall was fantastic. We had great fun walking the beach in the morning using the convenient shuttle bus, we enjoyed the pool and the views, our bungalow was fantastic, walking the resort grounds was pleasant.  This area is one of my favorite places to visit in the USA and this hotel makes the stay extra fun. The food could have been better. We were disappointed at breakfast as well as lunch by the pool. Also, the room upkeep crew keeps barging in. It almost felt like somebody was trying to get in to do something on the hour.

This place is gorgeous! The staff is amazing and caters to your every need. The brunch was absolutely wonderful and the views are breathtaking! The pool is huge and overlooks the beautiful golf course. This is a must visit when you are in the area.

Fantastic resort in Orange County. Rooms are top notch and the grounds are impeccable . Food is 5 star and service first class ! We travel a lot and stayed across the street at the Marriot before and Pelcan Hill blows that place away!

Summary Heading: Opulent resort with first class service
Summary: This is the second time we have stayed here and the quality of our stay exceeded our expectations. We had a huge bungalow that was immaculate. We played the South course and had a wonderful round, our caddie, Bud, was superb. My only minor quibble concerns the pool area. This is a child friendly resort and during early August there were many families here with young kids. Surely at a resort like this there should be an adults only poolside area for those of us traveling without kids who seek a bit of quiet. And although the hot tub area clearly states that the hot tub is not to be used by children, there remain parents who believe that a hot tub is the equivalent of a kiddie pool and it was used that way. Staff at the pool should enforce the rules. Other than that, we love this

We have just returned from a lovely week at the Resort at Pelican Hill!  My husband and two children (age 11 and 14) really enjoyed our time there.  After a long journey from London we were looking forward to relaxing in a luxury resort near the coast, and this place did not disappoint - it was gorgeous.  The resort, gardens, pools, views décor and accommodation are all stunning!  When we arrived the staff were incredibly welcoming and friendly and we were allocated a Butler who was always on hand if we needed anything.   (We didn't make much use his services in the end)  There was even milk in the fridge when we arrived. All week the staff were great - they couldn't do enough for us. The level of service around the resort is great.  The rooms are very well decorated and

Summary Heading: My favorite spot to stay in southern California
Summary: Love love love this spot.  Staff could not have been nicer. First time went we had a very large villa. This time we had a lovely ocean front bungalow.  I prefer the bungalow closer to main resort and pool.   I did the roller class in gym and instructor Cara  very well versed and helpful making sure we all had best technique. Pool best spot I love eating breakfast and lunch at pool area.  Dinner best at golf course.  This is not a hip hotel with happening lobby but very nice.  Only negative is walking paths around resort, wish they would add path around resort so no need to,take shuttle.

One of the best places in Newport Beach to have a coffee with marvelous view, wide scenic view of the ocean and top view over golf course.  I haven't stayed here before though I just enjoy the view in the Caffe of the hotel.

This was my first visit to the area and I couldn't have been more pleased. The resort was truly a five star location. Our every need was attended to in a timely and friendly manner. The views of the Pacific from our room were spectacular.

Like spending a week in heaven - we rented one of the 4 Bedroom Ocean View Villas and were not disappointed - first class accommodations with the bonus of a 2 car garage, laundry facilities, 4 beautiful marble bathrooms (one for each bedroom) and a full kitchen with first class appliances.  From the moment you check in and meet your butler who follows you to your 'residence' and helps to unpack to the moment you leave you will feel like a VIP.  Turn down service every night with a delicious chocolate treat. Love the private pool and wine bar/breakfast buffet at the Club House reserved for those staying in the Villas.  Not very crowded and with a breathtaking view.  We actually spent a lot of time in the Villa, on the patio drinking wine, in the evening watching the beautiful

We've stayed here a few times, so something keeps bringing us back - the accommodations are lovely and the location is beautiful. Sadly, the service is hit and miss. With a property of this caliber, one would expect service to be more consistently excellent.
Manager Response: Gina,   Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback. It is our mission to provide exceptional service and memorable experiences for each and every guest who visits the Resort. I regret this is not reflected consistently during your visits, especially knowing that you have been a loyal guest.   We kindly request an opportunity to speak with you directly to discuss your feedback further, so that we can listen and understand your perspective in more detail. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The Resort at Pelican Hill is wonderful! The grounds, pool area, rooms, restaurants, golf course are all beautifully maintained.  The staff is friendly, efficient and accommodating.  This was my fourth visit to the resort and I am looking forward to my fifth visit.  This is the place to stay when visiting the Newport Beach area!

Summary Heading: Promises broken, over priced, not a beach vacation spot
Summary: Pelican Hill advertises itself as a beach location. It is not. It is essentially an over priced development 3 miles from the beach with staff that is diffident and does not live up to promises.  Made reservations months in advance and was promised family accommodations very close to each other. Instead rooms were not available until after 5pm accommodations were so far spread apart that we needed a car service to get between them.  Staff denied that promises were made despite the fact that that they agreed notations were on file.  They claimed that all discussions before arrival were subject to change due to availability.
Manager Response: Gordon,   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I sincerely apologize that we did not deliver a positive experience for you and your family, as we intend to provide for each of our guests. We kindly request an opportunity to speak with you directly to discuss your feedback further, so that we can listen and understand your perspective in more detail. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. Once again, I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Never book this kind of hotel using booking or another hotel reservation they will treat you as second class guest
Summary: Poor service No for forigners, eventhough that 70% of the employees are mexicans or latinos bad breakfast, super expensive and cold coffee.  the hotel is beautiful but is empty no soul.  Room service is as fast as canoo trip, in addition to that,  if you want to have your own romantic wine night with cheese and crakers, berries etc, they do not have extra tablecloth so be ready to use  the towels and also bring your own wine glasses. TV did not work for my whole stay!!  not even a sorry letter. Upgrade not even in your dreams so if you are centurion or infinite card holder do not try to use it. The most important never use hoterl reservation enginse such as booking, hotel or other they do no like that.  you will pay in way or another the price reduction.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback here and through our feedback form. I sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you have encountered during your stay. At Pelican Hill, we continuously strive to exceed guests’ expectations, and it troubles me that your experience did not reflect this.   In following up on the details you described here, I learned that the Manager of Rooms have already reached out to you directly to address your concerns and extended special considerations, given your circumstance. Once again, I apologize that you were disappointed in your experience. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Excellent resort in everyway.  Highly recommend for special occasions.  Husband and I just celebrated our 31st anniversary, staying at the resort for a night.   From the moment we arrived every detail is 1st class.  Lovely room, ourstanding views, beautiful grounds.  attentive kind personnel.  Thank you Resort at Pelican Hill.

Summary Heading: Pelican Hill Grill not listed on Trip Advisor?
Summary: We went to this restaurant without reservations and were initial turned toward the noisy Sat. Bar after golf games.When I asked we were seated in the main restaurant in a quiet booth.Excellent food and service.

Summary Heading: Not The Same Pelican Hill Resort You Knew And Loved...
Summary: Well I guess all good things must sooner or later end...  The Resort at Pelican Hill is still gorgeous, but there must be a new management team consisting of only bean counters because the service has dropped significantly and there is a price for everything.  The service used to be truly exceptional.  Now, housekeeping cannot meet requested times, apparently because there are fewer of them to save money.  In-room dining requests are repeatedly messed up.  Simple items routinely malfunction (the juice dispenser at breakfast, the tub drain, etc.).  It seems as if no expense has been spared to save every expense possible, regardless of the impact on customers.    I had similar problems during my previous visit, and delayed another visit by many months because the quality had
Manager Response: Michael,   Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback. I apologize that your recent experiences did not meet your expectations and our goals. At Pelican Hill, it is our mission and responsibility to provide exceptional service and memorable experiences for each and every guest who chooses to visit the Resort. We care very much about our guests, and I’m deeply disappointed that your visits did not reflect our commitment to Five-Star service standards.   I have personally followed up with management of each area detailed in your review. Additionally, I regret that you did not enjoy our refreshed Caffè & Market, which offers a curated collection of gourmet items on-the-go, while maintaining all of our guests’ long-time favorites, such as authentic Italian espresso bar and Resort-made gelato, to savor indoors or al freso at Caffè tables.   We value your perspective and kindly request an opportunity to speak with you directly to discuss your feedback further. I will provide the contact information for the Hotel Manager separately in a private message. Once again, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The bungalow we had was quite spacious and beautiful.  It is about twice the size of a regular hotel room.  The Coliseum pool is gorgeous and I loved the outside sitting areas that were shaded and almost always available.  The service was quite good.  One glitch happened in a an evening that we requested a ride from our room to the main lobby (quite a distance).  We waited quite a while, but every hotel golf cart with hotel personnel who passed us and realized we were waiting so long, asked if they could call and remind the transportation that we were still waiting.  Thought it was very nice that they were concerned.  Would definitely return.

This is one of the newest and most luxurious hotels in Newport Beach. It's a fantastic property, however service levels can be improved. Worth to give it a try, especially if you're a golfer. Amazing vistas and a fantastic circular pool awaits you for a getaway.

What a great stay. Frontdesk, waiters, roomservice, inhouseservice... All amazing!!  I would recommend anyone who visits LA to visit Newport Beach. Anyone who visits Newport Beach to stay here.   And the best pool ever!!! Just mind blowing.

Stayed here this past weekend (7/25 - 7/26) and had a great time.  We had a Bungalow for the weekend with an ocean view.  It was beautiful and incredibly comfortable.  The service was fantastic especially from the front desk, concierge and valet.  We couldn't have had a better time.  Thanks to everyone for a wonderful weekend!

Stayed at Pelican Hill in late July.  The facilities are beautiful, the food excellent and the service very good.  My room was huge with probably 15 ft ceilings and a large bathroom and terrace.  Luxurious furniture and bedding and finishes throughout make it feel equal to a Four Seasons.  The golf courses are resort style but very fun and challenging.  My only complaint was having to take a shuttle everywhere on property as things are far apart.  The shuttle service is free and generally available but I did wait longer than expected a few times.

Summary Heading: AMAZING 2 NIGHTS- ONLY REGRET WAS NOT BEING ABLE TO STAY LONGER.
Summary: From the moment we arrived the staff was pleasant ,polite and very helpful. Our room was spacious, clean and absolutely perfect. The crisp white linens and duvet and our king size bed was dreamy!!The pool area is gorgeous and so is the spa. The staff at the golf course was able to accommodate my husband by finding him a golf game to join. Everything was wonderful and we cannot wait to return for another visit. To all the people at Pelican Hill- we thank you!!

It’s actually somewhat rare when I stay at a property, dine somewhere, or visit an attraction that I really feel like deserves TripAdvisor’s “Excellent” rating. There’s simply no other way to rate The Resort at Pelican Hill.  The service, the room, the amenities, the grounds, the views… All perfect.   My only tiny complaint is that there’s really only one place on property to have breakfast… And although the breakfast buffet was good, I just didn’t feel like my wife and I got good value for my $110. Other nice places like The Four Seasons, The Fairmont, or The Ritz-Carlton offer breakfast buffets that are more in the $25 range. Perhaps the $42++ would be OK if there were other options on property for breakfast.  You know this resort is awesome if that’s all I can find to

Came down for a weekend getaway of golf and relaxation. The hotel and grounds are in excellent condition and the staff are top notch. From the moment you drive up to the time you leave, the staff is very accommodating and never pushy.  The two golf courses have incredible ocean views. Get the fore caddy who will help you with some local course knowledge.  Can't wait to go back!

We stayed at Pelican Hill for five nights recently.   This was our first visit.   Our room overlooking the ocean was outstanding.   Only regret is that we did not have an umbrella on our patio as the sun was bright.   Food and service throughout were top notch and always with a smile

Fabulous property, beautifully maintained, great golf. Put this on your list if you are visiting Southern California..spend time at the Collisium pool for breakfast and or drinks. Take the shuttle to the beach

Summary Heading: Not on the Beach - But Who Cares!
Summary: Wonderful, wonderful place. Impeccable grounds. Friendly, efficient staff. Beautifully maintained. Large comfortable rooms. Terraces available that overlook the Pacific Ocean. Shuttles to the beach. Great food. Beautiful salt water pool that is a pleasure to swim in. Terrific water pressure in the showers. Fire places in the rooms. Perfect location between Newport and Laguna Beaches. This is a special place. Highly recommended.  One caveat, which is the only reason why I am not rating the resort as excellent. The pool is a great pool for families but not for adults without families. It is 50 feet in diameter, which is enormous, but there are no accommodations for adults who just want to lounge in the pool or swim laps. And it can get pretty noisy, although there is one small

Summary Heading: What a great place with amazing customer service!
Summary: Karey at the clubhouse pool was extremely helpful, great customer service as well as on Friday Nick at the clubhouse pool was so helpful and friendly! He killed Us with kindness and is quick with our requests! He had amazing customer service! The coliseum pool was amazing yesterday and the customer vice was on point! Travis the butler was great too!!!

We (wife and two kids) were in town visiting our son who recently started work in Newport Beach. Someone recommended Pelican Hill and we gave it a try.  Rooms are extremely spacious, and our suite comfortably handled all four of us.  The grounds are spectacularly well maintained and were nice to simply walk.  A beautiful pool is by the main clubhouse, although we did not use it.  The resort also has a well regarded golf course on premises; but again, we didn't play.  Despite our lack of fully using the amenities, the stay was really nice.  Would recommend to anyone, but especially golfers.

Summary Heading: Shangri-La does exist, it's The Resort at Pelican HIll
Summary: If you want to treat yourself to a fantastic experience, visit The Resort at Pelican Hill.  Since 2008, my wife and I have decided this is our favorite destination - bar none.  You won't find a more beautiful setting within a metro area.  Views are stunning.  The property is like an oasis set in the lovely Newport Beach hills.  Facilities and rooms are immaculate.  The guest rooms are large, they are comfortable, and each one has a private outdoor area.  We found the staff members are one of the attractions to this resort; they are all highly trained, very friendly, and go out of their way to pamper their guests.  For example, on a recent visit we were eating in the restaurant "Andrea" (on property).  When our waiter discovered we were celebrating our anniversary, well ... the

I grew up around the area and have since moved back to the East Coast. I wanted to show my girlfriend the beauty of coastal California. The experience was just as I expected - even as a small child I was aware of the luxury that awaits at Pelican Hill. I had dined at their grill multiple times, and it is probably one of the most beautiful restaurants in California. Their guest rooms are spacious and romantic, with tasteful decorations. Because of Pelican Hill's age, I had expected the rooms to be slightly dated. That was not the case - I could not find any signs of age. The room service was quick (but expensive) and the staff could not have been friendlier. Be sure to enjoy your breakfast al fresco at the Coliseum pool. I can't wait to go back.

The best golf course in the southern california.  There are two courses, south and the North.  I personally think the North is more beautiful with the ocean views in every hole.  They have good caddies and the pro shop is very nice too.   the ocean view bungalows are very roomy and it's got very high ceiling and and great balcony.  The villas are ve;ry nice too if you are travelling with family.  A great pool and the restaurants have great food.  It's for everybody, for golfters, for kids, ...... and there are so many nice rerstaurants outside the resort, and great shopping too, for there is a fashion island shopping mall near by.

Beckoned to Pelican Hill for a wedding, we couldn't beat the convenience of grabbing a villa for our family of four to stay at over the weekend of festivities. Where to begin? If you like breathtaking views, stunning architecture, spacious rooms, poolside dining and a bit of elegance, look no further. One might complain that there isn't beach access, but I was willing to overlook that because of the true comfort and luxury of the resort and the fact that few California resorts offer that anyway. Our villa was more like a condo and it came stocked with a few awesome ammenties (Nespresso, milk, mini cereal boxes and beer!). And don't even get me started on how gorgeous the wedding was...!

This resort is absolutely beautiful! We stayed in one of the bungalows and everything about it was perfect......all top notch. The resort is very large so the complimentary shuttle service is helpful when you want to get around and don't feel like walking. The privacy of the bungalow and the entire resort itself, make for a very relaxing stay. My husband played the golf course and I rode along....the views are quite beautiful. The spa is very luxurious with so many services to choose from. If I visit Newport Beach again, I wouldn't stay anywhere other than Pelican Hill.

Summary Heading: Privacy and luxury in an awesome spot
Summary: This is about as close to heaven on earth as you’re going to get—provided you’re willing to tolerate/ignore some of the irritating types who tend to stay there (easy to do; this is a big place).  We have stayed here several times, at different times of the year. The villa options, albeit pricey, work really well when staying with family.  The rooms are ample, with own bathrooms, and the shared space is very comfortable and provides a good focal point for family or group interaction.  The ocean views are unbeatable, and the sunsets on the patio or terrace are to behold.  The villas are very nicely equipped—technology-wise, furnishings, kitchen gadgets, and whatever is not there is a phone call away to the attentive butler.  But the place is sprawling and in-villa dining can

The hotel is secluded from the rest of the area and is surrounded by some of the most beautiful beaches and neighborhoods in California. I was amazed at how nice all of the staff were and how accommodating they were to people with dietary restrictions. The room was so nice and provided lots of privacy while allowing us to park our car and was right in front of the golf course (bring your clubs), the food is awesome and it is so close to LA and Laguna Beach. One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at and would highly recommend!

Summary Heading: Still a great golf vacation but...
Summary: This was our third trip to the resort over the last 5 years.  It's a golfer's paradise with two of the best courses you could ever want to play.  The resort is beautiful and exceptionally well maintained.  However, all four of us on this trip felt that the service at the resort had slipped a bit since our last trip.  The service slippage was most noticeable at the golf pro shop, The Coliseum restaurant and the Pelican Grill restaurant.  It remains a wonderful spot for a 3 to 5 day trip but management needs to get sharper and pay more attention to service levels.

The staff was outstanding, from the personalized service we received at check-in to the detailed one on one event planning with Torri Black.  Pelican Hill is in a league of its own.  The rooms were outstanding suites and a nice change from "hotel" style rooms.   The food was excellent at the pool and in the dining room, where we attended a party in a private room.  The wait staff was also outstanding.   All the little extras made this trip one to remember.  From the Bentley ride to the golf shop to the outstanding views from our patio.

Summary Heading: The Icing on the Newport Beach Cake!
Summary: I had visited this resort several times for dinner and cocktails.  It sits in a gorgeous location in beautiful Newport Beach.  There were some great deals to be in had (under $400)when we visited in March.  Typical California weather- it was in the 80s!  I traveled with 3 girlfriends and we had the double room in the bungalows.  There are additional types of accommodations including 1, 2 and 3 bedroom villas.  They even have houses on the golf course.  Ours was a spacious 900 ft room with a lovely porch, with a view of the ocean, and a magnificent bathroom.  Beds were heavenly.  Parking is right outside the villas so getting your luggage in and out is super easy.   The food on property is FANTASTIC.  You can go high end or medium end- nothing is on the cheap side at this 5 star

I have stayed at Pelican Hill probably ten times over the last 5 - 6 years.   I have found the resort to be an enjoyable stay.  What I object to, and the reason for my negative review, is the misleading advertising that Pelican Hill chooses to send out.  As an example, I received a "Seaside Staycation" email today, which said that if you stayed for a minimum of 3 nights, your stay was between July 5 - August 31, you would receive a daily $100 resort credit.  They state that Bungalow rates starting from $425 per night and Villa rates from $1,395 per night.  So, I call there and ask about a 4 day stay there in later July, which meets their criteria.  I do qualify for the $100 daily resort credit, but the room rate is $795 per night.  I asked what days the $425 rate was available
Manager Response: Bob,   Thank you for taking the time to share you feedback here. I understand your level of disappointment and regret that the starting rate is unavailable during the dates you were looking to book. We value your perspective and appreciate you taking the time to share it here.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We stayed here recently while in Orange County for one night.  This resort sits within the massive master planned area of Newport Coast, and the long winding roads past picture perfect housing and commercial developments reflects that.  We rented a 2 bedroom villa, which has a separate "clubhouse" style registration lobby with it's own lively pool and bistro area.  Many of the villas are fractional ownership, so you will see families here who are very comfortable with the staff and surroundings.  This is different from the main lobby - where you would check in if you had reserved a regular hotel room.  The main lobby is very large, with a very distinct museum-like ambiance.  It seems well suited to corporate events and weddings.  Our villa itself was very nice, but showed signs

Summary Heading: Luxury and Service at Their Best!
Summary: My wife and I just had the good fortune of staying here, and were extremely pleased!  From the moment you arrive, you are greeted warmly, and surrounded by luxury.  The property and views are spectacular, and the room amenities are unmatched.  Each employee displays a pleasure in helping the guests.  Don't miss Andrea's for dinner, and the Coliseum for breakfast!

Great place to stay. Bungalow are FAB, with great views of the sea and golf course. Restaurants are great, nothing to much. Staff helpful if a little over bearing at times. Great pool, had to our self most of the time, and the golf courses are a challenge to all levels.

Summary Heading: The REAL reason why this resort is rated so highly!
Summary: Yes the location is amazing, the facilities are outstanding, the food is great and the overall ambiance is a mixture of tranquility meets sophistication but the REAL defining factor that makes this resort a 10 is the SERVICE.  The concierge (in particular Janid) went above and beyond to make a very special weekend family reunion/birthday celebration absolutely perfect.  She handled everything and made what could have been an emotional roller-coaster easy and effortless.  From boat rides to canyon walks to spa appointments to special decorations in the room to constant phone calls to make sure we were happy - Janid got everything perfect.  The spa staff (in particular Grace) was remarkable - kind/attentive/caring.  Grace understood the very specific issues of my mom who is

I spent 2 nights at this resort for a business meeting and it was wonderful despite their computer systems being down. The rooms are large, luxurious, and have views of the ocean. I think the cost of the bungalows are reasonable. If this resort were in Hawaii or a more frequented vacation destination the rooms would easily go for triple the price. The service here is good but not spectacular. The golf course and forecaddy were incredible and the beverage cart had many  top shelf selections. I would definitely consider staying here again for a staycation or a mid-week getaway.

Summary Heading: Theft of cash and valuables at Villa of Pelican Hills
Summary: Two villas were rented by our family through Andrew sharper travel. On the 1st day after our arrival we visited Universal Studios. Some staff knew of our plans and our plan to pay some of our resort bill with cash. Upon returning from our day out we discovered that cash and valuables had been stolen from both villas. We contacted hotel security and then police to file a report. We were contacted by hotel security late the following morning but not by hotel management until I complained the following afternoon. I was in contact with various asst managers over the next few days and each one seemed unaware that anything had happened. Upper management seemed in no way to accept responsibility, offer apologies, or any plan or need to offer compensatin for our losses or trouble
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid comments. I apologize that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. Based on your phone conversation on Friday, June 26 with the Director or Rooms, we believe your concerns have been addressed and resolved to your satisfaction. As discussed, we do not condone the unfortunate incident described here, as the safety and security of our guests is our highest priority. To that end, we kindly remind our guests to lock their doors and use the provided in-room safes for valuables, especially when upon departing their accommodation. We are confident that these measures help prevent the loss of property, as you experienced. To minimize risk in the future, please know that our staff is always available to personally assist you with securing valuables and doors the next time you choose to stay with us.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Villa with a View in Paradise
Summary: I have nothing but great things to say about Pelican Hill.  We live local and have only stayed here one other time but frequent the resort for spa treatments, restaurant visits and to play golf plus my son goes to the Glen Deck Junior Golf Camp every summer.  Our last visit was fantastic but this trip was amazing-above and beyond expectations.  We had made a reservation to stay in a garden bungalow but at the last minute my brother and his family wanted to come to so I called the front desk and spoke with Griffen to see about adding a room or upgrading to 2 br suite.  Griffen was awesome and gave us a great rate so we could upgrade to a 2br/3 ba ocean view suite with 2200 sq ft.  We got there around noon and Nikolay checked us in and was so great to us.  We were offered a butler

Was only able to stay one night in a bungalow but absolutely loved it. The hotel grounds we gorgeous and the pool was  amazing. Everything was clean as expected and the staff was very kind and helpful. I look forward to spending more time here in the future.

The resort surpassed expectations at the start of a 3 week vacation.  A two bedroom ocean view villa was simply stunning with every possible amenity and I really wished we had booked for longer ! The resort is in a fabulous location and for exploring the Pacific Coast you could not ask for better.  The staff are incredibly helpful, yet not overbearing and nothing was too much trouble throughout the stay.  I should definitely recommend this resort and really do look forward to visiting again

the resort is beautifully set out and very well maintained. We had one of the villas which are very spacious. Very private and quiet.  Comfortable beds and superb bathrooms. The views from the main hotel are stunning. We don't play golf, but rather wish you did when you see the course with the ocean in the background. We ate in the main restaurant and the grill and was very impressed with the food. Wine is incredibly expensive but that seems to be the case in America in general. Our only criticism was that our waitress serving in the grill one evening was obviously in a hurry to get home and we felt very rushed. Have to mention it was only about 9 o'clock. Not what you want when you are spending a lot on your meal and are on holiday .

I had the best time at this resort.  Such a beautiful location, and the entire staff really treated you like royalty.  My group of friends planned a stay here for my bachelorette party, and the resort upgraded us to a bigger suite.  We had a Butler!  He was great, so enthusiastic and gentlemanly.  I had a fantastic time with my girlfriends.  Can't wait to come back!

Truly lovely coastal setting - spacious guest rooms with huge bathrooms and beautiful furnishings, fireplace and very large sea view balcony. The resort has excellent amenities - a huge outdoor pool with shady areas to sit around - a wonderful spa - the beds are superb, all round comfort and I can't wait to return. A treat for all seasons !

The Pelican Hill Resort is first class all the way.  We shared a two bedroom villa with friends of ours and it was the perfect layout to travel with another couple.  Large living room with fireplace and a nicely equipped kitchen.  Bathrooms had great soaking tubs and large showers.  The service at Pelican Hill is outstanding!  Everything from the service at the pool that included complimentary fresh fruit being served every hour to the villa butlers assisting with whatever is needed.  Concierge did a great job of recommending local restaurants and booking a boat tour of Balboa Island for us.  This is truly a five star resort and look forward to staying here on a future trip to California!

The resort grounds are just beautiful. The ocean view bungalow is very welcoming-- especially with the fireplace. Felt like home after a few days. The resort staff were all wonderful. Probably the best maid service I've ever had at a resort. The staff at the Coliseum Grille was good but not quite as good as at the Pelican Grill. Would definitely return.

My wife had booked this place so I had no idea what to expect.  I had flown in after work and was meeting my family who had already stayed here a few nights.  It was dark and mistakenly I had flown into LAX instead of Orange County and it took forever to escape the Friday night LA traffic to get to the resort.  I found our unit, parked in an adjacent parking space outside and walked in.  The lobby of the unit was pretty bland, took an elevator to the second floor, knocked on the door and was let in by my wife.  I walked in and .. it was chaos.  That was due to my wife and my kids lounging around with their stuff all over the place.  But the unit is very large. Over 2000 square feet.   With a large living room/common area.  The kitchen is very nicely appointed.  The bedrooms are

Summary Heading: I rather go on the show Naked and Afraid then sleep one more night here!
Summary: You must start at the top because the fish stinks from the head down. The motto at this resort must be "Just say No" they give very little for what they charge. You will not sleep well in the villas because they have the worst mattresses that are defective. The bath tubs don't drain, the ovens don't work well and forget having a good cup of coffee. The furnishings are suboptimal, all the cushions are completely worn. The lounges at the villa pool are stained and ripping and the sad thing is I could keep going... I don't know if I am just dealing with a Bilionaire slum lord or someone who really doesn't know how a resort should be run... Get rid of all the Mercedes that the butlers are driving around and put the money into the attention to details and quality not quantity of your
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I apologize that your experience fell short of the Five-Star standards you expect and we aim to deliver. In following up on the details you described here, I learned that both the Director of Rooms and Villa General Manager have already reached out to you directly to address your concerns and extended special considerations, given your circumstance. I believe our staff has made extra effort to accommodate your requests. Once again, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect. We look forward to make exceptional improvements during the reminder of your stay.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Gorgeous but management seriously missed the mark.
Summary: We just got back from a 3 day stay. The resort itself was absolutely 5 star - very clean and well kept up with all the amenities. My issues are with the management.  We were staying in the bungalows and I had forgotten to pack my hairbrush so I decided to just go up to the spa and have my hair washed and blown dry. My hair is extremely easy to work with, long and one length. The woman had absolutely no idea what she was doing and got the brush caught in my hair numerous times. I looked like I had been through a wind storm - twice as bad leaving as I did walking in. I went back the next morning to speak with a manager but she (Robin) was on the phone. I left a message for her about my displeasure and was never called back.  My husband and I headed over to the golf course on our
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent visit. I apologize that you experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. I have personally followed-up with the Spa Director and learned that she did try reaching out to you shortly after you departed the Spa. Additionally, please know that we do not condone the actions you have detailed here, as the safety and security of all guests and staff is Pelican Hill’s top priority.   We kindly request an opportunity to speak with you personally, so we may discuss your feedback further. I will provide the contact information for our Director of Rooms separately in a private message, so you may contact us directly at your convenience. Once again, I apologize that you were disappointed in your experience.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Our family had a wonderful end of school vacation at Pelican Hill last week.  The spacious villa was beautifully appointed and the views of the golf course and ocean from the spacious terrace were spectacular. The pools, golf course and spa were all first rate and the fitness classes were complimentary.  We enjoyed lunch at the Colosseum pool and our food was delicious and well priced.  Best of all, the staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly.  One of our favorite activities was to walk down to Crystal Cove State Park and enjoy the beautiful beach and grab a meal at the Shake Shack.  The wonderful weather and great shopping and dining in Newport/Laguna Beach makes Pelican Hill an ideal escape.

If 6 stars existed, Pelican Hill would be in that class.  We spent 2-3 days here a couple of years ago and though the place was incredible.  Our expectations were high when we returned last week but it some how seemed even better than we remembered.  This is truly an exceptional resort which has not left a single detail to chance.  Every single room, or more accurately bungalow suite, is a luxury suite.  The rooms are enormous - close to 1000 SF and every aspect of the room is sensational.  Ours had a king bed with as you would expect sensational bedding.  The bathroom was also fabulous and so was the living area and private terrace - big enough for two full sized chaise lounges. But what is so fantastic about Pelican Hill is that it always surpasses your expectations.  The

Summary Heading: Amazing Resort in a Beautiful Location
Summary: My husband went for a conference and I got to tag along.  It has a five start rating and I think it really deserves it.  Everything was perfect...from the rooms, the bathrobes, toiletries, gym, pool, spa and employees.  The conference provided all the meals and the food was amazing.   I didn't want to leave.

Summary Heading: Disappointing End to a Nice Stay
Summary: My boyfriend took me on a surprise staycation to Pelican Hill for my birthday last weekend. Overall the stay was great. We had a wonderful couples massage at the spa and a wonderful dinner at the Coliseum restaurant. There were a couple of downsides that I didn't expect from such a high end resort though. When we came back to our room after a nice dinner, we noticed that housekeeping had come and we were missing our bed pillows and the down comforter/blankets. We had to call room service for pillows to sleep on that night and I woke up freezing because the lack of a comforter/blankets. We figured that housekeeping had simply forgot and thought nothing of it. Come Monday morning, my boyfriend checks his credit card statement and Pelican Hill had charged him an extra fee of $800
Manager Response: Erin,   Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback. I sincerely apologize that your experience fell short of the Five-Star standards you expect and we aim to deliver. In following up on the details you described here, I learned that our Front Office Manager has already reached out to your boyfriend directly to address your concerns. Please know that we appreciate you taking the time to share your comments here, and we certainly hope to welcome you back in the future for a much-improved experience.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The best way to experience Pelican Bay is to stay in one of their enormous villas. We thoroughly enjoyed our two bedroom villa which stretches out to more than 2,100 square feet. The two bedrooms (one with two queen beds and one with one king) are very large with each having an en suite bathroom.  The sitting area is similarly spacious (with a separate dining area) and there is a full kitchen with a Wolf gas range and full size refrigerator/freezer. There is also a large terrace to just hang out in.   You do have your own garage though it is quite small so if you have a large SUV you may be very challenged to get it in. The villa clubhouse is not easily accessible (we stayed in the North Villas) though you could walk there. You'll likely want to rely on the hotel shuttle to get

Summary Heading: worst most outdated resort in America
Summary: Staff here is the most arrogant conceited handful of worthless people I have ever encountered. Especially Kevin the head of security whom does nothing but lie and berate you for his own amusement. Stay away. Go to the montage if you are looking for a good time.
Manager Response: Patrick,   I regret that you have been disappointed in your experience. Unfortunately, the personal insults posted here about our staff violate TripAdvisor’s content guidelines, so we have requested that those specific comments be removed from your review. In following up on the details you described here, it is my understanding that our security team was called to the restaurant due to the inappropriate behavior you exhibited toward our female servers. When a similar encounter took place a few months ago, our security officers asked you not to return. The safety and security of all guests and staff is Pelican Hill’s top priority. To this end, I have followed up with the security director and addressed this incident in detail.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: While I usually stay at the Peninsula in Beverly Hills, Pelican Hill comes close in service and food  while exceeding with an amazing space and beautiful scenery We stayed in a three bedroom villas and got a nice upgrade to the golf course and ocean view. This is the ideal CA lifestyle for golf and grandeur. While the villa breakfast was expensive, why leave when everything is just excellent?

We stayed in a 4 bedroom villa for 4 nights in late March. It's the best place we have ever stayed worldwide. Can't say enough good things about it. Definitely 5 star! Beautiful unobstructed view of Catalina Island and the golf course. Service was impeccable throughout our stay. Food and service in the restaurants was excellent. The Kids Club was wonderful for our grand daughter.

This property is absolutely beautiful!  The staff, the grounds, the accommodations, the food all perfect.  I travel a lot for work and the staff at this resort were some of the best I have ever experienced.  I would have to say this is one of the most beautiful properties that I have stayed at in the U.S.

I stayed here for a short time. The resort is one of the best resorts I have ever stayed in. Everything is perfect the only think I didn't like was the location it is a bit far away from Los angeles, santa monica and hollywood but it is not a problem since you are close to laguna beach and if you have a car. The resort is really nice, romantic and qauit. The staff was really nice and friendly.

Outstanding resort and one of the best in the world   Service and amenities top notch.  Andrea restaurant outstanding.  Spa is great.  Coliseum pool one of a kind.  The fireplace in the suites great glow to the atmosphere.  Wish I had more time to spend.  Will be back. joe

Summary Heading: This is a real 5 star property
Summary: Went on a golf trip with my sons. My oldest made the reservations so I really did not get a chance to review. I have seen golf ad's about the property but they did not give the hotel enough credit. The property is beautiful. The layout is gives the people in the Villas a  different private experience. My check in was effortless considering we checked in on Mothers Day. The doorman and front desk is in total sync. My room was ready before the time quoted and it was a great room. I started out in a Bungalow and moved to my Villa when my boys arrived. They made the move for me and I wasn't inconvenienced at all.  My checkout had some issues but it wasn't do to the hotel. The booking agent my son used did not communicate to the hotel  all of the credits promised. When I returned I

Summary Heading: Apart from check in a perfect stay
Summary: We arrived after a very long flight to find a queue at check in.  After waiting about 5 minutes a man came out to help the two girls at reception.   He was not particularly welcoming or friendly and we had to hang around till about 4.15pm as the room wasn't ready.   Not a good start but that was our only complaint. The resort is beautiful and the accommodation is to a very high standard. The very extensive grounds of the hotel are lovely and extremely well maintained.  We stayed in a bungalow suite which was huge and extremely tasteful, comfortable and luxurious. It was kept spotlessly clean and the view from the balcony was lovely. There were nice toileteries, a room safe, excellent wifi, in fact everything you could possibly need. Top marks for everyone working in the hotel.

We stayed for 4 nights ocean view bungalow. It was amazing. The service was impeccable and friendly. Gavin the concierge arrange several dinners go us on and off property. We were shocked that he told the restaurants that it was our anniversary and they treated us to candlelit deserts! My husband loved the golf courses. Everyone should stay here at least once. We usually stay at the Montage Laguna Beach. Now we have decided to rotate our annual visits between these two fabulous locations. The views from our bungalow were great.

beautiful location, ocean view bungalow overlooking first hole of south golf course was lovely, fireplace, high ceilings, etc.  coliseum pool a great spot, and dinner at andrea's was delicious (although a few lapses in service).  Biggest complaint is the price.  I realize the nicer hotels often demand steep prices, but breakfast for 2 in the room (pancakes, oatmeal, bacon, milk/juice, potatoes) was $80.  At a certain point, pricing becomes gouging.  and the golf courses, while lovely, are not worth $300 a round, particularly in the condition they were in.  an otherwise exceptional experience that suffered due to ridiculous price points.

Summary Heading: Delicious food, impeccable service, relaxing atmosphere.
Summary: We were staying at a nearby property and visited both the Coliseum Pool Bar and Grill and the Pelican Grill for evening meals. Both restaurants served delicious food and the waiters were attentive, friendly and respectful. Definitely somewhere we would return to.

I stayed here for 3 nights during my trip last month. The resort is located on a hill so you get lovely combined views of the golf course and the ocean. I haven't seen such beautiful blue waters anywhere... The sight is relaxing and beautiful, automatically puts you in vacation mode. I had a bungalow suite booked and it's quite spacious with a large bathroom. The amenities in the bathroom are of very good quality and are available at the resort shop. I personally loved the body lotion and shower gel. You have your own parking space in front of the bungalow which is nice as you don't have to go the main reception area. The pool is a a massive circular one and they have sun decks around the pool so you can easily spend hours reading or just basking in the sun.  I have to mention

We stayed at one of the Pelican Villas.  The villa was large, comfortable, luxurious and had every amenity imaginable.  We had our own garage, indoor fireplace, kitchen with top of the line appliances and small outdoor area.  The clubhouse was only a short walk away and complete with a beautiful pool, gym and bar.  The staff was helpful and attentive, and the resort clean and well-kept.  Overall a great experience but at a cost.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with a few issues
Summary: We stayed here a couple months ago for a weekend get-a-way. Loved the room with the ocean view, the restaurant Pelican Grill was really good  but there were a couple issues I have to mention. The AC was weird....first of all its not intuitive...took me forever to figure out and I couldd not get it to do what I wanted.  The AC could not maintain a steady temperature...it was either too stuffy or too cold all of a sudden...to the point I had a restless sleep. Not sure if it was a related issue but I found the bed to be uncomfortable. I couldn't really pinpoint the exact problem, but I've never had issues with beds at other five star hotels.  Lastly and most disappointing, my husband got a rash all over his back after our stay. Not sure if related to the quality of the sheets or a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback about your experience with us. Please know that it is our priority to offer a pleasant, relaxing environment for all guests and I apologize that this was not reflected in your stay. I have personally shared your valued feedback with management teams in each of the areas detailed in your review. We are addressing the concerns you kindly noted here, as we continually strive to heighten service levels throughout the Resort.   Once again, thank you for offering your input here. I kindly invite you to call the Director of Rooms, Santosh Kuruvilla, directly to discuss your feedback further. I will provide his contact information in a separate message, so you may contact him directly at your convenience.    Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Luxurious resort decorated with Spanish Country influence.  Spa and outdoor pool were both wonderful.  Service was what you would expect at a 5 star hotel.  Our room had a view of the Pacific.  Golf course was premier.  Wonderful food too.

We stayed for five nights in a three bedroom Villa overlooking the Golf Course with Ocean Views.  The Resort is expensive but the service is extremely good.  The Villa was spacious and well fitted.  You have a private checkin building as well as pool area specifically for Villa residents.  The bedding and towels are luxurious and the furnishings are extremely tasteful.   The kitchen is fully fitted and a washer and dryer are in the two car garage.  The patio is so private and spacious - absolutely wonderful. The spa experience was amazing-$300.00 for an 80 minute massage but it was so decadent we forgot about the price.  The only negative for our family  was the Mother's Day Brunch buffet at $120.00 the food was beautifully displayed but they were understaffed, no refilling on
