We only spent one night but it was very special. Everything about our stay was fantastic and we'll be back when we're feeling flush enough for the $500 per night price.  We asked for an upgrade and got an ocean view but I realized after it wasn't that much more money for the view.

This was my second time to stay here and I again found it to be very nice.  I've travelled to Italy four times and coming to this hotel reminds me very much of things I've seen there.  As you enter you cross under what looks like an arched Roman aqueduct and of course the hotel architecture and landscaping is all Mediterranean - or largely so.  It is a massive property such that you use your car to get to your bungalow or villa.  I liked our location in Bungalow 124 as it was still an easy walk to the spa and exercise facility.  The spa was incredibly relaxing and I loved the hot tub.  It reminded me of the Roman Bath in Bath, England (at least as best as I can recall).  There were large arched frosted windows, lots of tile and columns and a very high ceiling.  I had the tub all

We stayed in the villas with another couple.  Booked via Amex travel and were upgraded to a 3 bedroom!  Had fantastic dinner at Italian restaurant...tremendous!  The room, spa, fitness facility and pool were wonderful.  Room service each morning was great and on time!   Looking forward to returning to play golf!!!!

Summary Heading: Too Big and too spread out
Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel for a conference. It is a large spread out venue. My wife had a foot problem; so, it was difficult to walk anywhere for us. The resort does have a shuttle service you can call. However, there is always a wait - not terribly long; but longer than you would like. Also, simple things like ice require a phone call to get. There should be some place to get it yourself. I got tired of imposing on staff; though the staff was very helpful. A nice place; but, I would never return.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback. Please know that I have personally followed up on the transportation service comments you provided. I regret that you and your wife were inconvenienced, and we apologize that your overall experience was less than perfect.  We appreciate your thoughts, as we strive to continuously heighted the overall guest experience. Once again, thank you for your feedback.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Another wonderful experience at Pelican Hill!
Summary: My last visit to Pelican Hill was this past February and it was wonderful this time as well. From the moment you drive into the large circular driveway & check in, you are treated like royalty. Not a single member of the staff have ever failed to impress me with their smile, service, and eagerness to please.  The complimentary valet service from your room to the various areas of the sprawling property is a huge bonus. This means once you park your car, you can leave it parked until you leave or unless you want to go off-property.  The rooms are well kept, the property is well maintained, and the golf course is beautifully kept up as well. Ever get lost or don't know where to locate something? No worries - just ask the first person you see and they're sure to direct you, if not

Loved EVERYTHING about the Resort at Pelican Hill!  We were looking for a quiet, elegant get a way that reminded us of Italy.  WE FOUND IT here!  The bungalow we stayed in was wonderfully appointed, comfortable and quiet.  The grounds and surrounding walking 'trail' were beautiful...never before have I seen such beautiful vista's and grounds.  Hilly, but not a back breaker!  Can't wait to return~

My wife and I visited The Resort as our anniversary getaway weekend. We rented a Villa for over $1,200 a night. We were not happy to arrive at 2:30 pm on Saturday to be told that check in was not available until 5:00 pm. We logically then thought, well we can then check out later the next day, Sunday, to be told that NOOO, check out is at noon. Therefore, your true time to enjoy your villa and resort is very limited. This was our first time here as we usually go to the St Regis Monarch Beach, clearly is going to be out last time at Pelican Hill. Not a bad place, just not worth it, too much of an attitude toward us as guests and we did not see at any point an effort to please the guest.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent visit. I understand your disappointment regarding the check-in and check-out time, which caused your experience fall short of your expectations and our goals. At Pelican Hill, it is our mission and responsibility to provide exceptional service and memorable experiences for each and every guest who chooses to visit the Resort. We care very much about accommodating our guests, and I regret that your visit did not reflect our commitment to Five-Star service standard.   We would like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Director of Rooms separately in a private message. Your candid thoughts are appreciated, as we strive to continuously heighten the overall guest experience. Once again, I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect. Thank you again for your feedback.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We stayed here for four days during a professional meeting held at the resort.  Our room in a "bungalow" was elegant and large; even though we had no view, a small veranda with roses nearby was a relaxing place to read  and enjoy the sun.  The room had a gas fireplace and all the amenities, including plush bathrobes.  Our only concern -- which we learned about at check-out -- was that the in-room coffee service carried an extra charge @ $10 per day for the coffee beans, a surprise given the room cost.  The staff were superb, with service around the pool and the grill meals there very nice.  A breakfast buffet on Sunday morning was $68 per person, too expensive for such a meal, we thought, and the hash I ordered instead was a disappointment --we didn't return for breakfast

Summary Heading: Grand in scale, comfort and service!
Summary: Rarely does one come across a property of such grandeur and magnitude that still manages to make you feel comfortable and at home.  From the moment of arrival, you enter a world of  grand spaces, refinement and service from the gracious valets who take your car to the polite team at the front desk.  The staff here are eager to please. The arresting view from the balcony beyond the front desk overlooks the enormous round pool, over a rolling fairway and out to the Pacific Ocean in the distance.  And it only gets better when you enter your room.  Our bungalow (#422) was as spacious and comfortably appointed as any I've stayed in with a countrified European elegance that is warm and inviting, not stuffy or stiff.  From the high thread count sheets to the casual, generous sitting

I had two days between trips and decided to go see my son who studies in the LA area. Stayed at the Pelican after having read so many excellent reviews. I'm glad I did. Simply one of the most amazing resorts that I have stayed in. Everything was just perfect from the time I checked in, my bangalo, the restaurants, just lived up to my expectations and beyond. Thank you all at the resort. I will defiantly come back

Summary Heading: Not what it used to be
Summary: We have been coming here since the year Pelican Hill opened. We were coming as often as 6-7 times a year for a few years but we have noticed a substantial decline in the service over the past couple of years and now come only 2-3 times a year and each time wonder why we did again. The facilities remain stunning. We stay in the villas most frequently but sometimes in the bungalows and often have friends in separate bungalows or villas. They are impeccably appointed and the pools and views remain the stars of the show.  Unfortunately the food and service never match the quality of the surroundings. People make promises to take care of things and then hours later they have not done anything, finished their shift, never informed anyone, and definitely did not follow up.  It could be
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid thoughts about your visits. I apologize that your recent experience did not meet your expectations and our goals. We strive to provide exceptional service and memorable experience for each and every guest who chooses to visit our Resort, and I am deeply disappointed to read that your visit was less than perfect, especially considering that you have been a loyal guest of ours from the beginning.   We value your perspective and kindly request an opportunity to speak with your personally to discuss your feedback further. I will provide the contact information for the Director of Rooms separately in a private message. Once again, I apologize that you were disappointed in your experience. Thank you for your gracious feedback.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I have been remiss in not writing review until now, as I stayed here in October 2014.  Tonight I was checking for upcoming vacancies, because I had such a fabulous experience at this resort.  What is not to love?  The view is wonderful, and the resort very charming, breath-taking actually.  Very troubling to read some of the reviews.  I have to wonder if those folks are ever happy.  The room was always very clean and the staff went out of their way to ensure the happiness and well being of our group.  The body lotion provided is dreamy, enjoyed by all of us.  I purchased several bottles to take home.    I didn't opt for a massage, b/c I wanted to spend my time enjoying the view and pool.  My traveling companions said the massage was the best ever.  I agree w/ one reviewer, as

I've stayed here a couple times in recent years, and they dot every I and cross every T.  The resort is gorgeous, the grounds are spectacular, the staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  THIS is what a five-star resort is supposed to be.  I can't recommend it highly enough.

This is a simple place to review. Phenomenal food, location, service, scenery, family-friendly resort. It is even better than their website predicted.  The resort is a paradise for all ages and interests - golf, beach, hiking, relaxing, etc

We booked using Amex fine hotels and resorts, upon arrival they upgraded us to a 3 bedroom villa, the villa was clean and in great shape. They put us near the pool which was great for our kids.   Overall a great stay again, like always we will return.

Summary Heading: When fancy is the only thing that will do!
Summary: Resort is really beautiful with Mediterranean architecture and manicured grounds.  Views from most of it are also spectacular!  The golf course is fabulous and the spa is top notch!  The main restaurant is great with indoor/ outdoor dining.   We had the cheapest room which is pricey at 500,  a double queen room,but we did have a slight ocean view, a fireplace and a spacious private patio, Are family of four was comfortable..  The robes and slippers are a nice touch too!  The Pool is big and the same depth across at approx. 4 ft lots of room even though it was busy it felt roomy, great drink and snack service too.  Prices on everything are really high, example cheapest margarita was 18.00, so think Four Seasons or Ritz when planning your trip!

This is a nice resort and overall I had a great experience until I had my items stolen from me.  I checked out of the hotel and realized I had left my iPhone charger and a shirt in the room.  I knew exactly where they were and  told staff within 1 hour of checkout, however they said the room had been cleaned and nothing was found.  I then spoke to Christy or Kirsty the following day simply asking for a credit for the taken items but she refused rudely saying there was nothing they would do. This is certainly not about the money but the principal that my items were not returned to me.  Beware, keep an eye on all possessions.
Manager Response: Steven,   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent visit. The safety and security of all guests and staff is Pelican Hill’s top priority. I apologize that your complete satisfaction was compromised by the unfortunate experiences you described here.   I have personally followed up with our front desk manager. I understand that the manager contacted housekeeping and security managers upon learning of the issue. The front desk manager explained that our housekeeping team did not find a charger in the room, and our security manager has placed a lost and found inquiry for the item. I am disappointed to learn that you chose to threaten our business with posting a poor online review if your demand for compensation was not accommodated.      We would like to speak with you personally, if you wish to discuss your experience further. I will provide the contact information for our Director of Rooms separately in a private message. Thank you again for your comments.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Lovely place - but not quite right
Summary: Friends had recommended this resort so we booked it without reading reviews. After returning, I have read (a lot!) of reviews. I believe that inconsistency of service is the main problem. When service is not reliable and does not meet the expectations of the guest then we are left with a sour taste.   Good points: 1. The place is beautiful. We had a lovely villa - very clean and nicely decorated.  2. Room service came on time for breakfast each morning.  3. One person at the Villa Club house bar was good. Offered to give me water to take to the room and made me a smoothie in a timely manner (I didn't get his name - but he was at least over 25 and had professional customer service skills) 4. The Pelican Grill Lunch was decent and the waiter was professional and attentive.  Here
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback. While I’m pleased to read that you enjoyed the property, I’m disappointed to learn that you encountered anything less than a Five-Star service experience. I apologize that your visit was less than perfect with regard to check-in, housekeeping, Villa poolside service and dining.   Please know that Pelican Hill leaders review and consider each guest’s comments carefully, so that we may continue to improve upon our service standards throughout the Resort. Your candid thoughts are sincerely appreciated, and we would like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your feedback further. Once again, I apologize for the inconveniences you encountered and thank you for providing your feedback here.    Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Everything about the resort was beautiful-the view, the rooms, the lobby, the pool. The service was excellent. The location is fantastic, close to Balboa Island, Fashion Island, Crystal Cove State Park, Laguna Beach etc. The restaurants on the property were all very good. We did spa treatments and the spa is beautiful. The service was exceptional throughout our stay. The only negative is that you have to drive everywhere... to the lobby, to breakfast, to the restaurants. Everything is spread out so it is not like staying at a regular hotel where you walk through the lobby and you can talk to the staff on your way to your room but it is so beautiful that I got over that fast. Definitely a good choice.

Summary Heading: Once a great five star resort!
Summary: I have stayed at Pelican Hill a few times over the past years and have always had an great but very expensive experience.   This time the hotel was very busy, I arrived back to my villa and pulled the covers back to find two spiders, the staff came and changed the bed, the maintenance guy tried to talk me out of spraying saying that the chemicals are very powerful.  He reluctantly sprayed around and behind the bed, i thought the problem was solved, it was not, the next night a new species of black bug had jumped into the bed, this time no one came or seemed to care.    I don't think I will be returning to Pelican Hill again anytime soon.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback about your recent visit to Pelican Hill, and sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you encountered during your stay. It is our highest priority to deliver exceptional service throughout the Resort, and I regret that your experience did not reflect our Five-Star standards, especially knowing that you have been a loyal guest in the past.    I have followed up with each department in the Villas to discuss the concerns you have detailed here. Thank you again for your feedback.     Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: As a returning guest, our late check in should have been anticipated by a phone call ahead of arrival.  No compensation was given, no follow up as a perceived important guest, even though the prior guest was charged 50% for late check out and we were not allowed to check in until 6pm.  Unacceptable.  No followup etc.  Also,  room service was 1 hour and 10 minutes which we can't quite understand how a resort of your supposed standard can live with?  We may have to begin reaching out to the Montage for future stays.....
Manager Response: Jeffrey,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent stay. I’m deeply disappointed to read about your experience, and I would like to extend my sincere apologies that your stay has fallen short of the Five-Star standards you expect and we aim to deliver. Please know I have personally followed up with our management in each area to discuss the comments you kindly noted here. Please know that our Director of Rooms will follow up with you directly at the email you provided in our guest feedback form. Once again, I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect. Thank you for your feedback.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We stayed here in a 2 bedroom villa in December and were over promised services at check in, we chalked it up to a late day and enjoyed the villa so much that despite the poor service we would give it another shot for Spring Break - if there was ANY way I could pull out of the reservation I would have. An absolute rude staff no check in until 5pm after being promised 2pm. For $11,000 a week, I would expect so much more- this is the last time here and in 4 months since the last visit the property has not been taken care of well. Horrible experience and they clearly don't care about their guests experience or service
Manager Response: Jacki,   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I am greatly disappointed to read that your experience was less than perfect. Your feedback is sincerely appreciated, as we strive to improve upon the unfortunate experience you encountered.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Hotel is 5 star but really 4 star because of service. amateurs running housekeeping and guest services. tv system lousy, 2 calls required to get service. food good at pool and golf club  room settings overlooking ocean excellent.  Golf very slow play. restaurant service very good.it ends there.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback. I apologize if your experience was anything less than perfect. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again for another visit in the future.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Stunning property and reasonable grill prices!
Summary: I had dinner here one evening and considering how expensive this resort must be, the dinner was pretty reasonable. The servers were attentive and the basil coconut sauce on the salmon was AMAZING. I would definitely stop here again for another fine dinner. The view of the Pacific Ocean and the resort's pool was beautiful.

Summary Heading: Dishonest despite being a beautiful hotel
Summary: I booked my stay for March 27-29, 2015 for two nights. When plans changed after arrival, I contacted the front desk personnel in person on the evening of March 27, 2015, and inquired as to an early checkout because of the change. I was told that wouldn't be a problem given the fact that the hotel was in an oversold situation for March 28, 2015.  Based on that, I personally checked out on March 28 at 9:00 a.m. and spoke to the front desk who confirmed the check out and that I would not be charged for the second night. I was grateful again and had the $1321.28 charge billed to my credit card.  I received my finalized bill within a few moments by email.  I vacated the hotel immediately.  The following day I received notice from my American Express that an additional $840.74 had
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent experience. I understand your level of disappointment and apologize that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals.   In following up on the details you described here, I learned that our Front Office Agent advised you of the cancellation policy prior to your request to check out and presented you with a copy of your folio. When you spoke with the Front Office Manager the next day, the manager explained our policy again and later extended special considerations. However, I am disappointed to learn that you chose to threaten our business with posting poor online reviews if your demand for refund was not accommodated. Additionally, please know that the Cabana pricing is fixed. Each cabana is equipped with a 30” flat-screen HDTV, BOSE audio and sounds system, and mini-refrigerator stocked with complimentary sodas, juices and water.   We would like to speak with you personally, if you wish to discuss your experience further. I will provide the contact information for the Director of Rooms separately in a private message. Summary: The property here is beautiful and very expansive! Our room was a bungalow with ocean view, stunning well appointed and roomy. Staff was friendly and helpful. Lots of good restaurants around in Newport and Corona del Mar. As we planned our weekend it included massages and facials for the 3 of us.The massages were everything you hoped it to be but the facials fell short by comparison. We have had many facials and this did not hit the mark at all.n It was much more expensive and was not worth it what so ever. Left message for manager who did not call back. During check out let the nice guy at the desk know and he said he will be sure they call us. The pool experience was okay. Our drinks and food seemed to be delivered very late. All and all we enjoyed each others company, hotel

The standard rooms are more spacious than Montage. Love the Service and dinning, over sized pool is nice and spacious. PelicanHill offers the golf course instead of beach access compared to Montage although you still have beautiful ocean view.

First of all I would like to start off by saying that I hate writing a bad review and would never do so unless the service was so terrible that it had to be noted.  I went to high tea yesterday afternoon with a couple of girlfriends that had been wanting to try it out.  We arrived at 2:30 for our reservation and our server Nita came over to take our order and from the get go was extremely rude and unfriendly.  After she brought us our food (which, I might add, she didn't even know how to explain to us what was in the sandwiches and desserts) and champagne, we NEVER once saw her again for the duration of our time there which was TWO HOURS.  It was so unbelievable because not only did we all basically wait on ourselves and pour our own tea, but once the tea ran out each of us

Summary: Wonderful resort. Our room was very large, well appointed, and clean. Our patio overlooked the ocean and the golf course.  Everything was first class. During our trip we golfed, ate in the restaurants, used to work out facilities, and ate at catered business meals.  The food was surprisingly good at the catered to business meals. The hotel has a wonderful walking trail down to the beach as well as around the pelican Hill area. During the conference breaks I was able to catch a shuttle down to the local shopping area.

Summary Heading: The Spa was great, the hotel dated
Summary: I am going to stick mainly with the hotel and it's facilities. I will rate the restaurants under their own titles. The probable with this room is, apparently, that it has been unoccupied for some time. The shower was plugged up, with water reaching my ankles. The next night, the t.v. needed to be rebooted. Both times, the maintenance man did come right away. The thermostat never worked, 71 being the equivalent of 67. I guess the cleaning lady did not notice this, as she left it on each day. My husband called for ice on the first day, new waited 45 minutes and called again. The second time, we left after 30 minutes. vWhen we returned the ice was there, but melted. These small details were enough to make us go elsewhere.

Summary Heading: The BEST place I have every stayed!!!
Summary: The setting is gorgeous, the rooms are outstanding, the food is great and the service is exceptional.  The American Express Platinum card enabled us to get a free upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite which was stunning.

I've only been here with my boyfriend at the restaurant by the pool. The view was amazing. We arrived at the wrong location and the staff called a shuttle to transfer us to the pool restaurant and came a Mercedes Benz black SUV (I was surprised). The waiter Andrew was very friendly and nice and brought some hot water as the morning was a little chilly. We sat along the ring of the circle pool the view was stunning. The food itself was made with fresh ingredients and was delicious and the price was reasonable considering the view we are experiencing. I would recommend this to anyone who can afford it!

Hands down the most amazing place we have ever stayed! Arrived at the end of our three week SoCal adventure for some luxury and were not disappointed! Upgraded to a 4 bedroom villa, Proseco and cheese on arrival, butler on call, housekeeping unpacked for us. The grounds and view are magnificent. The Villa lobby and pool is quiet but a short ride in a Mercedes GL (or scenic 7min walk) will take you to the Colosseum pool and the main lobby, day spa, kids club and restaurants - all of which were exceptional. Warning: be prepared to pay: I think we loved it so much bcse we stopped counting dollars by that stage. Its expensive but worth every penny. Such an amazing treat! We will be back and will certainly stay longer next time.

The rooms, both villas with bedrooms, and the ocean view bungalows have great view, high ceiling, spacious setting, huge bathrooms even great coffees.  If you have children, they have A great pool overlooking the ocean, if you are a golfer, like we are, the courses here are breathtaking. Especially the north course has an ocean view almost every hole and it's a challenging course.  The food is great too.  the restaurants they have, they all have great food, even the cafe next to the golf course.    Nearby, there is an upscale shopping mall and great  beaches. So, there's lot to do here.    Wi-fi was free and great!

Wow. I am absolutely shocked but the horrible quality of service I received while at pelican hill this weekend. I arrived on Saturday after a long drive tired at 430PM just to find out my room wasn't ready which was supposed to be ready at 2pm. For $600 a night the room should be ready but instead of offering me a room that was ready the front desk agent gave me $50 dollars off of my rate. If I wanted to stay in a cheaper hotel I would have. I didn't want to pay such a high rate just to wait in the lobby. This really made me feel like I was staying in a motel 6 not a 5 star hotel. It took the hotel another 2 hours to get my room ready. I'm shocked I paid $600 to check in 4 hours after just to get into a cold room which I could barley sleep in. I wanted to have a relaxing night

Summary: My boyfriend and I live locally and occasionally stay at the resort for a special night or needed staycation. This experience was as exceptional as always. Perfect staff, perfect resort. I do dislike hearing the kids at the pool but I know this going in as they have just one pool. The only thing I do not like about this resort is that the wait staff at the pool restaurant are so slow. The girl was nice enough but waiting 20 mins from the time we sat down for a drink order, 20 more mins to receive the drink order, another 30 to get our food. She never even apologized for the delay, just said "since you've been waiting a while are you ready to order?" I was about to pass out from hunger by the time our food arrived and was at that point so hungry I was physically ill and could

My family just came back from a week at The Resort at Pelican Hill.  We had another amazing vacation there!  We stayed in one of the beautiful, specious 3 bedroom villa that over looked the golf course and ocean.  The pool and spa are fantastic

Summary Heading: Fabulous location and an incredible property, but....
Summary: We were here for a conference. The room was a gorgeous suite with amazing views. The concierge was very helpful but a request for an extra cord for a sleep machine came the next day. When the ice bucket was gone, and I asked for ice, they asked where the bucket went (?!) And charging for the in room coffee seems a bit much...but all in all, I would go back. It really is an incredibly beautiful property.

My wife and I were very much  looking forward to our stay at Pelican Hill.  From the photos, the reviews and recommendations of friends we were excited to experience the hotel.  We have a fairly good reference point for fine hotels and resort experiences as we travel at least 80 nights a year and stay in 4 and 5 star properties in the US and Europe. First, upon arrival this is a stunningly beautiful resort and physical facility, very unique.  We booked through the American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts program that if available offers an upgrade to whatever category room you booked in.  Due to occupancy there was no upgrade available but that is to be understood.  However, the room we were given in the ocean view category was about as bad a room as you could have.  It was on

Summary: My wife and I stayed in January here for a 4 day getaway and we definitely loved it. It was our first time in Newport area and since we were traveling without our kids, we looked for something special to spend a few days away. The property is beautiful. The room where we stayed very large with high ceilings and big bathroom. The service was good even though we did not have a lot of interaction with the staff, practically just when having breakfast at the beautiful restaurant by the pool. The only thing that I think they exaggerated were charging for the coffee that you had available in the room. I would suggest the management to have it included. I was really surprised while checking out, seeing that I got billed for the in room coffee.

Pros: - Beautiful property - Beautifully appointed rooms (fireplace, large patio) - Kids Club staff was stellar - Gelato/coffee bar - great service from one of the workers there - Cookies and milk delivered to our room as part of their welcome service for guests with kids  Cons: - Poor front desk service - they didn't seem competent and empowered by management; zero follow through with problem resolution   - Spa - nail technician showed up 25 minutes late. Just got an apology, didn't even seem like a sincere one.   - Overcharged on bill. DOUBLE CHECK your final bill before checking out.  When they tried to adjust it, we realized they actually charged us more.  No follow through from the front desk manager.  - Wait staff - our male server was indifferent and gave poor service.
Manager Response: Genesis,   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I want to apologize for the inconveniences you encountered during your stay. I am disappointed that these oversights impacted your overall experience at Pelican Hill. Please know that I have followed up with the front desk, spa, restaurants and housekeeping managers to address the feedback you have graciously detailed here. The Resort does offer complimentary nightly turn-down service, and I regret that this was not reflected in your stay.   Once again, I apologize that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. We kindly request an opportunity to speak with you personally to discuss your experience further. I’ll provide the contact information for our Director of Rooms separately in a private message. We sincerely appreciate your feedback.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This is definitely not a 5 star resort by the service of the staff. The staff is very rude. Vivian had a non perfusion all attitude with me. Just horribe.  The view is 5 star but not the front desk service.  I'm here for a wedding and lots of money is getting spent at the girls at the front desk need to find a different job.

I will provide the contact information for the Director of Rooms separately in a private message. Once again, we apologize that your experience was less than perfect and thank you for your feedback.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: we've tried this resort 12/15 times because our children live nearby...every time we stay we leave saying we're never coming back again...hoping they could figure it out and they simply don't have a clue. We talk to Management every time...they apologize and it's worse next time.  Good example...yesterday we went out at 11:00 am...came back at 2:30..room had not been cleaned...left again came back at 5:00...room not cleaned ( they claim this is five star resort ) . Called front desk to ask how do we get the suite cleaned...the guy actually said we to wait in line for this service and it would be better to call a nd request this service .. I said your kidding..he said no.  At 7:30 same morning we drove to the spa (Sunday am ) there wasn't a person anywhere. As we walked in..a

Please know that I have personally followed up on housekeeping and valet comments you kindly detailed.   We value your perspective and kindly request an opportunity to speak with you personally to discuss your experience further. Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: 4.5 star experience at a 5 star property
Summary: This was a girls trip to celebrate friend's "Big" birthday.  The property deserves 5 stars, hands down.  The buildings are beautiful, well decorated and well maintained.  Our rooms were attractive and comfortable.  The fixtures and finishings were what one would expect at this price tag.  Our experience, however left a little to be desired.    Upon arrival, after checking in, we asked where we could enjoy a small lunch we had brought.  We were directed to several different options, including a patio area just outside the main reception hall.  There were no other guests to be seen.  Shortly after unpacking our food, we were approached by a different employee who told us that no, we could not eat food that we had brought, that rather we would have to purchase something from the

We loved our stay at the The Pelican Hill resort.  It is in a great location and the property is well maintained. The staff is very friendly and quite helpful.  We had a lovely birthday dinner in their signature restaurant and the food was excellent.  We especially liked the bungalow rooms with their generous patios and gorgeous Pacific Ocean views.  The bathtub and bathroom was huge and the room well appointed with a very comfortable bed and couch. I especially loved that our car was parked right outside our door.

We spent a week in a two bedroom villa with a garden view.  The resort and the villa are stunning. The two bedroom villa was very well sized for a family of 5.  The staff is warm and welcoming and responsive to all requests. As noted in some of the other reviews, food service is extremely expensive and not entirely prompt -- but this is one point in an otherwise flawless stay.  We enjoyed two of the excursions you can book through the hotel, kayaking and surf lessons and both were amazing.  One note, all two bedroom villas are in the north of the resort and the only difference between ocean and garden view of the former is on the third floor and the latter is in the second of the same building.  Some of the harsh complaints in other reviews seem to be expectation-based; as in "I

I stayed one night here for a business meeting. The room or bungalow where I stayed was very nice and comfortable but a few things kind of bothered me. 1.  The fireplace in the room is cool (I'm not even sure if it is a real functioning fireplace) but inside of it was filthy - very dusty and it some sort of trash in the bottom mixed in with the rocks.  Looks like it hasn't been cleaned in months. 2.  The toilet lid / seat in the bathroom was about to fall off. I tightened it up by myself no problem but it makes me wonder when it was truly last cleaned. If it had been cleaned - the housekeeping staff should have noticed it was very loose and had it fixed prior to the next check in. 3.  I decided to make a pot of coffee in the room (there's a nice coffee pot with grinder and bags
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback, so we may improve upon the unfortunate oversights you kindly detailed here. I apologize if your experience was anything less than perfect. I have personally followed up with our housekeeping and maintenance teams to address your concerns. As your perspective provides us with the opportunity to heighten the overall guest experience, my Director of Rooms would like to discuss your experience further. I will provide the contact information in a separate private message. Thank you again for your candid comments about your recent stay.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Service Standard-- Don't Let it Slip
Summary: We love, love, love this hotel.  The grounds, restaurants, and the rooms are gorgeous.  Location is fabulous.    This last visit we noticed that the service standard had dropped.  There were major delays in deliveries of room service, some of the staff didn't have answers to basic questions, etc.  Maybe we caught the hotel in a transition of new hires, but it was a noticeable difference between this visit and the previous visit as far as staff's expertise.    We will go back and still highly recommend this lovely hotel.

Participated in a girlfriend reunion this past Valentine's weekend. Three of us stayed in one suite.  Suite decor was beautiful & very clean.   Overall, this hotel is stunningly beautiful & pristine with amazing ocean views and very memorable.  HOWEVER, the service was disappointing.     Following are some of the service issues we experienced: Room wasn't ready until 5pm for check in.   Appetizer amenity ordered wasn't delivered until the following day No turn down service.     No extra bedding for the sleeper sofas.  Resorted to using bath towels for blankets Coffee maker broken so we requested pitchers of coffee be brought to our room, which were sent timely, but no creamer included.  Requested creamer 3 times.  In lieu of creamer a plumber showed up with plunger in
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback here. While I’m pleased to read that you enjoyed your visit, I’m disappointed that we did not deliver a positive service experience for you, as we intend to provide for each of our guests. I have personally followed up with our management of each area to discuss the comments you kindly noted here. We value your perspective and kindly request an opportunity to speak with you personally to discuss your experience further. I will provide the contact information for our Director of Rooms separately in a private message. Once again, I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Just an amazing place. I spent three nights in an ocean view bungalow and this was a first class experience all the way. The staff is friendly and helpful, the hotel is beyond gorgeous and the rooms seem to have been constructed with the objective of recreating an Italian villa with cost being no object. I am very familiar with the hospitality industry and it can usually poke holes in any hotels standards of service, cleanliness or presentation; however I could find nothing at this fine resort to knock them on. The food is very good as I ate both at Andrea’s and at the Coliseum Grill at the huge round pool. The last work is actually the first thing you see. The hotel has constructed a gigantic replica of a roman aqueduct as a cart path to get golf carts over the main entrance

We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa the week after New Years 2015. This is a very quiet time of the year and was perfect for our family. It is an enormous resort and there are 2 separate areas to stay . The Villas  and the bungalows. The Villas are away from the main resort area so you do feel removed from the rest of the resort ,but we loved that part. The Villas have their own pool , restaurant, beautiful lounge area and work out room with showers . We also loved this because it was much more private than the main big coliseum  pool.  The 2 bedroom villas are across the road from the 3 and 4 bedroom villas. Our villa was beautiful ! The beds were very comfortable and the villas very clean. The view was beautiful with Catalina Island in the distance. However all the 2 bedroom villas

Was here for a business conference, and found the hotel to be very large and with excellent amenities. The staff were very friendly and for such a large hotel, the valet service was very quick and efficient. The room was very clean and suitable for my needs.

First ocean view turned out the view of the parking lot and bungalows.  We ordered room service at 7:30 and at 10pm was told it's gonna be another half hour.  Territory is just a big parking lot with a golf course. Huge grounds yet no place to walk around and enjoy the view.  Service is below average , in the restaurant they brought us food and then it took about 10 minutes to bring forks ????
Manager Response: Svetlana,  Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback about your stay with us. I sincerely apologize that your experiences were less than perfect. Please know that what you encountered is the exception, and not the rule.   Based upon your comments, I have personally addressed your concerns regarding room view, in-room dining and restaurant service with each department manager. Pelican Hill leaders review and consider each guest’s comments carefully, so that we may continue to heighten the overall guest experience.   I appreciate your perspective on the resort grounds and regret that you did not have the opportunity to walk around to enjoy the view. Please know that Pelican Hill spans more than 504 acres overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Guests are invited to take in the ocean vistas and stroll the alfresco promenade walkways and tree-lined lanes around the grounds.   Once again, thank you for offering your input here. I kindly invite you to call the Director of Rooms directly to discuss your feedback further. I will provide his contact information in a separate message, so you may contact him directly at your convenience.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: The best place in Orange County
Summary: My wife and stayed here for a business conference and thoroughly enjoyed the pampering and luxury.  It is expensive but worth every penny.  The amenities and were incredible. Good location next to beach. Professional staff that understands professional standards and courtesy.  The bed was  a  little hard. That is my only complaint. Rooms and amenities were outstanding.  Spa was great. Golf was a nice memory overlooking the ocean.

Fabulous resort, great service but not walking distance to the beach. The villas are set into well established vegetation and the ocean view is spectacular. The coliseum pool is heater with spectacular views of the sunset. The villas are quiet and large with vaulted ceilings and a gas fireplace.

I stayed for a few days to attend a business meeting but did not have a chance to enjoy most of the on site amenities. The resort is top notch and the bungalow room was spacious and well appointed. This is definitely one of the best resorts that I have visited in my travels.

Stayed here for 3 nights form the 27/1-30/1. Hotel is beautiful. Rooms are amazing. Staff helpful attentive and so friendly and nothing was a concern. Would have no hesitation in staying there again. The Day Spa is amazing the staff there cater to your every need and it was an absolute pleasure to visit.

Wonderful trip.  Husband on business.  Stayed in ocean view bungalow.   Gorgeous room with fireplace ...large patio...large bathroom.   Could have more shops as not easy to leave property unless you have a car.  Free Shuttle to upscale outdoor mall very nice.   Husband loved the golf courses.   Not happy with housekeeping.

Summary Heading: A stunning uncrowded property with fantastic pool
Summary: My family of four, with two ten year olds, had the opportunity to stay at Pelican Hill for a few days.  Not being one for too much pomp and circumstance I was lukewarm about going to this despite the fact that is one of the premier resorts in the world.  However I realized once we arrived that this is the case for a reason.  The staff was extremely friendly, prompt and helpful when we made any requests.  Our daughter forgot something in the kids club and a staff member quickly helped us retrieve it when we couldn't immediately make it back.  We found out that they will also ferry your children to you from the kids club if you are elsewhere on the property and need them picked up.  We were there over the holiday and they had truly the most amazing gingerbread village set up in

Wow. What a place. Very quiet but upscale resort on the hill in Newport coast. Close to beach and shopping at fashion island. Fee valet and wifi. Everything I could ask for! Well trained staff. Professional from check in to check out. Highly recommended.

This evening I ordered food to my bungalow. My server Shane offered great service and was very welcoming and friendly. The food was delicious. I will definitely be coming back again and recommending this place to others!

I had the pleasure of staying at The Resort at Pelican Hill for a business conference in December 2014. All I can say is "wow". I travel a lot for business and for pleasure and this had to be one of the nicest hotels, if not the nicest that I have ever been to. The rooms are set up as private villas, each with their own fireplace and balcony. Mine had unspoiled views out over the Spanish tiled villas below me and out to the Pacific. It was gorgeous. Most of our meals were catered for our event, but I did enjoy a lovely breakfast in their restaurant and a few after dinner drinks at the bar. If only my husband could have accompanied me it would have been a perfect few nights.

Summary Heading: Weekend Stay-cation with the Kids - Family Friendly Luxury Resort
Summary: We decided to spend the weekend of Thanksgiving at Pelican to celebrate my husband's birthday. We are local, and it seemed like most of the other guests were as well. Despite its luxury, the resort is approachable and very family friendly!   We stayed in a 2 queen bungalow, ocean view, with our 2 kids. The room was clean, with beautiful high ceilings, comfortable beds, a nice wet bar area, and a spacious bathroom. We had a crib, there was a stuffed pelican waiting for the kids, as well as kid's bath amenity, and a beautiful plate of birthday chocolates for my husband, very nice and appreciated touch. The room was excellent, but the ocean view left something to be desired; we were facing an odd angle over brush, and given that check in is in the afternoon, the sun set early, and

Possibly the most beautiful place I have ever stayed.  The bungalows are stunning, quiet and the terraces have great privacy.  Lovely bathrooms and products.  The spa is breathtaking, the pool is divine.  You can easily forget your troubles here.  My only regret is not staying for longer.

Summary Heading: It is a fabulous place to stay in. Point blank.
Summary: The property is awesome. The. Staff and service is perfect. Heaven on earth. Our room ocean view you can see the sunset. The ceiling is like 5 meter high and fire place so spacious and comfortable. They have thought of everything. The gym is also grest!!!

When I walked into my room I thought it looked more like a honeymoon suite than a hotel room for a business meeting.  This place is gorgeous and the service top notch.  This sprawling property is divided into two types of places to stay:  bungalows and villas.  The villas are several bedrooms with a shared living area.  I stay in a bungalow.  I was in room 443.  It had two queen sized beds, a fireplace, a bar, a desk with two chairs, a reading chair and a gigantic bathroom with a window that looks out straight through the room and out the terrace door.  The ceilings must be 30' high.  The terrace has two lounge chairs and table with chairs.  I melted into the bed each night - it was so comfortable.  The bath products are made specifically for Pelican Hill and are wonderful.  To

We enjoyed a 2-night pre-holiday staycation here, booked kind of last-minute thanks to an online flash sale.  I was familiar with this resort, but this was our first stay.  First off, be aware the resort is situated in the hills above the ocean, not directly adjacent.  Ocean views are thus on the horizon, not unlike those at the St. Regis Monarch Beach a few miles down the road.  Between the resort and the Pacific are the resort's golf courses and clubhouse/restaurant, Marriott's Newport Coast Villas Vacation Club (timeshares), busy Pacific Coast Highway and Crystal Cove State Beach.  The hotel can shuttle you to the beach in one of their Mercedes minibuses.  The resort is situated on over 500 acres with architecture inspired by 16th century Italian architect Andrea Palladio.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Destination but Staff Don’t Deliver!
Summary: Pros:  beautiful property, great views of ocean from villa, villa nicely appointed, washer/dryer available in villa garage, multiple beautiful vanishing edge pools, convenient location between Newport Beach and Laguna Beach, 25 minute drive to Orange County airport.    Cons:  many staff do not speak English and communication is difficult, housekeeping staff are lazy, do a poor job cleaning and fail to follow simple requests, villa is not stocked adequately with basic supplies, butler service is unreliable, concierge staff are not adequately knowledgeable of property amenities, 2 car garage too small to easily park 2 vehicles, unreliable wireless internet, multiple issues with non-functioning kitchen appliances, management does not follow up timely with complaints.  Exercise room
Manager Response: Mark,   Thank you for taking the time to post your thoughtful feedback about your recent visit. I apologize that your experience did not reflect our Five-Star service standards, which we strive to deliver to each and every guest.   Based upon your detailed comments, I have spoken with the Villa GM and personally addressed your service concerns regarding housekeeping, engineering and villa butler with each department manager. We value your perspective and appreciate you taking the time to share it here. We would like to take a moment to speak with you to discuss your feedback further. Please know that I am sending a private message with the contact details for our Director of Rooms, so we may connect with you directly at your convenience.   Once again, I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future for a much-improved experience.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Had the opportunity to stay at this resort as part of a business conference.  What a treat!  It even made sitting through endless presentations enjoyable.  The staff is excellent and everyone seems truly interested in helping you enjoy your stay.  If you can think it, they can probably provide it.  The rooms are luxurious and the villas are unbelievable.  I don't think there's a bad view at the resort unless you fear the Pacific.

I visited pelican hill for 5 nights . Stayed in a bungalow. Everything was brilliant. The staff were attentive and effective the room was nice with a separate large bath  a large shower. The room was quiet had a fire place. The view was not great as I was in 210 and obscured by lower villas but that did not bother me. The gym is a little small.

This resort is excellent, truly a gorgeous facility in every way. The suites are beautifully and comfortably furnished, and our ocean-view terrace was large and had a splendid view of Catalina.  We tried all the restaurants several times. The food was great, and with just one exception, the service was fast. It is located in the hills set back a bit from the ocean, but a beautiful beach is just down the hill, and we enjoyed it every day.

So, I've been to this property a few times, along with many other 5 star / 5 diamond properties.  Every time I come to Pelican Hill one of my "life mantras" enters my head as pass under the impressive arches guarding the resort  that seem to resemble the what I imagine the gates of heaven to look like.    - In life, be frugal in all things - but spare no expense for Education and Vacation.  Education will unlock doors of opportunity that grow your world view and change you to the core..  Vacation will grow fond memories with loved ones that will never be forgotten and give meaning to life itself.    To vacationers of all types.  Do yourself a favor and go to The Resort at Pelican Hill.  It's perfect.

We've stayed here on three occasions: my last 2 birthdays (in October) and Mother's Day...beautiful and relaxing! Just love the bungalow type accommodations with parking (free!) nearby. The views are spectacular, varied dining options (note to Montage--get with it, you need a snack cafe on your property--Pelican Hill, St. Regis and the Ritz-Carlton all offer them) and the best spa amenities in terms of value. Lovely pool as well. We truly feel rested after a visit here, removed from the typical hotel commotion. A word here concerning the website Whatahotel.com--It's terrific!!! We've been using it for 7 years and LOVE the value of its package deals...check it out. The agent, Richie Massa, is amazingly helpful and always gets back to you quickly...thanks, Richie, for 7 years of

We spent 7 nights at Pelican Hill over New Years this year. I brought my family. We had two rooms. When we walked in the lobby, we were so impressed. It was beautiful, tasteful and the view out the back was spectacular.  We did get there early and attempted to check in. They told us at the desk that we had a 3pm check in. We left our phone number and one of our rooms was ready by 3pm. At 5pm I went to the front desk and asked about the second room. The young man at the desk essentially blew me off. He was insulted that I would ask where my room was even thought it was two hours late. We were told it was being cleaned. No apology. We got to our second room and the carpet was wet. When I called and asked about it I was told it was just steam cleaned and it must not have dried yet.

This is our second stay overnight  and we've been there many times for meals, pool, etc as we are locals.  After reading many reviews in the past, it seems that the service is what's complained about often, and I would have to agree.    The physical aspect of Pelican is undeniably beautiful.  It's going to be pricey so I have no complaints about that.  When a resort is operating at this level, it's the little things that get magnified.  When we checked in we were automatically upgraded to a 2 bedroom villa.  No questions, no choice...just the upgrade. We never consented beforehand.  Please ask the guest if they want an upgrade. Simple.  Maybe we wanted to be closer to the coliseum pool, maybe we didn't want to drive further to get to the coliseum pool, maybe we didn't want to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your candid thoughts. I sincerely regret that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. In following up on the details you described here, I learned that our Front Office Supervisor has already reached out to you directly to discuss your concerns. Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I have spent 5 nights in this hotel during my vacation in California.  I have stayed in the four bedrooms villa, which has an ocean view, spacious and meticulously clean.  What I liked about this hotel that its feels more like an upscale neighborhood rather than a conventional hotel.

Back to Pelican Hill for third time over the holidays, but rented a villa this time and did some entertaining through the hotel's in-room catering folks. Courtney Gladney,couldn't have been more helpful and everything was far beyond my expectations. Food quality and presentation were extraordinary and the service, unmatched. My mother wants to adopt banquet server Bilal, but everyone--butlers, concierges, desk, room service, housekeeping, drivers--were all extraordinary. This is going to be a tough vacation to top!

Beautiful hilltop setting, fantastic views, pools, spa, golf course  What else can you say. Had a wonderful relaxing time here. Villas are beautiful. Not beachfront, so if you want that and want 5 star  resort you will have to go to the Montage or the Ritz further south.  Have been to all and this is more serene and relaxing though the other resorts are nice as well. They are all expensive but you get what you pay for.

I took my family here for the New Year's holiday. 11 people. Six children and five adults. We had a 4 bedroom unit and a 2 bedroom unit for 6 nights. I knew it would be expensive but I expected good service and amenities. I got neither. This might be a good place to play golf but don't bring your family.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid thoughts. I regret that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. Summary Heading: Lacks personality & warmth. Way too expensive for what you get.
Summary: In general, I found the hotel to lack personality & warmth. Some of this is the architecture of the hotel (very spread out and empty-feeling).. part of it also is the complete lack of warmth or sincerity on behalf of the staff. They seemed annoyed whenever you asked something. Our key did not work to our room and the staff seemed completely annoyed, "Can you try it again before we come out to help you?" Since the rooms are far from the main hotel we had to run and track down someone on a golf cart to eventually help us and verity that indeed our key did not work.   They have a coffee machine in the room but will charge you $$$ to make coffee yourself...ridiculous For $400/night can I not get free coffee in the room, like most motels even have?  There were 3 of us in the room (we
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid thoughts about your visit. While I’m delighted to read that you enjoyed the room and wellness activities offered at the Spa, I am troubled to know that we did not deliver a positive experience for you and your group, as we intend to provide for each of our guests.   I have personally followed up with the management of each area to discuss the comments you kindly noted here. We value your perspective and kindly request an opportunity to speak with you personally to discuss your experience further. I will provide the contact information for our Director of Rooms separately in a private message. Once again, I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The grounds are fabulous, the rooms luxurious and large. The staff go out of their way for you. Room service breakfast and dinner took at least 60 minutes on all 5 occasions. Housekeeping and communication was lacking. Dirty glasses, room not cleaned in 2 1/2 hour requested window. Turn down service 2 hours later, and had to request vacuuming of room. Certainly not what I would expect from a 5 diamond and the $600 room rate. A $15 bottle of champagne not much of a consolation for 5 night of less than stellar service
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback. I regret that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. Your candid thoughts are appreciated, as we strive to continuously heighten the overall guest experience. I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect and thank you again for your feedback.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We stayed at the Villas at Pelican Hill for a family vacation. We reserved a four-bedroom villa and it worked out perfectly. The villas have a separate pool, gym and dining area as well. The kitchen with the villa is fully stocked and we were able to have our meals in the villa. The bulter service is very convenient. They drove us to the restaurant and is willing to drive us to the beach and meet really any of our needs. We connected with the service beforehand and our refrigerator was stocked with food and drinks beforehand.   We planned to have a large “get-together” for family for a 50th wedding celebration for parents at the villa. Easily accommodate 25 people for a dinner party Working ahead to villa catering we were able to put together a beautiful dinner and we had

My wife and I celebrated our 20th Wedding Anniversary and spent a weekend here at Pelican Hill. We did a bit of research using Trip Advisor and had narrowed our choices down to Pelican Hill and Terranea Resort.      We ended up choosing Pelican Hill and I registered for the “Exclusive Privileges VIP Status.” As we live relatively local in SoCal, I figured we may be using the resort more than once.  After receiving our “Exclusive Privileges” card I contacted the resort via email to arrange for reservations.  The response was very prompt and helpful and we received the special rate as advertised.  CONCIERGE SERVICES - As we were celebrating our anniversary I made mention of this when I contacted the concierge and they did a fantastic job of accommodating our special weekend. I

My wife and I recently spent 3 nights at this resort. It is truly beautiful and the staff is excellent. The only downside is it's very expensive. it is unique in that you are giving your own bungalow. Our bungalow was over 800 square feet with its own fireplace and a patio overlooking the Pacific Ocean at a distance. It's a very romantic place with a great restaurant called, the Coliseum restaurant. We ate there many times and it was always delicious. The gym is great and there is a very nice free spa area for relaxation. Overall, I would give it very high marks but it is expensive and we spent approximately 500 dollars per night for our stay.

We recently went back to the resort at Pelican Hill.  The Resort is incredible.  We stayed in the Villas which were very spacious and beautiful. My wife and I are avid golfers and we have played both beautiful courses previously.   We were very disappointed in the condition of the South Course. The greens and fairways were well below what we expected for the money.   The North course was in excellent shape.  If you go do not play the South Course until they get it into proper shape. I would guess it will take at least 6 months.

We have stayed at Pelican for many years. The resort has definately gone down hill. I even looked the resort up online to see if there was an ownership change. They must have made some significant budget cuts. It shows. Here are the issues:  1.  They blatantly lied about available American Express room upgrades. I booked $1000 a night 3 bedroom villa. Upgrades were available, but the staff is noe teained to immediately say that they are full. They weren't.   2.  Everything is a little dirtier now.  The rooms are not clean like they used to be. There were spiders in the bathroom and urination on the floors.   3.  Maid servie didnt show up until 3:30pm. Thats annoying. When i called to request maid service in the morning, i was immediately told a script that said that housekeeping

Summary: The property, the view, the public spaces, the rooms are all big and grand.  The service is attentive. The location is great for exploring Orange County.  Food is good. Recommened For a getaway for several days.

Two words to describe this place: beautiful & exquisite.  We had the good fortune of attending a friend's wedding here, and wow, what an experience!  We stayed 2 nights in a 2 bedroom villa and by far this is the nicest resort we've ever stayed at.    The ONLY criticism I have is that they charge for the in-room gourmet coffee.

Summary Heading: Relaxing in the hidden beauty of the Newport coast
Summary: up on a cliff overlooking the CRYSTAL COVE STATE PARK, a must go for those seeking excellent service, beauty , options, golf, pool, views. This is not the hub bub place like other other hotel/resorts in the area. Don think see and be seen. Think, relax, unwind. Walked on the beach everyday amongst the beautiful state beach park and the cozy cottages of Crystal Cove, the history abounds. Wow what a charming discovery of beach cottages built in the early 1900's.  fabulous restraunts with views of the sunset on property looking out at the Newport Coast and Catalina island in the distant.

Pelican Hill is simply incredible. The resort is spread out in an arc overlooking the Pacific Ocean and has to have one of the most spectacular views and settings in the continental US. It patterns itself after a luxurious Tuscan seaside resort and succeeds on every level. Everything is high end, including the price, but not over the top or pretentious. The hotel staff are amazing. Friendly, helpful, but also give you needed space.  The rooms are very large and with every amenity one could possibly imagine. The coffee grinder and brewer are a particularly nice surprise. Each room has a large balcony with lounge chairs and a view of the ocean. I did not stay in the villas but heard they were incredible.  The food is authentic Tuscan cuisine with a few California twists that just

Summary Heading: A little too pricey with excellent view and service
Summary: We stayed there in the villa for small classmates reunion. The villa offers basic supplies (milk, cereal, plates...) and for the first run, it's free. The coffee machine is out of order which made the coffee tastes like water. The wifi was really slow during daytime but fast after midnight. The villa comes with 4 bedroom.  One is twin beds, two with king, one with queen. We have ocean view and a patio and beach chairs to enjoy the view. There are four full baths.  Inside the garage there are washer and dryer with the laundry supplies which is very considerable. Walking along the villa area was quiet and nice. There is a stationed security gate in front of the main gate of villa area. The whole experience was good but the price is a little too high.

What a wonderful experience!  From check-in to departure, our stay at Pelican Hill could not have been more perfect.  The bungalow room we stayed in was spacious and kept very clean.  We dined at The Grill and Andreas, and both were fantastic.  Finally, every member of the staff we encountered was courteous, welcoming and warm.  What a place!  We will definitely return!

Summary Heading: World class Resort and Luxurious accommodations!!
Summary: Pamper yourself at the finest resort in North America! Imagine a five-star resort with breathtaking ocean views In Newport Beach California... World-class accommodations, Five star dining, The ultimate spa experience, Challenging golf with breathtaking ocean views, Private butlers to chauffeur you around this authentic Tuscan Italian themed resort! And a personal concierge to attend to every need and desire that will maximize your stay at The Resort at Pelican Hill. Posh, Over-the-top Bungalows and Villas will make you feel right at home... During our stay we truly felt like we were in Tuscany. From the Italian architecture to the transplanted hundreds of thousands of authentic olive trees throughout this gorgeous property. This is a must stay resort for anyone looking for a

This is an extraordinary hotel even if you do not play golf. There are lots of hiking trails, walking distance to beautiful beaches and ocean and terrific food. The restaurant Andrea has wonderful fresh pasta and the risotto melts in your mouth. We stayed in bungalow 216. It has a balcony and ocean view.

My wife and stayed here back in 2012.  This resort is amazing!  The service and staff treat you like royalty.  The ground and facilities were spotless.  While we were there we went whale watching and enjoyed some of the great dining in the area like Mastros.   I highly recommend if you ever get the opportunity to visit this place to take advantage of it.  It by far the best resort we have even stay at.

We had 5 amazing nights in this fantastic resort. We stayed in one of the bungalows; very luxurious and comfortable. The bathroom is very spacious with two separate sinks and a roomy walk in shower. There is also a bath tub for those who like to take their time ... The bungalow had Bose equipment where we hooked up the iPad to and played our own Spotify playlists. In the morning we enjoyed a freshly brewed cup of coffee on the terrace overlooking the ocean.  The beds are super. Very comfortable and after a 15 hours journey, it's hard to get up ;-) But you have to because this resort breaths tranquility under the Californian sun and you do want to explore what this resort has in store. There is restaurant Andrea, Italian cuisine. Fine Italian dining outside on the terrace and if

If you want a quiet, high end, luxurious retreat to nurture and pamper your soul in Orange County - this is it. Whether you choose a regular room or one of their gigantic villas, both are equally clean, roomy and have amazing views. Service is top notch, room service efficient and the amenities in the hotel (pools, gym, golf course, restaurants) are equally excellent. Try Andrea's for dinner - probably the best Italian restaurant in Orange County. Lunch by the pool is always a good idea - food is light, healthy and delicious. If I have business in the OC, I stay here.

Two great golf courses, fantastic ocean view room, great restaurants and meals, super spa, all combined with extrodinary service. Four wonderful days! A complete package that makes for a completely relaxing stay in a beautiful location.

Summary Heading: Amazing resort , breath taking location & first class service
Summary: we selected to stay in one of the bungalows, approximately $500 a night. Appointments were luxurious and extremely comfortable, a very private patio with gorgeous sunset views. Pool is 24 hour access, a novelty compared to the hours for most resorts. Food and drinks were of top quality, we very much enjoyed our private bartender sent out to our room. Golf course and grounds are amazing reminiscent of Pebble Beach.

We stayed at the North Villa's for one week & it was absolutely perfect. The fact that I had 2 1/2 baths, and a welcoming living room made our SoCal trip truly relaxing. The full kitchen was a nice feature, but we didn't use it. The bedrooms were quite spacious and well appointed. The only drawback- terrible dresser space. we pack HEAVY and found that we really could have used more drawers. The Villa was quiet, had gorgeous views and we just loved the space.  The villa pool, while not as stunning as the Coliseum pool, was much nicer. The chairs had the proper amount of space between them, the actual area was larger and the views were also gorgeous. Even the menu was superior.   The standout employees that made us feel pampered and special, true Five Diamond type staffers? Joey

Summary Heading: Grand Italian style in Newport Beach
Summary: Lets get the obvious out of the way.  This place is expensive, very expensive.  I would not think of paying there summer rates but a 3 bedroon villa in mid November was very comperable to 3 rooms at a ritz or 4 seasons and offered much more.  Upon checking into you Villa you are greeted by your butler, who goes out of your way to endulge you.  Given the kitchen setup we brought some hard liquor.  The butler quickly found us some old fashion glasses and offer to mix us up some cocktails.  The veiw from the villas is a pretty as anywhere in the world.  Large double deck with table chairs and chaise loungers.  We had incredible weather the first 2 days.  Almost unlimited view.  The 3rd day was fogged in and you could not see the ocean.  Everything in the villa was top notch.  From

The Resort at Pelican Hill really is one of the most wonderful resorts in California. This resort  is a breath of fresh air. The resort looks like an Italian styled village with olive trees which makes this resort a delight and such as fabulous place to stay. The rooms are amazing - large with a fireplace.The pool area  is spectacular - a huge circular pool.. The setting of the pool surrounded by the fun 'Coliseum' style building with the restaurant and cabanas and the open view to the golf course and the sea is just the perfect place to relax and chill. It really was an unforgettable experience.

We stop her in our summer vacation  As we looking for relax area ..  It was really good and beautiful hotel We have our bungalow its not ocean view but it was with amazing terrace..  I love how is big the bungalow and the service was very good .  Really i will be back there.

Summary Heading: The little things make a difference
Summary: This was our 4th time staying at the Pelican Hill. Lovely setting , lovely views , lovely staff especially the pool attendants , good food in all restaurants and cafe. Great views from the room across the ocean which we decided to enjoy with a morning and evening coffee. To be clear this wasn't room service, this was me crushing beans, cleaning out filters, pouring old beans down the toilet etc and using the coffee provided in the room. Sadly on leaving we were presented with a bill for $ 44 ish for making my own coffee in the room. You either are or are not a 5 star hotel. Tea and coffee facilities are a basic requirement in a room . Charging for room service is fine but for making your own coffee laughable. Put 10 dollars on the price of the already expensive rooms but don't
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit. While I’m delighted to read that you enjoyed the Resort setting and dining, I’m disappointed that your experience with the in-room coffee maker did not meet your expectations and our goals. We are committed to providing exceptional experiences throughout the Resort, and your feedback is vital to the continual improvement of our service.   Once again, I apologize if you were disappointed in your stay and appreciate you taking a moment to post your feedback here. I hope that we will have the opportunity to serve you again soon.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama  Managing Director  The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to go as a family
Summary: We loved our stay. I was trying to understand what reviews meant by being a great place to stay as a family, and my husband and I understand now what an understatement great is. We stayed mid-week, booked through amex platinum and stayed in a bungalow suite. This is ideal for families in that both rooms of the suite were huge- the second bathroom easily became a "nursery" for nap time so that both children could easily rest. There was room to spread out and enjoy just relaxing as a family.  With little ones, we really love suite arrangements and this was exceptional.  The staff understands and welcomes children in a fashion we have not experienced at other resorts in the area, and as a mother, that in and of itself is reason to return.   We stayed in the 200s and could see the

I stayed at this luxury property for several days and would recommend it to all my friends. The customer service is superb and all the staff is very friendly. There was an issue with the reservation and the General Manager helped us fix it right away. He offered us an early check in and we had a wonderful vacation. Nikolay Tevekeliyski welcomed us with a smile and introduced us to our Butler  - Berry. WOW what a great start of our stay, we could not ask for more. I had heard for this place but it exceeded my expectations. We felt like royalty - not to mention that we received a nice card accompanied with fresh fruit the same night with management contact information and great greetings.

We are in the process of arranging a couple of weeks stay at Pelican Hill. Never have I had such an ordeal booking a hotel. They want full payment 30 days in advance. I can live with that but they also want reams of paperwork: lengthy contracts, card authorisation documents, a contract addendum because we added an extra night. This all needs to be scanned over to them. They will not confirm our booking - leaving the hint that although we've already paid then $000s, the booking isn't secure. Really lacking in common sense and off putting. Had I not had a stellar recommendation from a friend and a good experience so far dealing with the concierges, I would not have persisted with this booking.
Manager Response: Annie,  Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback. I understand your level of disappointment and apologize for the inconveniences you experienced. In following up with our reservations and sales managers, I understand that we worked closely with you to secure your reservations, both on the original reservation and the additional stay. Due to issues with your payment, we were unable to finalize your reservations in a timely manner until we received an alternative from you. Additionally, it is our standard procedure to execute an addendum for extended stays and I regret that the reservation process did not meet your expectations and our goals.   If you would like to discuss your experience further, kindly contact me directly.  I will provide my contact information in a private message, so I can listen and understand your perspective in more detail. Thank you again for your feedback.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill
