Summary: We had come for a fun romantic getaway after hearing about "five star this and five star that" from different magazines and advertisements (Travel & Leisure, Trip Advisor).  We were there in the middle of the week (Tues-Fri) and the hotel wasn't crowded or overly busy but we did see more people every day with Friday morning's breakfast being the busiest.    I'd never been to Newport Beach and it's lovely.  The hotel has beautiful views down to the ocean.  We did not play golf but walked along the cart path and everything seemed perfectly manicured.  As you can tell from the photos, the pool is quite a showstopper.  It's not for doing laps or even for swimming as it's shallow.  It's perfect for floating around and cooling off.  The drink & food service around the pool is also
Manager Response: Kelly,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit. I understand your disappointment regarding your Bungalow guestroom and the sports viewing options at the Coliseum Lounge, all of which caused your experience fall short of your expectations and certainly our goals. I have shared your feedback with management teams in each of the areas detailed in your review, including the security team who handles the shipment of your blouse. Additionally, we would like to take a moment to speak with you personally to discuss your experience further. I will provide the contact information for our director of rooms separately in a private message. I apologize that your experience was less than perfect. Thank you again for your feedback.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama  Managing Director  The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We spent 5 wonderful days at The Resort at Pelican Hill and found it to be enchanting.  Having visited many of the top resorts in Southern California, I found this to be our favorite.  The swimming pool is spectacular, the largest round pool in the world we are told. The front of the house has staff are very skilled, professional and helpful. The restaurant staff were excellent as well. The spa is also top notch, I had a massage, nail service and a facial, all very good, as expected in a 5 star resort.   We stayed in one of the Bungalows, room 425, the view of the ocean over the golf course was breathtaking.  The room was huge and so well appointed that you really could have stayed there the entire time and also enjoyed the privacy of the patio, with glass wind screening, two

Summary Heading: It doesn't get any better than this!
Summary: Back again for the 4th year in a row for business and can't think of a better place in the US.  Pelican Hill is like being in Paradise!  The room, the food, the staff, the facilities, the view - it's all amazing!  If you can afford it, do it!  You won't be sorry.  The bungalows (rooms) are exquisite. Huge bathrooms and showers, a soaking tub. The beds are very comfortable, Bose sound system connected to the TV or you can connect your phone or player for music, large flat screen TV's, your own balcony, and even a gas fireplace - it is Paradise!

Summary Heading: Million Dollar Ocean View and Villa  Life
Summary: Had the opportunity to travel as a group for fund and business and we stayed at the Southern Section Villas (4bdrm and 3 bdrm) at the Resort at Pelican Hill, Newport Beach, CA.  This resort hotel has rooms and a separate section for Villas.   4 bdrm / 4 ba. Two master suites with their own baths and two luxurious rooms with baths adjacent.  Large entertainment patio with golf course and ocean views.  Able to have people attend to us, cook breakfast or any meal if desired as well as all of the multiple dining and other amenities of this 5/6 star property.

Absolutely loved our experience here.  We stayed in one of their villas with some friends for a girls stay-cation and absolutely loved it.  The service was exceptional and the cabana at both pools was fabulous too.  It was a great weekend away!

Our king ocean-view room was huge with a modern California vibe and a soaring ceiling, gorgeous large marble bathroom with separate toilet, beautiful views off the patio with chaise loungers and luxurious linens on the supremely comfortable bed. The staff in the restaurants were friendly and accomodating, concierge staff was knowledgeable and helpful (although all we wanted to do was stay at the resort we did venture off to Javiers for dinner one night), spa was beautiful and relaxing with great massage, pool is enormous and comfortable with lots of seating options, food at both the Grill and the Pool was wonderful, fresh modern California cuisine. Golf courses looked spectacular but we were more in a relaxing mood, leisurely lunches overlooking the course were fantastic,guided

An absolutely horrible place. The view may be magnificent, but the service is the worst I have ever received. My girlfriends and I stayed for my 45th birthday and spent a huge amount on a villa. We had reservations at the Spa. However, the restaurant on property was late with our lunch, so I called the spa and they told me "no problem". We arrived 15 minutes late and NONE of my girlfriends received their full $250 treatments. They were forced out within 20 minutes. I asked the spa manager to contact me, and she never did. I spoke with the general manager, Nikolay, when we checked out, and he said they would reimburse us 50%. 50% was NEVER reimbursed to my credit card and when I called to complain, Nikolay treated me rudely and disrespectfully. I warn EVERYONE...read the YELP
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing you feedback about your recent experience. I understand your level of disappointment and have personally followed up with the Villa and Spa managers about the concerns you have detailed here. It is my understanding that our Spa manager advised your party of the Spa arrival policy and later extended special courtesies in consideration of your circumstance. However, I learned that you chose to threaten our business with posting a poor online review, if your demands for a full refund were not accommodated.  I regret that you remain unsatisfied, especially on such a special occasion as your birthday. I believe our management staff has made extra efforts to accommodate you. We would like to speak with you personally, if you wish to discuss your experience further. I will provide the contact information separately in a private message. Thank you again for your comments.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama	 Managing Director  The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We have stayed here and my husband proposed here.  It is such a gorgeous resort!  We live only a few miles away and enjoy it as a vacation getaway.  I highly recommend it for those wanting a five star experience.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  The rooms are gorgeous and well laid out.  They are much larger than most resort rooms.

My wife and I are locals and have used Pelican Hill's Spa and dined at Andrea's many a time.  We decided we wanted to do a staycation away from our son for so much needed "we" time, yet be a few miles away up the road.   We booked through AMEX fine hotels and resorts for the benefits and stayed during their festa dell'autunno (Italian autumn festival).  The AMEX benefits included a $100 spa credit, daily breakfast, early check in, and late check out.  The most amazing benefit was when we checked in.  We booked a bungalow ocean view king, and we drove up to the main lobby to check in.  When we arrived, the front desk said we were upgraded to an ocean view three bedroom villa!  The villas are located at a different part of the resort.  As with all rooms, you drive your car

I've been fortunate enough to have stayed, over the years, at some of the finest golf resorts in the country including Pebble Beach, Kapalua, Broadmoor, etc. The Villas at Pelican Hill are at the very least, on par with these other fine resorts, at the best, they are far superior. We were fortunate enough to stay in a 3 bedroom Villa over-looking the ocean, it doesn't get any better! The restaurants were all superb, room service as well. Of equal importance, the management, all service people were top notch and the butlers & butler service unequaled. All associates were smart, attentive, helpful and all had great attitudes. Pelican Hill Resort deserves 5 stars plus.

Summary Heading: A Great Stay Because of Great Staff
Summary: My wife and I recently visited the Pelican Hill Resort in Newport Coast California.  The facilities are breathtaking.  We stayed in the villas and had a tremendous view of the Golf Course and the Pacific.  The rooms were spacious and very clean.  The food in Andrea Restorante was excellent.  Most importantly, however, was the quality of the staff.  Nikolay Tevekeliyski, the General Manager of the Villas, could not do enough to make our stay one of the best ever.  When we wanted to extend our stay he worked his magic to accomplish this even with a "full house."  Andrea's manager, Sorin Dina, was also very accommodating, personally helping us match wines with our courses to enhance the meal.  Housekeeping went out of their way to respond to our every request and to make us feel at

While I agree with most of the reviews in terms of the property, the staff, the food, there is a management problem at this resort which can destroy enjoyment of your stay. I saw one review where the resort switched rooms, which may be symptomatic of a lack of understanding of customer experience. In my case I had American Express book two four-bedroom villas for three nights - Wednesday through Saturday - for a retreat for myself and seven colleagues . As sometimes happens, especially with a larger group, the decision was made to stay only two nights, not three. I was traveling and asked my Assistant to make the change with the hotel.  The hotel has a 5-day cancellation policy. Whether I, Amex or my Assistant screwed up, the change was not made at the time. I discovered this on
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent reservations experience. I understand your level of disappointment and regret that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals.   In following up with our reservations department, I understand that our reservations staff has made extra effort to find alternative solutions for your party, so that you would not forfeit your payment. Additionally, our reservations agent followed up with your assistant prior to your arrival and the Villa manager extended special considerations, given your circumstance. I regret that you remain unsatisfied, especially given the past visits you have enjoyed with us. We value your perspective and kindly request an opportunity to speak with you personally to discuss your experience further. I will provide the contact information for our Director of Rooms separately in a private message. Once again, I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I want to start off by saying that this is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed at! The drive from LA to Newport Beach itself is brilliant and just arriving here is the icing on the cake. We stayed in a Garden View Bungalow which is bigger than anywhere either of us have ever lived, it is massive! Brilliantly located, we did so much from here. This hotel has everything! The dining experience here is outstanding, some of the best food we have eaten. The facilities, the overall service and wine :-) are all top drawer. We enjoyed a fantastic stay here, it was just perfect from start to finish.

We actually plan our getaways, and this one was no different. We reviewed the hotel's website, right down to the floor plans, and we made a reservation more than a month ahead of time for an "Ocean View Bungalow Suite." When we arrived the desk clerk said, "congratulations; you have been upgraded to a North Villa 2 bedroom suite."  "Is that better?" "Oh yes," she replied and everyone from the bell captain to the valet began "congratulating" us on the upgrade. We were directed to get back in our car and drive about a third of a mile down the road, and check in at another location. The desk clerk seemed to have trouble finding a room, but eventually, yet again, we were directed to drive back out on the road, through another security gate and to a dull, featureless garage

My husband and I were lucky to have stayed five wonderful days at this resort with another couple. The four of us agreed that there was nothing to criticize. You seldom see a place that has management on top of everything. The grounds were immaculate, our room was extraordinary, the food was delicious, the spa was excellent and their hiring and training practices of their personel have to be amazing. Everyone wished you a good morning, asked if you needed anything with great big smiles on their faces. It was such a pleasure staying at this incredible spot.

What a great hotel. The pool is massive and overlooks beautiful green parks.  The food was nice and friendly staff. Rooms are more on a classic decor but clean and comfortable. Your close enough to town about 15 minuet drive.

We stayed in the four bedroom villa and it was amazing. It was huge and had all the amenities. The butler service was quick to respond and very helpful. The villa pool was so amazing and relaxing. It has full showers and a gym as well.

Stayed a week at Pelican Hill. You need to know two things about this resort. One, it is simply one of the most luxurious, elegant and relaxing resorts you will ever visit. And two, you need to bring your chequebook because none of that comes cheaply. It's worth every penny, in my estimation.  The resort is designed to look like an Italian villa and it succeeds on every front. It's hard to believe this resort is about a mile from the ocean and is set back on a hillside from a major highway. Once you are inside the resort you'd think you were miles away from the inconveniences of modern society while being right on top of the ocean. It is masterfully designed and impeccably maintained. I saw one piece of trash on the grounds and it lasted mere seconds before someone form the

Absolutely beautiful villa with amazing ocean view and butler service. Great transportation to spa, restaurants, beach and shopping mall. Excellent restaurants and beautiful facilities. Friendly and helpful staff.

Imagine luxury is defined as a 10 on the 1 to 10 scale. The 1 is a Motel 6 in Chico, California, roadside and the 10 is the rare air. Pelican Hill is an 11.   Yes, it is expensive and even a bit over the top but damn, this is a special place setting. The two golf courses are just under the Pebble Beach/Spyglass caliber but not by much. The views of the Pacific mesmerize and the individual bungalows simply incredible. I could live in one of these bungalows if they would allow me to! The Italian restaurant on campus is 5 stars and the spa.... heavenly.   Dont miss Pelican Hill. It will leave a very big impression for a long time to come.

You will find a paradise if you have the chance to stay at the Pelican Villas. The staff is very personable and attentive. Our Butler did offer us many suggestions for dining and we loved the recommendations. My family received a great tour of the property and we had a chance to meet the General Manager - Mr. Nikolay who was very approachable and extended his time to welcome us as return guests. The level of Hospitality is unsurpassed. The Pool at the Villas was magnificent and the servers were most helpful and knowledgeable. The service was extraordinary and we cannot wait to return back next year. Thank you to Pelican Hill staff for being so accommodating.

Enjoyed the most wonderful experience while staying at the Villas at Pelican Hill in Newport Beach. Incredible rooms with the utmost in detail and luxury. Be sure to reserve the upper villas for the best ocean views.

This is our fourth time at this property in Newport Coast, and sitting on the patio of the South Villas, amidst the gabled imported terracotta roof-tops, which face the ocean and the golf course, the review is writing itself. This property is expansive. The hotel surrounds the world's largest circular pool; the villas have their own smaller private pools. The property is heavily gated. The architecture is like the rest of the community, Tuscan. This is a family resort, so there is no adult swim, but, most of the children seem well behaved. Some of the nannies, though, need further training. Our three bedroom villa had a private courtyard, garage, and a huge patio, I would say easily covering 1700 sq. ft. The interior design is what you would expect, ski-chalet like, but, without

I was preparing for some uneven service here after reading the reviews on tripadvisor but i must say that this property absolutely blew me away!    as you approach the resort from the pacific coast highway, you will be in awe of the details they spent from the cypress trees to the aquaduct entrance structure to replicate the tuscan feel.  The staff were professional and accomodated an early check in for me. The villa's are clean, bright, amazing balcony views and the beds are super comfy.  The bathrooms have the folding blinds that open up to the main bedroom space which just makes the room more open.  a couple of small things i would add, the iron settings were worn off so i wasn't sure if it was on or not.  The safe was not operational but the staff were able to fix it right

This place is truly fantastic. We stayed in a villa for my best friend's wedding. The accommodations what you would expect for a villa at this price. Nice big patio with views of the coast located about a mile from the beach. The bathrooms are very large and modern. The catered lunch was great, I loved the big cookies! We had brunch at the pool bar and grill next to the beautiful coliseum pool. Food was good service was prompt and loved the to go cups of coffee. The fitness center is pretty meager but most folks don't excercise when they are at a resort so it's not a big deal to me. Overall the service is 5 star. This feels more like a secluded retreat rather than a busy resort at the end of summer. The wedding was beautiful and the catering staff executed the reception very

I have tried to alter my initial review twice with no success. I should review Trip Advisor. Anyway, in an earlier review, I pointed out that the resort would not work with me on extending a deposit on room nights to a later date (late cancellation) due to a sudden sickness. Well, they did extend the deposit and the trip turned out to be an excellent experience to a First Class resort. We will go back.   Jeff Wilson, Hilton Head SC

The south villas are a total escape with 24 hour service. Our butler, Michael Guzman is awesome: super down to earth and truly dedicated to ensuring everything you need is delivered to the villa. The villas are absolutely well appointed and perfect for families:  2 master suites, 2 bedrooms, awesome kitchen with wolf appliances, great ocean view patio, Bose sound system and 2 car garage with washer/dryer.  Staff at villa club house was great and sales manager Guiliana G. Really went above and beyond. Great property with great views but the team members at the spa, restaurants, concierge and butler service really make the experience memorable. Thanks Dolly at Savvy Traveler for the great booking experience.

Summary Heading: ruins your trip ideas for smalleurutrash rooms
Summary: this is a collasal resort with 4000 sq foot villas overlooking the pacific . we had  18 people in 2 villas  certainly one of the nicest resorts in so cal . Pool is huge , about the size of lake tahoe and so is your bill  nice spa  . i was underwhelmed with andreas

Had a wonderful time at Pelican Hill -- how could you not? The Colisseum area for breakfast and meals has a spectacular view! Loved the circular pool as the water never gets over your head. Be prepared to do lots of walking to various points in the property to get from point A to point B; though the Resort does offer shuttle service to get you wherever you want to go. Tip:  When we made our reservation, we didn't know that we had the choice of breakfast being included--and so an automatic $50 is charged to your rate.  It took many calls to front desk to have the breakfast charge removed from our rate -- as we only had it 3 times. Overall:  would go back in a heart-beat!

This past weekend I had the opportunity to stay at a 2-bedroom villa (2100 sq ft) in the "North Villas" section of the resort.  It was our first time at the resort and we were taken aback - it was gorgeous.  The grounds are in immaculate condition, and with modern Italian style and high quality materials throughout, it whispered opulence and luxury.  The property is also quite expansive - we never felt like we were at a 'hotel' - crammed like sardines in rooms stacked every which way on top and beside each other.  Instead the property is comprised of several different sections of the resort for the various villas (which have their own check-in areas, clubhouse and pool) and bungalows (main resort).  They are logically spaced out, even the single room bungalows felt incredible

Summary Heading: How did I not know about this resort sooner!
Summary: This resort is tops! If George Clooney's hotel in Venice was a 7 star - this is 8! Top of the line. Excellent service from top to bottom. GM began in Bermuda hotel industry and his influence is everywhere. The Bungalows are exceptional with fabulous views of the sunset and complete privacy on the balcony. The rooms have high ceilings and well placed fireplaces. The bathroom is large with separate bath, shower and toilet area. The spa...maybe the best experience I have ever had and I have been to many!

Summary Heading: Great place, shame about the people!
Summary: Firstly, let me be clear, there is nothing wrong with Pelican Hill as a property. It is slick, modern, in a great setting, fabulous rooms, the most spectacular swimming pool and pretty attentive staff. We were there for 3 nights in September- a Friday,Saturday and Sunday night stay. Amazing weather and unseasonably warm 33 Centigrade which certainly attracted people to the pool. I'm not sure whether an LA crowd descend on this place every weekend - the guys to play golf and the ladies to pamper in the spa, but the place was packed on the Saturday and the "Coliseum" pool area was simply not big enough to cater for the numbers. The noise levels, mainly of adults after an indulgence of Mai Tais, were incredible, with large gaggles of people in the ppol, drinking, smoking e-cigs and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your visit. While I’m glad to read that your enjoyed the Resort, I understand your disappointment regarding the noise levels at Coliseum Pool, which caused your experience fall short of your expectations and our goals. For this reason, I have personally shared your feedback with the Coliseum Pool managers. We are addressing the concerns you kindly noted here, as we strive to deliver exceptional service and memorable experiences for each and every guest who visits the Resort. Thank you again for your feedback. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you in the future.    Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: My family and I go every year to the christmas lunch held at Pelican Hill. I must say it is the most well planned event and one I look forward to each year. There is the most delicious food and the staff are so helpful and very nice. The activities are great as well with cupcake making, carolers, puppet show, photos with santa and much much more. The view is fantastic as well! Pelican Hill is and will continue to be the best Christmas experience!

Nothing more to say. Absolute paradise!  The bungalows are unbelievable, the pool gorgeous and scenic, just absolutely fantastic!  Went as part of honeymoon and had superb treatment throughout!  The restaurants on site are a tad expensive but superb and the bungalows are a great place to sit out and enjoy a few drinks.  Go here, you won't regret it!

I rarely comment about travel experieinces; but, in this case, I felt that I needed to provide some feedback.  The hotel was beautiful and the view spectacular.  However, given the cost, I expected a better experience.  In a two night stay over Labor Day, I was confronted by three problems.  First, my wife and I were forced to sit around in the lobby for over over two hours before we could check-in.  It was 6 PM before we were allowed in our room even though we arrived at 3 PM and the hotel check-in time was listed as 4 PM.  Second, the room that we requested (and were assured we would be given) was not available.  We were subsequently provided a room with a marginal view.  Third, there was an hour wait in order to access the pool.  For a purported five star resort (with five
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your visit. I understand your level of disappointment regarding check-in and pool access. I apologize that your requests could not be accommodated sooner, due to heightened demand during a busy holiday weekend. I have personally shared your valued feedback with management teams in each of the areas detailed in your review. We are addressing the concerns you kindly noted here, as we continuously strive to improve the Pelican Hill guest experience.  Once again, thank you for offering your input here. I kindly invite you to call the Director of Rooms, Santosh Kuruvilla, directly to discuss your feedback further. I will provide his contact information in a separate message, so you may contact him at your convenience.    Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Preparing a wedding in the family, being together as a family! We spent 2 days of a re-union, resting talking, beach combing and just chilling out ! Wonderful placer to do so and as we were 7 adults in the family 1 Villa was the absolute right choice!

Exceeded our expectations for a night away.  Upgraded huge room with an ocean view, with a huge bathroom, and patio to enjoy the sunset.  Ate breakfast at the restaurant at the pool, which was pricey but good.  Had a cabana poolside for most of the day; gracious and attentive service for lunch and drinks.  Huge resort property, wish I had time for golf.  Relaxing massage at the spa, nice gym with yoga and other classes.  Can't wait to come back!

Beautiful spot, terrific food, mostly a well run place with very helpful staff. Considering its reputation for an excellent spa, was very surprised when the yoga instructor failed to show up for a calendared yoga class. Highly unprofessional, and a bummer when you schedule your last day there around the class. Sometimes the service was spotty, eg placed on hold for five minutes when ordering room service.  Considering the price, this was disappointing.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent stay at Pelican Hill. I regret that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. The less-than-Five-Star service from the yoga instructor is unacceptable, and I assure you that I have personally discussed your feedback with the Spa Director. Based upon your comment, I have also addressed your concerns regarding room service with the in-room dining manager. We sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you experienced.  Should you wish to discuss your feedback further, I invite you to contact our Director of Spa at your convenience. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Our family stayed at the villa of this resort in September. The ground is green and very well maintained. The room is homey with a fireplace and has a great bathroom and shower. The beds are comfy. It has a balcony with a remote view of the ocean. It's convenient to have parking just near the front of the villa (since our villa was in a cul-de-sac it was actually a one minute short walk for most day). The huge and round pool of this resort is second to none and the pool service is top notch. The resort is not near the beach and is a fair distance from highway 1 that runs along the beach. It was a rigorous 20-minute walk to the ocean (especially uphill on the way back) but it turned out to be a good workout for us.

Stayed in a villa for work. Fantastic luxury property. Nice touches such as cheese and fruit plate delivered to our villa. Full kitchen. Gorgeous infinity pool, great food. Enjoyed wonderful breakfast near pool..eggs benedict and great breakfast burrito. Staff was great. A treat!!

My husband and I recently stayed at the Pelican Hill for our anniversary. The rooms are quite stunning with tall wood beamed ceilings, fireplace, and beautiful furnishings....not to mention the large scale of the room and bathroom. The bed linens were very nice and it was so comfy to sleep in! I was surprised that we were able to park right outside our room which was convenient (not having to wait for valet to pull our car every time). The hotel is further south than I thought too -- about half way between Laguna than Newport in proximity. While it lacks the beachfront component of some other luxury resorts in the area, it makes up for it in other areas. The pool is absolutely breathtaking and just as gorgeous as the photos.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel in a beautiful setting
Summary: The view of the ocean from this hotel was breathtaking, our room was luxurious, the restaurants are outstanding and the swimming pool is huge and the staff is very attentive. You couldn't ask for more!

Just returned from a weekend stay last night. We had a bungalow with ocean view (very beautiful). The bungalow has a vaulted wood-beam ceiling, fireplace, very comfortable bedding, and huge beautiful bathroom. Nice coffee grinder/maker in room (although apparently we were charged for the coffee sitting next to it which should be included). The bungalow was very quiet and comfortable, and parking is right outside the door.  The resort is gated and HUGE.  Service was incapable in every way - from the front desk staff that greeted us (and let us check into our room at 11am even though stated checkin is 4pm), the room service (delivered exactly at the time you requested -although quiet overpriced for eggs and bacon). Rooms are immaculate cleaned and we were often visited by staff

My husband and I stayed at this resort recently for our anniversary and we had the most wonderful and relaxing time. We've stayed at quite a few nice resorts in the past and I have to say this Resort is definitely one of the best in terms of the rooms and location. It was excellent. The resort is very spread out so you never feel like you're in a hotel. It truly felt like we were in our own little villa with no one else around. Very quiet and peaceful. The grounds are immaculate and very clean. The rooms were big and impressive with very high ceilings and comfortable beds/couches and great amenities. The room service was excellent and house cleaning did a wonderful job. No complaints! We used the spa and I would highly recommend their services. Very clean facility with wonderful

Came predominantly for the two golf courses, but of which were worth the trip.   Unfortunately the one practice putting green was closed and there's no sand/ bunker/chipping  green, which, for very expensive rounds, is unacceptable. Hotel facility top notch which one would expect at this high price point.  Service in most restaurants fairly good. Shower water pressure in room almost non-existent.

Stayed with my family for 5 days during a 3 week tour of California. Stayed in a 2 bed villa apartment. The villa is well finished, a good size at over 2000 sf with washer/dryer/kitchen etc and everything worked well. The resort itself is very spread out from the villa clubhouse area to the main hotel complex to the golf clubhouse. However all the buildings are well designed and attractive as are the grounds and the swimming pools. Unfortunately that is where the good news ends as the service experience was awful - room cleaning took place late in the afternoon even after we complained on day 1; we saw our 'butler' upon arrival and never again, no matter how many calls we put in; the restaurant staff at the villa complex were highly unmotivated and appear to be dramatically
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments about your visit. I understand your disappointment and apologize if your service experience was anything less than Five-Star. Please know that I have personally followed up to address your feedback with each area you mentioned, as we continually strive to heighten service delivery throughout the Resort.   I appreciate your candid thoughts and hope we will have an opportunity to regain your trust in the future. I will provide the contact information for our Director of Rooms separately in a private message, so you may contact us directly if you wish to return for another visit. Once again, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I booked this hotel for our honeymoon. the hotel management and reception were very kind and upgrade our room free with complementary fresh fruit and chocolate.  Everything about the resort was top class, the staff could not do enough to help you . The location is great for beaches and shopping. for sure i recommend this place to everybody.

Summary Heading: WOW.  An amazing property in every way.
Summary: My husband and I are here right now.  Room....huge and comfortable.  Staff...helpful and courteous.  Pool.. amazing.  Food...Great.  Would recommend highly.  Went to dinner at a outside restaurant after consulting the concierge and the hotel arranged dessert for us.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience about Pelican Hill on our review page. I am delighted that you and your husband enjoyed the Resort’s accommodations, service, pool and dining offerings. We hope to welcome you back to stay again in the future.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The Irvine Company (I think that's the name) has spent a fortune building an incredible resort, nice spacious rooms, etc.  They should hire Four Seasons or Peninsula or someone to run the hotel portion  for them because this management can not run a hotel well.  I have stayed at Pelican Hill 3 times in 2014 and have had major service issues each time.  The hotel is so spread out that it must cost a fortune to provide great service.  One of the conflicts is that they are also a local country club / fitness center; and all these members and their children are competing to use the pool, spa, workout facility with hotel guests spending a ton and expecting some resort atmosphere / solitude.  So many issues here; for example: 1. Check in / out....the front desk computers seem to
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your detailed, thoughtful feedback about your stay with us. I sincerely apologize that your experience fell short of the Five-Star standards you expect and we aim to deliver. I understand your disappointment with the resort pool and fitness center, due to the heightened demand during the busy season. However, please know that the resort amenities, including Coliseum Pool, are reserved exclusively for overnight guests.  It is our mission and responsibility to provide exceptional service and memorable experiences for each and every guest, and it troubles me that your experience did not reflect this. We value your perspective and kindly request an opportunity to speak with you personally to discuss your experience further. I will provide the contact information for our Director of Rooms separately in a private message. Once again, I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama  Managing Director  The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Everything about the resort was top class in my opinion, the staff could not do enough to help you or sort out any problems you may occur. The location is great for beaches and shopping.  Must say a big thank you to the fitness staff (especially Cara and Wendy), their enthusiasm and approach to the classes was absolutely first class whatever number of people turned up.  I did read a lot of negative reviews of this resort but I struggled to find any problems and would recommend this place to everybody.

From Check In to Check Out- Five Stars! Maxwell at the Front Desk was extremely helpful and friendly! Room was spacious, quiet and clean! Dinner was AMAZING, at Andrea's! I had homemade-Gluten free pasta....the best gluten free dish I have ever tasted and we even met the head Chef! You won't be disappointed!

This is a lovely property situated in Newport Coast, between Newport and Laguna Beaches. We stayed in a bungalow, which was very spacious with high ceilings, a fireplace and very comfortable bed. The patio was my favorite part of the room, with two cushy lounge chairs to spend time relaxing and enjoying the view. We had a partial ocean view, but the room felt surprisingly private. It was quiet for the most part, only being able to hear the occasional slamming door or people on adjoining patios. The service was great, despite a small issue at check-in with the staff being unable to make keys for a few minutes because of a system error. The breakfast buffet was delicious, and our dinner at Andrea was very good. The nice thing is that Crystal Cove Promenade is a quick drive down

Summary Heading: Not safe, horrible security.  No cameras in parking areas
Summary: We drove up to the resort from la with a brand new Mercedes GL, 6 days old.  Our very first ride with the car was to the resort; we hadn't even gone to the gas station prior the this trip.  When we came to put our little girl in the car the next morning we found our car had clearly been keyed in a vertical pattern on one side of the car.  We called security and they took pictures and made a report and said, "we will take care of this."  We asked them to role back the tape to see who had done this, and they replied there are no cameras in the parking area. They are charging approx. $700 a night and they don't have cameras in the parking lot????? What if something serious had happened when we went out to the car at night? The head of security, Kevin Romero danced me around for

Me and my wife cant get enough and have probably stayed here over 10 times. The bungalows are magical, the views of the golf course and ocean are stunning and the service is absolutely impeccable. Dont forget to dine and enjoy the company of their staff!

We phoned the hotel directly to book a room, and the first comment was we should use expedia rather than speak directly with them to book a same day reservation. There was no change in price, just seemed the hotel staffer was not interested in speaking directly with a client. Booked on Expedia at 11am and arrived at 4:10 pm (check in is at 4pm) only to be told our reservation had not been received by the front desk (gee wonder why we tried to call them directly...used to work in the hotel business...I am familiar with the drill). Nonetheless our room was not ready, nor were many other rooms ready for other guests checking in to attend a wedding that evening. The staff were polite but not at all empathetic. Kept explaining their inspector had to examine each room prior to
Manager Response: Lisa,  Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback about your experience with us. I understand your disappointment with reservations and apologize for the inconveniences you experienced, especially during check-in.   While I’m glad to read that you enjoyed the spa treatment, I regret the lack of communication regarding our fitness center that is located within the Spa. The fitness center, fitness classes and our spa facilities are available complimentary to Resort guests throughout their stay.   I have personally addressed your feedback with reservations, front office, housekeeping and spa mangers. Further, we would like to take a moment to speak with you personally to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Director of Rooms separately in a private message, so you may contact him directly at your convenience. Once again, I apologize that your experience was anything less than perfect.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I stayed at the pelican hill resort this August. They misplaced a 1500$ dollar handbag that I purchased online and had shipped to the hotel. They were/are extremely uncooperative in relocating it or providing any information on how it was handled. For the rate we paid I expected a far more professional service. So if you're staying at the hotel keep an eye on your expensive items and never ship any of your online purchases to the hotel.   Mr Giuseppe Lama, I would appreciate your help in relocating my package.

We stayed in the South Villas.  The villas are well appointed and spacious. Restaurants are terrific, golf course (I played the South Course) was exceptional, with great caddies.  The Villa pool has great breezes and views of the distant ocean.  Only complaints are that it did take time to have phones answered by staff and there were lots of loud children at the pool both days we went.  Short two mile walk to Crystal Cove beach and easy driving (or Uber) distance from lots of restaurants and other activities.

We stay at Pelican Hill twice a year as a "staycation".  The Villas are perfect for families.  I wouldn't even bother getting a sitter and going to a restaurant because the room service is incredible.  The pools at the Villas are gorgeous and kid-friendly.  I highly recommend this resort!

For nearly 20 years, four couples have visited high end golf resorts each June. This year we visited Pelican Hill and found it excellent in every way. The lodging (4 bedroom villa overlooking golf course and Pacific) was wonderful. Golf courses were challenging and offered spectacular views. Restaurants in the resort were fantastic. Concierge (Jack) was very helpful in arranging reservations at local restaurants which were varied in cuisine and wonderful. Prompt shuttles made intra resort travel very easy. Taxis made travel to local towns easy.  All in all, a sensational (but expensive) trip.

It's a shame that this hotel isn't on any of the top 50 in the world lists. This is truly a great hotel and never disappoints. The little touches are nice...like the way they toast your bread in your room for you. The coliseum pool is truly a sight and the two golf courses are some of the most scenic in CA. Prices have definitely gone up since it first opened, but that is to be expected with its popularity. While some of the bungalows have better views than others, they are all amazingly appointed and with all of the olive trees throughout the property, it could definitely be mistaken for a getaway in Italy. 5 stars all the way around.

We decided to visit The Resort at Pelican HIll this past Labor Day weekend as a family to get some beach time in before the end of summer.  We have vacationed at many great places as a family, like the Four Seasons Maui, Nevis, Punta Mita, and regularly visit the One and Only Palmilla.    This resort turned out to be a real letdown and absolutely nowhere in the same league as those outstanding properties.  We understand any amazing resort can get a bad review on this site from someone who gives one star because their ahi tuna wasn't quite seared properly, but we're not like that, and comments below should give you a decent picture of our experience at Pelican.  Like a previous reviewer, we also arrived midmorning.  We didn't have quite as good a result.  We were told the front
Manager Response: Andrew,  Thank you for the time you have kindly taken to share your detailed, candid feedback. I sincerely apologize that your experience at Pelican Hill has fallen short of the Five-Star standards you expect and we aim to deliver. Additionally, I am troubled to know that your recent visit did not deliver a positive experience for you and your family, as we intend to provide for each of our guests. While I have discussed your feedback in depth with our front office management and culinary teams, we would appreciate an opportunity to connect with your directly. I will provide the contact information for the Director of Rooms separately in a private message, so we may discuss your feedback further. Once again, I apologize for the unfortunate disappointment you experienced and thank you for providing your feedback here.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This property is one of the most beautiful resorts we have ever visited.  My family and I have traveled to many beautiful destinations, and always enjoy visiting new places, but this resort at Pelican Hill is one that we look forward to visiting again.  My wife and I were traveling with family and friends and an 18-month baby so we had lots of logistical demands.  We started our stay in 2 bungalows and a 2-bedroom villa.  All of the accommodations were beautiful and very spacious.  The views and landscaping of the property were absolutely stunning. The staff and butler service did all they could to make our stay as easy as possible. During our stay, we decided to move into a 4-bedroom villa and the staff made the transition as seamless as possible.  Traveling with a baby has its

Summary Heading: Hotel on top of the hill...
Summary: This is my first stay at the Pelican Hill Hotel and it was a comfortable one.   The location of the hotel on top of the hill allowed residents to have a nice view of the ocean and the surrounding property which was a very nice in the morning. So if you enjoy daily morning walks or jogs then you're in the right location.  We had a 3 bdrm villa with a private large balcony overlooking the golf course and the ocean, all amenities were provided especially in the kitchen. All cooking utensils, if you plan to cook for yourself,a washing machine with a dryer and a private garage.   House keeping - took care of everything especially if you were too lazy to wash the dishes.   Butler service - we met with our butler on arrival but haven't heard from him during the whole stay which is not
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent stay at Pelican Hill. The less-than-Five-Star service from your butler is unacceptable, and I assure you that I have personally discussed your feedback with our Villa managers. Based upon your comment, I have also addressed your concerns regarding the carpets with the housekeeping manager. As we continuously strive to improve the Pelican Hill guest experience, I sincerely thank you for your thoughtful feedback. Should you wish to discuss your experience further, I invite you to contact our Director of Rooms directly at your convenience. I will provide his contact information separately in a private message. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you in the future.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Lovely view.  nice room.  did not use the facilities much but used more as a luxury base from which to explore.  note that we called and were quoted about $100 more than the hotels.com price... we were treated very well on arrival.  nicely looked after.  made to feel very welcome.  there were quite a few single male golfers some of who were a little rude but this is not the hotel's fault !

Last minute booking , arrived mid morning , the front desk went out of their way to help us get into our room early , in the meantime , we relaxed around the most amazing pool ! The room was impeccable, with an incredible sea view , the children were so happy ! The in room dining was expensive , but service and food was very good  The amenities are above and beyond , the staff perfect , the complimenatry bus ride to Crystal cove , with towels and water provided outstanding !! What more can we say , 2 fabulous days , Thank you so much we will be back

Summary Heading: Hotel does not meet minimum requests
Summary: We asked for an early check in but our room was not even ready ay the guaranteed time of check in. Given that we were checking out early it seemed like a fair request. We ended up going to the desk 3 times to inquire about the room status and we kept being told it was almost ready for over 2 hours. I wrote to the hotel after my stay and never even heard back. Won't stay here again.
Manager Response: I sincerely appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback. I apologize for the delay in your check-in time and regret that your request could not be accommodated, due to the heightened demand during the busy season. Please know that our staff made every effort to expedite the cleaning and inspection of your accommodation. I have personally addressed your feedback with our front office and housekeeping managers. Further, we would like to take a moment to speak with you personally to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide the contact information for the Director of Rooms separately in a private message, so we may take this opportunity to listen and understand your perspective in more detail.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: A lovely resort! The property was immaculate and our 3-bedroom villa was to die for! We used the American Express Fine Hotels/ Resorts benefit and stayed here for 2 days for a wedding.   The website doesn't do this place justice. It is beautiful, even if you're not into golfing. The swimming pool was great and having your own butler was pretty amazing too!   I can't say enough wonderful things. I'm sure it's on the pricey end but it's well worth it. We received fruits, cheese and wine when we arrived. There was half a dozen of beer and other drinks in the fridge that were all complimentary.   We had an expansive patio that had the view of the mountains. It was a great way to wake up to! I will come back here again in a heartbeat!!

My husband needed to stay at Pelican Hill for 6 days for a work-related conference, and my 3 children and I decided to join him. We booked a standard bungalow, which was about 700 square feet. It comfortably fit 2 queen beds and a roll-away with room to work at the desk and play on the floor! The bathroom was spacious and well-appointed, and we had gorgeous views across the golf course and down tot he ocean from our patio. Patios are equipped with tables, chairs and loungers and have glass fronts, so very safe with the kids, but nothing to block the view.  Staff were very flexible about cleaning times (2x/day) with naps, etc and any concerns we called about were handled promptly and politely. The pool at The Colosseum is marvelous - 136 feet in diameter, 3.5 feet deep throughout

We stayed in the bungalows and loved it.  The bathroom is wonderful, and large.  The only thing I will say is the lighting in the bathroom could be brighter.  The bed was very comfortable.  The property overall is wonderful.  The pool is massive.  We ate dinner at Andreas and the food was extremely good.  Very unique and flavorful.  This is a place to be pampered.  Depending where your room is located you may have a bit of a hike to the restaurant.  They do have a little free shuttle service around the property.

I booked 2 massages for my sons, two facials for my guests and a body scrub for myself at the spa. They messed up my appointment by giving my son a facial instead of massage, and I had to wait  30 min. For my body scrub. My guests had to wait on me for lunch because the spa therapist was behind the schedule. The desk person did not apologize for what they have done to me! I love this place, it is so beautiful clean and  quiet. I gave it 5 stars for the resort, but 3 stars for the help desk at the spa. They should consider more on how to train the staff to work for the resort, and don't let them ruin the resort reputation.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to communicate with us and share your thoughts about your recent experience at The Spa. Your thoughtful feedback is appreciated, as we strive to provide the highest level of service and exceed our guests’ expectations.   I sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you experienced and have personally addressed your feedback with the Spa Director. I invite you to contact our Spa Director directly the next time you visit. I will provide the contact details in a separate message. Thank you again for your candid feedback. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This is Newport finest properties.  We stayed at the Villas and could not think of one item to complain about just praise for the staff to the property to the beds.  It's pricey but you get the red carpet rolled out for you.

We rented a 4 bedroom Villa, and it was really amazing.  The rooms are immaculate, everything was spotless...exactly what I would have expected for my first stay here.  The staff/butler/managers were very accommodating, and literally available for any and all requests we had.  The golf course surrounding the property is a great plus with staying here.  I would highly recommend renting a villa if you have mutiple people in your party.  The only thing I didn't like was that the couches in our villa looked pretty old and disgusting.  Lots of stains, and it looked as if they had not been cared for in quite some time.

This is our second time staying here and the property has gone downhill in the last few years.  We stayed with our family for 3 nights.  The positives were a great location, large well kept grounds, nice pool and wonderful breakfast at Coliseum restaurant.  Upon check in, the room was not organized according to our reservation (it was missing a pullout couch/cot for our toddler) so they charged us an additional $25/night for this.  Housekeeping was poor and did not replenish towels and toiletries as needed.  On our last night, they set-up a large corporate event in front of guest bungalows!!  Despite having numerous places to do this, they chose to do this in front our our room.  Despite speaking with the manager and him assuring us of no disruption or options to move, we heard
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your comments about your recent stay. I understand your disappointment with housekeeping, parking and the event taking place near your Bungalow. I apologize that these unfortunate circumstances disrupted your enjoyment of the Resort.   Please know that it is our priority to offer a pleasant, relaxing environment for all guests. I have taken the opportunity to follow up with managers of each department regarding your feedback. It is my understanding that our front office manager extended special considerations, in consideration of the inconveniences you experienced. However, I am disappointed to learn that you chose to threaten our business with posting a poor online review if your demand for more compensation was not accommodated.    I believe our management staff made extra efforts to accommodate your concerns during your stay, but regret that you remain unsatisfied, especially given past visits you have enjoyed with us. If you wish to discuss your experience further, I invite you to contact me directly.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We were making a reservation for December 18 thru December 21. We were quoted $990 per night for a 3 Bedroom bungalow.  We accepted and the reservationist began making the reservations.  After a period of silence she came back to us with a new price for the second and third nights at a new rate of $1290.00 per night.    We were happy to get the great rate of $990 per night originally but if this hotel is going to play a shell game with there prices.  I will warn other people NOT TO TRUST THEM and go to the Ritz, they stick with the prices they offer.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your thoughts about your recent reservations experience. I understand your disappointment and regret that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals.   In following up with our reservations department, I have personally reviewed the conversation you had with our reservations agent. The first rate that the agent provided did not reflect your intended arrival date. The agent corrected the error and quoted the best available rate for the exact dates you requested. I sincerely apologize for the confusion you experienced. I have followed up with the reservations manager to discuss your feedback in details. Thank you again for sharing your comments.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This is my third time staying at this resort and once again everything was wonderful. The bungalows and pool are beautiful.  The Coliseum is a great place for breakfast with a very accommodating staff.  The staff at the pool is very friendly and efficient. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained.  The sunsets are gorgeous.  This is a great resort to stay at when visiting the Newport Coast area.

This place is just amazing - the rooms were fabulous with the vaulted ceilings and enclosed patio that faced the ocean.  The food was wonderful - I had lobster and scrambled eggs for breakfast every day.  The spa was quite nice too.  The shuttle will take you across the highway to this fabulous state park that has a couple cute places to eat and shop.   One of the nicest places you can stay ...cannot say enough.  The golf was also very good!

we have just returned from a weeks stay --and found the service standards poorly lacking . We had been at this resort last year and it has definitely changed . Would think twice about coming back . on a positive note the golf and golf service were excellent . however the same can not be said of the resort /housekeeping . on 3 days of our stay our rooms had not been cleaned and I had to phone numerous times to get housekeeping to address . after the first time it was agreed our room would be serviced by 2pm each day going forward  --but the following day when we went back to our rooms at 4.30 nothing had been done . the pool area is chaotic --- it is staffed by junior staff who just ignore you . on our first visit it took over an hour to get any beach towels and we had to ask 3
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to post your feedback about your recent stay at Pelican Hill. While I’m glad to read that you enjoyed the golf facilities and service, it troubles me that you were disappointed in the overall level of service you encountered during your return visit.   At Pelican Hill, we are committed to providing ongoing service training for our staff, so we may not only meet, but exceed our guests’ expectations. I sincerely apologize for your experience with housekeeping and pool service, and assure you that I have personally followed up with the management teams to communicate your feedback.    Once again, thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts, as your candid feedback is a valuable training tool. I kindly invite you to call the Director of Rooms, Santosh Kuruvilla, directly to discuss your feedback further. I will provide his contact information in a separate message, so we may take this opportunity to understand your perspective in more detail.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: A fabulous place to stay but extremely short on staff.  Their answer if you say something is to comp you.  It's not the price its the service your after and when the service is lacking it ruins the experience.  Also a lot of families with unruly children in the restaurants it seems parents do not care what their children are up to.  We were sitting in the bar at 9:30pm, there were 3 children wrestling on the floor, running about and no parents.  What are children doing in the bar at that hour?
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing thoughts about your recent experience with us. I sincerely regret that your experience with us fell short of your expectations and our goals. It is the highest priority of our dedicated staff to deliver the best possible experience to each and every guest. I have taken the time to share your concerns with our restaurant managers, based on the feedback you kindly provided here. If you wish to discuss your experience further, I invite you to contact me directly. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again for another visit in the future.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Everything was above and beyond except for a repair which was not made for us prior to our stay. The location was perfect and the service was beyond all expectations. As it turned out the weather was also in our favor so we were able to do everything we had planned. I would definitely recommend staying at this resort.

Nice resort if you are looking for boring, staff that never leaves you alone and solitude. Highly disappointed and we felt like we were in a prison. At $795 per night , we had to call housekeeping twice to come and make up the room. I felt the staff were over the top and they had an answer for everything ! Waited an hour to get ice as apparently that is a no no for guests to get their own ice. When you do finally get your room made up ,  there were 4 to 5 different people that came ! When asked if I need anything else.......yes, leave me alone ! Staff "hovers" over you too much. Could not wait to leave the prison !
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your thoughts here. your candid feedback is appreciated. Please know that it is our priority to offer a pleasant and relaxing environment for all guests. I apologize if your experience has fallen short of your expectations and our goals. I welcome any additional thoughts you may prefer to share with us. I will send you a private message with the contact information for the director of rooms. Once again, thank you for your review.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Our family of 4 stayed in a large room with 2 queen beds.  The room was exceptional.  Everything was clean and new, with high level finishes and a view of the ocean.  The pool was one of the best I've seen anywhere.  Resort food was very good, and Newport is only about 10 min. down the mountain.  I highly recommend this resort.

Thanks again Pelican Hill! I have stayed here over a dozen times without a complaint. This time I brought my 18 year old daughter and she LOVED it too! The pool is amazing and she loved the property. So close to Laguna beach so a perfect package.  The service as well as all the guests are wonderful.

We stayed in a garden view bungalow for 3 nights recently.  The accommodations and property were first rate, truly transporting, and we loved the private, exclusive feel of the property.  There was no welcoming overview of services though- we would call and ask how to get to the pool and would then be offered to be shuttled over, for example- and found housekeeping to be spotty (we specifically asked for our foyer to be cleaned of sand twice and it never was).  We wonder what other services we were not aware of.   Service is European style- not overly friendly or accommodating but always polite-  we asked to be upgraded to an ocean view and were politely declined (despite its availability online), likewise when the wifi went down every morning 3 days in a row, we did not receive

Summary Heading: Some of the best mixed with some 'meh'
Summary: I booked a weekend stay, and my son fell ill and we had to cancel on short notice.  It was a total bummer and they kept a full night rate... which I fully understand is policy, so no complaints and I didn't mention it, but its still a bummer to lose several $100...  So a few weeks later when everyone was well I rebooked another stay.  I dropped the hotel a note and let them know I was coming for my first visit (after paying for and not using my last one) and that I wanted to request a room upgrade if possible. The reply was most surprising: defensive and reinstating the policy and how they wouldn't be able to give me a refund for the previous stay.  And I was most insulted because I never (either time) asked for a refund... and the experience made me feel cheap... which is most
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your experience with us. I’m sorry to read about the unfortunate circumstances you encountered, but glad that your son recovered and you were able to visit after all. I have personally addressed your feedback with our guest services and reservations managers.   I will provide our contact information for the director of rooms separately in a private message, so you may contact us directly at your convenience to discuss your comments further.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Amazing location and modern spacy bungalows. The food was great in all restaurants we visited. The service could be better at the Coliseum Pool & Grill. Pricy drinks, especially the wine! The golf course is a must. In all, a spectacular resort.

This hotel may be pretty but the management is horrific.  They do not care about their guests. They think they are too good for their guests and the service is horrible.  I have stayed at countless five star resorts all over the world.  The management here is the pits.     Stay elsewhere.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. At Pelican Hill, we strive to deliver personalized service to each guest who we have the opportunity to service. I regret that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. Your candid thoughts are appreciated, and I would like to hear more about your experience. I will provide you with my contact details separately in a private message, so you may contact me directly at your convenience.   Once again, we value your feedback and thank you for posting your thoughts here.    Kind regards,  Santosh Kuruvilla Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Spectacular property and stunning location (need to work on the detail)
Summary: The quality, space and sheer luxury is outstanding and their main restaurant Andrea's is worth a visit.   Service slips (which is usually corrected) too often and the pool area needs greater attention in terms of service (e.g. removing used food/drink items, cleaning under the beds over night).  The gym is quite neglected and often has grubby machines.  Sounds a little bit of a whinge, but a 5 star resort normally looks after these items.  Overall, we liked the resort but felt disappointed by the service levels and a small number of staff that were quite unprofessional (many were outstanding though, but they really all should be all of the time for this kind of money).
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent visit. While I’m delighted to hear you enjoyed the Resort grounds and dining experience at Andrea, I apologize that your complete satisfaction was compromised by the less-than-perfect service you encountered.   I understand your level of disappointment in your experience with the pool service, fitness center and housekeeping. In consideration of the detailed feedback you have provided here, I have personally taken the time to follow up with the management of each department about the experiences you have described.  As we continuously strive to heighten the guest experience at Southern California’s top-ranked resort, I kindly thank you for taking the time to post your candid feedback.  Kind regards,  Santosh Kuruvilla Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The Resort at Pelican Hill is spectacular. The staff is the very best in service and friendliness. We played both the north and south course which were both magnificent but I would not recommend either for beginners. All the restaurants were wonderful. The pool and Spa were relaxing and we highly recommend treating yourself to a massage. It was the best! For walkers, there are many trails with beautiful views of estate homes and the Pacific. Dollars were not spared on the facilities and it is very well maintained. Can't say enough about the resort.

Summary Heading: pretty property but the service is awful.
Summary: This is a beautiful setting but the service is lacking. On our first day it took 45 minutes for anyone to ask if we needed anything by the pool. My friend is a travel agent and told them if this was going to be the type of service we were going to get then we were checking out!! They hopped to it, but it went right back to lax service. I don't know if they are under staffed but for what you pay to stay at this property the service should be superior.  My husband golfed and the check in guys were rude and wouldn't allow them to practice putt before their round of golf. totally unprofessional.  As for me I will stay at the Montage the next time I visit Southern California.  The Montage is fabulous!
Manager Response: I appreciate the time you have so graciously taken to share your candid feedback here. I am disappointed to read that your recent visit fell short of your expectations and certainly our goals. Please know that I have taken the opportunity to personally follow up with our pool service manager and golf executives to discuss the feedback you have detailed here.   Please know that the golf practice facility is available complimentary to all golfers who have same-day tee times booked. I apologize for the inconvenience your husband experienced and would like to speak with your personally to discuss your feedback in detail. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message. As we continuously strive to heighten the guest experience at Pelican Hill, your candid thoughts are truly appreciated.  Kind regards,  Santosh Kuruvilla Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We stayed here for a few days because we had read great things about it. Overall we really liked it but it was very diffrent from any other resort especially the Ritz at Laguna where we have stayed before. First of all, you almost don't feel like you are in a hotel or a resort but are at the condo of a very wealthy friend who is not home. The resort is very large and spread out. We stayed in a villa so we checked in at the "special villa part" and did not even see the lobby of the hotel until our final days stay, which is much more grand and has many more offerings. Once you are taken to your villa you are somewhat on your on so to speak. The butlers will drive you around the resort in the Mercedes four wheel drive when you call them but you feel pretty isolated. We stayed in a

We stayed at the resort a few nights ago and we booked a package that included "Spa Cuisine Lunch for two (2) at The Spa at Pelican Hill  "  We checked in around 3 and had a couples massage at 5:30.  The following day we went to the Spa for our lunch but were told that we could not dine together and that the food would take 45 minutes to arrive.  Apparently this "lunch" was meant to be consumed alone in the gender specific area.  Some helpful employee saw what was happening and suggested that they feed us in the front waiting room together which was nice.  We ordered 2 glasses of champage and a few snacks which came to $80.  The lunch credit was $75 so we thought we would be charged just the balance.  Upon leaving we found that they charged us the full $80.  I called and they
Manager Response: Mark,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent experience. Your sincere feedback is appreciated, as we strive to provide the highest levels of service and exceed our guests’ expectations.   I apologize for the confusion you experienced about what was included in the Spa lunch. I have taken the time to personally follow up with our director of Spa, in-room dining and housekeeping managers to address the inconveniences you experienced. I assure you that what you experienced was the exception, and not the rule.    I would like to take the time to speak with you directly to discuss your feedback in more detail. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message. Once again, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect, and I hope that we will have the opportunity to serve you again soon.   Kind regards,  Santosh Kuruvilla Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Please do yourself and your family a favor and stay out of this Hotel! I spend the weekend there with my family and spend over 2 grand on room and food and it was the worst experience of my life!  The management there is terrible, the people who work there are unhelpful and a bunch of liers!  We got items stolen from our room, we got our car keyed in a private parking lot and we were lied to about the check out time.  The property itself is nice, but the service and management is zero!!!!!  The hotel charges you an arm and a leg for everything you touch in your room. You feel like a prisoner and  it's not kids friendly. The food at all the restaurants in the hotel are tasteless and overpriced! KEEP OUT AND SAVE YOUR MONEY FOR SOMEWHERE WORTH WHILE!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent experience with us. I understand your disappointment and am sorry to read about the unfortunate experiences described here. I apologize that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals.   The safety and security of all guests and staff is Pelican Hill’s top priority. We interviewed the housekeeping staff and searched their lockers as soon as we received the loss report. We found no discrepancies in the interviews. Additionally, our security manager and front office manager were in constant communication with you during the investigation and advised you of the findings. We do not condone the actions you have detailed here, and I regret that what should have been an enjoyable getaway for you and your family left you disappointed.   I appreciate you taking the time to provide your candid feedback. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message so you may contact me at your earliest convenience.   Kind regards,  Santosh Kuruvilla Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I rarely if at all ever write reviews for a hotel stay. However, this was one of the worst experiences my family and I have ever had staying at such a prominent and highly touted resort. The pool staff at the villa pool is too thin and not well managed. It took approximately 17 minutes to get water and then 12 more minutes to get someone to come around to take our order.... After nearly an hour of waiting on and off we ate our lunch. The food was marginal, we waited another 30 minutes for staff member to come by and clear our dishes. We tried to flag four different people down and finally had to get up and go tell them to come over.... We asked very kindly for water again several times and no one brought it to us... The pool area wasn't even that busy... It was a terrible

My family stayed at the pelican hill resort for four nights and we absolutely loved it! Everything is beautiful and very well displayed. However, It is hard not to order food and drinks by the pool and at the resort restaurants, which seems to add up very quickly. Everything is very highly priced, and after just  two fruity drinks by the pool we had a bill for $50. Other than that, our stay was flawless. The service is great and the pool is amazing. Though we did not use the golf course, it looked immaculate. There were lots of other kids and adults, and we made lots of friends. The food is overall very good and nicely sized portions. We could not have asked for a better place to stay!
Manager Response: I am delighted to learn that you and your family loved your recent trip to Pelican Hill, and appreciate you sharing your thoughtful comments about the food, pool and service. We hope to welcome you back soon.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I really enjoy the general location of this hotel.  The rooms are large and well-appointed.  The property is near the coast but not a walk down to the beach.  There are shuttlees every hour..  There is an enormous pool with good pool service.  Bkfst was great, albeit expensive for the buffet at $55 per person.  Dinner at Colliseum was beautifull , we sat in a private cabana whichi was great, but two items brought to the table of 7 people had actually gone bad. Andrea's is better, more formal, but indoors. The spa is really nice, and I had a grewat massage with a therapist there.ONe thing to note, I book wiht Amex Platinum always.  This hotel is does not give upgrades even if there is availability.  I have stayed at least a dozen times and that has consistently been the case.  So
Manager Response: We are thankful for your numerous visits to Pelican Hill, and appreciate you taking the time to post your feedback about your most recent stay. While I am pleased to read about your consistent enjoyment of your accommodations, as well as your time at the Coliseum Pool, Andrea and the Spa, I am disappointed to learn that your dining experience at Coliseum Pool & Grill was not up to standard. I have personally addressed these comments with our management team. We hope to see you again soon.    Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: AMAZING!!!!!!  truly a five star in every aspect!
Summary: WOW!!  I had family visiting from the east coast and we traveled from San Diego to Catalina for the day.  I'm not familiar with Newport so I asked a friend who lives in Newport to recommend a nice place for dinner with a great view for our guests.   My family was blown away.  From the moment we pulled up to the valet at the Coliseum Grill to when we asked for our check - I was VERY happy.  In fact, I will return with my hubby to enjoy a weekend at this resort - I was so impressed.  This is a top notch property worthy of all it's accolades in Newport.  Our dinner was delicious!! service was very good.  Mind you, we were not dressed to impress (long day of driving...) but we were treated like royalty.  I wish I lived closer - I would come here every week!
Manager Response: Kara,  I am pleased that you enjoyed your experience at Coliseum Pool & Grill with your family. It is our mission to provide every guest with Five-Star service, and I am delighted that this was reflected in your short visit here. We look forward to welcoming you and your husband for a weekend at our Tuscan seaside village.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I grew up in Hawaii and was privileged to visit many of the exclusive resorts on the Islands.  The facilities, staff and amenities at Pelican Hill are among the best I have ever experienced.  The view of the Newport Coasts from our room was excellent and made morning coffee a joy.
