I highly recommend the massage, it is an excellent way to begin your vacation.
Manager Response: Rich,  Thank you for sharing your gracious feedback about Pelican Hill. I am delighted to read how much you enjoyed the Resort’s facilities, staff, amenities and spa treatment, and have taken the time to thank our entire staff for making your experience excellent.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Just returned from a brief mother-daughter sojourn at Pelican Hill.  There are no rooms in the main building - all rooms are bungalows or villas, and the word bungalow doesn't do them justice.  We stayed in a bungalow guest room with a distant view of the ocean from the terrace.  The room was gorgeous - two large Queen beds, desk and chairs, fireplace - beautifully decorated - vaulted wood- beam ceiling, sliding glass doors to the private terrace which had a glass wall and two chaise lounges, table and chairs, huge bathroom with a large tub, double sinks, separate WC, and walk-in shower without curtain - terrific water pressure.  The room was QUIET, firm yet downy mattresses, complimentary water, free wi-fi, and complimentary parking which is unheard of in CA (we were able to
Manager Response: Janice,  I am delighted to read how much you enjoyed your recent mother-daughter trip to Pelican Hill, and appreciate you taking the time to post your gracious comments. I am pleased that your experience exceeded your expectations, and personally passed along my gratitude to Shaylin in Concierge for assisting you with your Pageant of the Masters tickets. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I had the opportunity to stay at Pelican Hill in October.  The weather was  perfect and the resort equally so.  Although the reception lacked a warm and fuzzy feeling they were excellent in  service.  I was fortunate to stay in a 2 bedroom villa on the top floor with an amazing view.  Although my villa was a distance away from the main building and services I never had to wait longer than it took for me to make it downstairs. The entire property is beautiful, the view spectacular and the food yummy.   Looking for a 5 star experience with that California Feeling one can only get in California?  This is a great place to give a try.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback about your recent visit to Pelican Hill. I am pleased to read that you enjoyed your Villa accommodations and dining experiences, and hope to welcome you back in the future.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Took my family here for a trip in March and it was excellent.  They were able to accommodate all of our requests and then some.  We had a great view of the ocean from our room.  Understand, this property is NOT on the ocean so your not going to have a beachfront view but some rooms have a much better view than others.  They are constantly bring fruit, snacks, water, etc to your room.  The rooms are very tastefully decorated.  The sleep experience is great.  The linens are great.  The toiletries are great.  We had a nice relaxing day by the pool in one of the cabanas and they pampered us all day in it.  We played one of the golf courses and found it to be just ok.  Not what I was expecting from an ocean course but it had some cool holes.  I travel a lot and try to stay at upscale
Manager Response: I am delighted that you enjoyed your family trip to Pelican Hill earlier this year. It is our aim to deliver Five-Star service to every guest, and I am pleased to read that this was reflected in your stay. We appreciate you posting your feedback, and hope to see you and your family back here soon.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Worthy of their recognition--A worthy respite. Attention to detail
Summary: Travelled 4th of July week and stayed 7 days at this property.   Two Couples. First the property was just spectacular.  We stayed in a bungalow with a really attractive ocean view.  No...the property does not sit directly on the ocean/beach, but the views are stunning and the proximity to the beach and the beauty and views from the grounds make this place jaw dropping.  The staff were attentive and professional from the moment we arrived until the car drove us to the airport.  The restaurants are top tier over all, with a special nod to Andrea's, the signature restaurant on site.  Our stay included a fishing expedition, off site restaurants, and a day trip PCH drive to San Diego, all assisted by the capable concierge staff---much of it presented to us as options before we
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post your thoughtful feedback here, in addition to the kind comments you posted on our Andrea, Pelican Grill, Pelican Hill Golf Club & Coliseum Pool & Grill review pages. I am pleased that you enjoyed your Bungalow accommodations, our Resort restaurants and service staff, and have personally shared your kudos with Danielle and the Concierge staff. We hope to welcome you for another restful and memorable stay in the future.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We've stayed here 3 or 4 times and are always amazed at the welcome we receive. The rooms are incredible and the staff wonderful! The views are awesome from the golf course and the banquet food is incredible!
Manager Response: Stephen,  Your feedback is a gift, and we appreciate you taking the time to post your kind comments here. I am pleased to know that you have consistently enjoyed your experiences with your accommodations, as well as our staff and food. We hope to welcome you back to our Tuscan seaside village soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Worst service we've ever experienced. We are seasoned travelers and have stayed at many wonderful resorts. Pelican hill staff is simply Unattentive and Unprofessional from front desk to hospitality services.  Disappointing for $500+ night. Not even close to the same stratosphere as hotels such as Four seasons or Mandarin Oriental etc.  We do NOT recommend staying here; the service is that poor :(
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback about your recent visit to Pelican Hill, and sincerely apologize that your stay was compromised by the less-than-perfect service you encountered. It is our highest priority to deliver exceptional service throughout the resort, and I regret that your experience did not reflect our Five-Star service standards.   I would like to take a moment to speak with you personally to discuss your feedback in detail. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message. As we continuously strive to heighten the guest experience at Pelican Hill, your feedback is appreciated.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Not quite the 5 stars we were expecting
Summary: Beautiful property with amazing views from our Villa!  The resort staff, from shuttle drivers to our personal Butler, were professional, attentive and very friendly.  The problems, unfortunately, were many.   Since our family was staying for a month, eating every meal "out" was not on the agenda. The "fully equipped" kitchen was lacking in pans, utensils, dishes and glasses which made a loud statement to us they didn't want us cooking on the state of the art Wolf range or even use the kitchen.  The TVs were analog and only offered 3 HD stations. (quite antiquated for the cost of staying here) The bedrooms and bathrooms were very spacious and beautifully appointed but we did have problems with the sprinklers from the golf course soaking the patio furniture at night, rendering
Manager Response: Ann,  I greatly appreciate you taking the time to post your comments about your recent visit to Pelican Hill. While I’m pleased to read that you and your family enjoyed the property and the service of our staff, I want to apologize for the inconveniences you encountered during your stay. I am disappointed that these oversights impacted your overall experience at Pelican Hill. Please know that I have followed with the Villa manager, restaurant managers and housekeeping department to address the feedback you have graciously detailed here.   It is through the candid and thoughtful feedback from our guests that we are able to continuously improve upon our service standards throughout the Resort. I regret that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals and would like to take a moment to speak with you personally to discuss your feedback further. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you in the future.  Kind regards,  Santosh Kuruvilla Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: My husband and I spent 3 days at the Resort at Pelican Hill last month and were very impressed with their high level of service and outstanding food service at all locations.  We stayed in the Villa's and found the comfort level similar to that of a five-star hotel(except one aspect).  The spa was excellent as my husband had a facila with Lidia Verdier, and he claimed it was outstanding!  Special thanks to Mark, our server at the Pelican Grill whom made the meal memorable. (The only aspect which needs attention is housekeeping:  Waited until 4:30 to check-in and one day our room was cleaned until 5:15 PM.)  But otherwise:  A great getaway!
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback about your recent visit to Pelican Hill. I am delighted to read about the overall level of service you experienced during your stay, and will certainly share your gracious comments with the staff members you mentioned by name.   At Pelican Hill, it is our mission to deliver Five-Star service to each and every guest. I am disappointed that this was not reflected in your experience with check in and housekeeping.   I will personally share your comments with our management team.   We look forward to welcoming you and your husband back to the Resort in the future.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: While you're in the Newport Beach, CA area this resort is definitely worth a visit.  The pool side restaurant is simply outstanding.  Sit outside and enjoy the view if possible.  Since this place is probably 5 stars you would expect the service to be great and you will not be disappointed.  We have gone there for a breakfast and it's a very relaxing way to start the day.  Try one of their special items that are on the menu.  Only one thing causes me some concern but it's fairly common in many restaurants - they are very slow in presenting you with the bill.  This is hard thing to complain about since you certainly don't want to feel rushed.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent experience. I am pleased to read about your dining experience at Coliseum Pool & Grill. I appreciate the feedback you provided in regard to receiving your bill and will personally share these comments with our restaurant staff. I hope to welcome you back to our Tuscan seaside village soon.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This place is absolutely amazing. Every detail is thought of. We loved the pool, the beautiful view from our room, the beach shuttle and the well appointed spa along with the very professional and gifted spa staff. All resort staff is so attentive, friendly and goes above and beyond to make their guests feel welcome. I will definitely be back and am still talking about my stay. The only mishap was a very rude retail associate in the shop. We left quickly from there as she was curt and not welcoming...nothing like the rest of the amazing staff. I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post your thoughts about your recent visit to Pelican Hill.  While I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed our amenities, Spa facilities and attentive staff, I have taken the opportunity to personally share your comments about your experience in our retail shop with our retail management. We hope to see you at Pelican Hill again soon.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Irvine Company owned resort with questionable business practices...
Summary: Made a reservation for a weeknight stay at this 2014 Forbes 5 Diamond Resort and Conde Nast's #1 Resort in the US. The resort is owned by the controversial The Irvine Company with a nightly rate of $425/night for an Ocean Facing Bungalow at 847 sq feet.  Checking in with the valets was friendly and helpful.  The check-in agent at the front desk was lackluster, considering that this was a 5 diamond resort. There was no mention of the amenities included with my stay booked through Visa Signature Luxury Hotel collection...it seemed like a cold experience...check-ins at Hilton properties are consistently excellent...I think the agent was Cynthia?!?  The bungalow itself was well-appointed, but starting to show its age. The waiter at the restaurant claimed that the resort was
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent stay with us. I’m delighted to read that you enjoyed the oceanview terrace and room service, but I am disappointed that your overall service experience was less than perfect. Please know that I have followed up with the management teams of each department you mentioned to ensure that your comments are considered carefully, as we continuously strive to heighten the guest experience throughout the Resort.  Please know that we constantly maintain each Bungalow guestroom according to Forbes Travel Guide Five-Star and AAA Five-Diamond standards.   Once again, I apologize that the service you encountered during your visit fell short of your expectations and our goals. I invite you to contact me directly if you would like to discuss your feedback further, or if I could be of assistance as you plan a future visit.  Kind regards,  Santosh Kuruvilla Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: A Second Review - From Bungalow to Villa
Summary: Having previously stayed at and favorably reviewed Pelican Hill, it was a privilege to return to the property nearly three years later. For this stay we were joined by grandparents and young children and elected a Villa accommodation rather than a bungalow. My comments will focus on the differentiating factors from this visit vs. prior stay. Please read my prior review for additional feedback.   Villa Accommodation: Our two bedroom villa easily absorbed 8 people, including children. Cribs and rollaways were readily available, as was laundry detergent for use in the en-suite machines. We benefited from an ocean view upgrade and a room that was ready in the morning upon arrival. Check in at the Villa Clubhouse was seamless and we were escorted to our villa by accommodating and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed thoughts with us. I am pleased to read that you and your family enjoyed your Villa accommodations, as well as the service you experienced by our staff. I have personally passed along my gratitude to the staff members you graciously referenced by name.  I am disappointed to read about the difficulties you experienced during your stay, and have taken this opportunity to share your comments with the respective culinary and restaurant service staff you mentioned.   Once again, thank you for the detailed comments you have posted here.  We look forward to welcoming you and your family back in the future.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Terrible service and food. Mysterious "mistake" charges.
Summary: As many others have noted before, TERRIBLE service. From the time of making reservations, to the time I have been spending trying to get clarifications on mysterious charges after checkout, this "resort" has been one of the most frustrating experiences we have had with any hotel, much less a supposed high end resort. My wife and I both travel extensively for both business and pleasure. We have stayed at high end hotels and resorts in most metropolitan areas of the United States, as well as internationally. My point being, is that we are very familiar with what is acceptable service and what is not, so please do not think that my review is just coming from someone who had a bad honeymoon, or has never stayed at anything beyond the Hampton Inn.   Let's start with reservations. I
Manager Response: Chris,   I appreciate the detailed feedback you have taken the time to post. I regret that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. Please know that I have personally followed up on the reservations, dining, housekeeping and check-in comments you provided.  Additionally, I would like to take a moment to speak with you personally to discuss your experience in detail. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message.  Please know that your candid thoughts are appreciated, as we strive to continuously heighten the overall guest experience. Thank you for sharing your feedback.  Kind regards,  Santosh Kuruvilla Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: For a resort as up-scale as this and at the price for a room, certain amenities are expected to be included for free.  Do-it-yourself in room coffee is one of them.  I couldn't believe the $10 price tag for in-room coffee.  Overall, everything at the resort carried a hefty price tag (for example, $6 for shave ice at the pool -- come on, it's flavored ice.)  Another major irritation was the check-in process.  Although check-in is supposed to be at 4:00 pm, when I arrived at 1:00, I was told that the maid were presently in the room and it would be a short wait.  No problem, I could kill some time by the pool.  But as hour after hour passed and I was told that the room was "waiting inspection," my irritation grew.  When the room was finally ready (after 4:00 pm), the room was hot

Summary Heading: Beautiful place and great front desk staff.
Summary: The hotel was nice with wonderful views. Loved the patio and think a heat lamp would be a great addition so we could have enjoyed the evenings on the patio. The rooms were somewhat spacious.  We enjoyed the fireplace and used it every night. I wouldn't say the room offers more than any other hotel but it is nice. We did love the plush bath towels.  The service was top notch at the front desk, with bellman and house keeping. The service with the fitness staff could be better. The yoga instructor carried on a conversation in the door to the studio as we were waiting to walk in. She never acknowledged we were waiting and actually made us wait to walk in to the studio until she was done talking. Very rude.

Summary Heading: Our new home away from home
Summary: My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and the end of another year of our medical residencies with a quick staycation to this great resort. From the spa to the grounds to the politest staff in California, we could not have wished for more.  We showed up a little early, so we checked our bags in and made use of the spa facilities. Immaculate and relaxing are the only adjectives that fit the bill here. Even when I accidentally dropped my iPhone into the jacuzzi, the men's spa attendant graciously got in touch with the kitchen to get me a bag of dry rice toute de suite in an attempt to save my device. Sadly my phone never turned back on, but the gesture was much appreciated.  Although our check in was delayed by some unexpected carpet shampooing, the villa manager more than
Manager Response: I enjoyed reading about your experience at Pelican Hill. Thank you for the kind comments you’ve shared here. We look forward to welcoming you back “home” to Pelican Hill soon!   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We booked an ocean view room and we could sort of see the ocean if you looked above the roof of the building across the road blocked by the bridge and through the trees.  I had hoped to enjoy a bottle of wine watching the sun set, but wound up on a claustrophobic balcony surrounded with trees.  Otherwise, the room was spacious, private and well appointed.    The restaurant was okay, but the ambience of a fine restaurant ruined since it was also used by a father watching a young child while Mon got a spa treatment.
Manager Response: I appreciate that you have taken the time to share your feedback about your recent stay at the Resort. I apologize if your accommodations did not meet your expectations. I have shared your thoughts with our Resort landscaping team, so we can ensure that views from our oceanview rooms are not obstructed in any way.  Once again, I regret that your stay was less than perfect and appreciate you taking the time to post your candid feedback. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you. Please contact me directly if I could be of assistance as you plan your next visit.  Kind regards,  Santosh Kuruvilla Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This was the last hotel we stayed in on our honeymoon tour of California and it was one of the best.  The service was excellent with everybody being so helpful.  We were given a bottle of champagne and some strawberries to help celebrate which was a lovely touch.  The swimming pool is breathtaking - completely circular and quite empty when we were there.  There are plenty of sunloungers there and a good poolside service.  The gym is in the hotel is good, although it could be bigger.  We had breakfast at the hotel and it was fabulous, but you do pay for this.  Unless you are going to eat a lot it is better value to order what you want rather than have the buffet which I think came to around $80 for 2 people, plus tip.  If you want to economise anywhere then get breakfast outside
Manager Response: Amy,  I am delighted to read that you enjoyed your honeymoon stay at Pelican Hill. Thank you for celebrating such a special occasion with us. We look forward to welcoming you back again in the future.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We have just returned from spending 16 nights at Pelican Hill and I am sure you can imagine its not 'cheap'! I have a lot to say about this place, mainly positive but also some hefty negatives. We booked a bungalow 'sea view' with 'binoculars' room was good in terms of size, nice bathroom and huge bed and extremely peaceful. On two occassions we had to contact housekeeping as our room had not been serviced which is outrageous for a resort that sells itself as 5 star. I had booked a rental car in advance with the concierge service but between themselves and Hertz they thoroughly messed up but they did their best to put it right and Hertz reduced my rental charge as compensation. Lack of communication seems to be a problem at Pelican they are not pro-active but re-active in

Summary Heading: Worst Service I Ever Had in a Resort, please read below
Summary: The worst service we ever had at a resort, we hope that this review will urge whoever is in charge to take some immediate action and improve the service. The accommodations are beautiful, but the service throughout the resort is lacking. My boyfriend took me there for my birthday weekend, he added it the romance package to our stay because he wanted something really special. Sadly they didn’t execute it correctly, not even one night of our stay.  On the first night, when we got to the room, they forgot the rose petals, we had to call and ask for them, the person on the phone said we’ll get them the next night.  The second night, we got the rose petals, but not the champagne. We arrived to the room really late, so they had plenty of time. I don’t understand why no one was in
Manager Response: Thanking you for taking the time to post your thoughtful, in-depth feedback about your recent stay with us. Please allow me to extend my sincerest apologies for the experience you encountered. It is our mission and responsibility to provide exceptional service and memorable experiences for each and every guest who chooses to visit here. I regret that what should have been an enjoyable birthday celebration left you disappointed, and assure you that what you experienced was the exception, and not the rule.  Based upon the detailed feedback you have provided, I have taken the time to personally follow up with our front desk, housekeeping, spa and Andrea managers to address the inconveniences you experienced. We are committed to the highest levels of customer service at Pelican Hill, and it troubles me that your experience did not reflect this.   I would like to take the time to speak with you directly to discuss your feedback in more detail. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message. Once again, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect, and I hope that we will have the opportunity to serve you again soon. Thank you again for taking the time to share your detailed feedback.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We recently stayed in the Villas and have stayed there a number of times in the past.  The rooms, pool and workout facility are fantastic.  With that said, it took us over 2 hours to check-in, dining service was slow and sporadic, forget about getting anything ordered at the pool as they staffed the entire Villa pool area with what seemed like 4 people and we wouldn't see our server for over 30 minutes (this was after we ordered something).  On top of that, our bill was all wrong as they didn't take into account the AMEX Platinum Card amenities and after taking an hour to straighten that out, I found a $120 charge to my credit card a day later.  When I contacted them about it they said it was a mistake and refunded it but still not what I would expect from a supposed top end
Manager Response: Chris,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit. I apologize that your experience did not meet your expectations and our goals. Our aim is to deliver the best possible experience for each and every guest, and I am disappointed to read that your visit was less than perfect, especially considering that you have been a loyal guest of ours.   At Pelican Hill, it is our top priority to uphold the rigorous Forbes five-star service standards, while providing exceptional experiences for each and every guest.  As we continuously strive to heighten our service levels throughout the Resort, your thoughtful feedback is a gift.   Once again, I apologize that your visit fell short of your expectations and our goals, and appreciate you taking the time to provide your candid feedback. Should you wish to discuss your experience further, I invite you to contact me directly. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Pelican vs St regis vs Ritz and the winner is...
Summary: Laguna Beach is our favorite beach destination in the US and we try to come every year, each time to a different place. Ritz was well located in Dana Point by the beach, but we disliked the pool and the wedding heavy atmosphere. St regis is another wedding heaven, only further away from the beach. Pelican Hill- our most recent experience- beats both for location (Crystal Cove beach, closer to Laguna, expansive property with all the privacy) and space (bungalow probably twice as big), but it is a bit too pretentious- the Italian design is copycat- after all we are not in Italy- the pool, while amazing in design- was full of toddlers jumping in the water- hello! There is a kids pool - can you not enforce basic rules for adult visitors comfort? The spa is nice but the Caesar Palace

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort but disappointed in service
Summary: The resort is lovely. Ocean view bungalow is very spacious that is well appointed with a huge bathroom. The pool area is also very clean and very large and beautiful. I read many reviews on trip advisor before I booked which tended to be very positive.  It took 1 and 1/2 hours to get breakfast which then arrived cold in the Coliseum restaurant on our second day there. It appeared that they were understaffed. The first day everything was great at breakfast. Bed needed to be replaced. It was high in the middle and low on the sides. When you pay $700.00 for a place to stay I had every expectation that service would be exemplary and the bed comfortable. We had problems even getting a restaurant reservation initially. Breakfast was included with our room as we booked with Platinum
Manager Response: As I’m reading through the thoughtful feedback you have provided here, I am disappointed that your recent stay was compromised by the less-than-perfect service you encountered, especially knowing that you were here to celebrate such a special occasion.   I regret that the housekeeping service and front desk staff were anything but five- star, and I have followed up to discuss this feedback with our teams. I can assure you we are committed to the highest levels of customer service at Pelican Hill, and it troubles me that your experience did not reflect this.   I would like to take a moment to speak with you personally to discuss your feedback in detail. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This is a beautiful hotel, the pool is wonderful, but I wouldn't go back. It was advertised as pay for three nights get the fourth night free with American Express Platinum.  But I was billed for the fourth night and they will not refund it.  They tell me now after the fact that on the $525 per night economy room I booked that promotion does not apply.  For $525 per night I was the room closest to the pool.  All of the parking in front of my room is used by the valet parkers to part Ferraris, Lamborghinis and other expensive cars.  When they aren't using the spots they put white cones so I can't park in front of my room.  I have to park far away and walk for $525.  Then they run the golf carts by and back up at 6:30 AM and they beep which woke me up two of the four days.  Then
Manager Response: Dan,  Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback about your recent visit to Pelican Hill. I am disappointed to read that your visit fell short of your expectations and our goals. At Pelican Hill, our aim is to deliver gracious, personalized Five-Star service to each and every guest.  Based upon the detailed feedback you have provided, I have taken the time to personally follow up with our reservations and spa manager to address the inconvenience you have experienced. Since you made the reservations directly with American Express, we were unable to personally inform you of the promotion restrictions prior to your booking. As for the gratuity charge, our staff advised you that the charge of 22% was adjustable and you may choose to make adjustments after the treatment or upon departure.    Once again, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect. I appreciate your perspective and kindly invite you to contact me directly to discuss your feedback in more detail. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Hi, My family of 5, (2 adults 3 children-10,10,7) stayed here in late January of this year, this was my treat after 6 days at Disneyland, it couldn't have been better. We got upgraded to a 4 bedroom villa, and the stay was marvellous. There was a delay checking in, very busy, and we had to wait, we let the concierge know we were waiting with kids, he took care of it via free drinks and a decent food credit, we were happy. The pools are great, and the golf is an experience in itself. I wanted to show my children what luxury was like, and this was it. A staff member who made a real difference was Patrick who we met upon check in and took care of sorting out bags and all sorts. A truly wonderful place. Thanks  Guy Mills, stayed late Jan 2014
Manager Response: I’m delighted to read that your stay was perfect. I appreciate you sharing your gracious comments about Patrick, who I will thank personally for his delivery of Five-Star service to you and your family. We look forward to welcoming you back “home” to Pelican Hill soon!  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We have stayed at this resort several times within the past 2 years. This most recent stay was a 4 BR villa, with three other families. The hotel is beautiful, nice amenities, rooms, pools, etc. like all the positive reviews we have read.  However this time we have a few things that did not quite work for us.  1. we have booked a cabana at the Coliseum pool 2 weeks prior to arrival. On the day we got there, it was changed to a villa pool cabana without any prior notification. Upon questioning, the concierge then stated it was due to a buy-out of the Coliseum pool that happens on our day of reservation. Therefore all guests need to vacate the pool by 4 pm and no Coliseum cabana will be available for anybody . I feel sorry for people who are staying there that day over night.
Manager Response: Rachel,   I sincerely appreciate your taking the time to share your feedback.  I’m delighted to read that your enjoyed the Resort ground and accommodation, but I’m disappointed that your overall experience did not meet your expectations and our goals. Based upon your detailed comments, I have personally addressed your concerns regarding front desk, reservations and housekeeping with each department manager. Please know that Pelican Hill leaders review and consider each guest’s comments carefully, so that we may continue to heighten the overall guest experience.    As we continuously strive to improve the Pelican Hill guest experience, I sincerely thank you for posting your candid thoughts here. Should you wish to discuss your experience further, I invite you to please contact me directly at your convenience. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you in the future.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I work for a large travel company and have the privilege of staying in many nice hotels. This one is different. Very rarely hotels just "get it", and this one does. The staff are superb, the quality of the rooms, bedding, furnishings etc are fabulous. The pool is shallow (3"6') and the water pressure isn't huge but if these are the issues I can find with the hotel, that says it all! Mastros is a great restaurant round the corner, Balboa Beach is great for being a tourist but if you're staying at the hotel you'll need a car.

Summary Heading: This is a top of the line resort!
Summary: This place is impressive from the minute you drive through the entrance... Which is impressive itself. Beautiful verandas for coffee, great quiet alcoves for discussions or just reading a paper. Entire staff is friendly and always offer to help. Food is very good at all the venues I tried. Two Italian style cafés with superb coffee, pastries, and gelato! Pool is dramatic and most views are spectacular! The rooms are spacious and very we'll appointed. This is a five star operation.

Located on the hill sides, but yet close enough to the ocean.  It was both beautiful and luxurious. The bed so one of the MOST comfortable bed I have ever slept in at any of the other, "Five Stars" resorts.  My children and I stayed there for two nights while visiting southern California last year.  Its was very quite, private, and yet close to everything.  You could rent a larger unit for a larger group.  The Butler, is also available if you don't feel like cooking for your big group or family.  I did not play golf on this trip, but their course was AMAZING.  You will not be disappointed if you are a golfer.

I absolutely loved our stay at Pelican Hill and can't wait to go back.  We had a pre-arrival issue which was not handled well and I seriously considered cancelling, but I couldn't find another suitable alternative, and I arrived ready to find fault (I am rather picky!).  But there was no fault to be found.  It was fabulous!  We booked a 3 bedroom villa which was comfortable and provided ample space for 2 adults, 2 children and our nanny.  Both pool areas were excellent and service was cheerful and attentive everywhere.   We ate a few times at Colliseum Grill and enjoyed it.    The primary purpose of our trip was taking the kids to Disneyland for 3 days.  Pelican Hill was an excellent base for this and DL was an easy drive (45 minutes in the morning (plus allow 30 minutes to park

This is the perfect place to stay if you're not a first time visitor to LA and have already seen Santa Monica, Hollywood and Beverly Hills.  It makes a re-visit to Disneyland very easy and is a good access point to great shopping malls, San Diego, not to mention the beach areas around southern california.   We stayed as a family of five in January and loved the space of the two bedroom garden villa.  The villas are a very decent size and we really appreciated the complimentary cereals, cheese platter and beer in the fridge.  Staff were fantastic, friendly and accommodating.  We felt very well looked after and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  The Coliseum Grill is superb and can highly recommend for kids and adults alike.  The setting is beautiful and we loved the food.    My only

Let me start by stating that we went to this resort because the company we write insurance for paid for the trip. First, it was beautiful and very classy, but that is where the problem starts. We used two little bags of coffee in our room and it cost me $20.00. The breakfast buffet was $40.00 per person and I have eaten the same buffets for $6.99 at one of the restaurant chains. The resort did not have beach access and it was at least a 2 mile walk in a straight line, but you could not walk in a straight line, so more like 4 miles. They did run a shuttle to down town Laguna Beach and that was okay, but there is only so much to see in Laguna Beach. On the plus side. The rooms were beautiful and had great views. The beds were made for sleeping and enjoying.  but overall, three
Manager Response: I greatly appreciate you taking the time to post your comments about your recent visit to Pelican Hill. It is through the candid and thoughtful feedback from our guests that we are able to continuously improve upon our service standards throughout the Resort. Although I’m delighted to read that your enjoyed the Resort ground and view, I’m disappointed that your overall experience did not meet your expectations and our goals.   I apologize if your experience was less than perfect, and thank you again for your candid feedback.    Kind regards,  Santosh Kuruvilla Director of Rooms Division The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Perfect solution to staying in LA but not 'staying' in LA
Summary: This review is really directed at travellers particularly Australians who want to enjoy the many attractions of LA but not stay there. Whatever you can say about LA it's not a pretty place to stay particularly the downtown and the only realistic options are Beverly Hills or Santa Monica area.This  is an alternative as a magnificent property set right above the main coastal road that does sometimes make you think you are in Tuscany ! Logistically it is very easy commute from LAX (about 45 minutes). We stayed recently for 3 nights with our family after an extensive driving tour of the east followed by 2 weeks skiing in Colorado so we were ready for some relaxation by a pool.  Well the pool and view certainly did deliver assisted by spectacular weather and the views over  ocean

Summary Heading: Fails to honor guaranteed check in time.
Summary: Check in time is guaranteed by 4:00. Room wasn't clean and therefor not ready. Finally got checked in at 4:20pm. Left word to have GM Carlos call me. Have yet to hear from him.  Also noticed staining on staircase carpet which needs to be replaced.  It gives me no satisfaction to write a poor review however this one is warranted.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback here. I’m very disappointed to learn that you encountered anything less than a Five-Star service experience you expect and we aim to deliver. I apologize for the delayed in your check-in time, due to the heightened demand during the busy weekend. Please know that our staff made every effort to expedite the cleaning and inspection of your accommodations.  As we continuously strive to improve the Pelican Hill guest experience, I sincerely thank you for posting your candid thoughts here. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you in the future.   Kind regards,  Santosh Kuruvilla Director of Rooms Division The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: My wife and I spent Mother's Day weekend at Pelican Hill attending a wedding and came away very impressed. Although you expect excellence when paying $600+ a night for a hotel room we were especially pleased with this resort. From the lobby, to the bungalow rooms, to the staff, all was absolutely top notch. Although we did not eat much at the hotel we did enjoy an amazing wedding at what must be one of the most beautiful wedding locations in SoCal--and the food and associated service that went along with that grand event was outstanding. From the Coliseum and pool, to the golf course, to the Spa, every aspect of our stay was excellent and we look forward to our next opportunity to splurge and pamper ourselves at this great resort.

A private home away from home with first class amenities and world class service.  I enjoyed a 4 night stay here and was blown away.  The views, the food, the pampering is tops.  The Villas offer 2+ bedroom 2+bath condo style homes with full chef quality kitchens and large balconies.  Oh and a garage for your car, just pull in.  Amazing.  The pool and spa amenities are spectacular as is the dining at Andrea.  A real treat.

Pelican Hill is a great resort.  We stayed for a week, Apr 29 - May 4, 2014. We stayed in a bungalow.  The resort has excellent customer service.  They have car service that will pick you up and take you anywhere on the resort grounds and to Crystal Cove Beach. If you stay at the resort definitely get car service to the beach because if you drive on your own, the beach parking is $15.  The resort car service will also take you to several other places off the resort grounds but we only used it to get around the resort and go to the beach.  The rooms are very clean and the beds are very comfortable.  Im picky about cleanliness in hotel rooms and I didnt have to call house keeping to come back and spot clean anything after they did their normal cleaning.  Our bungalow had a

We spent a beautiful weekend at the resort. The grounds are beautiful, the staff so attentive, the villa was amazing, everything was perfect. Every meal we had was excellent. Great place for families with kids of all ages. We will definitely return.

Unbelievable pool. Gorgeous. Service was impeccable. Staff was pleasant. The poolside restaurant was very good, prices were reasonable and the staff was again pleasant and very attentive. We were not staying at the hotel but the property and staff were impressive enough that we are convinced that this is a must-stay resort. We will definitely return for a real stay.

we recently stayed at the resort at pelican hill in one of the villas. It was everything you could ask for and more! we will definitely go back and stay for longer than a week. The villas are beautiful, the clubhouse for villas is great and the service spectacular.

Summary Heading: Perfect stay at the Resort at Pelican Hill
Summary: We stayed here for four wonderful nights in mid-April. Everything was top-notch and we couldn't have been more pleased. As others have noted, the service is some of the best around; courteous, efficient, and friendly. And the entire grounds of the very large property were immaculately tended to - absolutely gorgeous.  Check-in was easy, and the front desk staff was friendly, efficient and helpful.  We booked a Double-Queen, Ocean View Bungalow, #338, and were completely pleased. Decor was understated and elegant, high-beamed ceilings, fireplace, lovely lanai, bathroom had every amenity a person could need, etc.   The grounds were stunning and afforded ample space to wander and catch lovely views of the ocean. We didn't use the golf course, but it looked lovely. We did make

My husband and I were here for a business trip in late April 2014.  The resort is beautiful and well manicured and has some of the friendliest & most helpful staff we've every experienced in the US.  We had a bungalow room with a partial ocean view (if we stood on our toes on a sunny day).  The beds were fantastic and even the resort provided shampoo, conditioner & lotions were spa quality.  Food was very good, especially the Oreo gelato! This resort is mainly attractive to golfers with wives who shop.  Since we aren't big on either, there was a bit of travel involved for us to be able to get to a beach, sightseeing or finding more affordable shopping/dining options.  However, nearby Laguna Beach and Balboa Island were the cure for that.

Stayed here in December 13 for a few days with the family - sheer perfection and top class service. View from our apartment was stunning and facilities were excellent. One or two hiccups during dinner service but the hotel did everything they could to put it right, even offering to dry clean my brothers tee shirt which had accidentally had coffee spilt on it. Would stay here again and recommend it to all. Tip: definitely need a hire car to make it down to Newport Beach and day trips to LA which can take well over an hour despite the relatively short distance.

Here for 4 days fora. Incentive trip courtesy of my employer.   There is nothing but positive observations to provide.  The surroundings are fabulous with views of the ocean, golf course and hills.  Our room was luxurious and the service from everyone we encountered just over the top.  Fabulous golf course, outstanding food, a wonderful spa with talented staff!    This was a real treat... I can't imagine anyone rating this less than 5 stars!   Not an inexpensive place to be but if you decide to go for it, you won't be disappointed!

Loved every minute here!! Only wish I could have stayed longer!! Stayed in 2bedroom villa. Beautiful spacious luxury suite!! Pool was amazing, staff was do accommodating! This place does everything right!!!! Totally want to go back and enjoy the golf and spa on next visit!!

This resort is amazing, from the service down to the facility. Probably nicest place I've ever stayed, and I've traveled quite a bit. You can walk or take shuttle to beach, or stay put like we did most of the time and enjoy the beautiful pool with waiter service.

This resort was amazing ...Our bungalow was incredible, with amazing views! The pool area was a postcard. We walked the resort, rented bikes and loved Crystal Cove, Beach-State park.  The beach restaurant was our favorite..added to the whole experience of Pelican Hill...Lovely!

My husband and I enjoyed a beautiful Easter weekend at the resort with a large group of friends. Everything was first rate. We were thrilled with the comfort and size of our Bungalow accommodations.  We had no need for a car as transportation around the property is just a phone call away and extremely prompt, and a complimentary shuttle is provided to Fashion Island -  which was at the top of my To Do list!  The food was amazing whether at the Pelican Grill, Andrea's or room service.  It was some of the best room service we have ever had.  When we ordered breakfast on a busy morning at 7:03 am, we were told our meal would arrive by 7:33 am or before.  All three mornings we ordered hot breakfasts they arrived (and piping hot) within 20 minutes, even when the resort was almost at

We met family and friends at the resort for a special birthday celebration.  We stayed in a luxurious villa and also had several bungalows.  The staff is so attentive that they anticipate your every need.  We had guests of all ages that were treated with nothing but respect and professionalism.  Prompt transportation throughout the resort is just a phone call away.  All of the meals were perfect, but we were especially spoiled at the Chef's Table in the Pelican Grill.  Andrea's presented an exceptional gourmet dinner for our group on a busy Saturday night.  The golfers were in awe of the beautiful courses and the spa was wonderful.  Thank you so much for a perfect stay!

Summary Heading: Luxurious property well worth the money
Summary: Took my mother for her birthday and she was just blown away. The presentation of this hotel went above and beyond my hopes. From the moment you walk threw the doors excellence all around. Made my mom feel like a queen for the day.  The room was just excellent as well we felt very secured. We had breakfast the next day at the pool grill and again mom was in heaven with her blueberry pancakes. Thank you for all that you did

We have enjoyed The Resort at Pelican Hill on many occasions.  Due to a change in management in the Villas -Luigi the Villa Manager has ruined this.  Do not intend to celebrate a special event within his presence.  He showed a extreme lack of professionalism and young adults from the community were harassed and discriminated against based solely on age.  We have appealed to the Director of Rooms and he has chosen to disregard the truth of all involved including his staff.  Its sad that the future young adults of the world have to endure this type of ordeal when they are attending one of the top universities in the world and have chosen to make a difference. Too bad management at Pelican Hill does not.
Manager Response: Patrice,  Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent visit. I understand your level of disappointment and have personally followed up with the Villa manager and Director of Rooms about the concerns you have detailed here. It is my understanding that the Villa manager advised your party of the Resort policies upon checking-in and later reiterated them on many occasions since we received numerous complaints from other guests regarding the behavior of your guests. We have policies in place that protect the enjoyment and privacy for all guests.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This was our third visit to Pelican Hill and it's become our go-to spot when we want and need a complete rest. The bungalows are spacious and elegant; the amenities first-rate; the spa is truly a sublime escape; and the golf is spectacular even when you play as badly as I do. Chris is our regular caddy and he is extremely knowledgeable about every aspect of both courses and club selection. Best of all, at Pelican Hill, there is no noise. The silence is heavenly.  As far as things that could be improved: 1) the resort's requirement that guests go through a central telephone bank to deal with most requests, such as housekeeping and restaurant reservations, is annoying and cumbersome. The phone bank is manned by wildly enthusiastic young people. I always call housekeeping whenever

What a lovely resort - amazing staff. Rooms immaculately clean, lovely beds and generous room sizes. The only slight niggle would be that the sunloungers around the pool could have newer cushions on them as a few have started to look a bit worn but you only notice this if you are down at the pool early before the fresh white towels go on! Otherwise pretty much perfect

This property is such a treat.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom Villa which was very West Coast casual elegance.  The Villa was well appointed with a full kitchen stocked with some complimentary breakfast items and spices for cooking.  The villa has a private garage, 2 1/2 baths; the two full baths have a bathtub and shower.  The bed is heavenly.  The villa has a large balcony with an Ocean View a perfect place to sit and enjoy a cup of tea or have breakfast.    The villa comes with access to a butler who will draw your bath for you, really?  Need I say more?  You also have your choice of check in at the main hotel or the club-house or even right from your villa. We were there celebrating my Mom’s birthday and upon arrival we were treated to a cheese and fruit plate along with a bottle

upon check in, we were greeted agressively when we were told our reservation was for 2 bungalows, as opposed to what i  DID book which was one bungalow for 2 people. as anyone who has stayed here knows, these bungalows are not inexpensive and even though there obviously was a mistake made, they told me i would have to pay for the second bungalow!! not only did they charge me, but deborah and michael in the front desk were snotty and underhanded as they lied to me and told me it would be taken care of. since arriving home, my card was charged for both and i have been given the run around by managers and accountants alike and they all are taking a hard nosed stand. i have never been treated so poorly by this quality hotel before, i WOULD NOT STAY HERE!!!! also, the beach that you
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your experience. I understand you level of disappointment and have personally followed up with the front office about the concerns you have detailed here. It is my understanding that our reservations staff advised you of the cancellation policy upon booking, and once again during check-in. In addition, our front office staff did not make any promises, and I believe they have made extra efforts to accommodate your circumstances.    We strive to provide exceptional service and memorable experiences for each and every guest who chooses to visit our resort. To this end, we value your perspective and appreciate you taking the time to share it here. Should you wish to discuss your experience further, I invite you to contact me directly. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Close to Perfect, Worth Every Penny
Summary: Two couples shared a villa and I've never had better accommodations. Two large bedrooms with outstanding bathrooms, a roomy and comfortable living area with a great fireplace, a small but well designed kitchen with everything you could need and a big balcony with unobstructed views of the Pacific. The decor was elegant and the architectural finishes were very nice. This was a 2200 sq.ft. villa with a garage, so nice that I thought the room rate was a bargain.   Service throughout the property was equal to the accommodations. Friendly and professional staff enhanced our stay, whether it was our butler, restaurant folks, golf staff and anybody else we encountered.   We played two rounds of golf giving us a chance to experience both courses. The North Course is one of all time

We spent a great weekend at this comfortable stylish hotel. The staff were excellent, well trained and very attentive. Rooms are spacious and well appointed each with its own little terrace and gas log fire in the bedroom. The Villas are in a separate complex, more like an apartment block but very civilised nevertheless. Choose a bungalow if being near to the main pool (a spectacular round pool) and hotel facilities is important to you. Bathrooms are spacious with plenty of bath towels, robes etc. Service in the restaurant was slow at breakfast but good in the main and terrace dining rooms, and by the pool. Although a large hotel the scale is broken up into very manageable spaces with plenty of places to collapse and read a book or work quietly.This is a great and very elegant

Loved this place.  Wonderful service.  New.  Well kept grounds.  Service was terrific.  They even brought in a firm mattress for me!  I'm coming back.  Just one suggestion: Upon entry, one needs to get out of the car to check in and then get back in the car to get to the Villa.  For such a nice place, it felt like we were going to a motel.  In this day and age, with the use of technology, the hotel should check you in at the valet.  It would be a nice touch.

There is no doubt that this a lavish resort where no expense has been spared in kitting out the estate.  Unfortunately the service levels are completely inconsistent.  The staff at the pool and in the two restaurants were very attentive and efficient but that was where efficiency ends and of course these are the areas where you have to pay for the service through tipping.....   When we checked in at 10 to 4 (check in time is 4pm) our room was not ready which was not a problem as we wanted to eat by the pool.  I then asked the staff there if they could have our keys sent down - it was now half past 5.  Keys duly arrived and we walked down to 'our' room and let ourselves in.  To our total embarrassment it was not our room but another guests who were present.  I'm not going to go
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your in-depth feedback about your experience. I sincerely apologize for the unfortunate disappointment you encountered during your stay. At Pelican Hill, it is our mission and responsibility to provide exceptional service and memorable experiences for each and every guest who chooses to visit our resort, and it troubles me that your experience did not reflect this. Please know that I have personally discussed your feedback with our front office staff and Villa manager, so we may continue to improve our service levels throughout the resort.   Once again, I apologize that your experience fell short of the Five-Standards you expect and we aim to deliver. What you encountered is the exception, and not the rule. Your candid thoughts are truly appreciated, and I would like to discuss your feedback further. I will provide you with my contact details separately in a private message, so you may contact me directly at your convenience. I look forward to the opportunity to listen and understand your perspective in more detail.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Four of us stayed in a villa and it was outstanding.  The accommodations, the views, the service, and the amenities are top notch!  Not to mention the great golf courses and dining!  The setting is fantastic and close to all types of restaurants, beaches, and shopping.  All in all a place I would recommend to anyone.

Got a great rate via AX Platinum, otherwise typical rates are to high.  Great room "villa".  Fireplace, huge bath, nice patio with table, loungers.  Staff was great, not real flexible in restaurants as everything on xmas eve was prix fix only.  Property is large and hilly, so expect to walk/hike, or call for shuttle.  Great overall, although expensive for everything, but sometimes it is just worth it.

every where we we go to was pretty enough to take pictures. it was so fancy and the staff was so nice. OCCASIONALLY, WE ENCOUNTER SMELLY SMOKERS. the food was good but small portion. it consider girl portion instead of men food portion. food is pricey. at the pelican grill, the y have a nice bar lounge with beautiful view. they have 2 giant tv to watch sport and live band music except the music band  kept playing songs the average guest don't know so they either ignore the band or  get up and leave. the band need to realize they need to play song that guest know and able to sing along or dance along. they were awful.

Truly. Combine Tuscany and the Amalfi coast, open your eyes- and you'll find yourself at Pelican Hill...surrounded by European architecture, the expansive pacific..and palm trees.  What a property... What a view... What service...What delicious food...What lovely bungalows ~ complete with sumptuous beds... what a Spa.  What's not to love?!?!?!  If you'd like to experience the best of California (all of the above) and avoid the worst (traffic, crowds,smog, snobs) look no further, and book your stay at Pelican Hill.

we stayed here for a week in in June 2013 and loved it. The place is luxurious and the unit is impeccable. We saw 2 hummingbird just outside the back porch when we came in for the first time. The smell of the flower garden fills up the room in the morning. We were given oceanview property and loved it. Best pool we've been to. One of the rare occasions where we actually attempted to extend our vacation. Loved the trips to Laguna Beach and the rest of Orange County. Would love to visit this place again, and enthusiastically recommend it!

My second stay in the last year and everything was as perfect as the first time. Rooms are beautiful and large. Staff are friendly and professional. Amazing views of the Pacific and world class golf course. Restaurant was great. My two stays were business related, but this is definitely a place to plan a vacation in paradise.

Hate to be a downer but I was not impressed today.  Have been many times but today was kind of a bummer.  Service was lack luster, slow and not really into it.  No questions about what you might like to drink, no bread, food was very slow, no refills on water, no requests for any additional items needed, fish on tacos was hard and not tasty.   Had to hunt down the waiter/waitress asked questions that seemed logical but seemed annoying to waitress.  Valet was excellent and I appreciated that there was no valet charge but would have appreciated the same service and food at the Grill.  Realizing that everyone in OC thinks they are "special" I was not asking for anything "special," just five star service for a five star price:)  Better luck next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback here. While I’m pleased to read that you enjoyed the valet service, I am disappointed that your recent visit to the Grill fell short of your expectations and certainly our goals. Please know that I have personally addressed your concerns with the Pelican Grill management team, so we may continue to heighten the overall service experience.  I appreciate your gracious feedback and invite you to contact me directly, if I may be of personal assistance in arranging a return visit to the Pelican Grill in the future.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director  The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This is an absolutely stunning resort with friendly, fabulous service. It is expensive, though so if you go be prepared for a rather large expense. But if you can afford this place, it is worth every penny. The pool area is magnificent and you overlook the golf course with the Pacific Ocean just beyond. The rooms, or bungalows as they call them are spacious, each with its own balcony and most with a view of the Pacific. Rooms are equipped with a coffee grinder, fresh beans and of course, a brewer. The only negative thing I have to say about the room is really about the throw pillows on the bed, and that is one of ours was very frayed at all 4 corners. Not exactly first rate. The rooms themselves are kept clean and beds are extremely comfortable.  There is an extensive fleet of

Summary Heading: This is a true 5 star hotel
Summary: I will admit that I complained about our trip to Pelican Hill when my family booked it.  I wanted to take the kids to a beach vacation, and I thought we would be trapped at a resort with nothing to do but sit by the pool.  I was wrong!  The place was amazing.  We stayed in a 4 bedroom villa which was the roomiest and nicest accommodations we have ever stayed in.  Each room had excellent linens, pillows, very comfortable beds and TVs.  There was plenty of living space and an amazing view/patio.  The service was incredible.  No matter what you asked them, the answer was always, "no problem."  The concierge took care of all our reservations and excursions.  The kids took surfing lessons, we went to Balboa pier and Universal studios.  We ate at all of the restaurants, and they were

What more can be said about the absolute perfection of this resort? Upon arrival my daughter and I were greeted by the valet who was warm and welcoming, then and there I knew that this would be a great stay. The front desk staff was a pleasure as they ensured we were checked in promptly and had everything we needed. The room believe it or not looks exactly the way it does on the resort's website. Clean and comfortable bed, spacious bathroom, greats views, pretty much the works. Sure the prices of this resort are not by any means budget prices, but as the old adage goes, "you get what you pay for!" I recommend this property to anyone traveling to the Orange County area as I am quite certain that you will enjoy your stay as much as I did.

Expensive but worth every cent. The service was great, the views and suite even better. The food was fantastic and the pool out of this world. I'm running out of superlatives! We stayed for three nights and each day was better. If you can afford it, one should go to this hotel, just for the experience. We will always remember The Resort At Pelican with fond memories!

The Resort at Pelican Hill is the ideal place to be in the Newport Beach area. From 3 outstanding restaurants to 36 holes of Tom Fazio golf, there is little you will not love about Pelican Hill. Perched above the Pacific most rooms have views of the ocean as well as one if the two golf courses. Our king bungalow suite, complete with fireplace, had a patio overlooking the first hole on the South Course with the Pacific and Catalina Island in the background. While both courses are wonderful, I prefer the South Course with its two par 3's paralleling the ocean. Bring you camera!!  The restaurants in property are excellent as is the service. Andrea, the resort's signature restaurant offers exceptional Italian cuisine. Have the risotto prepared table side in a wheel of Parmesan, you

There is no doubt that this place is very nice and definitely 5* - however when you take into account the price and the service (lack of it in our case) - you would not return. We had an issue of a misunderstanding on dates and even though we told them we were leaving on a set date - when we checked in - they still charged us for the additional day which was terrible in our opinion. It's not as if the place was booked out !!! Very few people there when we stayed. Best avoided until they learn the importance of customers!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback here. I am disappointed to read that your recent visit to the Resort fell short of your expectations and certainly our goals. Please know that I have personally discussed your feedback with our front office staff. It is my understanding that our reservations and front office staff advised you of the deposit and cancellation policy upon booking.   We strive to provide exceptional service and memorable experiences for each and every guest who chooses to visit our resort. To this end, we value your perspective and appreciate you taking the time to share it here. Once again, I apologize that you experience was less than perfect, and appreciate you taking the time to provide your candid feedback. Should you wish to discuss your experience further, I invite you to contact me directly. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: This place is absolutely top notch. Stayed in the 2 bedroom villas and they were amazing! 2 bedrooms master with king bed and master bath. 2nd bedroom was very large with 2 queen beds and a huge attached bathroom. It also has a full kitchen, dining and living area. along with a large patio with table and chairs and 2 wonderful chaise lounges on it. There is also a 3rd bathroom that was quite large. We used it as a room for the baby. It was dark and quite so we rolled the porta crib in it and it worked perfect. Baby didn't get woke up by anyone sharing a room with her. The villa also has a private garage attached. You also have a butler assigned to you and they come and pick you up in a private car to go places within the resort. We felt like the lifestyles of the Rich and

Although it was cool and rainy, it didn't dampen a trip to this spectacular resort.  Recently, I was lucky enough to stay at this resort during a business conference.  Everything about it was as good as it gets.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The property was gorgeous from every angle, overlooking the golf course, straight out to the ocean.  The room was comfortable and featured a nice balcony with an unobstructed view of the ocean.  Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Almost perfect.  Suits just need to help out. Don't idle cars
Summary: My in-laws recommended this resort so not sure what to expect.  We were upgraded to fabulous 4 bedroom villa, not that we needed all this space.  But would be perfect for a family. We had a lovely butler who was always available by text which was nice.  Villas a bit far from main resort but easy walk to main resort.  Ask how to walk the fast back way.  Also you can walk to golf shop, 20 min. but wonderful walk.   Small issues with a beautiful property in a beautiful part of the world.  We arrived starving from an early morning east coast flight.  Went straight villa restaurant by pool, I explained I was famished so ordered the gazpacho, explaining to bring right away.  Thinking how long could cold soup take.  After numerous asks,  it took good 20min. Started trip on bad note.

Great location with gorgeous views and accessible to so many great beaches and locations. Visited Laguna, Newport Beach and other quaint areas. Started the trip as business extended to personal and it was a great experience on both fronts. Even made new friends by the gorgeous infinity pool!  Rooms were beautifully equipped and they were willing to accommodate any needs. Can't wait to go back with the kids.

This is among the best resorts to stay at in the world.  The rooms, golf, food and over the top amazing service made this memorable.  The staff at the Irvine Co. owned property are well trained and if I could give them six stars -- I would.

This was our second trip to Pelican Hill.  This resort is first class all the way around.  The service and accommodations were outstanding.  The golf on both the South and North courses was exceptional.  The conditions were great and the views are probably the best we have ever had, including golf trips we have taken to the mountains and in Hawaii.

I booked our stay through American Express Platinum Travel. We arrived with happy anticipation of a lovely stay. That feeling only lasted until we reached the front desk. We were met there by Carly, whose professional goal, it seems, is to make one feel like a number or "just another sheep in the herd". She recited her spiel about check-in being at 4:00 etc. No mention of our reservation being with Platinum Travel Services until I asked if they could honor the early check-in which is one of the benefits. No mention of any of the other benefits of our AMEX reservation either. I wondered if she was even familiar with the program.  When I mentioned that, in addition, we were members of the Resort's own Exclusive Privelege Program she had no idea what that meant, or it meant nothing
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your in-depth feedback about your experience. I would like to extend my sincerest apologies for the experience you encountered. It is our mission and responsibility to provide exceptional service and memorable experiences for each and every guest who chooses to visit our resort. Please know that I have personally discussed your feedback with our managing director and followed up directly with our front office staff so we may continue to improve our service levels throughout the resort.   Please note that our front office manager has tried to reach you several times and left messages, hoping to have the opportunity to connect before your departure.  I would also like to take the time to speak with you directly to discuss your feedback in more detail.  I will provide you with my contact details separately in a private message, so you may contact me directly at your convenience. Once again, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect, and I look forward to speaking with you so that we can make exceptional improvements during the remainder of your stay.   Kind Regards,  David Phillips Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We have stayed at Pelican before and had a wonderful time, which is what led to me picking the resort to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary.  I opted to "upgrade" to a 2 bedroom villa for the 3 nights figuring it would be nice and comfortable for our family of four.  We arrived at the resort around 3:30 p.m. on Friday.  Guaranteed Check in is at 4 p.m.  As we are waiting to check in I hear the couple ahead of us is upgraded to a 3 bedroom ocean view villa.  I think "great", since I'm an Irvine Company "Customer Privilege" member I also qualify for an ocean view upgrade - so I'm feeling good!  I step to the desk to check in, the front desk girl confirms our reservation in a "garden view" villa.  I hand her my "customer privilege" card and request the upgrade.  She informs me
Manager Response: Lori,  I sincerely appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback. While I’m please to read that you enjoyed dinning at our restaurants, I regret that your experience fell short of the Five-Star standards you expect and we aim to deliver. Please know that what you encountered is the exception, and not the rule.    Based upon your detailed comments, I have personally addressed your concerns with regards to the check-in process, maintenance and housekeeping. Pelican Hill leaders review and consider each guest’s comments carefully, so that we may continue to heighten the overall guest experience.   I apologize for the unfortunate disappointment you experienced and would like to hear more about your perspective. I will provide you with my contact details separately in a private message, so you may contact me directly at your convenience.   Kind Regards,  David Phillips Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The Resort at Pelican Hill was five star luxury at its finest.  Instead of hotel rooms, guests have their own villas overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  The service was phenomenal and the food exceptional.  We loved ordering room service for breakfast and wine/cheese at night before we went to dinner.  The rooms have a bedroom and living room with 2 fireplaces and a huge patio.  Truly felt like we were staying at a beautiful home!  The pool service was amazing surrounded the perfectly round pool built to replicate ancient Greece.  The Italian restaurant was awesome, everything was delicious and authentic.  Overall, first class service, amenities and staff.

This was part of my birthday present, and Bill couldn't have done better! Even the weather cooperated! Bit of a mix up with the booking but the management couldn't have been nicer and fixed it without a big fuss, or increase! The property was gorgeous and we walked every inch with a baby stroller! We baby sat for our granddaughter for a day! The restaurant made an extra effort to place us away from noisy parties, so we could keep the baby asleep while we ate. The baby also loved the kiddy park which was away from the main guest area so we did not disturb others Fireplace in the room added a wonderful cozy touch. We even got driven down to Crystal Cove for breakfast on the beach, which was wonderful. Do it! The only iffy piece was some of the quick food late in the evening, in

Difficult to find any fault at this great resort hotel.  Operation of fireplace in the room could have been explained a little better.  Room service staff seemed a little too familiar and asked a lot of questions in their attempt to be hospitable.  Perhaps a little training n this area.

This place is fantastic. Prepare to relax in a true oasis of serenity. The exclusiveness of the resort keeps everything clean, quiet, and serene. The pool is large, open, and great for people watching. The location is on a fantastic golf course - one of the best in the world . I really enjoyed my stay. My wife loved it.

Stayed 2 nights at a Villa. The check in was smooth. The facilities are rather spread out so had to get chauffeured to our unit.  The unit was fully decked out. A master suite and a double bed children room with its own bathroom. There was a guest half bath.  Enjoyed both the North and South course. The rentals were Nike.  The driving range was probably one of the most beautiful ones I've seen. Definitely recommend getting a caddie as you will enjoy the course much more.  Breakfast portions at the reception were American sized and service was great both times. Drinks at the clubhouse grill was ok. Dinner was Andrea was excellent but the atmosphere somewhat superficial. The risotto was the best.   Overall, great food, great service and great golf

I was fortunate to stay in the bungalows a few weeks ago and found them beautiful.  Super quiet, luxurious accommodations.  Very roomy and nice patio.  Service here was great; I didn't anticipate the layout being so spread out but calling for a shuttle always got a very prompt response if you don't want to walk.  Beautiful pool, great golf courses (I played them both, the South is a tad easier) and great shopping nearby.  Highly recommended

Summary Heading: Amazing Place to Stay and Relax!!!!!
Summary: This was by far one of the most amazing places I have had the pleasure of staying!   GREAT food at the on site restaurant!  We enjoyed lunch and dinner there! I used the spa facilities for a wonderful massage and manicure/pedicure, plus the steam room and sauna were a "stay as long as you'd like" experience! The staff is above and beyond accomodating!  My husband and I would highly recommend this for a romantic get away! The pool is beautiful with the view of the coast and ocean! Great area to sip a glass of wine and watch the sun set!

My husband and I traveled to this resort to meet an old Marine Corps friend. Although we did not stay at the hotel, we did enjoy lunch here. We also took a stroll around the grounds, and lounged by the pool. It was a beautiful, sunny day! The service was great. The manager of the restaurant gave a free round of champagne to thank my husband, and his friend, for serving our country. It was a very sweet and unexpected gesture. I would definitely like to return to this resort to stay the night.

Perfect. Wish we would have had more time to enjoy it but were only there for one day. Great staff and accommodations. Will be back as soon as we can. Everyone was so nice and welcoming and the place was amazing in terms of little sweet things they all did to make us feel pampered. Great stay.
