Loved everything about Pelican Hill!    The staff was fantastic from the door person to the pool staff.  We are not golfers, and didn't know if we would like staying on a golf course.  Thought it was fantastic, and loved looking over the golf course to the ocean.  We knew ahead of time that it was up from the ocean, not right on the ocean so it didn't bother us.  I thought it was a good value for what you got.  Especially if you compare to other resorts in the area!  We would go back in a second!

Nice location. Room was ok, poor design with a weird location for a TV. Rooms are far from the main lobby (more like a condo complex). You have to drive from the main check in to your room. Problem is, there is no reserved parking, so I was unable to find a space in my entire complex at 8pm at night. Real big inconvenience. Need to have at lease one parking space reserved for each room  Food was nice. Coffee shop was slow as molasses, so if your in a hurry in the morning, forget it.   I would not stay there again. Overpriced.

Summary Heading: Location, location, location - quite a treat
Summary: Sure all depends on the rate, but all in all a great a resort to chill, golf, wine and dine. Staff friendly, good access to beach and in driving distance to other nice beach towns and even better dining and 'watch the sunset' restaurants. Good for singles, couples and business trips; not sure about families.

What a place!   This is the absolute best resort we have stayed anywhere. The location, accommodation, food, and service are all fantastic and truly exceptional. Only small downside the size of the fitness room is a bit small but there are two to choose from, so not a big deal. We can't wait to return soon!

Summary Heading: Amazing property.  Expensive and worth every penny.
Summary: What a perfect stay-cation from LA.  This place was incredible, I can't say enough about it.  Everything was wonderful- from the bungalow to the pool/jacuzzi (open 24h!) to the restaurants on site.  We celebrated my fiancee's 30th bday and she was in heaven.  We only stayed one night and both of us had to deal with mild depression as we left Sunday afternoon to drive back to LA.  The Pelican Grill was excellent on all counts as was the poolside dining.    We found the staff incredibly helpful and accomodating, one call to the concierge and we had a dinner res, a private car pickup, and someone to come fix a minor issue with our tub while we were out dining.  Fantastic.  I'm not usually one for upscale resorts but I have to say it's really nice to get away and just relax at a

My husband and I have been to the grill many times, but never have I thought to stay at the resort. I decided to surprise my husband for this birthday with a little "stay-cation" at the Pelican Hill this last week. I didn't feel like I was in Newport Beach - it felt as if I traveled to a hillside community in Italy. It was quiet, quaint and luxurious all at the same time. The staff was excellent - Chuck (our "bell-man") was so knowledgeable about all the amenities and took his time explaining everything in our Bungalow.   And our Bungalow suite - to die for! 1650 square feet (maybe a little overboard for one night), but WOW, it was beautiful! From the view, to the furnishing to the overall finishes of the room - it was breath taking!   We ordered room service for both lunch and

My husband and I stayed here four nights over New Years. We absolutely loved the bungalow with a nice patio and the overall resort. We used the pool, spa and gym and loved all of it. However, we were continuously disappointed by the staff and service.  - I had signed up for Exclusive Privileges program before arrival, received no confirmation and no details on what to expect next. The website does not have any details on how to use. - We inquired about Exclusive Privileges at check in. The front desk agent didn't know the answer but she told us she'd follow up (and even wrote a note), but never did. - New Year's in the Great Room was very chaotic. We witnessed staff and managers arguing, our waitress clearly did not want to be there, and noticed they changed their policy (added

My family and I stayed at the Villas last weekend on a staycation.  I have to say, I'm ready to sell my home and move in one.  They're beautiful, big, comfortable, everything I want in a home.  Completely detached homes with a garage and a great back patio.  They also come with a butler, Jeeves.  Our villa had panoramic Ocean/Sunset views as well as Golf Course views.  It came stocked with adult beverages and snacks for the kids.  We spent the day by the Coliseum Pool and the fog rolled in covering the Ocean but stayed away from the pool.  Awesome weekend, my only regret is we didn't stay longer.  Can't wait to go back!  Five star service.

We stayed at the Pelican Hill villas based on a recommendation from friends who stayed here in the summer. We were so impressed with the spaciousness and privacy of the 3-bedroom villa. One thing that was not clear from the PH website was whether or not there was an ocean view from each of the villas. Our 3-bedroom villa had a beautiful ocean view just overlooking the golf course below. Our 3 kids had plenty of space to relax, and everyone had their own bathroom which was fantastic.  I loved that there was open wi-fi, and no need to log in or anything. The bathrooms are huge with oversized showers and tubs, and double-sinks. Having our own garage with a washer and dryer was great. We really felt as though it was a vacation home and not a hotel.  If you are traveling as a family,

We just came back from spending our holiday vacation at Pelican Hill and it exceeded all expectations, and I think I am pretty picky.  We had been looking for an easy convenient place for the 4 of us to visit from New York, and meet our son who is in graduate school in L.A. We talked about going to the Caribbean or Cabo, but everything really nice was booked. So we settled on the CA Newport Beach/Laguna area.  I guess it is considered off season because we were able to rent a huge and beautiful 4 bedroom villa (with its own garage) for about half the cost that a much smaller 2 or 3 bedroom villa would cost at an equivalent type of resort in the Caribbean.  And the unit was great - huge, luxurious, immaculate, and a spectacular view over the golf course to the Pacific Ocean. It

Summary Heading: First Class Resort - Attention to Details
Summary: My 2 night stay at this resort was simply first class in every way. The first thing you notice is that the staff are all impeccably well trained. Attention to detail is evident everywhere.  I booked a garden view bungalow but appeared to have been upgraded to an ocean view because I had a generous view of the ocean. I appreciate how the resort didn't try and cram everyone together as all the bungalows were generously spaced out with only a handful of bungalows connected to each other at a time. You feel as if you are going to a home, not a room.  Inside, the room was very spacious with high ceilings, a cozy fireplace, large seating area, private terrace and a gorgeously designed bathroom (pictures on their website felt accurate). I definitely appreciated how well thought out

We spent 2 nights here last week.  The location is good.  The rooms are large and well done. We love the fact you can drive/park in front of your room.   The goodness stops there in the context of a 5 star rating and 5 star pricing.    The service at the pool was awful.  45 minutes to get 2 drinks served in dirty glasses.   We asked our waiter several times if someone could bus the old food and drink strewed all over the chaises and old towels next to us. It was over 1.5 hours before it was removed.  We did not enjoy these birds and bees - swarming all over the food.  The whole of the pool seemed to be in a similar state of 1-2 start quality service.  The most frustrating part was the staff and managements lack of care and purpose.  Plenty of 2 star properties have better
Manager Response: Brad,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback here. While I’m delighted to read that you enjoyed the Resort’s location, layout and Bungalow guest rooms, I’m very disappointed to learn that you encountered anything less than a Five-Star service experience. I apologize that your visit was less than perfect with regard to poolside service, in-room maintenance and extending your stay.  Please know that Pelican Hill leaders review and consider each guest’s comments carefully, so that we may continue to heighten the overall guest experience. Your candid thoughts are sincerely appreciated, and I would like to hear more about your experience. I will provide you with my contact details separately in a private message, so you may contact me directly at your convenience.   Thank you again for graciously taking the time to share your comments. I look forward to the opportunity to listen and understand your perspective in more detail.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Luxury family resort removed from bustle
Summary: My family and I traveled here after Christmas when we were able to secure a really good rate for the bungalows (regular rooms). The hotel itself is everything you would expect of a five star resort. Service is impeccable, rooms are complete with all the basics and the extras (fireplaces and deep tubs), amenities like the pool and fitness center is completely up to snuff. If you are a golf fan or could spend all day in a spa, this is really your place.   Fair and huge warning-- if you do not enjoy those things or plan on venturing off the resort a lot- it might not be worth your money to stay at such a secluded place. While easily accessible from PCH, Pelican Hill is located an hour or so from LAX and 1 hour and a half from San Diego. There are some odd and end places to visit in

Just spent a few days at Pelican over Christmas.  Wow...no better way to spend the holiday than laying out by the pool in 80 degree plus weather with superb service.  Pelican is a first class resort with amazing service and luxury villas.  This is our only choice when visiting the Newport area.  The staff for the Villas is also truly amazing catering to all of your needs.

Returned for another stay at what I believe may be the best US destination.  It is a remarkable resort which, while not inexpensive, is a superior value. Our bungalow was terrific - great views with the pacific ocean in distance. You would never know the pch was in-between. The physical beauty of the place can take your breath away. Service too is over the top.  Please open gym early ( door open in 3 min), extra water (again, 3 min). My theory of the place is that it is owned by Irvine Company and that Mr. Bren's priorities allow the experience of staying at the resort to not be compromised by squeezing out maximum near-term margin. Not sure.  In any event, for this skeptical and road weary traveler, I cannot come up with any constructive criticism and look forward to visiting

Second stay at Pelican Hill for Christmas. Not only is it an aesthetically perfect property with a consistently friendly staff, but they don't nickel-and-dime you like a lot of hotels nowadays: Pelican offers free parking, no resort fee, free Wifi for ALL your devices (a recent chain hotel charged me $17.99 per day PER device!) and complimentary use of the spa and fitness center. Plus, our package included a $50 per day breakfast credit. If there is a problem with this hotel, it's that you really, really don't want to leave!

Summary Heading: So good we extended our stay
Summary: We stayed in the 2 bed room North villas which had a wonderful  view of the coast line and the wonderful sunset. The villas are very large, comfortable and kept very clean . The staff are very friendly and helpful. A couple of criticisms, there is a lot made of the fact that each villa has it's own butler, where was he/she???? Also the 3 meals we had, especially in the Pelican Grill were poor for a luxury resort. Having said that I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel or staying here again.

My wife and I visited SoCal for the first time this past week came away very impressed with PH. I first heard about the resort by seeing an advertisement for it in the WSJ and decided we needed to check it out (I am an avid golfer) when we decided to visit my daughter in Costa Mesa. As an avid golfer I have stayed at some of the finest golf resorts in America (Pebble, Pinehurst, The Breakers) and I would rank this the finest combination accomodations/golf I have experienced.   Pros- The staff were all very friendly and helpful (both hotel and golf). I found the golf personel from the proshop to the valets and bartender at the course to be very personable. I did not get the feel of a stuffy club.          - The room (Bungalo) was outstanding with a great view and comfortable

Summary Heading: One of a few really wonderful gems
Summary: Spectacular in every sense of the word. From the room to the service to the spa everything is over the top.  an experience you'll never forget. I ddin't rate the breakfast, as  we choose to eat breakfast outside the hotel, as there are so many places close by to get a fabulous breakfast.  One is The Beachcomber near Crystal Cove & Panini in Newport Beach on PCH.

Prior reviewers have positively described this stunning Tuscan style property.  The pool is spectacular...the largest round pool in the US, it is said. We stayed in a bungalow and paid for it! No upgrade so this is unbiased. It was lovely....particularly the large wet bar/sink.  The drivers to and fro, were very friendly and polite and mostly on time.  We stayed 3 days mid December and I believe that there were less experienced staff on in the restaurants and it was quite amateur for the calibre of the hotel. There was a lot of socializing by breakfast staff in the Colliseum and not a lot of attention to clearing plates from our tiny table for two.  There was also a discussion on the recipe for martinis for the brunch crowd.  They were very nice, probably college kids,  just not

We stayed 4 days at this beautiful resort and we enjoyed every minute!  From the moment you step foot on the property until the unfortunate time comes to depart, the staff will make sure your stay is memorable. The beauty of the property is fitting of the best 5 star properties, and the location, with panoramic views of the pacific, is as good as it gets.   A slew of pros and some nitpicking cons:  Pros...we stayed in a bungalow (143) with a fantastic view of the ocean. You're a little higher up on the hill, so views are less obstructed. Cool patio with comfy lounge chairs to enjoy the afternoon sunshine and amazing sunsets. Unlike another reviewer, we found the quality of soaps and lotions to be equal to any of the finer properties we've stayed, as were the linens and mattress.

The facility is immaculate.  Style is Italian.  Gorgeous views of landscape, buildings, and ocean.  The Grille food was excellent as was the service.  Friendly and efficient throughout the resort from the front desk to the valet to the security.    I was there on business for only 1 night but would like to stay for a week for pleasure.  This is a resort, not a hotel. People stay in one story, quiet bungalows which are splendid. Gas fireplace was a nice touch.

Summary Heading: Style over Substance 2: The Fish stinks from the head down.
Summary: We had a weekend  last month at Pelican and wished we had read some of the reviews before staying here. In particular, I read the "Style over substance" review  and found great points. Looking over some of the positive reviews, it looks like people got some free upgrades, etc. and wrote a glorious review. Booking website also had tales of people with problems with this hotel.  So here is my view of Pelican in a nutshell.  PRO's: 1. Location in Newport Beach, Southern Cali close to lots of entertainment and shopping 2. Beautiful buildings and architecture (unlimited money from Irvine Company)  CON's: 1. Not 5 star, 4 star, or even 3 star service ( read more later) 2. Mediocre management with less than Motel 6 mentality in customer service 3. Unreasonable cancellation policies
Manager Response: Dan,  Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback. Please know that Pelican Hill considers each guest’s comments very carefully, in an effort to heighten the guest experience throughout every corner of the Resort. Our management team reads each review and follows up with guests about their concerns to better understand their perspectives.  To this end, I would like to take a moment to discuss your comments further and will provide you with my contact details separately in a private message. I look forward to the opportunity to speak with you soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I recently stayed at Pelican hill with my family for the Thanksgiving holiday, and I must say that all in all this property and its staff are top notch. Luigi and his team made us feel extremely special and very well taken care of the entire time we were there. The accommodations were amazing, and everything in the Bungalows was brand new and functioned perfectly. We had 180 degree panoramic views of the ocean from every room, and it was breathtaking. The staff was extremely friendly and was more than willing to go above and beyond to ensure that our experience was top notch in every aspect. Luigi, one of the managers, came to greet us upon check-in, and he ensured that his entire team was on point and attended to our every need throughout the stay. They truly are experts in

Spoil yourself!  I was only able to spend an evening and night at the hotel, and didn't enjoy most of what the Hotel offers......but those few hours were a huge treat.  The room is beautiful and every detail is perfect.  The view and the patio are awesome.  The staff is courteous and well trained.  The setting is perfect.  This hotel deserves 10 stars!  Bravo

We stayed one night at Pelican hill and we regretted not staying for another 2 nights. The check in was classy and smooth and in less than 5 minutes we were escorted to our villa (with a nice ocean view). The facilities of the hotel are superb. In the morning we have tried the Cafe and they serve very delicious pastries. (Do not miss that). The cafe overlooking the golf course and the sea. The price that we booked the bungalow was $ 435.00 (all inclusive) which is considered acceptable considering that it is a resort. The bungalow was spacious and well decorated. What we also liked are the exceptional staff (friendly and helpful).  To conclude, this was a 5 stars experience.

I just dropped by the resort for a short visit. It is indeed a beautiful property overlooking the Ocean. The huge circular pool is quite impressive. The grounds well kept and maintained well. And the staff were all well-dressed and professional. The decor of the lobby was beautiful and tastefully done. You can tell that a lot of work was put into building this resort. I hope to return soon even for just a short stay.

This past weekend, I surprised my husband with a two night stay at The Resort at Pelican Hill for his birthday. It started with a very warm welcoming at prestigious Villas. Shane and Patrick made our experience fantastic. They greeted us with a refreshing smile and made us laugh. The Villa Clubhouse was spectacular. Cooper was very helpful and the view from our Villa was spectacular.   It was the perfect place to surprise my husband for his birthday weekend! The views, the service, and the food were all excellent.  Pelican Hill really is my favorite hotel in Orange County and all of the United States. We will be back very soon. Thank you for making our experience so memorable.

i stayed at pelican hill with my family over the thanksgiving weekend.  the resort is so beautiful....the views are magnificent....the rooms are really nice.  we stayed in the bungalows...they are a really nice size and decorated very nicely.  the hotel has very nice restaurants, and the pool is beautiful.  it was a very nice stay. the spa is lovely also..... the only critique i have of the hotel is the service....it's so slow.  the people are all very nice, but, the response time is really slow...we had a problem with our tv during a movie, i called the front desk and it took more than an hour to get the problem fixed....other than that it was a great stay.

Summary Heading: The Villas at Pelican Hill Resort are exquisite!
Summary: I stayed at the North Villas for a month and I wish I could have stayed longer. I had a great time. The facilities are elegant, comfortable and of high quality. The service was first rate, starting with  the sales manager Ivan and Jonathan, the Villas manager and extending to the butler, front desk and room dining personnel. I loved the Gym and the pool. The food was excellent at the main resort restaurants, especially Andrea's, and good at the villa clubhouse. The views were magnificent.

This property is drop dead gorgeous!  The staff is well trained and attentive. The food staff both at the restaurants and the banquet centers are tremendous! My surprise to the down side was the lack of attention to the maintenance of the villas. Our villa, priced at nearly $1,000 a day had several maintenance issues. Lights that did not turn on and lights that would not turn off.  Bad case of ants in one of the bedrooms. Disney properties have maintenance  schedules to replace items at specific times.  You can tell that does not happen here. But I highly recommend this experience.

This is a beautiful property situated on a hill above the Pacific Ocean.  Its only five years old.  Our room was beautiful.  The fitness center was well equipped.  The pool area is spectacular - we saw the sun set over Catalina Island from the pool.  We didn't eat any meals there.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.

I booked a bungalow room for my husband and I to celebrate our 30-year anniversary in early November. What a wonderful anniversary gift to be upgraded to a Villa, compliments of Casey Rodgers, who is the Assistant Front Office Manager in the Bungalows. I recall his invaluable assistance the last time we stayed at Pelican Hill over a year ago. To be treated as an appreciated, valued, returning guest is one of his many fine customer service qualities.  We decided to arrive early before our check in time to make use of the amenities offered. We were welcomed so warmly and were treated well by Ruth and Colin at the Villa Restaurant. We ate then enjoyed the peacefulness and the gorgeous coastline out by the pool. That evening, dinner at the Pelican Grill was flawless, under the

The resort is beautifully landscaped, built and furnished. Every view is gorgeous and every room we were in, public or private, was beautiful.  I can't figure out if this is a three, four or five star resort though.  In room amenities were scarce and cheap, inexpensive, no-brand mass produced lotion, shampoo and bath gel smelled strongly of chemical fragrance and were rather drying.  Towels were cheap and smelled of detergent.  The coffee set up was clever but we could not get service to refresh it so we made coffee and had no cups from which to drink.  The bed is comfortab E with nice sheets.  We stayed in an ocean view bungalow with a fireplace and it was lovely. The food was clearly the products of a massive and probably over-taxed F&B system.  Andreas, the fine dining
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I am disappointed to read that your Pelican Hill experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. Please allow me to address the concerns you kindly detailed here.  All Bungalow and Villa guests receive a collection of signature bath products, including shampoo with basil extract, conditioner with calendula extract, shower gel with lemon extract, body lotion with olive leaf extract, massage bar with Ceylon tea leaf and more, created exclusively for Pelican Hill by Gilchrist & Soames®. I appreciate your input on these products and apologize if they did not meet your expectations.  I sincerely regret that your overall experience was less than perfect. I have addressed your comments regarding dining, housekeeping and front desk with the appropriate department managers. We look forward to improving the guest experience, based upon the feedback you shared. Should you wish to discuss your experience further, I invite you to please contact me directly at your convenience.  Kind regards,  David Phillips Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I recently stayed at the Resort at Pelican Hill as a getaway with my girlfriend and all I can say is wow! From the moment we arrived until we had to depart, the experience was flawless. The room was absolutely breathtaking (bungalow suite)! Complete with fireplace and a balcony overlooking the ocean, it was incredible. Probably my favorite aspect was the layout of the resort. It is very spread out and feels more like a luxurious neighborhood than a hotel. The result, peace, quiet, tranquility. I loved having my car right outside of my bungalow. Rather than having to park in some lot very far away or valet my car each day, it was always accessible. However, if I just wanted to get around the resort, a complimentary shuttle could pick us up within a few minutes. Another incredible

Summary Heading: This place is a true 5 star resort
Summary: I recently stayed at this resort for business/pleasure, I am a semi-frequent traveler who appreciates luxury but doesn't need/require it. My review as per the following CAT's;  Room(s): I stayed in a standard room for a few nights and moved to a 2bdrm villa for a few nights.  As this is a newer resort the rooms have very little wear and tear, they are large, clean and high-end (fireplace was a beautiful touch).  Now I am sure someone could come on here and write something negative but I am sorry these are very nice rooms by most standards unless you live in a $20M+ home.  The villa was approx 2,200 sq ft and very comfortable for two couples, the appliances were all high-end (wolf range) and custom built in fridge/freezer etc.  Golf Course/Amenities: Wow, find a place on this

Summary Heading: Nice place, but missed the mark abit.
Summary: Our friends asked us to join them on vacation. We stayed in a 3 bdr, 3 bath south villa,overlooking one of the golf courses and the ocean. Beautiful view and accommodations, very comfortable living area and nice bedroom linens and duvets. I have no idea what it cost them for the villa, but I am sure it was alot. The good points are stated above but so many things were missed from my point of view on what a true 5 star plus resort should be. Housekeeping came really early in the morning ( who wants housekeeping at 8.00 in the morning on vacation), and one day just never came. They always missed putting towels in our bathroom only, either one face cloth, no bath mats, one towel etc. not enough for two people. One day I unrolled the bath mat we did get, and it had a huge dark stain
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent experience. I sincerely regret that your stay was less than perfect. I have addressed your comments with each department you mentioned. We appreciate the opportunity to heighten the guest experience, based upon the detailed comments you posted here. Should you wish to discuss your experience further, I invite you to please contact me directly at your convenience.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Very deifferent from a normal hotel. This is definitely more of a getaway spot. You'll love it! The only mistake we made was booking through a third party because they screwed up our bed situation. We paid for a king bed and they changed it to 2 queens. We sleep in a queen at home, so why wouldn't we want a king on a trip?! Especially if we're paying a good amount of money to stay there... They also charged our card twice. Anyway, don't book through Olotels.com, save yourself the trouble, and just pay the extra 5 or 10 bucks by booking directly through Pelican Hill :)

Upon arriving at this hotel the staff scrambled to get us into our room early. Our flight got us here at 11:00am and they got us into our beautiful perfect bungalow with the most amazing real ocean view not a peek of ocean either. I am sitting on my private deck writing this review. I had lunch at the pool grill with a pitcher of sangria. Not cheap but worth every penny. Besides the Grand Wailea in Maui this is my new favorite California Hotel. Everybody needs to experience this hotel and their service. Tomorrow a 90 minute massage. I will send a review about it tomorrow. I'm in earths heaven right now.

If Beauty, Serenity & Courtesy has a name, it got to be "The Resort at Pelican Hill". This was our (me & my wife) first stay here and we are glad we came here. The rooms/cottages were huge looking over the hill. The rooms and elegant decoration and a lovely fireplace. Having coffee at the balcony was a blissful experience.  However what made our stay was the friendly and courteous staff. We really liked the conversation that we had with all the staff. The breakfast served in the rooms were awesome especially the muffins.  Another thing to do is the trip around the Golf course which is supposed to be one of the finest in the world.  I wish the massage session should have been longer :-)

This was our fourth stay at this hotel as it has become one of our favorite places to stay.  Our main reasons why we enjoy this property so much are because of the large and beautiful standard rooms, the unique layout of the hotel, and the pretty setting.  The rooms, called bungalows, are pure bliss and provide a very attractive and relaxing environment. Besides being very large, they are comfortable and come across as more homey than a standard hotel room.  Perhaps it is the limestone fireplace, light wood cabinetry, or vaulted wood beamed ceiling that makes you feel you are in a special place. An equally sublime bathroom of pure luxury and space should also be noted.   These features combined with a cohesive soft color palate create the perfect retreat.  To top it off, large

Highly recommend this amazing beautiful resort.  The food is exceptional and they even have an inhouse geleto laboratory, spectacular ocean views and exceptional quality food.  You dont want to leave Pelican Hill

This is the second time I've been to Pelican Hill and I am as amazed if not more so. The thing that I find so amazing has got to be the staff. Upon check in Pauline was so friendly and made me feel welcomed back, Jon the manager went out of his way to ensure all of my needs where met, by introducing me to the staff that would be available to me and making me aware of their names, I truly feel like family when I come to Pelican Hill. I have to recommend that if you happened to journey to the coliseum pool the manager Jameson will treat you like royalty, and last but not least I have to mention Betty at the front desk, she has got to be the most outgoing and enjoyable person to be greeted by when you walk in the door. So if you are not already convinced about staying then I hope

if you want to just "chill out", then this is your place!  very relaxing, excellent amenities, first class service.  Spa was first class.  Rooms were spacious and linens were top quality. Great nearby restaurants if you want to leave the resort.  We loved it!

We stayed for 4 nights at Pelican Hill and it was a wonderful experience. Breakfast buffet is amazing! Team members are absolutely delightful. It was wonderful spending the entire day at the Coliseum pool on Saturday.

This was our second time to stay in the North Villas.  Please see my other review.  I will start off by saying, we very much enjoy this hotel, however, on this trip I found a few flaws.  The first was the condition of our living/kitchen area rug. (room 621) The rug was very stained and NEEDS to be cleaned by a professional.  The condition was disgusting. The other problem we encountered was the tv.  The remotes had been switched around and the volume was not working properly.  It was more than just finding which remote went to the right tv.  Maintenance did come (at almost 9pm) and fixed the problem with the volume.  Twice we had someone park in our garage, however we did not complain.  It was easier to just park in the extra parking right across from the garages.    A crib was

I attended a wedding at the Resort at Pelican Hill and it was a very nice setting, outdoor patio for mingling prior to the black tie reception also at the hotel.  The food was excellent, service was top notch.

Summary Heading: Luxurious resort with amazing golf courses
Summary: Pelican Hill is a most luxurious resort. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and come with all the amenities you require. The service is impeccable. The golf courses are simply amazing - wonderful ocean views, helpful and friendly caddies, and the courses offer a great challenge for all calibers. Best golf course I have ever played. Club rentals are Nike which do not suit everyone's taste and expectation. The pool area can get crowded and noisy on weekends, and the pool side service can be slow. If you are looking for a comfort and great golf, this is the place.

Absolute luxury and a beautiful place to relax! We stayed in one of the bungalow suites overlooking the Pacific Ocean… superb! The service at the resort is impeccable. Everything was flawless- and I mean everything! Food was phenomenal, we dine at Pelican Grill, beautiful view, and the Spa was wonderful. They have a shuttle service to the Crystal Cove beach which is convenient and Beachcomber restaurant at the beach is nice but put your name in first then walk around the beach because there is always 30-45 min wait.  I can live here, lol! We will be back!

Seriously the Pelican Hill is the best hotel we have ever stayed in! Everything was top notch. It was the first time we travelled with our toddler daughter and we all loved it! We will definately go back in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: Superb property, but some focus on details needed
Summary: We have stayed at Pelican Hill several times since it opened. It is a stunning property with exceptional rooms, pristine grounds, significant privacy, engaged staff and very good food. It should and does command a high price from guests. But in turn, when guests are paying $900.00+ a night for Bungalow Suite, you should receive over the top service – which is not what occurred during our visit this week. But first, the good stuff: •	Pelican Hill is frankly the best of the best. The views are stunning and the grounds are lovely. I don’t play golf, but those I have spoken with say the courses are exceptional only to be matched by the views.  •	Regardless of what restaurant you choose, the food is fresh, inventive, and served by knowledgeable staff.  •	We received a lovely fruit

Summary Heading: Peek a boo ocean view, amongst other issues
Summary: Stayed in what Pelican Hill calls ocean view 2 bedroom villa.  3rd floor.  Only, where's the view?  Trees cover the entire view with the ocean peeking through. Had to go out on the end of the balcony and look to the side to get a view with only a few trees blocking the view.  Joke.  North villas sit on busy thorough fair with the locals flying down the road in the sports cars.  Very noisy.  And far away from the pool area. And you would think when you pay 600 a night you would have pillows that were not torn and falling apart in your room.  Restaurant in hotel extremely slow in service.  Ordered food and had to remind server, who didn't even know the chef's name (no kidding) and whose knowledge of the menu was extremely lacking, that we were still missing an entree.  And way too
Manager Response: I appreciate that you have taken the time to share your feedback about your recent stay at the Resort, and would like to apologize if your Villa accommodations did not meet your expectations. I have shared your thoughts with our Resort landscaping team, so we can ensure that views from our ocean view Villas are not obstructed in any way.  In addition, I have communicated your feedback on the less-than-perfect service you encountered during your dining experience to our director of food and beverage and restaurant managers. As we continually strive to improve our guest experiences throughout the Resort, your comments are a valuable asset, and I assure you they will be addressed with our staff.   Once again, I apologize if you were disappointed in your stay, and invite you to contact me directly, should you wish to discuss further. I will provide my contact information to you separately in a private message.  Kind regards,  David Phillips Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: a lovely resort and great golf
Summary: we had a two bedroom villa which comes with own fully equipped kitchen and butler, all round this is a great resort and exudes quality everywhere, the golf courses are very scenic, the pools and bars etc are all high end quality. my only slight criticism would be that the villas (north) felt a little bit out of it, but that is being super critical

Summary Heading: Best High End Resort in California
Summary: We travel to LA about 3 times a year, and being seasoned travellers are looking for the ultimate in luxury. The resort at Pelican Hill is by far the best and most exclusive stay on the West Coast. The service is second to none, and the peace and tranquility is to be savoured. We will be back!

Best value in California, beautiful resort with large villas or bungalows.  No resort or valet parking charges, charming staff and wonderful amenities.  Only slight snag was that no drink service was available after 4.00 p.m. in villa pool nor any lunch service after 2.00 p.m.  Apart from that, the same beautiful views with meticulous surroundings, near to gorgeous Crystal Cove where there is a regular shuttle to the beach.  One of the best resorts in the world.  There will always be the odd snag with hotels, but this one feels exceptional.  Thanks again to all the staff who served us.

Reside in the Lap of Luxury at Pelican Hill. Villas are wonderful. Amazing views. Exceptional service, but be prepared to wait when ordering food poolside or in- room. Professional, helpful, and friendly staff. Beautiful property.

Summary Heading: Exclusive Luxury Resort - Not Any More!
Summary: I give this resort 5 stars for it's location and dramatic layout. Truely spectacular! If you are expecting a quite luxury resort then you will be disappointed. If you are looking for a loud, raucous Palm Springs party crowd, then this is the place for you. That's why I gave it 3 stars overall.   We were shocked at how dramatically the resort had changed since our last visit three years ago. Service used to be flawless. Now it is inconsistent. A few examples: arrived at the pool and looked forward to a drink. After waiting 30 minutes I gave up and tracked down a server to place our order. Even after this order, we still had no service for the remainder of the afternoon. Next morning tried to order breakfast in the room only to be told that delivery would be "at least an hour"!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your thoughts about your recent visit to the Resort. At Pelican Hill, we invite guests from near and far to join us for a variety of events, celebrations and occasions, however I apologize that the circumstances you encountered during your stay disrupted your experience. I understand your expectation for a quiet, relaxing getaway, and have taken the time to share your comments with our management team, so we may better address this type of situation in the future.   As Newport Beach’s only Five-Star Resort, I regret that your interactions with our staff were inconsistent and did not reflect our luxury standards. We are committed to providing exceptional experiences throughout the Resort, and your feedback is vital to the continual improvement and training of our teams.   Additionally, I have communicated your concerns regarding the condition of your Bungalow balcony with our Resort landscaping and engineering teams. I assure you that your safety is our highest priority, and if any structural inconsistencies are discovered, they will be immediately addressed.   Once again, I apologize if you were disappointed in your stay, and appreciate you taking a moment to post your feedback here. I hope that we will have the opportunity to regain your trust and welcome you back for a third visit. Should you wish to discuss your feedback further, I invite you to contact me directly.  Kind regards,  David Phillips Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: My rating is based on comparable luxury resorts with similar amenities. The service was great but after the cost you would think they could extend checkout one hour to accommodate flight schedules. They did not have a large Monday check in and the answer was a flat out no! They employees were excellent and did everything to take great care of their guests but intentionally non accommodating when there was a group ordering asking for checks by couples...........not necessarily traveling together, they just about insisted the bill be split....not realistic.

This is it.  I have stayed at Ritz Properties and Four Seasons.  If they are the gold standard, then Pelican Hill is the PLATINUM Standard.  We had a chance to stay recently in the Villas and it was the most relaxing 3 days we had in a long time.  Food and service were amazing, to go along with a gorgeous property and stunning views.  I cannot say enough about this property.  Start to finish, the best experience I have had.  Tips:  If possible, opt for a Villa over a Bungalow.  Breakfast was a little pricey for the buffet ($40), but the a la carte items came with enough food for two.  Be sure to book the spa early.  Stay for a Monday.  We practically had the whole resort to ourselves!

Summary Heading: Luxury and Views but Varied Warmth
Summary: My husband and I just completed our second stay at Pelican Hill within the last 12 months. The views, setting, linens and amenities are truly first class. All restaurants on site have fabulous food and selection. As expected with any top notch resort, retaurant prices are on the higher end but you get what you pay for - high end, quality food with great selection. The only restaurant I felt was a bit "off" was the Coliseum Pool & Grill. They are a bit over priced for what they serve. We found service from Housekeeping, Spa Staff, Golf Cart Drivers and Poolside Servers to be OUTSTANDING! They were all warm, kind, down to earth and friendly. The one area which I was surprised to be so vastly different from our last visit was the warmth of the Front Desk, Valet and Doorman. They

Our stay at Pelican Hill was a bit off from the start. When asked at check-in to please try to ensure we had a nice view (no parking lot) the desk agent assured us it was lovely, overlooking gardens and the mountainside with a peek of the ocean from the terrace. We arrived at the room to find it actually backed up to a thorny hedge that shielded the view from the main entry drive into the resort.  Plenty of traffic noise but no view of a garden and certainly no ocean. The room was spacious with a nice fireplace, but as others have testified, home to several small spiders and other bugs. That said, the people from room service and housekeeping were warm, welcoming and extremely professional. The desk staff and valet stiff but polite. The location is nice, but we'll keep returning

I am not sure you could get anymore luxurious than this hotel.   From the staff to the dining to the linens to the lobby. All Grande and all luxurious.   Would DEFINITLEY recommend it!   The restaurant is wonderful! Make a point to eat there and sit out on the terrace, super romantic...  Also go when you can lay by the pool! View is top notch!

I just read the review about bad business practices. I was amused by the General Managers response that asked the gentleman to call him directly. That is a joke. My wife booked a vacation from the east coast to see our son and celebrate her birthday. I was hospitalized the night before and had to delay our trip (hospital letter was obtained but was of no value. They charged us for the complete stay and told us we could apply it toward a future visit if used this year. We have tried to contact Lama the GM and Amy, the head of reservations for over a week with no success. Left many messages with assistants etc. Without their approval, the front desk can not rebook. Proverbial runaround. They have our money so " stall and delay" tactics are obviously being used. We were referred by
Manager Response: Jeffery,  I understand your frustration with your recent experience, but I am disappointed to read the comments you have posted here. As I was away from the Resort this week on business, multiple members of my management team have reached out to you by phone with no response. Within this week, we have contacted you more than eight times. I understand you spoke with my assistant directly on multiple occasions, but each of our return phone calls went unanswered.  It is unfortunate that our attempts to connect with you have not been well received. We will continue to try and reach out to remedy this situation.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Stunning property, good service, and no smiles.
Summary: There is no question that The Resort at Pelican HIll is breathtaking in most every way.  The grounds, golf course, ocean views, etc. are all stunning!  We had a nice ocean view bungalow which was well-appointed with all that you'd expect from a hotel of this caliber (two exceptions : no slippers and no bath tub amenities).  The bed, linens ... all superb.  The food, both in the restaurant and in-room dining, were very good. No complaints.   The only thing that stood out to us during our stay was that no one seemed to be willing to part with a smile : from the valets, to the front desk personnel, and most of the service staff.  Even after attempting to be cordial and smile ourselves (and generous tips in some cases).  Every one was professional enough, but just seemed oddly cold.

My wife and I originally booked a Bungalow room (about 800 sq. feet). Upon check in we were upgraded to a 3 bedroom Villa (thanks AMEX, I think we caught them on a slow week too). This room was over 2000 sq. feet with new, very high end finishes (marble, full stocked kitchen, great linens, garage etc.). It is worth noting the bungalows are just as nice, just a little smaller.The well appointed beautiful  rooms, large swimming  pools, professional staff, numerous restaurants are better than any Ritz Carlton I have stayed at. We played golf the next day on the South course which was very scenic, challenging but friendly. Great views all day too. Our caddy, Eric was so nice and helpful; excellent pro shop as well.They have Mercedes Benz SUV's to shuttle you anytime you need a ride

Summary Heading: 1st night Spiders in our bed, and more spiders and ants in our room throughout stay.
Summary: We checked into villa 709 with much enthusiasm and excitement to stay with our  twin girls for  our 5 night vacation! This  turned out to be a beautiful resort, with amazing rooms, views and ...substandard service & maintenance, and novice villa management.  1st night- watching movie in master-bedroom and saw black spider crawling in the bed. Both husband and I jumped out of bed and scrambled to kill spider so we could try to hopefully sleep in the same bed.  Midnight- found 2 big black spiders in master bathroom floor. Now feeling very uncomfortable trying to go back to bed with what now appears to be a  spider problem.  We notified pelican staff of problem that morning.  Next day found mounds of ants in kitchen on clean baby bottles. We again notified Pelican staff problem.
Manager Response: Ann,  Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback about your recent stay. I appreciate you sharing your comments here, and would like to personally apologize for any discomfort you experienced during your stay. I understand your concerns, especially with two young children in the room.  With the Resort situated on 504 acres of a coastal hillside landscape, we recommend that our guests keep their windows and doors closed, to avoid any concerns with pests entering the room during the warm summer season. As a preventative measure, our landscaping team also facilitates routine pest control maintenance.  In speaking with our management team, I understand that you received significant compensation during your stay, to remedy this unfortunate situation. The complimentary spa service was offered to you as a sincere gesture, so you could enjoy the Resort’s amenities, while our team came in to address the concerns in your Villa.   Again, I apologize if your experience was less than perfect, and invite you to contact me directly, should you wish to discuss further. I will provide my contact information to you separately in a private message.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: While the grounds are beautiful and the "bungalow" room is palatial, it was very disappointing to end up with a room with no view.  It's described as a 'Garden View' room (#159) but the roomy and restful looking terrace overlooks...what?...bushes.  Not a garden, not the ocean, not the golf course....just bushes.  Bushes, weeds, and the tops of some trees.  Sitting up on a hillside with beautiful grounds in front, isolated from the main building by a winding drive up a hill that is an uncomfortable walk,, one would think the view would be expansive.  At $359 per night, I suppose this is a bargain room here, but the fabulous room is just part of the expected ambiance.  Too bad because I was sooooo looking forward to this trip...quiet time by myself to relax and enjoy the west
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing The Resort at Pelican Hill for your relaxing West Coast getaway, and appreciate that you have taken the time to share your thoughts about your stay. I understand your disappointment, and apologize if the view from your accommodations did not meet your expectations. I hope that the Resort’s amenities, serene setting and the Five-Star service from our staff allowed you to enjoy your visit to Newport Coast.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We had a wonderful stay at the Resort last week with one exception. The rooms, landscaping & employees were all as advertised ie spectacular.  However, the only negative, of all things, had to do with golf. The condition of the course was in "ok shape" ie not very good or excellent. As a result, be sure to pay for the afternoon special as the regular pricing is not a value. Finally, the condition of the rental clubs was awful.......watch out

The grounds are stunning, surrounded as they are by the golf courses, with a beautiful view of the Pacific. Large and elegant rooms with the typical bungalow (better say small villas) style. Perfect service. Five deserved stars.

This is truly a 5-star resort.  From making my reservation with EmilyAnn to departing it was perfect.  Everyone at the resort makes sure your needs are care for and they are very attentive. Our bungalow was #423 and it  was perfect--nice view, quiet and well kept.  Housekeeping did a great job and always asked how our stay was going and if there was anything else we needed.  The pool was lovely--wish it was deeper but it was relaxing.  The service at the pool was excellent.  they did not bother too much or too little! Perfect!.

You can understand why the price for these beautiful villas are what they are once you get to your room. Gorgeous furnishings breathtaking views. It really is a very special place. The only negative was the dinner in the Italian restaurant. I ordered the $80 truffles for on my steak and they brought us 2 orders which we were charged for, then our server spilled a glass of wine on me and complained that it spilled on her as well. I did not think the food was up to standards that I expected. They did dry clean my dress and after much complaining to the manager they took off the one order of truffles from our bill. Next time we stay we will eat at Mastros or one of the other local restaurants.

I attended a MasterMind retreat here recently and it was a perfect place for that.  The view of the golf course and the ocean beyond is stunning, as are the sunsets!  The circular pool is special and the villas and restaurants are top notch.  The service was excellent and friendly, as well. My only complaint was the in room coffee pot, which did not work and took me several tries to get replaced. (They did not believe me that it was broken, always a customer service faux pas!). As an east coaster visiting the west coast, that first morning's coffee is so critical.  I would still highly recommend Pelican Hill to anyone who needs a great atmosphere to relax and unwind--or even to get some work done!

Was surprised by the individual bungalow style rooms with the outstanding views of the Pacific ocean.  Wonderful pool, beautiful grounds, and great service.  Went here on a conference and have already planned to come back for a relaxing vacation.

Incredibly exciting, amazing, beautiful resort! Service is perfect!! Rooms are first class! Area is classy, beaches are beautiful! Close to Laguna beach! Restaurants Maestro's and Javier's are just minutes away!

Summary Heading: If you can afford to stay here don't delay
Summary: We were driven to our villa in a rolls Royce and treated like royalty at every turn Unsurpassed pacific coast views a spa to die for white glove treatment and food that is the tops in the world oh and did I mention the golf course it too is in a league of its own

My husband booked an anniversary getaway...staycation!  He asked for a king bed and told them it was our anniversary.  When we checked in they said they were sorry, that all the king beds were taken, but that we could have two queens.  We reluctantly said OK.  Then they drove us to our suite...the best room on the property!  Atop the hill, private veranda overlooking the ocean with 180 degree views!  Sitting room, huge bathroom, luxe linens...one of our best nights we have stayed anywhere, all in our backyard!

Stayed at Pelican Hill for the first time over Labor Day Weekend.  We live close by and eat there often but have never stayed there.  Got a great last minute rate on whatahotel.com so for $425 plus tax got a garden view with 2 queens, $50 breakfast credit and a $100 golf credit.  I had asked for an early check in but when we arrived at 2pm our room wasn't ready.  I asked if I could pay to upgrade so we could check in and the front desk guy said I was already being upgraded to a room twice the size of room I had booked so worth the wait.  He told me they would call me soon definitely well before the normal check in time of 4pm.  So we went to the pool and hung out. Nobody ever called and finally I called the front desk around 4pm and they said my room was ready.  Shuttle took us

I have been staying at this resort since its opening back in 2009. I have always loved the view, the environment, and its decor. Service has always been inconsistent. Despite the service, it has not prevented me from re-booking time and time again.   For this recent stay, I booked a 4 bedroom villa for 8 nights. Upon check in, I asked the front desk to send the butler to assist my family with our luggage. The butler showed up promptly, however, she only took the luggage to the front door of the villa and did not ask us where/or if we wanted the luggage to be brought to our respective rooms (One of the little things that a guest would expect staying at a five star resort.)   Whilst the butler was moving the luggage, I noticed that the neighboring villas had quite a few children
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your comments about your recent stay. We sincerely appreciate your loyalty over the years. I understand your concerns regarding service and the noisy behavior of other guests. I apologize that these unfortunate circumstances disrupted your enjoyment of the Resort.  Please know it is our priority to offer a pleasant, relaxing environment for all guests. As you mentioned, our managers graciously address inconsiderate guest behavior. I am disappointed to read that the disturbance persisted during your visit, but I thank you for bringing this concern to our attention, so we may take this opportunity to improve our approach in the future.  Additionally, thank you for sharing your thoughts about the turn-down water, air conditioning, welcome amenity and butler service. I apologize that your Villa experience was less than perfect in these areas. I have taken the time to follow up with managers regarding your feedback.  Once again, I appreciate your detailed review and welcome any additional thoughts you may prefer to share with me directly. I will send you a private message with my contact information.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Can't fault the service, style or location - or the view, which is hugely impressive. It's comfy, clean and cosy, but why oh why can't you get decent light in the bungalows at night or early in the morning? Or if you have the shutters closed to avoid shocking the golfers! Wouldn't put me off, but I might ask for extra lighting next time.

If you want to relax and enjoy the place with privacy, this is the place to go. The resort consists of all villas (you can park your car in front of it) and it's walking distance of everywhere. If you dont want to walk, they have a service where they will come get you. The villas are big, beautiful and very comfortable, with a balcony. They have a few restaurants, which serve amazing food. The pool is huge, perfect for kids, and they have an amazing spa and exercise room. Meeting rooms are great, with a nice view (can be distracting haha) but really, this place is amazing. The only thing though, is that it's not right on the beach. So if you plan to go at the beach, you'll have to walk.

We just got back from a few days at Pelican Hill and we were very sad to leave.  The rooms are beautiful, the food was excellent, this service is lovely and accommodating and the grounds are amazing. The smells of lavender, pine and lemon in the spa, lobby, in the rooms and walking outside were beautiful and provided an overall sense of well being and relaxation. We have also stayed at the St. Regis and the Montage and this is by far our favorite resort in the area.

The Villas were great! Good service and fun golf!! Hidden treasure in Newport!! Good times :)  We had a caddie which was very helpful! Even if you just wanted to stay in the room and relax...private balcony and amazing views.

Summary Heading: It very well could be 5 Stars!
Summary: I was here for only one night, and stayed in the Villas on the North side of the property. The exclusive area in Newport Beach and the drive on PCH entering the property was very impressive. The villa resembled a town home development on the side of a dry Calif. hillside. If security is important to you, then you will feel safe with many sliding gates and needing to show ID. The decor and the lighting were on the dark side for my taste. Heavy wood doors, paneling and dark bedrooms/bath, did not impress me. A short drive down to the lobby of the main property continued with the heavy and dark decor and feel. This aura changed as soon as you walk out on the lobby veranda to the  pool area.  Views of the fabulous Pacific ocean mesmerize you. The main pool is the attraction of the

We stayed at Pelican Hill for some much needed R&R after a recent Disneyland trip.  The resort is located down in Newport Beach, across the PCH, and up the hill from the ocean.  There isn't alot up the hill except this resort and I believe the Marriot Villas.  We had booked a bungalow close to the main pool but were upgraded to a North Villa.  The villas are very large and very nice.  It is like staying in a house with every amenity.  We were traveling with a group of 6 so the extra space was nice.  Absolutely no complaints at all except we only had a partial ocean view.  Up at the villas there is a small restaurant and nice pool.  It took about 5 minutes to walk from our villa to the villa pool.  We did walk down to the main pool once but it is a pretty good hike so normally

I booked a weekend at Pelican Hill resort, never received a conformation email.  I then called and cancelled that day, i never received a cancellation email. 5 days in advance of the booking, i saw a charge on my credit card & called to query.  They told me i never cancelled. I have been charged the full amount of the booking.  I am working with my credit card company to stop the charges going through.  just an unpleasant experience.  I will never recommend this hotel to anyone.  i will tell anyone who wants to hear how terrible this experience has been.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your concerns about your recent experience with Pelican Hill. I understand your frustration, and have taken the time to look further into this situation for you.  In speaking with our reservations manager, a confirmation letter for your stay was issued on April 4, 2013 to the personal email address you provided during your online booking. A cancellation call related to your reservation is not shown in our records. Our online booking policy clearly states that a non-refundable deposit will be processed for cancellations within five days prior to the arrival date.  I apologize that your reservation experience was less than perfect. If there’s anything more we can do to assist you in resolving the unfortunate circumstances surrounding your booking, please contact me directly.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Very disappointing waste of several thousand dollars
Summary: This is supposed to be one of the family oriented kid friendly places in Orange County Coast. Not unless your kid got a corporate logo branded on his or her forehead or drives up in Aston Martin with her plastic surgeon. We came here for a quick beach getaway one week before Labor Day and our other vacation was cancelled by forest fire. Hotel is new and fine though I am sure if their clientele continues to SKU towards gigantic corporate groups as it appears to be now, the gloss will wear away quickly.The place is nothing but a glorified convention trap masquerading as an upscale resort. Our first mistake was driving up in a minivan.  We stayed in a one bedroom villa with two children. Price was well in excess of $1300 per night. We were very happy to get our gift certificate for
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback about your recent visit to Pelican Hill. As our Front Office Manager expressed during your conversation on Sunday, August 25, we are disappointed to learn of the unfortunate circumstances that did not meet your expectations, and our goals.   Please accept my sincere apology, as well as the other considerations that our Front Office Manager kindly offered to you. Also, please know that all of your comments are being addressed with managers in the appropriate departments.   As you mentioned, the Resort attracts discerning leisure and business travelers alike. Please allow me to clarify that our Forbes Five-Star destination caters to executive retreats, corporate incentive programs and brand launch events, but does not offer the facilities for large-scale conventions and trade shows.  Once again, we appreciate the thoughts you have shared here and sincerely apologize that your experience was less than perfect. Should you wish to discuss your feedback further, I invite you to contact me directly.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: This is truly one of the finest resort facilities in the country!  The room was amazing with a walk in shower and a deep tub.  The tub had bath salts and bath wash to encourage a relaxing time.  Fireplace in room.  Views of golf courses and the ocean from every room!  Huge round swimming pool.  I was disappointed it was only 3 1/2 feet deep, but I understand the reason.  There are shuttles to the beach which is very close to Newport Beach, Huntington Beach, and Laguna Beach.  Waves were breaking at 5-6 feet when we swam.  There are also shuttles to Fashion Island, which is a large outdoor shopping mall, with top retail and restaurants and even a Tesla store for the guys!  We swear we saw John Malkovich getting out of a Ferrari to walk into a restaurant!  It's expensive, so don't

We are returning travelers to Pelican Hill.  We have experienced the Bungalows as well as the Villas.  All were lovely depending on your need for space.  Almost all accommodations have views of the Pacific which is very nice.  The two bedroom villas are lovely as are the 4 bedrooms.  Front desk, concierge, spa attendants, butlers, valets all work very hard to please and are very service oriented and are doing a great job.  The on site restaurants Andrea and the new fusion Italian/Asian restaurant for tapas and to go food need a lot of improvement so unless you hear differently I wouldn't bother.  We did not enjoy either and the food was actually bad-- service good though.  The Colliseum Grill for breakfast is wonderful and the Pelican Grill for dinner is excellent.  The Villa

This place is just fabulous. It is on hundreds of acres so clearly spread out but there are ample SUVs to transport you around to the various areas within the resort. The golf course was outstanding and not intimidating for a less than mediocre golf player ably assisted by caddy Eric who was brilliant. We were there with 3 young kids aged 6,7 and 10 for 4 days R&R at the end of a frantic trip around California. It really doesn't get any better. We were to stay in a bungalow which looks amazing but got upgraded to the villa via Amex booking compliments of the resort. Expensive but worth every cent!

Spent 7 days here with my family, two adults and 3 children (2 boys 12 & 10 and one daughter age 8 ). We stood in a 2 bedroom villa. The villas are well appointed and decorated beautifully. You have use of a butler to take you to and from the main club house or villa pool. From our villa the pool was only about a 5 minute walk. Room service is offered as is in room cooking if requested. Maid service is done both in the day and turn down in the evening. I would suggest that everyday upon leaving to contact the maid service to request your room to be made up otherwise they might not come to later in the afternoon.  The resort is beautiful and the lay out works well. Check in for villa guests is at a different private entrance and all went well. Prior to arrival I requested an

The land planner for this property (or the State of California anti-development groups) should be hung for this site plan - way too spread out and necessitates tons of Mercedes SUV's and golf carts that aren't always around when you want them. If you play tennis, be ready to leave the property (they will call you a cab.......). Beach and golf are not easily accessible or close to the rooms.  Also, when you pay a huge rate for the incredibly comfortable rooms, it is absurd to have a coffee maker that wakes up your spouse AND you are asked to pay $10 for a bag of beans. The golf courses are over the top beautiful but take way too long to play, the entry parking area is like a Costco parking lot, and the overall service was ok but not great.The Bungalow rooms are wonderful and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit to Pelican Hill. I appreciate your view on the Resort’s spacious layout, and I apologize if you had any trouble with our transportation services during your stay.  The design of Pelican Hill, brought to life after decades of detailed planning, is crafted in the style of the Italian Renaissance and intended to be timeless, aesthetically pleasing and a seamless fit within the master planned community of Newport Coast. Recognized for its unprecedented attention to detail with top national and global accolades from Condé Nast Traveler, Andrew Harper’s Hideaway Report and many others since opening in 2008, Pelican Hill has emerged as one of the world’s finest Five-Star Resorts.  I understand if the design concept and style of the Resort does not match your personal preference, and I appreciate you providing your candid feedback.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Gracious, Helpful Staff at a Premier Resort
Summary: A buddy and I were doing the "Rent a Convertible and Drive up the California Coast" and this place was our first stop.  I had a 3-bedroom villa.  It was magnificent.  The views out over the greens to Catalina were inspiring.  Wonderful breakfasts were delivered before golf.  From check-in to check-out, I found the staff to be accommodating and polite.  This resort is first rate and I would love to stay here again some time.

Summary Heading: I really wanted to love Pelocan Hill
Summary: I was so disappointed in Pelican Hill.  The restaurants, spa and setting were outstanding.  The rooms were beautiful and it just appeared to have the makings of a first class resort experience.  Unfortunately, guest services were highly unprofessional and often outright rude.  Simple requests, like a roll away bed for one evening, or coffee creamer and a clean cup, were met with rude and snarky responses that were emabarassing to us.  As well, the poolside service was lacking in the extreme.  The servers seemed to be unhappy, and often made guests wait on requests while they openly bickered with one another.  On the positive side, they had a wonderful live singer/guitarist at the pool, and he was fantastic.  I am going to discuss this with management before leaving, and will

Really quite a disappointing few days at what used to be a Real favourite. Service with a smile helps but most staff seemed keen but robotic. I felt the owners run the hotel with far too tight a grip and do not allow any flair or self expression. Will stay elsewhere next time. Certainly no longer 5 star deluxe.
Manager Response: Matt,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your stay. As a return guest, I apologize that you were let down by your recent visit to Pelican Hill, and I’m sorry you felt that our staff was not as warm and welcoming as you experienced in the past.   I can assure you that we are committed to providing gracious, personalized service for each of our guests, focusing on the Resort’s Five-Star service standards. I will be sure to communicate your feedback to our management team, as we are continually looking for ways to improve the overall guest experience.     Once again, I apologize if you were disappointed in your stay, and appreciate you taking a moment to post your feedback here. I hope that we will have the opportunity to serve you again soon.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: I was looking for things to be negative about
Summary: During booking, there was a small hiccup. When looking at the hotels website it appeared there  were rooms available. So I told everyone we were going. Then when you click on the room, it says  "we are sorry, there are no more rooms" . So I called the hotel and they confirmed they were sold out. Being upset, I started clicking around the internet and came upon booking.com and it showed rooms available, so I quick bought for 1 night and then called American Express Platinum to see if the could extend my stay and get me the benefits of the card. They were able to help me out. When we arrived we were upgraded to a 1600 sq ft double ocean view bungalow suite. Nicer than any Four Seasons suite we have been in. It was a little annoying that the coffee shop did not open till 7am every

Beautiful property, well maintained, but serious holes in quality of service and food especially with the prices they charge. On a cloudy and cool day with the pool nearly empty drink service was still incredibly slow - 20 + minutes.  On another day after being seated for lunch at the coliseum restaurant we waited over 15 minutes to have anyone come over to take our order, delivered the wrong drinks, and then had to ask multiple times for the check so we could get the heck out of there.  We decided we were far better off taking a cab to restaurants off the property where the food was better, prices in the realm of reasonable, and most surprising.- service was better,  I would want to check out other resorts in the area before ever coming back.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to post your feedback about your recent stay at Pelican Hill. While I’m glad to read that you enjoyed the beauty and serene location of Pelican Hill, it troubles me that you were disappointed in the level of service you encountered during your visit.  At Pelican Hill, we pride ourselves on being a complete luxury resort destination, where guests check in, and have all of the desired Five-Star amenities at their fingertips. I regret that your experience at the Coliseum Pool left you wising to dine elsewhere, and assure you I have taken the time to follow up with our restaurant management team to communicate your feedback.   We are committed to providing ongoing service training for our staff, so we may not only meet, but exceed our guests’ expectations. Once again, I want to thank you for taking the time to communicate your thoughts, as your candid feedback is a valuable training tool. I sincerely apologize if your visit was less than perfect, and I hope that we will have the opportunity to serve you again soon.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: The moment your car door opens one's  every expectation is a given and every step magical and thrilling!
Summary: Patrick started our stay by giving us great service and advice that never disappointed our entire expectations.  The staff at the desk the drivers to our villa, Andrea, The Collisuim,Pelican Grill and the staff at the cute cafe with gelato fantastic cusine all around. The beds so comfortable,the villa perfect for our entire family get-together must say the masquitos did present some challenges but overall a perfect experience.

Pretty property. Rooms were very nice. Two BR condo with nice views  but not cheap. Over $2,000/night. Andrea's food was good but way over priced ($1050 for 5 people without wine!). The Pelican Grill was just north on average. Golf was nice. Very slow greens and terrible caddies. Overall, service was average to poor. Flew in on a private jet and did not feel we needed a rental car. They had no service to pick us up, 10-15 min away. Seemed crazy to me. Spa - average. Fitness center - far below average. No windows. Treadmills face a blank wall. The pool seating was like being on a cruise ship. Lounge chairs 1 inch apart. Terrible. Everybody asked you all day "is everything perfect?" Well, what are you going to say? It's like telling your wife her haircut is bad...you just say yes.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit to Pelican Hill. I understand you had the opportunity to experience many of the Resort’s amenities during your stay, and it troubles me to read that your overall sentiment upon departure was one of disappointment.    It is our top priority to make every guest’s experience at Pelican Hill memorable, whether they are visiting for the day or staying for an extended getaway. In rare instances such as yours, where we regretfully miss the mark, I can assure you that I am personally committed to resolving the situation. We value your candid feedback, and will take this as an opportunity to continually improve upon our service levels throughout the Resort.  I would like to take the time to speak with you directly to discuss your feedback in more detail, and will provide my contact details separately in a private message. Once again, I apologize that you were disappointed in your experience, and I hope that we will have the opportunity to regain your trust and confidence.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Poor Experience - Not worth the money
Summary: We stayed here in July for 4 nights.  We were very disappointed.  Our room had many issues.  The shower head sprayed so hard it was actually painful.  We told the staff and they claimed to have fixed it, but it was not fixed.  The bed was leaning to one side when we got there and it eventually broke (yes, literally broke).  The air conditioner did not provide enough cooling.  They charged $10 for the in-room coffee - after such a high nightly rate, you would think they could spring for some coffee.    There was a woman at the Concierge desk who took my credit card and never returned it.  She then did not tell anyone where she left it so I had to wait a very long time to get it back.   The manager was supposed to call me after I left a complaint card, but he never did.    If I
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback here. I understand your disappointment and sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you encountered with your shower, bedding and air conditioning. I have shared your comments with our engineering team, so we may address the concerns you have mentioned here.  In speaking with our front office manager, I understand your credit card was left in the concierge gallery after your sudden and unexpected departure to take care of a personal matter. Although your credit card was safely and securely stored until you returned to retrieve it, I am sorry for any alarm this may have caused you.   I apologize if your experience was less than perfect, and thank you for sharing your feedback. I hope that we will have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We have just checked out of Pelican hill resort after an 8 day stay in a 2 bedroom suite with our son and granddaughter and it was a complete disappointment.  The staff there seem to believe that service is about repeatedly and annoyingly asking"how is your day going" or "have a nice day".  It's unacceptable to :- Be told on arrival that I could get into my villa only when my husband arrived with our photo I.d.  (he was running 15 minutes behind me having collected a car from the airport.) It's an insult!  But needless to say I found another receptionist to give me my key Wait 45 minutes and ask three different "servers" before getting some toast   Wait 24 hours to get some shower gel For the female bar person to bark at my 9 year old grandson. "You can't sit here" when he tried
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your detailed feedback about your recent visit to Pelican Hill.
