I regret that you and your family were inconvenienced in any way during your stay, and apologize that your experience did not meet your expectations and our goals.  I have taken the time to speak with our Villa managers to discuss your comments in detail. I understand that the incorrect honor bar charges were immediately removed from your daughter’s room account, and that our staff provided compensation toward your daughter’s room charges, in consideration of the challenges she experienced with our housekeeping services. As there were no challenges related to your Villa accommodations, additional compensation was not issued. I apologize if we did not remedy the situation to your satisfaction.  Providing a safe and comfortable environment for each of our guests is our top priority at Pelican Hill. By law, guests under the age of 21 are not permitted to be seated at a bar. I apologize if this information was not communicated to you in a gracious manner, and I have followed up with our restaurant manager to address your concerns detailed here.  Once again, I appreciate you providing your candid feedback and we look forward to another opportunity to serve you.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: this resort is 5 star quality in every way, except for a housekeeping snafu during our stay. we were out by 8am and returned at 3pm and room wasnt made up. after calling to express our disappointment we were told the hours were between 9 and 4pm. I asked if we could request a time period for the following day and were told we could. we asked for morning anytime until noon.  we returned again around 3pm only to find our room not cleaned again. The resort was sold out, but I expect a clean room before 4pm, especially after I asked. all other aspects were superb. there flagship restaurant , andrea's was superb and the other 2 were terrific as well. only other dig was how they "gouge" when the resort is full. the daily rate was $425.00, which is quite healthy, but our first night we
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to provide your feedback on your recent experience at Pelican Hill. I apologize for the inconvenience you experienced with our housekeeping services, and assure you I have taken the time to discuss your comments with our housekeeping department.    I am delighted you had the opportunity to visit the Resort during the summer holiday, and we look forward to another opportunity to serve you again soon. Thank you again for taking the time to share your feedback.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We are two adults who stayed at the hotel for five days: we were part of a company trip that included over 300 adults. The hotel location, staff, service and amenities were terrific. To us the staff seemed well trained and sincere:  never felt that a smile and offer to help was put on. We thought the staff seemed happy to be working there.  The food and service were very good:  we were served several meals both indoors and out in a large group, which we don't think is easy to do.  It may be possible that our group received special attention,but whether we did or not, it was a great five days. We think this is a spectacular hotel.

Summary Heading: Spread out, unwieldy & poorly trained staff
Summary: Being in the hospitality industry, I try not to be too critical, but if a property touts itself as a 5-star property, then every single aspect and experience should match that billing. My #1 impression is that staff lacked training.  Is it because their employee selection is Southern California beach casual, and they aren't accustomed or acquainted to the finer points of 5-star international hotel service?  Hotel reservations went smoothly enough, but trying to book a special dinner for a large party at their Andrea's restaurant was comical and downright exasperating.  It took countless phone calls and phone transfers to confirm dinner.  Email confirmations for the dinner came randomly and well after I had made changes to the party size.  Calling was no help.  No one on property

Summary: The Pelican lives up to its expectation of a five star resort. The service, amenities and staff are wonderful! They are very accommodating as well. This was my second visit here and I can't wait to go back again

The perfect stay-vacation!  This property is absolutely beautiful.  The Villa's are a favorite and perfect for entertaining.  Guests visit and we sit and watch the ocean in a private backyard setting.  Have fun in the kitchen or room service is a great option.  Made a big impromptu dinner for family and room service came set the table with all we needed and cleaned up after.  Villa pool cabana's are beautiful and the staff is so helpful.  Downside, NO umbrellas at the cabana's and shade is very limited at the pool.  Andrea is delicious Chef Luigi is excellent.  Lots of things to do and lots of things not to do.  A simple walk here at sunset can take your breath away.

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort, but service and attention to detail lacking
Summary: Being just 15 minutes from home, it's the perfect spot for us to have a night out sans kids. We've been to the resort a number of times for events and spa use but this was our first 'sleepover'!  On the plus side...absolutely gorgeous property, the pool was calling our name, the room was spacious and the soaking tub was lovely (and the bubble bath smells delicious). Valet, bell men and shuttle drivers were top notch - friendly, warm, helpful and respectful.  The cons...we called the concierge on our drive in as we weren't able to get Mastro's reservations and were hoping for some help. The man we spoke with (Randy?) tried calling and was unsuccessful. That was okay, but when asked for other recommendations his offerings were sub par given where we had wanted to go.  We had lunch

Summary Heading: Good place to relax - needs a little polish
Summary: We are SoCal locals and were looking for a place for a stay-cation.  The check-in was the fastest I have encountered in any hotel I have ever stayed in. The initial contact with the front desk staff and bellboys was top notch.  Since we had a newborn with us, we were very happy that we had a private patio. The rooms were spacious and clean. The room service menu was better than many hotels. The in-room coffee maker was the best I have had, but charging an extra $10 for some beans seems out of place. I'd rather pay it rolled into my room price, rather than being nickled and dimed.  However, there were still a couple of flaws that would make this one of the best resorts I have stayed in.   Here is my constructive criticism:  - We had lunch with a newborn at the Coliseum Grill. The

It is through the candid and thoughtful feedback from our guests that we are able to continuously improve upon our service standards throughout the Resort.  While I’m pleased to read that you and your family enjoyed our spacious accommodations, I want to apologize for the disturbance you encountered during your lunch at Coliseum Pool & Grill, and the regrettable interaction with our In-Room Dining staff. Once again, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect, and I hope that we will have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.  Kind regards,  Khalid Mirza Director of Food & Beverage The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: It topped our expectations in every way. It was more romantic than our honeymoon. We can't wait to go back. Too many great things to say. We felt like we were back in Italy with all the tuscany touches.

After reading reviews on this resort, we decided to book for 3 nights.  We just got back and all the reviews were accurate.  This resort will not disappoint.  Customer service is 10+.  They ensure you are well taken care of and will try to accomodate your every need.  The resort is beautiful and clean.  It is a perfect place to go to if you want peace and quiet.  The food is excellent at the restaurants.  The resort is a pricey but worth the price you pay.  We didn't want to pay $500 for a room with a view  but we were pleased with the $300 price we paid for a garden view.  The rooms are beautiful and comfortable.  The bathroom is huge.  We didn't have any spa services but we went to the jacuzzi and sauna which is included in the price of the room.  The spa is probably one of

Summary: It's my second stay in pelican hill . I stayed for 1 night the I transferred to a great house . The butlers and the housekeepers are the best in the resort the rest are layers . I called the front disk of the villa to order kids kit and slippers for my kids they said its not available at the same time I asked the housekeeper and she quick brought me what I ask for . In the morning of check out my kids felt cold I called the front disk again to provide me with kids blanket robes they said ( sorry we can't send it to you since you are checking out today ) I told them I need then they said again ( we will charge you if you take it with you) my god what they're saying , I was staying in 3 bedroom villa and pay a lot for that they have to treat us like kings .
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback about your recent stay with us. At Pelican Hill, our aim is to deliver gracious, personalized Five-Star service to each and every guest, and I apologize if your visit fell short of your expectations and our goals.  As we continuously strive to heighten service levels throughout the Resort, your thoughtful feedback is a gift. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Villa with an expansive Pacific view
Summary: We stayed in a 3-bedroom villa on top of a hill overlooking the golf course and with the most amazing expansive view of the Pacific. The villa was gorgeous with plenty of room (queen in 1 room; 2 queens in second room; king in master bedroom). Each room has either an in-suite bathroom or across the hall from a large bathroom. The kitchen is elegant and stocked with basics (milk and beer in the fridge) though you have to pay for the coffee. There is a fully stocked wine cooler. Fantastic wine that we enjoyed on the patio overlooking the view. It has a good sized garage with washer/dryer inside. The service throughout was spectacular. Especially the assigned butler, Michael. He offered to unpack for us and to go grocery shopping. Since we were only staying one night, we didn't

This property was one of the finest we've stayed at in many years. The villas are high end in every respect, with large balconies overlooking the pacific. The resort's service level was refined to the point where it's clear every employee gets extensive training. Service oriented from the start to finish - we had trouble coming up with a request they wouldn't accommodate. The coliseum pool is exquisite and the restaurants on property were all upscale and relaxed. We played the south golf course, which has the better views of the two courses. Beautiful, and well-maintained golf course. We were in a 3 bedroom suite, which I highly recommend.

Amazing stay, great resort, personal service, unreal pool.  I was surprised how many families were on vacation there, but an awesome place to stay, have meetings or lunch.   The golf course also have an beautiful course and the weather is surreal this time of year.

A beautiful resort in a nice location. Quiet nice sized rooms and good food in an ideal location. Everything was top notch! Our only 2 complaints were that the pro shop staff could have been more friendly especially when guests are paying top dollar. Also, we were w/o wireless Internet service for over 48 hours despite asking the front desk to remedy the problem on multiple occasions. Other then that the resort is top notch.

It is hard to write a review when you really do not have anything to complain about! The rooms are huge and beautiful. You have your own private terrace that has two lay out chairs and enough space to have a group of people on it.  The food at the pool was very good. The drinks are pricey but that is what I expected. A short drive in the Peninsula. We only stayed two days and unfortunately had to leave for the complete opposite of this hotel in Catalina Island. I wish I would have stayed here all week!

Summary Heading: Luxury - yes! But big $ and you might feel a little self-conscious unless your rental is a Jag
Summary: We went last month for a friend's 40th - among the group of us, we rented 1 4 b.r. villa and 3 bungalows. The resort is absolutely beautiful. Everything is well appointed and luxurious. I really have no complaints about the service other than that feeling that they are looking at you like you don't belong there (especially when you drive up in your rented Mazda and they try to hide it away from the Maseratis, Lamborghinis and Aston Martins.) No joke! The pool is fanastic (the largest circular pool in the world I believe?) and we had great service (had a cabana both days). The food was decent at the pool as well. (We didn't eat at the formal restaurant.) Had a decent massage at the spa (though wouldn't say it was my best one ever or anything) and the facilities (sauna, steam,

We were very pleasantly surprised with this jewel. A beautiful suite that we literally stayed in most of the day on Friday. Very comfortable bed with great views anywhere in the hotel and grounds. Definitely want to come back.

This is truly one of the nicest resorts in the United States.  The staff service is over the top.  The bungalows are spacious and luxurious.  The large pool with renting a cabana is wonderful.  The golf courses are beautiful and challenging.  The restaurants have fantastic food and service.  I can't say one bad thing about this place.  I would recommend to go as soon as you can!

The Resort at Pelican Hill is a truly spectacular place.  Set back in Newport Coast, driving up one gets the feeling of pulling into a sprawling mansion rather than a hotel.  And with rooms starting at 847 square feet, mansion size is somewhat fitting.  My specific room was a bungalow suite.  Though not even close to the largest accommodation here (the Villas take that honor), the room was still almost 1700 square feet.  But a big room is one thing; this one was also fitted with immense detail, and tended to by a housekeeping team that made it look as though we never lived in the place.  Beyond the rooms, the Resort at Pelican hill also features multiple fine dining options, an insane infinity pool, and 24 hour “courtesy shuttles” (essentially, you give them a call and they will

Great golf course and facilities. It would appear to have everything except a commitment to customer service and attention to detail.  Intermittent service was the biggest problem. On first day sat down for lunch. It took over an hour to get served, and when we did my quesadilla appeared to have been microwaved to melt the cheese and then thrown in pan for a couple minutes in a poor attempt to brown the tortilla. When I tried to order room service I was left on the line for 5 minutes. When I finally got someone to answer, after the front desk had cycled the call to room service a couple of times, I said I simply wanted to order some food. The woman who answered had an attitude and let me know she was the manager in a way that sounded as though I should feel honored to have the

Summary: My husband and I went there for a couple of nights. The resort is a well maintained place, I think there were more staff then visitors.  The original cost of our bungalow was $595 per night. About nine days prior I saw that the rate went down to $399 per night. I called the resort and they gave me the better rate. If I had paid $595 per night I would be writing a different review, it was not worth that price. The one thing I do not like is price gouging and they are very guilty of that.  In the room, there is a wet bar with drinks and snacks.  The prices were outrageous. I am used to seeing higher prices for that type of stuff but they were ridiculous, it was actually a joke. An example, a regular size snicker bar was $6. A one ounce bag of sea salt chips that you can buy at the

I apologize if your experience was less than perfect, and thank you again for your candid feedback.    Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Having stayed in 5 starts around the world, this is the most outstanding place I know.
Summary: This hotel, the staff, the food, the grounds, the atmosphere, the energy, the spa, the gym, the location, the huge amount of well being activities to do, the salon, the golf, the runs, the near by beach, the rooms, the VIP status everyone gets, the amazing tranquil setting that is immaculate, the health events, the shop, the cars that drive you from your door to anywhere you want to go, the security and safeness you feel as a guest, the amazing restaurants, the take out service, the breakfast served, set up and if requested cooked in your room or villa, the posh level of privacy that allows some of the wealthiest and most famous attend, yet the down to earth feeling for any kind of guest. It is without question the nicest place we have ever stayed and we have stayed all over the

This hotel is absolutely beautiful.  The grounds are lush and mature.  I checked in and my room wasn't available but they offered for me to use the spa facilities if I wanted to freshen up or change.  I declined and headed to the pool to relax.  Service was fantastic and quick with my drink and food.  The grounds are spread out but the walk is enjoyable.  You park your car next to your room which is convenient.  If you need, the hotel offers rides from your room to wherever  you need to go.  My husband played golf and the hotel drove him over to the course.  Our room was very large and well appointed.  The spa is fantastic as well as the service.

My mother and I had a wonderful trip.  We arrived earlier than check in time and they had our room ready for us.  We were handed an envelope, which included our itinerary during our stay.  This included our spa and dinner reservations.  Eric took us to our beautiful bungalow in the 'golf' cart and explained the features of the gorgeous room.  The Coliseum Grill's and Andrea's service and food was outstanding.  Mom and I walked around the pristine property all the while looking out to the blue Pacific.  We also took the complimentary coach to nearby Fashion Island, which leaves the resort at the top of the hour.  This complimentary coach also picks up from Fashion Island every half hour...extremely convenient and impressive, I thought.  The rooms are quiet.  The bath amenities

Summary Heading: No Phone Service-do not stay at this hotel

I was placed on hold for 3 mintues and then Alissa picked up and began askingme about my roomdates, etc.  After speaking to ehr for another 3 mintues, she said someone form reservations would call me back.  I asked her why she said she was "reservations" and she said, "oh no, I amreservations for activites. not rooms."  I asked her why I could not be transferred to room reservations and she said they were all in a meeting.  It is Monday at 5:45pm and not one single room reservations person is avaialbe to speak to.....I thena sked to speak to teh GM and she told me that isnt possible.  I asked to speak to a amanger, and she put me on hold for about 90 secodns and then

Summary Heading: Pelican Hill vs The Lodge at Torrey Pines
Summary: Both are absolutely lovely resorts. Pelican Hill is newer and much more sophisticated, Torrey Pines is more laid back and comfortable. The staff at both resorts are exceptionally good at what they do and it's obvious that they receive excellent training. The bungalows at Pelican Hill are gorgeous and encourage you to just relax and take it all in. We really enjoyed the fireplace and were upgrade to an ocean (albeit obstructed by trees) view. We ate at the Grille twice and both meals were very good, with even better service. The young women who work in the Cafe are super nice and helpful.  The big difference between the two resorts I think is that guests at Torrey Pines are so much friendlier and more considerate of others. The last night of our stay we had a large group of

My husband, daughter, and I wanted a quick escape for the July 4th weekend. I just wish that we had a longer vacation at The Resort at Pelican Hill! From the moment we arrived, the service was excellent. We were addressed by name and were told very quickly that we were upgraded from a 1-bedroom bungalow to a 2-bedroom villa. For us, it was perfect.  If you are unaware of the resort layout, the villas are quite a bit secluded from the rest of the property. Since we were wanting a relaxing vacation, this was a good fit for us. If you are wanting "a piece of the action" I would suggest a bungalow.  Our 2 bedroom villa was at least 1500 square feet, if not larger. There was a very modern full kitchen. We just used the fridge. There was a washer/dryer which came in handy to rinse/dry

My wife and I recently went with another couple friend to The Resort at Pelican Hill.  We stayed in one of their Villas which was first class.  The staff at the whole resort was about as good as I have experienced.  Kerry at the Villa pool went above and beyond to make sure we had a good time and even took us out on a boat to see the Harbor.  Kevin, the butler was also great and made sure our villa had everything we needed.  Overall, we will be back to Pelican Hill!  Alex E

Summary Heading: Superb resort -- but you pay for it
Summary: The bottom line for Pelican Hill is that it is a wonderful place, but one that is expensive by any standard.  If you stay for a few days and are hitting the golf courses, the spa and the restaurants you can run up a bill that approaches the national debt of some countries.  The property is beautiful and immaculately kept.  The extensive landscaping is very well maintained.  We stayed in an ocean view bungalow, which was large and had a very nice patio.  "Ocean view" is a bit of a misnomer since the resort is a good distance from the Pacific and you really only see the ocean from your bungalow if you stand on your tiptoes and peer over the landscaping.  The rooms are nicely appointed with comfortable furnishings and bedding.  The bathrooms are spacious with enough water pressure

We have had the pleasure of staying at Pelican Hill a couple of times. The location overlooking the ocean is gorgeous. Love the old olive trees. Lots of activities on and off grounds but doing nothing is a pure joy too. Staff is very attentive. Great massage and facial services -- Mrs. Verdere will have your skin glowing. Looking forward to visiting again!

From the rooms, to the landscaping, excellent golf, incredible service, beautiful pool area and pricey but fabulous restaurants, Pelican Hill meets the 5 star standard.  We spent a couple of nights there for my wife's birthday and ate at Andrea where the homemade pasta lived up to its booking,and the grill at the golf course was excellent as well  The South course was unfortunately closed, but I played the North and the layout was superb.  Only complaint about the golf was I thought the green speed was a little slow. Minor point unless you play lots of golf.  Anyway the rooms were very spacious with fireplaces, beautiful deck looking to the ocean and spacious baths.  I would stay there again in a minute. Make sure you go down to Crystal Cove while visiting

This is our second stay at Pelican Hill - and the second visit was even better than the first.  The resort architecture is picturesque - and the grounds are stunning.  We've stayed in both a 2 bedroom villa and a bungalow (different trips).  Both are fantastic.  The Villas are located outside of the main resort area (approx. 1/2 block)- but has a separate club house area if you need it.  The Villas also provide Butler service.  Our 2 bedroom villa could comfortably fit a family of four and the bungalow accommodates 2 people comfortably. However, I do prefer the pool area and fitness center in the main resort area.  Both areas are very quiet/peaceful. The pool is unlike any I have seen before.  The coliseum style is really different - and they have plenty of private cabana areas.

We arrived early (11am) as part of a small family gathering (3 families/15 people). I knew our room would probably not be ready but I gave my ID and the young  not very friendly female working the desk also swiped my credit card. She asked the usual questions ("what local paper do you want.").  Meanwhile the other families checked in. I check at the desk with the same female again after 90 minutes. It is obvious she knows me because she replies my room is not ready. I give her my cell number and wait. Around 3:15  later, I walk up to checkin, after eating lunch. I ask about my room and she says it is ready. But, she wants my ID and credit card.  I just walked up from the pool with only my phone. So, I have to walk back to the pool to get my ID AGAIN. I understand you need to

Summary: ....so do your homework before you go! We were there as part of a conference, and many of the people I spoke to said that it was the best venue that they had ever stayed in. I had no complaints at all, but it's not my style.  Pros: the place is beautiful, in a California over-the-top way. It is a 3-D magazine spread, with not a leaf out of place, no ceiling under 12', no pillow not karate-chopped. We were in a bungalow, and lucky enough to have our terrace open onto a private garden, but some open on the sidewalk, leaving you no privacy if you don't close the shutters. The bungalow itself is very spacious, and completely wheelchair accessible. There are thoughtful touches, such as the bowl on the dresser in the front hall, which is a perfect place to drop your keys, etc. when

Absolutely breath taking and amazing, it is expensive but was worth saving up to come stay one night. The view the experience it is everything you would want at a resort. Makes me not miss hawaii at all! I just didnt want to leave, also the service here makes me feel like I am the only person who they are attending too in the resort. Also a special thank you for Tom the Concierge he was so incredibly helpful and polite and always smiling. Thank you Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: The BEST place in the US!  A feel of Tuscany!
Summary: We have stayed in luxury hotels all over the world. I honestly would say this is one of the BEST! The Coliseum dining area has a fabulous menu using the highest quality ingredients. Brunch overlooking the Pacific Ocean is a beauitiful way to begin your day in heaven. Everything is first class from the service, to the restaurants to the room appointments-nothing is missed.

Summary Heading: Nice room, the worst management team ever
Summary: My husband and I decided to come to here for for part one of our honeymoon.  While the resort is very nice, the management team is absolutely terrible and, in fact, lies to its customers.  Unfortunately, during our stay, a personal item (that is not replaceable) was taken by the laundry team and we spent the following two days of our stay trying to hunt the item down.    The house manager (Nathan Donaldson) spoke to us in person and promised that he would follow  us with us during our honeymoon that he would either (i) find the item or (ii) provide us with monetary compensation for our loss.  Our honeymoon was in March.  We never heard back from Mr. Donaldson during our honeymoon, and in fact, he never followed up throughout the entire month of April.  We left voice messages for

Summary: We came in with low expectation from our last trip (read my 1st review from last May) but I was still disappointed. We decided to stay here again  b/c it's close to disneyland and it's a nice facility to relax (not nice service). We are a family of 4 with a well behave 4 years old and a mellow 7 months old who just want a place to relax after a day of theme parks. We frequent high end hotels regularly (four seasons and Peninsula hotels around the world).  We booked our room though our travel agent and paid full price for it ( not hotel and air fare package or Priceline) what we got in return when we checked in at 7pm was an accessible room. When we are paying for a room to relax in a resort it's very disappointing to received a room that doesn't suit our needs. The check in
Manager Response: It is with great disappointment that I read through the feedback you have kindly taken the time to post here. I would like to extend my apologies that your experience at Pelican Hill has fallen short of your expectations and our goals. We value you as a return guest, and I am troubled to know that your recent visit did not deliver a positive experience for you and your family, as we intend to provide for each of our guests.   At Pelican Hill, we aim to instill the highest levels of service and professionalism in each of our employees, as we continuously strive to exceed guests’ expectations. When we regretfully miss the target, I understand that we can only improve with thoughtful input from our guests, and I want to thank you for providing your detailed comments. I assure you I have taken the time to discuss your feedback with our general manager and front office management teams, so we may improve our overall guest experience.   Once again, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect, and hope that we will have the opportunity to regain your trust and confidence. I would like to take the time to speak with you directly to discuss your feedback in more detail, and will provide my contact details separately in a private message. Thank you again for taking the time to share your candid feedback.   Kind regards,  David Phillips Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Move over Montage- there is a new King of luxury on the hill.
Summary: My family and I stayed in a 3 bedroom villa for a week. The room itself is incredible. Almost 2200sqft. With 5 million dollar views. The common area in the villa has 2 separate slide away glass walls onto an enormous patio with unobstructed ocean views. Felt like paradise.  The villas have a separate pool and clubhouse.  We used the butler service more that we thought we would after my 3 year old became "best friend" with our butler.  The service level at the property is 2nd to none- great experience. Truly a 'pampered' vacation. 3 months prior I was able to stay in one of the ocean view bungalows, also very nice. All the rooms have huge deep soaking tubs separate marble showers, and huge fireplaces. The beds are the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. It will be hard to

The resort at pelican hill is easily one of the nicest resorts I've been to. It's arcitecture is stunning. And it's landscape is breathtaking. You feel like you are in a Italy. The resort is considerably cheaper then competitors starting at $395.  No resort fee .An ocean view bungalow is $495. The resort also offers luxerious villas. 2 bedroom is from $595 and 4 bed over $1000. The resort is very spread out so there is lots of walking to do. The pool is stunning but shallow. It is salt water. The food is great, but pricy. The service is good, however I was surprised how cold and impersonal the bellboy was. The room was great. Wonderful design. They are big for standerd rooms, 847 sf. If you are looking for a quiet relaxing getaway, this is definitely the place for you. If you

Pelican hill resort is the best everything there is perfect! I just loved it there i also liked their lavender and honey ice tea so i think pelican hill is a REALLY GOOD HOTEL! Pelican hill has so many facilities and there rooms are great the have so many lovely pools and great restuarants i really enjoyed it there!

We went to PH on a corporate event but stayed an extra few days on our own following.  The facilities are all above first class, and with the right bungalow, the views are magnificent.  We thought the food, both at the events and on our own was well above average, but didn't always justify the price, but then that is often the norm at many of the high end spots throughout our travels.  The staff was quite accommodating to all of our needs.  However, unless you get a real thrill out of paying outlandish prices for mediocre services by snooty folks, avoid the Spa.  But would we go back, absolutely, because the over all experience was a real treat.

Summary Heading: Excellence Defined by the Resort at Pelican Hill
Summary: This is far and away the best resort I have ever set foot in, and to date, the only five star review I have given in spite of having stayed at numerous high end resorts in Europe and North America. As I have stated in reviews prior, there needs to be an objective standard for overall excellence and the Pelican Hill is the archetype from my perspective.   I could have shot three rolls of film documenting the gorgeous detail of our 800 square foot room and the impressive and tasteful buildings that house the restaurants and bars. My girlfriend was ecstatic when she found the robes, bed linens and towels to be of the highest quality and we had our own private, outdoor patio.   Dining was a decadent affair every evening as we sampled the finest Californian vintages - one doesn't

had the pleasure of staying at Pelican Hill as part of my work.. Everything they do here is top notch. From the moment we checked in to the hotel we were treated so well. Everything here is grand and larger than life, without being really OTT.. The staff treated us with grace and kindness. They even picked something up from the hotel store for me and brought it to my room. The turndown service was beyond compare. Handmade chocolate, slippers .  We ate in the restaurant s and ordered room service the food was delicious . . The shuttle was where we needed it when we needed it.  Travelling with children we used camp pelican and the children enjoyed the time and activities on offer, again as with everywhere else in the resort the staff were wonderful.  If you are looking for an

I've been a big fan of The Montage for years, but decided to try PH this time because I was going to be in Corona Del Mar and Newport Beach a lot.  I have to say I'm very surprised by all the 5 star reviews because our experience there was far from perfect. I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could.   We went with a villa and the good news is that is was HUGE and very reasonably priced for the size.  We could have easily shared it with another couple (or even two!).   The golf course view was nice, though I'd rather see more of the ocean (largely blocked by trees). I personally didn't like the décor - almost everything was beige or tan and kind of clunky - just not very attractive in my opinion. And surprisingly some of it wasn't in the best shape or of very high quality. A couple
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your thoughts about your recent visit. Although I am delighted to read that you enjoyed our luxurious Villa accommodations, I’m disappointed to read that your overall experience did not meet your expectations and our goals.   Based upon the thoughtful feedback you have provided, I have taken the time to personally follow up with our Villa management team to address any imperfections you may have encountered during your stay. I apologize for any discontent you may have experienced while visiting the Resort.   As we continuously strive to heighten the guest experience throughout our Five-Star Resort, I want to thank you for sharing your candid feedback. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you again soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary Heading: Golfers paradise and a 5 star resort
Summary: I have stayed at The Resort at Pelican Hill twice in the past 12 months.  Both visits have been outstanding experiences.  The 2 golf courses are simply spectacular and the golf operation is first rate with fore caddies included with each round.  The resort itself is beautiful and very well run.  Rooms are in bungalow buildings that run along the ridge lines on the hills.  The rooms are quite large and include gas burning fireplaces and large patios.  I have eaten in all 3 restaurants and the food is consistently very good.  My wife said the spa is top notch.  This is a great long weekend get away spot particularly for couples and families.  You see a lot of families here enjoying the large pool area.  It is only a 15 minute drive from Orange County airport.  This is a spot you

Pelican Hill Resort is a perfect getaway for just a day or an extended stay. Conveniently located along the Pacific Coast between Newport Beach and Laguna Beach, it is a great base for seeing many of the sights of Southern California. It's a short drive to Disneyland and just over an hour to Los Angeles.  The resort itself is not located directly on the beach but across Pacific Coast Highway in the hills facing the ocean. The views are stunning from many of the public areas of the resort and the restaurants. What a pleasure to wake up to a beautiful ocean view from our bungalow. Now when you hear the word bungalow you may think of a rather small accommodation which certainly doesn't apply to the bungalows at Pelican Hill. The room is very large with high vaulted ceilings, an

I am fortunate as I grew up in Newport.   So, after watching the evolution of Newport Coast my wife and I decided to experience the Resort at Pelican Hill.   We booked a Villa Which is essentially a very nicely appointed tract home.   The views are spectacular, overlooking the 1st and 18th holes of the North Course.   The villa pool and clubhouse are separated from the resort and at never crowded.   Many people bring their families and small children so it is not a peaceful experience.   The service is very good but a bit pretentious.   It definitely caters to the Nuevo Riche.     We had dinner at Andrea's.   Despite bad reviews about the service, we found the service impeccable.   We were seated on the heated outside patio for sunset and were very comfortable.   The menu had

We stayed for four nights in April. The weather was actually cold and rainy most days, which was too bad.  Other than the weather, the trip was fantastic.  We were unable to upgrade our bungalow to one with a view because they were booked. But even with no view (other than tree's / secluded) the terrace was nice and relaxing. It would have been nicer if the weather was better though. Loved the bath products in the room and the bathroom itself was wonderful.  Bed was comfortable, room was very spacious, staff were friendly and prompt and the dining was excellent. Ate at both the Pelican Grill and the Coliseum Grill and both were great. Ate on the terrace which had heaters above and the views were amazing.  I loved this resort and would love to go back again sometime.  Location is

This resort is for the dubious looking to get away from all the hoopla and wind down in peace.  While PHR is not inexpensive by any means, it is absolutely breathtaking.  The grounds are immaculate and pristine.

Every interaction demonstrated this hotel's commitment to customer service. Food excellent, service excellent, rooms excellent. I couldn't have asked for anything more. This is my second stay at this hotel and I hope that the conference I was attending makes this a regular stop. The Villa's would be roomy for 2 families of 4, each villa had 2 bedrooms with 2 queen beds, washer/dryer/ fridge, stove, wine cooler, small stock of groceries, milk, cream and water. The only extra charge was $10 per bag for some very fine coffee, again well worth it.

The grounds are beautiful and the service is impeccable. Fantastic food. Golf courses are the best I've seen. The spa is a must. The rooms are very spacious and the balconies are private with a beautiful ocean view for most of them. Make sure to request one in case they gave you garden view which isn't that bad but not as good. Cadillac Escalades are used for ground transportation. Really amazing!!

This is a beautiful very high end resort high above the Pacific.  The resort has a beautiful pool called the Colosseum .  Overall a very relaxing 2 days.  Very romantic and quiet.  If you ar looking for a lot of action this would not be a great place to be.  Great for families and a romantic weekend.

Summary Heading: very very nice but need a few adjustments to be a 5 star
Summary: Setting is lovely, food was delicious--particularly enjoyed a leisurely lunch at the Pelican Grill which was a solid 5 stars.  Issue was room service breakfast--took an hour the first day (promised 40 minutes) and both mornings the food was only lukewarm.  Not sure if it's their delivery truck or what but the food was not very appetizing at that temperature.  The owners of this property obviously take great care and pride in it, and they should address this shortcoming.  Otherwise--it was lovely.
Manager Response: Elisabeth,   Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit. While I’m delighted to read that you enjoyed the Resort’s coastal setting and your lunch at Pelican Grill, I regret that your experience with in-room dining fell short of your expectations and our goals.   As we continuously strive to heighten dining experiences throughout the Resort, I have taken this opportunity to share your comments with our In-Room Dining management team. I apologize if your experience was less than perfect, and we look forward to another opportunity to serve you again soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: We stayed in the four bedroom villa. Unit 703- AMAZING. Beautiful luxurious property. You get your own butler 24/7. If you want to spoil yourself this is the place. The pool is beautiful as well as the whole property incredible views from everywhere on the property.

Setting fabulous. Italian approach meets SoCal. Views, spaces, attention. A world apart for high end resorts. Unusually May/June are not the best SoCal months - but it was amazing. Not trendy and busy. Go out for that. Enjoy the spa, silence and pampering. My room was near a busy street - so some car noise by day but good location.  At checkin confirm location. Definitely do. At least once.

Summary Heading: Simply stunning, but you pay for it
Summary: This is a beautiful resort with great staff and in a perfect location, but you certainly do pay for it. I'm not a cheapskate and enjoy 5 star hotels and travel, but felt the hit at Pelican Hill for sure.   If you can afford the price you will be spoiled by this amazing setting and a first rate staff.  We stayed in the Bungalows and had a huge room with a big walk-in shower, deep tub, spacious living area and a private outdoor patio. My only complaint would be our proximity to the service area by the Coliseum Pool and grill, so the ever busy staff members and their vehicles could always be heard from our patio.  This definitely detracted from our enjoyment of the patio. Our bed was quite average and actually tilted a little so I was always waking up to move back into the middle.

Recently stayed at this beautiful resort to attend a meeting.  You know you've gone to a great meeting venue when the first topic of conversation at the meeting is how great the resort is.  I could find no flaws at the resort, from the elegance of the room, the sea view, and the room amenities, to the friendly staff.  Nothing is overlooked, even the little things.  For example, in-room coffee service is with an automatic grind-your-own coffee maker.  Coffee beans are provided (instead of the institutional packets) which can be placed in the coffee maker, which then grinds then brews fresh drip grind coffee.  I am impressed enough that I will make part of my daughter's wedding gift a stay at this resort, after she and new husband return from their honeymoon.

Beautiful resort everything was first class. We usually stay at the Ritz Carlton but decided to try something new. We enjoyed it better than the Ritz. The service and the atmosphere were great. I was able to play both golf courses which were amazing. My wife loved the spa. We stayed in a bungalow that was spacious and beautiful. Plan to stay there again next time we are in California.

Stayed for 6 nights after visiting from LA. From the minute you step inside, you get this feeling, that this is going to be special. Have read all the trip advisor reports and thing that they don't go far enough is describing this fantastic destination. We are have travelled a lot and it is rare you find a destination which feel so perfect. It is pricey, sure, but we think if you buy cheap you buy twice..you get what you pay for.....well worth the expense. Are we coming back...for sure.

Very unique resort with bungalows and villas.  Great restaurant.  Two golf courses which are average, but with a high green fee.  Service is great.  Good spa.  We were upgraded from a bungalow to a three bedroom villa.  Beautiful villa with about 2500 sq ft - full kitchen, 3 bedrooms and 3 baths, large LR and DR, flat panel tv's in LR and all BR's.  Main drawback - you need a shuttle to get to the Villa Clubhouse or the mail clubhouse.  However, more convenient if you have a car.

We stayed here for my husbands work conference and it was great. The rooms are very nice & the service is great. The views from the rooms are gorgeous. You are close to Fashion Island (shopping) & Newport which has a lot of restaurants & shops. It's a great location.

My husband and I spent 4 nights in one of the bungalows at Pelican Hill and I cannot say enough about this gorgeous property.  Our room was exquisite with all the amenities we could ever want.  Without exception, the staff was very professional, friendly and accommodating to our every need.  The grounds and the pool are beautiful with spectacular views.  The restaurants and the spa are also wonderful. I would not hesitate to recommend this lovely resort.

Summary Heading: Luxury, fine service and beautiful views
Summary: I've just recently stayed at the Villas at the Pelican Hills Resort in Newport Beach.  What a wonderful place to stay!  The spacious 3bedroom villa comes with a butler who is simply one touch on the phone away. He is never near the villa unless you require his services. If you would like a ride to one of the restaurants he pulls up in a black Escalade to escort you to your desired destination. The views of the golf course and ocean are hard to tear your eyes away from!  The fridge was stocked with a few things to get you started in the morning. I will be back!  The entire experience was first rate!,

Summary Heading: Very good overall but small things are important....
Summary: Second time staying here. Overall First Class Resort with Excellent Service. However, they have some holes in their game that need to be addresses for a resort of this caliber.   Called a few days before our arrival to set up car service to take us to dinner. Took 3 follow up calls to confirm a car and then we were informed it would be a $200 minimum for a one way drop off. Ended up using an independent service for half the cost and had an S Class pick us up.   Upon check in, we were escorted to our Ocean View Bungalow, which was very nice. Spacious, nice balcony, etc. The guy who showed us to our room was very thorough, explained where everything was, how everything worked, the amenities, etc. Great start!   Called to book massages at the spa. Danielle informed me that our

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort but a little different
Summary: My husband and I just came back from The Resort at Pelican Hill. We were there on a business trip with a few extra days added on for pleasure. This was my first trip to the Newport Beach area. It's a beautiful place, very affluent.  The resort itself is gorgeous but not your average resort. There is not a main hotel with rooms attached. The resort, as many people have described, is broken up into a main entrance which has the main pool, spa, workout center and restaurants. The lodging is spread out throughout the resort. It has the feel of a beautiful planned community. The rooms (king/2Queens sitting area) which are called bungalows are in clusters a short walk/ride away from the main building. In addition to the bungalows there are also two,three and four bedroom villas. We

This was our second visit to PH. Last time (also during peak spring break season), we were upgraded to a 4 bedroom villa on the Fine Hotels and Resorts program, but this time we were told that having booked a 2 bedroom villa, we could not be upgraded to any other villa. After checking in and noticing that the villa had a distinct dank and moldy odor, we requested a villa change via the concierge and we were told that no other villas were available. (The reason for this is that the 2 bedroom villas are in shared building with 4 villas per building. All 2 bedroom villas look out into the parking area/garage roof, and the street beyond.  Even the "ocean view 2 bedrooms are covered with an overhanging roof so that there is no option for lounging on your own terrace in the sun- in
Manager Response: Francine,  I am deeply disappointed to hear that your recent visit was less than perfect, and appreciate you taking the time to post your feedback here. As a valued guest of Pelican Hill, I want to thank you for returning to our Italian seaside village, and apologize that your experience over the Easter holiday did not meet your expectations and our goals.   We are pleased to provide accommodation upgrades when available, although occasionally guest demand does not allow it. I apologize for any discontent you may have experienced with your two-bedroom Villa. I understand our Villa Manager spoke directly with you and offered to assist with a room move after your first night, but appreciate that you and your family were already settled in to your accommodations. Rest assured, our team has thoroughly inspected the Villa you stayed in, and no mold has been found.   Please know that I have followed up with the management teams of our food and beverage, housekeeping and front office departments to ensure that your comments are considered carefully, as we continuously strive to heighten the guest experience throughout our Five-Star Resort.  I would like to take the time to speak with you directly to discuss your feedback in more detail. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message. Again, thank you for your candid feedback.  Kind regards,  David Phillips Director of Rooms The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: My wife and I checked in for four nights and all I can say is wow!  From the moment we entered the facility we were treated like royalty.  Regardless of where we went or who we encountered, we were always greeted by name as if we were family.  The room, with a view of the Pacific, was perched on a hill just a short walk from the pool, restaurants, spa, workout facility, etc.  The bedroom had a working fireplace, more than ample storage, work area with very large desk, and a bathroom with a window into the bedroom and out to the Pacific.  Additionally, there was a very large and private balcony.  The evening we arrived was the day American Airlines had their computer outage and it took us 12 hours to fly cross country.  Despite our tired and greasy look and still in our travel

This resort is First Class all the way! Filled overly friendly staff ready to assist you with every move!  Location is at the top of the cliff so the view is amazing. The resort is just outside of Newport Beach...so it is a slight drive to town.. Need a car to get to restaurants n shops! However they do have plenty of drivers available with a great fleet of SUVs ! We opted for a villa instead of two hotel rooms..as It was less expensive than two hotel rooms. Amazing place!

This Tuscan-style property with amazing views and grounds is definitely a great get-away, with generally great staff.  When we checked in and announced a special occasion, however, we were told pretty dismissively that there are no upgrades available without additional cost and that even if we were to upgrade, it would only be for two nights.  And, despite it being around 5 pm, our room was not ready.  After loitering in the lobby and seeing the breathtaking views, we decided to pay for the upgrade and be able to get into a room right away.  We ended up being told we could get the ocean view for all three nights, but the whole check-in experience felt a little less than 5 stars.  The ocean view bungalow room was well worth it though and the gas fireplaces are really awesomely

Very nice, the staff was unbelievably helpful.  We stayed in a bungalow with a million dollar view.  The one downside is there is only 3 restaurants on site so If you don't want to go out its not ideal.   Great big heated pool and semi private cabanas where you can relax.  You can walk to Cristal cove or grab a cab to Laguna beach ($20) for a 10 min ride.  Fashion Island if you want to do some shopping will also cost you ($20).   In all a 5 star + hotel.

Well ,we checked in and all was well .We are asked if we had been upgraded as we are Centurion Amex .They said nothing was available but if we wanted to pay more they could do it . We went to our Bungalow and it was nice but not great .Not what we thought we were getting .They lost 2 FedEx packages that they had signed for ,it took them a day and a half to find them . The next day it was cold and rainy ,we had booked a Cabana at $350 .We asked if they had heaters ,no .We asked if we could cancel .No, we had to pay as they require 72 hours notice to cancel regardless of weather .I guess it would be fun in a Hurricane !!!!  After 20 minutes of back and forwards  they did not charge us . Went back to our room and asked for Champagne glasses ,No . Later we asked for room service
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your thoughts about your recent visit. I am glad to read that you enjoyed our Villas, but I am disappointed to read that your overall experience was less than perfect.   Based upon the comments you mentioned regarding cabana reservations, the pool and in-room dining, I have personally taken this opportunity to follow up with the leaders of each department. Please know that your feedback is a gift, as we continually strive to heighten the overall guest experience in every corner of the Resort.   I apologize your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. I appreciate your candid feedback and kindly invite you to contact me directly to discuss your experience in more detail. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message. Again, thank you for sharing your thoughts.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Worst and snobbiest hotel in Newport Beach
Summary: The hotel staff are snobs and think you are above everyone else. Everything is also overpriced once you are at the hotel. The bungalows are nice but the resort is too spread out. The location scenic is nice but far from restaurants and shopping.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback about your recent experience with us. I am disappointed to read that your visit fell short of your expectations and our goals. At Pelican Hill, our aim is to deliver gracious, personalized Five-Star service to each and every guest.  I apologize that your experience was less than perfect. I appreciate your perspective and kindly invite you to contact me directly to discuss your feedback in more detail. I will provide my contact details separately in a private message. Again, thank you for your candid feedback.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: There are very few hotels where you go and everything is simply perfect.  This was our third visit to the property and again, flawless execution throughout all areas of the hotel.  It was one of those gloomy weekends we have in Southern California in April.  We had utilized the American Express Centurion package which includes the breakfast, spa credit, pool cabana and breakfast each day.  We sat in our cabana and watched The Masters wrapped in towels.  Our pool attendant couldn't have been more accommodating.  The rooms, as always, were perfect and so very thoughtfully put together.  The beds were incredibly comfortable, the in-room internet worked well, we had a lovely ocean view and the fireplace helped warm up the room in the cool California mornings.  We stayed in the 400

Summary Heading: the best hotel I have been so far
Summary: This was part of an annual recognition program for a company I used to work for, I payed the extra charges to bring my kids/teens along - the place is just fabulous - excellent service, room well above average in terms of size, layout and comfort - restaurants and room service are top notch and close to all major interesting spots like Laguna Beach and several malls.  unforgettable!

My family recently spent a couple nights in the villas here and it was very nice but not quite five stars.  The resort and the facilities are beautiful as they have always been.  It was our second time in the villas either my fourth or fifth stay at the hotel in the last several years and the service was not quite what we have experienced in the past.   The smaller nature of the villa customer services/check-in desk resulted in 5-10 minutes waits for any check-in, check-out questions, etc.  In the past we have always had a lovely cheese plate waiting in our room upon check-in.  Not so this year although they did bring one when we inquired.   Perhaps we were just unlucky but the service at the villa pools was decidedly lacking.  It was a long wait to get a chair and 45 minutes or

Summary Heading: Everything done to a very high standard!
Summary: This is one of the most beautiful; and relaxing places to stay in the world – particularly if you are interested in golf. It is far from cheap. We however stayed in one of the villas which was (as indeed is the whole hotel) impeccably finished.  The furnishings are to a very high standard.  It is very difficult to see any sign of wear and tear anywhere.  The service is to the highest standard. Anything we wanted was made available almost immediately. On one occasion we had to call housekeeping late at night because a garment had been damaged by a spillage of red wine. They came to collect it immediately and it was brought back the following day without even a microscopic trace of the stain! It has a range of restaurants all of which are very good. We would unhesitatingly

This is one of the finest hotels I have stayed at.  There is no main large building containing all the rooms but a string of bungalows.  The bungalows were outstanding.  The hotel provides transportation from your room to the main facility that houses the restaurants and meeting rooms.  I was in one of the last bungalows and did not mind walking in the mornings to the meetings.  The bungalows are first class large rooms with nice bathrooms and fireplaces.  We were their for a business meeting and had a special rate for the room.  If you have an opportunity to stay here don't miss it.

This place was recently voted the best resort hotel in America and I can see why. Less than 5 years old, this resort is perched on the rolling hills above Newport beach with one of the most spectacular views on the west coast. The hotel is absolutely first class in all respects. Beautiful hotel, villas and restaurants. A large circular pool and world class golf course. The food was fantastic even when served banquet style to several hundred people at the same time. Staff was attentive and professional in all respects.  Lovely gift shop with very unique and affordable items.

If I could live there I would. What an amazing resort...they have it all. 5 star all the way. The oceanview rooms have a great view and a wonderful patio with lounges. If you are travelling with a family, definitely book a villa...they have full kitchens. In the villa section, they have their own private clubhouse and pool...much quieter than the main Coliseum Pool. Pool service is wonderful. At the Coliseum Pool, the view is overlooking the golf course and ocean behind...spectacular. The Spa is amazing...and their body wash is to die for when you shower. Same products you receive in your bathroom in your rooms.

Summary Heading: Only the best, that is Pelican Hill!
Summary: Beautiful 5 star property that makes you feel like part of the rich and famous.  Even the restrooms at the main building are fantastic.  Huge doors and you get folded towels to wash your hands and it is always so clean!   We loved the little coffee shop inside the resort, that had tables inside and also outside on the patio with fantastic views everywhere.   They make great coffee drinks and the prices are comparable to Starbucks.  If you have it to dine there, you get pretty fine china cups and saucers, or large mugs, depending on the drink itself  I had the Cafe Mocha twice and it comes in a huge pretty mug & was very good with whipped cream & choc drizzled over it.    Out at the pool area, you have full service.  When you arrive the pool boy puts a clean towel over each

This is quite an amazing property! Beautiful villas, we were in a 3 bedroom. We love the service, everyone is SO friendly and they have a driving service that will take you anywhere on the resort you would like to go. While everything is top notch thus comes great expectations. When we arrived in our villa it didn't take long to notice that the counters and table had not been cleaned and were sticky with dried food. We also notice that there was broken glass on the carpet and cigarette buts in the planters on the patio. A few things that shouldn't be happening in a place such as this. They did come to clean it but no sincere apologies or communication from any management personnel. We had lunch at the clubhouse by the pool and while the food was nice it took FOREVER and there

You know how some places say they're 5 stars? Then it's outdated and filled with regret? Not here! I always dream of booking a place and finding a real paradise- and they've outdone themselves! The John Wayne Airport (SNA) is less than 10 miles away. They have Bungalows for less than $400. We enjoyed a 2 bedroom Villa with one car garage (over 2100 sq.ft.)!for $695. We were 30 mins from Disneyland. Although we were on a family trip with our 2 kids, my husband and I were thinking of returning for a romantic trip alone next year. The service is outstanding. You can call a hotel shuttle to drive you to the pool, restaurants, or golf. There's a "butler" assigned to your villa, too. We tipped him $40 for bringing up our bags, but didn't need his services after that. Room Service is a

This resort is stelaar in every aspect - a real treat! Fantastic service overall although we had to wait an hour and a half for room service one night but it was over the Easter weekend and coffee and condiments weren't replenished as needed but they have a wonderful coffee shop  just off the lobby in the main building. It truly feels as if you're in Italy when staying at this resort. Wonderful shuttle service that takes you to Crystal Cove beach where you can have breakfast on the beach and go for long walks. We'll return to this resort at the first opportunity we have again! The golf courses at Pelican also looks fantastic with breathtaking views of the ocean. Picture perfect!

Our villa looked west toward gorgeous sunsets and Catalina Island. The villa was about 2200 sq. feet so almost house size. Well equipped and they brought any extras we needed for cooking and serving guests. Anything we requested was brought very quickly and all the help we friendly as they could be. We travel extensively and this was one of the nicest places we've ever been. We have already reserved for next year for another month. Lots of restaurants on the grounds and nearby and the resort has a fleet of Escalades to drive you around. Spa was amazing and mainly not too busy in March. Great place to spend time and enjoy the area.

Huge resort, but very private feeling.  They have luxury vehicles at your beck and call to take you places within the resort.  Staff were all excellent, room beautiful and big, and food was decent.  I was in bungalow 234, I think the 400's might be better for ocean view, but I did have a peek a boo view.   There was some construction noise nearby but off the resort, that started some mornings at 5am.   Also, in the early morning I could hear any big trucks along the road behind the resort.   I found the bed a bit hard (a normal complaint with me), but there were 3 pillows to choose from.  One skinny down, one medium down, and one big puffy euro sized synthetic.   So, sleeps were barely adequate.   The A/V system was great, they have bose speakers, and you can easily hook up your

Summary Heading: Best resort and staff in America
Summary: this is not my first time staying at Pelican Hill in Newport beach Ca and will not be my last as it is the most beautiful and luxurious place on the West coast. The staff at the Villa front desk especially Betty and Casey are simply wonderful and will make sure your stay is perfect every time. We have been coming to Pelican for over 4 years and Josh the front desk manager has delivered a perfect stay every time we have come and has gone out of his way to point out great restaurants and places to visit during our stay. The value at Pelican Hill is far above any suite at any 5 star hotel because the 3 and 4 bedroom villas are simply put as good or better than your own home.

We stayed at The Resort at Pelican Hill over Easter break and had an amazing time.  We were in a 4-bedroom villa and enjoyed the privacy that this first class resort offers. The ocean views are stunning, restaurants are delicious and the pool is superb.  Checking in at the main front desk we were greeted by Josh, the front desk manager, who made everything happen.  He was so informative with suggestions of what to do that he made our stay an over the top success.

Summary Heading: First class, with a few imperfections
Summary: We stayed four nights in an Ocean View King bungalow. The room is very nice, more like an attached townhome (in other words, the rooms are connected, but seem like their own bungalows). That said, we did not hear any noise from the neighbors. The bathrooms are huge and luxurious, the bed is comfy and there is plenty of room. The outdoor patio left a little to be desired, and remember that this resort is still quite a bit away from the ocean, so the view is nice but not spectacular.  The service is first-class and the resort is sprawling and grand. The golf was great, not completely breathtaking but a nice course with occasional views of the ocean. The spa was also enjoyed by my wife. Dinner was lovely, outdoors at the Pelican Grill (the "second" restaurant there). Drinks in the

My husband and I stayed this weekend at the Resort at Pelican Hill to celebrate my birthday. We found a phenomenal deal on the internet and knew it would be the perfect way to celebrate. We checked in on my actual birthday, Friday, March 29. Although we paid a very reduced rate, we were treated very well at check-in and were upgraded to a partial ocean view room since it was my birthday. We live locally in Newport Beach but had never stayed or dined at the resort before this weekend.   Our room was gorgeous! We had a bungalow with a large patio, a fire place in the room, and a hug tub. It was so cozy!   The food at the pool was wonderful and completely reasonable in price! Service was decent. There were a ton of children at the pool making lots of noise. I wish they had an adult

Just got back from California and had the pleasure of spending five wonderful days at Pelican Hill.  We had a beautiful two bedroom villa that overlooked the ocean and surrounding area,  spectacular views to enjoy while having a glass of wine on the patio.  The villa had all the comforts of home without the work of being home.  The staff made sure the villa was always clean and well stocked with anything you asked for. The services were incredible and extremely friendly, yet casual, never feeling as if the friendliness was faked.  The concierge service was very good, dining recommendations very knowledgeable and no matter what, always got us a table regardless of how booked a restaurant was. The spa services were also very good.  I was lucky enough to go a couple of times and

Summary Heading: It's like coming home, I've never felt my welcomed and relaxed
Summary: The south villas and their staff could not have been more friendly, professional, enjoyable to be around and met every need and expectation I had. John the villas manager was gracious and accommodating. Andrew the restaurant manager at piccolo took care of everything was asked for and made me and my family so happy to be there plus we felt that he knows the region and culture very well. Jameson our server was spot on when suggesting and making our drinks, Stacy was cheerful and Pauline at the front desk handled everything splendidly. There was not one thing bad I could say about Pelican Hill, and the staff at the south villas. Bravo!

My wife and I are staying at The Resort at Pelican Hill for a leisure event or my company. What an exceptional property in every aspect. The grounds are great, the staff is great and you every need will be met. It is not a place for  the price conscious but if you are looking for a great retreat that will treat you like royalty this is the place to stay.

Flawless check-in. Room (bungalow) was amazing. One of the best rooms I have ever stayed in. Free parking and wi-fi. Food at the resort was excellent and staff were very attentive and helpful. Beautiful resort overall. Only one small gripe was the lousy unattentive and unfriendly pair on reception when I checked out. Smarmy, almost threw my bill at me. Having said that I would definitely return.

I just returned from the resort, celebrating my birthday.  I only live 20 minutes away, but I truly felt like I was miles away from my normal hustle and bustle.  The staff was extremely attentive, friendly and helpful.  It started w the email I received from Shannon, my guest experience concierge, who offered to book spa, golf and/or dining for me.  I had her book my spa treatment and informed her I was celebrating my birthday.    The spa was pristine.  I was greeted by Lidia, who was so helpful, and my technician (Erica) took the time to ask questions about my skin and what I really wanted.  The result was one of the best facials I've had - my skin looks amazing!  My bungalow was well appointed, quiet and beautiful - and the bed is soooo comfortable.  I was surprised and

When we arrived at Pelican Hill, our room was not ready.  If your room is not ready, they give you free gelato.  The architecture is beautiful.  All of the staff made sure that we were happy at all times.  It has a nice pool and hot tub.  It is right on the coast so you can take walks on the beach and not have to go very far.  This was a wonderful trip.  And I know that I will be taking my family back to Pelican Hill.

Summary Heading: Stay, play golf and relax here, just don't eat here.
Summary: First off, the extraordinary physical facility that is this resort as well as it's breathtaking location on the Southern California coast will make you very happy that you decided to come and stay here. We have done so frequently since 2009.  As a local SoCal visitor and Golf/Spa afficionado, I can attest that the Resort at Pelican Hill, offers the best of both experiences in one sybaritic location. I have brought many guests to play the ocean front course as well as treated friends and relatives to the absolutely delightful and relaxing spa experiences. There is simply no equal to the skill, polish, service and attentiveness of the staff as well as the facilities for golf and spa at Pelican. Even if you decide NOT to stay at Pelican, try the Golf and Spa - it's that good and in

Summary Heading: Excellent Experience 3X going back for a Fourth!
Summary: The service, food and property are excellent. This is a must-do if you can afford to experience a week of lavish views, spend time relaxing at the Collesium pool, golf a round at the North Course, and eat at one or two of the amazing restaurants. No matter the reason to be there, it will take your breath away.

Summary Heading: We are fortunate to have four incredible resorts in Orange County
Summary: Three couples decided to sneak off for a night at the PH, and we thought the annual Festa Dell' Autunno was the perfect excuse. Boy, did we choose wisely! The hotel throws an annual three day festival to celebrate their olive harvest. It includes a street festival on site (including finger foods and wine), a delicious outdoor "family style" dinner featuring a selection of italian foods cooked by their reknown chefs, and a fabulous Sunday morning jazz brunch.  We were regaled by opera and pop singers, talented jazz musicians, local artists, a reknown Italian flag tossing troupe, and had to "endure" fascinating stories from our fellow diners during dinner. Did I over-eat? You BETCHA, but who wouldn't when treated this way. It was fabulous! I am a local, and for those that don't

What can I say? It's one of the finest  properties I've even had the pleasure of staying at with one of the most spectacular views on the planet. Should I stop my review now? Probably, but I'll share more details to give you and idea of what makes the property such a special place. I'l cover our room, services, food, ameniites, and scenery.   First our room or in our case our villa.  Our 20 year old daughter was joining us for spring break so we reserved a two bedroom villa and due to our travel agent we received a complimentary upgrade into a 3 bedroom villa. We were told to stay in the SouthVillas and very glad we did as had a drop dead georgeous view. The 3 bedrooom villa was nothing short of spectacular, from three bedrooms, huge living room/dining room and wonderful garage.

I have stayed here 3 times now and surprisingly had a varied experience.  My last two visits were not as positive as my first visit.  The room I stayed in was as far away from the lobby as you could get and my room overlooked the road.  Did not enjoy traffic noises and the view of bushes and weeds.  Regardless, the spacious patio is a great place to spend time as the lounge chairs are a comfortable place to relax.  I also really enjoyed the gym - went to a boot camp class that was intense and rewarding.  Great job on the classes!  There was a large stain on the light colored carpet and I expect higher standards at a resort of this calibre.  There was a cleaning rag left on the furniture on the patio and some empty wrappers that were on the patio.  Seems minor, but this is an
Manager Response: Nicole,   Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit.  I’m delighted to read that you enjoyed the gym, private terrace and other in-room appointments, but apologize that your recent experiences fell short of your expectations and our goals.   At Pelican Hill, we aim to deliver exceptional experiences for every guest, every time. I am disappointed to read about the housekeeping oversights and less than perfect in-room dining experience. Rest assured, I have taken the time to personally follow up with managers in each area you noted, so we can address your concerns.   No detail is too minor and I appreciate you providing your candid feedback, as we continually strive to heighten the guest experience in every corner of the resort. Should your travels bring you to Pelican Hill again in the future, we look forward to another opportunity to serve you.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: I have had the pleasure of staying at the resort for personal vacation and this trip was for a business conference.  The quality of service and attention to detail throughout the entire resort is 5 star.  The rooms are so comfortable and spacious!  The food - from the buffet breakfast that our group was offered to the lunches and dinners - simply outstanding.  I'm not sure that any resort in the country can offer the complete package that Pelican Hill has to offer!  Incredible!!!

My wife and I were scheduled to spend our first night away from our 8 month old baby back in January. Unfortunately, two nights before our trip, our daughter was hospitalized with a respiratory virus. I called the hotel to cancel and they told me they would still have to charge me the "deposit", which turned out to be the full fee of around $500. After speaking to various representatives, and being told that only one manager could override this policy, and after offering to send doctor's notes, hospital records, etc., I was told they couldn't refund the fee, but they could give me a credit towards re-booking if I chose a date within 30 days. As a family with a young child, that seemed unreasonably restrictive, so I called AMEX and luckily they agreed to dispute the charge based
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent experience with us. I understand your disappointment and am sorry to read about the unfortunate circumstances of your daughter’s unexpected illness. I hope she has made a swift recovery.  While our online booking policy clearly states the specifics of the non-refundable deposit for cancellations within five days prior to the arrival date, our reservations team kindly reached out to reschedule the dates of your visit, based on the difficult situation you encountered. In reviewing your correspondence with our reservations manager, it seems that a mutual agreement was reached during your conversation on January 25th and that you intended to move your deposit to a future date within 60 days.  When you have a chance to confirm a future visit date with our reservations department, we certainly look forward to hearing from you. In the meantime, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect and appreciate you taking the time to post your thoughts here.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The Resort at Pelican Hill is visually stunning.  The grounds, the golf course, the pool are all world class.  My wife and I stayed there at a business meeting but still had plenty of time to enjoy the resort.  The fitness center opens early with plenty of machines and equipment.  The restaurant Andrea serves wonderful Italian inspired food with great service and an even better wine list.  I had a dental  emergency and the concierge made so many calls until she found a dentist that could see me right away, and the hotel provided a car so I could get back and forth.  By the end of our visit we were greeted by name and the very special Felicia was icing on the cake.  A great visit!

Just spent 4 night at this resort and I was blown away! I stay and travel a lot of places so it takes alot to impress me this much. They resort is beautiful with a huge round pool and outstanding views of the Pacific Ocean. It features single floor rooms that make you feel like you have complete privacy.
