They have a private sun patio with 2 cushioned loungers, table and chairs, large sun umbrella with amazing view of the ocean, fireplaces and plenty of room. They also have 1 & 2 Bedroom villas. This resort should totally be in the Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous. We were treated like royality the entire time we were here. Went to the spa 2 days and the facilities are outstanding. Their services were top notch. The relaxation room was large and comfy. They also will bring you

We stayed here for only 1 night and were thoroughly dazzled.  The setting is gorgeous and we loved that it's not a typical hotel set-up.  After we checked in, we were taken to our villa/room.  It was California elegance at its finest.  The room was huge with a great view of the ocean.  There was a great seating area, fireplace, a king bed with wonderful linens and even slippers set out for each of us. We had dinner that night at the Coliseum Pool & Grill.  Our waiter was wonderful; the meal was delish!  We highly recommend this wonderful property!

This has to be the best hotel in at least the continental US. My husband and I have stayed at this hotel at least ten times.  It is a wonderful place that is perfect in every way.  Yes, it is pricey....but you definitely get what you pay for.  We have stayed in both the normal rooms and the villas.  The villas are great if you are traveling with families or a group.   Everything is superb and I can not even think of any complaints!   We can not wait to be back there soon!

Summary Heading: Italian elegance with a California view
Summary: My wife an I spent a few days in Beverly Hills before driving up to Pelican Hill. Everthing was perfect. From the moment we walked in the room we thought "have we been upgraded?" The room was more than spacious, with a good size deck with two loungers in the sun. The property is expensive so there is some walking, but who minds in this weather? My wife went to the spa, which she described as one of the best, and I golfed a few times at one of their two courses. Also very nice. It is a place that you would need a car for as most of the shopping and restaurants are not in walking distncae, but I would highly recommend this place, especially for a couples getaway. We'll be back if we can.

Gorgeous architecture and layout, coupled with unrivaled views of the Pacific Ocean, this is our new favorite hotel on the West Coast.  Impeccable service, beautiful rooms, there is nothing here that we could suggest improvement on.  Loved every minute of our stay!

We stayed here in June 2012 for 4 nights. Our ocean view bungalow was nice  and the pool was beautiful. We spent most of our time away from the hotel at Disney so you would think we shouldn't run into many issues.   When we arrived we asked the front desk how much breakfast allowance we had for our bed and breakfast package and the girl told us that we can order any 2 breakfast we want each morning at any value which did not make any sense since there is a different range in price for different breakfast. Later we spoke to another staff and they told us the correct answer which is 30.00 per person.   After we checked in the front desk told us one of the guys outside will guide us to our bungalow in their golf cart so we went outside and one of the guys told us someone will come
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback about your stay with us last summer. I’m delighted to read that you enjoyed your Bungalow and the pool, but I am disappointed that your service experience was less than perfect.  Please know that I have followed up with the management teams of each department you mentioned to ensure that your comments are considered carefully, as we continuously strive to heighten the guest experience throughout the Resort.  Once again, I apologize that the service you encountered during your visit fell short of your expectations and our goals. I kindly thank you for sharing your candid feedback. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you in the future.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The resort at Pelican Hill is a stunning property. It is exquisitely built and offers beautiful views from almost everywhere on the property. My husband and I stayed for Valentine's Day weekend and had a wonderful time. Our bungalow was private and lovely. The bathroom is spacious and the beds are extremely comfortable. We're not huge golfers so we were a little disappointed that there were no tennis facilities on the property. One other draw back is that you have to take a shuttle to the beach. The resort makes up for this by offering hourly shuttles to and from but its still not as convenient as being beach side. Overall we have a wonderful trip, food was amazing at all the restaurants at Pelican Hill and the spa was a wonderfully relaxing experience.

Physically, this is an absolutely beautiful place.  The staff are wonderfully friendly also. However, the resort suffers from a serious lack of attention to detail.  Some examples - we were presented with a welcome gift of a fruit plate.  A very nice gesture, but it arrived at our room at 9:30pm, almost six hours after we checked in and shortly after my wife went to bed.  We had a nice 40" flat screen tv with Bose audio system, but only one speaker worked.  The housekeeping staff was very friendly, but after taking the used washcloths, they didn't replace them. We had to park far away from our bungalow one night because the spots near to it were full with valeted cars from the restaurant. I had a very good BLT one night, but only after being on hold with room service for over
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent stay with us. While I’m delighted to read you enjoyed Resort accommodations and interaction with our gracious staff, I sincerely regret that the service you encountered during your visit fell short of your expectations and our goals.  In consideration of your detailed feedback, I have personally followed up with the management teams of each department you have mentioned here. I understand your level of disappointment and appreciate you taking the time to post your thoughts as we continuously strive to heighten the guest experience throughout the Resort.  Once again, I kindly thank you for providing your candid feedback and we look forward to another opportunity to serve you in the future.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: Finally, a resort that lives up to its promises, they deliver perfection on a silver platter. Everything about this resort is the best of the best. They beat out every other resort I have ever stayed at. The pool is one of a kind, tranquil and gorgeous; it sounds, feels and looks as if you are floating off into the horizon above the ocean. The bungalows are divine, quiet, spacious and luxurious; every one with a spectacular view in which you have complete privacy. The staff is wonderfully attentive and personable – you couldn’t ask for more. That is why I return every year!

I stayed in a two bedroom villa from February 9 through February 15, 2013. The villa was extremely comfortable. The butler, Barry was very accommodating. The entire staff was excellent. I would not hesitate to go back. I also stayed in the Four Seasons Scottsdale and Ritz Carlton Palm Beach. Pelican Hill was the best out of the three. I would rate them Pelican Hill First Four Seasons Second and Ritz Carlton a very distant third.

I stayed here this past Saturday at a bungalow suite to celebrate my husbands birthday. We had the best resort experience ever.  I don't know why anyone would give a rating less than 5 for this resort.  Every thing you can think of of what you would expect of a 5 star resort they had. The thing that stood out the most, amongst a lot of others, was service. Everyone that worked had a great attitude, with happy smiles, willing and ready to make our stay the most pleasant.   We were amazed on how beautiful this resort is. We at the Coliseum grill and had beer, salads, and sandwiches. It was just a perfect lunch with great service and a spectacular view of the beach.  Our room was so cozy. Loved the comfy bedding and dreamy pillows. Loved the flat screen, surround sound, luxurious

Summary Heading: Perfection missed at this luxury retreat
Summary: Overall, I have always been a big fan of the Resort at Pelican Hill. The location is superb, amenities top-notch and rooms a nice retreat. The staff here are also tremendously helpful and nice. I just finished a stay here recently and was disappointed in my stay only because as I went to take a shower this morning, there was a clump of dried hair stuck in the corner. I was a little repulsed, felt that I was in an unsanitary shower and did not expect this type of an oversight from such a luxurious property. While I overall think this property is great, I was and am disappointed at this lack of cleanliness.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent stay with us. I am disappointed to read that your experience was less than perfect, especially knowing that you have enjoyed visiting Pelican Hill so much in the past.  It is our highest priority to deliver cleanliness throughout the Resort and I apologize for the unfortunate oversight you encountered. Please know this is the exception, not the rule, and I have taken the time to follow up with our housekeeping management team to address the concerns you have kindly detailed here.   As we continuously strive to heighten service levels throughout the Resort, your thoughtful feedback is valued. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: went to the bar and spa
Summary: Wonderful hotel, Staff is A.T.  The spa was great the bar looking over at the mountains was beautiful. Staff could not be nicer. This hotel better then the Ritz or Four Seasons. Spa was great clean and they knew what they where doing.

Stayed in a double queen bed bungalow for 3 nights while on business. The grounds of the hotel is very large, and depending where your room is located, require a car/golf cart to get around (parking was convenient; spaces right outside the room). The pool and cabanas are absolutely beautiful, as is the spa. Service was, for the most part, excellent. The only recommendation that I would make to the hotel is the front desk service. On the day that I checked in (2/4), the gentleman assisting me at the front desk was not overly hospitable, did not attempt to engage me, and did not try to explain the property, the location of the pool, spa, where breakfast is served, what the hotel offered, etc. Standard stuff at other luxury properties, and given the size of the hotel itself,

We are currently staying at the Pelican Hill resort in Newport Beach, CA.  We have a bungalow overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  I was hoping for a room that faced the afternoon sun which #227 has just this plus the view.   It is very nice.  It has a nice large deck with lounge chairs to catch some California sun.  I have walked down to the Crystal Cove State Park each morning for a very relaxing walk on the beach.  The park is located exactly 1 mile from our bungalow.  The walk back up to our bungalow is all up hill but it is a good workout.     I mentioned to our bartender at the Colieseum bar that our mini fridge in our room was in need of getting restocked and i asked him who I should call for this.  He immediately took it upon himself to call for us and take care of it.  When

This is a magnificent property and the service levels on the property are very good.  The only thing I would advise is to keep expectations in line when booking an "OCEAN VIEW" room.  We were assigned room #104 which is closest to the top (right by the entrance gate) and thus the view is at best, a partial ocean view (in the distant corner).  When we commented back on the website comment form, we never heard back.  Finally, upon receiving numerous promotional emails, I finally had to call and ask why we never heard back from the comment form which was submitted TWICE.  No real good answer.  They apologized...offered us an upgrade the next time we chose to visit.    Just keep expectations in line when it comes to the view.  They don't categorize their rooms as partial or full
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit. I’m delighted to hear that you enjoyed our Italian seaside village along the coast of Newport Beach, but regret that your accommodations did not meet your expectations.  I understand your disappointment in the communication from our staff and have taken the time to personally follow up with our team to address your concerns.   Once again, I regret that your Bungalow stay was less than perfect and appreciate you taking the time to post your candid feedback. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you. Please contact me directly if I could be of assistance as you plan your next visit.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: In my travels you come across rare and exceptional sites occasionally.  I wish it was more often, but when you find one - it is a treasure.   The Resort at Pelican Hill is such a treasure.   Simple elegance.  Huge rooms with vaulted ceilings, bose speakers, huge deep bathtub and all the extras of a Fine, Fine resort.   And then the staff does all the extras, such as calls when you arrive, always knowing your name, calling to wish you on your way when you leave.  Every staff member went above and beyond without even asking.   The view is incredible and makes your visit to the Laguna/Newport area a treat.

The Pelican Hill resort is set on a hillside rising above the Pacific Coast Highway in Newport Beach.   The rooms are spacious with beautiful views.  The waitstaff is attentive to every need and the food at the hotel is wonderful.  There are shuttle services that will take you promptly to the Pelican Grill or the golf course.  When at the main resort you are treated to views of the 18th hole of the golf course or looking out to the Pacific you can see the Catalina Island rising from the mist.  The setting, service and facilities make this a total experience worth repeating.

Just not enough positive things to say.   Even without the incredible views and accommodations (large rooms)  I would have provided a positive review on the service alone.   Highly suggest other hotel chains send some managers to this hotel so they can learn how easy it is to do the little things that make a difference. If you have been on a high-end cruised I would compare the service to that.  Just some minor examples of the service difference:  Personalized call at beginning and end of the stay. An employee sees trash on the ground they walk over to other side of the road to pick it up. Shuttle drivers say high to folks waling on the side of the road during the evening. Shuttle driver stops and asks if you need a ride All staff smiling and say Hello when you walk by. Towel

We got an amazing Hotwire rate for the resort and stayed in a bungalow king. Everything about the property is superior. Rooms are huge, 847 sq ft with huge bathrooms, great in-room amenities, and even with our Hotwire rate, they gave us an ocean view bungalow. You drive to your bungalow and park your car in front of it, which was handy for coming and going.   The pool itself is a destination, it's HUGE and one of the most beautiful pools you'll see. We loved dining in the Coliseum Grill overlooking the pool, then the golf course, then the Pacific. Even though the resort is across PCH from the ocean, sitting there and looking at it, it seems to be "right there."  Service was exceptional, everyone was so friendly and went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed.

This is by far one of the best  hotels I have ever seen.  From the minute we arrived and were taken to our suite ( 2 large rooms with see thru fireplace) until we left , service and amenities  were perfect.  The bed linens are so comfortable; and the view terrific.  Be sure to take in the spa  and dining outside by the pool.  Car service is immediately available whenever you call.  They also have 2 bedroom villas available  for rent.

Summary Heading: The best hotel I have ever stayed in
Summary: We were towards the end of a long holiday in the USA and ready to return home to Australia but had the last 2 nights booked at the pelican hill resort. We arrived and as we had booked through centurion card got an upgrade to a 3 bed villa overlooking the ocean. It was beautiful, extremely well appointed, fireplace, fabulous beds and linens etc etc. the weather was perfect and the pools at the hotel and villa club great. The most amazing thing about the hotel is the service - the best I have ever experienced. There are so many staff and they are all completely ' on it' I had to take a coffee back ( as we had left it to go cold - totally our fault) and the manager came straight back to see me to check what the problem was.  Brilliant restaurants, fantastic service, such friendly

We spent our Christmas holiday in a 2 bedroom villa with friends and loved it! High end kitchen appliances, extremely comfortable beds and furniture. We had the gas fireplace on daily. Two Huge baths with separate bath and huge shower and a powder room. Plus a garage and washer/dryer. We were minutes from restaurants and shopping. And we had a view of the Pacific Ocean below.  It is definitely on my list of favorite hotels!

Ocean view, number of restaurants with all different cuisine. Has a circular Coliseum Pool, Sunset view is just too good. One can take walk of one Km to the beach to do surfing,sunbathing, secinic walking trails, bird watching. Pure relaxation

1. Beautiful, expansive resort.  I love that you can wander around the property.  If you don't like to walk they have people who will pick you up in a car and take you anywhere you need. 2. Rooms are awesome.  I could see the sunset/ocean from the bath. 3. Service - Overall great service.  We had to wait a little bit to get checked in and then they came by one too many times (a call, and three people stopping by).  But everyone was really friendly and easy to talk to. 4. Spa - oh beautiful and wonderful.  It's expensive, as you would expect from a first class spa 5. The restaurant - great food, expect to spend $200+ for a dinner here. 6. Value - I actually think this is a pretty good value for the large room and great service. 7. Location - amazing views but it is set back from

We stayed in a villa over New Year's.  Fantastic.  This is truly the nicest place to stay one of the country's nicest spots.  Much better than the nearby Ritz, where we've also spent some time - this just has a much more resort-like feel.  Great service, great amenities, garage with washer/dryer, amazing views, beautiful pool area, just all around fantastic.  Every meal we ate on site was delicious.  Will absolutely return.

This is an amazing property.  The rooms are well appointed and the staff was fantastic.  Only a few items I would note: the heater in our room was not adequate to heat the room, we cranked it all the way to 82 degrees but the room itself was never above 68 degrees and the bathroom was ice cold.  I also felt the shower lacked water pressure.  As for their coffee machine, I am not a fan of the idea of a coffee  machine where I need to ground the beans to brew a pot of coffee couldn't they just get those nice Kcup machines?   I was so worried I would screw up the coffee that I did not want to waste paying the $10 for the beans so I walked to the coffee shop in the lobby or drove to Starbucks in town.  (this is not a huge deal to everyone but I am a huge coffee drinker).  The only

Summary Heading: Great (not perfect) but still highly recommended
Summary: Sabina and I were in OC for some meetings and decided to stay (for the 3rd time) at Pelican Hill.  We reserved through AMEX/Fine Hotels and Resorts so we got an upgrade to a HUGE Bungalow Suite so that was pretty great (AMEX does a great job)!  There were a couple of places where PH fell short this time and they were: 1. service relating to the shuttles that are supposed to come and pick you up and take you around the property - it was 5 calls and 25 minutes of waiting before we gave up on our shuttle to take us to dinner (Andrea (amazing - see review)) and 2.  service relating to us missing our reservation because of the shuttle delay - they made us wait an additional 10-15 minutes once we did arrive.  The two incidents aside, the resort really is amazing - views, rooms,

Truly world-class resort in every sense.  We were upgraded from a 2BR to a 3BR oceanfront villa, which we shared with another couple, and it was stunning. I thought that the service, accommodations, quality, cleanliness and value were better than Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton resorts.  The golf was great, the pools were stunning, the restaurants were good.  It was a perfect 4 night stay.

Summary Heading: Amazing resort, golf, spa and more
Summary: This is a fabulous property! The rooms are large and beautiful. The two golf courses are everything one would want in a championship layout. The dining is far above average. And the spa is beautiful not to mention the pool, grounds and service.  While some may complain about the rooms being away from the pool and main building I rather enjoyed that and there is free shuttle service if you don't want to take the short walk to these facilities. Great location just a short ride to the beach and near to other restaurants and shops.

It took me a little while to figure out why this resort was so nice.  It is owned by Donald Bren who is worth a cool 13 billion!!!  Service, room, and view is unreal!!!  I definitely would like to go back and visit!!!

We stayed at the Pelican Hill in the Villas section in September 2012. Our 3 bedroom villa was just amazing, I could've moved in and stay there forever. We have three bedroom, each with it's own full bathroom. One master bedroom with a king, one with two queens and a smaller one with one queen. There is a full kitchen with subzero appliances and everything you need to cook a full meal. You also get a 2 car private garage that has a washer and dryer. The view of the ocean, while not directly on the ocean was very nice. We had lunch at the Villa clubhouse. While it was good, it took over an hour to get our paninis...   The pool is very nice and very private, only the villa renters are allowed in this section of the resorts, while everyone (including Villa renters) has access to

I booked this as a golf weekend for my husband and our anniversary.  We stayed two nights and had a wonderful time.  He had golf lessons for two days and for the first time said he was tired of golf!  But that didn't last for long.  The courses are beautiful and the golf pro, Glenn,  was generous with his coaching and golf tips.  My husband enjoyed the lessons and would do a shorter lesson the next time.  The resort is just beautiful with just about anything you could want.  We started our stay with a couple of massages which was wonderful.  The locker room was well equiped and very organized.   The waiting room was very mellow and provided teas and waters with some things to nibble on.  The masseuse was small but very strong, got a great massage.  Our room was very comfortable

We stayed for 2 days around 17 Dec mainly for the golf. This is a real luxury resort, not cheap but is quite outstanding. We thought the golf was amongst the best courses we have played in the USA..very scenic..both courses were difficult and thanks to our fantastic caddy CHris our scores were respectable. The golf is expensive but worth it. Had an excellent meal in the signature restaurant. All in all a great place....we will be back.

My stay at The Resort at Pelican Hill was 5 star! From the greeting to the extra care that all the staff provided. All the amenities were wonderful and the room was pristine. The extras they offer just kept coming. I loved the shuttle service to all the different destinations within the resort. Made my entire visit 'care free'.

The villa was wonderful.  Most of the staff had excellent training. Check out was a bit odd, as if they hadn't been expecting anyone to leave that day - no doorman, front desk was a bit flustered.  The food was fabulous.  We had to wait over 30 minutes for our villa to be ready, which was a little boring - not much to do in the villa lobby other than a TV set to sports.  Staff never asked if we would like a drink when we were waiting despite the fact we were clearly staying there and they were asking other guests.  Never made it over to the main resort as there was never any need!  Beautiful property, very well kept.  Could have easily stayed longer if we hadn't been heading to Disney.

My family and I stayed in the Villas at Pelican Hill on 12/23-12/29. The resort is beautiful , the golf course outstanding and the Spa services were excellent . In addition , the location is excellent with a 10 minute drive to Laguna .However , the first couple of days felt like we were on Candid Camera just waiting for the TV cameras to arrive to surprise us . Our spa reservations , 3 of us , were confirmed for 4pm but when we arrived two of our reservations were randomly rescheduled for 5pm - no big deal but we did alter our plans to arrive on time . The same evening I called to arrange for a trip to Disneyland and was informed that someone would call me back in 5 minutes and I never received a call . We proceeded to dinner for our 8pm confirmed reservation for 5 people and
Manager Response: Richard,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent experience with us. I appreciate your kind comments about the Villas, spa and golf, but sincerely regret that your experiences with reservations, dining and housekeeping fell short of your expectations and our goals.  As you mentioned, it is the highest priority of our dedicated staff to be helpful and nice, while striving to deliver the best possible experience to each and every guest. It was our pleasure to remove unsatisfactory items from your bill in consideration of the oversights you encountered.  Although I am disappointed to read that your visit was less than perfect, I sincerely appreciate you sharing your comments here. We certainly look forward to another opportunity to serve you.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We traveled to LA during Christmas and booked 5 nights at the Omni hotel downtown which was closer to everything we wanted to get to but after 3 nights, we decided to cancel the two remaining nights and stay at the Pelican hill resort. As soon as I stepped inside the lobby, I felt like I was home. We were greeted with smiles and were immediately asked if we needed assistance. I booked my stay through AMEX platinum and was immediately upgraded without hassle. After getting the room keys, we were immediately assisted to our room by the staff ( not just giving us the directions to our room but led to in a hotel vehicle)  We opened the door to the hotel room and headed straight to the outside to enjoy the ocean view room. I felt after being 4 days in LA that I was finally on my

We stayed with our five grown up children at a 4 br villa for 5 nights and had a great time, everything at the villa was first class and convenient, spacious, cozy,view, confortable, good and solicitous personell. The food at the restaurants is a bit expensive, but you have the full kitchen to fix breakfast and warm up take outs for dinner as a family, which made the trip a wonderfull get toghether. Pelican Hill is very well comunicated and Newport is a great place for a vacation with the John Wayne Airport so near. With out a question the best place we have stayed.

Is there any coastline in the U.S. more posh than Newport?...of course, where there is posh there typically follows pretense....fair trade-off I think....in any case, we (meaning me) planned a family vacation here, "family" being defined as a place where Dad can play world-class golf...so my wife was quietly pleased and wisely kept it to herself with the irony of me injuring my back badly enough just prior to leaving CO that all tee times were cancelled....I could hear the golf Nazi shouting "NO GOLF FOR YOU!!"....so properly medicated, I resigned myself to enjoying the other amenities of Pelican Hill, not all that difficult...a couple of kudos and complaints...the "villa" we booked through AMEX travel was not what I'd call a "villa" but that's a semantic issue, I suppose...a

Summary Heading: Bring your wallet and a shower cap
Summary: The North Villas offer a stunning view of the ocean from a high vantage point. We stayed in a 2 BR villa. It was a large space with very ample bedrooms, washer and dryer, a small open kitchen, a living room/dining room combo and a large outdoor space facing the spectacular view of the Pacific. The furnishings are especially plush and the bed may be even more comfortable than the Four Seasons!  We did have a problem with the heating system and it took two calls to the engineer before it was fixed. Lighting in the bathrooms was very dim and really didn't have good light until the daytime when daylight supplemented the weak interior lighting.  The toiletries are top of the line with exquisite scents and rich emollients. But if you need to keep your hair dry when you take a shower

Summary Heading: The most scenic and beautiful place in Newport Beach, CA
Summary: There are several restaurants at Pelican HIlls.  The food is always great.  The decor beautiful, the bathrooms beautiful, the pool incredible, and many restaurants to choose from.  Go for a family brunch, a couples romantic dinner, or bring out of town guests.  You will NEVER BE Disappointed.  Always wonderful and gorgeous gingerbread trees throughout Christmas.

Summary Heading: Everything about Tea at Pelican is Wonderful!
Summary: I have had High Tea at Pelican Resort three or four times with my girlfriends and always had a wonderful experience. I'm sure guys may like this but it's definitely a girl thing!  The tea selection is varied -- something for every taste, and it's fresh, not "Lipton." The food is petite but tasty and complimentary to the teas. A reminder for those looking for more substantial food, it's not supposed to be a meal. The view is spectacular and the lounge very cozy. The servers are excellent and refill the hot water constantly. I highly recommend this for some girlfriend time!

Spent 2 nights in a 3 bedroom villa and played both North and South golf courses.  The Resort was quiet, understandable considering we were there during the week in early December.  It's an immense place; you need a vehicle to get around the property.  The North course was nice, but I much preferred the South course.  More scenic, more character.  Ate at the Pelican Grill one night and was really impressed with all the Middle Eastern food on the menu!  Did a pretty faithful job too.  Service was quite good overall.  Only complaints were small issues.  Very poor water pressure in all but one shower in the villa, for example.  Also, lights would randomly cut out at times.  While a great experience, the Resort is not a value proposition; you pay through the nose.

I went on my work retreat to this resort.  My very generous boss takes our office staff and significant others on a vacation weekend each year and spoils us rotten.  I am not complaining by ANY means, but we have had amazing opportunities to stay at the best of the best and this place didn't quite hit the mark for me.  While the grounds and golf course are beautiful, there was nothing special about the bungalows (which were simply hotel rooms) and were kind of "meh".  The resort is large and very detached.  You have to call an on-site car service to take you to various places around the property, especially if you are dressed for dinner and in very tall heels.  The pool area is amazing with spectacular views and the service is top notch. I don't have anything to report in the

This hotel was really amazing...just for anyone wanting to stay there, it's not your typical hotel where you check-in at the lobby walk a few feet the elevator and there is your room. This place is not your average hotel experience...it's like living in a luxury gated community. The rooms are like oversized guest houses like 800 sq. feet...and this was a startup room.. I was in an ocean view bungalow room at it was great, there was my own parking space right in front of my room which was great and the room was awesome...in comparison to any other hotel, I'm sure you would be hard pressed to find larger rooms that this...for a 5 star property, you get a room double the size at the same price of a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons. Staff was really nice & helpful. Room Service lady

We recently enjoyed a five night stay at this gorgeous resort. We stayed in a bungalow which was absolutely amazing. The Coliseum pool was outstanding and the service everywhere was excellent.  The only down side was the greeting we received upon arrival at the resort. The chief parking attendant was incredibly rude to us and asked how he could help us! We were obviously checking in but he did not welcome us and made us feel very uncomfortable.  The front desk staff were not very efficient either, the bellman Jesus was amazing and made up for all the others!!! We were given a room with no view at all even though we had paid for a sea view room but Jesus helped us! We also had a problem with our final account and had to involve the manager but we got there in the end!!!

Summary Heading: Wow! Best hotel I have ever had the pleasure of staying.
Summary: The rooms at the Resort are unbelievable and very interesting. I have not stayed in a hotel where you are able to take a bath and then open the wooden shutters onto the bedroom. The area outside of your room is a perfect place to relax as well as have a few cocktails outside of your room. The breakfast buffet is unbelievable and every item is so fresh. The service is outstanding from the obvious joy the workers have spending time with the guests. David at the Pelican Grill is outstanding and he provided our group with such great insight and information on the food and how they prepared it. Make sure you ask for him as he will make sure you feel as if you are home.  Also, make sure you visit the spa while you are there as the massage I received was so refreshing. Aromatic massage

Summary Heading: Beautiful Resort, Nice Staff, Looks Like a Planned Community
Summary: Just got home yesterday.  I was there for Thanksgiving weekend with family.  The resort was beautiful, the staff was extremly helpful and kind to all the children ages 6-16 (loved our waiter at the Pelican Grill). Would stay there again but my 3 minor complaints are the shower head was really bad, the "butler" was never seen except at check-in (so don't advertise a butler if they aren't really around or never ask if you need anything) and the kitchen cabinet door handles could have been wiped down (grimy), along with the handles in the bathroom and dresser drawers.

Well, Pelican Hill may now be the #1 resort according to Conde Nast, but they have become more than complacent in their service.  Butlers for every villa, whatever for?  Ours was not seen nor heard from again once he'd taken his initial $30. tip.  And we discovered shortly after he left that our mini bar in the premium kitchen had been vandalized and looted!  He hadn't even bothered to check that the bare minimums were on hand for his new arrivals! The keyed lock had been roughly  gouged out with some sharp instrument, apparently by someone desperate to steal the liquor!  Inside was mostly bare space where snacks should have been.  When we summoned someone to fix the lock, they left no new key.    In our one-week villa stay, our mini bar was not replenished once.  We stocked the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit.  I sincerely regret that your experience with butler service, honor bar and dining was less than perfect.   Rest assured, the circumstances you encountered are the exception, and not the rule. I have personally taken this opportunity to address your concerns with leaders in each of the areas detailed in your review.  Once again, I am sorry to read that your Villa stay fell short of your expectations and our goals. I appreciate you providing your candid feedback and invite you to contact me directly, should you wish to discuss your experience further.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Place to celebrate a very special event
Summary: My husband and I were looking for a resort to celebrate a special occasion and birthday.  We found Pelican Hill and couldn't have been happier.  First, the "bungalows" are beautiful and feel very luxurious.  Ours had a beautiful ocean view, two fireplaces and was almost as big as a modest size house.  The service from the staff was exceptional, and both the golf and spa were as  lovely as advertised.  The place is definitely expensive, but was just a perfect spot for the special occasion. The weather was nice, but a little too cool for swimming in their huge circular pool, set in a colliseum and protected from the wind.  All of the restaurants were also great, so there is no need to leave the property for a long weekend.  We did use the shuttle to visit Crystal Cove State Park

Our stay at Pelican Hill was beautiful. We arrived and after check-in, they show you how to drive to your villa. The room was gorgeous and the view is beautiful. You feel like you in Tuscany. The only bad thing in the room was the shower head, it was really bad with the worst water pressure ever. And no hand-held shower head. It really didn't match the rest of the opulent bathroom. The breakfast delivered on our terrace was amazing. The coliseum pool is fabulous with very good service. The lunch menu is ok but not great. We drove one day to Laguna beach which is fun. We went to Sol Cocina for dinner one night and it was excellent. As well as Pizzeria Mozza. My husband loved both golf course at the resort, said it was amazing. We would definitely come back.

I just returned from four nights at the Pelican Hill Resort.  I went to Newport Beach to visit family and was told that this would be a beautiful place to stay, right on the Pacific.  Our spacious room with a large terrace hovered over lush greenery with a breathtaking view of the ocean.  Everyone on the staff was helpful and greeted you by name and with a smile.  The food was excellent at all of the restaurants.  We enjoyed breakfast each morning overlooking probably the most magnificent pool I have ever seen which also had a view over dunes to the ocean.  While I am not a golfer, i couldn't help but notice how inviting the course looked, but also quite challenging with hills and valleys and the ocean.  Unfortunately, the weather was most uncooperative but it gave me hours in

Summary Heading: Come on people, this property looks and feels like the burbs
Summary: I live very close to the resort, and after many many bike rides thru the property, I read that Pelhill received the 1 ranking in my favorite travel magazine.  I never really like the Suburban street vibe of the property, but thought I must be missing something and should drive the 1 mile to Pelhill on 4 wheels and check out the hype.  I rented a very nice second floor suite. After about an hour, I wanted to go home.  -  check in process was lackluster and very cold. Umm, I'm not bad looking, why do you not want to look at me front desk lady?  I have a nice car, why is valet asking about dinner ressies and bugging me about if anyone else will be joining me during my stay? R u kidding me? What business is this of yours? I had the feeling they thought I was a low spender. Um, check
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit.  I understand your perspective and sincerely regret that your experience was less than perfect.  For locals and Resort guests alike, we aim is to deliver exceptional experiences and the finest in anticipative service, which includes inquiring about guests’ interest in dining reservations, special occasions, accommodations for additional members of your party and much more. I sincerely apologize if our staff’s offers of assistance fell short of your expectations and our goals.  The design and vision of the Resort, brought to life after decades of detailed planning, is crafted in the style of the Italian Renaissance and intended to be timeless, aesthetically pleasing and a seamless fit within the master planned community of Newport Coast.  The unprecedented attention to detail throughout the Resort has set us apart as one of the world’s finest Resorts.  As you mentioned, Pelican Hill has been recognized with top national and global accolades from Condé Nast Traveler and many others since opening in 2008. I understand if the design concept and style of the Resort does not match your personal preference.  Once again, I appreciate you providing your candid feedback and invite you to contact me directly, should you wish to discuss your visit further.   Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We've stayed at Pelican Hill for weekend getaways twice now and we're addicted.  Unbelievable grounds and view, even though you are a ways back from the ocean.  Great staff, and always great service.  The tasting menu at Andrea is wonderful and we had terrific waiters both times.  We really enjoy spending evenings in the Great Room listening to Adam Michaelson; the Andrea menu is available in there if you ask.  The spa is also a highlight; the couples hot stone massage followed by the aromatic will relax and re-charge body and mind.  The Coliseum pool is spectacular, pleanty of lounges, some in the shade but most out in the open. Service there has always been good and breakfast overlooking the pool with the ocean in the background doesn't get much better.  Go.

Summary Heading: Fabulous villa with impeccable service and amenities.
Summary: Pelican Hill is the type of resort that makes you feel welcome whether you are staying for one night, a week or a month. Service was excellent and always helpful. The villas are perfect for our family and give us just the right amount of homeyness while still making us feel like we are in a hotel. I highly recommend this hotel. We will be going back again next summer.

Summary Heading: Pelican Hill Resort is the ULTIMATE!
Summary: You will never be more impressed by a resort in the US.  This property is AMAZING, the setting is amazing.  The rooms are amazing, the staff is amazing and the food is extremely amazing.  It's expensive but worth it! The Pelican Grill is one of the eateries on the property and it's exquisite. The restaurant overlooking the pool, which is HUGE has excellent food as well.  It's will be perhaps the best resort you will ever stay in.

Summary Heading: Nice but not amazing - not quite 5-star
Summary: This is an interesting property that surprised me due to it's ratings.  This property is a 5-star that should really be a 4-star. Understand that I am comparing this to other 5-star properties I have stayed in.  I was extremely surprised that both Andrew Harper and Conde Nast voted this property a #1.  Let me say I had very high expectations for the property, room, service, food and golf.  They disappointed me in every way except the golf.  We drove in to the resort.  The view from the lobby is of the lovely circular pool and the ocean in the distance. Valet service extraordinary - so fast that they whisked the car off before I could get my phone out of the car! There is no complimentary welcome beverage, glass of water or tour. We were just told at 2pm that our room was not
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent visit. I’m delighted to read that you enjoyed our golf experience, but sincerely regret that your stay and dining experiences were less than perfect.  I understand your level of disappointment and have taken the time to follow up with the appropriate managers about the comments you kindly detailed here.  As you mentioned in your review, we offer complimentary transportation around the expansive 504-acre property and to the adjacent beach at Crystal Cove, located just a few minutes from the Resort. While it is possible to walk to the Golf Shop, beach, pool and restaurants, we provide complimentary coach service for guests’ convenience. Pelican Hill also provides complimentary parking, Internet access and no added Resort fees for spa, pool and fitness center access.  Once again, I am sorry to read that your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. Should you wish to discuss your visit further, I invite you to contact me directly. As we continuously strive to heighten the guest experience at Southern California’s top-ranked resort, I kindly thank you for providing your candid feedback.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: The Villas at The Resort at Pelican Hill are spacious and luxurious.  The 4 bedroom 4 bath ocean view Villa was outstanding in every respect.  The restaurants, spa, pools and golf course are not to be missed.  Adjacent to the resort are many first class shopping opportunities.  The Resort is only 35 miles from LAX and is great fun bringing family and friends.

We stayed here with several other couples on a "retreat" a few weeks ago. The bungalows are amazingly large with every amenity you could ever want. The property itself is gorgeous and our room had an beautiful room overlooking the ocean (though quite a long ways away). There are "guest cars" (black Cadillac Escalades) available for free guest transportation throughout the property and the majority of staff went way over and above what we expected. The men golfed and everyone was very impressed with the golf course as well as with the "caddy" that was assigned to each group of golfers. NICE PLACE!

5 star property with outstanding views of the Pacific Ocean.  We stayed in a King room- spacious with beautiful view of the ocean - around Rm #400.  Shuttle provided down the hill to lobby or spa- but totally enjoyed walking back to the room each night.  Great area to walk right from the hotel- @3-4miles to Corona Del Mar public park by ocean and easy 2 miles walk on sidewalk the other way along residential/condo area.  Newport Beach rocky and dirty- but park path paved and very nice.  Conceirge service was terrible - to say the least.  We we're trying to arrange a private dinner party at Andrea's and they consistently NEVER returned emails or phone calls.  The party turned off without a hitch- pasta amazing, but rest of food overrated for the price. Golf - very expensive- but

I attended a  wedding at the Pelican Hills a couple of months ago and must say I was very disappointed with the property.  There  is nothing special about this resort as I  have seen and stayed at much more beautiful resorts around the world.  I do agree with the other reviews regarding "lack of character" and quite frankly, I also don't understand all the hype.  The food quality served at the wedding was good but nothing exceptional.      I do hope they make all the necessary changes to get customer service to an exceptional level.

Summary Heading: One of the best we have had the pleasure to stay!
Summary: We had just dropped off our youngest daughter to UCSD to start college.  We decided to take a litte down time and relaxtion for ourselves and start our journey as empty nesters so we drove one and half hours from La Jolla to this little paradise in the sun.  Oh my! Well, what a wondeful surprise upon our arrival to this fabulous resort.  From the time we checked in everything was perfect.  This is truly one great place.  It has the largest circular pool in the world.....the restauants were also excellent no to mention the great ocean views. Something interesting is they not only do they have single rooms where we stayed WITH a wonderful patio where we had breakfast.  BUT also there are two, three and four bedroom villas for rent, great for families; Seven days for as long as you

This hotel property is amazing.  The customer service from the front desk, to housekeeping, to room service is really very high end.  My only word of caution is with respect to the view.  Given that this property is very close to the ocean you might think that the rooms will all have a decent view -- no so.  If ocean view is important to you be sure to ask.  Our wonderful suite had a view of bushes, not even a glimpse of the ocean or horizon from where we were.

I just stayed for one night at the Resort this past weekend and this is what I thought about it.   Check in- When we pulled up to Valet they took my car to a waiting area beacause after you check-in you get escorted (Follow an employee driving a Golf Cart) to your parking spot. From the spot he loaded our bags in the golf cart and drove us to our room.   The room - beautiful and spacious. I booked a Bungalow with 2 queen beds, ocean view. The "ocean view" was lacking as this property is NOT right on the water. The ocean can be seen in the far distance. So if your expecting waves to be crashing at your balcony, this is not the place. The room had a fireplace, a nice sitting area, high ceilings and a very spaciuos balcony. The beds were very comfortable, the room was very clean-

Spent 4 nights at Pelican Hill in a 3 bedroom Villa. The villa was outstanding - large rooms, huge bathrooms, full kitchen. Each bedroom had it's own large screen TV. Even larger TV and fireplace in Living Room. Large private patio with a stunning view of the sun setting over Catalina. They even had milk, orange juice, cereal, 4 bottles of beer, and bottle water to get you started. Service was spectacular -  From Check-in, the pool, the restaurants, housekeeping, valet, all of the hotel staff we encountered were exceptionally nice, and attentive, exactly what you would expect from a 5 Star Resort. Villas have private clubhouse with smaller pool and food service. We played golf on both courses. Views of the Ocean and canyons are spectacular! Both courses are very challenging.

This is one of the most beautiful and well maintained resorts I have ever been to.  The service was impeccable, and everyone remembered my name after helping me one time.  I wish I would have had time to golf - the course looks incredible!  I did get to eat breakfast at The Colosseum, which was the best buffet I have ever experienced.  I also got to spend an hour or so at the pool, which was stunning and had great views!  The rooms were beautiful as well, and I was very impressed with housekeeping.   The spa was very nice as well, I just wish I had more time to enjoy it!

Summary Heading: What getting away is all about
Summary: We frequently spend long weekends at Pelican Hill and at the end of each visit, I find myself booking our next visit. I am addicted!  We usually stay in the Villas and sometimes invite friends or relatives to stay with us. The rooms in the hotel are just as beautiful, however, we enjoy  having the full kitchen, outdoor dining table, and living room to play board games. The coliseum pool is spectacular and service is wonderful. The layout of the entire property is private and the views are gorgeous.  Even a single night there feels like a luxury vacation.  The only drawbacks are that the food at Andrea is not good - we have had a few dinners there and won't return (we haven't gone there during our last five visits) - and the decor in the restaurants and lobby and other public

Summary Heading: I'm often amazed when I stay at 5 star places and see negative reviews. What is wrong with some of you people??
Summary: Three couples decided to sneak off for a night at the PH, and we thought the annual Festa Dell' Autunno was the perfect excuse. Boy, did we choose wisely! The hotel throws an annual three day festival to celebrate their olive harvest. It includes a street festival on site (including finger foods and wine), a delicious outdoor "family style" dinner featuring a selection of italian foods cooked by their reknown chefs, and a fabulous Sunday morning jazz brunch.  We were regaled by opera and pop singers, talented jazz musicians, local artists, a reknown Italian flag tossing troupe, and had to "endure" fascinating stories from our fellow diners during dinner. Did I over-eat? You BETCHA, but who wouldn't when treated this way. It was fabulous! I am a local, and for those that don't

Outstanding 5 Star Property with Service to Match.  The setting is idyllic, on a bluff overlooking a beautiful golf course and the Pacific Ocean in the distance.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom Villa (North Villas--all two bedroom villas are located in the North Villas).  While the location of the Villa was not ideal....(across a busy street from the Villa Clubhouse and the rest of the Resort), the Villa itself was spectacular.  At over 2100 square feet, the bedrooms, bathrooms and living area are all rather expansive, and very well appointed.  Both bathrooms had separate deep soaking tubs and large showers.  The beds were extremely comfortable...hard time getting both my wife and kids out of bed.  The living area is also very nice, large flat screen TV and fireplace and very

For all the hype, this resort just does not live up. Overall the property is stiff, snobby (including most of the staff, and one in particular we ran into), lacks character, and is generally beige and bland. The round pool does not provide any shade unless you pony up for a $500 cabana - that sort of nickel and diming is tacky. The service is miserable, and the food is average. For example, the $14 guacamole appetizer is half an avocado and half an onion mixed together - this just does not cut it for such a highly-rated property.   The spa (at least the women's side) is nice and private, although there is no spa pool which seems common at similar high-end properties. Massage servcices were good, although over-priced for the amenities there.  If you are going to hang out in this
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your visit. I sincerely regret that your experience with us fell short of your expectations and our goals.  In consideration of the detailed feedback you have posted here regarding your experience with service, the pool and the Spa, I have personally followed up with our management teams of each department about the input you have kindly provided.  As you noted in your comments, the Resort design features neutral, natural tones and this understated approach creates a casually elegant seaside setting that many of our guests favor. I understand if this design scheme is not your personal preference.  With the only Five-Star Spa in Newport Beach, Pelican Hill strives to provide our guests with exceptional value across 22,000 square feet of spacious amenities, including luxurious Acqua Colonnades, more than 25 complimentary fitness classes weekly and complimentary valet parking. I am delighted to read that you enjoyed your massage service, but sorry that you felt the value was less than satisfactory.  Should you wish to discuss your experience further, I invite you to contact me directly. As we continuously strive to heighten the guest experience at Southern California’s top-ranked resort, I kindly thank you for providing your candid feedback.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: Luxurious amenities but food quality below average.
Summary: Spent several nights at the Resort at Pelican Hill on several occasions.  Located in prime Newport Beach location.  The scenic view of Golf course and Pacific ocean is stunning.  Room accommodations are luxurious : spacious and well kept.  The major downside is the mediocre quality of the food products offerings.  We tried the restaurant by the pool and room service.  Both were very disappointing.  Simple dishes were undercooked and badly seasoned.  Unacceptable. A resort of this caliber MUST have top tested chef and cooks in order to be taken seriously.  Offering great amenities (Golf, spa, pool...) are not enough to make it a truly memorable experience.   The culinary product line requires a major overhaul in quality and originality in order for this resort to achieve top

Summary Heading: The #1 Resort in America??? No, not even close
Summary: My review is being written a little late considering we stayed August 18-24.  I still wanted to put my two cents in with all the other reviews. I have a son living in Newport Beach, hence the reason for the stay in the area. I kept reading how Pelican Hill was the Number #1 Resort in America - at least that is the way the advertise it. In a word - no. Not even close.  It is an extremely nice property.  The room we stayed in was LARGE and extremely comfortable.  The staff - excellent, with the exception of the front desk!  I got the feeling that I was more of an aggravation then a "welcomed guest".  Maybe it was because we were not in a "Villa"? We stayed in room 356 - once again - VERY NICE.  The place was a bit "stiff".  I am a frequent guest at the Montage (trust me, don't
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your visit. I sincerely regret that your experience with us fell short of your expectations and our goals.  I understand your level of disappointment in your experiences with the front desk, dining and your Bungalow location. In consideration of the detailed feedback you have provided here, I have personally taken the time to follow up with the management of each department about the experiences you have described.  Should you wish to discuss your experience further, I invite you to contact me directly. As we continuously strive to heighten the guest experience at Southern California’s top-ranked resort, I kindly thank you for taking the time to post your candid feedback.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary: We are headed back to Pelican Hill this Thanksgiving after a fabulous trip last year...we felt  very special from the moment we arrived. The service was impeccable in every department, everyday we were there. I have not a single negative comment !  We stayed in the 2 bedroom villa with a full kitchen so we could still have a home cooked Thanksgiving dinner with leftovers. Beds, linens etc were plush...2 car garage and sunny balcony/patio. We do wait for the specials they run several times a year which makes it affordable for our family.

I was there on a girls's golf trip.  We stayed in a Bungalow - very spacious and well-appointed.  Very comfortable beds.  Great service.   This is not a "hotel" property - it's villas and bungalows which makes it special.  YOu need to call for a car or golf cart if you don't want to walk too much (e.g. golf course is across the street and a bit of a hike).  Little things annoyed me as I travel a lot - e.g. $10 for a small bag of coffee beans. For this price, the coffee beans for the in-room coffee maker ought to be included . . .come on Pelican.   Internet was included so that was nice, but to charge $10 for a small bag of beans . ..   Very expensive but very nice.  There are also other greawt options in this area - Dana Point & Laguna.

Summary Heading: The only regret you'll have is not upgrading sooner
Summary: Stayed on a Friday night with a few friends as a small getaway.  Booked a garden bungalow suite (#157 on Via Assisi) and really regretted not getting an ocean view ONLY because I loved the garden bungalow so much.  Service: Impeccable and very impressive. Pulled into the lobby in my little Altima (one day I'll roll in with the Bentley like everyone else) and was greeted very warmly by an attendant. Told him I wanted to grab my keys quickly, since I had another engagement right after check-in. After getting the keys to the room, my car was right where I left it, and another attendant led me up to the room in a golf cart. Even offered to carry my one bag and seemed genuinely interested in helping (and not for the tip!). I also requested a late check-out of 1pm and also it being

Stayed this past weekend for two nights.  The man who checked us in was just OK.  He did not confirm dates of stay or room type and didn't follow certain 'five diamond' standards that I expect an agent at this caliber of resort to hit.  I give the check in process two stars.  The valet who took us to our bungalow made up for his coworker's uninterested attitude. Gave us a run down of the room and some of the amenities and features of the property.  Was a happy, friendly young man and we appreciated him giving us such a warm welcome!  As for the room itself it was beautiful.  Very high, vaulted ceiling and very spacious. Our bungalow had an ocean view and golf course view. :) Pretty grounds that are VERY well taken care of!  The wall outlets were a bit oddly placed.  None near

If your looking for a true indulging weekend get away, pricey but fabulous consider Pelican Hill Villas. We went to get away for a weekend after a very busy summer. As soon as we made our reservation, we were contacted by Jessica Ellis who was so incredibly punctual, patient and HELPFUL. She was flexible with my constantly changing mind and even equipped our villa with martini glasses, martini shakers, appetizers and much more for a last minute cocktail party we hosted with local friends!! She really set up the vibe for the rest of our fabulous trip!  Took Friday off of work, went early to take advantage of the resort. From the minute we arrived at 10:30am, to the departure on Sunday- we had the most enjoyable long weekend we have had in a LONG time. The cost is worth it. We

We were fortunate enough to snag a great package on Expedia for the Pelican Hill.  This resort is a beautiful property, and allowed us to shop and explore many of the nearby attractions.  The bungalow rooms are so spacious and well appointed.  Service was outstanding throughout the property - we especially enjoyed the complimentary rides around the resort if we didn't feel like walking.  The pool area is large and gorgeous.  We also were able to take advantage of the workout classes which were taught by great instructors.  Overall, a wonderful experience and a chance to feel pampered!

This is a wonderful top notch resort with a excellent accommodating staff (seriously, they've been trained very well). Location is great, wish it was a little closer to the beach, but secluded and yet close enough all the activity. This was our first time to So Cal, and we'll be back.

Summary Heading: Great destination resort-a repeat appearance merited
Summary: Our second time here and this trip was as fabulous as the first.  Our guest room is simply the best room I have been in since I was here last year.  We spend 200 nights a year traveling and this resort has exceptional guest rooms.  Views are terrific, but to be clear, this is not oceanfront property, more like ocean view.  The staff could not have been more attentive.  We did a group dinner (around 50 of us) and we were so pleased at the way the food and servic met or exceeded everyone's expectations.

Romantic travelers will enjoy the solitude of their detached bungalows in quiet, suburban environs. If there were a kitchen, you'd think you were staying in someone's house, because these bungalows are like separate detached houses on various cul de sacs scattered across the sprawling property. You need to whistle up the resort's golf cart to ferry you anywhere you want to get to outside the privacy and seclusion of your own little house. That has its plus sides for those who want that kind of intimacy, but drawbacks for those who want to be more in on the action. Think of this literally as a home (meaning, your own little house) away from home, where you have to go into town for meals, swims, shopping, or to just get some alone time from your traveling companions. Is there even

Summary Heading: Very Good But Not Great- A Study in Beige
Summary: We visited for a week's stay.  Perfect weather, lovely suite, good location and food.  Suite had views toward the Pacific but it is far away, and principal obstruction are chimneys of adjacent bungalows.  Golf courses are fun to play, but if you enjoy something less than five hours on the course, book early and get out in front of the herd.  The food is quite good but pricey, and while the wine selection is reasonably broad, the vintages and value leave something to be desired.  Andrea, the main restaurant is a large space with beige everywhere and a small terrace outdoors. A bit of color (flowers?) would break the monotony of the monotone.  Service is mixed- what we term California Goofy.  Nice, attentive, but just off- as in asking "So, how is your food tasting?"  The

Summary Heading: Grounds: 5 star; Service: 3 star: Food: 3 star
Summary: This has all the makings of a 5 star resort. The grounds are lovely with beautiful landscaping, spacious and lovely pools, a wonderful hillside location. What is missing is 5 star service, attention to detail, and extreme pricing for what you receive.  First, do not waste your money on an ocean view . The ocean view is about a mile away and there is quite a bit of landscaping that will block your view. You see the shimmer of the ocean and that's about it.   Our bungalow was lovely. It was larger than a standard hotel room with a fireplace, good sized balcony and great linens. The bed was in the beginning stages of being lumpy. The volume of the TV did not work via the remote. But what irked me the most was the nickle-dime aspect of the room. Yes, there was a coffeemaker that

So...a close friend of mine has extremely high standards. I mean, unattainably high. Pelican Hill is one of the only hotels she has good things to say about, so when we only had one night to get away recently, the Newport Coast was our pick. It is a massive property, on over 500 acres, and beautifully landscaped. Unobstructed views of the rolling golf greens, palm, olive, and eucalyptus trees stretch to the seaside cliffs. Driving in, the resort looks huge...Las Vegas proportions. Valet and check in were attentive and quick. They know your name. It's a very nice lobby. Then, since the resort is all "bungalows" and villas, you drive right up to your room, led by a bellman in a golf cart. The resort is a part of the platinum Amex FHAR program; however, we did not receive an

This resort exceeded my expectations. We checked in on Friday and did not bother to leave until checkout on Sunday.  Staff, restaurants, pool, room, were all outstanding.  It is expensive, but the resort delivers.

Their swimming is so pretty.  It looks like a coliseum in Italy.  It has a private little room all around. It has 2 floor levels.  The resort is very nice.  We did not stay there.  We just went there to meet up with friends...hang out for drinks.  There a couple of nice restaurant in there...very pricey.  It is not far from the beach....just across the street from the beach.  And it is not far from Fashion Island mall.

This resort was wonderful.  Arrived and marvelled at the architecture of the buildings and paths.  Check in was prompt and efficient.  Quickly whisked away to guest room.  Wow!  Lots of plants and the room was spacious.  Nice view out towards ocean.  Staff was constantly available to offer rides, but preferred to walk. The Coliseum pool is a marvel.  Not a fan of 3 1/2 feet depth, but otherwise, what a great design.  Lots of area for sun and shade.  Food service was courteous and fast service. The grounds were spectacular with several breath-taking ocean views.  Walking the paths along the golf course was an excellent workout.  The walk down to the ocean was also a good workout.  Shuttles were available to avoid the hike back up the hill. The car show (both guest's and rentals)

Being local, we stayed one night for a wedding celebration, which was at the Hotel.  We had requested an early check in, 2 pm, which did not happen, but we had been warned. However, they upgraded us from a one room, ocean view bungalow, to a suite. Sixteen hundred feet of luxury that you can really live in. As mentioned elsewhere, the ocean views can be limited by over-grown landscape and the terrace you are on, so check the room first if view is a big factor. Room service for breakfast was excellent. On time with well prepared HOT food. For a wedding, this resort is superb, but expensive. In this area, Pelican Hill is second only to Montage.

We stayed for 4 nights in a bungalow-garden view. The resort is gorgeous! Often you see pix on a hotel website that dont live up.. this place is as beautiful as it looks. Its a bit pricey & out of our normal lodging budget but we got a good deal on-line. The room & bathroom were large & very well appointed.  High ceilings, nice tv, wet bar, fire place, seating area.. a really comfortable room you just feel relaxed in! Cozy & comfy.  The patio was also nice (although a bit warm as the glass panels trap the heat) The resort  should make them standard on all patios, but ask for lounge chair covers. Its very private and a huge plus that you park your own car near your door..no waiting for valet.  We really appreciated that as we could come & go without delay to visit the sights.

Mr [--],   I recently was a guest at the Resort at Pelican Hill. While the resort was in a great location and had many great amenities, the service I received at the resort was less than that received at a Holiday Inn.   Here is a letter I submitted to Mr [--]...  Late Check-In I arrived at your resort at approximately 3pm and was informed my room was not yet prepared. I was informed that when the room was ready, I would be contacted. I was not informed regarding the “Guaranteed Check-in time of 4pm” when I initially arrived at your resort. It was not until 4:28pm I was contacted to inform me that my room was ready.  Room was not adequately prepared, prior to my arrival When I arrived at my room, I found that the room was not adequately prepared. I found that the carpet was
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent visit. As expressed by our management team in their discussions with you, we truly understand your level of disappointment and regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered with your accommodation and newspaper delivery.  In consideration of your experience falling short of your expectations and our goals, a room credit was provided to you and a complimentary room upgrade was offered by our Managing Director in his correspondence that was mailed September 14, 2012. Unfortunately, it seems that this correspondence did not reach you before this review was posted.  As communicated in the response letter and in our managements phone discussions with you, we sincerely regret that you remain unsatisfied with your experience. Should you wish to discuss your experience further, I invite you to contact me directly.  Kind regards,  Scott Lundahl Resident Manager  The Resort at Pelican Hill

Summary Heading: If you're staying in the villas, here are the people to see
Summary: This resort has had, justifiably, many wonderful reviews. But an area that is often overlooked, yet crucial to a meaningful and memorable stay is the service industry. In staying many times in the villas, my family and I can tell you of two absolutely wonderful front desk people at the villas that you must ask for when you stay there. Josh Smith and Casey Rodgers are truly the best. They both exemplify what their positions as front desk managers should be--namely, they actually listen, are extremely polite and helpful, and most importantly, will try their very best to get fulfill your requests. Make sure to ask for either of these two fine young men, because they are both 5 stars, to match the resort!

We've just returned from a long weekend with our daughter at Pelican Hill and while the resort is lovely it does not merit the $700.00+ night room charge.  We booked a one bedroom bungalow with Ocean View, the view was obscured by the trees in front of our unit and what we did see was water glistening in the far distance.  The bungalows are huge, so maybe thats the trade off.  That however is not the reason for this review.  Our biggest problem was the unruly children at this resort, the kids in the pool scream non-stop, there's running and screaming and jumping into the pool, it was a nighmare.  Our neighbours had 3 children and a nanny, we ended up asking for a room change since the screaming started at 6:30 and and ended well after dark.  We chose not to spend to much time at

We stayed at this beautiful resort in the week leading up to and including Labor Day and the dates are significant as they had a considerable impact upon our experience there.  The first thing to say is that aesthetically, the hotel is breathtaking.  The views are amazing and the architecture blends beautifully into its surroundings.  We stayed in a garden bungalow which was within a minute of the pool and restaurants so we had no transport issues.  The room was well appointed and certainly enough for our needs.  The pool was certainly a focal point for the hotel, although little to no shade, and the decor throughout luxurious without being pompous.  We ate at the Coliseum Bar & Grill, the Andrea, the Caffe and had room service.  The Coliseum Bar & Grill was always a great

Summary Heading: Hard to live up to #1 in the U.S.
Summary: Given the No. 1 rating in Conde Nast Traveler, our expectations were sky high. Had it not been for that, we would have been blown away. As it was, Pelican Hill still deserves an excellent rating.  The building and the grounds are lovely. The golf is  great. The North Course has ocean views (albeit distant) on most holes. The pool is beautiful.  We had a great dinner at Andrea; great food, and lovely setting.  Although, we've been to the Villa San Michelle in Florence, and that comparison is a bit of a stretch.  Now, for the nits. Describing the Bungalo as "Ocean View" is also a bit of a stretch. Our Bungalo really had mostly a view of some plantings, the next row of bungalows, and some blue water way off in the distance. Not bad, but not what's pictured on the website, and not

This is our third visit to Pelican Hill.  We had some issues in a previous visit, and Mr. Llama was a most gracious host on this, our third visit. Because of the wonderful after sales service, we have already recommended some of our friends, who did stay in July and we will be returning next year again.  Our villa was stunning with magnificent view of the golf course and ocean beyond, the villa pool and service were impeccable and food delicious..  We travel five/six times per year and each time to several locations, and having read previous negative comments regarding this beautiful building, am really not sure what people expect. This property and landscaping far exceeds many of the old European properties even though it is of modern build.  The only 'down side' was that with

I took a tour of the property on my last visit to Laguna and promised myself to come back and stay as a guest. I just returned from a glorious 6 day trip that was both business and pleasure. I am so glad I splurged and chose this property. I have stayed at alot of nice places but can't say enough about the beautiful rooms, the amazing service and all of the amenities. But my favorite part about the service was it was not fake or intimidating. I have stayed at some hotels where you feel like you have to dress up just to go to the pool or breakfast. This was not the case at the Pelican. I am counting down the days until I can return for all pleasure next time and not have any   agenda for work. Thanks Pelican for a trip to remember.

My brother and I enjoyed a six night stay in a two-bedroom villa in May 2012.  The Resort is not cheap but we felt it was worth every penny. As neither of us plays golf we took advantage of the pools, the restaurants, and the spa.  The setting is beautiful and the resort makes excellent use of its location.  The pools are sparkling and the service, especially at the Villa pool by Karey and his staff, is extremely attentive, very prompt and efficient.  The food is excellent.  The spa was a real treat.  Our villa was always well maintained and spotless with many thoughtful features.  Obviously, the housekeeping staff works very hard and they are well-versed in all aspects of the rooms including the entertainment system (which one of them had to give us a brief tutorial in

What a fantastic hotel!  About 10 minutes from John Wayne airport.  Beautiful grounds, fantastic ocean views, well-appointed rooms, huge pool in a dramatic oval configuration, massive TV in the bar and 5 minutes from great restaurants and shopping.  This hotel has it all.  I was here for a business conference (the food was excellent as well) so I didn't take time to go to the beach.  That said, I'm from Los Angeles and I know the water in Orange County/Newport Beach is much clearer than in LA.  This hotel is expensive but I can't imagine being unhappy with it.  Keep in mind that all the rooms are separate buildings and you drive your car to the room.  I thought this was great because your car is right outside your room.  Very convenient and more quiet.  Beautiful olive trees

Summary Heading: Feels like A taste of Italy
Summary: The most beautiful ocean view resort I've stayed in the coliseum pool was amazingly perfectly designed. Pool side service was more then accommodating. The Restuarant's were a taste of Italy , the selections of wines were amazing. Couldn't ask for better views of the pacific ocean.Just make reservation for the Restuarant 's cause they get over committed quickly . Over all may stay was relaxing and fun ...

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay in stylish, sophisticated & world class resort
Summary: Myself, husband & 2 children (2&5) stayed for 9 nights at a bungalow suite at pelican hill.  This was the last stop of a 3 centre stay (LA, Dana Point & here).   We found the whole place absolutely wonderful, service very smooth & attentive, rooms luxurious & beautifully appointed.  Pool enjoying lovely views and a superb setting.  Some have complained of a lack of shade, however we were very well looked after & didn't ever wait longer than 30 mins on the wait list for shade (Jamie pool host) was very attentive & professional.  Breakfast and lunch in the coliseum was faultless!    If I had to pick negatives, it would be the lack of amenities in the bathroom, several times we had to request more shower gel & the food in Andrea was over rated & pricey. We were let down on a

We stayed for 2 days just after the holiday weekend.  I had booked through the "WhataHotel" website to receive "extras" including an upgrade if available, welcome amenity, breakfast credit for both days and a spa/golf credit.  When we checked in we were upgraded to a garden view suite.  The location of the suite was spectacular - we overlooked the golf course and had a partial ocean view.
