Once we were settled in, room service arrived with our welcome gift - a bottle of wine and fruit and cheese platter.  We had booked surfing lessons through the concierge and everything was handled smoothly with door to door service.  Prior to booking I had checked reviews of this hotel and a couple of others that were comparable in the area.  I'm not disappointed we stayed here.  We found the

Summary Heading: if not in your own private palazzo, this is next best
Summary: As a splurge this was absolutely worth it. It hits a really nice mix of well run while relaxed, polished while fun. The room layout (ocean view bungalow) was elegant, with lots of little extras that make the difference. Food at both Andrea and the Coliseum (informal) was excellent, fun, fresh. In retrospect, a really nice part of the experience was the staff, who seemed happy, were on top of things, and performed over and above. Another plus is it's a quick walk to Crystal Cove and the splendid tide-pooling....

Summary Heading: All show and no substance.  Tacky Tacky.
Summary: I was torn between three and four stars but when I saw that 4 stars was intended to represent "very good" and 3 represents "average", I decided that this resort absolutely deserves only a 3.  I'll start with some positives.  Some other reviewers noted serious service problems and I didn't encounter these so I will assume that management took the comments seriously.  The service was fine.  Nothing special, but fine.  The absolutely worst thing about his hotel is the pool.  Now, I know that the hotel thinks that the pool is just spectacular but I disagree.  The design, like that of the whole hotel, is gaudy and vegas like.  Some people like that but I don't.  However, the worst problem at the pool is the lack of shade.  I've never seen a hotel so into the idea of promoting sunburn
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit.  While I am delighted to read that you enjoyed the service you experienced during your stay, I regret that your overall visit fell short your expectations and our goals. I understand your disappointment in the circumstances surrounding the availability of shaded seating available when you visited the Coliseum Pool and sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you encountered.  Our aim is to deliver the perfect guest experience, where every aspect, step and moment of a guest’s stay is comfortable, satisfying and uplifting. To this end, we provide complimentary valet parking and Internet access, as well as access to all pools, fitness centers and spa facilities without an added resort fee. Many guests have expressed appreciation for these value-driven considerations, which are uncommon among other luxury destinations.  Regarding the Resort’s architectural design, it was envisioned through decades of careful planning and a clear, long-term vision. As an authentic, yet modern, adaptation of Italian Renaissance architecture, the Resort’s design was intended to be aesthetically pleasing, timeless, and perfectly suited to its chic California coastal setting. Pelican Hill is a truly inspired adaptation of the architectural style of Italy’s renowned 16th century architect Andrea Palladio, whose work was based on the classic building principles of ancient Rome and Greece. Palladio’s legacy has been adapted to the 21st century to create a resort of timeless beauty, proportion and vision.  The unprecedented attention to detail has set Pelican Hill apart as one of the world’s finest Resorts. In fact, Pelican Hill has been recognized with top national and global accolades from Andrew Harper Hideaway Report, Condé Nast Traveler, Travel & Leisure and many others since opening in 2008. The Resort’s architecture was also featured in a cover story of Architectural Digest magazine.  Once again, thank you for taking the time to post your feedback here. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary Heading: First Class Resort, Great Staff, a couple of "blips"
Summary: We stayed at a Pelican Hill for 10 days during August, and I have to say it is an excellent hotel/ resort.  Working on the basis that not every resort of this size will be 100% flawless all the time Pelican Hill is probably as good as it gets.  For those of you planning a trip to Pelican Hill the following is a summary of our stay there.   We arrived quite late in the evening and appreciated a very smooth and quick check in, the entire process took about 2 mins and we were transported to our villa within a few minutes.  We had a top floor two bedroom villa, located in the North Villas (I think all two bedroom villas are in the North Villas) and the place was huge and very well appointed with a real quality feel. We were shown round by our “Butler” and were impressed by his “call

When we arrived the bellman showed us the fireplace but it wouldn't go on.  He said he would take care of it, but apparently didn't because when we came back from dinner it still wasn't working.  We called for a repair and stood around awkwardly while it was fixed. The "repair" only lasted that night; the next night it didn't go on again. Oh well.  On the third night, we had no hot water.  Someone came to the room and stood in the bathroom with the water running to confirm our report.  Then he left the room to go to the hot water heater.  About 20 minutes later we called the front desk to ask if we should give up hope for a shower that night. Someone called back in about 15 minutes to say that it was fixed and that we would have hot water soon. The water was warmer but it was
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent experience with us. I understand your level of disappointment concerning the unfortunate circumstances you encountered during your stay. While I’m delighted to hear you enjoyed the Resort’s beautiful setting, Five-Star Spa and Coliseum Pool & Grill, I sincerely regret the guest room inconveniences that fell short of your expectations and our goals.  Please know that we strive to ensure each guest room is in perfect condition that each guest enjoys gracious personalized service, especially during our busy summer season. I have personally followed up on the comments you shared here and have addressed your concerns with the Resort’s engineering, guest services and front desk managers.  I am sincerely sorry that your experience was less than perfect. As we continually strive to heighten the guest experience at Pelican Hill, I would be grateful for the opportunity to speak with you further about your feedback. I have sent my contact details to you separately in a private message and look forward to the prospect of speaking with you soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: great food! The perfect vacation! I stayed at the South villas with my wife and kids this summer and I must say, the only thing better than the gorgeous scenery and architecture was the outstanding service! I have traveled all over the world and I must say Pelican Hill?s service definitely stand out amongst the rest. Our buter Berlantee was so welcoming for the beginning to the end! She came to visit us everyday and called and left a sweet voicemail when we were not in! she surprised my kids with chocolate chip cookies and a bottle of white wine for my wife and I after overhearing us talking about celebrating my wife?s birthday. That was a very sweet touch. We will definitely be returning next summer and we might even be making Pelican Hill a yearly tradition! Great Hospitality,

We stayed for 5 nights with our 3 children in a 3 bedroom villa which was really well appointed with lovely views across the golf course to the Pacific. Amazing sunsets. Pools are enormous and very child-friendly (shallow throughout), the architecture of the resort is on a grand scale and the resort is large. Newport Beach, a short shuttle bus ride away, is a great place to go with the kids - massive stretch of sandy beach, good waves to jump, sea quite chilly (August). Food good everywhere but service very slow indeed. Great steak at Golf Club Grill. Would recommend for family but 5 nights was enough.

We travel to OC often with our kids. On one trip we decided to stay here so we can get the resort experience. The Pelican Inn is great for a traveling family because they make everything easy for you. They baby proof the room, leave you sand toys, give you plenty of bottled water, have a shuttle to go to the beach, and excellent pool for kids, plenty of food options- just to name a few perks. Little touches (like leaving a diaper pail in the bathroom) were nice. The rooms were very spacious for the four of us as well. One of the best things is that they have parking right outside your bungalow. This makes it so much easier than walking over to the valet and waiting for your car. (though, they have that too.)  I would recommend this place if you don't a really nice resort

Summary Heading: Really truly liked it, even with little kinks that occurred on a daily basis.
Summary: We just spent five nights at Pelican Hill and would definitely return next summer. The accommodations are fantastic for a family and our kids had a great time at the pool and golf camp. This is a hotel verging on true greatness - they just need to work out the final kinks that mainly have to do with service glitches. Everyone is super nice and tries really hard- and the Colisuem restaurant food is definitely yummy and they cater really nicely to kids. Our biggest complaint is that things just seem to run a bit too slow and the housekeeping department seemed a bit too busy - there was a day they didn't show up to service the room until 3pm, they didn't pick up breakfast dishes til 4pm after two phone calls, turn down service happened one day at 9pm, it was hard to reach internal

My husband and I just returned from five nights here, and we loved this resort.  My husband is an architecture buff and has very exacting standards.  The Italian country design was beautiful, and the resort is kept immaculately.  The pool, gym and spa are all first-rate.  Only complaints, and they are small: We thought the Andrea restaurant was excellent but not extraordinary.  We live in Manhattan so perhaps we are too picky.    Also, the reservation staff is not well trained.  They had difficulty in making date changes and answering pretty basic questions.  Finally, we were glad we got the Bungalow and Breakfast package.  Breakfast delivered to our room was still very expensive ($100/two before the package discount) even with this package.  But we are dreaming of returning,

We stayed as a family for 3 nights and had one of the brilliant bungalows, fab views, tons of space and a super comfy bed.  The Pelican Grill was our favourite restaurant with great steaks and romantic views.  The buildings and scale of the Pelican together with the landscaping make you feel transported to a dream of what a Mediterranean holiday should look like, just fab. I rated at 4 stars for one specific reason, we stayed the previous week at the Grand Del Mar where the pool service is outstanding at the Pelican our experience on several occasions was so disappointing, we had to either get the towels and set ourselves up or the pool staff did half the job, towels on the lounger but none to dry off with.  Not sure what's going on here but definitely a area to improve!  A

Summary Heading: beautiful resort in beautiful Newport Beach
Summary: We are a family with two teenage daughters and we enjoyed our stay here very much. We loved Newport Beach and Balbao!! The bungalow rooms are big enough for our family to with all our suitcases. We asked for a bungalow with 2 queens nr 308. (not the king and sofabed that we got first nr 307, which was dark because of a tree in front of the patio) The beds are very comfortable and there was no sound of the airco. The bathroom amenities are great, don't know the brand but it feels and smells just like Aveda. There is also nice outdoor patio. Breakfast was very nice, also the service was good. Self parking in front of the bungalows. We went to Crystal cove with the complimentary bus service and they gave us a bag with towels, water and sunscreen. They took good care of us. Fashion

Summary Heading: Excellent setting, poor service and food
Summary: I stayed in this resort with my family for 5 days this August 2012. Overall the place itself is really gorgeous: rooms are new, spacious and elegant, pools and spa very nice, golf course superbe and views unique. Unfortunately the service we experienced was not in line with the standards of this  category of resorts. Just as examples: one day the room was not made up and we had to call 3 times to have it done (and this happened at 8:00 pm), another day room service competely forgot to clean the balcony where we had breakfast in the morning (we only noticed this, when we returned in the room at 7:00 pm), I have been waiting for hours for a FedEx shipment, whereas the package had been delivered and forgotten at the reception. Last but not least, food didn't meet our (probably
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent experience with us.  I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the Resort’s luxurious accommodations, pools, Five-star Spa and world-class golf courses, but regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered surrounding service during your stay.  I understand your level of disappointment regarding housekeeping, staff follow-up and dining, which caused your experience fall short of your expectations and our goals. For this reason, I am taking this opportunity to share your valued feedback with management teams in each department, as well as with our culinary staff. We are addressing the concerns you kindly noted here, as we continually strive to heighten service levels throughout the Resort.  Once again, thank you for offering your input here. We look forward to the opportunity to serve you again. Should your travels bring you back to Southern California, please contact me personally.  Kind regards,  Scott Lundahl Resident Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful Resort, Okay Service and Food
Summary: My husband and I live in the area, and frequent many of the resorts for stays, food, drink and spa treatments. This however, was our first stay here at the Pelican Hill. We had planned to book just a couple of massages and stay for the day, something that we've done a few times at both the Montage and the Ritz Carlton Laguna Niguel. At the Pelican Hill they do not allow you to use the amenities if you are not a hotel guest (and there is no spa pool to enjoy after your treatments). So we decided that we would stay the night.   Unfortunately, I was not impressed with the massage, I was hoping that my husband would be raving about his so that the spa would have a redeeming quality, but no, he was not impressed either. I wonder if the 22% they take upfront for all services leaves

Summary Heading: Resort is amazing/food however needs improvement
Summary: During my stay at this amazing resort we found the amenities to be outstanding, however the food was not 5 star.  Go figure for a resort of this caliber that the food would be sub-par.  One can find better deals for sure at this price.  The food should be outstanding in my opinion.

Summary Heading: Service not nearly worth the price
Summary: Just returned from a week long trip with my wife and two kids.  Stayed in two bedroom North Villa for ~$1200 per night. Accommodations were nice as was property--though very spread out.  Major disappointment was with service which was far below expectations given lofty room rate.  I expected something close to Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton, for what we were paying but got closer to Best Western...So here is the list of service related issues we experienced during our stay...  + Room was not serviced first day of vacation.  Left the room at 8AM and returned at 6PM after a long day at pool / beach to dirty room; Complained to manager and received apology--nothing more + Butler service that is supposed to be available to tend to needs often unavailable when you try to call; Put on
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about the unfortunate circumstances you encountered recently. While I’m delighted that you enjoyed our accommodations, I sincerely regret that your service experience fell short of your expectations and our goals.  I understand your level of disappointment and have taken this opportunity to personally follow up with the leaders of each department, based on the details you shared regarding housekeeping, butlers, transportation services and the front desk. Rest assured, we are addressing the important concerns you kindly noted here as we continually strive to heighten service levels throughout the Resort.  In consideration of your thoughtful feedback, I would be grateful for the opportunity to speak with you further about your experience. I kindly invite you to call me directly and have sent my contact details to you separately in a private message. I look forward to speaking with you, so I may express my apologies to you personally.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary Heading: Family vacation at the North Villas
Summary: My husband and I have stayed numerous times at Pelican Hill. However this was our first time to stay in the villas. We usually stay in the bungalows.  The north villas are not in the same area as the Villa pool if you are looking for easy access to the pool. The villas worked out great for our family. We were traveling with our two daughters and their friends. A total of 4 teens and 2 adults.  We had a two bedroom villa. It had a kitchen and living area with two full baths and one half bath. The second bedroom had two double beds. We spent the majority of our time at the Collisium pool.  We drove and valeted our car but you can call for a golf cart. I believe the pool at the Collisium is the largest circular pool in the US. It is absolutely gorgeous. We enjoyed many meals by the

Well we found the resort via trip advisor and overall it was very good.  The rooms (bungalows) are HUGE, we stayed in a "garden view" and it wasn't exactly a garden view BUT it was still incredible view.   The staff was great.  The concierge were very good (randy specifically).  If you like riding your bike, hiking, running, the beeches you will love ths place.  Shop for the rates, again is pricey but not over the top.  It really seemed to be worth he price we paid.

My husband and I travel a lot and have stayed in many beautiful places, but Pelican HilI is one of the most fabulous resorts we have ever stayed in. From our roomy bungalow with beamed ceilings and a fireplace, to the round pool area, to the scenic views, it was first class. We escaped the stifling Kansas city heat and felt like we landed in paradise. The service and the food..grea. We had breakfast everyone morning outside at the Colisieum Grill, beautiful views of the pool, golf course and ocean.  very pricey but delicious. We had dinner one night at Pelican Grill and loved the view and the food. My husband golfed on the north golf course and said it was gorgeous and challenging. I had a massage at the spa and loved it..  Take advantage of the wet area in the spa...the steam,

Just got back from Pelican Hill. We were supposed to stay 3 weeks but decided to leave early. From the moment we arrived, just about everything went wrong. 1) We specifically asked for a 3rd Floor 2 bedroom villa as we have two young kids and did not want to be kept up at night with people walking above us. They didn't give us that room despite the fact I reserved the room 4 months in advance. Never sign a contract with these people 2) If you want rooms that smell like fresh paint, cheap laundry detergent, and recently shampooed carpets, Pelican Hill is for you (as cancer will be for you 3) When you complain, there is no remorse on the part of staff, it's the customer who is crazy. No follow up phone call to assess our happiness. I am paying 1000 per night, call me to see how my
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent visit. Per the conversations our management had with you during your stay, we understand your level of disappointment and regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered.  We always strive to ensure that each guest room remains in the best possible condition, but most especially during the summer season when accommodations are consistently in highest demand. Touch-ups, repairs and deep cleaning are part of the process to maintain the superb quality of our facilities for our guests’ benefit and comfort.  Although our Villas General Manager allowed you to view many options for a change of Villas, you instead requested to break your contract for the accommodations that were reserved for you. In consideration of your experience falling short of your expectations and our goals, Resort executives made an exception for you in the spirit of hospitality. We welcomed the appreciation you expressed to us and your gracious acceptance of this offer, but regret that you remain unsatisfied with circumstances of your visit.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: Beautiful Resort that offers a relaxing  environment. The pool is wonderful to get away and read a book or just stay in the room for a relaxing afternoon. We had a wonderful time and found ourselves staying at the Resort for everything. It was the perfect place to escape for a peaceful and relaxing time.

One of the nicest places we have ever stayed! We were upgraded to an Ocean King bungalow because we booked through American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts and the room was very large and beautiful.  Looks exactly like the picture on their web site. Service is wonderful. Had a very wonderful manicure and pedicure in the spa, also courtesy of American Express $100 spa credit (although it cost $140 after tax and tip). Golf courses are also amazing. Will definitely return.

Summary Heading: The best resort in the USA!
Summary: My wife and I just spent 4 days at the Pelican Hill property - it was great! A perfect place to vacation! We got upgraded to a 2600 sq ft villa overlooking the golf coarse and Pacific Ocean. The Spa and pools were the best I've ever used. The staff was plentiful and always asking to do more.

We stayed in a two bedroom Villa.  North Villas.  2,250 square feet!  Sub-Zero Refridgerator, Wolf Range.  Our own enclosed garage.  Guess we should have epected as such when they told us that our "Butler" would be there to show us around our Villa!  Then there is the view all the way to Catalina!  Everything about the Pelican Hill Resort was beyond First Class.  We've stayed at the Beverly Hills Hotel and that was way down the ladder compared to this Resort!  Incredible!  Oh, another thing.   By the time we were back from breakfast our room was cleaned and made up! And the Shower had real water pressure!  The Bungalows are also nice, but not on a par with the Villas.

Top drawer the entire stay!  We've stayed at lots of five star properties and this one met all of our expectations.  We had a bungalow with an incredible view.  It was very quiet.  We never heard a neighbor or hotel worker during our five day visit.  The food and service was first class.  We had dinner at the Pelican Grill one evening with a breathtaking view of the sunset and a meal that was outstanding.  To a person, everyone was friendly and efficient.  Everyone was performing their duties effortlessly, friendly and efficient.  This ranks as one of our favorite hotels.  If you get the opportunity to stay here, take it!!

Summary Heading: Nice resort just don't expect to have your room cleaned
Summary: Nice location great views resturant good but no house keeping service we had to call everyday to have our room cleaned the resort is very large and they seem to just be under staffed and if your room is not available when they want to clean it they just don't do It.so your out of towels soap etc and they don't seem to care. We are here with a group and don't think we will return. To Many other choices to put up with this kind of service. Very disappointing Would of rated all 1's but that would not be fare everything else was very nice at the resort except the house keeping!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent stay with us.  While I’m delighted to hear you enjoyed the Resort’s panoramic ocean views and world-class restaurants, I regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered regarding housekeeping.  I understand the level of disappointment, as your experience fell short of your expectations and our goals.  I have taken the opportunity to follow up with our housekeeping management team to address the concerns you have kindly detailed here.   As we continuously strive to heighten service levels throughout the Resort, your thoughtful feedback is valued. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary Heading: Leaving Here Was the Best Part of my Stay
Summary: Stayed 10 days in the Villas which are the Uber residences on the hill above the resort.  They have their own clubhouse, gym and pool and give you access to all the main resort amenities as well.  Stayed here previously just as the economy was turning downward and noticed the level of service fall off as our stay wore-on. I was hoping for a different outcome this time but am sorry to report that this stay was worse than last time.  The villas themselves are lovely with views down the Coast to Newport Beach, Lovely finishing detail and a passion for the premisses shine through.  The visionary that dreamt up the resort and it's grounds obviously planned this property as a legacy.    Service levels at this resort however, leave you feeling like you're on your own.  Some of the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit.  I am delighted to hear you enjoyed the setting of The Resort’s private Villa enclave, but sincerely regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered regarding service.  Based upon the details you shared regarding in-room dining, butlers and housekeeping, I understand your level of disappointment and have taken the opportunity to personally follow up with the leaders of each department. We are addressing the concerns you kindly noted here, as we continually strive to heighten service levels throughout The Resort.  Rest assured, the staff and management at Pelican Hill remain passionately committed to providing excellent service for each and every guest. Once again, your thoughtful feedback is valued, and I thank you for posting your input here.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary Heading: Some shortcomings-otherwise we would love to give it 5 stars!
Summary: We stayed at the South Villas of this resort, and found the villa beautifully appointed and very comfortably equipped. The kitchen allows you to prepare your own meals.The six burner stove is a bit over the top, unless you are a chef or wish to hire a chef! Service can be a bit erratic: we notified housekeeping in the morning, that we would leave the premises, so they could clean up the place. By the time it was late afternoon, we came home, and housekeeping staff was in the middle of cleaning up. A bag of pillows was left beside the front door, and it still stood there the next morning.(We had not requested any). The Coliseum Pool is great for all family members, and service there is very professional. Opposed to that the pool near the South Villas is different: staff is mostly

Summary Heading: Great Place for a Co. Meeting
Summary: Nice proeprty of course, but a better staff.  Meeting rooms are nice, and banquets staff all over us.  Everything is "no problem".  Highly recommend.  Only 15 min from John Wayne Airport.

I booked the Pelican Hill to stay at the night before my wedding in July 2011 and for our wedding night.  The rooms are grandiose and charming. Our room had two rooms, one is the bedroom with the bathroom and the other is your living room.  Both open to your own large private patio looking out to the ocean. The bathroom was large and had a tub that opened up with a window to the room, which I loved. Knowing it was our wedding night, I would have liked the hotel to do something special for us but they did not, and honestly I didn't even think about it until we were on our honeymoon.  My only regret is not getting to spend some more time at the amazing pool.  The grounds at this hotel are top notch, as is the pool.  We ordered room service for all the bridesmaids and all the food

I traveled to Pelican Hill for a long weekend with my wife and another couple.  Pelican Hill is a beautiful (and huge) resort, but the food and beverage service really disappointed, particularly at the pool...excessively long wait times, wrong orders, forgotten food, etc.  It happened several times, unfortunately, both at the main pool and at the Villa pool.  We also though the food was pretty average in general...very little stood out (and we had dinner at the nice restaurant).  I also was disappointed in the distance from the ocean/beach, although I knew it wasn't very close when booking the reservation.  It probably is a mile and a half to the beach (I ran on the beach twice).  The rooms/main building/grounds are pretty impeccable, but I just felt like it lacked a little

Summary Heading: Exquisite hotel, Great weekend, some staff need training.
Summary: My wife and me stayed there for a weekend. The room was great, spa great, food great, our only complain is that some of the staff are a little rude. This might be because it is a place visited by many non guests for meals and golf. Otherwise it was fantastic. We will be back.

Everything about this hotel is amazing. They make you feel like the most important person on the resort. Food was amazing. Pool was great, heated for year round enjoyment. Golf course was tough of course but beatiful. A good walk away from the beach though.

I can't say enough about this resort.  The grounds are amazing.  No detail was neglected when it came to the rooms and furnishings. The impeccably mannered staff was attentive to our every need.  Our stay was a pleasure from the moment we checked in.  A very satisfied and relaxed couple left after a fantastic weekend getaway!

Pelican Hill is located in a beautiful area of Southern California and the views from almost all of the resort are magnificent. It's 2 golf courses look gorgeous. My husband golfed with friends, I did not. Golf fees as a resort guest are reasonable for courses such as these. We had expected the fees to be about the same as Pebble Beach but they were less. Aside from the golf fees, I think that the rest of the fees at this hotel are over the top. The spa charges on the weekend are much higher than week days - even for resort guests and 22% fee is attached to all spa charges.   The spacious bungalows are beautifully furnished. Our unit had no view (# 204 Bellagio) even though our Amex Platinum Fine Hotel & Resorts reservation comes with an upgraded room upon check in if available.

Our Daughter was married at Pelican Hills..stayed for 4 days in the Villas it was beautiful..Our Butler Jamie was very professional and took care of our every need...The pool was fantastic as was the restaurant..we did not want for anything on the big day..Jamie took care of everything..Thanks for a wonderful time...can not say enough good things about the staff

I thought this resort was absolutely gorgeous.  The staff and service were top notch and the grounds were stunning.  I stayed in a villa, but also spent quite a bit of time in the bungalows.  Honestly, you can't go wrong with either.  Both were nicely done!    I did have dinner one evening at the onsite restaurant, and it was great.  The pool cabanas were very private, and the pool itself was amazing as well.  I honestly thought this was an impeccable property.    If you can afford it, stay here.

We went here with 4 adults, a four year old and a two year old.  It was great.  The pool is one of the best I have seen.  We sat around drinking boat drinks and taking the kids swimming.  Service was great and the views are beautiful.  It is pricey, but that is what I expected for something of this caliber.  You get what you pay for.  The spa was good as were the restaurants we ate at.  They have a shuttle that can take you just about anywhere in town you want.  Visit Balboa Island and Newport Harbor when you are there.  Avoid the dinner cruise.  Bad food and not really a Yacht as it advertises.   We would return to this resort in a heart beat.  So much to do within 10 miles.

Summary Heading: Nice Resort, restaurants not so great
Summary: My Family surprised me for my Birthday and booked a four night stay at the Pelican Resort. On the night of my Birthday reservations were made at Andreas restaurant with the concierge and we were told we could get a patio sitting watching the sunset at dinner. When we arrived we were told they don't take reservations for the patio (which the Hotel  concierge should have known about ). I would love to know who the family was sitting in front of us, since the Maitre de was glued to their table with his back to us more than half of our dinner. We waited patiently for him to finish, but there was no end in site.  I was so disturbed by this, we started recording his lovely back and loud voice on my iphone. He stood there for over 55 minutes, taking care of them. We actually stopped
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent visit.  While I am delighted to hear you enjoyed the Coliseum Pool and our ocean-view Resort property, I sincerely regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered in dining at Andrea.  I understand your level of disappointment, as this experience marked a special occasion for your birthday celebration.  At Pelican Hill and Andrea, we strive to provide exceptional service and cuisine to each and every guest. To this end, I have taken the opportunity to personally follow up with our concierge, restaurant manager and culinary team to address the concerns you have detailed here.  Once again, your thoughtful feedback is valued, and I thank you again for offering your input here. We look forward to the opportunity to serve you again soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: Pelican Hill Resort is a little pricey, but well worth the splurge.  Some places leave you wondering if the extra price was really worth it - well Pelican Hill is!  It is an absolute oasis from the "real world".  The rooms are gorgeous and the service in every corner of this resot was absolutely unsurpassed. The Coliseum Pool is both a beautiful spot to relax and very kid friendly, and our meals on property were delicious.   My husband also really enjoyed the golf course.  The spa was exteremely accomodmodating in arranging joint appointments for my mom, my daughter and I to have nails and hair done before a family wedding..  And the hotel makes it easy with their shuttle to get to the local beach too!   We arrived after a difficult series of family health issues and in need of

From check-in to check-out your every need is met. The restaurants were very good. The rooms were just beautiful. The spa is number one all around. A very luxurious resort. I would recommend this resort as one of the best I have ever stayed in.

Summary Heading: Best value luxury & Which types of rooms to choose?
Summary: We stayed at Pelican Hill oceanview bungalow (single story, 847 FT) and absolutely loved it! When you are making your reservation, there are two types of accomodations: bungalow or villa.  On the reservation screen, the word bungalow does not appear, if it's not a villa, it's bungalow.  Bungalows are single bedrooms although if you select a suite, you get more living space at 1637 FT.  Villas are good for 2 bedrooms to 4 bedrooms and comes with washer/dryer.  The bungalows/villas are all single story, you can drive up and park directly in front of your room without having to use elevators, walk through the lobby or any other public areas.  This is excellent for families or if you access your car frequently.  We absolutely love the convenience! Imagine as soon as you step out of

I have to say, I have traveled the world and this was the nicest place I have ever stayed in.  The property was just emaculate and the staff was overly helpful, nice and accomodating.  I would recommend this place highly.

I spent three nights at Pelican Hill in late June with three other couples.  Make no mistake, this is one of the most magnificent resorts in the world.  Perched on a hillside overlooking the Pacific Ocean, almost every room, every restaurant and every golf hole provide stunning views of the resort and the Ocean; absolutely breathtaking.  The resort features two accomodation options:  Bungalows and villas.  The bungalows are very spacious, one bedroom units, all of which face the ocean and have open patios.  Villas can be rented in several different floor plans, up to four bedroom.  The bungalows and villas spread out around the central meeting area that contains the conference facilities, spa, restaurants and the incredible Colisseum pool area.  The golf course and associated
Great hotel, world class facility and accomodations. World class golf coarse. Service and people over the top.

Summary Heading: Great place to take your kids!
Summary: The property is gorgeous and very kid and pet friendly.  I have never been to a hotel that caters to children that is of this caliber. They will pick you up from your bungalow and shuffle you all over the property or down to the beach. The pool is gorgeous and there is a great kids camp with attentive staff. We ate at both the Colosseum and the fine dining restaurant Andrea. The poolside Colosseum was beautiful and we had a great breakfast (try the toast with the egg baked in... yum!) and lunch (chicken kabob was amazing).  We went to Andrea to celebrate our anniversary, we had excellent service and loved the truffle rissoto in the parmesan cheese wheel- something we hadn't seen before.  We had the tasting menu and enjoyed every course except the egg dish.  I went to the spa and
The villas are great for families with young children. The main pool is beautiful, great food, excellent service. Perfect for long walks with beautiful views.  Will go back in a heartbeat.
Celebrated at The Colloseum Restaurant a special occassion. The staff was flawless and the hotel and food fantastic!

Wow! Amazing! We spent a weekend in the Villas for my daughters 21st birthday and it was weekend that will not soon be forgotten.The accomodations were spectacular. The food wonderful. But what was most impressive and what made the real difference was the level of service from everybody at the resort and the attention to detail. We have travelled extensively around the world at some great and highly rated properties and this was among the best I have ever experienced. it is expensive, but in this case, you really do get what you pay for!

Just returned with my wife from a fabulous, weekend,romantic, celebratory stay in a villa at Pelican Hill. Even though we had fog (as is the California coastal custom) til early afternoon during our stay, it certainly didn't adversely impact our affinity for this resort and property. First cabin all the way! Loved the fine service, great restaurants (especially Andrea), the lush vegetation, the diversity of all of the upscale amenities, the reclusive and peaceful villa with ocean view, and the casually elegant nature of it all. We drove away very refreshed and appreciative of the quality time we had at Pelican Hill. Well done!!!
Love it! I wish I could live there! They had the friendliest staff, best location, best customer service.... Ever. We still talk about pelican hills

As soon as we drove in the gates I was feeling that this was going to be good!  A feeling of luxury the entire time, in a beautiful setting.  The pool area was fantastic, rooms spacious and nicely appointed, service impeccable at all times. Food was amazing. I can't really think of any drawbacks depending on what kind of holiday you are after - it is a bit of a trek to LA but I quite like being out of the city and in such a relaxing environment.  Bliss!

Went on Memorial Day weekend with our 8 month old. The "bungalow" rooms are wonderful - almost like suites they are so large.  The bathrooms are exceptionally large, a side kitchen/sink area with gourmet coffee selections and coffee grounder/maker.  Robes are comfortable.  Room service and hospitality could not be better.  We had dinner at Andrea - also very nice. Baby-friendly. Will definitely go back.  Beautiful property and close to Balboa Island.

Summary Heading: It's Like The Four Seasons......Without The Chain
Summary: My wife and I stayed at Pelican Hill for four nights last week as we were celebrating our first wedding anniversary.  We checked in and the extremely nice lady at the front desk (sorry I do not recall her name!) gave us a free upgrade to an ocean view room instead of the garden view that we were supposed to have.  The highlights of the room (called bungalows here) were a working fireplace and a spacious private (i.e. no one could look in and vice-versa) terrace with a pretty view of the Pacific.  The bathrooms are very large and well-appointed (love the separate toilet room) with a oversize shower.  The bed is extremely comfortable.  The resort is large and spread out, which will often require transportation to and from your room depending on its location.  PH has that covered

Nice accommodation in a beautiful setting but there are some drawbacks. The bungalows are great and it's nice that you can drive up to them, but the views aren't as spectacular as you are lead to believe unless you get lucky. We tried 2 different bungalows but both had poor views. The grounds are large but are mainly taken up by the golf course, there aren't many places to walk around the resort other than the roadways which was very disappointing. Tried two of the restaurants and the coffee shop, Andreas was great, no complaints there but the Coliseum was overrated, poor menu choices and the strangest service I have ever experienced. We were kept waiting for over 10 minutes to be sseated despite the restaurant being empty whilst the hostess was on the phone, then when seated

Summary Heading: Big, green, luxury and private Golf Resort.
Summary: This is great and private Resort. We spent over there 2 nights. The value to stay here is great. Villas are big and service is very good. Dining is nice as well. This place would be perfect to bring your kids if you have them... but for couples it would be a great escape as well. Good thing that you can drive from the Resort smth like 8 min to the Mastros STK and Javier’s - 2 the best dining places in Newport Beach. So, you can have your privacy and enjoy great landscapes, but if you looking for activity - you can go to one of these restaurants and have a great time.  The only disadvantage of the resort – beach is about 10 min drive down the hill. But Golf Resort is awesome!  SPA is a great place to be as well. On weekends there is a life band in the bar. Food is good, but not

Wife and I stayed for two nights on a weekend.  Nothing but heaven.  No complaints.  A very elite property with every detain considered.  Sure, you pay for it but it is worth it.  Not on the beach but great views of the water.  Food was outstanding.  Golf looked amazing.  You won't leave disappointed (albeit a bit poorer).

Went as part of a group business / pleasure trip.  Place is ridiculously spectacular.  It was certainly nice to have it be on someone else's tab, but my wife and I will definitely return.  Our room was beautiful.  We were on one of the golf holes, with the ocean as a backdrop.  We only had two meals on sight.  One was a group buffet, so it was difficult to assess how good the food was, though the buffet was well done.  I was able to have breakfast at the Coliseum, which was very good.  Everywhere you seem to be in the resort there was a great view of something.    My wife was able to get a massage, and she came back and raved about how good it was.  I played golf on both courses and though I've played better courses, there wasn't much to complain about.  Location enabled the

Summary Heading: As good or better than advertised
Summary: Best rooms for the money in the US for a 5 star property. Vaulted ceilings and enormous size a real plus. Amenities over the top. Staff is great. Parking spaces right in front of bungalows, so no valet fees. Incredibly convenient to restaurants in Newport Beach and Laguna Beach, and 20 minutes form John Wayne Airport. Food at Coliseum Restaurant not too expensive with many big screens for viewing. And the two golf courses on the property - North and South - rival any anywhere for view and challenge. Room serivce great too.

Wow $645/night..that seemed steep...I mean like "the Montage" Steep. But alas this was to be a dream Honeymoon so we took the plunge. I Tried to reserve a cabana at the Gorgeous Collesium Pool only to  be told that a private event was happening there so no room for you two love birds. At Breakfast our waiter spoke Italian to the table ahead of us but in the hour and a half we were there checked in on us once. I suppose we should learn Italian? The cleaning service took two of our own Riedel wine glasses that we brought from our wedding. We complained only to be told that they were looking for them..never found them. Food at Andrea was way overpriced. $80 for Under cooked Risotto and Mushrooms..oops I mean truffles. By the way ..none of the wait staff(Water guy, Girl pushing the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts.  Your comments are important to us, as we continually strive to improve the guest experience throughout the resort, based upon our guests’ thoughtful feedback.  I deeply regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered during your stay, especially as you were visiting to celebrate your honeymoon with us.  In following up on the concerns you’ve detailed here, I have taken the time to promptly discuss your feedback with our management team.  I understand your level of disappointment, as you were unable to enjoy our luxurious cabanas at the Coliseum Pool due to a private event.  I am sincerely sorry to hear about the loss of your wine glasses, as clearly they are a treasured belonging. Knowing that many guests bring valuable items along, we provide safes in every room to safely store belongings. In following up regarding loss prevention, I learned that a loss report was not filed with The Resort’s on-site Security Department. I kindly encourage you to contact our Security professionals and file this report at your convenience.  Our talented culinary staff and service team in Andrea are dedicated to creating the finest epicurean experiences for each and every guest. I regret that your dining experience fell short of your expectations and our goals. I have followed up to address the impressions you've kindly detailed here.  Once again, I appreciate your time in sharing the unfortunate circumstances experienced during your stay.  Please contact me directly if I could be of personal assistance.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: We visited Pelican Hill twice duriong the Month of May on two separate weekends.  We went for my birthday and also again for Mother's Day.  We book through Whatahotel (Lorraine Travel) and always get the best deal, rate and service.  We receive a room upgrade, $100 resort credit, welcome amenity and breakfast for two.  Maria at Lorraine Travel always contacts the hotel personally to make sure we get all the perks and even our favorite room.  I highly recommend using this website to book.  As for the hotel, it is first class.  The pool is spectacular,and they have a world class spa and golf course.  We get an early check in on Saturday and a late check out on Sunday, so we get two full days for the price of one night.  This makes sense for us because we live just 20 minutes away

we booked a long week end here after a business trip to China and we were eager to see how relaxing it would be.It is important to note that although all the accomodations face the Pacific, it is purely '' facing ' and not seeing.The villas are set back a considerable way from the coastline and even though they are elevated you really see very little.In fact the first room offered to us faced the roof of another villa.Service in the resort was friendly and very accomodating,the main restaurant was very good ,although portions are very small.The pool area is beautiful with a circular pool and seating around it.Pool service was excellent as was the food around the pool.Spa was amazing with excellent facilities.Summing up.... a well run, luxurious resort, good food but actual ocean
This is by far one of the best resorts in the country. Beautiful buildings, land, view, amazing food. The rooms are lavish and very comfortable.

We stayed last summer and we're booked to stay in the villas but did not like how far away they felt to everything so moved to the bungalows and loved it . The rooms or I should say suites are all amazing we had one with lounge and extra bathroom which accommodated our family very well . The main pool is wonderful service we found to be very good despite some negative reviews food was fantastic I don't really know what benefit we would have felt by the villas as even though they have another pool and restaurant /bar I did not think it was anywhere as lovely to sit by as the main pool . Fab people watching as it is situated in a very affluent area so the bar drawing room was great to be in the evening . Good gym great spa beautiful area close to Disney ! all in all one of our
I enjoyed every minute of my week long stay at the Pelican Resort. It was absolutely great.

This place is simply amazing!   You will feel like royalty from the second you walk into the building to the time you check out. I went to Pelican on a business trip and loved every minute of it.  Make sure you visit the pool, and spa facilities. Jacuzzi, Sauna, and steam room were epic, and the cucumber water was to die for. I must have had 8 cups of it just in an hour.  We had our farewell dinner on the deck overlooking the ocean and pool; the views are/were fantastic. My favorite part of the room was the bathroom because of the deep bath tub, and the fact that every room is like a bungalow made you feel like you weren’t at a hotel at all. The rooms were comfortable and spacious, and the bed was so soft and comfortable that I had to buy the mattress pad for my own bed lol.

A brit abroad - different views perhaps than the "locals". Its 5 star 5***** all the way, nothing is too much trouble, the courtesy cars from the villas are brand new escolades (sp?) and they arrive in a instant. Food so far has been nothing short of awesome, the service 9 star, the butlers amazing and its raining - imagine how good this place might be in the sun. We are in the North Villa 506, a gentle jog (if you can be assed) to the club house, a view overlooking the sea and as quiet as quiet can be. Nice 2 bedroom, beautiful bathrooms, gorgeous sitting area, great kitchen (I'm a chef) and awesome TV/Hi-Fi. we are a family of 1 kid (13) and me and the wife.We are booking for next year....

This is a magnificent place to stay. We loved it!  We were blown away by the view from our villa!  It was spectacular...fire place in the living room and the bedroom.  Terrific bathroom off the master, as well as a second full bath with shower off the living room.  I would have given this 5 stars, had it not been for the food.  We thought it was a little lacking for such a nice resort.  The last morning there, a simple pancake breakfast with coffee was $35 with tip. Our business dinner was

We spent a weekend here. The suite was lovely. There was a problem with the heat not working in the livingroom area, but they fixed it for us. The food was excellent in all the restaurants, including room service. All the staff was friendly and helpful. The beds are a delight! The massage therapist was amazing. Perfection.

Summary Heading: Pelican Hill: a Knockout Punch in the OC
Summary: Overall Property: Lacking only a beachfront location, Pelican Hill is expansive, private, well-manicured and kept with an exceptional attention to detail. An experience of a weekend at this segment-leading property can only leave the well-informed travelled wanting more.   Rooms: At a generous 1.5x size any comparable property, the well-appointed rooms are a pleasure to be in. Combining the expansiveness of the property with the comfort of home, the bathrooms, beds, private patios and overall space exceeds the local alternatives so completely that to find fault would be almost unfair.   Spa: Vegas sizing + Italian motifs, but one hour from LA. Go figure. Gender specific jacuzzi, sauna and steam, along with fully appointed staffed lockers and regular schedule of exercise and yoga

Summary Heading: Pelican Hill is a Keeper- - A Slendid Experience in a Beautiful Resort Residence.
Summary: My wife and I recently stayed for 9 nights in early April at Pelican Hill in an ocean view (king bed) bungalow. We live in the heart of Phoenix-Scottsdale-Paradise Valley, Arizona  - - home to some of the country's most celebrated and gorgeous resorts, spas and golf courses. We travel to SoCal, especially the Newport Coast-Laguna Beach vicinity, several times each year. Having previously stayed at each of the Montage, the St. Regis and the Ritz (each of which are lovely properties), we decided to try Pelican Hill.  Pelican Hill more than lived up to its reputation. It eclipses each of its competitor resorts in terms of beauty, elegance, service and, perhaps most importantly, overall karma. This is not just another scenic hotel resort. Instead, when you stay at Pelican Hill you

Summary Heading: Only go if you are prepared that you must leave
Summary: From the weather to the service, this hotel is amazing. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The outside balcony is private and ours had an amazing view. Each room has it's own fireplace for those evenings that get chilly and beds must be made out of clouds because you float on them. Anyone that says a hotel room is just for sleeping has not stayed here. The service is impeccable from the check-in to the restaurants. I will say the prices are quite high, even for 5 star hotels, but well worth the extra. If you prefer simple, there's a nice Marriott down the street. I don't golf, but it's also worth getting a golf cart and just take a drive of the course. Enjoy your stay and you won't forget it.

Our stay at Pelican Hill is easily our favorite destination to date and will be an experience we will never forget. The staff provided us a 5 star experience from our ocean view bungalow, poolside cabana and the most amazing spa day. And the dining?  Wow!  Andrea, Pelican Grill, Coliseum - all highly recommended.  A heartfelt thank you to the Pelican Hill team for making our 10 year anniversary extra special. We have already booked a return stay for no special occasion other than to return to our home away from home!

Summary Heading: A most beautiful place to vacation- You'll wish you could move in!
Summary: Pelican Hill resort in Newport Beach, California is one of the most beautiful and relaxing resorts I have ever visited. My family has made annual trips to Newport coast since leaving California to live in Las Vegas some 13 years ago : That being said, the past two visits have been spent at the best of all resorts in the are. Having stayed at  both the St Regis and the Ritz Carlton several times I can tell you that Pelican Hill offers the most family friendly, upscale and relaxing stay of the three. The resort is laid out among acres of sprawling terraced landscapes, many with views of the ocean and or the golf course. You will never feel crowded  due to the resort's casita bungalow style of accomodations , which allow guests to drive-up to their room. The main building houses a

This has to be one of the most breathtaking venues in the world! Truly eye candy and very relaxing with one of the most unique concepts of a hotel that I've ever experienced in a great way.  I would totally recommend this property for relaxation, privacy or exclusivity because it gives you all of it in aces!!!  The service concept is present but there is a need for some service training in certain areas such as housekeeping opening the door without knocking, leaving the balcony door open after cleaning, and restaurant staff that wasn't prepared to be on the floorbut yet serving us (didn't know soup of the day, unfamiliar with how to charge house accounts, etc).  Now the super stars of service were the valet, guest transport, and the spa. Chris in the spa was the best spa

The golf courses are simply spectacular, We were apprehensive about having to share our golfing experience with a caddy at first but T..........s was a great help, the only down side was being reminded what it was like to be 20+ years younger as he sprinted from divot to bunker, shooting yardage for all throughout the round. The condition of the courses and the views are hard to match. Lunch at the clubhouse was very good, fresh seafood with a great grilled flavor. The service while friendly was severely lacking in training for such a target audience. The waitress stacked our finished plates right at my setting, somewhat unnerving at the cutlery clattered threatening my lap.  The room was spacious with huge ceilings and a great private view. The bathroom was equally Grande with
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent experience with us. While I’m delighted to hear that you enjoyed the Golf Club, bungalow, pool and spa, I regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered and detailed here.   I understand your level of disappointment, and appreciate the opportunity to improve upon the areas that fell short of your expectations and our goals. To this end, I invite you to contact me directly, so we may discuss your feedback further. I have provided my contact information in a private message to you.   As we continuously strive to enhance the guest experience throughout the resort, your thoughtful input is valued. I thank you again for providing your thoughts here, and we look forward to the opportunity to serve you again soon.   Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Pelican Hill.  The rooms are very spacious and comfortable.  The resort itself is lovely with a beautiful spa and excellent restaurants.  The Italian restaurant was excellent and our breakfasts were delicious.  The service was very good and they were most accommodating.

Summary Heading: Not as great as everyone says
Summary: Beautiful property however service extremely slow. Staff friendly enough however terrible lack of follow up-even complaining to the Assistant General Manager. Room service menu limited not worth the money
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent experience with us. I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed our beautiful “Italian seaside village,” but regret the unfortunate circumstances surrounding service that you’ve noted here.  I understand your level of disappointment regarding staff follow-up and room service that fell short of your expectations and our goals. As we continuously strive to heighten service levels throughout the resort, I kindly invite you to call me directly to discuss your experience in further detail. I have sent my contact details to you separately in a private message.  Your thoughtful feedback is valued, and I look forward to the opportunity to speak with you about your experience in more detail.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary Heading: Property is fantastic.  Service could be improved.
Summary: We visited Pelican Hill for a week in March.  Let me begin by saying that the property is amazing.  The grounds are immaculately maintained and the entire area is pristinely clean. If I were giving a rating for the property alone, it would be a 5.  Due to service issues, though, I had to give it a 4.   We were in a one bedroom / two bath bungalow with an ocean view.  The bungalows are very large with a bedroom and very large living room area.  We also had a private patio with ocean view.  It had two lounge chairs and a table with umbrella and chairs.  It was lovely to sit outside and enjoy the view and a drink or meal. The bungalow had two large flat screen tvs with bose sound systems.  The sound systems were difficult to figure out, but then again, I am not great with such
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent experience with us. While I’m delighted to hear that you enjoyed Bungalow stay, The Spa and activities in the surrounding area, I understand your level of disappointment regarding service that fell short of your expectations and our goals.  I regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered, and have taken this opportunity to discuss solutions with the managers of the areas you mentioned. As we continuously strive to heighten service levels throughout the resort, I kindly invite you to call me directly to discuss your experience further and have sent my contact details to you separately in a private message. Your thoughtful feedback is valued, and I thank you again for providing it here. We look forward to the opportunity to serve you again soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: Today is our last day  and I do not want to go home. This resort is incredible! The staff is great too. Our room was a bungalow that was like a studio apartment with a gas fireplace. The room also had a terrace with a view of the ocean. We had a wet bar and refrigerator. If I had a microwave and/or stove top, it would have been perfect. Believe me though, I was still able to manage.  The spa- worth every penny. The restaurants- delicious. We also liked being chauffered around the property in Mercedes cars and Escalades! Pelican Hill is a place I will return to again!

Summary Heading: Beautiful place to stay with a price fitting
Summary: The place and overall experience was excellent. I would never spend or stay at a place like this if I had chosen it. But we were invited with all expenses paid. So for that reason I might have a different point of view.  The grounds are immaculate, you feel like if you were somewhere in an Italian village with a view of the Mediterranean. From our bungalow we had a view of the rooftops below us and at a distance the Pacific Ocean.    The room was beautiful. We stayed in bungalow 330 and I can't say that there was anything missing. The bathroom was huge with a set of windows you can open while you're in the bathtub and enjoy the view. About the only thing wrong was the same complaint we heard from everyone "the coffee maker would only brew one cup of coffee, when you clearly put

The property is very impressive at first sight, but things just didn't go as planned. Our reservation for a king size bed Bungalow was not able to accommodate as promised, although they offered to upgrade us to a Villa we didn't take it as our plan was to experience their Bungalows for summer trip choice. Anyway, we took Bungalow with two queen size beds to stick to the plan. You would think the relaxing time finally begin, think twice. As we entered the room, we realized that the view from our room is different from the gorgeous brochures the resort sent us over the years. Then the TV doesn't work, we couldn't figure out even the basic - how to turn up the volume, called front desk for help and the help never came (they came after 3 and half hours later when we called again).
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent experience with us. While I’m delighted to hear you enjoyed the beautiful setting, I sincerely regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered that fell short of your expectations and our goals.   As the top-ranked Resort in the country, we strive to provide the best possible experience and gracious personalized service to each guest, especially during times of high demand when the resort is at full capacity. Rest assured, the inconveniences you experienced and detailed here have been addressed with the appropriate managers of each department.  Your thoughtful feedback is valued, as we continuously seek ways to heighten our service levels throughout every corner of the Resort. We look forward to the opportunity to serve you again soon.  Kind regards,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: We stayed in the Villas at the hotel & they were absolutely gorgeous!!!! The hotel provided above & beyond customer service. The person who showed us the best service was Sergio who worked in the restaurant at Villas Clubhouse. I will definitely come back and refer this place to others.

I just came back from Pelican Hill. I had booked a king ocean view room for my birthday. Upon arrival I was told that they were upgrading me to a suite for my birthday. Reception was so nice, the valet personal was very friendly. The suite was just amazingly beautiful. Spacious, bright and clean.   If you want to move around the area (access the villas for ex), they have shuttles right away, they were town cars and SUV and each driver was sooo nice and friendly.   All personal were so nice and helpful. We ate at the Coliseum grill by the pool  and had drinks at the Villa Club house. The pools are nice (heated), towels are available with plenty of lounging chairs.   This place is very popular for weddings and receptions so before booking  you might want to inquire if the Coliseum

Excellent property, very good service, excellent bungalow rooms with fire place. The clubhouse restaurant is very good. Perfect for a romantic getaway, definitely would recommend, can't wait to go back.
OMG I was blown away at this resort. The staff was great. The views were as if I haved died and gone to heaven. Thank you for the wonderful expierence. Staff was amazingly friendly.

Summary Heading: A Travel Writer's Review - Ultra Luxurious, Ultra Private
Summary: In 2008, the luxe Pelican Hill resort opened, setting the bar (believe it or not) higher for southern California luxury resorts.  This lovely hotel, resort, golf paradise and spa is situated in the foothills between Newport Beach and Laguna Beach.    PALLADIAN PERFECTION  I have classified Pelican Hill as an ultra-luxurious hotel for several reasons.  First, the resort takes incredible pride in its design and in particular, the intricate detail in the design.  Pelican Hill pays homage to Andrea Palladio, an Italian Renaissance master of architectural design, born in 1508 in Padua, Italy.  Palladio’s name at birth was Andrea Di Pietro della Gondola; it was changed by scholar Gian Giorgio Trissino to mimic the name of the Greek goddess of war and wisdom, Pallas Athene, often

Having stayed here an abbreviated 2 days last year, I was aunable to fully understand the dynamics of this resort.  I knew it was good but it took a 4-day weekend in March of 2012 to truly appreciate all the resort has to offer ... and I'm thinking that it likely offers even more than what I had the time to experience.  We were greeted warmly on Friday on arrival - nothing fake about it ... as we all felt there was a genuine appreciation for us visiting their establishment.  We checked into our villas then made our way to the Spa to enjoy a massage as a warm-up to our weekend .. and what a start it was.  After a quick stop in the hot tub, enjoyed an 80 minute massage under the attenting hands of one of the most expereinced masseuse's ever - she was wonderful ... almost fell

My husband and I were lucky enough to stay here on a business trip. We absolutely loved it here! The only negative was that we only had 3 days to spend there! The staff was super helpful and friendly, the room was beautiful, clean, and comfortable. The view was beautiful and the pool area was so serene.  Overall I enjoyed my spa experience also. I did the standard massage, I'd suggest trying a deeper tissue if you really like your massages to be "productive", as this was more of a relaxing oil rub, it didn't really get any kinks out, but it was certainly enjoyable and relaxing. The facial was really wonderful and I really enjoyed the esthetician (I think her name was Rebecca). The spa facility was perfect, modern, clean, and quiet.  I found the resort grounds to be perfectly

Summary Heading: As close to perfect as it gets
Summary: Stayed here back in December of 2010 and visiting again this month.  This place is simply spectacular.  Rooms are gorgeous! Full of amenities.  Great bathrooms.  The service is first class.  The place is spotless clean.  Food is great.  The meeting room facilities are awesome with great views and all the amenities one needs to conduct a great meeting.  The view of Catalina island are stunning.  Both golf courses are great.  Newport is a great area.  It's pricey but that is to be expected at a hotel of this caliber and when they deliver, it makes it that much easier to accept.  Can't say enough good things about Pelican Hill!

Drove down for the weekend with my husband, 1.5 year old, parents, and sister's family (husband and 6 month old).  By far, probably one of the most luxurious hotels.  We stayed in a 3-bedroom villa, which was nice then most houses I have seen.  The balcony/patio had a very nice view of the golf course and ocean.  Both the Colliseum pool and the Villa pool were great.  The Colliseum pool is overwhelmingly beautiful.  I think my daughter had the best time of all.  The villa had a large main area with a full kitchen, living area, and dining room.  2 of the bedrooms had King Bed and one of the bedrooms had 2 queens.  Upon special request, they will bring a crib.  Having stayed at a few hotels now with babies/toddlers, the crib was perfect, standard size.  The biggest negative about

We stayed at Pelican Hills for 3 nights for my husband's company get-away and this place is just amazing. From the extremely friendly staff to the beautifully appointed suites to the incredible views of the pacific......every service we enjoyed at the resort exceeded our expectations. I had the most incredible facial at the spa and the golf course was awesome. Pelican Hills is worth every penny, can't wait to go back.

This resort is beautiful.  There are endless amounts of grand marble and well appointed elegant rooms.  There are not any attached rooms to the main lobby building as there are for example in the Lodge at Pebble Beach.  Every thing is up the hill or down the hill.  If you want to go to the spectacular pool you  dial up a shuttle and wait until they come and collect you. The room is either a bungalow somewhat closer to the resort center or away in either the North or South Villas.  We did not care for this lay out at all.  If you are in a villa you are in splendid isolation ... too far away for me.  The service was not what it should of been the staff was rather indifferent.  I agree with some other posters who have stated they felt something was "off" I felt this as well.  As a

Summary Heading: Beautiful design and location.  Impersonal service.
Summary: The setting, design, overall physical ambience is beautiful.  Everything is grand and tasteful. The pool is incrediblel.  The room was large and comfortable.  However, something felt off.  The service was not welcoming, rather impersonal and a bit indifferent.  They don't try to accommodate your needs, as one would expect at this level and price of hotel.  I believe it's those little things that really make a difference at a top quality hotel.

This is the best hotel in which I have had the privilege to stay.  That is saying a lot as I travel quite a bit.   Dining here is no ordinary experience and the rooms (bungalow) are truly superior in terms of location, furnishings, appointments and size.   The grounds are equally manicured and beautiful.  The service was excellent and we had requested an early checkin and our room was ready as we requested.  As I didn't pay the bill (I was at a business meeting) I cannot comment on the cost of the visit.  I would certainly return if given the opportunity.

During my stay at pelican hill, here is the good, and the bad.  GOOD  pretty resort roman arkitecture, room 104 large well appointed with wonderful beds, bathroom was impeccible with deep tub. Large patio with lighting. Room spotless and clean. Colosium grill good, pool large saltwater, nice grounds. quite peaceful. Staff was great. Nicley treated. can't wait to return.   Bad   had to leave.  Can't wait to return, would highly reccomend to anyone.

Summary Heading: One of the most beautiful resorts I've ever been too.
Summary: This property is stunning.  The views of the ocean, sunset and Catalina island are breathtaking. The service is phenomenal.  The rooms are quite large and tastefully decorated with a gas fireplace in every room.  The bathrroms are extremely spacious. I was made to feel like a queen.  The food was so good - top quality and prepared to perfection!  A must for everyone's bucket list!

Everything about this resort is outstanding -- the grounds, staff, lodging, etc.  All of our needs and whims were cared for during the five days we spent in a villa.  Can't say enough good things about the staff. The perfect place for a family or friends getaway.

Just got back from a four-night stay at Pelican Hill and loved every minute of it.  Once a year I meet up with four college girlfriends for our annual girls trip.  We have stayed at some posh places across the country and Pelican Hill ranks right up there with the best.  We stayed in a Villa, which proved to be a fabulous two bedroom suite.  The service was impeccable, the pools are fabulous and the spa was top notch.  We enjoyed our dinner at the Grill but will say dinner at Andrea was slightly disappointing.  Laguna Beach and Newport Beach are quick drives away.  Would retrun to Pelican Hill in a heartbeat!

Never have I stayed in such a luxurious and tranquil as all the others that I have stayed at before. I must say that I thoroughly enjoyed my every minute of stay in this villa, Pelican Hill Resort. On reaching our destination, I was completely blown away by the lush greenery in the gardens surrounding the villas and the beautifully-furnished and cosy room.   Pelican Hill Resort is strategically-located along the coast in Newport Beach and it is a perfect place for you to escape the hustle and bustle of city life. Besides enjoying the state-of-the-art facilities provided, you can take a short walk to the soft sandy beach for a stroll to enjoy the breathtaking scenery or you can take a leisurely walk around the huge landscaped surroundings where you can just enjoy nature’s beauty.

Summary Heading: Deserving of #1 resort in the US
Summary: Pelican Hill is a true 5 star resort!  It is exquisitely beautiful, quiet and out of the way. Perfect for golfers, spa-goers or people who just want their privacy.  We stayed for 2 weeks in a king bungalow overlooking the Ocean.  The rooms are not directly on the ocean but they have ocean views and are spacious, comfortable, new and clean. We had a double fireplace, huge bathrooms, huge bedroom- everything was perfect.  The staff was amazing and everyone bent over backwards to make sure we were taken care of.  The property is very large so it never appears crowded or busy- even over Christmas.  The landscaping and property are impeccable.  We played a lot of golf.  Both the North and South courses have stunning views.  We preferred the North as do most people our caddies told

Stayed here for a corporate retreat in January 2012.  The rooms are lovely and they all seem to have magic views of the ocean.  The staff is exceptional and went out of their way to make sure we had a wonderful time.  On our first day there, one of the shuttle drivers gave us an impromptu ride down to Crystal Cove beach for lunch.  The grounds are so large that you need either the shuttle bus or the ubiquitous golf carts to get around, otherwise you have to walk a lot.  Wasn't a big problem for us, as we liked the exercise.    Restaurants were nice and the food was quite delicious.  Access to the beach was nice, but again, you probably need the shuttle rather than walking down.   Overall it was a great experience and we loved our time there.

Summary Heading: Everything you would expect from a resort such as this !!!
Summary: I stayed at the resort at pelican hill recently on a business trip with Porsche ( who i work for ), I was lucky enough to have my room paid for for a few nights while i paid for a few nights myself as i extended my stay.  I arrived at John Wayne airport and picked up my rental car ( i believe its about a $30 cab ride ), the drive to the resort took about 20 minutes and it was easy to find ( using my GPS :) ), i pulled into the reception area and was checked in in minutes, i was greeted warmly and everyone had a smile and a greeting for me.  I had a bungalow reserved, which i had one of the employees lead me to it in a golf cart while i followed in my rental car , i was staying in 439 which while offering a great view is a little far away from some of the amenities ( more on that
This hotel is great.  Perfect beds and room service.  Stunning views. No doubt I will come back
Everything about Pelican Hill is outstanding.  The rooms, the service, the grounds, the facilites.

We were lucky enough to spend our last night on our babymoon/last hurrah vacation in a beautiful Villa at Pelican Hills. We shared a three bedroom with my sister and her family (7 of us total) and it was perfect! We had a spectacular view of the golf course and ocean with Catalina Island in perfect site. We spent the first afternoon at the Villa pool, which is the smaller of the resort pools, but it was still quite large. The waitstaff was attentive and we couldn't have asked for a better day.  Our Villa was well appointed with every amentity we could think of. The bulter service was great and when we needed a wine opener, we got one within 5 minutes! We had room service breakfast and it wasn't over the top expensive and then spent a lazy morning/afternoon up at the main
A fabulous resort hotel; comfortable, modern, chic, stylish and friendly. Views outside over the amazing circular pool at sunset are something else.

Summary Heading: Great Weekend Getaway from LA--especially with a small child
Summary: This was a great weekend getaway from LA.  It takes less than an hour to get there from Santa Monica but feels like a world away--beautiful views and very serene setting.  The service is amazing from the moment you pull up.  Everyone is very friendly and helpful.  We had brunch at the restaurant by the pool while we waited for our room.  The view was beautiful and the food was delicious, though nothing particularly unique. We stayed in the ocean view villa, which was a two room suite--bedroom, living room, two bathrooms and a huge terrace. I really liked that the two areas (bedroom and living room) were separated by a actual door.
