Our son came with us and it was very easy to put him down for a nap in one of the rooms, shut the door so that he wouldn't be disturbed, and do our

Don't get me wrong, when I say like in heaven. True there are not many guests. It is just the way you feel - idyllic, special and peaceable. The best way to make vocations- if you have the necessary wherewithal!

We stayed three nights in a 3 bed villa with another family overlooking the golf course and ocean.  Unfortunately the smog from LA was always visible as there was little wind over the three days.  Apart from that, two beautiful large communal pools and we had room service one night - excellent - and the restaurant another night which was also terrific.  We also played golf which was challenging even for our low handicappers.  One objection - $8 for a takeaway coffee from the golf cafe one morning - bit excessive!  Villa has a well supplied kitchen, large enough lounge and deck overlooking the golf.  We would definitely stay again and recommend to other friends.

An amazing property with a staff that is phenomenal.  The restaurants on site were excellent and everywhere you turned someone was offering help.   The only down-side is cost and additional costs here and there.

Summary Heading: Outstanding in every way; very impressed
Summary: I have never felt compelled to write a review of a property before I have even checked but I must.  In every way, Pelican Hill has exceeded my expectations.  The staff could not have been friendlier, the accomodations so comfortable and warm, the facilities, food, spa, golf, etc.) first class.  One of the best resorts I have ever been to.

Summary Heading: Nice setting, beautiful views and good facilities
Summary: There are several top-notch resorts in the area; we (my husband, my teenage son and I) had already been at The Ritz-Carlton Laguna Niguel and had wanted to try another one. It proved difficult to find such a place at least if you don’t want to pay exorbitant prices, so we were lucky enough to come across the Pelican Hill. Of course it isn’t a bargain but you get value for money there. The hotel doesn’t lie on the beach but it’s situated in the hills above the Crystal Cove State Park. Nonetheless, you have expansive views of the Pacific Ocean and there is a coach service from resort lobby to Crystal Cove where you get a chair and umbrella set up from the Beachcomber attendants. The grounds of Pelican Hill are vast und pristine. As the hotel didn’t accommodate three persons in a

We stay in one of the North Villas. The resort was even more beautiful and luxurious than I'd pictured having read these reviews. The villa was a large 2 bedroom, excellently furnished, and overlooking the ocean. It came with twice daily housecleaning as well as a fully equipped kitchen.  Our concierge, Akita, cared for our every need, including recommending fun activities and finding us an emergency dentist on a weekend.   Even though it was cold outside, we swam in the pools which were heated to 82 degrees.  We had a great yoga class at the spa. This was a very comfortable resort for a family with children as well as groups of adults.  The location is very convenient to activities in the area although it is not right on the beach. We mostly ate off-resort, but we had drinks by

Visited in November of 2011 on business.  The resort and the rooms are just beautiful.  Rather spreadout so you can either take a nice walk , use shuttle bus or possibly the Bentleys they have out front.  A few larger business group were having conferences but the resort still felt uncrowded and peaceful.  Pool area is lovely but eventhough you have a view of the ocean the beach is a short drive down the hill.  Last evening had a fantastic dinner at Andrea--must try to the risotto.

This was the nicest property I've ever stayed at. The rooms and the views were phenomenal, service was great and the amenities were first class. 2 golf courses, a spa, trails and all sorts of activities make it so you don't have to leave. I played golf on the North Course and it was well worth it. Just a warning, though, make sure you can afford this place, as it will likely cost in the $600 to $1000+ range.

Summary Heading: High end resort-without high end prices!
Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at Pelican Hill. I thought the staff was extremely personable, polite, and provided excellent service- The Pelican Grill has excellent food & service also, in a beautiful, sophisticated setting. The Coliseum, however, also had excellent service, but very lousy food! The bungalows are beautiful, private, and very large. I also thought the spa was great, however my therapist had cold hands, and my room was cold, and I was getting over the flu. So, that wasn't very helpful. But it's always nice to go someplace where you are treated in a superior manner, yet not paying astronomical prices. Lots of value-I will definitely be back! Yes, and I agree that the only thing lacking is no ocean view @ the pool. It's hard to have it all, I suppose!

Summary Heading: Beautiful Setting but Would Have Liked Something Closer to Beach
Summary: Definitely a high end resort with all the amenities.  Service was good, villas were nice and roomy.  Bad experience with the golf club which put a bit of a damper on our trip.  We had scheduled a tee time for two.  When my husband and son arrived, they were told they had to play with two other people.  This was never mentioned when the reservation was made and they were truly looking forward to spending time with each other.  They declined playing with two strangers and were billed $150 for canceling the reservation.  The treatment by the golf club was not the kindest, especially for a guest of the resort who spent a considerable amount of money.  We most likely won't return.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent visit. I’m delighted to read that you enjoyed your Resort stay, but understand your level of disappointment in your Golf Club experience that fell short of your expectations and our goals.  With Pelican Hill’s current ranking as #1 California Golf Resort by Condé Nast Traveler magazine readers, we are fortunate to experience heightened demand. However, whenever business levels allow it, the Golf Club accommodates special guest requests, such as two-player rounds.  During busy peak holidays (such as December when you visited), rounds are in the highest demand and we strive to accommodate all golfers who wish to play. Arranging foursomes is standard protocol at most popular public golf courses, including ours.  Once again, your feedback is very important to us and I thank you for posting your thoughts here. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you and I invite you to contact me directly, if I could be of personal assistance on your next visit.  Kind regards,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: Wonderful place to stay. I was upgraded to an ocean view for NO charge and felt that the staff was very attentive. It was great service from check in to check out. I loved to just hang out by the pool and do nothing. I will be coming back in the summer!

We stayed just 1 night for new years.  Amazing staff and facilities.  My son is already begging to go back.  Beautiful full size crib and baby soaps etc for him.  Pool staff really great. Free wifi but $10 for a tiny bag of coffee really sucks.  I read other reviews so I took my own coffee and was good to go.  The coffee maker in room grinds coffee if that's your preference. Really fancy yet easy going hotel. They brought us a complimentary plate of chocolates for new years eve. Very nice touch. Burger at coliseum grill was super yummy! Can't wait to go back.
For those who want the best!  From check in to check out the well trained staff make sure you are well taken care of.  The staff seem to genuinely care about your welfare.  Highly recommended.

I have been coming to Peilican Hill to eat since it first opened. I live locally, so it took until December 2011 to actually stay here.    I decided to surprise my husband with a overnight getaway.  I expected A LOT from this hotel room based on the quality of the rest of the hotel. We were upgraded to an ocean view, no charge! The room and view were beautiful.  Our attendant was very helpful. Everything seemed perfect until I laid on the bed.  It was badly collapsed on the two sleeping sections of the king.  You could not lay in the middle of the bed without rolling to one side.  For a hotel of this caliber to have badly damaged beds is unacceptable.  We also had a very negative experience while trying to book spa appointments through the hospitality line of the hotel.  On hold

stayed here with family for christmas weekend.  we had 9 people and got the 4-bedroom, 4-bathroom villa.  the villa was very clean and organized.  each room has a flatscreen TV and the living room and kitchen area is huge.  each villa had a patio with a glass fence overlooking the ocean north course.    we played a round of golf christmas day on the ocean south course.  for any services within the resort, you do not need to drive yourself.  there is a full service shuttle that will take you anywhere in the resort (hotel, spa, golf course, mar vista).  the course was in great shape and our forecaddie, kirk, provided excellent tips on our game.  the driving range is really nice.  you hit into an upslope canyon with a few bunkers and green.  they had 2 putting greens, but they

We were blown away by this resort. Absolute luxury. Beautiful architecture / gardens. We stayed in a four bedroom villa (No 823) just before Christmas. We actually used it as a base to visit Disneyland which is 20 minutes up the road, and only wished we had spent more time at the hotel itself ! The hotel resort itself is very smart, clean and the food / services excellent. Our villa had a terrace overlooking the gold course and the ocean, a magnificent kitchen and four well-appointed bedrooms. Local attactions like Crystal Cove, Balboa Island and proximity to Newport and Laguna Beach made it the perfect spot for our family of six (four boys aged 3-13). Security / valet parking made it seem all the more exclusive.

Summary Heading: An absolutely beautiful place to stay
Summary: The Pelican Hill property is an oasis. Reminds me of my time in Italy. Immaculate grounds and top notch service. Check in was a breeze with Brandon at the helm. My Bungalow was upgraded, with a gorgeous view of the Pacific. It was situated in a nice courtyard with a fountain. Although, the resort was at a high capacity it appeared desolate (I like that). The room, with it's soaring high ceiling, fireplace, and patio with a view was awesome. The room had shutters to open from the huge bathroom to enjoy the view. Nice flat screen tv, with bose system was nice. (Rooms could use an ipod clock).   Room service was quick and precise. Served with a smile. Also, nice job done on my free shoe shine.  Andrea (the signature restaurant) was spectacular! Under the watchful eye of Mr. Marco
The resort is open and has amazing views. The rooms are big and cozy, with a fireplace. The staff are there to make your stay perfect and it was.

We normally stay at Bacara or the Ritz for a quick weekend get a way, but this time we heard so much about PHR that we had to give it a try. PHR was by far the nicest of the 2 by leaps and bounds. My wife and I stayed two nights to celebrate her birthday. We booked the smallest and least expensive room Garden Bugalow (840 sq ft) on American Express and wella we were upgraded to an Ocean Front 1Br and 2bath Bungalow (1650sqft)...a dream come true. Everything was simply amazing, service was extrodinary. We dined at Andrea and as others haved raved about, the Risotto served table side for an appetizer is simply to die for. I could go on and on but I would only bore you. Read the other reviews as they are all pretty accurate. One thing for sure, be sure to book a spa appointment it

Pelican Hill is just down the street from where I live but when I stay there it feels like I am far away from home.  The Villas are beautiful and private.  The pool, cabanas, gym, bar and restaurant at the villa's are nice and quite.   The staff will accommodate  any needs you may have.   This is the perfect getaway for anyone it's also a great meeting place for friends for a long weekend.  The property at Pelican is breathtaking and the grounds are pristine.  The hotel part of the resort is also a jewel.  The pool is round and very big, the restaurants are delicious. Andrea's we frequent on a regular basis not just when we stay at the resort and its a favorite.  The spa love it, always feel like I am the only one there, even when it's full.  The golf course is very scenic and

If you are a value oriented traveler do NOT overlook Pelican Hill. The locale is stunning and the hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The service at every level was absolutely outstanding. Some would consider the resort expensive. Not for what you get. I will make the flight from the east coast again just to stay at Pelican Hill.
Our room and the service were excellent.  Take the resort shuttle to the Beachcomber restaurant at nearby Crystal Cove Beach.
This hotel gets no publicity but it was tremendous. Excellent room, great service, and it is amazingly beautifeal.

We had a four bedroom villa for our family over Thanksgiving and it was the peak of luxury - we even had our own butler ! The villa was spacious with a fabulous view of the sunset, the staff was terrific and the dining deluxe.  We loved the perk of a pool and clubhouse for the villa renters - it was very private.  We took advantage of the beach at Crystal Cove which is over three empty miles of sandy beach and tide pools.  Impossible to believe that this still exists in Orange County !

Pelican Hill was all I hoped for and more.  We were upgraded upon arrival from a 2 bedroom villa to a 3 (Amex fine hotels and resorts).  It was gorgeous - shiny and new and luxurious in every important way.  Bathrooms, bedrooms, kitchen, view, just outstanding.  While you do feel like you are in a townhome (you are) it's still so much better than a hotel room when traveling with children.  There was more than enough space for all 7 of us (3 kids, 4 adults) and the service was excellent.  We had Thanksgiving room serviced in - how great is that!  The food was wonderful and the clean up was a breeze.  We loved biking down the hill to Crystal Cove and spending most of Thanksgiving day at the beach.  We also spent time at the pool and when it was chilly the staff brought out

Summary Heading: One of the nicest and most service oriented resorts ever
Summary: I've stayed at the Ritz Laguna Niguel and the Surf and Sand Laguna and liked them both.  The Pelican Hill Resort was by far the nicest of the 3.  Stayed for 3 nights in what I believe was the smallest and least expensive room (840 sq ft) with a beautiful walk out patio with a lovely view of the garden.  We ate at the Coliseum for Thanksgiving lunch and had a beautiful view of the golf course, ocean and pool area.  On our second day, we had massages and there was a special at the spa making them $80 each whichis unheard of at a resort.  My only negative comments are: 1) Fri-Sun and holidays, the same massage goes up to $165 which just seems ridiculous...I get maybe charging 20% on weekends (although actually I really don't) but as a result we skipped at least another massage we

Summary Heading: Nice property, like Terranea on steroids
Summary: The Resort at Pelican Hill is a monstrously large property overlooking a golf course and the ocean in Orange County.  Real pain to get there off the toll roads ($2.25 each way!), but once you arrive you'll note the sheer size of the property, which is not conveniently walkable (they have shuttles to take you around, though sometimes their response rate is not very prompt).    The one-room hotel rooms are fine, with large private balconies overlooking the ocean (mine had an overgrown garden right beside it).  Fireplaces in the room are a nice touch, as is a bathroom tub that extends into the bedroom area.  Television down at the other end of the room is a bit inconvenient to watch in the tub, however.  Bathroom amenities are great, and the bathroom itself is quite large.  They

Summary Heading: Excellent lunch at the Coliseum restaurant!
Summary: Recently we were in Southern CA looking for different locations for our business seminars. We decided to review the Pelican Hill resort. We stopped in for a quick overview of the resort to see if it would accommodate our needs. In doing so we had the pleasure of eating at the Coliseum restaurant. The experience got me thinking about how reviews can influence our decisions, not just in terms of what we order at a restaurant, but as to whether or not we will stay at a resort or even go to a restaurant at all .I certainly find professional reviews helpful and interesting to read, but, good or bad, I try not to let them diminish my curiosity about a restaurant or resort.  I have been to many resorts across the country and must say how impressed I was with the quality of service that

We stayed here in September for business.  Rooms are lovely, large very comfortable.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Lovely ocean views from the rooms and the grounds .  I would definitely like to return .

My husband and I recently were able to  spend a long weekend at this phenomenal resort. We stayed in a cottage that was spacious, had a fireplace, patio with privacy, spacious sitting area and huge bathroom. The grounds were lovely and well kept. My husband golfed one of the days and stated the course and more ocean views than many other coastal courses he has played. Spa was great... food was delicous, staff friendly, really not one complaint or concern with this resort. We will go back, and I hope soon!

Summary Heading: Wonderful location, great service and beautiful rooms.
Summary: This resort provided excellent service! The rooms are spacious.

Pelican Hill surpassed our high expectations.   We normally stay at the Ritz, Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental - and Pelican Hill did not disappoint.  At check-in, they upgraded us to a suite, which was larger than our NYC apartment! The suite was well-appointed and very spacious.  We had a lovely ocean view.  The staff was very friendly.  When walking around the property, we ran into one of the people who was at the front desk when we checked in the day prior.  He remembered our names when he greeted us!  At check-in, we were given a certificate for a free body scrub with the purchase of a spa treatment.  So I booked a much-needed massage, which was heavenly.  Also went on the morning beach walk.  Highly recommend this.  Overall, we loved Pelican Hill and fully expect to return

My husband and I had an amazing experience at the resort.  The property is spectacular.  From the moment you drive in, you feel as if you are in another world. The architecture and views are second to none.  The staff was exceptionally attentive.  We celebrated our wedding anniversary and were treated with many tasty indulgences compliments of the resort.  For lunch, I recommend the Coliseum's seared ahi tuna and mango margarita.  As for dinner, Andrea must not be missed.  If amazing culinary cuisine and again exceptional service is what you desire this is the place to be. And what a special treat it was that the excutive chef came over to chat with us and wished us a happy anniversay with two glasses of Prosecco. The accomodations are warm and inviting, nothing like a

The hotel is a faux italian design with an interior that is pretty conservative in the way most upscale U.S resorts like Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons tend to be-but is very comfortable and we found all the staff to be very efficient and friendly.We ate in all of the hotel restaurants and found the food and service to be very good and the prices ok for this class of resort.The golf and the spa are quite expensive but are both fantastic and well worth treating yourself to.The rooms are very nice and the huge bathrooms are simply fab.For a few days of pampering in L.A. this hotel is perfect.

The rooms are all individual bungalows which provided a peaceful, quiet retreat. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. My bungalow had a fireplace which I enjoyed immensely with the cool evenings. The bathroom was quite a treat with a large travertine shower and soaking tub with bubble bath. They thought of everything! The property was beautiful. I enjoyed wandering around. We ate most of our meals at the resort. The food was incredible. It was too chilly to swim but the pool was large and beautiful. The golf course was gorgeous but admittedly I do not golf so that is all I can say about the golf course. I went with a bunch of friends, we each had our own rooms. We did a lot of fun stuff but could not wait to get back to our bungalows and soak in the tub! (no kids,no

Stayed here while on a recent business trip and LOVED everything about this resort! The gym is probably THE best Hotel gym I have ever used. So clean and plenty of equipment, water, etc. and included in the price of the stay. I didn't get to use the pool, but wished my family were with me because it looked so luxurious!  My room was really clean and nice, and very large. It had everything i could possibly need for a two night stay.   I loved it and would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Luxury....and then some. An gorgeous setting, perfect villas, and a drop dead view. Pinch me....

My husband and I had the pleasure of dining at the Pelican Hill this past weekend.  Words can not describe how fantastic our experience was.  We chose the restaurant by the pool.  Our food was superb, the atmosphere was out of this world but it was the individual attention given to us that took me back.  All of the wait staff were prompt and courteous, our food arrived in a very timely fashion, and we felt as if our table was in a VIP section.  The manager came by to introduce himself, engaged us in friendly conversation, and even went so far as to offer us suggestions on meal selection.  Before our meal was concluded a female supervisor stopped by to ensure our experience was superior.  This truly impressed us and I can say with confidence we will be back to dine at the Pelican

Summary Heading: Very good experience and worthy of a visit
Summary: Overall excellent. Great rooms and all service delivered at levels one would expect of deluxe property, including golf and spa experiences. Internal resort transportation and room service very good which given logistics of resort is critical.only weakness is at pool restaurant which was consistently slow and inaccurate food delivery.

I recently returned from a 4 day stay in a 3 bedroom Pelican Hill villa. Six of us stayed in total comfort. The villa was lovely - 2 huge master bedrooms with their own huge bathrooms, and one slightly smaller bedroom with a full bath across the hall. There was a spacious living room, kitchen, and dining area, along with a large balcony with a wonderful view of the golf course and ocean.  We spent one afternoon at the spa, which was lovely as well, and enjoyed lunch by the beautiful Coliseum pool. The property would be absolutely stunning for a wedding.   Service was generally quite good and responsive. We had one small incident where we found ants in one of the bedrooms, and maintenance quickly came and sprayed, sending housekeeping to change the bedding when we asked.   I
I have travelled and stayed at many beautiful resorts. This was by far the nicest.  The bungalows are built and decorated so nicely and comfortably it was better than home.
We had lunch at the Colliseum over looking the pool and it was breathtaking. The food and the service was first class.

When  I came here I was never so happy. The Service, Food, Price and General stuff was top standard. We had a beautiful view as well as quick ascess to The Coliseum pool which is currently the biggest round- shaped pool in the world. I couldn't even complain about anything as this was too good for its price and will definitely be coming back to New Port. Overall Great standard one of my favourite hotels.

Summary Heading: Blissful, Sublime, Flawless in Every Way
Summary: A lusciously lovely, sprawling property, exquisitely landscaped, with gently winding streets of one story spacious rooms and suites.   Gorgeous location with its views of the golf course and Pacific Ocean. Huge swimming pool with lots of chaise lounges or private cabanas.  Everything on the property is immaculately clean and beautifully maintained.  Beautifully appointed rooms. Spacious. Efficiently laid out, function as well as appearance.   Luxurious with all the amenities from gas fireplaces to flat screen tvs to free wifi. Big closets and good storage space in dressers.   Big bathroom with double sinks, a large shower with a seat, and separate soaking tub.   Huge patio with chaise lounges to recline on and enjoy the sunshine in privacy.  Housekeeping was right on time and

My husband and I had the opportunity to spend a week-end , in September- I didn't know anything abut the Pelican Hill Resort, so therefore had no expectations..  We travel a lot, so have certainly the ability to compare and rate properties... I have to admit : ****The Pelican Hill Resort offered THE BEST SERVICE we have EVER experienced in the US , and one of the top in the World.  *The bungalows are spacious and extremely well appointed, with a nice patio *the Pool, the spa, the golf  are just amazing.. ( which they had tennis courts on location- but to help the Tennis guests, they do offer a transfer to close by club)-  **They offer free Valet parking, fee water in the rooms and at the pool ( even when you arrive and leave they offer you water)- A little touch that is not to

Two weeks ago i was in Newport and spent my sunday afternoon and sunday night at the Pelican Hill.   The property is very big and you need a car to go from one place to an other, if you don't want to drive, no worry the Pelican Hill is providing a free shuttle within the property.   The lunch at the Grill was very relaxing. I always like a casual relax place. the food was delicious, the service good, people were watching a football game inside and it was a very good ambiance.  After lunch we went to the gigantic round pool, and even if it was a lot of children around (over  the week end the family from Los Angeles are coming for a get away I guess) it was very relaxing. Service by the lounge chair, pro active pool attendent.  My favourite part was the room, you can tell they

Our journey started oct 4. We booked for a 1week stay. I was traveling with my wife, brother, and my 3 children. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa, ( north villas)  Pelican arranged that our rental car would be at the airport and it was there waiting. The room was ready and the butler was there to take us to the room, and walked us through the room to show us the details. The hotel was quiet due to the time of year which made it feel much more private. Anytime we called the concierge or butler they were there to help ASAP. We played a round of golf on there south shore course and it was awesome. The course was challanging but the caddy was there to guide us.   This was our second vacation at pelican and it was as perfect as the first time, I highly recommend this resort for

Summary Heading: Coliseum restaurant - great food, great views
Summary: My friend and I stopped by for "only a drink". We ended up staying for dinner and were not disappointed. The prices are high, but 1) it's Newport Beach and 2) the atmosphere was spectacular. We sat on the terrace overlooking the pool and the ocean, sipping champagne cocktails, watching the sun go down and couldn't get up from the comfy chairs.  Had the calamari starter, which was probably THE BEST calamari I have ever had. I don't know how chef got it so tender. And the breading was perfectly seasoned. We each had a different seafood entree that we each loved (scallops and swordfish).  The only minor disappointment was the apple cobbler for dessert. I should have just had another cocktail.  But overall, I would go back in a heartbeat to catch another sunset and have more of that

Summary Heading: Disappointing Service, Expensive Food, Andrea Overrated
Summary: For a 'five star' resort, the room cleanliness and service were not very good. The housekeeping staff only tidied around our own property whereas in other hotels staff actually straightened our magazines and personal property.  Coffee from machine in room not replenished and rooms not cleaned properly.  Food often arrived cold at pool and breakfast despite requests to ensure food was hot. Sometimes breakfast orders were wrong.  Andrea pretentious and overpriced.  Much better restaurants offering better value in Newport Beach.  Villa pool service slow and not much in evidence.  Room service took ages and also very expensive pro rata.  Students seem to be the bulk of the service staff, much better service in other hotel groups such as Four Seasons, Oberoi etc.  Would benefit from
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts regarding your recent stay at Pelican Hill.  As we continually address opportunities to perfect the Five-Diamond guest experience in every area of the Resort, your thoughtful feedback is a gift to us.  I sincerely apologize for the regrettable circumstances you encountered that fell short of your expectations and our goals. In following up on the concerns you’ve detailed here about housekeeping, in-room dining, pool service and restaurant dining, I have shared your input with our management team.  I understand your level of disappointment with your Andrea dining experience, but assure you that our talented culinary staff and service team are whole-heartedly dedicated to creating the finest epicurean experiences for each and every guest. For this reason, Andrea has been recognized for its service and cuisine by Wine Spectator and OpenTable Diners’ Choice as a top restaurant destination.  Please allow me to share with you that our four Resort boutiques offer guests a variety of seasonal mementos and unique gifts. While the Spa Boutique and Allegra offer quality swimwear and spa products (as you mentioned), our Newsstand retails fine books, home décor and children’s products, as well as Pelican Hill logo apparel, current periodicals and convenience items.  Once again, your valuable feedback is very important to us and I thank you for offering your thoughts. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you and I invite you to contact me directly, if I could be of personal assistance when you return.  Sincerely,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: We chose Newport Beach for my birthday destination, then started searching properties.  We chose the Pelican Hill resort based on advice from another reviewer.  It didn't disappoint.   The opulence of the resort was evident from the moment we pulled up to the entry.  Doormen escorted us from our car to the lobby.  The front desk staff were accommodating and respectful.  We were then shuttled to our ocean view bungalow.  The room was gorgeous, very well thought out from a design perspective, and the ocean view was stunning.  The balcony, fully equipped with a table and chairs, and two chaise lounges allowed for unobstructed views of the ocean.   The pool area was fantastic.  The pool is the perfect depth, and huge.  The lounging area circling the pool was comfortable.  We even

I took my wife and daughter to the villas at Pelican Hill Resort.  From the first view of the property, I was an immediate hero.  They gushed about how beautiful the villa was, the high ceilings and the gorgeous decor.  My wife repeated, "this is how I want our house to look!" The next day we explored the property, after having breakfast delivered to our patio which had an end to end view of the ocean.  Not a bad way to start a day!  The Resort has a service to Crystal Cove Beach nearby and we went down there for a run after my wife and daughter had enough time at the spa. The only wrinkle were some complications concerning the doorlock, but these frustrations were more than counterbalanced when the Resort chauffered us around in their Bentley!  I want to give special applause

We wanted a quiet and relaxing weekend getaway and were extremely pleased with the Pelican Hill Resort.  The layout is unusual as there are individual bungalos with generous bathrooms and high ceilings.  The units and patios share a common wall with the next unit which was a problem the first night for us.  The staff was remarkably attentive and responsive.  The grounds and pool were beautiful.  We splurged and got a pool side cabana for $150 for the day and found this very relaxing.  We ate in both restaurants, the poolside cafe and the formal in-house restaurant.  The in house restaurant, the Andrea was spectacular but make reservations early!    We normally stay at  the Laguna Ritz Carlton and the Pelican Hill is superior in my opinion.  The room rates are about the same,

Attended a conference and have been thoroughly impressed!  It is a large and spread out resort, but shuttles are readily available and if you are lucky, you might get a Bentley. Top notch service at every venue. Gorgeous views, super clean, just a special place to be!

I was expecting poor service after reading some of the reviews and what I found could not have been different.  The resort was by far full so you would expect sparse staff but there were friendly, helpful, smiling staff at every turn.  All the front door staff, housekeeping and room service staff were efficient and friendly.  When room service was delivered, they inquired when when you would like the tray picked up, and then picked it up at that time.  The "privacy" sign was on the door when housekeeping came to do turn down and we were left a message to call if we needed anything at all.  Restaurants were good (although at $90.00 for two, the weekend breakfast buffet while good, was perhaps a little expensive) and service prompt.  Only the bar/lounge staff need some help, they

This hotel was amazing.  We had a suite with an ocean view and it was huge!  My husband loved how everything was made with quality wood, marble, etc.  The high ceilings were fantastic as were the 2 fireplaces.  The staff was really friendly and accommodating.  I liked that they had a little cafe that opened at 7am so you didn't need to order expensive room service every morning. I just walked there for my bagel.  The gym was big and clean with a yoga room.  The coliseum pool was breathtaking - the staff here could do better.  You had to flag them down to get served, but not the end of the world.  The beach shuttle was great. Dropped us off right at the Beachcomber and gave us a bag with towels, water and sunscreen - great perk.  I used the spa and while it was amazing, they

The first time we stayed here, Pelican Hill had only been open a short period of time...and we actually loved it so much more then.  Now that the resort is busy, the deficiencies in staff and service are very apparent.  The physical property (grounds, rooms, public spaces, spa, golf, restaurants, pool) are all beautifully designed and well-maintained and that is why this resort gets such high marks.  The rooms are large and well appointed.  Most food at the restaurants is very good.  The spa is large and feels like a real destination retreat...you could just spend hours relaxing in there.  There is nothing critical to be said about the physical property other than the lack of direct beach access...the developers did a very nice job and the property is gorgeous.  Pelican Hill has
Manager Response: I kindly thank you for taking the time to share your valuable input about your recent experience at Pelican Hill. I appreciate you choosing to stay with us again and am delighted to read your positive feedback about the property’s design and maintenance.  It is our goal to provide the best possible experience and exceptional service for every guest, especially during our busy summer season. For this reason, I sincerely regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered during your visit to the Coliseum Pool, in one of our restaurants, and in your accommodation. Thank you for taking the time to post your thoughts regarding your recent stay at Pelican Hill.  Once again, please accept my sincerest apologies and we look forward to another opportunity to serve you in the future.  Sincerely,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: I stayed in a two bedroom villa for several weeks. What a luxurious treat. The staff was flawless, absolutely made me believe they took pleasure in providing  a beyond expectations experience for my family. Impeccably clean, luxurious linens and comfortable beds - awesome bath products, incredible spa - great robes, sauna, steam, jacuzzi - villa pool and jacuzzi were outstanding. Fitness Center was first class. GORGEOUS views of Catalina and the ocean, sunsets to die for. The great room was so comfy - we settled right in. The gourmet kitchen was wonderful - we cooked in most nights, though there were so many wonderful restaurants to try we ventured out. Love the little cafe for coffee and gelato. This was a very healing place - I cannot recommend it highly enough!  I cried when

We've stayed at Pelican Hill many times, and it never disappoints.  The property is beautiful -with stunning views, perfectly manicured grounds, and great golf too! The staff is phenomenal, and will do anything they can to make your stay perfect.  The Spa is worth a visit - they do everything from massages to manicures in a relaxing and comfortable environment. The restaurants on property are all great, and the patio at the Coliseum Grill is a must do :)

Pelican Hill has no rival.  You cannot go wrong with either the the ocean bungalow or, if you want to really splurge, with an ocean villa.  I have stayed in both the bungalow and the villa and both are exceptional.  Service is excellent.  The grounds are impeccable. The staff in the Villa Club House are attentive and eager to please. I most recently stayed the weekend of September 10th 2011.  If you are looking for luxury and can afford it, I suggest a stay at Pelican Hill.
The place is just wonderful. The rooms are beautiful and the grounds and view are just amazing. We will be back!

Summary Heading: It was amazing and we will be back.
Summary: We  were here for our wedding and the hotel was nothing but amazing.  They gave us an amazing villa for less than we thought we would pay.  Our location was excellent.  The staff was always smiling and always willing to go the extra mile.  They know you by name at the villas and you feel like a millionaire.  There is really nothing like it.

We have nonidea what recent posters wre whining about in terms of service, attention and courtey here --  all were amply provided and observed as one would expect at what really is a 5 star proprty.  Food is imaginiive, fun and filling. Space in rooms, relative to price, fr surpaases all competitors in this coastal area.  Rits & St. Regs step aside... Unless yoyr company s paying or you are attendig a conf, don't waste our time with those prehistorc, fine fir wht they re, but overly exensive experiences.  We a a gy couplevwith one teen and we were very well welcomedbat PH.

Beautiful property. Stayed in bungalow with okay ocean view. Roofs of higher numbered bungalows were part of view. Room interior very nice.  Room was late being cleaned one day. Had to call twice same afternoon.  Minibar was not restocked next day. Unique pool at main resort area. Too many small children at pool;  need an adult pool area.  Music in lobby at night fun. Good food.

Summary Heading: Not quite perfect, but very good
Summary: A definite four star resort.  Not quite a five star yet.  Overall we had a wonderful visit.  Beautiful resort, high end amenities and generally great service.  The biggest issue was at check in.  We literally live on the other side of the hill of this resort.  It took less than five minutes to get to the resort.  This was suppose to be a quick getaway without the kids as the in laws were in town.   I called in advance to confirm a check in time of 4PM.  We did not actually get into our room until 5:30PM.  We had dinner reservations at 5:30 at Andrea and it was surprising how difficult it was to get this pushed back.  My wife and I had to get ready for dinner and a Concierge actually offered us the use of the showers in the locker rooms.  It would have been easier for me to drive

Summary Heading: Never Again will I return to Pelican Hill
Summary: The resort is absolutely beautiful with breath taking views. Too bad I cannot say the same about the service. I made reservations for this hotel a month ahead of time and booked three rooms. When we checked in, they had totally screwed up the rooms. When we called to complain to the front desk, we were given a lot of attitude. Therefore, we asked to speak to the manager hoping that we would receive better service from him. Boy were we wrong! The manager, Kevin Boil (or Boyd) was EXTREMELY RUDE! The whole time he was trying to just get off the phone with us, and even told me that there is nothing they can do for us and that he had to go because he had other guests to attend to. And when I told him that I was a guest also and his job was to help us, he told me, “Do not tell me how

As we continually strive to improve our service standards throughout the Resort, your valuable feedback is very important to us.  I deeply regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered during your stay with us.  Mediocrity among our staff at Pelican Hill, and the behavior displayed by a leader of our Resort will not be tolerated.  It is our goal to provide an unparalleled, all-around experience and exceptional personal service for every guest. Sincerely,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: After a three night stay during Labor Day weekend, here is our assessment of Pelican Hill:  Rooms - the bungalows are spectacular - very large, super-comfortable beds, five star bathroom.  The buildings are single story and spread out, so it is very quiet / you definitely will get a good nights sleep here.  Caveat - our ocean view room did have an ocean view, but that was blocked somewhat by some trees in front of the unit.  If you are expecting 100% unobstructed ocean views, some rooms don't quite deliver there.  Pool - the main pool is the largest round pool in the world.  It is very big.  They had plenty of lounge chairs and were able to support all guests (who were out at the pool by at least noon).  Pool service was top notch.  Note - if you want to reserve a private

Summary Heading: Amazing rooms, amazing service, amazing golf, amazing spa
Summary: Pelican Hill is the most fantastic place I have ever stayed and would recommend it, and have recommended it to many family and friends!! We brought our 3 year old and Camp Pelican was perfect. The staff was great with our daughter! Pelican Hill is also close enough to Disneyland that it is an easy day trip if you do bring the kids and want to leave this absolutely luxurious destination!

Summary Heading: If nature were to create a vacation spot
Summary: The Resort at Pelican Hill tops my list of trips. Having been afforded the oppurtunity to visit over 30 states and stay in various levels of hotels, I must say this was the finest experience to date. the most impressive item was how the resort gives way to nature and the views. In all areas your senses are filled with luxurious Itallian landscape and views of the mountains and Ocean. Second, the resort staff was incredibly service oriented and took great care to assure, even upon initial requests, that any necessities associated with the initial request were offered. They even go as far as providing and meeting  approximate times of service. The Resort rooms, fitness facility and other areas of interest were EXTREMELY clean. the room service for food was of high quality and the

Pelican Hill is a beautiful resort. The rooms are spacious and beautiful with every ammenity including working fireplaces. The views from the rooms were also wonderful. We dined in all of the resort restaraunts and were quite surprised by how good the food and the service were. The golf course, though i did not have a chance to play it, looked to be in great condition and appeared to have many interesting, panaromic, and challenging holes. The pool area is particularly lovely and a much better place to be than the beach wich is quite a distance from the hotel  and without the fabulous service  and facilities that the resort itself offers.  The Spa was also excellent. I had a massage and treatment at the Spa and found them both to be quite good. We greatly enjoyed the resort and

We live in Newport Coast and decided to take a "staycation" before our second child was born. Boy are we glad we did! This resort is phenomenal! We stayed in a bungalow that was spacious, had an ocean view, fireplace, bose sound system and great bath tub. The resort itself is gorgeous with large trees and beautiful paved roads. There are shuttles that can take you from your room to anyplace on the resort.  The spa is by far one of the best I've ever been too. I had a facial, my husband had a deep tissue massage. This was the 1st time my husband had been to the spa and he raved about it. I had been previously and had the same great experience the 2nd time. The staff are friendly and pay attention to every detail.  The Colliseum Pool is beautiful. It's only 3 1/2 feet deep all the

Summary Heading: We are going to make this a family tradition!
Summary: We stayed at the Pelican Hill Resort while my husband was on a business trip.  We arrived a few days ahead of time to take advantage of the facilities before his conference began.  Within a short time of arrive, we really felt as though we were on vacation.  The rooms are gorgeous and feel like a beautiful modern cabin on the ocean.  We had views of the ocean from our private patio and had our coffee there every day in the morning.  I always started the day with a dip in the hot tub at the spa followed by a sauna.  This was included with the room rate, so although I only had one official treatment at the spa, I felt as though I had been pampered all week.  We loved it here and will definitely make it our place to stay in Newport Beach.

The Resort at Pelican Hill is a beautiful resort and away from all of the hustle and bustle.  You truly feel like you are getting away from it all when you visit this place.  It is located between Laguna Beach and Newport Beach and is about fifteen minutes from Orange County's John Wayne airport.  The owner was inspired by the Italian architect, Andrea Palladio and it shows.  The entire resort has a northern Italian feel to it from the overall decor, Italian bed linens to the landscaping.    We stayed in one of the ocean-view Bungalows (regular room).  These rooms are very spacious and quiet.  Each room has its own gas-lit fireplace, private terrace, seating area with love seat and chair, table with chairs, granite wet bar, flat screen TV and the list goes on.  The resort is

Summary Heading: We are locals,we alternate between Andre and Coliseum Restaurants
Summary: I was greeted with fake smile by "Raquel or Rachel" because I did not have a reservation at the Coliseum Restaurant. She asked me where I would like to be seated; I replied by the canopy shade then another  hostess lead me to the table where there was no protection. I pointed to her a table that my husband and I would prefer to sit down ; mind you she replied it is reserved. No one sat in that table for one hour and forty-five minutes. It went down hill from there, our server Nancy apologetic made a mistake with my order: I ordered a glass of wine, half order of Tuscan Cesar salad and for my entree grilled swordfish. My 2 oz swordfish {that is right folks} came rubbery. The server did ask how my meal and I told her the truth the swordfish was rubbery. She did not do anything

The rooms are not in a hotel, but scattered along the property like condo's on a street.  All are attached.  So picture several streets lined above each other.  Transportation is provided to take you to the pool, lobby, etc.  The area is small enough to walk it, though.  At night, you would prefer to take transportation because it's poorly lit.  Pool is only 3 feet deep, so limited fun.  Services are slow and rooms are not made up until late in the day.  Maids placed personal items (hair brush, hair dyer) in other bathroom and cabinets without asking!  I have never experienced this in my life!  I had to look for items that I knew I had left on the bathroom counter.  Very strange.  At early hours outside disturbances will awaken you.  Food and mixed drinks were inconsistant and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to offer your thoughts regarding your recent stay at Pelican Hill.  As we continually strive to improve our service standards throughout the Resort, your valuable feedback is a gift to us.  As a thoughtfully designed Five-Diamond Resort, Pelican Hill stretches across more than 500 coastal acres overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Situated to provide the maximum exposure to these expansive ocean views, our tranquil and private Bungalows are laid out much like a seaside Italian village, rather than standard stacked hotel rooms that empty into a single traffic-congested lobby. Indeed, the Coliseum Pool is 3 feet deep throughout, but also one of the largest circular pools in the world at 136 feet in diameter with 1.1 million hand-laid mosaic glass tiles.  While I am pleased you had the opportunity to enjoy the accommodations, coaches and concierge services, I regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered with housekeeping, dining and our Five-Star Spa.  I understand your level of dissatisfaction, which fell short of your expectations and our goals.  As a result of your comments provided here, I have taken this opportunity to follow up with the Director of Housekeeping, Director of Food & Beverage, and Spa Director. Rest assured, what you experienced was the exception and not the rule, as our personnel are consistently complimented for the unparalleled service they deliver.  Once again, I sincerely regret the discontent you experienced during your stay and look forward to another opportunity to serve you at Pelican Hill. Please contact me directly if I could be of personal assistance.  Sincerely,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: As soon as we drove up to the villa gates, we knew we were going to have a fun time checking out this place. My husband, three kids and my parents stayed in a 3-bedroom villa. We originally reserved a two-bedroom, but we were gladly upgraded. The staff welcomed us with a plate of gourmet meats, cheese and bread.   The villas have a garage with a washer and dryer in it. The villa is spacious and gorgeous. The kitchen is nice with top of the line appliances. The staff stocked the fridge with complimentary water, milk and beer. The patio itself is wide and has patio furniture so you can enjoy the view of the golf course and Pacific Ocean. It was clear enough to see Catalina Island during our visit. The staff is very helpful. One of the terrific service features is the shuttle from

We've been to PH several times and each a pleasant experience. We love the gorgeous finishes, enormous square footage, kitchen and laundry provided at the villas; a luxurious and convenient option for a week's stay with a large family. The ease of maneuvering around the resort with your car is the best! Between the 2 distinct areas; main hotel and villas the place is massive and offers most everything.  Service - very inconsistent and at times nonexistent at the Villa Clubhouse, restaurant and pool. Extremely helpful and accommodating once you find someone but for the most part you are on your own. If you are looking for FS service and the small details, this is not the place. Housekeeping - again very helpful when you ring up with a request but if you ask for later than 9am

Summary Heading: Shut the front door!!  This place is fabulous!!
Summary: Absolutely breathtaking...everything from the warm greeting and ambiance of the lobby, the over the top friendliness of the staff "you can do whatever you'd like" attitude, the spectacular grounds, the transportation to and from everywhere, the sexy, hip, chill vibe of the entire colliseum vibe...best pool scene ever!  the quaintness of crystal cove...it goes on and on...the cute coffee cups in the hotel lobby hand made and delish coffee!  incredible!  can't wait to come back...oh yes, the spa....omg....it's fantastic - great smells, steam room amazing, etc, etc, etc

Summary Heading: What a Luxury Resort Should Be! My New Found Love
Summary: Love Love Love Pelican Hill. Not only is it pure luxury (the coffee maker was a grinder and brew pot in one and they had fresh gourmet coffee beans instead of pods or old coffee) but they made me feel like I was the queen of Sheba. I liked the way we were greeted, the way we were catered to, the attention to detail mostly.  Outside of our bungalow was a beautiful fountain with orange trees and palms. It was beautiful. The room was gorgeous and the only complaint was that the carpet was dirty and a little frayed.   We ate at Pelican Grill which was a sweet elegant lunch. We also ate at the Coliseum by the pool and I enjoyed a lovely salad.   The caffe is stocked with gourmet desserts and sandwiches and deluxe coffees and chocolates.  I felt like I was home here. In alot of

Summary Heading: Spectacular Setting. The resort could be outstanding but service issues loom large
Summary: The setting, the views, the landscaping and the accommodations are all outstanding. These things as well as the "Butler" service create and expectation of outstanding service. Sadly, the service could range from excellent to "oh my god, are you serious."  Before elaborating on the service, I should advise that the place is amazing. The common areas are full of warm woods and wonderful design. The 2 bedroom villa we had was appointed beautifully. It had a lovely kitchen area that was very functional and came with some of the basic stuff you often have to run right to the store to purchase. The beds are very comfy and the bathrooms are HUGE. We had a giant deck with double sliding glass doors that allow you to really enjoy the sunsets and the ocean breeze.   You want to love this

Please contact me directly if I could be of personal assistance.   Sincerely,   Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: I have stayed at many other resorts in the area, I personally believe that this place is the best. We had an ocean view bungalow which was really well appointed , i love it when even the smallest details are top class, and they were , from the Bose sound system to the free wifi. The service around the pool was good but not great maybe a 80% , we had just come from the Four Seasons in LA where the service is 99%, me just being a bit critical. You can park your car right outside your room, which is great except that there is really no need to go to the lobby other than checking in or out, so its a little soulless , other than that you should really stay here if visiting this part of southern california

I brought my wife here for just one night as a thank you for the stresses of our move, while her mother watched our daughter.  I booked through American Express, and they had a great deal where I got extra resort credit, a room upgrade and a late checkout.  The rooms are beautiful and make you feel like you are in a little villa instead of in a hotel, and frankly except for the size (no kitchen, etc) they could be upscale condo units.  The round pool is amazing.  Individual hand set glass tiles in a huge round pool with an awesome view of the Pacific, and the food and drinks at poolside were unique and amazing too.  We actually kept asking what was in the specialty drinks and taking notes because I had never seen such drinks.  Very unique.  Overall very worth while stay here.

The property is gorgeous and the pool is spectacular. The rooms are very spacious and nicely done. We were originally upgraded via Amex to a one-bedroom suite but had to be moved because the room location was right on the maid road (near the Colesium) so we could hear all the cars, people waiting at the valet, and the employees coming out of the service entrance. Just a tip - if you get offered room 201, ask to be moved. You'll be up all night with unwanted noise. We didn't mind getting a regular room - was still very pretty and quiet! Eat at Andrea's - delicious! Overall, we were very satisfied and will definitely come back again!

WOW What an amazing resort! Our two bedroom apartment was stunning, very spacious with beautiful decor. We had two huge bedrooms with large on-suite bath/shower rooms, and a lounge/dining area with a well equipped kitchen. Although the resort is large there are shuttle buses to ferry you around day or night. The spa was one of the best I have ever been to, with fantastic treatments available. The main swimming pool was great as was the smaller one designated to villa guests. All the restaurants had fantastic service and wonderful food-we didn't have one bad meal in our whole week we were there! Although not  golfers the courses were superb and beautifully kept! The concierge were so efficient and all staff were so friendly and couldn't do enough! The whole hotel was immaculately

Summary Heading: Death of a Great Property by thousand poor service cuts!
Summary: We have enjoyed this property in prior years and always had an exceptional stay.  This year from a property standpoint the experience was the same, BUT... OMG where has the service level gone?  Check in was flawless and the room was wonderful, we stayed in a 3 bedroom villa, beautiful room, beautiful views and clean as can be,  As we stayed, little things began to add up.  For instance, the bathtub drain would not open up and did not during the three day stay, even though the tub was left full each day (since we couldn't open the drain).  Normally I would expect housekeeping to call maintaince and get the issue fixed.  Not here.  We were on vacation, housekeeping came promptly at 9am each morning!   Who has ever heard of 9am cleaning, and when we said come back in an hour, they

Summary Heading: Gorgeous 5 star resort with slight service issues
Summary: We stayed in a gorgeous bungalow for three days with our two children.  The room was beautifully appointed with a large bathroom and great fireplace.  We loved the spacious patio area too.  The pool was extremely unique in that is was enormous and round!  Great setting with the ocean in the distance.  The kids club was fabulous for our children.  They went for one day and did not want to leave when we picked them up.  Great separate kids' pool area with water jets.  Children's menu by the pool was a great value.  The spa was also fabulous with wonderful service and attention to detail.  It was very clean and constantly being restocked with towels, tea, etc.  The only downside were a couple of service issues. On the first day, we waited for the tram to take us down to the beach.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous Resort with Disappointing Customer Service
Summary: The grounds are gorgeous, and my fiancee's and my stay was going fine, till we handed our car over to valet, had to wait half and hour, were told that the resort had "lost" the keys, and then had security drive it up, after illegally searching the car for weapons. My fiancee and I talked with the head of security, and he told us everything was fine. We went to our room, and a few hours later, three policemen showed up, and dragged my boyfriend out in his boxers. They left, embarrassed and mortified. He hadn't done anything illegal; they simply had to answer the resort's call. We saw management about the issue, and were treated terribly. I pressed the issue, and was called with a "Sorry." Extremely disappointing management.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent stay, following your conversations with management and the courtesies extended to you for the inconvenience regarding the rifle you chose to bring on property. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay, but regret the unfortunate circumstances surrounding the weapon that was exposed in your trunk as our staff unloaded your luggage. As we discussed over the phone on the evening of July 31, the safety and security of all Pelican Hill guests and staff is one of our highest priorities.  During your stay, we informed you that Pelican Hill is a weapon-free Resort and all guests are required to keep personal firearms either locked in a safe or locked within your vehicle. For this reason, the unsecured rifle observed in your trunk was brought to the attention of our security team. It is not our policy to search any guest’s vehicle under any circumstances. When Resort security inquired with you directly about the weapon, you provided the serial number for it. As a matter of protocol to ensure the safety of everyone on property, the Resort provided the serial number to local law enforcement for the purposes of records verification. This step in our protocol concluded the Resort’s investigation of your rifle.  However, the local police decided come on property to investigate, including a search of your vehicle when you gave them the keys. The police then verified the matching registration for your rifle.  Although the head of Resort security offered to speak with you further to clarify any questions, concerns or confusion, you declined this follow-up with Resort management.  In consideration of the inconvenience that these security measures caused, Resort management provided you with a complimentary dinner at Andrea. It was our understanding that you acknowledged our sincere apology when you accepted this courtesy from us. We regret that this gesture resulted in your feeling “treated terribly.”  Should you wish to discuss your experience and our commitment to safety and security further, please contact me directly to follow up on our recent phone conversation. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you at Pelican Hill.   Sincerely,   Donald Stamets Pelican Hill Resident Manager

Summary: This is one of the best hotel room products that I have seen.  Service was impeccable and the rooms were very impressive.  If you can afford it this is the place to go.  The golf is also world class make sure you bring your driver with you.  I would highly recommend this place.

I had the fantastic experience of staying at the Resort at Pelican Hill this week and am so so sad that I was only there for one night.  If I'd known how spectacular it would be, I would've schemed up reasons to stay longer.  The views, the service, the lush gardens, the luxe appointments -- quite possibly the nicest place I have ever stayed.  If only I golfed, since the course looked gorgeous too.

Summary Heading: AWESOME - Fantastic Wedding and vacation spot
Summary: We had our wedding here. EVERYTHING was perfect and will try our best to come back every year. I could not fault the property on anything. Recommend this place to anyone seeking the ultimate in luxury and the best Newport Coast has to offer.

I almost am hesitant to even write this as I feel this is the best kept secret. If you have kids, this is the best way to go.  Roomy, spacious, and so luxurious. The butler service is great, love the options of the pools and the convenience of driving right up to my room.  Great shuttle service to nearby restaurants and shops, and you can't beat their spa and golf.  Highly recommend.

This is a beautiful resort with very weak service, nuisance fees and waning upkeep.    In my room 3 light bulbs were burned out leaving the room very dark in areas.  Also one of the chaise cushions was horrribly stained and should have been replaced.  But the really sad part here is the service.  It's very, I mean very, poor.  You are put on long holds any time you call reservations or room service.  I was unable to get any service at all at the pool and it wasn't unusually crowded - just disinterested and inattentive staff.  Later I ordered room service and ordered one glass of wine and was told I had to order a bottle - no glasses of wine availiable.  This theme of overcharging continues - with the ridiculous coffee runaround I experienced.  On the morning I was leaving, I

Summary Heading: For serious golfers and goof offs
Summary: We came to this hotel for a family reunion with our sons and young grandchildren. It is an ideal place for this sort of get together. There are no rooms, only bungalows, or villas, which is great, since you can drive right up to your place and park the car there, very convenient if you are arriving with all the equipment that babies need. The bunglows where we stayed are very spacious and well appointed, and have a terrace. There is a coffee maker, a toaster, and a mini bar that can be used to refrigerate small items for the kids. Our bungalows were unfortunately the furthest from the pool, and there is a hill to manage; we asked to be relocated considering that it would be difficult to deal with the strollers on the way up but we got little cooperation there. There is a shuttle

My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary for 2 nights, our first visit.  We had an ocean view bungalow and it was a fantastic location.  We were up high with a panoramic view of the ocean and more bungalows and the Marriott Villas in the distance in front of us, but it was very scenic and private.   Our patio had 2 lounge chairs, a table where we had room service delivered, and a glass front wall, so we left the wide shutter doors to the spacious room open all night for the fresh ocean air and views.   The Italian fireplace was very romantic, there is wireless internet, and a spacious marble, 2 sink bath and huge soaking tub with tray across which held a book or toiletries.  Large shutter  doors could be opened from the bath to catch the ocean views, so nice.  The tile
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent stay with us. It is our goal to offer an unparalleled all-around experience and exceptional personal service for every guest.  While I’m delighted to read that you enjoyed your accommodations and our live late night entertainer, I sincerely regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered while dining at Andrea. Please allow me to share with you that Andrea has been ranked among the "Top 50 U.S. Restaurants for Best Italian Cuisine" and "Top 50 Most Romantic Restaurants in the U.S." in the OpenTable Diners' Choice Awards.   For many guests, experiencing Andrea’s gracious service and signature Northern Italian cuisine is a cherished highlight of their Pelican Hill visit. I would like to extend my sincerest apologies for your recent experience that fell short of your expectations and our goals.  We look forward to another opportunity to serve you at Pelican Hill. Please contact me directly if I could be of personal assistance.   Sincerely,   Donald Stamets Pelican Hill Resident Manager

Summary: I feel sorry about the location , the room we got was very dirty and also bad management we told them our room is very dirty two of thier managers ( kevin boil and morisio ) easily said check out and ther we had an argument with morisio he said he will checked us out of the resort and we where prepaid all our say we stay around 36 days in pelican hill, butlers r the best ... I realy had bad bad experience their
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post your comments about your recent stay with us, following our ongoing conversations and the courtesies extended to you and your family throughout your visit. We kindly thank you for choosing to stay with us for a third time this summer, and regret the unfortunate circumstances you encountered during this most recent visit.  We are delighted to read that you enjoyed our personalized butler service in the Villas, but understand your level of disappointment regarding the condition of your accommodation that fell short of your expectations and our goals. It was our understanding that the dissatisfaction was remedied when the questionable furnishings were replaced during your stay and the courtesy rates were extended for your additional Bungalow bookings with us.  As discussed during your conversations on site with our Villas and Front Desk managers, the disruptive actions, argumentative tone and aggressive physical interactions we experienced from you in the lobby were not welcomed. In consideration of the safety of our employees and the comfort of all Pelican Hill guests, it is not our policy to engage this level of behavior under any circumstances. In the unfortunate event that circumstances require it, guests may be asked to exit the property.  Should you wish to discuss your experience with us further, I invite you to return the phone messages our management team left with you frequently during your visit to ensure that your stay proved satisfactory. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you at Pelican Hill.   Sincerely,   Donald Stamets Pelican Hill Resident Manager

Summary: This property is spectacular!  We love the S. California coast and will make any excuse to experience its beauty.  Everything about this property says opulence, from the location of the property to the actual property itself and the amenities it has to offer.    My wife and I recently had the pleasure of spending five days at the hotel.  We enjoyed an ocean view bungalow during our stay equipped with a private terrace and fireplace.  The views of the golf course and the ocean are beautiful from Andreas and Coliseum Pool & Grill.  The views from our terrace of the surrounding bungalows and the ocean reminded me of the hill country of Tuscany. The fireplace came in handy as night began to set in as the temperature dropped due to the proximity to the coast.  One of my favorite

My wife and I stayed here for a three-day weekend, arriving on Thursday afternoon and departing on Sunday morning.  The hotel, lobbies, villa, pool and accomodations were all top-notch.  I have seen the term 'casually elegant' used by others to describe this resort and I would agree.  Elegant, but not in a stuck-up 'don't touch' way.  Very appealing to us.  It's not a beach resort, which was a bit of a surprise.  We were expecting something right on the beach.  Not a problem, just a difference of expectations.  The villas were private, well appointed with lots of storage room, great beds, roomy bathroom, lots of electronics and a nice patio area.  It did appear that this was THE PLACE for locals to visit to have a drink, luncheon or spa.  Others have mentioned poor service

Summary Heading: 8 nights stayed July 2011 - the good, the bad, and the service...
Summary: We have stayed in a lot of the top hotels around the US and Europe, so I'm being very harsh on Pelican HIll because I truly believe if they fix the service level I would give it a 5 stars.  Also, I do take into consideration most people are paying anywhere from 600-1,100 a night so they better have things in order.  I don't like starting with the negatives, but I think its important for the hotel and for future guests to provide feedback (only makes them better).  This is our annual trip July 2-July 10th to somewhere incredible for my wife's Birthday and our anniversary.  Typically most hotels go above and beyond knowing both fall in the same week.  I'm overally prepared and actually contacted the hotel 5 times about these notes and helping me arrange some special surprises for

I kindly thank you for choosing to stay with us at Pelican Hill and sincerely appreciate your thoughts on your recent stay with us.   It is our goal to offer an unparalleled all-around experience and exceptional personal service for every guest, especially those who visit in celebration of a special occasion. I understand your level of disappointment in your anniversary and your wife’s birthday having been left unacknowledged throughout your time with us. Certainly, we wish you both all the best and sincerely regret missing the opportunity to honor your special occasion during your stay.  Furthermore, I appreciate your detailed account of the unfortunate oversights you encountered with housekeeping and food and beverage service. Summary: This was the last stop on our holiday itinerary and we wanted to splurge in the lap of luxury. The resort was magnificent and appears to be the central point for whose who amongst locals. If you want to see a luxury car, rest assured there will be one at the front gate at least every 20 minutes.   The room we stayed in was beautiful (although it should be for the amount we spent). Fabulous bathroom and the room was quite spacious with a fire place and a private balcony with a lovely view. The swimming pool is amazing and the entire pool area is built around the structure of the Colosseum.There are villas that have their own private pools and a separate pool for those who can afford the villas. You can also hire out a cabana at the normal pool for around $200 a day. It really is

I am delighted that you chose to visit Pelican Hill during your holiday and appreciate the feedback that you have detailed here regarding your recent stay with us.   I understand your level of disappointment regarding your pool and restaurant experience, which fell short of your expectations and our goals. I have followed up with the Food and Beverage Director and the Restaurant Manager to review your feedback, as we continuously strive to heighten our service performance throughout each corner of the Resort. Summary: Everything about pelican hill is fantastic. Best location, right between Newport and laguna. Prefer it over montage and ritz Carlton.

This resort is just fantastic.  The rooms themselves are some of the best I've ever stayed in.  The ceilings are high, the beds are comfortable, finishes are great, big bathrooms, huge patio, lots of nice little touches (coffee maker that grinds beans plus a toaster, TV with iPod/iPad hookup, Bose soundsystem, plenty of towels and robes, floormats by the bed with turndown service).  The overall layout is very cool, very "California."  You drive up to the lobby and then after being checked in drive to your bungalow!  The pool is truly epic, the pictures are great but you won't believe how big it is when you see it.  It is a saltwater pool which is much more pleasant to swim in than chlorine.  The gym is amazing, didn't use the spa or golf course.  I've stayed at the other OC

Summary Heading: Nearly perfect---where is my welcome basket???
Summary: Stayed for 3 nights over Father's Day weekend.  Had a wonderful time and the resort is absolutely first class.  Only 2 very minor complaints.  1.  The water pressure is pretty weak in the shower. 2.  They forgot my welcome basket!  The resort is spread out, with the main building/meeting area/pool/restaurants in one area, and the bungalows (regular rooms and suites) in many smaller buildings adjacent to the main buildings.  You can park right in front of your bungalows (a bellman on a golf cart will direct you to the room and help you unload) which makes getting takeout for our little ones easier (Fashion Island Mall is about 5 min up the road...CPK, PF Chang, Cheesecake Factory are some of the restaurantes in that area.  There is also a Bristol Farms and Whole Foods near by).

Pelican Hill is an enormous gorgeous property. It has a very opulent, posh feel from the moment you drive up.  Most rooms seem to have fireplaces which I love. Bathrooms, bar and electrical conveniences are well set-up in the room with attention to detail apparent. It isa very spread out property which is nice for privacy.  There seems to be a great set-up for golfers but tennis is 5 miles away which was disappointing.  The three shops are really nice with great stuff - fun for some retail therapy when the weather turned foggy.  Andrea is a great restaurant - five star in terms of food and service, and is actually fairly priced. Pool food service was weak - they got our order wrong but replaced  it and room service forgot a few ingredients.   I thought the hotel was expensive
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide your thoughts on your recent stay with us. I am delighted that you chose to visit Pelican Hill with your family and appreciate your detailed feedback.  Please allow me to provide an explanation of our weekday value rates at The Spa. As you discussed over the phone with Resident Manager Donald Stamets after this review posted, our pricing structure provides tiered rates during off-peak weekday periods. Most guests and locals find this to be a wonderful value for a Five-Star, Five-Diamond Spa experience. Our regular rates remain steady during weekends when our therapists and other spa professionals are in highest demand. We strive to offer the most competitive rates around our area – including the best value during weekend peak periods.  In addition to values on services and treatments, all Resort and Spa guests have complimentary access (no added Resort fees) to ample amenities, including the fitness center, Acqua Colonnade (with Roman soaking tubs, eucalyptus steam room and cedar sauna), men’s and women’s lounges, showers, vanity areas, lockers/ changing rooms, daily guided beach hike, movement studio and complimentary fitness classes.   I understand your level of disappointment regarding your family’s experience accessing the fitness center, which fell short of your expectations and our goals. Rest assured, I have met with the spa director to review your feedback and consider reasonable exceptions to our minimum age requirement moving forward.  Finally, I sincerely regret your unfortunate experience with in-room dining and poolside food service. I have discussed this feedback with our Director of Food & Beverage, as we continuously make every effort to heighten our service performance throughout each corner of the Resort.  In closing, thank you once again for your valuable feedback. It is truly a gift to us, as we strive to offer an unparalleled all-around experience and exceptional personal service for every guest, with the finest in facilities, services and values. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you at Pelican Hill. Please contact me directly if I could be of personal assistance.  Sincerely,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: My husband and I just returned from pelican hill. We were only there for 1 night and we can't stop talking or thinking about our stay.  I booked a 2 bedroom villa and called to see if there was any chance we could check in early and the person I spoke with said they would do their best to accommodate our request. Only a short drive from San Diego we said goodbye to our 3 boys "under the age of 6" and headed north. We arrived at the villa checkin at 10:10am and were already blown away by how amazing this resort looked. Not only did they have our villa ready "unheard of to be able to check in at 10am!!" they also upgraded us to a 3 bedroom villa!!  After a 5 second drive we arrived at villa 720 with our butler standing at the driveway waiting to greet us.  Then it gets better. Is
