This was our third stay with Pelican Hill. As usual the stay was fantastic. The resort is beautiful, the rooms are quiet and so private. The staff are gracious, courteous and ALWAYS accomodating. My daughter is gluten free and the chef's and staff always do a wonderful job making fabulous food she is thrilled with. Our housekeeping was a little spotty this trip, but they were VERY busy. I would recommend the beaches in Laguna rather than Crystal Cove (the beach they shuttle too) as they are much nicer, as is Corona Del Mar (the restrooms are closer and not as many bugs). That said I have stayed at a lot of five star resorts and Pelican Hill is the best of the best!

I traveled to California and stayed at the Pelican Hill resort compliments of my job. Everything was amazing. I only wished that I had brought my partner with me, so that she could enjoy this peaceful and relaxing environment. We were greeted by the friendly staff and treated like royalty. The rooms were very spacious and decorated simply buy sleek and clean. The bathroom was like a dream. It actually had a window that opened up into the bedroom area and there were double sinks with more counter top than you knew what to do with. The views were awesome everywhere you looked, especially the one at the colliseum pool. There was a golf course that was perfectly manicured and of course you were right on the waters edge. The food was fabulous and again the staff was very courteous. I

Summary Heading: The Resort @ Pelican Hill - understated elegance that is not fussed
Summary: The design of the Resort @ Pelican Hill takes its cue from Andrea Palladio, great Italian Renaissance architect: classical forms, floor to ceiling marble and robust roman columns make it a 'grande scale' resort.   Liked the free front of bungalow parking and the resorts landscaping adding to the overall Med design with olive trees, lanes of cypress trees, vivid bougainvillea bushes and cotton tail rabbits, on commission to trim the lawns!   The bungalow's vaulted woodbeam ceilings and large gas-lit limestone fireplace add to the residential ambience of a Tuscan cottage.   We loved the tranquility of the golf course and ocean views from the private patio of our bungalow. The bungalows have overstuffed, deep couches and beds you simply flop into, with pillows menus and personal

Summary Heading: Just doesn't get any better than this...........
Summary: From beginning to end, our stay was flawless.  The level of service is fantastic, the surroundings fantastic and the rooms are exquisite.  Wonderful romantic getaway.  We would go back tomorrow!!!!

We stayed in the south villas from may 22 to may 29,  the concierge arranged our transportation to and from lax, this went without a single issue. we stayed in the south villas which are very close to the villa clubhouse. we stayed in a 3 bedroom villa. the villas are very very clean. the decor was very nice and the views from the patio were outstanding. bedrooms are more then big enough and the beds are super comfy. kitchen was well equipped and made it very easy for me to cook up the kids something when they were hungary. loved the fact that they had a laundry room and garage to park the car. I had the hotel arrange a vehicle for us. could not have been any easier of a experience. the pool was awesome, clean and the water was the perfect temperature. The natural beauty of the

Expensive, but worth a visit.  They don’t charge you the typical fees: resort fee, internet fee, parking fee, etc.  All incidental charges are included in the price, probably evens out in total cost.  The rooms are exquisite, great bed, huge bathroom, plush linens, cozy fireplace and comfortable patio.  Great pool area only open to hotel guest.  We had breakfast buffet on the patio at Coliseum Grill.  The food was excellent!  Resort is close walk to Crystal Cove.  Definitely plan to visit Pelican Hill again.

Was looking for a quick getaway from LA and we found it at Pelican Hill. The entire property is based on a Roman architecture theme/setting. From the moment we stepped out of our car the vibe was "welcome, relax, let us take care of you". This was exactly what we were looking for. It was my husband's birthday so we checked in for one night. We booked spa services and also booked our kids into Club Pelican so we could start our stay at the resort right away. Upon check in, they told us our room was ready (noon) so that was a nice surprise. Kids loved the camp and were busy all afternoon plus they got fed lunch, swam, met lizard wizard pet guide and more. My husband and I took advantage of the spa which was luxurious and amazing. My only complaint about the women's spa was that

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Need to work out a few kinks to make it Perfect
Summary: This is a wonderful hotel.  The ground are beautiful, overlooking the golf course and the ocean.  The Coliseum Pool is large, breathtaking and is warm on even a chilly day.  The food at the resort is great, without being austentatious.  We stayed in a basic room that had high ceilings, a fireplace, and comfy beds.  I traveled with my little one and the staff worked hard to please, including rounding up some bed rails for the bed.  There were a few glitches, however, that prevents me from giving the resort five out of five.  They sent me down to the wrong room at check in.  A quick phone call with the front desk resolved everything satisfactorily, but for this quality resort, mistakes like that shouldn't happen.  There is a shuttle to the beach-- they wound up missing our pickup.

I have had my eye on this Resort for quite a while and have been watching the rates on my favorite travel site, Whatahotel.com. We did not want to pay the rack rate because we live only 20 miles away. But, a great deal popped up right at my birthday (also Mother's Day weekend) that provided an upgrade, early check in and late check out, breakfast up to $60 each day and a $100 Resort credit and a welcome amenity. By the time you added up all the perks, the room rate was quite decent.  We stayed just one night but because we did not have to check out until 4 PM, it was an entire weekend. Maria, at Whatahotel, secured the late check out in advance.  Maria always manages to get exactly what I want for my trips. Anyway, about the Resort, it is gorgeous and the Ocean views are

Stayed at Pelican Hill with a business conference. I was very impressed by the appointments, the SERVICE of everyone you encounter (front desk, entrance/security (Jesus) and the restaurant (Silverio: what an excellent veggie omelet!), the views, our room (bungalow 355). Been and lived in Europe and do extensively travel and I now have updated my list: this one is in my top 5 worldwide. EACH ONE went out of their way to help and assist.  I have no hesitation in returning and will advocate my organization in doing so.

My wife, 24 year old daughter, and I spend the Mother's Day weekend at the Pelican Hill Resort. We had a 2 bedroom suite overlooking the ocean which was beautifully furnished and extremely spacious. The staff was extremely helpful, pleasant, and eager to please. The meals including the Mother's Day brunch, were all wonderful. The property was well maintained and extremely clean. The prices were high but not outrageous for a first class Southern California facility. I would highly recommend this resort for a special occasion or a for a brief get-away from it all.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous views, outstanding service and pure indulgence.
Summary: My family visited Pelican Hill Resort in April 2011.  From the moment we arrived at our beautiful villa our every need was attended to by the incredible staff.  Every request we had made on our pre-arrival request had been completed.  The view from our terrace was gorgeous.  I felt as if I was looking out at the Mediterranean from a beautiful Italian villa.  It seems that the staff at Pelican Hill knew my needs before I did.  The dining was DELICIOUS!  We ate at all the restaurants at the resort as well as in-room dining and loved every bite.  There was plenty for all in the family to do.  The pools, beach, spa, golf, shopping and boating.  We also went to LA and San Diego while we were there and the location was perfect to still be able to visit both cities.  The concierge was

Summary Heading: Luxury and Relaxation Just a Short Drive From Los Angeles
Summary: My friends and I spent a few days a Pelican Hill for my Birthday.  We had a fantastic time.  We had pretty high expectations and they were definitely met.  The grounds are gorgeous. The room was nicely decorated, spacious, comfortable and had a great view.  The pool, where we wanted to spend our time, was beautiful.  We all had spa services.  It's quite luxurious.  Some of us liked our services and some of us didn't, but in general it's clear they understand what a spa should be.  Most importantly, the service was impeccable.  Everywhere you look there was someone to help.  To me, service can really make or brake a hotel, and the service at Pelican Hill is what makes it an extraordinary hotel.  We also loved that you don't have to valet your car.  This way you can just get in

Summary Heading: Wonderful, relaxing trip with young kids!
Summary: We just returned from an amazingly relaxing trip to Pelican Hill with my three young children (7,5,and 2) and my parents.  We arrived, exhausted, after two fun- filled packed days at Disneyland.  While Disneyland is great with young kids, Pelican Hill is just what the Dr. ordered for both adult and kids.  The grounds, pools, service, spa, food, villas and ambiance is truly first class.  The villas are super spacious and completely perfect for anyone with a family.  We walked in to our 3 bedroom villa and not only were we welcomed by a butler, but there were gorgeous snacks and stuffed animals and treats for the kids.  The spa was one of the best I have ever come across.  They have a eucalyptus steam room, (and when you get out a cool mint washcloth awaits you), salt whirlpool,

Summary Heading: Gorgeous and relaxing, wish I was there right now!
Summary: We were traveling to Southern Cal over spring break to visit Disney and hoped to enjoy some beach and poolside R&R.  I was traveling alone with 2 young children.  Initially, we looked into the Disney resorts, to be close to the park and get the full Disney experience.  But after the very wet and cold winter we had, the kids were very keen to get in some time fun in the sun at the pool.  Besides, this was our 3rd trip to Disney (once to Anaheim and once to Orlando - we prefer the Orlando parks).  While researching properties around Orange County (on Expedia), this resort showed up as an option - and at the same price point as the Disney property (not Grand Californian - that was a lot more).  The pictures and website looked amazing,TA reviews sealed the deal.  We arrived at the

Summary Heading: Best hotel we've ever stayed at  in the L.A. area
Summary: This place was amazing. It felt like we were in Tuscany. Very relaxing atmosphere, outstanding service, outstanding accommodations. We had not stayed here before because it was so expensive but they had a deal where we got a rate close to the RItz and Montage price. The Andrea restaurant was one of the best meals I've ever had. The room are all casita style, separate from the main building. We liked being in 403, right near the pool building.  It isn't a beach hotel but if you want golf or just a very nice secluded place, you won't be disappointed. It was also nice that it is closer to the big shopping areas than the holels in Dana Point. Also, the parking, internet and bicycle usage  was free which is significant savings compared to other hotels.

I attended Pelican for 3 nights/4 days. I can't think of any knocks against this place. I even read a few of the poorer reviews by others first to see if they would jog my memory of something I may have looked past, but they are just ridiculous and written by those that obviously just need something to complain about.   This is a 5-diamond resort in the purest sense. Everything was thought of twice. I played golf on the North course, and no matter where you turn, you are either looking at 35k+ square foot palatial estates, or breathtaking views of the beach, ocean, and Catalina in the distance. All the staff members (of which there was an abundance - this place employs TONS of people) were very friendly and knowledgable. The concierge desk should be in a textbook; thinking of a

We stayed in a beautifully appointed 2 bedrm Villa w/ panoramic views of the Pacific. The villa beds(1 King & 2 Queens) were amazingly comfortable. The kitchen was well equipped w/ high end stainless appliances. Plenty of space in the combo dining/ living room w/ a gas fireplace and fabulous outdoor terrace. The villa has 2.5 spa quality bathrooms and toiletries. The grounds are filled w/ lush plantings: fruiting olive, lemon, lime trees and hundreds of tropical bird of paradise, roses and other flowers perfuming the air. The staff were all very professional, helpful and friendly. The resort contains a high end spa, casual to formal dining, coffee, gift and other onsite stores. There are several swimming pools, exercise rooms and great golf course. We enjoyed the local flair of

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay in a luxurius place
Summary: We had a wonderful stay at Pelican Hill ! The pool is so big and the kids enjoyed their stay. Take the time to play a round of golf (with a caddy) as the views are magnificient!
Beautiful bungalows overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  Breathtaking views.  Impeccable service and a beautiful spa.  An experience to remember!

We just returned from our trip to Pelican Hill (part of a road trip from LA to Vegas) and we couldn't have been happier with the resort.  Often my complaint about expensive hotels is that they feel starched and "stuck up", but there was none of that here.  Yes, it is still quite expensive to eat and drink, but the atmosphere is laid back, the staff hugely helpful and the surroundings stunning.  We had good and bad weather while we were there, and the bungalow was perfect for both; cosy with the fire on when it's rainy and windy, lovely in the sun with the double doors open, relaxing on the sun loungers.  I have never written a review before but thought this place was worth it!

We stayed in the Villas of Pelican Hill in March 2011 and I have to say that it was the most incredible hotel experience we have ever had. From our personal butler who is on-call 24 hours a day to the grand size and view of the 3BR Villa to the service at the Villa Pool, we were blown away. We typically only stay at the best of the best (usually only stay at FS and RC) and this is the absolute tops and will be tough to beat. Will definitely return!!!

I have been fortunate to stay at many of the finest resorts in the world and I can honestly say that Pelican Hill is the nicest.  It is not a posh or extravagant resort.  That is not its charm.  It is casually elegant, but very casually elegant.  Everything from the scents in the great rooms and suites to the finishes is superb.  But, without a doubt what is most exceptional is the service.  It is truly exceptional.  I have never experienced such a desire to make my stay so perfect.  I have stayed at Pelican Hill 4 times in the last year and I cannot wait to return.  I manufacture reasons to go to that part of the country just to be able to stay there.  Although it is expensive, you get what you pay for.  With Pelican Hill, it is worth every penny.

Pelican Hill was one of the best places we have ever stayed!  We have stayed at many nice hotels and this had all the comforts of home.  We booked a 2  bedroom villa for Spring Break and I guess they weren't full because they upgraded us to a 4 bedroom villa without even asking!!!!!!!!   The hotel was very kid friendly especially at the Coliseum Poll and Grill.  They had toys for the kids to play with at the dinner table.  I can't say enough good things about this place.  The view from the villa was breathtaking and the golf course was absolutely beautiful.  What made it especially nice was that the villas had their own garage so we didn't have to park and walk a ways to our room.  Very helpful at the end of the day when young kids are tired.  Also, no hidden fees or daily

Summary Heading: Luxury, Beautiful Views and Extremely Attentive Staff
Summary: I stayed at the Pelican Hill for a work conference and the organizers of the conference will have a very hard time topping themselves next year! This place was incredible. I stayed in the bungalows and the rooms were ridiculously huge with beautiful touches throughout, such as the gas remote-controlled fireplace, large glass sliding doors that revealed the glass enclosed balcony with ocean views, super soft bed, huge luxurious bath, I could go on. The resort is a bit isolated so if you're looking for a place where you can get to other places easily, this isn't it but it's great for a getaway where you can enjoy relaxation in a semi-secluded environment. The resort is beautiful and it's great to walk the grounds. There is a really nice fitness center and several restaurants on

Summary Heading: BEST of the Best in Orange, CA area
Summary: There was real debate about where to stay as this was a much needed vacation and important to stay at the perfect hotel- one with a comfortable and spacious room.  We generally stay at Ritz Carltons and Four Seasons all over the USA and the Caribbean.  The Resort at Pelican Hill FAR met and exceeded those stellar hopes we had had from those reputable hotels in the past.  Pelican Hill is the BEST of the BEST!  From making my reservation with Daniel who was most helpful~ to the concierge, Stephanie, who patiently and graciously worked out lunch and dinner reservations for 8-10 people for 5 days and nights, to pool service at the Villa Clubhouse and infinity pool and the clean and welcome housekeeping...what more could one want?  I expected a great deal and got even more than

My husband was on a business trip, and I had the pleasure of relaxing at this beautiful resort for a weekend.  The facilities are beautiful and the hotel has a shuttle service to the Crystal Cove Beach. The food was wonderful as well.

Summary Heading: Posh, quiet, luxurious, and very modern
Summary: The Pelican Hill resort is an astonishing property. It has sweeping views of the Pacific, and is meticulously maintained. Gorgeous landscaping, grounds, and rooms. I stayed in the Villas, and then the hotel; all of which were truly palatial in scope, space, and decor.  The one thing I did find unnerving is that the place is so big and exclusive, that you feel like you're alone most of the time, which can be good or bad, depending on your mood. It's a wonderful place to escape, but not somewhere to stay if you are looking for socialization.  The pool and clubhouse are beautiful, offering premium service, and exceptional variety.

Summary Heading: Easily Proved its 96.0 Rating in the Conde Nast Gold List
Summary: From arrival to departure, everything about my stay was absolutely fantastic and top-of-class.  From the valets to the spa, I found service to be bullet-fast, friendly, and thoughtful, and was especially impressed with the number of staffers who addressed me by name....perhaps easier in the low season, but still extremely appreciated.  I found the property beautifully formed and a breeze to walk between the restaurants, spa, pool, and my bungalow....which is the crowning glory of the resort in my mind.  At a minimum of 840 square feet, the amount of space invites relaxation, and the fireplace, great bedding, and enormous bath stocked with upper-end toiletries invite one to luxuriate.  The casual and upscale restaurants were all excellent, the property absolutely pristine, and

Summary Heading: You relax as soon as you arrive!
Summary: I love this place.  I was in need of rest and pampering after putting down my beautiful 14 year old dog.  As soon as I arrived I knew I picked the right place.  I stayed in a two bedroom villa that was bigger than my house!  The place is grand, but not in a cheesey Las Vegas way, quality construction, furniture, bedding, etc.  The service is first-rate, yet casual.  I think our butler would have given us the shirt off his back if we asked.   Did I mention, whenever you want to go to the beach, golf course, or restaurant, you just call you butler and he is there within minutes to drive you.  Also, no extra cost to park, internet, use of spa or fitness facilities which was nice for a change.  I miss Pelican Hill so much, I am planning a trip in May!

Summary Heading: Horrible service: Staff is unhelpful and chef knows nothing about allergies
Summary: Although the grounds of Pelican Hill were beautiful, we had quite a bad experience. I suffer from Celiac Disease, which requires a gluten free diet. The hotel assured us before we planned our trip from Chicago that they could take care of my needs. However, one of the meals they served me contained a regular bun (which the server told me several times was gluten free) and the other meal was contaiminated by gluten (the french fries they told me were gluten free were cooked in the same fryer as gluten-containing items). This ruined several days of my trip because I got very sick. The chef and his staff knew nothing about allergies or a gluten free diet, even though they told me they had my needs under control. When we approached them about the issue (we talked to three different
Manager Response: Ms. Moran,  Thank you your valuable feedback, as we continuously strive to heighten our service performance throughout every corner of the Resort. As Managing Director of Pelican Hill Resort, I kindly thank you for choosing to stay with us at Pelican Hill and sincerely appreciate the feedback provided in the detailed letter I received from your family, as well as in this subsequent Trip Advisor posting.  As expressed in the February 1, 2011 letter of response I sent to your family, I deeply regret the unfortunate challenges that you incurred during your recent stay at Pelican Hill. We take special dietary requirements very seriously and apologize that such attention fell short when it came to your dining experience with us. Please know that what you experienced was an exception and not the rule.   I understand your level of disappointment from the points you mentioned regarding cross-contamination and proper knowledge when handling food, and can assure you that many members of our kitchen staff are ServSafe-certified.  While I was pleased to learn that our Director of Food & Beverage and Restaurant Manager did not charge you for the meal, I would also like to make you aware of the resort-wide alert sent out on January 28, to ensure that appropriate attention was given to your gluten-free dietary requirement. In your family’s email and phone exchanges with our Restaurant Manager and Chef on January 28, our management team also offered you their personal assistance with any dining needs during your stay.  In addition to the measures taken during your stay, I have recently taken the time to meet with the Executive Chef concerning your experience and the Resort staff’s responsibility to ensure that proper care and attention are given to future guests in a similar situation as yours.  In closing, thank you once again for your thoughtful feedback. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you at Pelican Hill. Please contact me directly if I could be of personal assistance.  Sincerely,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: Pelican Hills Resort is the perfect place for a much needed getaway with family or friends.  It is truly a "cut above" other hotels I have stayed at, yet it with a comfortable feeling.  The rooms, grounds and restaurants have that extra special touch of class, yet the feeling is to relax and enjoy.  Business casual is really the feeling, not at all stuffy.  The employees are there to make your stay as relaxing as possible and really want to please you with a friendly attitude.  Highly suggest the spa treatments as well as the guided hike in the morning.  The only thing you must "rush" to is finding a spot to watch the amazing sunset.

Stayed at his resort for a short weekend getaway. This place will take your breath away. From the minute in check in, you are treated like royalty. Every employee is pleasant and will assist in any way. The rooms are incredible. The pool area is breathtaking, and the food is to die for.

We stayed for two nights, and it's pretty rare I give a hotel all five stars.  But this one is comfortable, soft, peaceful, pleasant, thoughtful and really really opulent.  We had a bungalow with 20' ceilings, a fireplace, HDTV with a Bose 3/2/1 system. All of the appointments at the desk were thought of, ethernet connection - free WIFI (no sign-in) plugs, an aux cable to hook up your ipod to the bose, great robes, great bath appointments.  Nothing was missing.  Reading light under the canopy headboard, room switches right next to your nightstand, accurate temperature control - even with the automatic fireplace.  These folks really know how to set the place up. The only error in our stay, and this was weird, was that the previous guest's food was in our honor bar (yogurt, cold

Stayed in a 4 bedroom villa over christmas weekend with extended family (total of 8 people).  Our stay was simply magnificent and unforgettable.  The villa came stocked with some peligrino water, beer, light breakfast foods, and a few snacks which was a plus.  the villa also had free wireless internet.    the villas were provided with maid service in the morning and again in the evening for turndown service.  another plus is if you are going anywhere within the resort, you do not need to drive yourself.  the resort offers free shuttle service to any other resort area (beach, golf course, gym, spa, etc.) and all you have to do is call the shuttle and stand outside your villa.    the spa service is top notch.  they have a lounge area with a tranquil waterfall with tranquil music

Summary Heading: A Bargain vs. the Montage with nicer rooms and great service.
Summary: Location:  The hotel is perched about a 1/2 mile up a hill overlooking the Pacific Ocean - panoramic views abound.  The grounds are expansive with several golf courses below the Bungalows and Villas - lots of hiking trails.  You are about 5-10 minutes from Laguna Beach and a similar distance to Newport Beach center depending on traffic.  The resort is sprawling and you either drive your own car or get complimentary shuttles to pick you up.  We stayed over New Years and staffing levels were good - so waits were not long for anything.  The Bungalows are about 850 sq. feet each - attached to one another like townhomes.  Much more spacious and nicer than The Montage, Ritz or St. Regis for equal or less price.  Each have large patios (most with Ocean views), fireplaces, sitting

This is our 100th review on Trip Advisor and we were hoping that number 100 would be a special hotel, and as it turns out this hotel truly is.   Set on a hillside overlooking the Pacific Ocean, this sprawling resort is gorgeous inside and out, and is a great place to relax and soak up the sun, the wonderful environment, and beautiful views.  The rooms of the hotel are rows of bungalows that spread out from the main buildings of the hotel. Mini buses are available to take you back to main sections, but the five minute or less walk from most bungalows allows you to enjoy the lush landscaping of the resort.  We stayed near the end of Via Dome in a bungalow that overlooked the ocean, but also had a little bit of road noise.  We liked this location however, because there were no

We were at the resort for business for three days and I was able to experience a lot of what the hotel has to offer.  Rooms are fantastic.  Very spacious and well appointed.  Bathrooms are huge with very nice spa products.  Terrace has two lounge chairs and a patio table, very private and relaxing.  Pool, spa and golf are all amazing.  The grounds are spectacular, perfect setting for a wedding.   Complimentary parking and no resort fees.  Rate may be high but you get what you pay for and more.   Only downside is the hotel does not have much going on in the evenings, the bar, lobby area and restaurant are relatively quiet so I suggest if you want a little nightlife you venture out to a nearby restaurant.

Summary Heading: Great Resort. THE best in the world!!
Summary: What a fantastic hotel! With its fantastic, attentive staff, great location, amazing concept & design, its the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Apart from transfer cost issues at checkout, which were resolved very quickly & slow service at breakfast on one of the days (the hotel kindly got rid of that day's charges for breakfast- very nice gesture!) it was amazing! Nothing was too much for them- the best restaurants/ sightseeing, nothing was too much to ask! Go there & you will love it. Its romantic, modern, elegant, great value for money, good for kids & family & above all, it makes you feel like you don't want to leave & want to go back again & again; I certainly will! Ignore all the negative reviews because they were not staying where we were- far from the "rubbish service"

Summary Heading: A GREAT resort at a GREAT location!
Summary: Had heard of the resort and have visited many wonderful places and this has to rank in my top 5 of all time. We stayed in a villa with no view of the ocean or anything exceptional but were fine with it. We only used the room to recharge for the next day. You can step out of any lodging to a view in no more than 50 steps. Food on the property not awesome but several very nice choices close. Spa was a great experience as well. Two golf courses to rival Pebble Beach.

Summary Heading: This is worth high praise overall!!!!!
Summary: Great personnel in massaging, front desk, butlers, and maid staff.  Golf was outstanding with nice forecaddies.. Prices have gone up in a recission is very surprising though.  From reports about California, they are having there troubles with real estate depreciating and local taxes going up.  Orange County is in a world of hurt but this place raises prices!!!!!  No criticism...If the demand is there which it should be in a good economy, the hotel should do well.  My wife and I were upgraded to a 3 bedroom and were treated like royalty.  Thanks again!!!!!!

Stayed at a three bedroom villa for 3 nights on a Family Golf trip. Everything about this place is five star service and attention. Both golf courses, South and North are meticously taken care of and in great condition. Courses are challenging with fantastic views of the OC and the Pacific. Cant beat California weather. Ask for Mike the caddie, you will have a blast with his company and he is very knowledgeable of the courses.  The Villa is about 200 square meters with all the right amenities and top of the line beds, kitchen appliances, furniture, giant bathrooms, etc.  Unlike other reviews, we thought the staff was super attentive to all of us during our stay and through out the resort.   We've done this family golf trip for the past seven years (pinehurst and Palm Springs)

Epicure Atmosphere ...Golf. This is a grand experience if you are looking for relaxation and social networking. The resort staff offers the finest service I have enjoyed. The resort dining is superb..casual pool side...the largest circular pool in the world and a grand pool side restaurant. Andrea Restaurant offers local superbly prepared Italian Fare. Pelican Grill is hopping with local residents and resort guests...dishes...seasonal..harvest season now...local olive oil pressed on site by Temecula Olive Oil Company. Vistas are serene...Mixology is fun and current. We enjoyed a new cocktail The Beautiful Lady or a Tall Beautiful Lady distinguished by 3 oz. of San Pelligreno  No bed bugs here. We checked the beds for comfort and the latest technology for bed bug extermination.

This place is sprawling and has everything imaginable at your fingertips. Wonderful service, delicious food, gorgeous views and the room is perfect! I loved all of the details, finishes and extreme cleanliness in our villa. Tons of space with over 1000sf. The pool is huge, fun and offers a fantastic view of the Pacific Ocean both day and night. The clientele was seemingly lots of la folks. My family, including 4 teens had a great time too. We can't wait to return.

First, the resort grounds are beautiful.  The bungalow is well planned out and has all the amenities you would expect for the price of the hotel.  The patio’s are very large and fantastic to have a glass of wine with your wife. The location is a bit far set back for the true ocean experience but proximity to the golf is perfect.  We walked every morning down the hill and down to Carona Del Mar for coffee.   We stayed 4 nights and played 2 rounds of golf.    The golf was amazing.  The courses are well taken care of and having the fore-caddie was a nice experience.  We went down for our 15th year wedding anniversary.  When we first booked the time they asked me if there was a special occasion, I told them about our 15th.  We booked an ocean view room.  When we first checked in all
Manager Response: We kindly thank you for choosing to celebrate your 15th anniversary with us and for taking the time to provide your thoughts about your recent experience with us at Pelican Hill. We are delighted to hear that you and your wife enjoyed your bungalow stay, poolside cabana experience and golf rounds. However, we regret that your expectations were not entirely met during this special occasion that you chose to celebrate with us.  Our team strives for the finest service in order to deliver an unparalleled all-around experience and exceptional personal service for each and every guest. To that end, I have addressed your concerns with our staff. Please allow me to express my sincere apologies for falling short of our goals and your expectations of  personalized service during your stay.  Once again, your thoughtful feedback is a gift to us and we appreciate the time you took to express your impressions of your stay. We look forward to another opportunity to serve you and your wife at Pelican Hill. I invite you to contact me directly if I could be of personal assistance to you.  Sincerely,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: Spent 5 nights at Pelican Hill and was treated like royalty.  This place was amazing and the service was top notch.  The food at every restaurant was excellent.  I can't think of one negative thing to say about the food, service or the resort.  Yes - you have to take a shuttle to the beach - but it's not like you can STAY on the beach.  Even driving there - you have to park further than where the shuttle drops you off.  The shuttle around the resort was awesome and quick.  And the resort isn't really that big - very easy to walk around.    I am not sure what all the whining is about.  :)  This is a very upscale resort - and not sure my kids (teenagers) would have enjoyed it....but we certainly did!  Loved the location - just minutes from Laguna Beach and Newport Beach.  (Laguna
Manager Response: I thank you for taking the time to share your wonderful impressions of your recent experience with us at Pelican Hill. It is a delight to hear that our services, dining experiences and spa visit met your expectations.  Allow me to share with you that our Teen Adventure program offers a variety of activities for teens, from surf lessons, kayaking or hiking on the coast to nearby shopping excursions. We invite you to consider us for your future family getaways! Our multi-bedroom villas are perfect for extended family “togethering” vacations or holidays.   Once again, your valuable feedback is greatly appreciated and we look forward to another opportunity to serve you at Pelican Hill. If I could be of personal assistance to you in making your next stay as memorable as your last, please contact me directly.  Sincerely,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary Heading: Way too expensive and far from Ocean
Summary: This is an expensive hotel with very nice rooms.  THey didn't shirk on the amenities.  The problem is the way too expensive for the service that you get.  The resort is so spread out its too hard to get to the pool and other parts of the resort.  We stayed at the villas, which were nice, but then had to get rides to get anywhere else on the resort.  I don't think its worth price given how much paid and how much we got.  I've stayed at nicer places with better service for less cost.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your impressions of your recent experience with us at Pelican Hill. Providing superior service and catering to personalized preferences is of utmost importance and priority to us. To this end, we have created dedicated services and amenities that allow guests to enjoy a relaxing, convenient and memorable stay by the ocean. Should you choose to return to Pelican Hill (and we hope you will), please consider allowing us to indulge you with The Pelican Hill Beach Experience, a complimentary service for Pelican Hill guests.  As part of our partnership with Crystal Cove Park, located directly adjacent to Pelican Hill, guests can spend a leisurely summer day on the pristine three-and-a-half mile beach within the stunning seaside nature preserve, complete with personal lounge chairs and umbrellas set up in the sand by beach attendants. We escort guests by complimentary round-trip shuttle service  (available daily) and provide beach bags for children and adults, filled with towels, water, sunscreen and beach activities, like paddle ball and sand pails. Food and beverage service is provided on the sand by The Beachcomber Café.  Additional ways that we arrange for guests to enjoy our ocean-adjacent location is coordinating kayaking, surfing and boating excursions through our concierge. Many Pelican Hill guests prefer to enjoy our panoramic ocean views and coastal vistas poolside at The Coliseum Pool, relaxing in luxurious lounge chairs or private cabanas, pampered by pool butlers. Whatever your preference, it’s our pleasure to help you enjoy our seaside location to the fullest.  Sincerely,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: We are well travelled, visting many destinations over many years, and this new resort is up there at the top!  Beautiful reception, magnificently appointed, delightful pool and Colisseum restaurant and wonderful wonderful rooms, extremely large with sitting area, massive bathroom, large deck and charming staff.  The attention to detail is amazing, the beds are heavenly with wonderful fireplace in single storey room.  View of the Pacific from all restaurants and our room, truly did not want to leave this magical place and will certainly return in the future.

I booked a night for the family to celebrate my husband's birthday. We spent the afternoon at the spectacular pool and everything was great. Afterwards, we tried to make a reservation at a restaurant on the premises, and was put on indefinite hold. After we called back, we were transferred to one concierge who told us the restaurant we wanted didn't have any availability. When we asked if another restaurant had availability, they said they would call us back. When they did call back, they said there was no reservations for the first restaurant we had already been told was booked, and had no clue what the other concierge already told us. Terrible communication. We finally gave up and booked a dinner off site. Before we left, we called housekeeping for an 8 p.m. turn down service
Manager Response: I sincerely regret to hear that your expectations were not entirely met during your stay with us at Pelican Hill. I understand your frustration and apologize for the unfortunate experiences encountered with your accommodations and dining requests.  I understand that your circumstance was brought to our management’s attention during your stay and that you allowed us to provide a complimentary service in response to the inconveniences experienced. Furthermore, I have addressed your concerns once again with our Rooms Manager and Hospitality Services Department to ensure that our policy has been clarified with all team members involved.  Your sincere feedback is a gift to us as we continuously strive to heighten our service performance throughout every corner of the resort. We kindly ask that you allow us another opportunity to serve you at Pelican Hill. Please call me directly if I can be of personal assistance to you in planning a future visit.  Sincerely,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary: We planned a small bridal shower at high tea time for 9 guests, 3 p.m.  The chairs and couches were set when we arrived but the help was not.  It was 4:15 before we got  our first sip or bite of anything.  The guests had startted eating the decorated sugar cookies brought as party favors because all were hungry and nothing had been served.  Once the tea was served our waitress was gone....No one was there to see if we needed anything or liked the tea.  The service was horrible, the Rennaisance service skimpy and the waitress forgot the scones until reminded.  Beautiful setting, horrible service, high price for disappointing bridal shower. Hotel beautiful....Tea? No.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to express your impression of the High Tea you allowed us to host here at Pelican Hill.  We strive for the finest in service and facilities, as it is our aim to offer an unparalleled all-around experience and exceptional personal service for every guest.  I understand your level of disappointment from your posting at Trip Advisor and I immediately reviewed the procedures with our Food and Beverage Director and our Lounge Supervisor responsible for that experience.  On that note, please allow me to express my sincere regrets for the unfortunate experience in which we fell short of our goals and your expectations. Your thoughtful, detailed feedback is a gift and we thank you for your input.    We look forward to another opportunity to serve you at Pelican Hill. Please call me directly if I can be of personal assistance to you.  Sincerely,  Giuseppe Lama Managing Director

Summary Heading: Five-Star Hawaiian vacation without the airfare.
Summary: My family has been to Maui multiple times over the years. This year, with the recession in full force, we decided to put the money we'd spend in airfare into a special resort. We chose The Resort at Pelican Hill and we were blown away. Everything about this resort is magnificent perfection. From the huge, luxurious rooms, to the tropical setting to the world-class golf course, this is a few days of pure escapism. The designers of this hotel are meticulous-- right down the the 8 perfectly placed palm trees at the colossal Coliseum Pool. The staff has service down to an art form in the way they deliver on whatever you can possible think of. Shrimp at Sunset by the pool? No problem even though it's not even on the menu. We all deserve to feel like royalty. When you consider the

Summary Heading: No expense spared and it shows!
Summary: This was our fourth trip to this area, we stayed at Pelican Hill primarily to play the two golf courses, which were quite challenging and very different from one another. The property is spectacular but overall we found it too be a bit cold and formal. We hosted a business dinner for 8 people at Andrea, the Italian restaurant at the resort, the service and food were impeccable. Overall, exactly what one would expect and receive at this price, but we both prefer the ambience at The Montage over Pelican Hill. Just a matter of personal taste.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel In So CAL But Dont Tell Anyone
Summary: Patrick, who manages guest services, is the reason I stayed at this hotel.  I left the Ritz Carlton Hotel in Laguna Niguel to go home to LA, when I stopped by Pelican Hill by happenstance.  He showed my family around the hotel, and convinced me (without much convincing on his part) to stay at the hotel.  His excellent and gracious attitude was exactly what I needed after my disasterous two days at the Ritz (what a dump).  Patrick should be made general manager and given a raise.  The hotel was as great as he was.

We stayed at Pelican Hill for 5 nights in a garden bungalow. I was expecting a luxurious resort based on the website info, but it exceeded our expectations from the moment we checked in. The staff are outstanding, the service was faultless and the facilities are second to none. Although we had the smallest bungalow, it was huge compared to most hotel rooms. The interior had a very high specification, no expense seems to have been spared. Eating at Pelican Hill is excellent. Menus are reasonably priced and the food is really good. Everyone at the resort went out of their way to ensure that we had a great stay. The staff are efficient and friendly. A special mention for our pool server Andrew who provided us with outstanding service and I gather he had only just started working at

Summary Heading: Perfect retreat for tired city souls without leaving the US
Summary: My husband and I stayed at Pelican Hill in early May and I just never got around to writing my review until someone asked me the other day if I would recommed it- YES!! Here is why: - Location, Location, Location: Even though there is no beach on the property, the stunning cliffs looking out to the Pacific was sure worth it. The pool area is probably the best to soak in that view (especially the nooks on the side not directly on the pool that overlook the golf course and ocean). The second best would the private verandah in your room. Even though we did not have a direct ocean view room, the verandah was so lush with sorrounding greenery and a little peak of the ocean, it made it perfect for drinking a bottle of CA pinot noir! We also took the resort shuttle down to the beach;

Summary Heading: Stunning views, impeccable grounds, rooms, truly a 5 star resort.
Summary: Pelican Hill was beautiful in every sense. We stayed in a 3rd floor "North Villa" that had a great view. If you are considering a Villa, I would suggest one of the "South Villas" as they are directly on the golf course and are quieter. Villa was gorgeous and extremely clean. Travertine floors, marble fireplace, beautiful bathrooms and kitchen. Housekeeping came 2X a day. Service was excellent, though still some kinks (timliness and follow through)..but still excellent compared to other standards. Place is pricey... 11K for a week, so you pay for the service, so use it!  Butler service not really as advertised (you don't really get 2 hours of a butler a day, in fact we never saw a butler after the first day).Andrea restaurant was excellent with a fabulous view of the pacifc.

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort great location. Housekeeping could improve.
Summary: Beautiful place.stayed in south villas. Everything was exceptional but the housekeeping. They kept forgetting to clean the villa or came early morning. We stayed a week and this occurred 4 times. On day of arrival villa was not ready and waited until 4 pm. Besides that everything was great. The free wifi, no resort fee, normal prices at all restaurants were a plus. The gyms ( both of them) where nice. I did find the spa great but a little overpriced. We appreciate the fact that they only have resort guests stay at the pool. We did not use the golf therefor no comment but it looked beautiful. We will go back when at the west coast.

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort - service still an issue
Summary: I was hoping to be able to write a glowing review like the others but our experience just wasn't what we expected.  My wife and I booked a Villa for a week through the AMEX Platinum Card promotion and when we booked our trip the brochure said all Villas were "ocean view".  Unfortunately, that isn't the case.  The first level North Villas have no ocean view due to the trees that have grown to completely obstruct the views.  About two weeks prior to our visit, we were asked when we would be arriving and the names of our guests.  It sounded like we were going to get a red carpet welcome - but unfortunately not.  We arrived at 1:30 PM and were told our villa wasn't ready.  We had lunch, returned at 2:30 and were told it still wasn't ready but they guaranteed it would be by 3:00.  We

Choosing b/w Pelican and Montage.. we went with Pelican. We were there for a wedding a year ago and the pool and private rooms, stole us away. Our family members go every year and they love it. They stayed in a garden room 151. We used AMEX to book our suite and upon our arrival ( we asked ) for any possible upgrade. The room we got upgraded to was amazing. It was 157. The concierge HOLLY was soo sweet and sent us free dessert to Maestro's ( not on property, at South Coast plaza). They ( AMEX or the hotel ) had a nice fruit and water basket waiting for us.  Another night, we couldn't finish our dinner and took it to go. They brought a microwave for us ( no charge ) so i can warm up food if i wanted. It requires you to have a small walk back to your garden bungalow or villa, bUT

I have travelled and stayed at many fine hotels and resorts and by far The Pelican Hill get's first prize for the most outstanding resort I have ever been at. The expression "you pay for what you get" is so true of this place. The rate we had was a summer promo of $495/night compared to it's 895/ngt rate during the summer months. The rooms, the landscaping, the grounds, the services, the restauarant were all top notch and worth every penny that we paid. If you are a family with young children, beware of Camp Pelican. I had my two chidlren registered there for an afternoon at a tune of $60/child which included lunch (not a bad deal) and a full afternoon of play. My word of caution is this: I happened to stroll past Camp Pelican to check up on my children playing and noticed

Originally booked and checked into Villa Room.  Did not like the isolation or 'feel' of the Villas.  Asked front desk to show us other options.  Ended up staying in 2 bedroom/3 bath suite in main part of resort....front desk was very accommadating!  LOVED the layout and architecture of 2 bedroom suite - large patio off King/Living room adjoining 2 queens bedroom with seperate patio.  The landscaping/grounds are amazing...feel like you are in Provence with all the olive trees!    That said, the service is still in need of improvement.  I think most employees try, but they are just not there yet.  We are still waiting for a call back from the conceige for several requests!  Calls for turn-down, refresh mini-bar, etc usually required several calls.    All in all, beautiful property

We, family with 2 kids (5 and 2 years old) spent 9 days in a Pelican Hill Villa  from 7 until 16 June, 2009. Actually, we came by accident : we wanted to go to Terranea but they postponed their opening, planned for the beginning of June 2009 . Pelican Hill made more than up for this loss. We were very happy that we choose them. Although the weather was not so great during the time we were there (June gloom), we enjoyed our time a lot.  Location:  Pelican Hill is not located directly at the beach - you won't hear the sea at night from your bedroom. but other than that we had everything you'd expect from a beach vacation: a really stunning beautiful seaview from our villa living room, a great shuttle service to the beach (Crystal Cove), and Chrystal Cove beach is really a great

Summary Heading: Amazing Hotel - Not sure anything better exists
Summary: Our family spent the 4th of July weekend in a 2 bedroom North Villa. The unit was huge and the finish quality was like a luxury home (Wolf Range, Sub Zero, 50 inch HD with surround sound). Far better than any St. Regis, Four Seasons, or Ritz. Staff was friendly and attentive.  Excellent pools, fitness centers, and beach shuttle.   We can't wait to return.

We just spent 5 nights at the Pelican Hill resort and had an amazing stay in a bungalow in the 400 building. We thought the level of service was top notch and everyone who worked there always greeted you with a smile. My husband played 18 holes on the golf course, while I had a one hour massage. The massage was fantastic and the facilities at the spa were great. You could even use the facilities if you were not getting a spa treatment. My husband really enjoyed the course. He said it was challenging but beautiful. We ate several of our meals at the restaurants on site. They were all good. We especially enjoyed the pool service where waiters came by with food and drink menus, so you never had to leave your relaxing spot. (If you forget sunscreen, they have spf 30 available at the
Pelican Hills is a wonderful place to be everyone in the family enjoyed it the rooms, restaurants, view, and mostly the two pools! We're coming back later!

Summary Heading: I would go back in a heartbeat!
Summary: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at Pelican Hill as winners of a company incentive trip. For this annual trip we typically stay at a nice, but overdone, resort somewhere warm. This year I was a little disappointed to hear we were only going to southern California. I thought we'd end up at a nice but not amazing place. Boy was I wrong. Everything they do here is top notch. From the moment we checked in to the hotel we were treated so well. Everything here is grand and larger than life, without being really gaudy. The staff treated us with grace and kindness. They even picked something up from the hotel store for me and brought it to my room. The turndown service was beyond compare. Handmade chocolate, slippers and fresh ice made the evening wonderful.   We ate in the

Summary Heading: Did not want to leave, the Four Seasons should send their employees to train here.
Summary: The location, setting, views, rooms and food absolutely cannot be beat! As a Four Seasons customer for the past four summers this came as a VERY pleasant surprise to me. The service was impeccable, all of the employees were so polite, nice and friendly. The bungalows are set up so that you feel as if you are the only family at the resort, even with three weddings going on. The only difficulty I really experienced was with the car service they hooked me up with, VIP Transportation, they were just awful. I have used LJ Transportation the last four years and should have gone with them...they have always been perfect. This wasn't completely the hotels fault however as they are a contract service, but the hotel should reconsider that relationship, and I would make my own car and

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort tucked into the hills of Newport Coast
Summary: Stayed for several days during a business event with spouse & colleagues.  Service was friendly and instantaneous - staff knew our names within the first day.  The bungalows are well appointed and were quiet and comfy.  Glass partitions around  the balcony kept the cooler ocean breezes at bay.  A gas fireplace was a welcome addition in the cool of the evening.  Shuttle service was available within minutes, but the walk to the pool & lobby was short and made even more lovely by the flowers and foliage along the sidewalks.  Food was exceptional.  Breakfast, lunch and dinner all were served quickly, beautifully presented, and absolutely delicious.  Worth the extra cost over the local restaurants.  Golf courses were beautiful, but difficult.  Expert caddies were much appreciated.  A

Absolute luxury.  We stayed in one of the bungalow suites- beyond words.  The service at the resort is impeccable.  Everything was perfect- and I mean everything!  Food is phenomenal.  Spa is glorious; the golf courses challenging and lovely.  Hubby loved his caddy- very knowledgeable and worthwhile! It is very expensive, but for a getaway, wedding, or conference it is absolutely worth every penny!  We will be back!

Summary Heading: Fantastic Resort in one of the Nicest Areas in the U.S.
Summary: Newport Coast is amazing. Fantastic views and a mix of fine resorts like this one... and relaxing old-world wonders, like the nearby Beachcomber. This hotel is fairly new, fine restaurants, great pool, panoramic ocean views, beautiful common areas, great service. It's as nice as a deluxe Four Seasons hotel or Ritz. Great wine selection and a world-class resort property.  If you are looking for a fantastic resort getaway or four star business hotel... this is your spot.  I differ with some of the reviews regarding kids. There is a nice kids pool, but I would not say this is a kids hotel.  The restaurants and overall feel geared toward sophisticated adults.  I do not know of a better resort in the area. It's in a sublime location with much to do nearby.  My only negative would be

There are many things to like about this resort.  We stayed at the villas, which are free-standing homes.  Ours was well-appointed, and was a short walk from the clubhouse, which has a restaurant and pool.  The villa pool is wonderful, and was never crowded.  Perfect for families with young kids.  The food (whether in the restaurant or room service) was terrific.  The staff were uniformly nice, thoughtful, and helpful.  Unfortunately, it felt to us like the resort may have cut its staffing too much during the recession and has not yet staffed back up to an adequate level.  Most calls for the "butler" service or concierge ended up with somebody else, who took a message.  Eventually we would hear back from the butler service or concierge, although a few times we had to call back

From the warm, professional staff to the understated elegance of the rooms, this resort is the real deal.  No flash, just the best quality in all things. The property is stunning.  The villas are the epitome of comfortable elegance.  The spa is out of this world amazing.  It's one of the finest spas I've been in, and I've been in many around the globe.  One hates to keep using the phrases remarkable & amazing, but this place solidly earns the accolades. We will return...we must!

Summary Heading: Nice resort but would never go on my own dime
Summary: Went here for a business retreat.  It was fine but I don't really get it.  It was very pretty, food was good but you are stuck there and not even on the beach.  Instead you are looking at a golf course.  Did take the shuttle into Laguna Beach and it was not too exciting.  Very 1950's feeling.  I was expecting something more quaint and cute.  The views are pretty but I've seen better in Italy and Greece.  To me it was not heaven on earth.  Would never go hear for a vacation.  Not my kind of vacation.

I've stayed at Pelican Hill three times in the last year (once in a guestroom, twice in a villa), and I've had great experiences each time.  VILLA vs. GUESTROOM/BUNGALOW: Villas are spacious and each of them are positioned with an ocean view. I prefer the South Villas over the North Villas -- the South Villas have better views and are adjacent to the Villa Club & pool. The villas come with butler service, which accommodates practically anything, and in my experience service has been excellent. They've unloaded our car, brought us basic kitchen necessities, straightened up our kitchen & loaded our dishwasher, taken away our trash, etc. Guestrooms/bungalows are great b/c they are located right in the main resort area, and therefore they're convenient to the restaurant, spa and the

Well folks. We enjoyed an extended part of summer in the Villas here. It was an interesting experience. When we checked in we were greeted by exceptional staff members, a welcome package awaited - the first 2 weeks were like walking on air. The property itself is magnificent looking, new and well laid out. About 3 weeks in, the hotel started laying off staff. It was a recession year and resort rumor was that it was a blanket firing, done without malice, to save money. As a business man I respect that, but as a guest I hated it because they let many of the higher paid right ones go, and kept many of the junior green ones in. Service literally went off a cliff. People seemed to try hard, but the flow was broken and nothing seemed to work as it did before. Two big issues started to

We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa over New Year's and it was amazing!!  We actually had booked a 2 bedroom and got upgraded to a 3 bedroom.  Several people have complained on this website about the service at Pelican Hill, but we found the service OUTSTANDING.  Everyone -- from the butlers, to the pool guys, to the drivers -- were friendly, attentive, informative.  The service just can't be beat.  We felt incredibly pampered, and had a wonderful time at this fabulous resort!

Summary Heading: Coliseum Restaurant- Comfortable and Casual Ambience, Elegant Food
Summary: I took my family to dinner at the Coliseum a few days after Christmas.  We have had dinner and brunch at the Coliseum before and thoroughly enjoy the food, the atmosphere and the service.  Chef Chang Sivilay is both innovative and creative.  For dinner, we dined on locally grown arrugula and golden beet salad, a refreshing and tasty start to our dinner.   For our entrees my daughters enjoyed the Spicy Miso Pork Osso Buco with Macadamia Nut Polenta.  The Osso Buco is tender and flavorful.  I had the Jidori Soy Chicken, which has a delectable hint of star anise.  To cleanse our palates before dessert, we were served "Shirley Temple" raspberry sorbets.  Our dessert was a delightful sampler of Creme Brulee, New York-style Cheesecake with gold-leaf garnished blackberry, and Creamy

Our first trip to the Resort at Pelican Hill was in March of 2009.  I accompanied my husband on a business trip.  When we arrived, we were greeted by name as we were helped out of our car.  At the check in desk, we were met with warm towels to refresh, served on a lovely silver platter.  That was only the beginning of the amazing service we experienced.   The staff knew that I would be alone during the day, and they arranged to have a driver take me shopping at a local mall.  Along the way, the driver gave me a nice tour of the canyon, an informative overview of the area.  Earlier that day, I went on a hike with the fitness director along the beautiful trails of the state park, located within easy walking distance of the resort.  The hike beat the shopping mall, hands down!

Summary Heading: One of the best in LA
Summary: We stayed at Pelican Hill for a wedding. Such a great place. I had no idea how great it is to have a fireplace on a timer in your room. To go to sleep each night with a fire and your doors open to your own deck for a cool breeze. Such a delight. They have a wonderful pool - and the food is the best. Really a wonderful wonderful hotel. Walk to the beach with wonderful trails, some of the best golf in california - I will definitely be back!

Assuming the bulk of the hi price of rooms was for the "stunning ocean views", not every room had one. Friendly but ill-trained staff, who couldn't answer basic questions. Amazingly, there's no manager on duty on a Friday(???) They don't even restock the coffee in your room after the first day. And they reach deep into your pockets for everything, even a simple cup of coffee.

Summary Heading: The Best Resort in the United States - without Question.
Summary: As a seasoned traveler  with very discriminating taste, I was completely overwhelmed and amazed at how outstanding this resort was. The rooms were spectacular and had every necessary amenity one could ask for. The service was impeccable, from the moment you arrived until after you departed, every staff member in the resort recognized you and greeted you by name at all times. The food in all restaurants was flawless and delicious, and fairly priced considering the setting. The pool area reminds me of Hearst Castle - and even when the hotel is full you can barely hear a soul around. This is the place to go for privacy, relaxation and real service. Having stayed at many 5 star hotels and resorts throughout  the world, this resort offers the most refined elegance, understated yet
Excellent resort!  The room was spacious and was quite luxurious.  It was very hard to leave and we look forward to our next visit

We stayed here as we won a trip in a competition for a couple of nights stay here. It is one of the most incredible hotels I have ever stayed at - everything is very new there and beautifully styled, the bungalow rooms are lovely with huge bed, bathroom and balcony.  Round pool is lovely with incredible views and was deserted when we were there so had the full attentions of the pool staff. Great fitness centre. Ate dinner at the Italian restaurant which was lovely, and the breakfasts were to die for. Not sure if we could ever afford to stay here again but if you want to splurge and treat yourself you will not be disappointed.

Stayed in a bungalow suite at Pelican Hill and was thoroughly impressed by the resort in every way.  Service exceeded all expectations and the physical beauty of the grounds, pool, golf course was stunning.  Our spa therapists were very knowledgeable - some of the best I have experienced - and made us feel very pampered.  The menu at the Coliseum pool grill had a large assortment of items on the menu and everything we ate was very good - we did not get a chance to eat at Andrea (the formal restaurant) but will do so on our next visit.  Above all else, every staff member was genuinely happy and enthusiastic, no matter what our request was.  Highly recommend Pelican Hill for golfers, spa-goers, and luxury travel lovers!  We can't wait to come back!

Summary Heading: Lovely, but the service is inexperienced and unenthusiastic
Summary: The property is really beautiful, the rooms and their private patios are exceptional, and the spectacular circular pool itself might be a reason to visit.  But at these prices, the service issues actually became kind of comical.  We had booked, and twice confirmed, a couples' massage with two female therapists, only to be escorted (once in our robes, after relaxing in the quiet room) by two male therapists.  When I voiced my opposition and explained we had confirmed two females (no offense to these guys), the two male therapists sort of looked at me like, "yeah, but now what do you want us to do."  We went ahead with the massages at that point, neither of us totally relaxed, and spending the entire time deciding what we'd say when we complained about it.  So, we spent $600 for

We decided to splurge on for my hubby's b-day. He wanted to play golf, and we hadn't been back since the property was remodeled. We knew going into the weekend that we would be spending a pretty penny to stay here (I'm writing this from our "bungalow"), and that was more than fine, however, mediocre food, hotel staff issues, layout of the hotel, made what should have been a fantastic birthday weekend completely disappointing.  I booked the reservation with our American Express card, doing so saves 10% per night. We arrived at check-in, and drove my Prius down. The valet looked completely taken aback when I told him we were checking in, he said, "really?" and I should have known then....Check-in took a little bit longer than usual, it was a Friday afternoon at 1:30, they were

Pelican Hill is, for better or worse, probably the most extravagant, over-the-top resort in the US.  On this stay we were in a 3 bedroom villa which is really more comparable to a house than any sort of hotel room.  It was very nice, with a private patio, private garage, full kitchen, butler service etc.  HOWEVER, you have to drive your car or have them shuttle just to get around the property (i.e. restaurants, pool, lobby etc) and its a pretty big hassle.  I would say that if you are not interested in just sitting by a beach all day or if you are in Newport for an extended amount of time, then Pelican HIll is the place for you.  Otherwise, if you want to stay closer to the beach and want more of a traditional hotel feel, then go to Montage (about 5 miles south on PCH).  Both

Summary Heading: Simply outstanding - spectacular and stunning resort - more than 5 star!!!
Summary: The Resort at Pelican Hill really is one of the most wonderful resorts in the US - more like 6 star luxury!! Unlike so many dated high rise towers or the familiar layout of so many hotels, this resort really is a breath of fresh air. The Italian styled village layout  with the wonderful olive trees etc really makes this resort a delight and such as fabulous place to stay. The rooms are superb - large and so comfortable with unforgettable views and the pool area really is spectacular - a huge circular pool that was never even near to being crowded. The setting of the pool surrounded by the fun 'Coliseum' style building with the restaurant and cabanas and the open view to the golf course and the sea is just the perfect place to relax and chill. The pool was never busy when we were

Summary Heading: Luxurious accomodations with awesome golf and great food
Summary: We went on a family vacation with our 20 and 24 year old and stayed in the south villas. Much more luxurious than a Four Seasons. The beds are incredibly comfortable. Enormous flat screen TVs with every amenity you could imagine. The view of the ocean and Catalina Island from the villa terrace took our breath away. We played both courses which were fantastic in their own way. Great lunches at the Pelican Grill. The spa is magnificent with great massages. This place is a gem. We cannot wait to go back.

My husband and I just returned from a three night stay at the glorious new Resort at Pelican Hill. We traveled with our two daughters, ages 7 and 11 and we all had a fabulous time! We stayed in one of the Bungalows and everything was perfect. The addition to detail throughout the property is really impressive. Everything from the architecture and views to the bath amenities, linens and Italian pottery is stunning.   We all spent hours by the Coliseum Pool which is circular and truly not be believed....we had fabulous meals in all of the restuarants and room service was delicious -- and on time! We even explored Crystal Cove beach and the experience was just lovely....the shuttle made parking hassle free and we had an attendant assist us with everything from beach towels to

Summary Heading: Great Views, Nice Beds, interesting guests & slow 3 star service.
Summary: We stayed for several days in the Villas.  The person we booked with was great but learned he was not there any longer and the attention that he would have given was absent.  It's a beautiful place and there wer famous sports figures and stars at the pool but I talked to a few and they said they would not be coming back.  They could tell that the staff was fawning all over them which they did not like and the regulars (like me and my group) were basically ignored.  Turn down service was missed on two of our days.  Just not what you'd expect for the price.

This is without a doubt, a beautiful hotel.  The rooms are magnificent, beautiful and comfortable.  This is where they shine.  They've anticipated almost every need possible with their amenities.  We stayed in a bungalow and it was the equivalent of a junior suite, with a couch, chair, desk (with free internet), and a very comfortable bed.  The bathroom opens up to the room over the very deep soaking bathtub and lets in the air conditioning as well as the sunlight.  There is a dual vanity in the bathroom, as well as drawers to put your things in.  Plus, the bedroom had a lot of drawer space.  The room has vaulted wood ceilings and it smells like a new model home every time you walk in.  The plasma t.v. is large and has a very good picture, though it does not tilt toward the bed,

Summary Heading: Many WOW factors at this place.
Summary: As soon as we drove up to the villa gates, we knew we were going to have a fun time checking out this place. My husband, three kids and my parents stayed in a 3-bedroom villa. We originally reserved a two-bedroom, but we were gladly upgraded. The staff welcomed us with a plate of gourmet meats, cheese and bread.   The villas have a garage with a washer and dryer in it. The villa is spacious and gorgeous. The kitchen is nice with top of the line appliances. The staff stocked the fridge with complimentary water, milk and beer. The patio itself is wide and has patio furniture so you can enjoy the view of the golf course and Pacific Ocean. It was clear enough to see Catalina Island during our visit. The staff is very helpful. One of the terrific service features is the shuttle from

We have just returned from a 2 week vacation at Pelican Hill and there is only one word to describe it - "exceptional".  We have staeyed at some of the world's top hotels and golf resorts and if you are looking for a golfing break with good restaurants onsite and exceptional service look no further.

This new resort is top notch with no detailed overlooked.  The bungalows and villas are gorgeous.  The pool is breathtaking, the spa fantastic,  the golf was amazing, the food was delecious, and the service was incredible!

This was a quick two day stay at Pelican to relax, play a round of golf with friends, have some good food and check out this newly opened resort.  We took a cab from John Wayne to the resort ($30 plus tip) and got there is less than twenty minutes.  The resort architecture is Italian and the grounds have an incredibly mature look for a resort that has only been open about 10 months.  We were told there were 750 mature olive trees on the property and indeed every street is lined with trees that look like they have been there for 30 years.  I would be interested in knowing where they got all these, probably bought out an orchard in the central valley by the look of it!  We stayed in the bungalow room, very spacious, with a king bed, couch, chairs, table, desk, and a large bathroom

We stayed one night at Pelican Hill and really enjoyed our stay.  The staff was VERY attentive and super helpful.  We enjoyed the pool (gorgeous round pool overlooking the ocean far below) and had a nice dinner at the golf clubhouse.  The only negative I can think of is that the resort seemed very empty (and we didn't receive an upgrade even though we booked through Leading Hotels of the World).  I even heard ppl comment to the pool guys about the emptiness....it was quiet though so can't complain about that!  The rooms are beautiful and very high end.

One of the best resorts I've been to!  We stayed in the South Villas at Pelican Hill.  I think because of my "Leading Hotels of the World" membership we were upgraded from a two bedroom villa to a 2,500 sq. ft., three bedroom villa.  The villas, clubhouse and grounds are impeccable as are the staff, always available but never intrusive.  I encountered nothing "cheap" here!!  Everything is "top notch" at Pelican Hill.  One unusual but nice feature is that the villas each have a private garage.  The security is great.  We had friends over for dinner who joked how it was like dealing with the CIA and FBI if your not a resort guest and trying to get in!  Security calls you, then escorts visitors to your villa.  We had dinner served en suite so everyone could relax and visit.  This

Warning , if you were planning to have a reception at the Pelican hill, there are a few things you MUST know.. the people in the catering dept. are down right stuck up. They wont take you seriously unless you are willing To spend at least 25 K on your even. If you cant, or want something small, they will have the nerve to tell you that you will have to WAIT it out to book anything till “ they see if another party books that will spend MORE money” in that case, they will then Bump you!  (we offered up to $9,000) NOT exactly chicken feed!      We could not belive the stuck up attitude of the people here. No wonder it’s a ghost town, the only people there are the bored looking staff.        The place is really nice but the people who work the catering dept have got a lot to learn

Summary Heading: Over the top exquisite delicious magnificent heaven
Summary: Took my husband for an overnight in a bungalow suite for his birthday, invited some friends for cocktails en suite, then off to the Coliseum restaurant for dinner.  From the moment we arrived, through the impressive massive arches, we were swept away into a world of beauty and luxury.  They pipe aromatherapy through the A/C throughout the property so all of your senses are engaged.  They spared no expense in every detail of the property - frunishings, finishes, amenities are all unequaled.  Our suite was FANTASTIC.  Nice patio with view, huge bathroom and bedroom, generous living room and bar, top of the line entertainment systems, 2 fireplaces, superfine linens and pillows.  And, strong wireless signal that they didn't charge $9.95 a day for (I find that so chintzy).  Whitney

If you are looking for a Romantic Getaway, with a Ocean View, Luxury Linens, Luxury Rooms, 5 Star Service, Great Spa and Golf, then the Pelican Hill Resort is for you!   From the moment your drive into the Beautiful Entry, a warm welcome greets you!   We walked into a magnificant lobby and were wisked away to a beautiful Luxury room!  A view of the Ocean, luxury Linens, Flat screen Tv's, The Best Bathropes ever! Large Patio, lounge chairs, and 5 star service!   A wonderful dinner of Northern Italian Great food , at "Andrea's." The Head Chef even came over to add more Olive Oil to put on our dinner if needed!  Dancing to a fun Dj, after dinner! Walking under a Star Filled night to our Bungalow!   Then, walking up, to fresh ground choice coffee beans in your room! Walking to a

Summary Heading: SOUTH VILLAS - 6 Star Hotel - FIRST CLASS
Summary: There are not many hotels I will afford a rating like this - SIX STARS ******, yes (6) stars goes to this hotel, not four, not five, but six.  I travel a fair amount around the world reserving my hotels through the reservation system of the Leading Hotels of the World, of which The Pelican Hill Resort is one of their newest members.   Pelican Hill opened only 10 weeks before my four day visit in January, the very few glitches that I saw is a compliment in itself on how good this hotel/resort is run, managed and designed.  I am privileged to have been invited a few years ago to be one of The Leading Hotels of the World, "Unlimited" Leaders Club members (their top tier loyalty program) which affords me many benefits, but I have to say that even without that distinction, this hotel

I went for the afternoon tea as part of a Christmas gift to my mother.  Our party consisted of 6 people total.  I made reservations in advance, but it appeared that we didn't need to.  When I made reservations they hadn't worked out all the pricing yet.  This was just their 2nd weekend to have afternoon tea.  It is served from 3pm to 5pm.  They had three prices, $19, $20, and $29.  The $19 dollar included only the baked goods, the $20 had sandwiches, and the $29, had both baked goods and sandwiches (hopefully I remembered this correctly).  All three included a selection of teas.  They had 4 on the menu, but they gave us 10 to choose from.  We all chose the $29 tea.  The sandwiches were great, there was a cucumber, egg salad, proscuitto and salmon with caviar.  Next came the

Summary Heading: More Amazing than the pictures and you have ever imagined
Summary: Stayed in a 3 bedroom 3 bath Villa with views of the golf course and the ocean sunset beyond that.   This place was a 2300 squ ft House with large bedrooms bathrooms, a living room, dining room, and full sized kitchen.  There were large LCD TV's in every room. State of the art furniture, electronics, there was even a wine fridge.  And you have a butler to get you anything you need. They even delivered our mountain bikes to our garage when we asked where we could rent them. The bike ride to Crystal Cove is a must.  And when it got too dark and too tired to go back up the hill, we asked the butler to pick us up.  Steven at the Villa Club makes you drinks from the freshest ingredients and fruits.  We tried one of his signature drinks and we named it Capri Island.  He even gave us
